author: Roc
title: Great visuals but the speakers are not as great as ...
content: Replaces Echo really. Great visuals but the speakers are not as great as Echo. In time. Still can Bluetooth to my speakers. Also, wish like Echo you could set alarms weeks on end. This is set 24 hours each day.

author: Suzanne
title: Very disappointed with this product
content: I ordered 2 and it was so hard to set up had to return them both.  However, only got refunded for one and still waiting for credit on the other. Very disappointed with this product.

author: ECL
title: Disappointed
content: My device does not work properly.  For example: I set the alarm for 5:45AM and it didn't go off (this happened on at least 3 occasions). DISAPPOINTED! TY

author: Rebeca Rodriguez
title: No Spanish
content: I returnef this item because it does not speak Spanish

author: SunsetsOverEmma
title: Love it!
content: Love the spot! Alexa still has some kinks to work it but overall she is improving quite a lot since the first gen for I had. Great little gadget :) I carry it with me from room to room since I only have 1 but it’s super easy.

author: J
title: Good product
content: Nice product. Does have a learning curve but as this technology improves and becomes a daily norm you’ll want to be ahead of the curve.

author: John Burris
title: ... how to pair and make operate are wanting at best. The unit is good but the instructions are ...
content: instructions on how to pair and make operate are wanting at best.  The unit is good but the instructions are terrible.

author: Barbara A. Fernandez
title: Five Stars
content:
Love Love Love my Echo Spot.  Small, yet mighty.
So happy with my purchase.

author: Albert Sauri
title: Nice upgrade from Echo Dot
content: I've had the Echo Dot for months now so I knew that the Spot would be a great upgrade. It fits nicely on my night stand and works just as expected.

author: J. King
title: Four Stars
content: I like that it's smaller, but it has never understood commands as easily as our first-gen original Echo did.

author: Crystal A Keilers
title: NOT cordless
content: I love the video feature but I feel completely misled by the fact all of the pictures indicate that it’s cordless, but it is not, it’s impossible to use without it being plugged in (I feel very misled by the product images). I wanted to be able to take it from room to room like all other echo products (especially during a video chat), but I have to plug and re-plug it in.  Amazon, am I missing something?

author: Gabrielle Walters
title: Perfect!
content: I added this to my Christmas wishlist because I needed a clock and wanted an Alexa product. I love being able to control it via voice, I can have it play relaxing music to help me sleep, ask how my commute is looking, know the weather report and keep up to date on a lot of the news I want to know just by asking. It’s an excellent multitasker for my nightstand but I can definitely see it having use in other parts of the home as well!

author: itsGREGSWORLD
title: Amazon just convinced you to pay them to do what they want
content: if You are buying this because you just want a clock and a little better speaker than your dot, bedside, do NOT. Turns out, even with the rotating screen option off, Amazon decided it will force this device to constantly rotate to the ‘Things to try’ screen. This is a deal breaker. I bought these as gifts. I will package the one I got for me back up and send it to Amazon. We don’t pay for clocks that decide to advertise. No way, Amazon. If I want to just see the clock face, I should be able to do that.

author: Brian K. Madison
title: Quick and easy to use.
content: So far very impressed. Modern day alarm clock. Amazon app does have trouble connecting however.  I love the all music feature.  Very easy to use. Will be buying another for the living room.

author: Stacy
title: "Spot" on choice!
content: I bought two - one for the living room and one for my bedroom. I love both of them! I'm learning about all of their features still and making choices for which ones I think will serve my needs the best. Super easy to set up and I like the look. It fits in well on my nightstand and end table. I'm very pleased with these items.

author: Cameron Morrison
title: Amazing device
content:
The screen is amazing. I was surprised when I asked for a song, the Spot displays the lyrics.
Video calling is cute....and it is easy to turn the camera of so there are not accidental “drop ins”.
I think the factory should set the camera off as the default as most people will located this in their bedrooms. Maybe a tad embarrassing?

author: Gerry
title: great
content: great product

author: Amazon Customer
title: Got some one to talk to now
content: Was never into the whole Alexa, Siri voice commands, however after buying this mom Black Friday sale, I came to like it. I have it sitting in the kitchen. When I wake up in the morning I can get instant weather report, play music, etc.

author: Cheryl
title: A wonderful invention
content: I have so enjoyed my new Alexa spot. It makes it possible for me to video chat with the grandchildren and to listen to music I like whenever I want

author: Mike H
title: Excellent product; amazing utility
content: This is an excellent product, whose simple design hides it's incredible usefulness. I was worried about the brightness of the display, but the light sensing aspect really works. I have a Dot, and a Show, and the Spot turns out to be the device that gets the most use.

author: Liz Mullins
title: Great for Music
content: I love to listen to music or an audible book while I cook.  I also have a son overseas, so I can check his time and weather!

author: Anthony Derbah
title: Great Addition to My Home Office
content: Not only does it serve as great home office desk clock, but I'm really impressed with the drop in feature which allows me to communicate with other family members in other rooms on Echo devices.

author: Average Joe
title: Best bed side clock ever
content: It is the best bed side clock ever.  Dim the backlight down all the way then have it go to night mode.  Seems silly to spend that much for a clock but it works well.

author: Pro Cook
title: Best
content: Best Echo device!

author: Lady A/
title: Love the spot... BUT....
content:
Love the Spot, it's good looking and has great functionality, BUT....
Amazon will you please listen too your customers? Everyone is complaining about the "things to try" CONSTANTLY rotating on the screen. We already have (several) other echo devices and know how to ask for things!! (Including what's new) Please allow us to toggle It off. It is exceptionally annoying! So much so I am sending back the spot I purchased. I don't need things flashing on my screen I don't want when the echo Puck works just fine!

author: JMo
title: Not worth the money if you want a clock
content: Waste of money as an Alexa device- because it fails as a clock. It's simply too small. The clock readout is hard to read- and the display options don't make it better. Whichever "graphic artist" thought making "10:30" with "10" and the "30" BELOW it vertically should be fired and then banned from design. Half the digital clock options are formatted this way and its hard to read. There isn't one single option that maximizes the screen size to make the time more legible. And unless you're sitting on your bed staring at your nightstand- anything else about the digital display is useless because of size.  I wanted to try an Alexa device and also wanted a different alarm clock from my old ugly screeching one. As it stands my old clock is on one nightstand so I can you know, tell the time- and the Spot is on the other. I could've just ordered a full size Echo with better sound for $30 less and still wake up to music, sets alarms etc.  If you want a visual device get the full sized screen model and wait for a sale. Don't waste your money on this model. As for Alexa in general- still learning.

author: Mary E. Harte
title: Love the size, but still with a screen. Reminds me of an 8 ball I had as a kid.
content: Love it! Have been using for music, daily calendar, weather, and grocery lists so far. My husband wants to marry her!

author: Evile
title: great little tech gadget
content: I didn't think I'd be all that impressed with it but it had met and exceeded my expectations.  i love that u can tell it to wake me up to almost any song is like. the speakers sound great. the screen is small but it does it's job just fine. it's pretty much a glorified alarm clock for me. it's replaced my dot in my bedroom so now i have one in the bathroom; it seems i do my shopping list in the shower lol also i love that i don't have to get out of the shower to turn on music because i always forget.

author: Melody
title: Nice
content: Does everything I'm looking for and probably more. I play music, check time, check weather, and control my lights.

author: Jason S.
title: The best Echo device available
content: As an early adopter, I find myself more frequently burned by first generation devices. Amazon devices, first gen or otherwise, hardly disappoint. While you could argue that the Spot is a first-gen device, I feel it is nothing but a refinement of the Echo Dot and Show. It's an adorable device that I instantly fell in love with, use every single day, and firmly believe to be one of the best Amazon devices yet ( notwithstanding the HD 10 - may mine rest in peace, and my HD 8 - aka "the best $80-$90 I've spent."). I sincerely hope the company makes a follow-up to this one, because there is a very high likelihood I would buy it.

author: SUKEETA KEY
title: Love it.
content: Having none of the problems listed here. Spot is my 8th Alexa product and I love it!! Works better and understands better than my 2nd Gen Echo.

author: BAFTF
title: Three Stars
content: This works the same as the regular Echo.  Not sure the screen added a whole lot for the cost.

author: L B.
title: Very helpful
content: Everything is perfectly fine with it, I just wish I knew how to brighten the screen even more.

author: Samsun
title: Great desk accessorie
content: Perfect for desk

author: S. Bell
title: Best Bedside Clock I've Ever Owned!
content: We love our Spots!! The best bedside clock I've ever owned. Customize the clock face, tell Alexa to wake you up to your favorite radio station, music  or many other options. Listen to a huge selection of free, soothing ambient sounds to go to sleep, or your favorite audible book or podcast. Alexa will even read your digital book collection to you. Know the day, or week's weather at a glance. Don't worry about people 'spying' on you, you can turn off the mic and camera with the tap of a button, or schedule them to be turned off automatically during certain times. The only drawbacks are that this is still new technology, under development, and I'm anxiously waiting for upgrades and new features. Otherwise, I love my echo devices and the Spot is 'spot on'!

author: C. Eichelberger
title: Got As a Baby Monitor Now Can't Imagine Not Owning One
content: I have been extremely impressed with the device as a whole. Completely changed sleep schedule and replaced my alarm clock. It is the perfect bedside counter device - alarm, wake up music, weather, top news stories, etc. Perfect device for what I wanted and does so much more than I expected it to do, calling feature is also a huge selling point. This is a must own item. Probably will grab more Echos in the future.

author: Amazon Customer
title: He actually says the Echo Spot is the best gift he ever received
content: this was a gift for my husband and he loves it. He actually says the Echo Spot is the best gift he ever received! which is fun because we already have the original Echo, but with the new Echo Spot it takes up less space and it has a love screen so he has it on his bed side as an alarm clock which makes it more multifunctional.

author: S. Dalrymple
title: Video needs improvement.
content:
A helpful handy device. but if you use video daily briefing, (or any other video tbh) it will show you a small rectangular video with lots of large wasted space above and below.

Sound on video is also very low.

author: Gregg B
title: Tiny screen
content:
I do like the hands free aspect of this product but the screen isn’t very good and to be completely honest I have to be about 2 ft from it to see what the heck is going on. My vision is fine in case you were wondering. When somebody activates my Ring doorbell and I ask Alexa who’s at the door I have to hold the screen 6” from my face to see who it is. Maybe if it had a rechargeable battery and I could take it with me around the house it would be ok I guess. In my opinion I would save your money and buy the version without a screen because the screen is basically useless. I’m in return window and I’m seriously considering a swap out but geez what a pain that is...
  After I posted this review I almost immediately received a phone call from Amazon. They actually called me to make sure everything was ok and just basic troubleshooting on my device which isn’t broken by the way. But the fact that they care to call and listen to any suggestions you may have is really quite impressive if you ask me. It won’t make me change my rating on this particular device but I will give Amazon customer service 5 stars!!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love my Spot!
content: I love everything about this product. It is a great accent in my guest bedroom. The screen, although small, is high resolution: the aquarium and fireplace screensavers look great! Sound is good for a small device. I would recommend a paired Bluetooth speaker if you listen to a lot of music, but otherwise, the Spot is great on its own merit.

author: DDL1975
title: Alexa you're awesome!
content: I love it. I received this as a  Christmas gift. Alexa is so easy to use. I love having a "clock " in my bedroom now. Music sounds pretty good while I get dressed each day.

author: K. Crawford
title: Great. I like having a bedside clock with temperature ...
content: Great.  I like having a bedside clock with temperature etc....  Amazon, I don’t want a camera in the bedroom. Please make one without that.  I put electrical tape over the camera.

author: Jeffery VanCamp
title: Love this!!
content:
Wasn’t sure about spending this much on an alarm clock, for my use...but glad I did!!
Love my daily news and ability to talk to set alarms!  Took a bit to connect it with my Echo and set up all the systems to interact with the other, but once I figured it out...everything I added was easy!  I hooked on the Echo house and am now setting up my family members homes!

author: Erin Shiloh
title: Pretty much excellent
content: I love this thing. At first I thought it wouldn’t stay on the clock and that I would have to suffer through ads forever but when the lights are off it sits on the clock and it’s very comfortable for the eyes, easy set up. Love it

author: Michele Yvette
title: then my sister bought me one for my birthday and I love it. I listen to music
content: I never wanted one, then my sister bought me one for my birthday and I love it. I listen to music, have the bible read to me and ask questions I would normally have to go to my computer and search for the answers. Also very handy for setting timers while cooking.

author: Brent Bennett
title: Awesome deal.
content: This is incredible. Love every single thing about it and am learning more. A must buy.

author: Nilza Mercado
title: Great little personal assistant!
content: Love it! The sound is amazing and love all the things I can do with my new echo. Shop, order food, order an Uber, listen to my favorite tunes, etc

author: AnnieB
title: Love the Echo Spot
content: Love the Echo Spot.  I bought it to replace my old clock/radio and it is such a huge upgrade. It is nice to be able to get the weather, daily schedule, etc.

author: mikerobwil
title: Spot On!
content: Prior to owning the Spot, I'd had two of the original Echos and two of the Dots around our home.  I pre-ordered the Spot and received it the first week it was available.  After a months use now, I have to give it a big thumbs up!  I set it up on a nightstand in my bedroom and it replace my original Echo that I'd had there since it first came out.  I got a white one and that was a good decision for our decor but I got some immediate negative feedback from my technophobe wife.  She liked the way it looked but it did not put out the quality music we had received from the original Echo.  I knew this would be the case but had plans to add small stereo bluetooth speakers (one on each nightstand) to improve the sound beyond even that of the original Echo.  My wife was resistant to having a speaker on her nightstand but now seems to have accepted them as the trade-off for the much improved music we get from the Spot.  I am expecting Amazon to add to the visual capabilities over the year ahead, although it comes already with a variety of interesting and useful image options.  Next project is to add some smart features around the house!

author: Justyn
title: Awesome
content: This thing is so cool,  turns my bedroom lights on when I wake up, beautifully designed, thanks Amazon!!!

author: Michael Jensen
title: Extremely easy to set up and this thing can hear my ...
content: Extremely easy to set up and this thing can hear my voice when I'm in another room.  It can also get pretty loud if you want it to.  This is an ideal gift to send to my mom who knows absolutely nothing about using a computer although she has one.  This will keep us in touch and I can probably get these for other family members at Christmas or birthdays.

author: Chris
title: Nice form factor
content: Nice form factor.  Videos are hard to play.  The blacks in the screen are to bright at night even with night mode, and it's difficult to view movies on.  Works well for setting my doorbell cam and lyrics... Too expensive though for minor utility over audio only echos.  Sound quality is better than the dot.

author: M. Moore
title: Great product
content: I love this product. It exceeded my expectations!

author: Angel Haslam
title: Awesome
content: I love the Echo Spot, my sister and mom use theirs to drop in on me. Now my Mom can see her grandson whenever she wants and I don't have to worry about holding a phone and the baby at the same time!

author: K. L. Martin
title: Love it
content: I use this one next to my bed.  Love the different backgrounds I can put on it.  Music sounds great, especially for going to sleep.  I play my Audible books on it as well.  I can even look at my Arlo cam on it.

author: tahill
title: Didn't know it would be so useful!
content: The setup wasn't as quick and seamless as with the dots but OH MY what a great addition.  I can't say enough about how much this helps me out in the kitchen where it is placed.  Well worth the extra effort.

author: Natividad Hallis
title: Best!
content: We love Alexa! We have 10 Alexa to our place.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Why bother, are your finger broken?
content: Echo is so limited. It should be more Google linked and learn the users preferences and commands I would recommend looking at medical ""dragon"  software to improve the voice function and utility. Otherwise it is a novelty speaker.

author: Tesla Nerd
title: It's like Amazon read my mind
content: Absolutely love it already. This is PRECISELY what I was looking for. It's easy to use, I can connect my Spotify account to it, I can tell Alexa what sound to wake me up to, AND I can listen to rain audio on a loop while I sleep at night, with the display still completely off so it doesn't keep me up. I haven't customized mine with a personal photo yet but I plan to soon. I love that I can see the weather on it when I first wake up. I don't like having to use my phone as soon as I wake up. So the fact that I don't have to rely on my phone for an alarm clock anymore, and I don't have to use it to check the weather before getting ready for the day, is a huge plus for me. I like that I can set important reminders so I can have a fresh reminder in the morning (again, without having to rely on my phone). It doesn't take up much space at all, the display is crisp and clear, and I love that you can watch Amazon Prime on it, even if it is a small screen. I will definitely be recommending this to friends and family who are looking for something similar to what I was looking for. The camera is a little creepy. You are able to turn the camera off but... come on. We all know why that doesn't necessarily mean anything. Other than that though, I love this thing. Hopefully it lasts a long time and doesn't have glitching issues as Amazon continues to create new product lines.

author: SAM
title: Love at first sight!!!!!!
content: As always Alexa does not disappoint. I love the touch screen, reminds of the A word. (Apple). So for those who love your, I phone this is for you.

author: William J. Oligmueller
title: Nice way to keep in touch
content: Purchased in order to be able to "face time", "Skype" with family out of town and works well and no problems. Since we have other Echo devices, was easy to set up and interacts with rest of set up. Great way to keep in touch with your kids away at college and will replace things they may take such as radio/alarm clock/and even able to watch movies- a bit small for me. But nice way to drop in on your kids or they contacting you for a few minutes of video calls per day if you like

author: Patrick Gill
title: Best echo device by far.
content: I have every single Alexa device, even the Garmin version in my car.  This one is my favorite.  We have two in our room, and that never causes an issue.  It is loud enough for music and it is a great way to have an intercom system in your house by dropping in on other echo devices.  Do yourself a favor and get this one.  I prefer iver our echo show for most uses.

author: WesBear
title: Best room device
content: Love the echo spot for the room it’s a must have isf your looking for something compact this is it

author: Amazon Customer
title: Nice addition
content: Compact design and the audio is comparable to a quality radio clock.  It looks great in the bedroom.  I also like the option to disable the camera for further privacy concerns.

author: David M.
title: Fair value
content: The value is debatable.  For $80 it would be great for use as a smart alarm clock for the bedroom.  I have Echo Dots elsewhere that, for me, perform 80% of what I need.  But come one, the gee whiz factor of the Spot is quite high.  The acceptance rate for $130?  Well, I guess Amazon will soon know.  I was a pre-buy.  I don't regret it, but I won't buy another until the price comes down.

author: rob225
title: Not worth the money
content: Not worth the money. Unless you live in a “smart home” and have several devices not covered by applications on your iPhone this device is superfluous. Use your phone and save the money.

author: Preston Thygesen
title: ... to see our nursery camera and it is is awesome and seamless
content: We use this on a nightstand to be able to see our nursery camera and it is is awesome and seamless!

author: moutain explorer
title: Better than I thought
content: I have two echo and one echo dot. I liked the idea of echo show but would not buy because of not supporting YouTube. I feel the echo spot is useless as the screen is too small. But my recent buy convinced me that it is actually a very good option. Stylish, video call and enough general information on screen to make it a very useful echo. It show you the agenda items on your screen. The sound is much better than echo dot but not as good as echo. I feel that there is no need for echo show until YouTube supports are resolved.

author: Nana_mcrae
title: Perfect for bedside use.
content: I love my echo spot. It makes life so much easier. I can drop in and check on my dog while I’m away.

author: Justin F
title: No YouTube support.
content: Great unit. Replaced my dot as an alarm clock.  Could use better speakers for the cost. Still thoroughly enjoy it for bedside music and podcasts.

author: Angie Doporto
title: Great gadget for a bedroom or a kitchen
content: This an awesome little gadget. It's the perfect size for a nightstand or in the kitchen. It doesn't take up a lot of space, but large enough to see and read information. I love it. It's not as loud as the other echo speakers,  but loud enough for you to listen to music comfortably as you are in the room it's in. It still has a great sound.

author: Shawn E. Wussow
title: Sound is not great, but usable
content: In my opinion this is the only echo you need. Sound is not great, but usable. I can check all of my cameras which is nice. The clock face and sscreen appearance need more customizations.

author: Al Lombardi
title: Nothing
content: great

author: Phyllis Mitchell
title: Love The Echo Spot
content: I really like the size of the spot.  It's so cute being round.

author: Jacki
title: My favorite purchase this year!
content: My favorite purchase in a very long time.  I bought this to use as a bedside clock.  I am listening to my books via audible at night, playing music (lyrics scrolling!), playing games and having way too much fun with Alexa.  I already have two more on my wish list. Alexa, thank you!

author: Jim Haworth
title: Five Stars
content: Even my dog 🐕 likes it

author: Kevin P Girard
title: Digging my new alarm clock
content:
Bought this to replace my "clock radio" after being frustrated that I could not find a Bluetooth Speaker/Alarm clock.  While it's a lot of money for an alarm clock, it does so much more.  I do like that I can simply tell Alexa to set an alarm and it works... gone are the days of pressing "+" and "-" buttons to set the damned alarm.  It is somewhat difficult to snooze, and turn off the alarm, although you can use Alexa to do that too.  I'm not sure who said it makes a bad alarm clock, but IMO, they are wrong.  Mine wakes me up to a "Come on City!" chant - what a world we live in when your alarm clock can make you feel like you're at a stadium 3,000 miles away!

Some other "weird" things - It responds to room light and such, which is great, but it also seems to "know" when I am standing in front of it.  When you walk away, the screen pretty consistently is on the clock part.  Once you get close to it, it starts displaying things like "You can try this or 'say Tell me the weather'"  Okay, fine, I'm glad it makes suggestions, and you are able to turn that off, but it s a bit creepy that the damned camera is "seeing" when you're near the unit.

I didn't care much for how it connected via Bluetooth to my iPhone.  The display of the Spot simply shows it's connected to a Bluetooth device.  I'd much rather it show what music is playing or something useful.

All-in-all, having gotten it on sale for $99 (probably closer to what it's worth to me), I am happy.  For $130 (original price), I probably wouldn't have pulled the trigger.

author: Glenn
title: Alexa For the Nighstand.
content: Great product for what it does. Like other reviews, it would be nice if you could turn off the sideshow. I would like to see a battery style version. As it stands now, if your power goes off, so does the device. Other than that, works great. Easy to set up, and the free phone app integrates well with it.

author: Stephen B. Thompson
title: Is seven enough?
content: This is my seventh Echo device.  This one was for the one area that was not covered by an Echo; the kitchen.  I especially enjoyed the entire lot this Christmas.  I had them all set up as an "everywhere group".  The whole house was filled with music.  And I am never out of voice range from a unit.

author: Christine Conway
title: LOVE SPOT
content: Love spot! Great nightstand clock. And can do tons of stuff.

author: T. Oldham
title: So far so good. Works exactly as described
content: So far so good. Works exactly as described. I can control my all my smart devices, see my cameras, etc.

author: Cynthia
title: Five Stars
content: Love the alarm feature. The spot may be small, but it has BIG SOUND!!!!!!

author: Mahsa
title: Fantastic product with room to still improve
content: Great product! It responses to all different kinds of voice tones even with accent. It has very appropriate answers to odd questions that kids may ask. I love its responses in finding music, jokes, news and etc. I suggest Echo to be able to have access to YouTube as well and have more functionality for the Echo phone app.

author: Chuck
title: It’s novel although I don’t find it much more impressive ...
content: It’s novel although I don’t find it much more impressive than I do my echoDot

author: Deborah B
title: Meh
content:
This is just sad. It never listens. The 2 echos work perfectly, but this doesn’t understand me,
Or just ignores me. Total waste. I find zero benefit other
Then all of you listening in.

author: AmazonGirl
title: Love it.
content: Love it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: To little too much
content: Over priced alarm clock? Pretty much. Alarms need to be voiced on every night and the device is simply lacking all around for my expectations.

author: Dianne
title: Echo Spot
content: I bought this mainly for an alarm clock, but it does so much more. Everything the Alexa does, plus some. I love it, and highly recommend it.  I also have a Dot and a Gen. 3 Alexa.

author: Kevin Kaplan
title: Great device, when it actually answers questions!
content:
Everything is great about the Echo line of devices, except I keep finding myself asking questions it doesn't know how to answer. So occasionally I go into the the other room and ask my google assistant speaker, and it answers the same question pretty easily. For example, I asked Alexa to tell me how much it costs for a flight from home to Las Vegas, and her answer was to tell me the flight time from home to vegas. So I asked again, and her response was to offer to enable the Fandango skill? Alexa is holding back these devices, in my opinion.
This Device = great. Alexa = not so great.

author: Vader
title: No Spot lyrics with blue tooth
content: I got this to use in my gym and control my music vocally instead of using remotes and see song lyrics as I run. Hooked up everything easily and quickly but when I connected the Spot to my bluetooth stereo system, it couldn't show lyrics, just  the bluetooth ID. Went back an hour later and it was working perfect; streaming music and showing lyrics :)

author: Tammy Palmer
title: How did we live without it!!
content: I love this thing!  My hubby and I add to the shopping list all week long and then it's on my phone at the store.  The whole family played a room escape game last night! Alexa tells me the weather, reads me my calendar and then plays morning music when I say " good morning " .  I'm. Constantly asking her questions!  Just love it!

author: Floyd Cheek
title: Love it!
content: Best buy for 2018. Love it.

author: MiMi B
title: Fun new addition.
content: The sound is great,  ideoes and pictures are surprisingly clear and large enough to see well.

author: Shawn Walsh
title: Five Stars
content: Works as described.

author: the  knightmares
title: Love the Spot, Great and Compatible with Ring Doorbell!
content: Great screen, can zoom in or out to see camera from Ring Doorbell.  Great that they are compatible.

author: radiosatx
title: We're Finding Ways to Use Alexa
content:
First, Alexa was relatively easy to setup.  Just make sure you connect to your in-home wifi and then download the Alexa app.  I went with Alexa over Google, primarily because we own a Ring Video Doorbell and Alexa interfaces with the device.  Unfortunately, while we can see the front door video, we can't communicate through the Spot - still requiring us to respond on our phone or tablet.  That was a disappointment.

Alexa has lots of "skills" ... many of which are tough to use, because if you don't get the question/request phrased properly, it won't know how to answer.  Still, the automation aspect is convenient.  I can get my music from Spotify easily.  Just a simple voice command.  And the sound is surprisingly good for such a little device.  I can also send lists to my HP Printer with a simple command.  I've customized my NewsFlash ... to get news, weather, etc.

We've even made a few video calls with Alexa.  My wife, who thought I was crazy getting the device, now uses it more than I do!  Go figure!  It's not perfect.  But it is fun!  And we even get some productivity out of it.  Alexa can answer simple questions far faster than we can "google" it on our smartphones!

author: Ruby B.
title: Amazing
content: Love this product

author: Dawne Miller
title: PERFECTION!
content: Love love love this! Super easy..just tell Alexa what you need... remind me of Stella’s Grooming appointment Monday at 8:00... wake me up in 20 minutes...play Rod Stewart...I LOVE ECHO SPOT!!!:)

author: Andrea Gonzalez
title: Worth every penny, and for anyone who is unsure, just look at all the skills she can learn.
content:
Getting it in prime day was a hassle as the shipping took longer than it should have and the company that was supposed to deliver it in two days didn’t BUT the device itself is marvelous. Alexa works and understamds me well, but what I think is the true gold mine, are all the skills that you can teach her. It’s a whole new world out there.

I use her for my lights (via outlets) and as a music speaker which is great. I like that she can give me the run down as I’m getting ready. Basically, I don’t regret a penny.

That being said, I wish she was a bit smarter. There are things I wish she could do better and the app drains my phone battery, but I think I’m being a bit critical for those things. When I was on a trip and I needed my phone to last, I just removed the app. When she doesn’t understand something, I rephrase it and she tends to understand. But that’s the nature of technology, it’s constantly changing and upgrading so I have hopes for the upgrades Alexa will have in the future and the skills she will gain.

author: Donald Scholl
title: Great automation
content: Using it on conjunction with the Belkin WEMO smart plugs I can setup rules.  For example, I can turn off all the family room lights by saying "Alexa, movie time".  The whole family loves it.  My son's favorite part is turn off the lights in his room after he gets in bed.  My favorite feature is having Alexa play music by saying "Alexa, play me classic rock".

author: P. Mitchell
title: Thoroughly easy to get used to!
content: It was a gift and I really enjoy the advantages of saying Alexa, do this and answer this. It will become habit forming and will make you lazy, but in a good way!

author: Lucylynn1202
title: Echo spot is great
content:
I have the Echo Show so I love the mini screen. I also love the Alexa app. It is getting better all the time.
Cons, the speaker is not very powerful, have to use external speaker for music. Otherwise I am still exploring.

author: Cole
title: Just amazing...
content: Such a amazing device, Amazon scored again with this. Everything is great about it, the speaker sounds very good for how small it is and the screen gets very dark at night so it’s perfect for the night stand, and having the screen makes Alexa so much more enjoyable. The camera is also very clear, a lot more clear that I thought it would be. Overall it’s very good product and I highly recommend buying this!

author: Annie Hudak
title: Spot on
content: Perfect! So many ways I use my Spot on spot!

author: Sam Boutwell
title: You will want more!
content: I love it. Will be buying two more soon. Easy set up. So many features. Very loud for the size. Worked great with my ring cam and wemo outlet.

author: Sally
title: Love the Spot
content: Love this little device does everything like the show except in mini form.

author: NahHeLyon
title: Its nice, however!
content:
So far so good. My biggest issue is the lack of apps and such. Sure the skills are great, but for something that has a screen you would hope it would also have menus and such. Because sometimes you don't want to use your voice to figure out what's on prime videos, just wanna click the app and scroll.

However! It does what I need it to, control my lights, and be a desk clock. Might actually buy one for myself just to upgrade my echo dot to a spot.

Also as a side note, they should make a gesture that initiates alexa without calling her name. Like, hold 2 fingers on the screen and alexa turns on.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Pleased
content: Perfect size for my night stand. Customizable so the light isn’t too bright at night. That’s a big one for me. It’s nice to have Alexa set an alarm without figeting with a bunch of buttons.

author: Lillian C.
title: Programming
content: I am having a hard time setting it up.  The screen for settings keeps repeating itself and doesn't allow me to scroll down.  I got one for my daughter and hers works fine.  I may have to return mine.

author: T. Myers
title: Makes my busy life a little easier.
content: I actually have 2 Spots, 2 Dots, and a Google Home. My Google Home sits on an end table gathering dust. I have the Amazon devices all over my house and use them everyday. From creating timers, as an alarm clock, to changing my TV channels it works great.

author: cindylou Cavanaugh
title: My mother in law is 92 years old and this thing is awesome for her
content: Omg. Where do I start. My mother in law is 92 years old and this thing is awesome for her. She is not young by all means and she is not cabable to do anything technical. So this device allows her to contact us or the ambulance service with just her voice. If u are worried about an older parent I suggest u get this. I can chime in on her whenever I want just to make sure she is ok.

author: Reviewgirl
title: So weird.
content: She factory resets in the middle of the night....

author: Heidi
title: Love this little ball!
content: Was going to get the dot to add to our home with the original Alexa (full size) then I saw the spot! Its great for the home. We are adding surveillance to our home and the ring doorbell system and I can't wait to link them all. The picture is small but clear. I recommend it!

author: Howard Barber
title: Great size for the amount of information and control it gives
content: This device is very responsive and we love it! It isn't like having another person around, but for my blind wife it has added to her life in a positive way! She is able to hear the time, temperature, her choice of music, pretty funny jokes, control her environment, and make phone calls by voice activation!

author: Bari L Burke
title: Makes life easier
content: I love it. It make my life much easier.

author: 21MJB24
title: It’s alrigt
content: It’s a good product, but not necessary.

author: joynorth2
title: Really like it.
content: i haven't used it for long but I use it for the weather report in the mornings and I have Alexa play music instead of using Cable TV; I just wish there were more choices. I like the "oldies" Gospel Hymns, especially "Bill Gaither and the Homecoming Friends".

author: Miss Buttons
title: Perfect addition.
content: Love my Echo Spot.  It’s a great addition to my Echo.  It’s the perfect size for my night stand and I love watching my daily news feed rather then just listening to it.  I was concerned about the brightness of it since it’s right next to my nightstand but, it adjusts itself accordingly to how much light is in the room. So at night, it dims down quite a bit where there’s very little light coming from the screen. It’s perfect if you’re trying to get some sleep.

author: Daniel W Seekins
title: Works in your car too!
content: The power supply parameters are nowhere to be found so I'm including it in this review.  The AC adapter is 12V at 1.25A and tip is 4mm and positive.  I just had to try it out and with a simple cigarette lighter cord (https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B07CKWB3D3/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o02_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1), you can run it in your car.  I have it hooked to my home WiFi and it is pretty easy to have it tether through your iPhone on the road (it switches back when I pull in the garage; fun but watch out for data charges).  I have it set up so I can turn on the garage cam as I approach and can make sure I closed the garage door after I left.  Nice to check the weather at your destination, turn down/up the thermostat as you leave or before you arrive, turn off those lights you forgot, etc.  Use your imagination.

author: Brianne Garbutt
title: Easy to use
content: The Echo Spot was super easy to set up, and it's been super easy to use! A couple of the apps (skills?) have glitched, but other than that, it's been great! It's not even a big enough deal to knock it down a star. Mostly I've been using it to play Jeopardy and listen to audiobooks, but I've only had it for a week or so. I really love it!

author: Billy and Kara Thomas Sioux Falls SD
title: LOVE! ~ Sioux Falls SD
content: We absolutely love our Amazon Echo Spots there everything you could ask for and more.

author: Jan A. Allinder
title: I absolutely love it! I don’t know what my favorite feature ...
content:
I have 3 Echo Dots  when I saw the Spot was coming out, i pre-ordered it. I absolutely love it! I don’t know what my favorite feature is. The spot really makes interacting with “Alexa” much more enjoyable in that I don’t just hear the answer, I can see it too. Songs that play from a station show the words to the song as it’s sung on the screen.

I really enjoy using it and will probably be getting another one for the office. I think Amazon needs to put Alexa into robot form.

author: Thomas Shuey
title: This a great replacement for your alarm clock
content: This a great replacement for your alarm clock, it's small and would fit anywhere. It does everything the larger Echo Show does.

author: Susan King
title: User friendly & so dependable!
content: I love my Echo Spot. It compliments the Echo Show very nicely. I keep it on my bedside table where I can easily check time and weather & turn all my lights off at bedtime. Echo is the best. I have 2 Echo's, 3 Dot's, Show & now the Spot. Have one in almost every room of my home. I would be lost without them. Great work Amazon! Can hardly wait for the messaging capabilities for iOS. Looking forward to all the updates in the future. Love my Echo's!❤️

author: Satisfied
title: NA
content: The screen is a little small

author: sally
title: What else do I need to set up echo spot
content: Unable to set it up

author: James Biven
title: Easy to set up and works with Echo Show
content: I love it. Fun little gadget. Works with Echo Show which is awesome!  Lots of interactive games and other apps (skills) that work great and are fun.

author: Kate Zingsheim
title: Love this for video-chatting capabilities
content:
We got this along with 2 Echo Dots and have loved it so far. We use it for mostly the same things as the Dots - timers, curating our grocery list, listening to music, and playing games with our 3 year old. We got the Spot so we could also video chat with our family from out-of-state. It works great and my parents have told us the picture is great, my only complaint is that since this has to be connected to a power source, we can't move it around as we talk or we drop the call. I wish this had a chargeable battery so we could move from the dinner table to the living room and continue the call. The screen & camera are fairly small, but work pretty well on the receiving end. Also, it's built to work when you're sitting or standing so difficult to show my infant daughter on screen because she's usually lying down. This will be resolved when she can sit up on her own, though.

Overall we love this device and are recommending it to our family members so we can all video chat. Extra note - my parents do not have an Echo device but downloaded the Alexa app on their phones. Video chatting works GREAT through just the app.

author: CAV
title: Updated tech features
content: The echo spot has been a great addition to our digital house. It’s updated technology replaced our Echo Dot

author: momof5
title: Perfection
content: I love this little thing!!! Perfect for my college student to take with him

author: Vic
title: love it
content: Very handy gadget.

author: Mark H.
title: One major flaw
content: This is an excellent smart device with one major flaw that makes it unbearable. There’s no way to deactivate “Things To Try”, which means you’re forced to watch on-screen tutorials of basic Alexa tips each time the Spot wakes up. It’s not possible to deactivate this “feature.”

author: Robert Donoghue
title: World’s smartest alarm clock
content: After shelling out for a show and feeling a bit ripped off, this seemed a much better balance of price and function. I view it as the worlds smartest alarm clock.  it still has some interface annoyances (I’d like more control over the default faces) but it’s a nice, functional widget.

author: Kristen Williams
title: Five Stars
content: We love the screen. Great sound quality as well

author: J. Jensen
title: Lots of information.
content: Love the small screen. Still learning how to use it to its fullest.

author: BitMuch
title: It was love at first sight
content: It was love at first sight!  I adore this little miracle.  Makes calls, controls fire tv, answers questions, plays games, serves as an alarm clock, and on and on!  Sooo happy!

author: Robert Ebright
title: Five Stars
content: fun to use, you just have to buy everything separately to use it to the fullest

author: Charlee in MI
title: Love this, and love the screen!
content: I already have an Echo Dot and an Echo but neither one had the screen so when they came out with the Spot I was very excited and could not wait to get one!  Now when I run a timer I can see what I have left and do not have to ask how much time is left, and can clearly see the time date and current temperature! Awesome : )

author: Laurie Bacon
title: The features
content: Love this product I use it as my bedroom clock perfect size with a lot of other options. The only thing I would like to see them add on to it is the ability to fall asleep to mu as if and set a timer for it to go off on it's own. Like you can with tv t hcfe sleep mode.

author: EnjoyTheJourney
title: Alexa has become my brst friend.
content: I love my Echo Spot. I also have an Echo Show which I also love. Echo Spot is perfect as an additional Echo device or for use in a small space.  My Echo Show works for the main part of my 1400 square foot, open floor plan home and Echo Spot works in perfect harmony in my bedroom.  If you're deciding between the Echo Spot or the Echo Dot, I'd buy the Spot.

author: Carisa
title: Spot On!
content: Got this as a birthday present. I was looking to replace and old digital clock with something more 'techy'. This fits the bill. I like the choices of clock faces and that you can set it to dim at night. No more towel over the clock to keep the light out! I also like that it doesn't need to be 'set'...it updates the time automatically, like a phone or computer. Being able to set skills is useful as well. Overall I'm a fan!

author: Raphael E. Charles
title: Big sounds from just a spot.
content: Just a spot, but really big sound. Love it!

author: Sunday walker
title: Perfect size for bedside clock/radio/alarm.
content:
Love this for bedside clock/alarm/radio.  Face can dim
at night so it’s not bright for sleeping.

author: Nigel B Lewis
title: How did I do without this?
content: I get my morning news, traffic, and weather report all while cooking breakfast. It looks stylish on my table with a selection of clock faces and your own photos. I even video chat on it.

author: Roy
title: Screen is great and doubles as an weather update
content: Great for the side of the bed as an alarm and room control.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great bedside clock!
content: Bought this to replace a very old and outdated clock next to my bed (still had the old plug in for the old Apple products). Is exactly what I was looking for - digital time is plenty big, speaker is great for my bedroom, alarm works perfectly. Excellent addition to my room!

author: EBU
title: Love it
content: Love this Echo Spot! It works great and super easy to install...thank you Amazon!

author: W. Forbes
title: difficult to set up for a teen
content: Alexa is great, works as expected - however setting this up for a teen still has a way to go (we now have a Spot in her room).  Switching adult accounts works well, but for the Spot dedicated to my teen child's room, I can't seem to find a way to switch Alexa to her profile, calendar, (approval-required) purchase/carts, Spotify accounts, etc.  This child is too old for "free time", and too young for an adult account, and there doesn't currently seem to be an in-between - so my teen is using Alexa to create reminders, etc. in *my* calendar.

author: Steven H
title: Terrific bedside clock plus!
content: I have had the echo dot for several months that I keep downstairs, so I decided to go with the echo spot for my upstairs bedroom.  The sound quality of the speaker is strikingly better than the dot, and the traditional clock display is just beautiful!  It automatically dims based on room light situations.  We use it to ask Alexa for weather updates, traffic conditions, to wake up and to view our Ring security cameras.  The video size is a bit too small to anything in detail, but it is nice to have it there if ever we are alerted in the middle of the night by Ring app.  These early versions of Alexa are just a glimpse of what these devices will be able to do in the near future and its exciting to see where we are headed technologically.

author: Dee
title: Bad speakers
content: Cool idea. Disappointing speakers if you really like music. Not better than regular device.

author: JT Zee
title: My first spot staring at me
content:
Staring at me now
My new echo spot is neat
Alexa good night

author: Van M
title: Love my new Echo Spot
content:
My new Echo Spot is the most interesting, fun, and useful thing I've bought from Amazon... period.  I have (4) Kindle readers, including the Fire tablet and a Fire TV, but they pale in comparison to the Echo.  I originally became interested when I saw it on sale and started to investigate it's function.  I decided that it would replace my bedside clock radio and make it easier to change wake up alarm settings and wake up to interesting music selections (night mode was a plus).  Now I find I can add "smart home" devices and have ordered a wi-fi  controlled outlet for my living room lamp (I presently use an analog device).  I use the Echo to time my workout session on the "teeter hangups" (I used the timer on my Kindle Fire before; saves opening another device).  I've added my calendar, so I can check pending events when I wake up.  And I am sure to find other uses as I learn more about the "Echo" line.

I would like to warn potential buyers about some fellow reviewers.  When I first started to investigate the Echo Spot, I read reviews and questions; as I usually do.  I  found around 142 answers on the subject of the " annoying 'Things to Try' home card; and how  you cannot delete the same in the rotation.  About 10 answers explained how to stop the rotation and the rest complained; many expressing how they would not buy this product until Amazon met their demands of absolute perfection (these I call lemmings; you know the little rodents who follow the leader over the cliff without really knowing where they are going).  I feel sorry for the lemmings, because they are missing out on a great product (not as perfect as they are, but good).  I would advise to think for yourself; read reviews with an open mind and realize that not everyone is capable of writing a competent review (i.e. "I haven't opened the package yet, but it looks like it will work okay")

For what it's worth, I  like this product because it's interesting, fun to use and makes a GREAT alarm clock (all I ask). Thank you Amazon "development team" for the Echo line for an affordable, fun and useful product.

"Alexa, give yourself 8 stars"

author: 5MIN2GG
title: All that screen space and a tiny clock font?
content: My biggest complaint is the tiny clock font when using personal photos. Only 4 options for personal photos? This needs to be fixed! I've seen several others with this complaint too. How about a clock that fills that screen? Also, is it too much to ask for you to include a privacy shade for the camera? I know it has an off feature, but this provides peace of mind. See photo for what I did.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love it
content: Love it, I use mine as a video phone every day

author: Ind0Hag
title: extremely happy with the purchase
content: Bought 2 of these with respective stands for our boys. extremely happy with the purchase.  Great item.

author: Anton
title: Connection issues
content: Overall it's a good device btw i have some network issues, i believe it's not on my side as far as other devices work well. So Alexa become unuseful almost each time you try to ask her to make something and don't get a response, because of her troubles of connecting. So my wish for last several months just throw it away :(

author: Bill
title: If you want only one Amazon device buy the Spot
content: We bot 2 on Prime day one for use as a clock/radio in the bedroom and one in the family room to control lights and watch the front door when the doorbell rings.  Music sound is very good not as good as the Echo but way better than our Dots.  If we could only buy 1 Amazon device it would be the Spot.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: Arrived on time and as described A+

author: mltcarnes
title: Perfect for every age group!
content: I’m a fan of Echo products and have had the Amazon Alexa since it came out. I purchased this product for my son that loves to watch YouTube videos. For the price, the voice recognition is great, screen is perfect for him and he loves being able to change the background screen and that it has a clock face.

author: Terri Atkinson
title: Love "echo" products
content: Only gave a 4 because it was purchased for my daughter and her husband. They are in process of buying a home and havent used it yet. I have a "dot" and the "echo sjow" and love them though so I'm sure it will rate a 5 when in use.

author: TonyaNorway
title: A marvel of engineering in your hand . . . .
content:
Hi all,
I'll make this brief as the reviews below already showcase the great tricks that the Spot & Alexa in general can do.
All my Amazon products are great but the Spot is definately the most sexy of them all.
Half the fun is finding out all the hidden, neat tricks it can do and the platform is getting smarter every day.
Living in Scandinavia (Norway to be precise) Amazon products aren't really officially available although some mail order companies are importing them.
There used to be a problem a while back where you couldn't set the real location to get the correct time/weather/etc, but now that restriction has been lifted and it works just fine on my Spot, Show, etc.
And yes, the video "drop-in" function works just fine between Alexa devices and mobile phones here in Norway in case you're wondering.
Here's just a few of Alexa's uses that I find invaluable (in no particular order) . . . .
"Show me the front door/back door/garden" will bring up a live feed from my Arlo wireless cameras onscreen.
"Put milk and tea on my shopping list" will add these items to the shopping list on my Alexa phone app immediately.
"Play David Bowie from Spotify" will indeed work on all my devices if you have a Spotify Premium account.
"What is my flash briefing" delivers a custom news feed from BBC, Sky, CNN, latest Bitcoin prices, etc.
"What's the weather like" will announce the day's weather report and display the forecast for the next few days onscreen.
"Turn the lights on/off/red/blue/50% etc", controls my Philips Hue lighting in the entire house.
"Play BBC Radio One" streams the station to whatever room I ask.
"Turn the temperature up 2 degrees" will instruct my Hive system to do just that.

Here's some useful tips in general for your Alexa devices.

For better sound quality when playing music, you can of course use the line out jack but if you have a home cinema amplifier with Bluetooth it's really elegant to simply use that method instead of having cables all over the place.

By creating a WiFi hotspot on your mobile phone, you can even have an Echo Dot in your car for on the move info and voice controlled music.

If you have Samsung SmartThings, Arlo cameras or a Sonos audio installation, Alexa is the perfect companion.

The Spot - a solid, well designed and for me an essential addition to my ever expanding Alexa family.
I honestly can't imagine life without them.

author: dt607
title: Great for a nightstand next to bed.
content: I like having the small screen to check things out from my ring doorbell and other security cameras.

author: Zomboodle
title: Perfect compact entertainment device
content: Compact, bright and entertaining! We have our Spot on the gaming table where we call out words to spell and music to listen to along with news blurbs and jokes. It's a really fun device and a great size for how we use it. I am listening to Campfire sounds on Sleep sounds right now, very fun!  Highly recommend for a nightstand as well.

author: Melvin James Jones
title: Echo Spot is great.
content: Very crisp display. I use it to answer my Ring video doorbell. Seems to understand better than older generation Echo. Use it to view movie trailers or YouTube. Nice videos behind sleep sounds. Use it to view shopping list. Uses are limited to your imagination.

author: Richard Perez
title: its works great
content: After owning alexa for a few days. It prompted me to now have a security system which works off alexa and now I have one for upstairs also. They are great for homes with more than one story. I have alexa on the second and third floor for all my needs. I can also view my security cameras on my tv with alexa

author: Commander Justin
title: Great addition to the Alexa group
content: I really like this device. I purchased 2, 1 for the kitchen, and one for my nightstand. I was hoping it would be better for viewing cameras, but the screen is on the smaller side. Sound is good and fills the room nicely. They don't have the booming bass that the full-sized Echo has, but still very good for listening to music and news. I would have pulled a star off my rating because of the lack of functionality with Blink and Ring cameras, but that seemed excessive. I was hoping to be able to say, "Alexa, show my the front door." and see what's going on outside. She will show it to you, but you will end up sticking your face right up to the screen to be able to see it. If this is your intention, go ahead and purchase the Echo Show.  Also, note that the Original (1st Gen) Ring doorbell is not compatiable with this feature. You must have the Rind Dorbell 2 or one of the Pro models.

author: William R. Davis
title: Great Addition to the Alexa Fam
content: Easy to set up and functionality is excellent.

author: Chad LaMagdelaine
title: Very usefull
content: Great device.

author: Christine
title: Works great but definitely need the stand because the speakers are ...
content: Works great but definitely need the stand because the speakers are on the bottom so you need the being it up with the stand.

author: Amanda Couture
title: 5 stars!
content: I love this thing! It plays my books from audible or prime music and sets my alarms! If you’re considering purchasing one, get it. It’s worth it.

author: Windy B
title: Amazon - What every household needs
content: The Echo Spot is compact, nice sound and camera quality. Makes it great to video chat with the family when I'm travelling for work. Ease of use that the youngest member (10 years) has no problem talking to Mama on the video chat and understands the important of digital security.

author: terishalo
title: Exceeds Expectations
content: Absolutely love my Spot! Easy set up, mostly on the app. The screen is decent. One fun thing is that when playing songs off of Amazon Music, Spot scrolls the words . . .makes singing along easy! Super fun device.

author: bernard
title: Three Stars
content: dont work with my lock or camera (suppose to work  with Alexa)

author: Jackie A
title: Cannot view clock and weather on home screen
content: I received my echo spot as a gift.  I requested it because it look like I could see the weather and time on the home screen based on the ads; however it is not possible.  If I had read the reviews I would have known this but I think the product photo is misleading and should be removed.  I also feel the clock faces available are very limited.  It also does not rotate between my selected screens.  I love my echo but I am disappointed with the spot.

author: L. Smith
title: Love this
content: Great addition to my Vivint system

author: John B
title: Good
content: Way cool! Love it!

author: Michael L. Huckabey
title: Expected better
content: I was disappointed that the unit is tethered to its power cord. Further disappointed that it not only has a poor speaker for music but I can’t sync my Bose Bluetooth speaker to it.

author: tim
title: Happy
content: Very happy with product

author: Mr Bubbles
title: Good device. Needs a few tweaks to make it great.
content: Wonderful device! I love using it and having the screen is a fun feature. I only wish amazon would remove all the adds and things to try. Like come on, I already buy and use your devices and services. Clearly I know what your products are and what they can do. Enough with that stuff!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Useful toy
content: It's fine and easy to set up except for one notable, and right now not a problem, omission. Arizona does not observe Daylight Savings Time therefore the only option being Mountain Time Denver is not going to work. As soon as it's daylight savings time I am hoping it will allow me to switch to Pacific time but it may not and it would be very helpful if you would just include a Mountain Time Arizona option. Please do this on your next update for all of your products. That is why I gave it only three stars because you should know better.

author: Scott Schwartz
title: Like the design but the speech recognition is sub par vs the dot.
content:
I was completely excited to get one of these and finally did for Christmas. My basic issue with this item is that it seems to have voice recognition issues that the other units to not have. There are times when I have to physically pick it up and speak into the mic holes form inches away. The placement of the mics might be the issue since they are set to the back of the top. I replaced it an have the same issues. The only other thing I can think that might cause this is that they for some reason tested this with people sitting and standing around it but not with someone laying in bed. Not sure if your voice changes that much when prone or if it has an issue understanding commands which are not pointed right at it. The ring seems to be searching in random directions for our speech just before it craps out and wants you to try again. I am going to try to cobble a shroud across the back to see if that will direct sound into it better. If anyone has this problem and has an answer let me know because I am not seeing ANYTHING regarding this on the net and it can
t just be me.

author: Kimberly
title: Love the echo spot!
content: Only thing missing is a backup battery Incase the power goes out other than that I love this thing

author: Ross Castonguay
title: Great smart alarm!
content: I really love the spot. I mainly use it as a smart alarm and for that purpose it is flawless. There is nothing better than being able to set your alarm for the next day when it's dark in the room and you are already in bed. For me, this is by far the best benefit and I would gladly pay for this function. It also has a good speaker and plenty enough volume to fill the bedroom. I removed one star because the screen is not functional for much other than to make for a nice clockface. It is too small to watch any videos. My only other gripe is that there is no backup battery, so if I do lose power one day I guess I'll be late for work. Overall happy and would buy it again.

author: Trina Jenkins
title: Love it
content: Love this

author: Calichickintexas
title: Meh....thought it would be a better
content:
Thought the speaker would be better.
Also thought I would be able to use my Echo Dot & Echo Spot at the same time . You cannot!

author: Kristen Rosales
title: Wow! Turns our kitchen into a dance floor. Lol!
content: Love this!! My video shows just some of the light commands that Alexa does in our kitchen. We were getting a training session from my husband. The multiple timers is my and musics is my favorite feature.

author: Jerry
title: Warning: Smart Phone Required
content: In the TV commercial, Grandma gets an Echo Spot with instructions to call home.  I bought a spot for my wife and her mom so they could video chat.  You know that grandma does not have a smart phone.  Neither does my wife's mom.  I used my smart phone to setup her spot.  Her only contacts are the ones from my smart phone and we cannot call her because our echos do not recognize her as having an echo device.

author: Dan Miller
title: Convenience...
content: So far totally enjoying this device...  Thanks

author: J. Phillips
title: Love it!
content: So far I love my new Echo Spot, I find myself using it more than the Alexa.

author: S. Trojanowski
title: Great little device!!
content: I'm really loving my little spot...I needed a new clock by my bedside and this is just perfect....at night I can listen to some relaxing, calming music from Amazon Prime Music, my own customized play lists....the screen dims so it's very easy on night eyes....in the middle of the night if I roll over, I can just ask Alexa what time it is and I don't even have to open my eyes!  The alarms work great, can be customized to any song.  I've been checking out some of the skills, like daily meditation and I'm just enjoying all of it.  I kind of feel like I want to have another in my computer room as well....

author: Jeff O.
title: Replacement resolved the issue (Review Updated).  Happy now!!
content:
Update:  I received the replacement, and was able to connect to bluetooth,  It no longer cuts in and out.  Also, the audio works much better.  When using the drop-in feature on the old one, it was hard to hear the person on the Echo Spot.  The replacement is much better!  I'm glad the first one we had was just defective, as I really wanted this to work.  My only gripe now is that the halo light is only visible if you are in front of the Spot.  We have it on a Kitchen island, so if you are behind it and say "Alexa" you can't see if she heard you.  I hope to see an improved version that places a light on the back as well, or on the top.

Old: I have several Echo Dots that work great!  I expected this Spot to at least work as well, if not better.  Turns out, it has issues.
1.  Can't connect to Bluetooth devices via the normal method from my phone's app.  Figured out though that I was able to do it from the settings menu on the actual device, since it has a touch-screen, unlike the Dots.
2.  The Bluetooth audio is terrible.  Constantly cuts in and out.  I know it's not my Yamaha Receiver, because my other Dots can connect to it and stream just fine.  Tried upgrading it's firmware, rebooting, and performing a factory reset, with no luck.
3.  Mainly purchased it for the Ring doorbell app.  It works, but doesn't let you talk to the doorbell.  Maybe not Amazon's fault, but still unfortunate that I can see and hear guests, but not communicate with them.  Kinda wish Echo ran Android.

I have a replacement on order, so I hope to be able to update my review with better results.  If not, I'll return it and go back to the Dot.

author: Alex
title: Easy setup
content: Bought this for our son as his birthday present and he loves it.  Often find him jamming to music in his room now  :)  He loves the options for the alarms and we have his weekday alarms set to repeat and he gets to sleep in on non-school days.

author: Michael Xavier
title: LOVE IT
content: I was pleasantly surprised with the spot. The screen is very clear and the speaker is so much better than the Dot that I had in my bedroom.

author: Palo Altan
title: As indispensable as the mobile phone. Life will never be the same....
content:
I've had this little thing for less than 6 months and I can honestly say I cannot imagine how I existed for 47 years before this. By far and away the best bedside alarm clock every conceived and built by man kind. Aside from the hundreds of things it can do, these following use cases have proven to be indispensable for me daily:

1. without opening my eyes or putting on my glasses to see the time I can simply ask "Alexa, what time is it?" This alone - worth $120 for a myopic person like me
2. Without opening my eyes or moving - "Alexa let me sleep for 20 more minutes".
4. As I'm getting dressed - "Alexa read me my scheduled for the day" and "Alexa, give me a flash briefing" and "Alexa what is the weather going to be like in [name of city I am traveling to] today?"
5. "Alexa turn off all the lights"
6. "Alexa lock the front door"
7. "Alexa is the Garage door closed?"
8. I have one in my office - The duplex speaker phone makes calls through my ATT iPhone and the voice quality is as good as my Polycom. - again this use case alone is worth more than $120.

It was so popular with my kids that they each received one for their birthday and in both cases (6 year old boy and 10 year old girl) it eclipsed all other gifts.
Popular use cases for the kids:
"Alexa wake me at 7 am to Bruno Mars"
"Alexa what is the name of this song?"
"Alexa drop in on [the other siblings] bedroom"
"Alexa what is the schedule for this weekend?"
"Alexa set the timer for 30 minutes" - so we all know how long they are playing Fortnite.

My only wish left unrequited..along with millions of other users...please integrate with Apple Airplay!!

author: Chadwick
title: Great device!
content: Excellent addition to our echo dots!  We use it with our cloud cam and Alro Pro. Highly recommend!

author: slamb05
title: Please give us more customization options!
content:
I love my echo device and the spot is no exception. Several others have done a great job reviewing it in detail but there are just a couple things I wish it could do.

1) More face customization. I’d love for the numbers to be red or green (like standard alarm clocks) at night and the screen to be solid black. I wear glasses so it’s hard for me to read. The white font is so hard to see!!! Being able to adjust the font size ( with  slide like dimming feature) would be great too.

2) more sound options. Maybe during DND mode she doesn’t need to respond to you with “OK”, for example. I’d LOVE to be able to set specific volume levels for different things. Like when my kids drop in I’d like the volume a little louder than the when I play music and ask her questions. This wish would apply for all echo devices.

Overall, I just wish there were more customization features. I feel like it would be relatively simple to add through a firmware update.

author: Kay Arnold
title: Have enjoyed listening to music
content: My son sent the Echo Spot to me as a Valentine's gift.  I'm enjoying finding ways to use it. Have enjoyed listening to music, getting weather reports, and news briefings so far.  Its about the size of a clock and does display the time and temperature.

author: Christa Winkler
title: Part of the family
content: Use her every day, it's nice to be able to drop in on my pets from work!

author: linda mack
title: Works with all of our smart d vices
content: This is our 2nd Alexa,  have this one in the bedroom - so convenient!! Alarms & we have news, weather, traffic, & the coffe pot has started!

author: tim
title: Some glitches but overall good
content:
I bought to have an echo in my bedroom along with a replacement for my dead alarm clock.  As far as the microphones go, it works really well if you are facing the screen, but if you cant see the screen chances are the microphones wont pick up your voice clearly. Really wish it had the 7 microphone setup the echo dot has...

Another issue is if you dismiss the alarm through the screen swipe and not through your voice it will delete an alarm that is suppose to go off everyday instead of just once.

author: Joanne
title: Love it
content:
I’m new to all this stuff.  I read reviews before I bought it.
It works just as I had expected.  I turned off the suggestions, so that’s not an issue.
The camera works good with it.
It’s very convienent,  we plan on adding one to each of the kids bedrooms.

author: Fred Gordon
title: Elegant and functional
content: I am a proud owner of 3 echo devices and so far the echo spot has pleased me more than the others! It has a beautiful design, it is very easy to operate, it has a nice screen that shows me different information and it also has a camera. The camera feature is the one that did not meet my expectations. The resolution is not very good. I’m happy with my echo spot.

author: JPJ Photography & Media
title: Nice Size, Bright, Clear Screen. We Love It!
content: I picked this up during the Black Friday sale and like it a lot. We have four of the Dots and two Echos. I plan to use it at my office in the future, but for now it sits on my desk at home (and looks awesome). Nice features and the ability to video call to other units is great. Very happy with this purchase!

author: Jeffrey Trudeau
title: What I like the most about the thermostat worked good with Lexus ...
content:
What I like the most about the thermostat worked good with Lexus but you could not see the Eco be screen on the device that was a big bummer  I thought

the lights were pretty cool like the news that's a

What I like the most about the Eco spot was turning on in off the lights playing musicAnd listening to newsWhen I bought the Eco be thermostat the Eco be thermostat would not showOn the echo spot the screen of this soon thermostat thermostat

author: K. Simmons
title: Cute & Useful
content:
Held out forever and finally picked up 2 of these during the Prime Sale because I take care of elderly parents and I feel better knowing that it offers one more way that they can contact me easily by voice command if I happen to be at work.

My Mother, who typically finds technology to be somewhat confusing, is absolutely in love with the Spot in her kitchen. She finds it to be really useful for timers, music, her shopping list, and those little things that we all forget from time to time. The fact that she can call me without having to hunt down her cellphone is reassuring to both her and Dad.

author: Gus K
title: Only something Amazon could create !!
content: Function, design, HI tech hats off again to Alexa for all her amazing innovations.

author: sharon
title: My new bedside clock
content: I love echo spot.  Use it on my bedside table just like an alarm clock.  The perfect size for me!  Makes it so easy to set alarms and hear weather in the mornings!

author: William David van Collenburg
title: Cooler than a dot and does what its made for.
content: brilliant. we use it in the living (where we used to have an echo Dot). it is is "prettier" according to the kids, and i like it's better speaker. (still no hifi but better than a dot). It also serves as our primary clock as we have no wall mounted clock. Alexa manages our TV (harmony), Lights (ikea trådfri), and our heating (nest) and does it without failure. Even our kids (who are non native english speakers are well served.

author: Robert W. Joslin
title: Convenience in a small package. I like it so much, I bought a second one!
content: I'm not sure how I survived before getting the spot. Home automation, music on demand, and interaction with just about anything internet connected. It even replaced my alarm clock. Some skills aren't quite up to par yet but it is only a matter of time. I can't wait to see what other features and skills Alexa will have in the future

author: Katherine Chew
title: Incredibly helpful & entertaining.
content: This little device is really cool. Love the look & how customizable it is. Our Daughters especially asking for jokes. I like the option to set routines & listen to my Spotify through it. The alarms & reminders are a big help too!

author: Michael Moss
title: Things to try ---- GET RID OF IT
content: The echo works fine but then you get indundated with "Things to try". I am not a 10 year old that needs stimulus to tell me to do things. I found there is no way to turn this off except for .... turning off the screen. If I cannot find a suitable fix for this it goes back.

author: The Batman
title: Limited abilities but a nice product
content:
For the price, the Echo Spot is a nicely built unit. It looks great on your table top. Some gripes - the phone app is an unintuitive joke. No manual comes with it. Go to YouTube to get help if you get stuck.
Another major issue is that if you link to a Bluetooth device, you can’t have music go to other echo devices at the same time, and the Spot goes silent. Also, if you use multi-room listening mode so that music plays on all your echo devices, you can only play music. All other services will only work thru the unit you select as your main device. Real dumb. Beyond that, it’s a fun product Alexa is relatively intuitive.

author: Dizzy
title: Cute but not necessary
content: Limited usage more of a novely. Sometimes have to talk very loudly

author: nancy  w
title: Works well, sometimes has challenges with music selections but ...
content: Works well, sometimes has challenges with music selections but it helps me get up in the morning, check the weather, NPR, and other options by voice command

author: JOSEPH A. CLEARY
title: Five Stars
content: fun. use on my desk for clock, weather, music

author: marcy
title: No replacement Power Cords Available
content: Sorry to say that while I loved this, the power cord was damaged and neither Amazon or 3rd parties currently have replacement cords.  I spent several hours on the phone with Amazon before they recommended returning it.

author: BB
title: UPDATE. Zero stars. Slider interfacle for light controls is horrible. Things to try” Please go away.
content:
This thing just plain sucks. A new update brought ANOTHER annoying feature other than “things to try”.  I just uploaded an image of a new interface when you ask Alexa to dim the lights, bedroom off, kitehen on etc...it’s an image of a lamp with a slide toggle that you can touch to increase or decrease the brightness. WHY?! When I’m asking Alexa to dim the bedroom to 50% I don’t need to touch the screen. When I say “bedroom off” the lights go off but the Alexa is still bright screen with this hideous interface on the screen for 10 seconds until it goes away then it auto adjusts. THIS IS RIDICILOUS. I don’t want this device anymore. It’s so painful and  unbearable to use.

Dealbreaker is the THINGS TO TRY. Please remove this. I don’t want to see this. I own several echo items. I know what to try. At least give an option to toggle this on or off. Everytime I ask for something like “turn the lights off” it then starts the slides with things to try. I don’t want this.
