I know I can set to show things to try only once after a request but this seems so silly that I cannot turn it off completely.

Please update this feature.

author: Lester R. Aubuchon
title: No
content: Have not used it much, but it looks like it will work well

author: Eric E
title: FANTASTIC - Everything I thought it would be.
content: The Echo Spot is taking the place of one of my DOT's in the bedroom and it is fantastic. I still have alot to learn but the video screen is better than I thought it would be. Threw away my old alarmclock and now I'm styling.

author: RED3
title: Works great!
content: Does excellent job of everything that I know of so far. Needs some more explanation of how to phrase your request.

author: WILLIAM W.
title: Good clear reading
content: I like my echo spot. I can see display clearly. Alexa not bad.

author: Bill
title: Echo Spot
content: Spot was bought for with to use primarily as an alarm clock. Normal Alexa functions seem to work well. The alarm clock functions need refinement. One should not have to vocalize alarm off or cancel all alarm settings with swipe.

author: Mr. P
title: a fun toy
content: Works well, just like the dot

author: W. Parker Sykes
title: Dot is attractive and has potential with further devey.
content: Nice appearance.  Can't get multiple screen configurations to work, like displaying time and weather at the same time.  It's interesting to see a talking person one Fix Need flash briefing buy no other feeds include video.  The sound is better than the dot.

author: Mark Davies
title: Great bedside clock / home auto / info utility.
content: Like this a lot - the auto diming feature makes is easily fit as a bed side alarm / utility.  It goes really dim after lights out so you can just read the clock.  Everything else as you'd expect from alexa which is great.

author: Reg
title: So cool and futuristic
content: I like so many things about this. The intercom feature, the lyrics on screen to songs, watching news stories, playing movies! Oh yeah and it's a clock. Lol

author: GLD
title: Five Stars
content: I love this - it helps me multi task around the house.

author: Alvaro A. Bravo Kohler
title: Love this device.
content: Although everyone is nervous on these devices spying on you, forget about it, no value on your private life, so stop worrying.  I understand the value that Alexa network provides, yes there are some commercial interests behind and Latin America languages are not supported but clearly Alexa network is a customer focused service I appreciate.

author: alohapiggy
title: So much fun!
content: I love my Echo Spot!  My son gave it to me for my birthday!  I listen to the weather forecast each morning, watch the news, get great tips from Alexa.  I even asked Alexa for a chocolate chip cookie recipe and a bunch of recipe links appeared on the screen.  I love the daily tips from America’s Test Kitchen, and most of all Alexa plays a Christmas music playlist for me as I fall asleep each night.  There are so many features I haven’t even explored yet, but I know that I will enjoy them as I explore!

author: lucas710
title: Love this thing!!!
content: This is my favorite new tech in years!! C'mon smart home for cheep 😁

author: nycrob81
title: No way to disable "Things to Try" on home screen, timekeeping extremely poor.
content:
We've owned many generations of Echo products in our home for years.  We're very familiar with their functionality and what Alexa can do.  I'm flabbergasted why Amazon isn't listening to its customers, and instead forces this devices to show "Things to Try with Alexa" quotes. I'd rather have the clock and the calendar persistently showing, instead of tutorial lines.  Let's be honest - this item was designed to look like a bedside clock, looks like a bedside clock, and certainly functions like one too.

People have complained about the "Things to Try" disabling for years.  It would be nice if Amazon actually listened.

Secondly, I'm revising this review after spending over a week with the device.  I have found its timekeeping extremely poor.  I have turned off the Wi-Fi (as I'm not a big fan of a radio transmitter placed inches from my head while I sleep), and with the Wi-Fi off, the timekeeping of the clock is extremely poor.  Over the course of a week, it ran 10+ minutes faster.

Lastly, while the device offers a way to schedule a DO NOT DISTURB mode, this mode doesn't allow you to include Wi-Fi disabling.  I'm personally not a big fan of having a 2.4Ghz (same frequency as your microwave oven) radio transceiver inches from my head throughout the whole night.  There should be a way to disable Wi-Fi in the do-not-disturb mode, or otherwise create a schedule.

Needless to say, I feel like this device was rushed to market without adequate thorough R&D.  Mine is going back to Amazon today.

author: Johnny Anonny
title: Good Piece of Technology
content: As advertised. Good piece of tech. Video adds a new dimension. Was able to FaceTime iPhones through this Amazon device. That process worked well.

author: Ramiro M.
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent

author: Damian Glaze
title: Perfect echo for rooms around the house
content: Perfect echo for rooms around the house.  I originally bought the Echo Show and I love it.  I wanted this one to replace my alarm clock in the bedroom, as well as extend playing music throughout the house controlled by any of the echo products.  My problem is I may end up buying one for every room in the house because the sound quality for the Spot is much better than the Dot and we love having the music going throughout the entire house.

author: Larissa
title: This is my PA!
content: This is an awesome little bit of tech! It keeps me organized,  allows me to reach out via calls, video chat, or messaging while I'm getting ready,  keeps me up to date on my schedule,  wakes me up in the a.m. , keeps me updated on news that important to me, updates my shopping lists and errands, and even tells me my daily deals as an Amazon prime member! AWESOME!!!

author: jsw5269
title: It's perfect
content: My wife loves this device. We have it connected to our Ring system so she can see everything and everyone that comes to our house. It's also the best looking clock around.

author: Amazonian
title: Nice Upgrade
content: Excellent addition to my Alexa family. Great size, low profile. Did not find it useful for a bedside nighttime clock as it has an odd backlight that obscures the numbers, but a minor issue for me. Otherwise, very happy with it. Really like having a screen.

author: Pete Ens
title: Video calls made easy
content: Alexa is great,  gonna get my mom 1 now so we can video call.

author: maria
title: Voice command with Alexa is entirely too helpful!
content: Love it all! I’m a mother of two with a husband that works nights away. This little glove is helpful with he voice command. My son loves it too! Alexa spends most of her time playing kids bop and staring fun facts for my kids, along with story time :) I do wish it was wireless for room to room convenience BUT I know that echo dot is for that and serves as an extension. Which we will probably be purchasing soon.

author: Lou Hatz
title: Works great if you love alexa then you need this
content: I love alexa. The pit is a very good looking device on a night stand or table. All the functions of alexa with a little screen. It wakes me up every morning, and puts me to sleep with soothing music. Needs additional features that I'm sure will get released in future updates but I l9ve the spot.

author: Kenrick D Hadley
title: perfect design.intuitive.
content: i love first the visual aspect of the design.the quality of the speaker is amazing for its size. i did not like the design of the larger show, not very well thought out, or i would have gotten  the show also.this device lifts my spirits each time i need music. it almost begs to be of help to me.

author: guyina4x4
title: Alexa is cool!
content:
I love this little ball of joy. wish I'd got 2 or 3 of them while they were $89
I haven't even figured out 20% of what it can do

author: Kristen D
title: A+
content: A+

author: Frog18
title: Great product!!!
content: We absolutely love this product!!! Wish we would have bought this instead of the dots!!!

author: BJ
title: Echo Spot on the Spot
content: My Echo spot was just what I needed to complete my room setup

author: Amy Yanner
title: Alexa
content: I love this it’s the coolest alarm clock ever.

author: jami
title: I love having the touch screen feature
content: I love having the touch screen feature. I just wish the camera were angled different. I looked forward to using the home check ability, but all I can see is my ceiling, and I've moved the spot around a couple of times to get it in a better location. Still not much luck.

author: MN
title: Great as video intercom
content: Love it. Alexa and Amazon music are handy. My toddler likes that she can request songs she wants to hear. We like the small size and the video screen. We use one upstairs and one downstairs as a video intercom system. Sound quality is average for it’s size.

author: Kevin T King
title: I like it
content: I works as advertised

author: George
title: WOW
content: I love it, it's my first Alexa, and I'm in love with it.....

author: L. Brenner
title: Best clock ever, great night mode
content: I was a bit worried about all the reviews saying people couldn’t turn off the rolling banner on this. But then I saw other reviews saying they could. So I took the leap and bought this. Great decision!  This clock is small but heavier and sturdier than most small clocks. You can choose from a variety of faces for it, which is fun. I opted to have night mode come on automatically in low light (alternative is to set it for certain times). This clock is the only one I’ve had where the night mode is truly unobtrusive—the clock hands just glow softly rather than there being any back light. I googled how to turn off the rolling banner and it took a few tries on my phone app and on the clock settings but it’s off. So no complaints!  We’re just starting to figure out how to use Alexa. Bought a smart plug and this morning I rolled over in bed and told Alexa to turn on the tea kettle in the kitchen which we’d set up the night before. Perfection!  Now we just need her to fix the tea and bring it to us in bed.

author: Manuel A. Lezcano
title: Problems with Bluetooth connection
content: After weeks of trying, and several calls and emails to Customer Service, I still can't get the Eco Spot to connect to any Bluetooth speakers. The option doesn't even show on the menu for this product in the Alexa App.

author: Paul Munoz
title: Three thumbs down could be a four. Disappointed
content: I like the idea of it. But number one thing is the speaker sucks really bad.  I know they can do 100% better with this for the amount we are paying for this.  And it seems like things don’t fit on the display screen all the time.

author: Tracy L
title: So fun and useful-ha
content: Enjoying. Keep next to bed. Talk to everynight. We have Echo in living room and Dot in kitchen.

author: E. R. Ugbinar
title: Worth it
content: Very sensitive to recognize your voice, a way lot better than the echo dot ( 2nd generation)

author: Smart Shopper
title: Amazing product. I use it more every day.
content: LOVE LOVE LOVE THESE. The only think I notice is that it doesn't pick-up my voice and commands as well as my Echo and Echo Dots (we have 4 Echo products throughout our house). I have this in the kitchen and in my bedroom as my alarm clock. I'm no longer searching for a pen and paper to make lists!!!!

author: Thomas I Kneder Sr
title: Spot On!
content: Easy of operation and set up were great. It is a unique interface that I use daily.

author: Sharon P
title: Perfect for my night stand
content: Perfect for my night stand.  She commands my lights.  She tells me weather and news.  She sets my alarm, snoozes, and timer.  She plays me music so I can sleep.  Awesome job Alexa!

author: sonja sausedo
title: Looks great. More than a computer she's a little bit of magic at your command.
content: She's there for all your questions. She keeps you on time.  And, she can set up your meditation session as well as your dance music!  What's not to love!

author: GJM
title: Almost perfect
content:
Liked most:
Ease of setting the alarm
Functionality of Alexa
Auto dimming function at night
Size and aesthetics

Liked least:
Hard to turn off alarm without waking your partner

author: TJ
title: I Love My Spot... Yes it’s Great!
content: Funny thing is I didn’t really think I would use this thinking sort of small. But after getting one I love it! It is so easy to use and perfect for video phone calls. Now my Spot and My Show are two of the most used items in the house. All my extended family has been buying for Christmas presents so we can all stay in touch with video calling.

author: NattyNattie
title: Screen keeps flickering
content: I really love how I’m able to connect to my security cameras and lights with it conveniently at my bed side. Only down side is the screen keeps flickering and it can be a little annoying. At first I was able to reboot and it would stop. Not it’s just a constant flickering no matter what I do. Waiting on customer service to see if there is a resolution. Fingers crossed.

author: Libby Strom-Eubanks
title: Nice addition
content: Great love the display and easy to use, though still learning what all it can do everyday.

author: B. Gorrell
title: Not the greatest speaker
content: The Echo Spot works exactly as advertised. The small screen size is not ideal for actually looking at much video however, and the audio quality of the speaker is marginal for music, which is what I seem to use it for more than anything else. It is living on my nightstand as a fancy alarm clock!

author: Deon Singh
title: It’s worth having
content: I like the fact that I’m able to do video chat with those that have the app on there phone or tablet.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not to smart!
content: 75% of the question I've asked Alexa she doesn't know the answer to.  This was a gift, I wouldn't buy this.

author: pawel
title: 5 stars.
content: Just great thing. We love it.

author: David S. Courington
title: Very nice
content: Awesome. Got it for my daughter to replace clock and echo Dot on nightstand. She loves it and so do I. The sound is better and it takes up less room than the two devices did. I want one for me now...

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Device
content:
I absolutely love this thing. Easy setup. Lots O' functionality.
Before purchasing I read the reviews. I have experienced none of the negative reviews.
Great product. Would recommend!

author: T Branco
title: Not trustworthy
content: Doesn't work as expected. It keeps disconnecting from my wi-fi even if it is at tge same room. I tried different routers and still the same problem ! To be honest I miss my old devices with bottoms on it. Bottoms doesn't need firmware update, dosen't stop working unexpectedly.

author: ash
title: Awesome
content: I love our spot. I love all the echo products but I put this into the kitchen and it has been so nice. I can drop in any time to check on the kids and my hubby. My three year old thinks this is the coolest thing. It can show me the shopping list as well as telling me. And of course no matter what I ask it to do my three year old can always tell it to play baby shark 500 times a day. So there is that of course.

author: DAVID F.
title: Four Stars
content: Great for the nightstand.  Roll over and watch the news, and weather.  Nice addition to my collections of echos.

author: Omar Duprey
title: Home
content: good product

author: muleladycm
title: Be patient. It learnes as you learn her.
content:
It’s kinda hard for me to figure out, but that’s
Most likely operator error. Other than that
It seems to be well made. The more I use it the better it gets! Like I said, operator error!🤣

author: Tiff Lich
title: Fun bedside replacement for my dot
content: Fun little echo that allowed me to get rid of my old alarm clock on my nightstand.  I will agree with others for the need of a larger number display for my 52 year old eyes!

author: nathan strom
title: Easy to hook up. Looks great, responds perfectly
content: Really fun, looks cool and is great for music while you cook or whatever. Random info getter and sounds fine.

author: Happy
title: Great Addition!
content: I received my Echo Spot as a gift.  I currently have 3 Echo Shows throughout the house.  My Echo Spot is the perfect addition to my Echo Shows.  I placed my Echo Spot in my Master Bathroom and now it is on my "Everywhere Group".  Love this little spot for my morning and evening routine in the Master Bathroom.  Highly recommend.  Space saver but full of features.  Still "Happy"

author: TommyG
title: Few things, none are done well
content: Too confusing, cannot do much with it.

author: California
title: Love it does all I need and more
content: Love it does all I need and more , plus works great with Ring pro

author: Charlie M
title: DO NOT PURCHASE!
content: I wanted to use this as a bedside clock with the ability to play music and podcasts. Sadly, it continuously scrolls the "Things to try" and won't stay on the clock face. This is absolutely maddening, and everyone complains about it. Yet Amazon refuses to fix it.

author: old grad
title: Echo spot hits the spot.
content: The size and colors on the screen are great. This is a much friendlier better version of the echo dot. It is well worth the difference in price.  Other reviews complain about the try this screen that cycles through. It is one of three screens that cycle through the display. I don’t see it as an issue. I have it sitting in my office.

author: jay
title: Nice build quality.
content: Bought to replace my wife's 10 year old alarm clock. Great Alexa features, so so as an alarm clock and should definitely have a USB port, which it does not. Would have been a 5 star with USB port.

author: angelmimi
title: Spot right on spot
content: I really like this item! I got it to replace my old alarm clock radio. It is a timer, alarm clock, weather radio and company for me! It  doesn't take up much space on my nightstand and looks good to. How did I ever get along without her?

author: Cindobaby
title: Non native English speakers don’t buy till they improve voice recognition
content: Don’t get any Alexa products if you are a non native English speaker, spare that change for google products who will understand you almost a 100% of the time.

author: God Is Everywhere
title: What’s not to like?
content: Best of Echo so far. Love the design. Alexa you outdid yourself.

author: psh51
title: Great gadget- fun technology.
content: We have had the Echo Dot in our family room for over a year, and while mostly I use it to get weather reports, listen to music and dropping in on hubby upstairs in his office, my grandkids love to chat with Alexa. We recently got the the Spot (gotta love flex pay) and I love it! We have a dog who loves to search and destroy when we are not home. While I have dropped in on her with the dot and warned her to knock it off, I was never sure that she was actually doing anything. Now I can drop in from my phone app, and see what's going on in our family room. We ordered the adjustable stand to aim it accurately and while annoyed a bit at the price, have to say totally worth it. Great view and clear pic!  Added bonus, when playing music the lyrics are on the screen which I missed in the description and was pleasantly surprised. If you are a gadget-y person like me, I think you will enjoy the Spot.

author: Sierra Grey Wolf
title: Can't turn off "Aks Alexa" notifications!
content: I would give at least 4 stars (I'm not happy with the limited clockface options), but I HATE that you can't stop the screen from popping up with things like "Ask Alexa what Kim Kardashian wore at the Oscars."  I'm not a newbie and am VERY irritated that I can't turn this off when I'm using it as a clock radio on my nightstand.  Grrr!

author: Aaron
title: Recommend
content: Works well

author: KVBcarter
title: I love it! It plays song lyrics when in Amazon ...
content: I love it! It plays song lyrics when in Amazon music. Can show video of news. Perfect for bedside. Sometime it gets confused and starts talking though. Must hear something on the tv.

author: Lj
title: Fantastic product!
content: This device is the perfect bedside companion. I only had minor issues at the beginning regarding alarms, but the problems resolved themselves and I am very happy now. I also love that I can split the payment up by month so don’t have to fork out a fortune to have some amazing technology. I am interested in a 3rd gen echo dot as well, but I’ll just keep waiting.

author: Gerald R. Neel
title: Best Echo so far.
content: Love my Spot.  I have the original Echo and a Dot.  I listen to music before going to sleep every night.  Use it for an alarm. also.

author: Anna Vanderford
title: One Star
content: Not impressed. Music cost monthly

author: Will Showers
title: Absolutely the coolest house bug available
content:
Let's not forget, first and foremost, the inherent risks of a device that listens to you all day long.  One will most definitely be sacrificing one's privacy by using this product and all others like it.

All necessary disclaimers aside, I'm really enjoying this little thing.  The display was perfect for a bedside clock right out of the box; I didn't find it necessary to adjust the brightness at all.  In absence of light, it automatically dims so as to never be obtrusive.

Alexa, while maybe the smartest voice assistant available, is still pretty dumb; it's probable that she'll do what you want her to, as long as you can find the magic combination of commands, but she's not exactly savvy to normal speech.

I love telling my clock to wake me up at a certain time without worrying about using buttons or wondering if I remembered to turn the alarm on, and I also love that I can tell it to play music for awhile and turn off automatically.  The weather feature is also nice, and the display automatically returns to the clock face after using it for other functions.  It may also surprise you how many times you end up just asking Alexa what time it is instead of looking at the clock.  Also, the spot is connected to my Ring doorbell and my Nest thermostat, so I can ask it to turn up the heat or AC or show me the front door whenever I want.

I feel like it's been money well spent so far; no buyer's remorse for me at this price point.

author: James Zelenka
title: Don't waste your money - just get a dot
content: Avoid this product. I have a couple of other Echo devices, so I thought this would go well with the fleet. I was wrong. I wanted two things out of the spot (as opposed to getting another Dot) - show the weather and show a perpetual slideshow from my Prime Photos. Neither works. It is impossible to enable weather, news, or any other text without also enabling a bunch of "Try this now" stuff. It is so annoying that I gave up on displaying anything other than the clock. I configured the slideshow from a Prime Photos album, but it just gets stuck on one photo forever. I tried removing that photo from the album. It displayed two other photos, then got stuck forever on the third. I've tried resetting the device multiple times but nothing helped.

author: Randy
title: Love it. Even video calls.
content: Love it. I use it to control my sound system (Sonos) and my lights by Phillip Hue.

author: Brian
title: Fun addition
content: I’m a fan of echo devices. I think it’s a great alternative to a clean clock. I like using it to adjust the lightning in the room and listening to sounds to help sleep. My two year old sleeps so much better with it on. We also use it to tell my two year old stories. Only issue is the volume of alexa speaking when you tell her to turn off the lights is loud when the volume is set to what you want to listen to the music at night

author: Bob
title: Great addon for Amazon
content: excellent everything works great, much better then the Show I wish I could trade the Show I have for another Spot and a lot cheaper and more decorative

author: Eva Olah
title: Just buy it!
content: I love it!! It’s my alarm clock and radio with real morning news!

author: Peanu75
title: Work out the bugs Amazon
content: I have an Echo and love my Echo! I thought that they would work seemlessly together in terms of playing music and there still needs to be a lot of work done. If you start playing in one room and want to skip that track to play another it says “”currently there is no music playing””. You can only control that music from the device you started it from. Other than that; I’m happy with the Spot

author: Brad S
title: Would be much better if you had better control over the clock face
content: Would be much better if you had better control over the clock face.  Not interested in your ads or promotions for new features.  Gimme a clock and leave me alone.

author: HomeGameRoom
title: Very happy with Spot!
content: I’ve had this a couple of weeks and I’m pretty happy with it. I use it mainly as an alarm clock in my bedroom. I was a little concerned that it would be too bright at night but it isn’t. The clock faces have defaults for night view; some have red numbers and others a light lime green (I haven’t cycled through all of them yet).  It also auto-dims when the room gets dark to a nice level (most of these are user-definable).  It’s also nice to control light fixtures in the house with it. It suits my needs perfectly and is a nice size with a great display.

author: Amanda Loo
title: Convenient to use but sound quality average
content: I use it mostly for background music when I’m working. The music choices are good but it doesn’t provide the clarity of a traditional sound system.

author: R. Benson
title: Quite good, but...
content:
I like my new Spot a lot and prefer it to the original Echo. It is attractive with better sound than the Dot (of which I am not a fan), and the screen is quite good. The down side probably is the PC app,. On the Amazon website, it said that there were several clock faces to choose from, that are chosen from a Device option on the PC app. But alas, no device option was found.. You can create a new "reminder" on the PC app, but not create a new alarm (must do verbally on the Spot).
..
In general, the PC app needs to catch up with the Alexa devices. Because of the limited vocabulary and interaction of Alexa, I find it much easier to do setups using the PC app than doing it verbally. And with the app, I can control all my devices in one location (my desk). But the app needs major work.

author: NeuroDoc
title: Best Echo in my opinion.
content: Bought this for my daughters room (6 yr old). It’s a great alarm clock for her. She uses it to control her lights, music, alarm, and of course to ask Alexa to tell her jokes. Excellent video quality in a small and cute package. Also, a ton of skins are sold on Amazon to spice up the look. Mine chose the pink zebra stripes. Looks great! Lastly, I use the Echo Show in my kitchen to drop in on her when she’s in the room. Very fun to connect visually to update her that dinner is ready.

author: Edgar
title: Perfect for a father's day present
content: Perfect for a father's day present! If you have an accent, possibilities are Alexa will not understand you immediately, but still works fine! I recommend it!

author: taxman
title: It's cute, but disappointing and not actually very useful.
content:
My 4 year old uses it more than anyone. She finds it fun to ask simple questions and hear the answers. It's supposed to work with my TV but it doesn't. Works intermittently with my TiVo.
Edit: Amazon must have noticed this review and sent me an email asking me to call into the support team, so +1 for seeming like you really care about helping me. But... The people I talked to were not really helpful. The first one didn't seem to understand my problem and transferred me to another department that only works with fire sticks and the like. That person transferred me back to the first group who after some explaining was able to figure out that my problem sounded like it was with the Vizio skill because Alexa would tell me if I did something wrong but would just beep a couple of times if I did it right, but still nothing happens on my TV, so -1 for not having very good support.

author: Adam
title: Great little alexa
content: Have it hooked up to smart plugs works great has some fun games too

author: AV
title: One expensive nightstand clock
content:
I returned it for a couple of reasons, most important been it’s lack of support of google play music which is great since I get both YouTube unlimited and play music unlimited as well for the same price.
Two, the annoying “things to say” screen that you cannot disable, I’m getting a google device instead.

author: Kindle Customer
title: "Alexa, I'm home!"
content: Alexa turns on a light and the radio. She keeps me informed. She reminds me. She plays my favorite music. The echo spot is a stylish clock as well as a music machine with surprisingly great sound! I had a slight problem getting my contacts on the phone. Otherwise I don't know how I lived without it!

author: ron
title: Best Buy on amazon
content: I love it it gets everything

author: Amazon Customer
title: Are
content: Does not work like I hope

author: Dustin Brumfield
title: Amazon look
content: I think you should have more clock faces and something that would be awesome is to see the weather and time on one screen also very important you need to be able to see a week timer as far as an alarm you can only set it 1 time you can't say Alexa st a timer for Mon through Friday with as smart as this alarm it's lacking little things but all in all pretty awesome plz fix

author: Seth
title: Great little device
content: I like this device its neat but I wish the speaker was louder. I plan on upgrading to an Echo Show soon because the speaker quality on this is not that great it is sometimes hard to hear. I also want a bigger screen. I use this to check my front door camera to see who is at the front door as I cannot see out the frosted glass. For that purpose this is awesome.

author: Malaysia gemini
title: Alexa is nice
content: Alexa is very nice, useful have not really played with it too much-still have a lot of programming to do

author: Alex G. MacDonald
title: Nice attractive clock
content: Nice attractive clock!  The major flaw is the inability to change the font size and style.  The current font size is way to small when viewing the clock at at a distance of  4 - 5 feet away!  This is a clock; the readability of the time should be its primary feature!  Perhaps add a custom feature that allows the user to customize the font size and style.  Also, change the background of the screen so it s darker in contrast to the white numerals  I would also like to have the option to show the current date below the time.  Also, denote "AM" and "PM" with the time.

author: carroll n. stelly
title: She know when she's not feeling well.
content: I asked a question. And she said there was an error.  That happened all day. She wasn't feeling well. That evening she was fine.

author: Daniel C.
title: Five Stars
content: Love Alexa and having a screen makes her so much more user friendly

author: Annette Looper
title: Love this
content: Got it for Xmas I so love this

author: D. Bartley
title: Better than I expected, but lacks parental control
content: Pretty cool, looks better than I thought something this small would look on the screen. 4 stars because Alexa still doesn't have family (kids) controls other than a PIN for purchases. Alexa AI has a bit to go yet, but pretty impressive all things considered. Work on getting parental controls in it and it is 5 star product.

author: Grace H.
title: Looks nice, don’t buy unless you have internet.
content: I just wish some features worked without wifi

author: Thomas Callahan
title: Great Device But Has Some Issues
content:
Overall I like my Spot, it is perfect for the bedroom and is great for playing music.

While the Spot is small, it would be nice if the speaker was a little bit better. The microphone does not always hear commands, Amazon might consider moving the microphone to the front panel instead of having it on top.

I use my Spot as an alarm clock however Alexa will not let me set an alarm for Monday-Friday, I have to set an alarm every night for the next morning.

Overall the Spot is a solid device and I am happy with it.

author: Phoenix User
title: Great product
content: I use this as a bedroom alarm clock but being able to see my ring cameras is a plus. Sound is good for size. Responds great.

author: Adam Dub
title: Useful but not 100% necessary. Probably a good option over the Echo Show.
content: Don’t use it for much as I thought we would. Synced with Kasa-Cam and use it to check up on our baby in the crib a lot. Lyrics for music is cool, too. Other than that it’s used as a clock and standard dot’ish features.

author: JDavis
title: Not sure it is worth the huge difference in price ...
content: Not sure it is worth the huge difference in price between this and a dot, personally. It's a cute alarm clock but nothing fancy really. I have an Echo, Dot, and now this. The sound quality is closer to the dot than the echo.

author: RV Doc
title: Worth it as long as you use it as intended
content:
I bought this as an alarm clock. Yes, I know actual alarm clocks are much much cheaper but I'm already consumed by the Alexa world so this was an obvious choice.
  The screen clarity is great. I don't watch anything on it. The downside to a round screen but the many choices in clock faces has allowed me to personalize my area. I do wish the camera was not there but nothing a black sticky dot couldn't take care of. I do have the option though if I'm sick or bed restricted, my family can contact me bedside. But until that day comes, the sticker stays and it's not noticable.
  Coming from someone who has sleep issues, the ability to customize the alarm tones has helped. If I ever get used to one sound and run the risk of sleeping through my alarm, I simply change the tone or add music to get me awake.
  The sound quality is good, especially from such a small device. I was expecting it to be similar to the Echo Dot but it's much better. The option to add an external speaker if needed it a great thing. I haven't needed it but I like options.
  The only down side to this whole thing is not the device itself. It's the cost. I went for the Echo Spot because I have an Echo Show in the Kitchen and I love it. The cost however was way too much to buy as a bedside alarm clock. So I bought the Echo Spot. Not two days later, the Echo Show dropped in price for a bit. Had I waited two more days, I would have bought another Echo Show. Oh well. That's Amazon for ya.

author: Susan
title: Five Stars
content: Love the echo spot it’s nice to have it do things you ask it to do

author: Grandma Barb
title: but the spot does so many other things that I like it.
content: having some issues with getting this synced up with my phone. but the spot does so many other things that I like it.

author: Mark
title: Expecations are key
content: Unlike the horrible Show, I think the Spot really hit its mark here. It might be just due to my expectations, but I'm very well pleased with it, the full Alexa capabilities, video integration and bedside smart clock like features.  It's definitely a bit pricey, and don't see myself buying one for every bedroom unless the price comes down a good amount.  However, it's pretty cool, and an interesting addition to my echo house.

author: GemmaStone
title: We LOVE Spot
content:
I picked my first echo spot up for $67 in ebay as barely used. Huge savings and a huge delight.
Ignore the whiney 1 star reviews. Every alexa device I own gives me things to try pointers, and as a person who appreciates technology and new advances in my alexa products, I like knowing about them and appreciate the tips. There is nothing bothersome about it and it runs as a clock as it should. I even have it set as to where my amazon photos will play in the background behind the clock for the clock face. Talk about being custom!
Aside from functioning as a clock the spot works just the same as it would the alexa show, only on a smaller device and screen.
Personally I though I wasn't going to like having a smaller screen, but I don't notice the difference when making video calls. I actually like the smaller screen for this.

The speaker is crisp and clear and it can get loud if you set it to max. Like really loud. I cannot fathom why anyone would complain about the speaker. It's great, and defintley made my echo dot seem puny in comparison.

The device itself is way heavier than I imagined it would be. Quality was important to the developers, and it shows. This is not a cheap plastic device. It's heavy, has weight and won't slide off of your end table anytime soon.
I love how it paired up with my ring camera and monitor. I can check on them as needed with no hiccups or connection issues

Overall:
 Im glad I decided to shop for one of these. Initially I was going to grab another amazon show, but didn't need such a large device on my end table. The spot worked out perfectly with features I appreciate.

author: Nick92
title: The only reason I am not giving it the 5th ...
content: The only reason I am not giving it the 5th star is it cannot play videos from Netflix or You tube.

author: LaDonna & Jerry
title: Echo Spot
content: I love the Echo Spot.  We have two now and I really am glad

author: Edward Hudley
title: A True Smart Alarm Clock.
content: The Spot continues the traditions of the growing Echo family. Sort of like if the Show and Dor had a baby, it would be the Spot...🤣 I do wish there was a physical camera shade. Being the most will have this sitting on their nightstands, something actually covering the camera would provide a bit more comfort. Also, I wish it had the same iconic bright glowing ring on the outer perimeter like on the Dot, Echo 2 and Ech Plus rather than just around the Spot’s display.

author: Honest Abe
title: Great Alarm Clock
content:
I bought this as an alarm clock for my son.  He loves it!

UPDATE:  You can only hear the other person in intercom mode if they speak directly into the echo.  Also, the network connection seems to be kind of intermittent sometimes.

author: tks
title: Clock not too bright at night, hard to find this feature
content: works as expected, love the clock feature at night not too bright, which is good.

author: R. H. Feenan
title: Watch that snooze/dismiss feature.
content: Yes it met my expectations.  The snooze on the alarm needs a but of work.  Tap it and it snoozes, swipe up and it prompts you to dismiss.  But without my glasses I can't read it and often it just snoozes.  Then one day I must have dismissed tomorrow's alarm because it never went off.  I have it set for Mon-Thu.  Fri I don't need to get up early.  A more apparent indicator of the alarm set would be nice.  My old alarm had a red light.

author: Yvonne Marie
title: Amazing and fun
content: Love it by our bed.  Named it Computer instead of Alexa.

author: jackie
title: great  little device
content: love this so much went out and bought the show also. i love the clock and alarm features and calling but most of all i love to listen to music on it. i think the sound is pretty good on it for something so small. all my friends want one since they seen mine.

author: KAC
title: My second spot for the home!
content: Love this for the bedroom! I like the Show for the kitchen, and the spot is the perfect size for the bedroom.  Bye bye alarm clocks...this does so much more!!

author: FitConvert
title: Loving the new Spot!
content: Purchased my first Echo for the living room and loved it. When the Spot came on the market, I was sure that I needed it or wanted it. I was just going to buy another Echo. I decided on the Spot and glad that I did. It's the perfect size (great on a night stand in the bedroom or end table in the living room) and is the right mix of Echo functionality with the added feature of being a clock. The screen is perfect for viewing quick videos and pictures. Havent tried Drop In yet, but seems like a very cool concept. Overall, the Spot is simple in concept but provides a wealth of uses and benefits. Really loving the Echo line of tech and cant wait to see how it evolves.

author: DearestRemarks
title: I love it!!
content: I own the first amazon echo and 3 dots but I love the spot!  I can actually talk to friends ds and love ones while sitting at my desk. The only thing I'm not crazy about is the events of the day or current events that keep popping up through the day

author: Gregor
title: A smart clock cannon ball with BIG features.
content:
I’m not a conspiracy theorist, so I love that Alexa is always listening.  The more I use it, the more I find it can do.  The speaker sound is great for such a small device (the size of a softball) and the screen, while small, is crisp.  Unlike some Alexa-compatable devices, like Vobot, the Spot has full integration with Ring to video show the front door, Nest, Remotesy (to verbally control most of your remotes) and Pandora (with lyrics displayed on the screen).  As a father of two teens, I need the lyrics (or the kids make fun of me for loudly singing fake ones)!
The only thing that keeps Spot from 5-stars is the dependence on a cord.  Amazon could remedy this with a portable docking station(s).  Also, albeit minor, it would be nice to verbally or through the app have Alexa hold the screen to time instead of a cycle of headlines, weather and time.  I know I can program time only but occasionally I want something like, “Alexa, scroll headlines for ten minutes” without interrupting my music.

author: L. Vassar
title: We will see
content: Bought as a gift. Neither person is tech savvy. I hope they can figure out all the features and is not to confusing.

author: Jason
title: Alarm Clock And A New Friend
content: Alexa is like having a someone in your room at all times. Ask it the weather or if your bored play a game with it. Trivia, Quizzes and much more. Play a song of your preference and enjoy jokes as well. This clock is brilliantly functional and it makes ones room full of purpose.

author: Patricia Taylor
title: Terrific Device with One Glaring Deficiency
content: The Echo Spot is a very handy and useful device that I like very much.  It's simple to set up and easy to use.  I would give it 5 stars if it were possible to remove the "Things to Try" card from the rotating display.  I find it distracting and annoying.

author: ron
title: Not just an alarm clock
content: It is a great alarm clock also great is when you want flash news briefing, weather report when you want it,and play ur favorite videos.

author: DoubleK
title: Great addition to Echo family
content:
Great addition to the Echo family in my opinion. I have it in my bedroom as a nightstand clock/alarm on top of linking it with my FireTV, all of which it works excellent with. Like the fact that I can disable/enable the camera with just asking. I worried about privacy that way and seems Amazon thought of that as well in the commands you can give Alexa. Sound quality is better than I expected out of the unit - figured it would be much like the Dot but actually sounds a lot stronger than that. Overall, pleased I bought it!
That said, I think it still has a little ways to go to becoming an outstanding product. Needs more clock faces in my opinion, better integration with FireTV (i.e. changing channels, switching apps isn't always accurate) and third party security systems for example. That said, still a solid product!

author: Kathy P
title: Love the spot!
content: We have a dot and an echo and the spot is by far my fave. It looks cute and I love how it can play music videos and more.

author: Sayurichan
title: I have purchased several Echo Spots and love them. Connects to my hue lights
content: I have purchased several Echo Spots and love them. Connects to my hue lights, my ring doorbell, and other devices. Love that I can display pictures or watch videos. Very easy to use and has clear audio quality and a bright screen. Also love that you can make video calls with the forward facing camera.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It’s beneficial for the whole family.
content: I really enjoy the screen. I am able to change the background to whatever I’m in the mood for. Also enjoy the clock and it’s various styles. What can I say. It’s perfect to get answers to the many questions I and my family have.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Works Great!
content: I am so in love with echo products and this one looks so nice on my bedside stand. It is easy to use. I had one hiccup in the beginning but customer service online chat helped me solve it immediately. It goes off every morning as directed and so much more. I don't worry to much about power failure as that is few and far between where I live so I dont worry that it will not go off because of that.

author: Bandit
title: Echo Spot- Unable to use camera skills reliably
content: The echo spot continues to lose connectivity to the paired/linked Wyze camera purchased together.  Finally gave up trying to re-establish the connection.  Most recently, Its had issues with buffering while using the Iheartradio music link.  No issues using any of the Amazon Music feature though.

author: cinfan
title: Pretty good with one exception
content: The echo spot is really great. I just got it and is easy to set up. I do have one problem. When the advertise it they show a screen with the time weather and your town. Sadly there is no way to make this the home screen. The home screen is just the time😔. I spoke to support and the wonderful lady tried and researched for 45 minutes to no avail. I am disappointed because I wanted that screen all the time not just during an occasional screen rotate. I am hoping they will do something about this. Other than that it’s great

author: Kevin Leonard
title: Love this thing
content: The screen make a world of difference.

author: M. Wright
title: Awesome invention
content: I rate the Spot 4.5 because I agree with many others here that think the stand should be part of the Spot configuration.  I'm living the display options. Fave skills so far are Ring linking that shows me my front door and streaming Sirius XM music. Also like the lava lamp and koi pond options that run for 1 hour with accompanying music. Great product all around!

author: candy
title: Go with the spot for small places. Attractive and works great
content: It’s just what I needed and wanted for my nightstand.  No complaints!!!

author: Ebony Kay
title: I really like it!
content: At first, I was like, “oh it’s just an alarm clock”, but then I went on YouTube and watched some reviews and that helped a lot. My most favorite feature is to tell Alexa to remind me where I put things. Not to mention, they are coming up with more skills everyday. Great device 👍🏾

author: Jenn Murray
title: I love the Spot!!!!
content: I got the Spot for Christmas, and it's AWESOME!!  I haven't tried the video calling, yet, but I plan to soon...I love the fact that I can ask Alexa to show me video for my requests, rather than imagine it in my mind, like I would have to do if I asked my original Echo...The sound is clear, and crisp...I love it!!

author: Patrick Kilburn
title: 30 Minute Timeout When Used with Nest Cam
content: The overall product is really nice, but the sole reason I purchased it was to use it as a bedside baby monitor to leave on all night. Initial setup was easy with the Drop Cam (called Nest Cam now) and the video comes in clear with a nice zoom in feature. However, I failed to read the reviews of the Nest Cam Alexa Skill before purchasing as a number of people call out that it times out after 30 minutes. I discovered this and thought it was a bug or connection issue, but alas it is by design. Since there are two companies involved, I'm not sure who is imposing the 30 minute limitation, but for my purposes it renders the product useless. If you're only going to use it to check cams occasionally, then this would be a great product. However, if the intent is to leave it on for hours as a baby monitor it won't work. This might get fixed by Amazon or Nest/Google, but I didn't want to wait around hoping so I returned it and reverted back to using a phone or tablet as a bedside monitor. Also, since Amazon and Google have been squabbling lately with interoperability, I wouldn't hold my breath on this getting fixed. P.S. I considered replacing the Nest Cam with the new Amazon Cloud Cam, but that product doesn't seem to be fully baked yet.

author: Diane S. Castor
title: It is fun
content: This was a gift to our son who thinks it is pretty cool.

author: Lenore Shopper
title: Visual Echo!
content: I just love the addition of visuals to the echo.  I can now see the time and timers.  I want to explore the potential of this device more in the coming weeks.

author: Jason Smythe
title: Way cooler than advertised
content: Was an excellent gift for girl friend!

author: Nancy J.
title: Awesome Bedside Clock
content:
I saw a lot of negative reviews before I purchased it.  Many complaints were about certain features that could be changed in settings.  I love this as a bedside clock.  I sleep alone so there are no issues with waking your partner when giving Alexa verbal instructions.  You can turn off the camera if you wish.

There are lots of settings but don't expect to plug it in and have it work exactly the way you want to right out of the box.  I wanted to use Spotify instead of Amazon Music.  You need a premium subscription which I have.  When I connected my account, it still used Amazon Music.  I had to change the default in the settings.

I used to use my phone as a clock but the display would come on at night for no reason.  I used to use my phone to check the weather before I got up.  Now I just ask Alexa.

author: Karen
title: Love the Echo
content: Got rid of the alarm by my bed and use the Echo now, and really like it.  Like the lighting of it, the options for what i look at and her waking  me up in the morning, verses a glaring sound.  Also like getting the weather report and Flash news briefing.

author: DigitalMan
title: really like this version of Echo
content: Really, really like this version of Echo.

author: Joseph S Brazell
title: Love this thing
content: It was easy to setup.  I use  it bedside as an alarm clock.  It works seamlessly with all the other alexa enabled devices I have around the house.  It has a 1/8" plug on the back that I used to tie it to s speaker system.  But you could use bluetooth if you'd like.  I wish they came with a battery so you could move it from one place to another easily.

author: JungleLuxe
title: Love this thing!
content:
I bought this for use as an alarm clock and for automation control in my master bedroom. I immediately disabled the camera via the app and put a tiny black sticker over it, and turned off the auto-brightness feature so that it didn't dim the screen. So far, no negative implications as a result. I don't want a camera in my bedroom, and I think a lot of people might feel the same way.

I have a bunch of Alexa-enabled devices, so the features that all of them share were no surprise, but the screen is really a cool addition! I set up the device, uploaded an image from my iPhone X to use as home screen and alarm background, and customized my alarm sounds within minutes. Like the Dot it is replacing, this allows me to easily control lights, fans, and other automation devices, but if you have a Ring doorbell, get ready to get excited! "Alexa, show me the front door!" It displays in seconds, which is faster than it shows up on the Ring app on my phone! Awesome.

This is a great addition to the family of devices, and works exactly how I would want it to work as an alarm clock. I love how it is so easy to customize, and that it's easy to dim completely at bedtime. When you listen to Amazon music, it displays in the same way it does when you stream on Amazon Fire TV, which is a nice touch.  The device itself is clean and elegant-looking, not cluttered with a bunch of buttons or knobs. It's the first of the product line to be truly stylish, and looks so cool it could easily be mistaken for a product made by a certain fruit-named company :-)

author: deanna mason
title: It can be hooked up with your ring doorbell
content:
I love the echo spot! And all the things it can
do!

author: william

author: GE

content:
Worlds best alarm clock, but some functionality poorly designed (ability to customized or change home screen, back lighting, etc,).
I think/hope the next release will have improved design/functionality.

author: Pants
title: Looks and sounds nice, but Amazon forces you to use it as a billboard in your home
content: Looks nice and sounds better than the Dot, but Amazon uses this as a billboard in your home.  You are not allowed to turn off the "things to try" screen, so every time I glance at the Spot to see either the weather or the time, the Spot is displaying the things-to-try adverting billboard.  I didn't pay Amazon $140 for a device that gives them free in-house advertising.

author: Linda G. Harth

OMG such great sound

title: Echo Spot

author: Maurice Smith
title: Device I Didnt Know I Needed
content: I didnt know I needed this!! It was on sale so i decided to take a chance on it. I'm so glad I did!!! When your hands are tied up and you want to change the radio, just send out the command. Got in the bed and forgot to turn the lights off in another room? Just tell it to turn them off!!!

author: Terri G
title: It’s an okay Alexa
content: Not impressed! Had the echo dot and decided to get this as an upgrade and put the dot in the bedroom. Still haven’t been able to pair them and the dot keeps going offline making it unusable. Needs more adjustability for sizing for the clock for the visually impaired.

author: Roberta Garcia
title: Eureka! Alexa! It works...
content: Eureka! Alexa! Thanks so much Amazon for this easy to use Echo Spot, for weather updates, movies, audio books, music, and orders statuses.  Very convienent. Echo Spot is great.

author: teash100%
title: Love it
content: Work perfect

author: holodoctor1
title: Great, but needs a little improvement to be perfect!
content:
I’m a big fan of the Echo Spot, though it needs a bit of improvement.
1. Needs the ability to send/receive sms via iPhone.
2. Needs to be able to remove “Things to try” card.
3. Would love integration with YouTube.
4. Needs to have a way to have the volume return to what it was set to after an alarm. I keep the volume at a “7”, but when the alarm goes off it jumps to a 10. Super annoying!!

Great device though! Really happy with it!

author: Darren Levine
title: So far so good! A bug or two...
content:
Up until this point I've been using an echo for my alarm but I got the spot to hopefully be both my wife and my alarm. The screen is a very nice addition to the alexa function

The one bug I've found is I tried to set different alarm sounds for each alarm within the Android app, but it still just used what was selected in the spot.

I really don't care about the camera privacy, they can look at my bare bunghole all they like. The wife however claims she'll be covering it whenever it's sexy time.

It's a bit pricey, but if that doesn't bother you I think it's a real nice bedside device. The sound quality is also much better than the for.

The 7inch show is also on sale for 20 bucks more, kind of tempting but totally different use, as that's a much bigger device

author: Terry
title: Pretty Cool
content: Ordered the first one with issues, a replacement was sent ASAP. Working great and really like the features for the price.

author: Dr. Gary Hanson
title: Easy to set up (because i had an echo account ...
content: Easy to set up (because i had an echo account already so Spot fit right in. The rotating messages  (well-documented) on the face are unnecessary and a pain but if you don't look at the clock all the time it is fine. Alarm tone is loud enough. I have a 2nd and 3rd gen. Echo (smaller version) and the clock works just fine!! Have an Echo 3rd and Spot in bedroom so have to call the Spot "Echo" or i would have both devices turning on at once. Makes for great stereo though :-)

content: Got it to show the clock.  Even when I set it to loop once, it loops anyway.  Unless you use this for the Facetime-like app, get another device.

author: Leah A
title: Warning: You'll Want Another :)
content:
The only flaw I have found - it doesn't remember that I don't want to see the music lyrics. Every time I play music, I have to ask it to go back to the home screen. Scrolling lyrics are distracting while I work. I just want a clock and image while it plays music. #FirstWorldProblems
Side note - the sound is much better than the Dots. I assumed the sound of the Spot vs. Show would be the same as the Dot vs. Echo. But it is much closer to the full Echo sound than I expected. Pleasant surprise! Now I want another :)

author: Billy Whitlock
title: I am new to this kind of things .
content: This echo spot is new to me but I think it can do a lot more than I know how to ask.

author: JohnMac
title: Hits the right Spot
content: I got both a white and a black one to match the decors of a bedroom and a breakfast nook. The styling is great, since their round screens will be looked at more often,  compared to regular Dots.  (Echo Show was too big, boxy, and ugly for me)  These Spots are like Dots on steroids.  The sound is more powerful on its own, though I do pipe them through external speakers.  The screen is crisp, and definitely enhances the conveyance of info like song lyrics, photos relating to factual inquiries, even videos from a few sources, including Amazon Video. I do wish Amazon and Google would make peace so to get Youtube back.  But overall, I must say I am very delighted with this purchase, and I'm are with further updates and new Skills it will get even better in the future.

author: Ranga
title: Regret buying
content: The quality of the product is great but at the end of the day, this is a really expensive alarm clock. I have this wired up with Samsung SmartThings but other than using Alexa to control the lights, there isn't much use for this. You really have to go out of your way to make use of it. If you really need voice control in your room, get a $25 Echo Dot.

author: Lexcalibur100
title: My fave Echo device!
content: This is my FAVORITE Echo device! Quickly set it up, just plug it in! Very easy to control what you want to see on the screen, just go into settings, then home. I was concerned that the numbers for the time would be too small for me to see from far away, but I love the "analog" clock face and it's quite clear to see and large. This has all the great Alexa features plus video! Sound is awesome. It's a little pricey, but more than worth it. Will definitely get another Echo Spot!

author: Paul
title: After 3 weeks I could not be happier. We've cancelled our XM Radio subscription as a ...
content: After 3 weeks I could not be happier. We've cancelled our XM Radio subscription as a result of buying the Echo.

author: KIRK MILLS

content: Love these  things - i have now bought  3 plus one I got as a gift last summer - coolest things ever. this one is perfect for a night stand or table  -

author: KEAWV

content: I love the clock face feature. I don’t know how to use many skills yet but I love the ones I do and am adding smart home items

author: Jimmy Rhythm
title: I love this little guy!
content: I love this little guy! Easy to set up, easy to maintain. Fun clock faces. I wish I could choose something from my own music library to set as an alarm, but I'm a Prime Music subscriber, so I get by.. I see a lot of complaints about the "ads" that can't be turned off. Pay attention! There are no "ads"! What you're seeing are suggestions for what you can ask Alexa. Most of them are pretty helpful. True, you can't turn them off, but you can set them to appear less often. On the whole, I'm very satisfied.

author: Nina
title: Cute version of Alexa
content: This version of Alexa is wonderful.  Perfect size for a nightstand.  Because of the screen, it’s easy to connect it to different wi-if networks.  When I take a car trip, I put the Show in my suitcase.  The time display is nice & big — even my old eyes can see it without glasses.  And, you can set it so that the numbers are a dark red at night so there’s no bright illumination when you’re trying to sleep.

author: Amazon Customer

content: I have started out using this as an alarm clock for my bedroom. But now  it’s a great way to fall asleep with sleep sounds listening to music and using the drop in feature for the living room .

author: Darwin

The only glitch was in a contact list and pronunciation became a challenge when asking to call some individuals.  One keeps learning with it and can imagine how this will evolve into a better and better connections.

author: Peggy Alexander
title: I made my contact address "Nana and Pops" so now my 3 and 5 year old grandkids can tell their spot to "call Nana and Pops" whenever they want - it's a fun way to see them when we are away for ...
content: I bought one for myself and one for my son's family.  I made my contact address "Nana and Pops" so now my 3 and 5 year old grandkids can tell their spot to "call Nana and Pops" whenever they want - it's a fun way to see them when we are away for the Summer.

author: Natalie Hendershott
title: Echo Spot is amazing. My son loves this
content: Echo Spot is amazing. My son loves this. He loves the alarm and plays music with it all the time.

author: NICK G 914

This device is amazing in so many different ways , You just have to have the right tech ,,Patience , to get to know the language of full operation , Thank You Amazon for leading me in the right direction .

author: William Kendall
title: Great Product
content: Got two of these and they work GREAT!

author: felipe_q
title: Good option, but if you don't need video, just get a Dot
content: The Spot is great for the bedside table, since it's got the display that shows the time and weather. Not sure if we'll ever use it to make a video call, because that just seems weird. But for listening to music, setting reminders (including alarms) or using the drop-in feature like an intercom, it's great. The display is bright, but it dims in low light, and the background goes black at night (when that feature is activated in settings). Overall, we're pleased with the Spot.

author: R Wong
title: Awesome, awesome and awesome
content: Awesome,awesome and awesome, loved it, I wish that they incorporate Spanish language, you will selling billions of this unit

author: Winter Wonderland
title: Love the viewscreen!
content: I love the viewscreen, especially when reviewing upcoming orders and the ability to customize the background picture. I haven’t even checked out all the features yet! It’s amazing.

author: Jay DM
title: NOT an alarm clock replacement!
content: The Alarm UI to snooze the alarm is "dismiss", and you have to swipe madly up the screen if you want to actually dismiss the alarm.  Why didn't they just put snooze and dismiss on the screen and let you stab at the one you want?  Swiping as the first thing I do when I wake up is too much to ask

author: Donna
title: After a year dosnt work
content: Purchased this as a today's special value  from QVC , so gad it about a year,  and now it doesn't work,  i reset and it still will not respond, keeps saying sorry something went wrong,  i have 3 echo dots,  a echo tap, thw original echo and they all are working just fine,  forget the clock,  waist of money!!

author: jodeg
title: Love My Echo Spot!
content: I love this little thing!  It's compact, has good sound and does everything my Echo and Dot do, only with a screen.  Lot's of backgrounds to choose from too.  I also bought the stand for it, which allows me to tilt it for better viewing.  It's great!  Would buy again!

author: Chad
title: Cool toy for someone who likes tech
content: I use this as my bedside clock. It’s a cool toy. Not necessary, but I love technology!!!

author: Tera Walker
title: The BEST Echo
content: Had to return this Echo because the bottom portion just came off.  Love my Echo, this was just an oddity

author: Gregory Weiss
title: Needs better customization
content: Would give 5 stars if I could customize the device to show the weather by default.  Also don't like that you can't turn off "things to try" and it constantly reappears after you do give any commands to the device.

author: Cedric Manning
title: Awesome
content: Awesome

author: LISA
title: Love it!
content: I bought two one for my office and one for my bedside table. They are fantastic the screen is just big enough when using the drop in feature to communicate with my mom. I can’t wait for prime day again to get one for my moms bedside table.

author: Christian K.
title: Great product
content: Really great product. The screen adds a whole new elements to the already amazing Alexa.

author: Todd P. Kennelly
title: Great form factor, limited usefulness.  Annoying "tips"
content:
Very nice design... Limited functionality... No YouTube, light ring notifications do not work.  (Still working fine on my Dots and Echo, but not the Spot)

The lack of access to YouTube is tempered slightly by the ability to view my Ring Video Doorbell feed via a simple voice command.  (For this feature alone, I'll eventually get 1 or 2 more Spots and another Ring Spotlight Camera, for the back entry.)

Very disappointed the light ring notifications don't function, hoping it's a software issue that will be addressed soon.

...and the ridiculous feud between Google and Amazon is stupid, frustrating for the consumer, and just plain bad business... (Amazon you claim to "sell everything under the Sun" ...but you won't sell the Google mini or max voice assistants... so Google won't let you use YouTube...  We -want- to access to our YouTube content...  So, just SELL the damn mini & max!!!)

Lastly, kill the overwhelmingly annoying "things to try" feature/tip/card...  (At the very least,  give us the option to shut it off...  Your users are literally -begging- you!!!)

No YouTube: -1 star,
Non-functional light ring notifications: -1 star.

author: Hermes Franqui
title: Entertaining but still need software development.
content:
These are good devices that still require more development. As an example, they can play Amazon's wide list of music and show the lyrics while playing.  However, if you ask to identify the song from lyrics you may know, the devices are totally lost.  If Google is presented with even a small subset of a song's lyrics, it returns several versions of the song(s) which have matching lyrics.

The devices also show a very limited command of "search" capability when you stray away from purchasing questions.  That said, IF Amazon continues to develop the capabilities of these devices, they will become as useful as they are presently entertaining.

author: Maureen Andreoni
title: Convenience and easy to use
content:
I love this product! Looked at it for 2yrs and finally bought it, should have done it soon.
I love to interact with Alexa for music, weather, and fun facts. Use it a lot for Ambient Sleep sounds to help me get and stay asleep

author: Pete
title: Not ready yet!
content: Could not get it to work smoothly with Ring products.  Will give it more time til they work out the problems with everything.

author: Uncle John
title: Great for the night stand. Less clutter.
content: You can display your photos in the background and choose the style clock you want.It is good for seing your cameras at night at your bedside. Great little unit for bedside.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Product
content: Very pleased with the product

author: Carol S. Hay
title: It will read my Kindle when my eyes are tired
content: I am very excited and happy with this. It was a breeze to set up and my favorite feature is reading my Kindle and going to sleep to Thunderstorm music.

author: Azriel
title: Great device
content: Great device, just wish I could connect it to my kitchen Alexa and have simultaneous music on both

author: Canes1
title: Love this product!!!
content: I love it!  Just added photos and they look great!  Have the old Alexa which is now In the bedroom and i keep this one in the kitchen.  Love the ability to see the lyrics when songs play or family photos.  Also discovered you can do multiple timers and label them.  Great for cooking!

author: Nell
title: Another great device in the Alexa family
content: Another great device in the Alexa family. I love the screen on it and customized it to have a photo of my dogs on there. The Spot basically set itself up and the GUI was super easy to work with. It plays music well with a good speaker as well. Loving this Alexa more than others!

author: Sharon D
title: LOVE my clock
content: Best smart clock I've ever owned. You will not be disappointed either. You can set it to dim during the night. Love the ease of setting an alarm. Love being able to ask what the weather will be that day or anything else in want to all Alexa. Fast shipping and a quality product.

author: Great Reads and Good Whole Foods
title: Poor controls for random outbound calls by kids to my contact list
content:
I bought this Echo Spot as a modern device for my kids bedrooms.  Sticker over camera (check!).  Soon I realize that my kids could mistakenly call any person listed in my phone contact list despite the I have selected every option to DISABLE access to my phone contact list!

I selected no access to contacts on my phone settings.

I also selected disable access to contacts within contact list of Alexa app and I selected communications>contact list>manage contacts> block and my kids still can call anyone by accident or purposely.  So frustrating.  Because Alexa interprets conversations and words I’m so concerned that this could be an outbound phone call in error.

AMAZON-THIS IS SO STRAIGHTFORWARD.  Please fix this!  My kids shouldn’t be able to accidentally call my contacts!

author: Megan Anderson
title: she’s the best. everyone needs one.
content: I love her. I’d been putting off buying an alexa for a while. got intoxicated at a halloween party and had a wonderful conversation with an echo spot for an hour. came home and purchased mine the next day.

author: MikeyFTL
title: Not working with iPhone app
content: I bought 3 of these for my family members for the holidays. Problems started almost immediately because one of my family members had a duplicate Amazon account with the same phone number, making it impossible to setup the Amazon Alexa app that is required to run these devices. Things only got worse when the duplicate account was removed by an Amazon employee. The app completely stopped working on his iPhone and required technical escalation with Amazon, after which I was given the 24-48 hour "we don't know what's wrong" blow-off. One down, two to go. I attempted to setup the second Echo on my step-mom's iPhone. The Spot was unable to access contacts, which was a major, major problem. The iPhone and the Spot were both on the same wifi so there was no reason for it. Alexa didn't want anything to do with her iPhone and kept saying "You'll need to setup your Amazon Alexa app before I can access your contacts". At this point I was starting to see a trend and it was the iPhone app. Two down, one to go. Completely frustrated, we decided to try using an android phone. Everything worked fine. Contacts were seen and Alexa was working...until we tried to ask her simple questions like "Alexa, what time is it?" For the most part, she answered them, until my stepmom asked her the same questions. Alexa either ignored her or gave the wrong answers. My mom seemed upset and lost interest in her Christmas gift almost immediately. Third times a charm, right? Wrong. I attempted to setup my parents android phones with the app but their phones were so old that they couldn't run the app at all, nor did they understand why the Spot wouldn't connect to their wifi. In short, what was supposed to be a fun Christmas gift turned into a day long disaster for all involved. I'm returning all 3 Echo Spots to Amazon.

author: GP
title: almost perfect smart alarm clock
content:
Got this from an Amazon booth in the local store just in time for Christmas (while it was out of stock online!). Really glad I did. Wife told me this is by far the best tech gift I ever gave her (which mostly says that all the others were rather.. meh, too geeky for her). She wanted a new nightstand clock and we already had an Echo in the kitchen/living room area.. So having Alexa with music etc. was a nice bonus. The built-in screen is great for this form factor, speaker and microphones are OK too, considering.. Yes, it's Alexa in the cutest and most useful package so far. I wished it had more clock faces and options available, but that's not so important.

Took a star off because Amazon did not provide an Echo Spot model *without* the built-in camera. Come on, guys, many people dislike the idea of having a camera in their bedroom, so like many others I too had to put some discreet black tape over the camera (I know the camera can be disabled in settings but let's be realistic about "software" settings..). Another minor issue is that I could not find a scheduling function to adjust the brightness to minimum only during the night, while turning it back up during the day -- come on, how hard is that? It does have the rather useless "night mode" that can be indeed scheduled but that mostly alters the color hues and it does not provide *full control* over the brightness level -- which should be really at the very minimum in a dark room at night. So right now we have to keep the brightness very low all the time which makes the screen almost unusable during the day.. Which is not big deal as the device does not get much use during the day. Yes I am aware that the auto-brightness functionality might have been affected by the piece of tape I put over the camera -- which again, is Amazon's biggest fault in this device -- not providing a model option without the camera hardware.. or at least provided better brightness control (scheduling) for those of us who use a camera cover.

author: Kay
title: User friendly
content: Love these things!!  We have several and use them for all sorts of things——intercom system, how to spell a word, listening to audible books including the Bible, music and the list goes on and on!

author: Donald Frankenfeld
title: It's Fun!
content: In different locations, we have two original Echos, two Dots, and an Echo show. The Spot (in each of two bedrooms) is the most fun, and does everything one would expect. We sometimes use it as a video intercom, with reasonably good results, and it works as a teleconferencing device, although the small screen makes it unsuitable for business use. You can watch movies on Amazon Prime or other packaged video, but the effective screen size is in the same league as a smart phone, which is to say pretty small.

author: Bobsacto
title: Don't think of Spot as an alarm clock
content: The Spot is a well-priced easy to use internet appliance. It is the equal or exceeds my previous internet radios for the same or less money. What it is not is an alarm clock. You should not depend on a device that requires constant external power and continual internet access to wake you up. Either use a cell phone, battery-powered clock, clock radio with battery backup, or heck a wind-up clock if you really need to get up at a particular time. The unit is attractive and takes up little room. Recently Amazon announced that Spotify and SiriusXM would now be able to be used across multiple Echo devices in a multi-room group setup. Don't know about Spotify but if you add a Spot to your Echo group SiriusXM does not play across the group though you can listen to the service on a Spot only. Hopefully, Amazon will fix this bug in the Spot software. Amazon music works across all Echo devices in a multi-room enviroment even when a Spot is part of the group.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Don't have internet, couldn't use...duh
content: Returned due to lack of internet at my house.  No fault of the item.

author: Ricky M Purvis
title: Easy to use
content: My wife has eye sight problems.  It is failing.  To be able to set alarms using voice and also cancel them is great.  She loves her Echo Spot.  Also to sync spot with contact in mobile phone and to call using voice commands is a great feature.  She says that this is the best Christmas present she has received in several years.

author: Harry Bee
title: better documentation would help
content: My only complaint is that it took a minute - maybe several - to figure out that there was a headphone output and where it was.  (Not pointed out in the minimal documentation that comes with it.)  Also, better documentation would help.  I guess that's two grips.  Otherwise, the addition of the screen at a still-reasonable price adds a lot to the Echo Dot.  I've replace my bedroom clock with this, and it reads to me at bedtime, and tells me the headlines and weather on waking.

author: Judd Q
title: Great alarm clock upgrade!!
content: I like that it shows my Ring devices. Was a little slow to connect with Ring at first but that’s improved. At first the screen would scroll and not stay on the clock. But after reading help answers that has been solved. Screen automatically dims in low light. I got it though to upgrade from an old alarm clock. Great upgrade!  Alexa is fun.

author: Carla Loves Amazon!
title: Poor audio quality
content: The Echo Spot has very poor sound quality compared to the other Amazon Echo devices.  Even the Echo Dot (much cheaper) has so much better sound quality! Disappointed.

author: Kim Vanacore
title: You do not have to be at all tech smart to set your Echo up and start using.
content: I am the least tech savvy person I know, but this was incredibly easy to set up and start using. I'm still learning more ways to use the Echo every day, easy to have so much information, music ... smart home just a voice command away.

author: Kevin Cunningham
title: My wife loves her Echo Spot. She primarily uses ...
content: My wife loves her Echo Spot. She primarily uses it as an advanced alarm clock to let her know the weather and news in the morning.

author: Orlando Garcia
title: ALEXA SPOT
content: Just love it. Excellent company.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazon is hard not to love!
content: what it does, it does OK.  However, using it as an alarm clock, I can't read the digital numbers at night and it won't turn on NPR (or any other station) at wake up time!  I wish they'd pack a brief instruction book with the device rather than having to wait 20" for tech support or try to find what is needed online.  Sooner or later I expect they'll publish a book and charge for it.  Nevertheless, Amazon is hard not to love!

author: YourGirLisa
title: ECHO SPOT IS GREAT!
content:
Fun, smart and user-friendly!
A smaller, less-costly version of Echo Show, for tighter spaces or just a more low-profile design.

author: Sheryl A. Ned
title: Amazing Echo!
