It's room to room video monitoring system is a nice feature to for the built-in intercom system for your home. It's an amazing product and every home needs it. Thanks

author: shantazzle
title: Love it!!
content: I use this product for everything!! Music, ordering products,  etc

author: Asiah B.
title: I love it for my children’s room
content: I love it for my children’s room. I bought the much bigger echo show first so the screen difference is huge to me. It definitely works great for a child’s room or bathroom. I am just used to a bigger screen with the show and it’s worth it.

author: CoffeeBean
title: I want one for every room!
content: This device is amazing! I love all the features and that it’s still learning! Highly recommended!

author: Alejandro F.
title: A pleasent surprise that continues to impress!
content:
Wow! What a product! I have and utilize Apple products, so when HomePod was released I began to look into this type of product. It's limited capabilities is the reason I began to look at Alexa Echo. The Spot is a sleek looking product especially in analog clock mode. Right when it arrived I was blown away by the almost unlimited things it can do. Just short of washing my dishes. Which, in time, I'm sure Alexa will be able to link to Smart Appliances and actually wash the dishes.
My family was visiting the day after I received my Echo, so I was showing it off. My aunty who is not technolically privy absolutely loved it and was able to navigate and control it like an old pro. What a wonderful time to be alive. I really recommend you all give it a try. You'll have so much fun adding skills (Alexa's equivalent to Apps) and experimenting and trying all kinds of things.

author: James P. Poe
title: Great price and sound.
content: Great price and sound

author: Mark J.
title: Annoying ads you can’t turn off
content: It is impossible to turn off “things to try.” The last thing I need when getting ready for work is to be told to ask for a ninja joke. I’ve tried every possible way to turn off those annoying ads. It makes you want to throw it across the room.  Also, it doesn’t show up as one of my cloud cams. So I’ll need another cloud cam just to monitor my home office when the spot should be perfectly capable.

author: ChrissyB
title: Love my Echo Spot!!!!!
content: The Echo Spot, I love my Echo spot and everyone that comes over always wants one!  It does so much!  It's worth every penny!!! It would be a great gift!!!

author: Lunchbox
title: Great replacement for your bedside clock.
content: Worthy successor to the echo dot and right at home in the bed room as an alarm clock.  However, for the price it should come with the stand

author: Son of a GV
title: Records what you say to Alexa in the cloud!
content:
Records what you say to Alexa in the cloud! Big Brother is watching So to speak.  I was very annoyed to find two problems with this which is not worth being able to turn off lights remotely, etc.
1) When you speak to Alexa, whatever you say is recorded in the cloud. You must manually go in and delete the recording’s every so often.  Defeats the purpose of security and privacy.
2)  several times I have been woken up in the middle of the night  By stupid advertisement recommendations. It’s bad enough that our phones, email, and snail mail gets spam mail! Now, you can get it delivered right to your inner ear while you’re sleeping! If someone knows how to turn this off then great but no one pays over 100 bucks to be bombarded with advertisements on a mini screen. Alarm clock, music, and control “smart outlets” is all people need or at least all I need.  The rest of the crap is just for Amazon and advertisers.  Guaranteed this will come back to bite Amazon on the ass  with class-action lawsuits  especially with number one above.

author: Jerser
title: The Alarm Clock of My Electric Dreams!
content: The Echo Spot is the alarm clock I always wanted. I can hop into bed and tell it to turn the lights off. The clock face is infinitely changeable and displays text as the Echo is answering questions. It tells me the news, the weather and links to my Spotify account to play music. It was very easy to set up. And I haven't even used the calling and intercom features yet.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great addition to my night stand
content: Love it

author: Kindle Customer
title: Was not a free with the other purchase.
content: This was supposed to be free if I bought a set of blink cameras.  Somehow the free didn’t translate and I don’t need it that badly.

author: Beverly
title: Perfect for the bedroom and appears like a small clock ...
content: Perfect for the bedroom and appears like a small clock but is perfect for turning the light on and off, checking the weather, using as an alarm, or playing music.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love it!
content: Sent to my parents for Christmas & they love it!  Said it was super easy to connect.

author: robby818
title: Every few minutes the screen will cycle to a page that frankly is useless and annoying
content: It is not possible to disable Things to Try suggestions.  Every few minutes the screen will cycle to a page that frankly is useless and annoying.

author: T. S. Crider
title: Perfect alarm clock with enhanced features
content: I had an Echo Dot and an alarm clock in my bedroom. I was looking at another Echo device and decided to combine the two into a Spot. In this regard it does exactly what I want. There is a learning curve to this device which keeps it from getting a full five stars. And that annoying 'What can Alexa do?' card which cannot be gotten rid of, but if all you want is an alarm clock replacement, then this does the job nicely.

author: ZaidaRing
title: I like that it is easy to use and it's really ...
content: I like that it is easy to use and it's really helpful... what I don't like and can't figure out, is how to have the "try this with Alexa" thing that is always coming up turned off.

author: Oldthor
title: Great device!
content: My new alarm clock and much more! I know seems expensive but believe me this device is well made! Sound quality is surprisingly good and while the screen is small it’s resolution is really good. I’m fussy about what I spend my money on and I’m extremly happy with this purchase.

author: Pamela M Sawyers-White
title: It is very helpful
content: Love it

author: JWebbe
title: We love the entire echo line
content: We have 4 dots, 1 echo and now the echo spot.  We love them all.  The spot is very useful in that its small and takes up very little space - I use it on my desk because I like visuals :) - plus it makes a great paper weight!

author: Michelle B.
title: No issues
content:
After reading most of the comments I went for it.  Followed the directions online for set up, super easy, and it works perfect.  Clock adjusts to l
Brightness, and only shows my clock face of my choice, weather, and text messages.  Nor does it make noise, unless I ask to make call, play music, or ask a question. Love it!

author: Molly Fitzgibbon
title: Don’t buy
content: We bought this to use with the amazon cloud cam as a baby monitor. The problem is the are two large buttons in the middle of the screen, so instead of seeing the room, you see two big circles, one to zoom, the other to speak, but you cannot see anything!!!!

author: Mike
title: Excellent
content: Excellent

author: Renee Richard
title: Easy to use.
content: I love that the spot has a video screen. I have one of my favorite picture on it.  The alarm clock is great and I can listen to music when I’m getting ready for work.

author: bebomber
title: Not as good as the Echo or Dot
content: Sound quality is less than a dot, microphones don't pick me up as well as the other models (i have Echo and Dots).  Picture quality is good

author: sandsmith
title: Nice.
content: I got this for traveling, on the assumption most hotels have good Wi-Fi. So far, it has been just great. I bought this over the Dot since it has a larger speaker and so better sound, plus the visual screen serves as a clock.  It is a little fussy to get the initial settings as I wanted, and I would like a larger digital clock display to be available.  These are  minor issues, and the touch screen is effective in getting to the settings.  I have also registered a request that the “things to try“ screen be made optional - I don’t need constant reminders of what to try.

author: BeckyN
title: Love this new product
content: Love this new product.  Keep it by my bedside so I can add things to lists as I think of them.  Great product Amazon!

author: Myron D.
title: Good Addition to Echo
content: Easy to set up.  Took 3-4 minutes after plugging in.  Liked the design of the screen (already have a Show).  Little disappointed by the sound, better than the Dot but not as good as the show or original Echo.

author: stacy
title: Absolutely worth it
content: I am having fun with my new echo sport it works wonderfully. Loving the functions and learning new things to do with it.

author: Donna M. Dees
title: Having so much fun with this
content: Having so much fun with this. Thinking of getting another one for upstairs. The screen is very clear and I love all the additional things you can do with it vs the dot.

author: Renee
title: More than a convenience, the Echo becomes a useful tool in our home.
content: I love my Echo Spot! I love the display. I ask a lot of random questions and get answers!! Our Echo woke me at 4:00 am for the royal wedding . I love weather updates.

author: Skip
title: Great Alarm Clock
content: tons of features

author: Chance
title: Everyone needs Alexa
content: Love my new echo dot! We have our whole house controlled by Alexa. Even lights and plugs. The Alexa app on my phone is hard to navigate and really glitchy, but the echo devices themselves and the technology is fantastic.

author: Rendo
title: Great for the bedroom and news like TV!
content: Still learning to use these things.  They sure are smart!  haha  She started reading a book to me yesterday.  Get one.  I like the way it controls the brightness all by itself when lights are turned off at night.

author: Sally Kershisnik
title: Voice distortion
content: Sound was not clear. Had to be directly facing it close or I could not be heard clearly. My voiced would fade if I turned my head to the side. Great size, just wish the sound was better, so any it back Love the larger size show!

author: Jess
title: Can’t edit contacts
content: The kids love to play with the dot that we had. The small screen is a nice extra and the sound is definitely better than the dot. We got the spot as a sort of house phone since we cut the land line so the kids could call their grandparents. It does work well for that. What is very frustrating is we have not found a way to edit contacts so they only have access to a few contacts and not everyone in our address book. For that I gave it 3 stars.

author: velvet suite
title: Good to name the Echoes different names so they won’t get mixed up as I have 2 others
content: Have this in my bathroom and it keeps me company while there with songs and any questions I have. Gives me the time, weather and traffic. Screen a little small and the next one I get will be the Show.

author: MorningZ
title: The mics work great, it can hear me from 2/3rds my house ...
content:
I have a Dot in the living room to my house, I use it all the time to play Spotify and XM Radio, use as a timer, ask for my daily news dump, turn off my living room's entertainment center, and control my Hue lights that I have throughout the house.

So when the Spot got announced, I was ecstatic that the power of this would be sitting on my nightstand.

For people to call it a glorified alarm clock is not doing it justice.  The mics work great, it can hear me from 2/3rds my house (the dot is "alexa", the spot is "echo" so they don't both act on a command), the speaker is sounds surprisingly great, and yes it makes an amazing alarm clock, especially with the update that came out this week to sound the alarm with Spotify music.

For my 2 cents, this device is an absolute "must have" for anyone even remotely into smart home stuff.

I highly recommend the Spot stand to be able to adjust the angle as well.

author: shotgun
title: Screen is small
content: Great addition to our "smart home", exactly as expected from reading the reviews. Screen is actually smaller than I expected but it still performs well.

author: Roger Ormand
title: Amazon Fan
content: Added to my Alexa whole home system!!

author: Tracie
title: I love having Alexa next to my bed
content: I love having Alexa next to my bed.  I wanted an alarm that had other modern features and this meets my needs perfectly.  I can get a quick weather update as I get up in order to prepare for early morning workouts.  I also love have relaxing music or mediation’s as I fall asleep.

author: Shay
title: My favorite Alexa device so far
content: This is my favorite Alexa device. It is compact and I don't mind the way it sits without the stand. It never loses connectivity, I like the clock face. It also scrolls through different things to try saying to Alexa, weather and trending topics, updates on any Amazon shipments, and the like, if you happen to be looking at the face. As far as weather goes, IMO Alexa herseld needs to default to a much more accurate weather service. I needed to know if there was rain in the forecast in the next few hours so I could blanket my horse. Alexa said no rain in forecast and only was able to tell me when it was currently raining. It annoys me to have to turn on my computer to get an accurate hour by hour forecast while Alexa just sits there. Nice device. I like it.

author: Patrick M Shine Sr
title: Big Disappointment
content: The Music playback quality is No Where near the good as the Dot and poor quality as compared to my Echo Tap. As for making phone calls I had to raise my voice quite a bit, standing only 4 feet I had to raise my voice quite a bit to be heard by the people I have called. Echo Spot is a waste of money. I am happier with the Echo Dot and think Echo Tap is terrific.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great alarm clock!
content: Love this! I wanted it for our alarm clock and it is so easy to set the alarms that we need and I don't have to try and find the button to shut off, I just tell Alexa.  I also like that I still can control everything that I have setup on my Echo downstairs so instead of yelling down to the Echo, I just ask my Spot...done! Love it!

author: Miss JE
title: This thing rocks!
content: I love this thing! I wish I would have got one sooner.

author: Beach Girl
title: Good product
content: Love this product. Was able to put a picture of my great-granddaughter on it.

author: Ashley
title: Need help with set up
content: I have always set up our Alexa and smart home devices. My husband got ahold of the echo spot before I could get to it and has no idea how he set it up. By the time I got to it it can play music it can tell us the weather all the genetics but I cannot find it anywhere in my or his Alexa app. If I try to add it as a device it gives me the option to add an Alexa/echo product but does not list an echo spot, how do I find it in my app? I would like to be able to customize it and add my smart home devices to it since it will be in our bedroom, is this even an echo that needs to be added to my Alexa app device list?

author: ANGEL BAKER
title: One is GREAT! the other NOT!
content: I bought 2 of these.  One of them is GREAT! 5 star all the way.  It is fast and cooperative, quick to learn, a joy.  The other one I would give a reluctant 3 stars leaning toward 2 stars.  It is very slow to respond and stops responding all together until it decides to play nice with me.  It is highly frustrating, argues, and refusing to answer questions or do what is asked.  I find it interesting how different these 2 identical devises are.

author: Elmno
title: Perfect
content: We are an Alexa family! Small screen but still great product

author: Chandler
title: Great Addition to the Echo family, but needs a little more refinement on the software side
content: Overall the Echo Spot has been a great experience, but there are a few areas where it needs improvement.  It needs more basic background images for the various clock faces, there's no option to tell which profile you're on without asking and there's no ability to "voicecast" what you're viewing to another device like the Echo is able to do.  The overall speech recognition is very good and the multitude of options that you can see on the screen makes this device well worth the asking price.

author: Grandma Sue
title: The features of this item are so numerous, wont ever need to use all of them.
content: Valentines gift and still learning how to use it.

author: Brett Graber
title: LOVE THIS THING
content: i use it as my alarm clock. its amazing. wouldnt go back to a regular clock ever again. great product

author: Angel
title: Love
content: This is my 3rd Alexa product. Love it

author: Melanie
title: Great product
content: Great echo device.  I use for alarm clock and is great.

author: Rosemary M.Lowry
title: Love Echo Spot
content: Very easy set up. We love the Echo Spot.

author: Akira Yoshimura
title: HATE 'Things to try'...
content: Liked the features.. at first. Able to make calls, ask questions, alarm clock, play music, and a nice design. I also have Echo Dot and have no issues. The Spot is a little smaller than I liked but decent for an alarm clock.  Spent over 1 hour trying to remove the annoying 'Things to try...'  since I mainly use the Spot for an alarm clock in my bedroom, I only want to see the time and weather. Did a quick search and found out this is the main complaint for the Spot. EVERYBODY hates this feature. I want to throw that piece of sh!t to the wall now.... it's so freaking annoying. I have to put it on Night mode just to use it as a clock.  I like to view my kids photo in the background with the time  but if I place it on night mode, no photo.  What a disappointment.

author: Herbert J.
title: Get it and you'll be hooked like I am
content: I've owned 2 Sony Dash internet radios until Sony decided to stop its service for Dash. This has been a dream come true. Voice controlled and will play everything from Amazon music to Spotify,Pandora, or just about anything you can think of. It has sleep timers you can set or wake you up when you like.You can ask it anything,upload pictures play video clips or communicate with other Alexa devices. And to put the icing on the cake, voice controlled equalizer! You'll just love the spot!

author: Elizabeth Alston
title: My new alarm clock
content: I received this as a Christmas present and I thinking I already have the dot why do I need this. I love it though I put the one I had in the kitchen and I keep the spot on the nightstand in the bedroom. My only issue with it is when I plug my speaker into it, it makes noise so I can’t keep it plug in it. I had it plugged into my dot and it didn’t do that so I don’t know the problem. Maybe I’ll figure it out but besides that I love it learning to do new things every day.

author: Strawberry Hill Povitica
title: Great Product
content: Great Product

author: Richard Wright
title: Echo Spot
content: I bought this as an updated alarm clock and it works well for that.  It is a nice addition to the bedroom....playing music, adding to my grocery list, Flash News updates, weather, etc.

author: Nina Poemape
title: THIS IS JUST THE BEGINNING
content: LOVE LOVE LOVE my Echo Spot.  Great volume, small screen size, but that is to be expected.  If I wanted a bigger screen, I have a laptop, tablets, TVs, etc.  The image resolution is great.  I mostly use it to keep an eye on my kids.  Totally worth it for me.  This is my only Amazon device, but I'm planning on expanding soon.  Fantastic for the price!

author: TC
title: Five Stars
content: Most amazing product. Our whole family really enjoys interacting with Alexa. Thanks Amazon!

author: D.J.
title: This device DOES allow VIDEO and AUDIO interaction with a RING 2 doorbell.
content: I love the Echo Spot, and the only reason I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that it is a tad small for me.  Other reviewers have compared it to a Magic 8 ball, and that is completely accurate.  If I were using it as a bedside or desktop clock, it would be fine.  I use it in a deep window sill next to my front door so I can see and speak to who is outside on my Ring 2.  For that purpose, I wish it were about 30 percent bigger (like maybe the size of a large grapefruit or small cantaloupe).  I have seen reviewers saying this does not have audio interface capabilities with the Ring 2.  That is NOT true.  Mine works great.  I say, "Alexa, show me the front door," and the video appears on the screen.  Then, in the lower right-hand corner of the circle screen, there is an icon for a microphone with a diagonal line thru it (the  universal sign for "muted").  You press that icon, and the diagonal line disappears, which turns on the Audio.  The automatic/default muting is a safety so that people cannot turn on the microphone and eavesdrop on your home just by pressing your Ring 2 doorbell.  The audio is 2-way, clear, and easy to hear.  When you complete the encounter, say "Alexa, go home" and it disconnects and returns to your home screen.  Since there appears to be a lot of misunderstanding as to this feature, I wanted to point it out and make sure everyone understands it does work and how to access it.

author: StressedMom
title: Small but mighty
content: My husband and I enjoy testing out the knowledge of Alexa, but I've also set up various alarms and reminders and just love it. It's s great that it has such a small footprint but still such a huge impact. Love it!!!

author: Mesia Willis
title: The best SPOT in the room!
content: I absolutely love my Amazon Echo Spot. As the owner of a Google Home Mini I was wondering did I really need the Echo Spot or were they the same thing. I am glad to be able to say that each has its own place. I would definitely recommend this to a friend!

author: KM
title: Love it
content: I replaced an echo I had on my nightstand with the Spot.  It’s so much better for this purpose.  More attractive, has a clock face that dims automatically at night and displays info instead of just talking to you.  Love it!

author: MsPLaza
title: Very handy device.
content: I love music. It is so easy to listen to music, start a timer, get the weather, question of the day, etc. I'm glad I upgraded to the spot from the dot. I like the visual feed back.

author: Hassi Grimm
title: Ads
content: The only thing i dont like is when you have music paused and go to okay it it'll sometimes just play an add over it, horrible if your in the middle of a playlist, besides that its fantastic, there maybe a way to turn it off but it still kinda sucks that thats the default...could have youtube support would make it a 5 out of 5

author: Rich
title: Love my Travel size echo
content:
I love the size. I travel extensively around the US and I take the spot with me. It is relatively simple to setup in most hotels. The screen is perfect to read information and to keep me informed of weather, news, ETC.
The only negative I have is the speaker isn't as nice as the ones in other models but I understand that the size of the unit is most likely the limitation for having a better one.

author: Louise A. Hickey
title: Five Stars
content: Works great. Excellent selection of songs. Would like to know more about all the things the Spot can do.

author: Michael L. Johnson
title: Echo Spot working with a Ring doorbell
content:
My daughter bought me the Echo Spot along with a Ring doorbell (and installation). We both thought it would work automatically when the Ring sends notifications. It doesn't. One has to ask Alexa to "show me the front door". Since the Echo connects to the Ring it baffles me why notifications aren't automatic.
Also, I don't want Amazon or Google devices listening to what is going on in my house.
I unplugged the unit until a software upgrade to fix the problem is released. In the not too distant future, I'll donate it to GoodWill.

author: Bea H
title: Five Stars
content: This was a gift for my husband and he absolutely loves it.

author: Kay
title: Alexa Spot - Love it!
content: I love my Alexa Spot, but we were having issues on her location and the weather.  Finally got it done.  Love the little Spot.  Now I can play my music while cooking and because she displays the lyrics, I will drive my husband nuts and I can't sing.  She is quite the little item.  Love it.

author: P. Severance
title: Fun Fun FUN
content: I LOVE this product. Just for finding out what time it is. AND you can ask so many questions. Just try it out 💕

author: Gary J. Gardner
title: Kind of spendy
content: Should have come with a manual

author: Manny
title: Bluetooth connection keeps dropping with my Sound Bar
content: I love the Spot, it is my new alarm clock and is wonderfull. But the Bluetooth connection drops and a won’t recognized the speakers and I have to reset it. I wonder if some body else is having this problem. Before the Spot I was using a Echo dot and worked perfect

author: DJ
title: Works great but the alarm...
content: Works great! The only issue I have with it is you cannot set an alarm using your phone and you do have to be at the device and speak to set it so if anyone is sleeping when you need to set an alarm they will easily be woken by Alexa

author: michael b.
title: Great
content:
I am a big Amazon guy and have the original Echo, Echo dot and now Echo spot and it's great. It works perfectly and has a great display and a much better speaker than the dot. I couldn't be happier, this thing does so many things and I like how you can customize the screen which has very good picture quality.
I will buy another one once they go on sale again.
I would highly recommend it.

author: road66warrior
title: Perfect for your bedroom nightstand...
content: I have one of the original Amazon Echo devices in my living room and decided to buy the Echo Spot for my bedroom.  I thought about buying the less expensive Echo Dot, but I like the added benefit of the display on the Spot.  No need for a separate alarm clock, radio, etc. when you have an Echo Spot sitting on your bedroom nightstand.  Setup was easy using the Echo app on my iPhone and both the Echo and Spot work well together.

author: Bon
title: Five Stars
content: I am sure this will be great,  I need to get aquainted with it first

author: Vic
title: Love my Echo Spot. Period.
content: What can I say more then I love my new Echo Spot. A step up from the little flat echo with video playback and more information that you can visual see. Highly recommended to all. -Vic Resto President Showroom Partners online.

author: Cliff-N
title: Replace your old alarm clock.
content: Love this product. Put it on the nightstand next to the bed. Replaced the old school alarm clock radio. Set a recurring weekday alarm and it's done. No remembering to flip the switch every night, Alexa does it for you. Time, temperature and music are all there for you. We also use the relaxing sounds for sleeping at night. It also works with our Arlo camera so we can view the front porch as needed. I'm tempted to add one or two more of these to the household.

author: Chip C.
title: Here's my thing
content: Spot continuously sends visuals on things to try. I just want an alarm clock and a very low light clock. You can't stop the suggestions rolling by and that's been an issue for many folks. I just ignore them now and it works just great.

author: Donald Kulibert
title: The echo is great!
content: I like listening to my music on the echo. We will mostly use to get daily weather, alarm and daily reminders. I still have much to learn.

author: Caroline
title: I kind of love it! I just added Reuters news and a ...
content: I kind of love it! I just added Reuters news and a bunch of skills. It’s already connected to my ring doorbell and just ordered the baby’s room camera so I can use it as a monitor at home, and then still check in on the baby when I’m at work. I want to convert all my dots now!

author: Simply Loren
title: has some cool features.
content: I'm really enjoying the spot. I like how it pulls videos from Youtube when you ask it to play a song. I like the screen that gives me my calendar too. it's a neat gadget.

author: Nick Yeager
title: A great all-around smarthome device and a beautiful alarm clock.
content:
The Amazon Echo Spot was exactly what I was looking for. A smart bedside alarm clock. Of course it has its other uses and would be suitable in any room but for me, this is the best device you can currently buy *if* you want to add home control and smarts to your bedroom and you want a nice looking alarm clock as well.

- The screen automatically adjusts brightness based on ambient lightning. I was worried this would be too bright at night but it's pretty good.
- The speaker is good for the form factor
- Bluetooth connectivity means you can pair with larger speakers

author: Linda Caudill
title: Echo
content: I purchased this to be able to listen to music at home.  I was able to do the set up at my work but when I tried to do that at home, it would not connect at all.  So I ended up returning the Amazon Echo to the store for a full refund

author: cwgood
title: Really love Alexa devices!!
content:
Update:  Amazon Tech Customer Service called me and were of tremendous help with my Echo Spot.  All is working wonderfully right now and they took the time to answer some other questions I had as well. Not once did I feel rushed. Superb customer service and again I will stress how I love my Echo Devices!! Thank you Echo Tech Support - you're wonderful!!

First let me say, that I am an early adapter of Alexa devices and I love them. With this Echo Spot - I am having challenges with it staying connected to WIFI for more than a couple of weeks at a time. In trying to follow the online suggestions to reconnect - the touch screen will not always work.  I had hoped to have this to help me check in with the drop in feature on a person with dementia - so far the drop in feature has not worked for me.  Disappointing.

author: Charles Carroll
title: Echo Spot - A perfect bedside alarm
content: I was looking for a new bedside clock for my wife. It had to be small, preferably round, and have an analog clock face. My favorite such clock was a Becker, but the company had gone out of business and I couldn't find any previously owned. But in email was a notice for a new Echo Spot. I took one look at it, looked at the available clock faces, and understood immediately that this was exactly what I was looking for. Even the price was right!

author: Bella
title: Works fine. Just remember it works differently at startup with ...
content: Works fine. Just remember it works differently at startup with the rest of these types of Amazon products. Have had issues with it just going off for no reason....but the wifi is probably the culprit.

author: Danielle
title: I'm obsessed
content: I've been avoiding the voice devices for a long time - I almost never use Siri or any other voice activated technology, so I figured I would never use it... but when I was seeking a new alarm clock, I stumbled across Echo Spot and now I want one for every room of my house. I also discovered Amazon music with the Echo Spot - equally wonderful... but with those things together, it's amazing. I love the clock display and the ability to "drop in" and video with other 'Spots' in the house. I never realized all the things you can ask Alexa... "Set a timer" while I'm cooking, "play rock music" while I'm running around cleaning, "add X item to amazon cart" while I see something I am out of but don't have my phone handy to add it to a checklist, "show me baby room" for my amazon cloud cam, and "unlock front door" for my amazon connected door lock. The screen + cute compactness is what sold me, but the features are what have me hooked. Definitely get it. Actually, get 3. It's such a great addition to the home.

author: Carmelo
title: Love the Echo Spot!
content: I really like the look of the Echo Spot. I love the fact it has a video screen and the different clock faces you can use as the home screen.  It was very easy to set it up. I use it on my home office desk.  I enjoy using it to control the various smart devices I have, such as Hue lights and a Denon Heos Bluetooth speaker.

author: mum of one
title: My kids seem to use it more than I do ...
content: My kids seem to use it more than I do.  I use it mainly for phone calls to family.  After a month of fiddling around we still haven't figured out how the config works when there are two Echo devices registered to one user.. and we hope Amazon can fix that issue soon!

author: Lauren K  Tyler
title: Great addition to our amazon devices.
content: Perfect addition to my nightstand and replacement of the echo dot that previously sat there. (Which is now located in a spare room that also works with our fire tv located in the same room). I like that I can listen to my audible books, set alarms, watch videos (more so my kids than myself), and view our ring cameras, as well as our amazon cloud cams.

author: Lee M. Thompson
title: Another great Amazon product
content: Another great Amazon product

author: Tanja D.
title: I’m in love haha
content: Omg where do I start, I LOVE THIS THING! None bad to say!

author: E. L. Kemp
title: I love my Echo spot
content: Alexa plus video, news updates, latest scores, ask for music and get the lyrics, really good sound plus a 3.5mm plug for a external speaker. I now have two.

author: William McCorcle
title: Perfect
content: It was perfect.  Exactly what I was looking for.

author: Charles Thompson
title: Never saw needing this, now love it.
content: So this started at Christmas with a gift of a Echo.  Was not sure what I was going to do with the thing, but played with the skills and found that ambient noise skills and using it to play music was pretty good.  However it got moved to a front bedroom due to 8 year old loving it.  I had added a Dot downstairs and 6 smart plugs.  I can now use it to "Turn on the lights" and get lights upstairs and downstairs on.  I can then turn on or off each plug has needed.  was adding a Ring Doorbell, and when upstairs in the master found that needed a way to see the camera.  I was using a very old ihome radio as a alarm, heck it was for a iPhone 3g.  Updated to the Spot and LOVE it.  Its a great clock, its great alarm.  Added a nice Bluetooth speaker and great sound.  This morning woke up early and never opened a eye, Alexia, what time is it?  I can say show the door and get the Ring on it.  The drop-in feature allows talking to other rooms.  Just very happy with it.  Now if it controlled Fire TV a lot better, just asking!

author: ewiz
title: Gifts for Grands
content: My daughter requested these as gifts for 2 grand kids...they hook up to your Alexia....now she doesn't have to yell up the stairs to get them....she simply calls their room.  I have found my grandkids listening to music all day...and it's not all todays stuff...they are having fun listening to classical.

author: Terri
title: Most convenient alarm clock I’ve ever owned.
content: I really like it’s small size and fits perfectly on my nightstand. It has been the best thing for me to help me get ready in the morning. Prior to owning an echo spot I would have a bunch of alarms set on my phone but as I was getting ready in the morning I would have to keep turning off every alarm. Now I can just tell Alexa to set a timer for 10 minutes and I can just tell Alexa to stop timer without having to stop what I’m doing. As I’m getting ready I can ask for the weather so now I can make sure to bring an umbrella before I leave the house. I can even view my Ring spotlight cam on it, even though it doesn’t show the full picture, I think it’s still a nice feature to have. I liked the echo spot so much that I bought the Echo Show for my kitchen and plan to get more echo spots for the rest of the family to use as an intercom system.

author: Criticalthinker
title: Good so far
content: I purchased this mostly to read my Audible books to me while I’m in bed. There are other devices that will do this, but they aren’t cute and round like this, and don’t have as good a speaker. The speaker is just okay for music — a bit tinny — but is excellent for voice. I haven’t explored much more than Spotify and Audible yet, but so far so good. The set-up app is not great, but it easy enough to search the FAQs for help.

author: Justin Thoms
title: Glad I was talked into this.
content: I was looking for a smart alarm clock and a classmate talk to me into checking this out. To be honest I was concerned about the price however very happy I paid for it. Skills are great, tells me the morning weather and traffic as I'm getting up. Morning and evening routines are easy to set up. Display screen is just the right size (I don't watch videos on this, why would you?). When I remember something that needs to be done mid day, I just say it out loud and Alexa adds it to my to do list. Great Product.

author: Paul
title: Rotating home cards
content:
Got my spot today. Set it up and tried disabling the trending screen (I don't care about any of those topics) and after googling it, I find out you can't. I this is a huge issue to me. I only want to see my time and if I swipe I see my weather. A disable the screen change would be greatw.

Update: I’m not sure why the home card disabling didn’t do it the first try but after turning off every card the screen will no longer change which is awesome. Amazon did try and contact me to inform me on how to do this but I was at work. Great customer care and so far bullet proof product. (Still hoping for a wink update for “Alexa what lights are on?”)

author: smcahee
title: Try ‘Alexa, disable things to try’. Oops can’t do that.
content: An OK device although setup requires typing your password using a tiny on-screen keyboard. This is no small feat when you’re almost 50 and you use a password manager with a complex password. My biggest beef however  is the inability to disable the cycling of what are essentially ads for the Alexa/echo voice service. “Try, Alexa what are your popular skills”. “Try, Alexa give me a prank”. “Try, Alexa give me a haloween sound”. “Try Alexa, pretend to be a superhero”. I really don’t want to see this stuff and it makes me wait to see the stuff I do want to see. There’s currently no way to turn these suggestions off.

author: Nurselove02
title: So many great features.
content: I love my new Echo spot. I a also have an echo dot. The screen on the spot is a great addition to the features. I like how all the lyrics show on the screen. Made a group of my devices so now I can play music upstairs and downstairs for an awesome surround sound effect.

author: Nobody777
title: Great device!
content:
Quality piece of equipment.  Works beautifully for virtually everything.  Great features, great design, great picture quality and excellent sound!

I do have a complaint... When using the device for "drop-in" calls, the quality is often marginal or poor audio.  Sometimes we can barely hear the other party, even with the volume at full.  Not sure why this is occurring.  Sometimes it works nicely but most of the time the drop in calls have been sub-par, sadly.  Hopefully they will improve.

Also wish this had two extra things... an extra USB port and maybe a battery backup.  Since this is intended to function as an alarm clock replacement, it seems a USB port would be a good addition (heck, maybe even two), so that you can charge your phone by your bed as well.  A battery backup would also seem like a natural addition to a device like this, but perhaps it's not necessary.  I suppose as long as you are logged into your Amazon account, perhaps it remembers your device settings...  I do not know.  At the very least it would be cool to have a battery to keep the clock working in the absence of power.

Overall GREAT device.  Very happy with our purchase!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love It!
content: Opened and set up in less than 10 minutes! The echo spot is so fun and so helpful already. Easy to integrate with my calendar, watch movie trailers, look up business hours and so much more! Great purchase :)

author: Kraig
title: Excellent alarm clock and Alexa device
content:
Works great. Fun, interactive and useful. Great features. Well worth the money. Besides the Echo Spot I also have 2 Echos and a Echo dot.  If you have 2 Echos within the sound of you voice the rings on each will light up but only the Echo closest to your voice will perform the command.
Very cool. Highly recommended

author: jerobins
title: Very Dissapointed & Unreliable Alarm
content: I bought the Echo Spot so I could have a good alarm clock set to steaming music but I quickly realized that there was something wrong with it. I set my alarm for 4am and it goes off and is supposed to “according to Amazon” play the radio station continuously until I tell her to stop.  Some mornings it plays for 7 minutes, other mornings it plays for 20 minutes and sometimes it even snoozes and come back on without prompting. I complained about this several months ago and did all the troubleshooting and yet the problem still exists. Now they have dropped the ball. The Spot does not have the answers to simple questions like my first Echo. It needs to go back for better software.

author: Tammie S. Brewer
title: Love the Screen!!
content: Love the Echo Spot!! I'm replacing all my dots with this product. I love the display and sound quality.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Sound is pretty good. A little disapointed with brightness of screen ...
content: It''s everything Echo should be. Sound is pretty good. A little disapointed with brightness of screen in awake mode.

author: Stacey Norman
title: I love the spot
content: I love the spot! I have the dot, but the spot does far more!  Great picture and sound quality! It's so great to be able to video chat with family and friends as well as watch videos and so much more.

author: Toni
title: Amazon Products Rock
content: I now have quite a few of the Amazon Alexa family of products, but this one is right up there as my favourites. Such a practical addition for the bedroom. Love it!

author: MV
title: This device is cool!
content: Aesthetically, this has a very awesome look, touch and feel.  The fact that it can also do everything that Echo does is mind blowing.  Not only does it wake me up, it tells me stories, reads me the news, tells me the weather, turns lights on and off throughout the house.  It plays music, and I have not done it yet, but I'm looking forward to its video chat abilities.  I know that I'm sounding a bit geeked out, but seriously I'm in love.  I was buying a replacement for my broken alarm clock, and got a whole lot more!

author: Amazon Customer
title: It's amazing and well worth the price
content: I'm giving this to my son for his birthday and I can't wait to see what he thinks about it! I opened it and set it all up for him and have tested it out and it's all ready for him to enjoy. From what little I have tried it it's awesome and worth 5 stars for sure! For anybody contemplating buying one just go for it! I choose the payment plan and I'm only paying $22 a month so it's not all coming out of my acount at once! With Amazon your guaranteed to like it or your money back so as long as you have $22 just buy it! I promise you will not regret it. It's a great price for what your really getting.

author: Cory F.
title: I love it!
content: I love it. It does everything I ask it to do. I did buy the stand for it. 8 use it for messaging and music as well as weather updates and the drop in feature on my house for security and also the calling feature to connect with friends and family.

author: Mary
title: Love the size and look
content: Still early days of using the Echo Spot but I'm enjoying it.

author: Warren Myers
title: Another great gadget
content: Great product and quality item overall. The screen is vivid, easy to setup, and as usual, alexa wins again.  Would purchase again for my living room.

author: kimberly Grant
title: Just ok.
content: I only want one thing: to be able to snooze for 10, 20, 30 mins without speaking. My clock radio snoozes 30 mins with 3 taps, but spot has to be tapped every 10 mins. Sound quality is good. Why cant you video-call amazon support on a spot?? You have to call on a cell phone. Someone didnt think that through.  Video plays in a square instead of round view - disappointing. My iphone has bigger screen. I thought echo dot was so good that spot would be even better. Not yet! Maybe a few more generations.

author: Paul E.
title: Spot on-ish
content: Would love to figure out how to turn off the scrolling and just leave it on the clock face except when using it for another function. Other than that it would get 5 stars.

author: Trish B
title: I’m a little mad at it
content:
I bought the Echo as a primary tool to voice automate my Sonos sound system; unfortunately, that task have been quite difficult to achieve. After reading reviews of the Sonos skill, I’ve found I’m an one of many who are having issues with the skill.
My kids love to play around with Alexa by shouting out various commands and inquiries, to which she handles well.
I’m hoping this learning curve won’t last long, making the Amazin Echo more enjoyable.

author: lee joyce
title: Overall I love it. The sound is a bit wimpy as ...
content: Overall  I love it.  The sound is a bit wimpy as a lot of their products are, but everything else is great and easy to use.

author: Duke Demchuk
title: Too small of a screen.
content: I like this amazon product. It’s smart  and small.  I had it by my bedside for the longest time, and now since I got my echo show 1 and 2 the spot is going to my kids room.  I can now look in on them to make sure they are ok.  I have a nanny cam in there too but this is better for a smaller room.  I like to watch my cameras from my bed, this video was a tad too small.  So I’ll give it to my babies and maybe they will enjoy watching daddy live!  Till now they only had a dot, daddy and mommy are watching!! They have to behave now right? Lol right. Would have given it more stars if the display was a little larger.

author: dawnmarie
title: I don't normally like to use this word but I believe Alexa is stupid
content: This is definitely not what I thought it would be Alexa is definitely not helpful whatsoever I actually get mad at it more than I'm happy with it if you just want to listen to music and that would be all it's good for

author: JT
title: Five Stars
content: Best Echo device ever. Kids loved to play with it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Get it!!
content: Love this item!!! I love Alexa!!!

author: Sonny
title: (I've spent more in a few hours at the club or about half as much for a good alarm clock that won't do a quarter of what ...
content:
Wanted to take a moment to address some of the negative feedback on the SPOT...
I'll venture to say 95% of these peoples problems are USER problems. In other words, Operator Error!!!  Amazon is and has been quick to address any real problems...
At 2 Dots and a Spot... This stuff is amazing people, simmer down and figure it out!

Ok, OK, its a little pricey... Bought mine on sale. (I've spent more in a few hours at the club or about half as much for a good alarm clock that won't do a quarter of what this thing does) And, i will say this... the features are awesome, the screen is great. its such a nice addition to my night stand beside the bed. Changeable faces, the auto dim feature is great, its simply COOL and informative at the same time.
LoL buy the damn thing, you wont regret it... (buy the stand too)
Now at...
2 - Dots ( I use command strips to adhere these to the wall, works Great! )
1 - Spot ( buy the stand )
1 - Google Home ( awesome )
Thank you Amazon, the future is Finally here

author: Angie, RN
title: If you think you are going to be disappointed, think again!  Alexa lives up to what you think this technology should do.
content:
Really, this thing is the bomb!  I have hesitated to embrace Echo.  I love Amazon and love everything about Amazon, but I find these products usually disappoint.  Like Siri, great idea, but she is just so limited and 1/2 the time she has no idea what I want her to do.  I find the pitch of my voice usually doesn't work with voice recognition products.  For example, if I call Walgreens to get a refill prescription, I usually have to press all the buttons instead of talking to it, because it gets confused.
Part of my problem with Siri and voice prompts is that I want to go too fast and they want to go too slow.  I can usually go through the prompts faster than listening to the device say everything, and I usually want to use the speaker-phone as well, that creates some delay.

Alexa is totally different.  In fact, we talk about her, so we have to call her "the one who won't be mentioned" because even eavesdropping on our conversations in the kitchen she will respond.  You don't have to talk loud to her, she just hears you.  The hardest thing for my husband to adjust to is when talking to Siri, you have to wait for Siri to respond.  With Alexa, you just say what you want.  You don't have to get her attention with "Hey Alexa!"  You just say, "Alexa drop in on Nathan's room" and instantly you are in a speaker conversation with your son upstairs.  The quaIity is nice!  No one has to raise their voice to speak in them, just a natrual voice conversation.  I actually bought these to be an intercom system in my house.  If you have ever priced out an intercom system it is incredibly expensive!  Also, all the reviews on Amazon are horrible for every intercom system available except for Nucleus, which is $100 bucks a room.  For years I have been looking for something.  We have a landline cordless phone system in my house that I have been trying to use, but it rings in their rooms and they typically ignore it instead of answer it because they don't even know how to use regular phones anymore!
For $30 bucks a room you get all this...
-Drop in on your kids' room, you can hear everything they are doing!
-Call your kids down to dinner without yelling!
-Really!  No more yelling in the house, no more "COMING!!!" response.  Just "hey, dinner is ready... ok mom, I'll be right down."
-No more excuses about why they need their phones in their room at night.  Dots can just play any playlist they have in Prime music, Spotify or Pandora.
-No more excuses about why they need their phones as alarm clocks.  Dots can set alarms.
-No more excuses about why they didn't turn their phone in at night.  You can set a reminder to tell them to turn their phones into your room at 9pm!
-If you are in your room at night and you can hear they are still up, you can drop into their room and tell them to go to bed.  You don't have to get up!

Plus this thing does millions of other things!  In the kitchen, we have the Echo Show.  The speaker quality is good.  You can have it play any music you want.  "Alexa, play some dinner music" and she picks a nice play list.  "Alexa, play some calm music" and she picks a relaxing playlist.  "Alexa play the Hamilton soundtrack" and she pulls up the soundtrack and plays it, while displaying the words.  What could be easier???  I really wanted the Show for recipes in the kitchen so I didn't have to go back to my computer in the office (I know, lazy!).  You can say "Alexa, what can I make with chicken and spinach?"  And she'll pull up recipes and even videos of the recipes.

Speaking of lazy, this thing is great.  I have the Spot in my room.  When it wakes me up in the morning I ask it to give my the daily briefing.  It tells me what is on my calendar for the day, what the weather is like outside, what the top news of the day is and what the traffic is like to work.  The only thing I wish it could do that it doesn't is have a battery so I could take it into the bathroom with me in the morning and listen to all that while I am getting ready.

Literally, we have had this for 1 day in our house, so I know it can do way more than those things, but for just that it was worth the investment.  Today I ordered 2 more dots.  One for my office and one for the basement.  Now, in every room I can have Alexa do things for me.  We don't have any smart lights or appliances, but maybe we will get some.  I can tell it to add things to my todo list as I randomly think of them during the day.  I can tell it to add things to my shopping list as I am looking in the refrigerator.  I can put things in my Amazon cart as I walk around the house instead of running to the computer and adding it to my cart.  Literally, I do almost all my shopping (outside of groceries) through Amazon, so I love having this handy device.  You can even order through Alexa.  I just like putting things in my cart and reviewing it later.

On the Spot specifically, the graphics are nice.  When it does the daily briefing it actually brings up the CNN anchor in the display.  It randomly shows things like the weather.  You can do voice/video calls with it.  The video between the Spot and the Show is nice.  For the money though, the dots work great in the kids' rooms.  I don't really need to see them.  I just need to speak with them without yelling!

If you are hesitating or on the fence, get one.  I can't believe I waited this long!  The technology has finally caught up.  It really works!

author: Barbara A.
title: For the most part I am happy with my Echo but find the setup confusing
content: For the most part I am happy with my Echo but find the setup confusing. I have 3 echo devices and even though i have the box marked to drop in on all 3 none of it works.  Just get the same answer that they arent in my contacts.  It doesnt explain how to add a contact to it.  No customer sercive either. Just get the ..go to the help to get instructions.  Good luck with that.  The music function works great though.

author: Donna Tesi
title: Love it
content: Nice

author: Momma Jess
title: Buy it.
content: The sound is awesome and I love that I can just tell it to set an alarm. We use it everyday.

author: Patrick Robertson
title: Fun addition to echo family
content: It's a fun little gadget, didn't expect the screen to be so small, going to upgrade to an echo show eventually

author: Sue
title: Alarm clock
content: I use it as an alarm clock. I wish it had battery backup in case the power goes off. I like that I can  wake up to soothing sounds, and ask for the weather before I get up..

author: Michelle
title: Love It
content: Can't say enough good things about this, absolutely love it.

author: Aly Berquist
title: I am really really happy with my purchase and glad I have it
content: I thought this was going to be an overpriced alarm clock. But in the end I use it almost every day. I use the check in option to check in on my pups while I am working and I can ask Alexa anything for a quick answer. I am really really happy with my purchase and glad I have it!

author: Steve J
title: An Elegant and Compact Delight
content: I bought the Echo Spot as part of a Ring Doorbell bundle, thinking that I might as well try it for just a few dollars more than the price of a standalone Ring Doorbell.  Configuring the Ring integration was a breeze.  But that was just the beginning.  Adding a video component to the Echo added a whole new dimension to the Echo/Alexa experience.  When playing music, you can read the lyrics on screen.  Helpful hints, the latest weather and news alerts all unobtrusively appear on screen, providing an additional level of interactivity.  I have yet to use any of the Spot's camera functions, but that's next on the list.  I heartily recommend the Echo Spot.

author: Chicken mom
title: The BEST.
content: People complain too much. There is nothing wrong with this device. You can set the screen as bright or dark as you want. The screen goes dark automatically when the room is dark and quiet, so the "glow" will NOT ruin your sleep. The alarm is easily dismissed or put on snooze without having to raise your head from the pillow, or even opening your eyes, if that is your wish. Alexa can hear, and understand you in your most grogy incoherent morning self. If you can't see the screen without your glasses near, or across the room, just ASK Alexa... what time is it? What's the temperature in the room or outside? Ask what the thermostate is set to before you dare let your big toe out from under the covers. Have Alexa turn off your TV instead of fishing for the remote,  because you know, any movement you make will take you out of that "almost asleep" state. If you want, Alexa can even read you a bedtime story. Now, COME ON! Even your mom won't do that anymore.

author: Lillian Thomas
title: Fun for kids and compact
content: My kids like the Echo Spot more than the original Echo because of the screen.  They like reading music lyrics or seeing the different images shown by Alexa.  I wanted the spot to replace a large stereo and clock in my office.  I would like the option to have just the time shown on the screen when not in use but it periodically shows the time in a small font with the weather or suggests questions for Alexa.  Maybe I have a setting wrong by I can’t figure it out.

author: Ann M. Dodds
title: Great alarm clock plus.
content: Overall, I like it very much. It is the perfect echo for bed side. I would be giving more stars, and may be rating too low, because it periodically disconnects and at times appears not to be robust enough to handle my smart home connections that are handled easily by the echo plus. I sometimes have to repeatedly give commands for the action to occur (such as turn out all lights). Again, in general I’m very happy with it as a bedside/clock-assistant.

author: J Picchi
title: Five Stars
content: Love it.

author: D. Bell
title: Works great with Ring doorbell
content: Got this to display whomever rangs the doorbell. Works great. (Better that the Ring Pro works)

author: Eric -K-
title: Don't use your amazon card expecting to pay with installments.
content: Be aware that if you select the box during checkout requesting to be billed in six installments on your amazon card, you may be billed for the entire purchase instead. Amazon won't resolve the payment method but instead requests that you return the perfectly good item and order it again, which isn't an option because it was on sale for $99 and now is back to $129.... Seems like a payment scam....Stupid.

author: JW Wright
title: It works, but
content: I like this little guy, but I notice that most of the time you get messages showing you tips about other things Alexa can do.  I did put a favorite picture on the screen.  I only have one so I have not figured out how it works with Alexa for video from other devices yet, but I like the way it puts information on the screen.

author: Gadgit Tech
title: The Spot is a nice upgrade if you already have the Echo dots.
content:
I like this little unit and a good addition to my other Alexa units, I already have 4 dots with two of them at over 2 years old. I mostly use Alexa for controlling my Automation system, streaming music and occasionally some news and now with video chat drop in is cool.

What I like about the spot is that I now can play music and see the album art plus the artist and tune being played.
Also, if you manual select with your settings for automation you get a slider to control your basic devices.
If you already have Echo dots, the controls are all the same for the most part.

What I don't like:
It has been said that you can turn off the "Try and ask Alexa" suggestions, I don't need it and have followed others suggestions to stop it, but... There seems to have been a change to the settings within the "Home & Clock" option... Mine shows no "Homecards" rather "Home Content" I assume this was a change, but wait it doesn't stop there...  Instead of "Rotate Once"... mine only shows "Rotate Continuously" with a slider for on or off, and guess what? my SPOT rotates the "Try and ask Alexa" anyway, regardless of what this setting is set for and this includes turning off all displayed content!
BTW, you might think you have solved the rotation of this annoying problem (it will lessen the frequency.. yes), but it will change and it might take awhile so you will need to wait some time to catch it changing, it might happen within a minute or it might be several minutes and this is without touching it or using commands such as the wake word. It will change and/or rotate the suggestions to "Try and ask Alexa" message. I have done all the suggestions that have been posted, I don't think I missed anything and yet the problem is still there and unfortunately if you do want weather or some other content to rotate you will also get the annoying message as too!

Amazon, is it not enough that I get a 10-20 emails a week and can see the opening screen on the app "Try and ask Alexa"?

Besides this issue so far I like the unit and will probably buy another one when they are under hundred bucks.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Sweet
content: Pretty cool

author: Kayro
title: Beautiful display
content: I keep this on the nightstand to view feed from my Ring doorbell and indoor Wyze Cam. Plus of course all the other things Alexa can do! Yes, you can turn off the video so you're not seen!

author: Grimjeeper77
title: Yep, I bought another Echo...
content: I love this thing! I have it on the nightstand next to my bed. I use it for my daily alarm clock. I also use it as a nose machine when I'm going to sleep at night. The possibilities and abilities seem to be endless. I've only scratched the surface on what I can use it for.

author: George Daniel Grenville
title: Basic Alarm clock fearure missing
content: All good except ... a basic alarm clock function is missing. There appears to be no way to turn off the wake up alarm non-verbally (as my wife is still asleep and I get up first) without cancelling all recurring alarms.

author: Frances N.
title: Wonderful gifts
content: Love these Echo spots.  Bought seven of them for Christmas gifts. We can all connect.

author: Joan
title: Privacy concerns with Alexa and all Echo Products
content:
I love it but recently I am concerned that Alexa is listening to conversations in my home.  Most of you have have read/seen the example of a Portland, Oregon couple who had a private conversation recorded by Alexa and sent to a random person in their address book.
I just got on the Amazon website and saw that Alexa had ordered "butter to the ghost"  Thankfully there is no such product but Alexa thought I was ordering something.  Must have misintrpreted a conversation in my home.
With Amazon Prime and one click ordering anything could happen.  I'm cancelling one click
The Echo is unplugged except when I want to listen to music or a podcast.  It's not worth the invasion of privacy to ask what time it is, what is the weather forcast, set a timer, etc.
I also unplug it when I am on the phone or talking in my house.

author: FAD
title: Please!
content: Rating totally based on inability to turn off “things to try” fix that and perfect.

author: Judith Soderlind
title: I love the Echo Spot. I use it to call family, make forgotten recipes & play games. ALEXA is SMART!
content: I have NO dislikes for this as Amazon continues to broaden the range for Alexa!

author: Stephanie
title: great device
content: good device. however, the volume is very loud, tried to set it but still increases every so often. just an fyi- you also need to get add ons for certain things such as music.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazing technology. So smart it’s a bit scary
content:
Amazing technology. So smart it’s a bit scary. I use my echo each morning as an alarm as well as to catch up on the daily news around the globe. The speaker is perfect. Packs a lot of punch in such a little package. Loved it so much I purchased one for each family member!
Only downside...we are an Apple household and Alexa, understandably, doesn’t sync with iPhones.

author: Suzy F. Deger
title: Very easy to set up - great little device
content: I love this thing! The only suggestion that I would make is can you give a few more options for a wake word? We have and Echo, and Echo Dot and now an Echo Spot. I would love to be able to wake it with "Spot". Can you add that to the programming?

author: stones
title: Five Stars
content: Great product. Good styling.

author: Michele A Newby
title: Five Stars
content: Love my new Spot!  Nothing like telling her what to do without lifting a finger!

author: Joe S.
title: I love my little Echo Spot
content: I love my little Echo Spot, I have replaced my older full size echo with this little guy. The round screen is an interesting choice and I'm not sure I like the look but it is growing on me. The speakers could be slightly louder but all in all it is a solid echo product.

author: C. Flowers
title: I like it but I don't love it
content: I almost which I had returned it. I have 3 stars seem a little harsh but 4 would be too many. I can't put a finger on what it is about the Spot that bothers me exactly. I will say this, if you want to picture and don't; have room for the Show the Spot will suffice but if you have space and can swing the extra $$ go for the Show especially now since they have a new version. I really want to upgrade my Show for the latest version but that's another review. I will say this, and I will admit I am a little bias, I don't believe you can go wrong with any of the Echo devices, it's just a matter of selecting the style that's right for you. For the past couple of years, Echo has been my go to gift idea with great success and it has always lead to the gift recipient making additional purchases.

author: Vankfire
title: Just not smart yet.
content:
Echo crash the Wyze app every few min. and sometimes do not connect to the camera, the Spotify app also stop from time to time.
Cannot Google stuffs like flight schedule, Wikipedia and several other sources.
You cannot personalize the name (only have 4 pre-defined options from Amazon and Echo is not one of them) .
The good thing is, you can some wifi devices like Deebot Vacuum Cleaner, power plug, light, etc...

author: Joe Matthews
title: If you are looking small smart device its great
content: If you are looking small smart device its great.  Only complaint is the clock itself is not larger enough.  You can zoom in but it will not hold. Would be great if the digital clock could fill more of the screen.

author: FON
title: The Best Echo/Alexa Device Yet!
content: This is by far the BEST Echo device ever.  I got it to replace a clunky iHome Clock Radio. I don't know why I waited so long.  First of all the design is beautiful (Hey Amazon maybe rethink the Echo Show). The option to change the clock faces and use your own photos is great. For a little orb the sound is quite satisfying. Set up was easy just like all of the Echos. The fact that I bought it when Amazon had it on sale was just the icing on the cake. At first I didn't think I'd be using so many of the Alexa commands in the Bedroom but I am.  My wife loves the ability to play some soft music with a simple command while we start to go to sleep.  If you like your Echo or Echo Show, get yourself a Echo Spot especially for your Bedroom Nightstand!

author: Bettylou
title: Great little Echo to chat with your doggie!
content: I suggest getting webrouter system if you have have Wi-Fi issues in your home. Echo is easy to install. Little did I know that red button on the top with slash means Echo was muted lol! Thank you Tami from Amazon customer service for helping figure that out! We love that Echo can back up our arlo pro cameras, talk to mom and our dog if we are away.

author: JR-A
title: LOVE HER
content:
ALEXA will do it. Great product and gadget to have, easy to use and provides many features, my favorite is the alarm. Will buy again.
"J"

author: Francisco Javier Aguirre Urbano
title: You have your own personal assistant
content:
This item is so useful I can control my music, alarms , agenda, reminders, it tells me jokes, news, etc.

A perfect companion.

author: Amazon Customer
title: This has become the Kitchen Spot where it presents recipes ...
content: This has become the Kitchen Spot where it presents recipes, does the timing of things cooking, and all while doing background music.

author: Oscar
title: Un buen equipo cercano
content: Es un equipo muy útil, porque permite la visualización de ciertas cosas, tiempo, noticias, dentro de los Alexas, solamente que es para un ambiente pequeño, un dormitorio, la potencia del parlante no es mucha, pero bueno, es aceptable

author: Thrifty shopper
title: Love it!
content: Wasn’t sure how well Alexa would understand us, we have iPhones and sometimes Siri doesn’t understand and it gets frustrating. Alexa is the real deal. After we got the spot and liked it, I went on and purchased 2 echo shows and gave the spot to the kids. We have our lights hooked up and a camera in the baby’s room. Now we can see or drop in and watch or call them to dinner. Still learning all of the neat stuff. Wished we had gotten one sooner.

author: David Webber
title: A MUST HAVE
content: It's the best. Not to bright and e-z to read. I really like the sound quality. A MUST HAVE ON YOUR NIGHT TABLE!!!!!

author: Chapy
title: Great buy
content: Very helpful and I don't know how we made it without.

author: G. Boscamp
title: one of the most useful Amazon products I received to date. Looks great, works great!
content: Ive only at this a few hours and I love it! I had a dot by my nightstand before this and it didn't really cut it, this has touchscreen you can change the background (mine is my beautiful heeler doggo Lea). It cycles through with weather and temperature plus calendar and from what I can tell you can add more screens to it for added viewing features. If I has a second nightstand I would get another. Im glad amazon is finally incorporating touchscreens, they help a lot for usability.

author: Tipsypaddy
title: Great for the kitchen
content: This is great for the kitchen. It will read recipes step by step, I watch my prime movies while washing dishes, listen to music while I clean. It's really a cool little device. Would recommend!

author: Sharon
title: Still new
content: I'm still new to this but so far it's great

author: Megan A. Galle
title: You do not need a base for this item!
content: I just got this item a few days ago so I am still learning. I wanted to post a review on here because so many people posted reviews stating that you needed to buy the base. I have been using it for a few days and there is no need for the base. The sound quality is excellent no muffling or other things as people have stated in past reviews. Not sure if possibly Amazon made a few changes but I can tell you that the base is not only not needed but I had ordered one and it came today and it was the tiniest thing I ever saw and seemed to me that my spot would be top-heavy with it. It's getting returned tomorrow.

author: mark s renfro
title: This is probably one of the best alarm clocks ever made
content: This is probably one of the best alarm clocks ever made, but i would think it would have more clock faces to select from. Nice to go to bed with rain sounds to put you to sleep and the days news and weather to hear before you ever get up. Nice selection of alarm sounds and works just as well as my regular echo.

author: harborview.8
title: A smart desktop addition...
content:
Very easy to setup, took a bit of experimenting with settings to remove annoying hints and notifications but now I have it as I like it. The clock looks good and I have all the functionality of Alexa available. The speaker is passable for music.

Overall much better than the Echo Show which is little better than a somewhat expensive and not very attractive digital clock.

author: Chris S.
title: Not too shabby
content: Love it.  Decent speaker and decent video.

author: Victoria Tucker
title: Alexa, When are you going to take over the world?
content: I love this adorable AI piece sitting on my kitchen counter.  I can ask Alexa anything and get an immediate response...don't have to go to my computer!  She may take over the world, but I will have answers to all of my silly trivia questions, temperature outside, listen to my favorite song and so much more.

author: Salveesalad
title: The screen is nothing to get excited about.
content:
Does what all the other Echos do...listens and responds.  It sounds fine, listens fine, but I find the screen to be underwhelming.  It really has limited function, and when you use it for a camera integration, a widescreen view tries to fit in a round display...so it becomes nearly impossible to see.

If you want an Echo...stick with the other devices.

author: Jo Ann Johnston
title: That it’s very easy to set up and use instantly.
content: Currently we only use the spot for weather, music, an alarm, to seek answers to questions and time. We love it. The speaker is incredible and of high quality. We have several Sonos speaker and think the spot is comparable to them.

author: Lilmagil
title: Best purchase of the year!
content: Purchased this on Prime Day and I absolutely love it!  I had the Echo Dot on my nightstand, but I really missed a display. This is perfect and the speakers are excellent.

author: Martha Villanueva
title: Love my spot
content: Very nice clear and fun love the photo slideshow and I use it as my alarm clock and weather and reminder

author: RJ
title: Solid and stout with more bass than expected.
content: We were impressed with this little device.  Well made and solid. This is our 3rd Alexa device, our first spot and pleased with the sound quality.  We use it in our bedroom and play sleep music and use the clock with hand display.  The display is nice and dim allowing me to sleep undisturbed. We also stream music from our phones while in bed and works great, it eventually turns off without a timer and find it is within a reasonable time. not too soon nor long. We've had it for a couple months now and that is the extent of our use so far.

author: the guru
title: Every home needs one, even if only for the alarm clock and the jokes
content: So far I am loving all of the cool features and enjoy getting the daily emails from Amazon alerting me to new functions. It is scary how much the voice recognition software has come. Sometimes I ask Alexa to play some music, bam...music.

author: Gmoney
title: Awesome product
content: Great product... Loved it so much I got an echo dot for the living room

author: AlarmGy
title: This is a WINNER! An Echo Show shrunk to Dot size.
content:
I love my Spot!  I especially love the clock display. It allowed me to get rid of my bulky old clock radio and replace it with this really useful technology. I replaced a Dot and I'm so pleased. The sound is so much better and the display is so useful in the morning to display the weather forecast and mt schedule. It's like having an Echo Show shrunk down to fit on my night stand.
  My only complaint is that it wasn't available sooner.
  Privacy was my initial concern, but so far it hasn't been an issue. A warning though! On an incoming video call be careful what you select since you only have 10 seconds to select audio only after you accept a call before the camera defogs and your on camera. Also, be aware of your drop-in setting, as the default is for anyone to drop in.

author: Paleo Newbie
title: My favorite feature is being able to call his room after ...
content: I purchased this for my 10yo son’s room. My favorite feature is being able to call his room after his alarm went off and I know he isn’t up. I can see his bunk bed and yell at him to get up. Oh did I mention I’m at the gym and I know his dad hasn’t follow up on the alarm?

author: mamadoc12
title: Echo spot
content: Great to view what’s happening in a specific area of the house, announces my calendar, let’s you sing a long with a song you are playing. I bought a 2nd one!

author: Carl S
title: Overall I like it but later generations should have more functionality.
content: It's a great alarm clock and a good speaker for listening to Pandora.  Very nice design that's just a bit larger than a baseball.  I agree with others that the lack of YouTube is a big drawback as being able to watch video should be a key feature.  I like being able to get the weather, see my schedule, set alarms, etc.  I think the current price point is a bit high for what it does but makes sense in comparison to other Alexa devices.

author: Michael Vaughan
title: Need One in Every Room
content: Just set up my second Spot, and I am already thinking about where I'll put the next one.  One of my favorite features is that I can play the same music throughout the house on all my Echo devices.  The Spot's speakers are much better than I expected from the size of the device, and it's the handiest thing ever.  I want one everywhere I am.

author: Diane Rodrigue
title: You can get Great information from her wuickly
content: Great for me!  I love to let her play songs while I’m in my kitchen cooking. My grandkids have her play Disney songs. I ask for daily news, weather, and many other things. Love her!

author: JR
title: Beatifull !
content: I will use as a clock bed side, perfect size

author: The AR
title: "Things to try" needs to go away.
content: We've got several echo devices, and we are very familiar with all the things it can do. That I can't turn off the idiotic "things to try" from rotating across the screen is bewildering,  maddening and poor software design which earns an otherwise solid product a mediocre three star rating from me.  AMAZON, FIX THIS!

author: Lisa
title: Great
content: Great

author: Amazon Customer
title: My favorite echo device!
content: I have a dot, tap and just got the spot.... Absolutely love it. The only issue I have is not being able to turn off things to try... Don't need or want it, but this is a minor issue. Don't let it stop you from getting this. If you like your echo, dot or tap, you will LOVE the spot

author: Wandrwoman
title: REVIEW UPDATED! Still Adorable and Smart as a Whip!
content:
PROS: Small (~4") Echo device with excellent voice recognition, color touch screen and camera is perfect for small places like bed-side table or kitchen counter. Good sound and image quality for such a small device. Constant software updates allow for almost limitless possibilities for uses now and in the future. In fact, many criticisms of early reviews have already been addressed and corrected.

CONS:  Not many and those that exist are, for the most part, software related and fixable by Amazon in the near future or IMHO, minor. Keep in mind that although this can play music, display videos, and make phone calls, the Spot is not a high res TV, a large entertainment center, a high fidelity listening device, or a smart phone. Expectations should be based on the fact that the Spot is a 4" device with a 1.4" speaker and a 2.5" screen.

REVIEW UPDATE JULY/9/2018:
I still love the Spot. I use it for a bedside "smart" clock radio, and I am extremely happy with it.

What does it do? It wakes me up. It plays music. It displays the time. It answers questions, mostly about the current weather conditions.
