I don't use it to teleconference, watch movies or videos, or call people's cell phones. I have the camera turned off. It's on my bedside table....Yuk! No always on camera, thank you!

As suspected, Amazon has added enhancements and fixed glitches with software upgrades. Complaints about the home screen clock face? Now there are a huge amount of customize able choices one can select. You can pick a background pattern, photo, or color, the type of clock hands or digital display, and whether there should be a tiny window for the date.

My biggest complaint is with the music it plays. I often have trouble getting Alexa to play the music I want. One has to ask Alexa properly, in the correct order. You have to say, "Alexa, Play songs by Bonnie Raitt." Or "Alexa, Play songs from my Modern Blues Playlist by Bonnie Raitt." Asking "Alexa, Play Bonnie Raitt" might just get a "Sorry! There are no songs called Bonnie Raitt" response. Things can get far trickier when you want to listen to a particular symphony by Beethoven.

Another issue is that "Shuffle" is not random. The shuffled songs are always played in the exact same order, every time they are played.

ORIGINAL DECEMBER 21, 2018 REVIEW:

THINGS TO KNOW:

1) The Spot has four types of controls, which often overlap in purpose and function:

a) Physical buttons on the top allow you to raise and lower the sound, turn the camera on and off.

b) Voice recognition: "Alexa, raise the sound," "Alexa, show me the current temperature," "Alexa, play modern blues,"

c) Touch screen:
---Swipe down to reveal a settings menu. Spend at least a few minutes exploring this menu and filling in important information like time zone and your location. By going through each setting, you will be able to customize many if not most of Spot's offerings.
---Touch the screen when music is playing to see title of artist, various play functions, and lyrics if available.
---Touch the screen for "snooze" when the alarm is going off.

 d) The Alexa app which can be downloaded to your smart phone or tablet. This is not entirely necessary for the Spot.

2) If you want the Spot to do something, tell it to do it. If the clock is not showing on the screen, say "Alexa, show the clock." If you want to know the current temperature say "Alexa, what is the current temperature." If you want it to stop rotating the dopey "Trending Topics" screen say "Alexa, stop showing the "Trending Topics" screen."

3) The quality of the screen is pretty good but not so good that you will want to watch a full length video. It's good enough for video calling, looking at album art, reading lyrics, glancing at the temperature, following a recipe.

4) The quality of the sound is pretty good. If you consider yourself an audiophile and are looking for a top quality audio system to listen to The Emperor Concerto with Artur Rubenstein, the Spot is absolutely not going to do it for you. Also, the Spot does not sound like a Bose. If you want or need fabulous sound quality, get a Bose. If you want an all purpose, small device that sounds good, the Spot's for you.

REVIEW:
I've been looking for a bed-side clock radio for about a year and just couldn't decide on anything. Like Goldilocks, the choices were either too big/too small/or way too last century. The minute I saw the Echo Spot, my heart did a flip! It was perfect.

First of all, the Spot is darned cute...in a small, round, orb-stylish way. My bedside table has a rim around it, so I decided to purchase the Echo Spot Adjustable Stand - White which lifts the Echo up about 1 1/2" and allows the Spot to tilt forward and back.

Set up is a snap. You plug it in, and Spot comes to life. The touch screen lights up and Spot talks to you. You pick your WiFi from a list, enter your WiFi password, and wait a minute or so while the software updates. While waiting you stare at the Spot and admire its adorableness. When the software is updated, you answer a few questions and before you know it, you and Spot are going steady and Spot has become the boss of you.

To change settings you swipe down on the screen to see the settings menu. It is important to go into Settings and set your preferences.

For now, here are six digital and six analog clock face selections for the home screen. I picked an old fashioned analog clock face with a sweep second hand and a small window for the date. You can also use a photo for the home screen.

The home screen clock alternates with several other info screens. One shows the current temperature, the time, the moon phase, and name of your city/location. Another gives suggestions of things or "Skills" to ask Spot to do for you. Another, which I quickly turned off, announces trending topics. I just didn't find "Scientists find moth not seen in 10 years" something I needed to see or even know.

Tune In Radio (which is free) provides all the radio stations I like to listen to. I ask Spot: "Alexa, play 1010 WINS on TuneIn" and away we go.

My only complaint is that there is an obvious bias to sign one up for Amazon Music Unlimited. Some requests for songs bump up against an advertisement for this subscription streaming service. I have a Prime membership and an Amazon Music account. That should be enough for now.

For now, Spot and I are in our honeymoon period and nothing is going to get me down.

author: RPS
title: Nice but expensive
content: Very nice product with a sleek modern design. Works, much like original Alexa only with a display. Could have had more clock faces or a way to upload more. Its a great addition as a bedroom nightstand or office accessory. Price point at 129.00 is overpriced. Should sell around 79.00.

author: David G.
title: Pros and cons but overall probably wouldn’t purchase again
content: I have had this for a few months now and am not a huge fan. The screen is too small to see the video and there is no zoom feature. My biggest complaint is how often it randomly speaks. I have had this troubleshoot discussed with an amazon tech who did not have a true answer aside from “background noise”. This is not the case as it usually will be silent when it answers something random. I do like that I can view the video back for 24 hours and download for free though. That is a huge perk to not be charged service for.

author: Annie Challis
title: I'm An Echo Addict!
content: Love this I put it beside my bed so I can see the time clearly, put on an alarm and get everything else Alexa has to offer, now I have an Echo in every room of the house.  Can't wait to see what is next.  I'm never disappointed!

author: Larry Carlisle
title: Four Stars
content: Doesn’t work at all with Bluetooth speakers

author: YVETTE G
title: Love it!
content: Love my Echo spot. Need to order a stand. It was delivered on time.

author: Dan
title: Very easy to set up
content:
Very easy to set up, and very little packaging (the earth thanks you Amazon!).  A wonderful little product to own, the Echo Spot is a powerful assistant in a sleek, small, and elegant package.  I also own the Echo Show and the Dot, so this is the latest addition to my home system.  Most of my home now runs on voice command (lights, thermostat, fans, music, entertainment system, etc.) all thanks to these fantastic devices.

Pros:
Easy to set up
Easy to pair and connect to other Alexa devices and skill devices.
Regular updates
Vast array of features and skills
Easy of use

Cons:
Home feature-based skills require more precise commands
Commands are heard and ignored (rare, but it has happened a few times)
Visibility: the display can be tough to read at a distance (10+ feet, which isn't much of a con considering the screen size)

All in all, a great buy.  Would (and probably will) buy it again.  Good job Amazon!

author: Phyllis F.
title: I love my Echo Spot
content: I love my Echo Spot.  It's very good company and so intelligent!!  I am still discovering great things to ask Alexa.  I really like that I can call up any song or artist.

author: Erin McAlpin
title: Solid choice
content: I was pretty hesitant about keeping this for a while because it seemed unnecessary and is a little pricey, but I’ve enjoyed it so much I’ve started slowly building a smart home in my apartment! It works wonderfully as a bedside alarm clock/good for news and games and playing music. I will say the speaker in the dot and plus are better, as evidenced by my calling my friend on their echo dot and they said it was clearer to hear me through my dot rather than my spot. Worth the money, coming from someone apprehensive.

author: michael f. heltz
title: The future is now old man.
content: Home automation at its finest. Easy integration Fast Response all around pleasant experience

author: Amazon Customer
title: Unable to avoid "things to try".
content:
Nice product with one exception.  The "things to try" advertisement continues to appear on the screen.  I wasted over an hour trying various suggestions that I found, with no luck.  A chat with Amazon Echo support confirmed that the "things to try" advertisement cannot be disabled.

Web comments suggesting using the setting menu (both on the device ot in the app) do not work.

Sad that Amazon did not fix this.  I returned my Spot for a Dot,

author: TikiCat
title: Great if you want Alexa features and a clock display.
content: Really like the clock and update features on the Spot. Others complained about this but if you go to settings the display features can be adjusted. Works well with the original Echo device and the echo dots.

author: Catcher12
title: Functionality
content: One of my BEST purchases that I have made!!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love it!
content: Makes playing music so easy, haven't tried the other features yet. but I like that it shows the words of most the songs on the screen. Just wish it came with a manual on how to use it.

author: Hernandez
title: I love it. I can listen to music
content: Got this as a Mother’s Day gift.  I love it. I can listen to music.  I can start me day listening to the weather and waking up to my favorite song. There’s so much more it can do and I’m going to take advantage of it.

author: Stephen
title: Don't waste your time!
content: You need a Harvard law degree to operate this thing! It's going back very soon!

author: D. Heyman
title: An updated Chumby!
content: Makes a great alarm clock and convenient source of Alexa info. The screen is nice for weather and short clips, but you can't watch too much on it. I had a Chumby years ago, the Spot is what it should have become.

author: Will Sullivan
title: My Echo Spot was working just fine. After a month of using it
content: My Echo Spot was working just fine.  After a month of using it, it would no longer power on.  I tried to go through the process of replacing it but the item no longer appears in my Orders.  It is always plugged into a surge protector and the power supply is still good.  The same thing happened with my Echo Dot, though that one lasted a year before it refused to power up.  Has anyone else had this issue with any of the Echo products?

author: gigi
title: Put on your dancing shoes.
content: Haven't found anything that I don't like about it so far.  Using it a lot for music of my choosing.

author: J. Hand
title: Had I known then what I know now...
content:
I bought this to video interface with my Ring doorbell. It does and works fine. Everything Echo related it does fine.

But, the display and its incessant switching off the analog clock to display digital time/temp and then an Alexa Tip and Trick. There are other selectable things it will also rotate thru if you choose. However, you can't shut the rotation completely off.

Some places mention a 'rotate once' selection but m!ne does not have it. There's only a switch that is 'rotation'.

The annoying thing beyond displaying unwanted Alexa tips- I know where to look if I want to know something- 95% of them I don't care about or already know!

In addition, it appears when it would display something else, the clock face display dims and flickers. It is quite aggravating as it catches my eye because it looks like something is wrong with it.

Finally, I had it turn the display completely off and moved it to another less used room and brought the old 'can' Echo back.

Had I known it did this, I would NOT have bought it. The one consolation is I didn't replace the other three Echos with video units. Apparently, they all do this.

author: Jill D
title: Can’t turn off constantly displaying trending topics
content: Fun and works well. A few downfalls. I can not stand that the display scrolls information when not in use. I want it to have the time only. That part is very annoying.

author: strangeways
title: Failing as a communication device, great to play music
content: Got this for my folks to 1) play music in their kitchen and 2) talk to me on my Echo. Playing music is working great for them using mostly the Pandora app I set up and the local public radio station. It didn't take long to explain it to my mom and she has the hang of it. However, it is not easy to set up people to call. Amazon says that currently, you must have a smart phone to connect to so the Echo can use your contacts list. That probably isn't going to work for my parents. I don't want to do that on mine because I don't want to give it access. Hello, Amazon? IT WOULD BE SO EASY TO ADD PHONE NUMBERS USING AN AMAZON ACCOUNT, either from a device or whatever. I'm really disappointed.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I like most the statements about what echo can do that ...
content: I like most the statements about what echo can do that come on the screen.. what I like least is since we got echo our Alexa that we put in another  room ...  it only responds to one command and then won't respond to any others until shut off and then turned back on.. we have to turn it off by unplugging it and then replugging .. any suggestions

author: Reynaldo
title: Great product
content: Great product; I just wish I could call it to view the camera

author: The Beard
title: A must have
content: This little device is anazing still learning all the in’s and out’s but its easy to set up and plan to buy a few more for my crib!

author: Guohong Chen
title: it is very bad.
content: I paid for a useless box that requires extra money to listen to music. We bought only a useless box.

author: J. Boden
title: Love it
content: Perfect.  Better then I expected.

author: Travis
title: Great device
content: I bought this specific echo spot for my mother who is 3200 miles away. Hooked it up to my account to allow my daughters to see and talk to Grandma whenever they like. My mother enjoys it and has made life easier for her. I’m happy to welcome her to the Amazon family!

author: Frances R. Greenwell
title: It is a fun item. Learning new things daily that Alexa can ...
content: It is a fun item. Learning new things daily that Alexa can do. She does not know everything asked of her and you must use the right words to get her to understand, but it is a learning experience for me.

author: M. Brodtke
title: Love Alexa but needs more instruction on skills.
content: Love it except that Amazon needs a reference one cohesive link for a full user manual. I don't have hours to research websites. Plus, more instruction from Alexa on skills would be great. We often get the answer, "I don't know that skill" even though I've added it in the app. I.e. Kwikset or Pizza Hut.

author: Bryan Lewis
title: The sound is horrible, similar to a little transistor radio
content: I was really excited to get this but it is very limited about what is displayed.  The sound is horrible, similar to a little transistor radio.  A novelty item I cannot recommend.  I was bored with it after a few days.  I'd recommend getting a new ECHO.  The sound on those are great.  I have purchased 5 of these devices so far and love.  This is just an expensive clock.

author: P. Lio
title: A charming little buddy!
content:
So neat. I'm just loving it. It's another little window into the house and we can drop in as a home intercom system to let everyone know dinner is ready or the bus is here.

Brilliant and simple, Amazon has another winner here!

author: Inkqbus
title: If you have amazon you should get this!
content: This is worth it if you want a Amazon Show but have a budget. I like this a lot and use in the bedroom. I plan on getting two more, one for my daughter and one for the Lani.

author: ellmar
title: disappointed
content: can only answer certain questions like weather would like her to be like Siri

author: remington Brake
title: Amazingly does exactly what was promised.
content: Amazing little device. Seems to be alerted sometimes when no one is talking but besides being quasi hauntedu love it.

author: Jeanine F
title: Perfect little package.
content: I love this little guy and learn something new daily that it can do. Perfect Alarm and it’s night time light is so soft it doesn’t disrupt my sleep. And it doesn’t take up a lot of space on my bedside table.

author: Mary
title: OK but not great
content: We were excited to upgrade from the DOT to the Spot.  Our kids have the Echo Show and we thought video chatting would be fun.  We found that it didn't work as well as we had hoped.  The sound came out like you were talking in a tunnel and it had frequent interruptions.  We just went back to Face Time with them because it worked a lot better.  We returned the Spot - we may upgrade one more time to the Show, just to see if it does any better.  Otherwise, the features were great and we enjoyed the variety of options offered.

author: Tony
title: Five Stars
content: VERY cool. The screen adds a whole new layer to Alexa

author: Linda Kester
content:
I like how she can tell definitions of word, play games with me, recipes, be a timer, & tell me a joke when I need a smile.  But mostly read my audible books to me.
  What I dont like is when I have to rephrase a question so she will understand, often, several times.

author: Amazon Customer
title: easy to use. screen shows what you are doing. unlike the
content: it tells me the weather, the news. shows the words for most songs. great speaker. small foot print. can be used as a bluetooth speaker. much more.

author: Ashley G. Lowe
title: LOVE
content: You need one! It is fantastic. The speaker is loud, it is durable (i dropped it from about 3 feet and nothing cracked or happened).

author: Amanda Ross
title: Love it!
content: I’ve been waiting forever for mine! I got he white one since it matches my room. I love how you can change the background on the clock. I also like that it has a auto dim setting when lights go off. I use mine as an alarm clock plus my normal Alexa stuff like the lights and ceiling fan. Very responsive. Better speaker than the echo dot but not as good as the original echo. Overall, I’d recommend it. Love mine!

author: Michael
title: Worst echo device.
content:
I own an echo 2, show, 5 dot 2, and unfortunately due to a sale they had on these 4 spots.

Of all my devices this is by far the worst. It has a great deal of difficulty hearing you, the sound is worse than the dot 2, the screen is always too dim, and it offers no way to customize what appears on the screen other than a picture. And the worst part yet is that its shaped like a ball, so it's very easy to grab and hurl across the room when it malfunctions.

Use your money for a different echo. The alexa system is good, this device is not.

author: NAL
title: Beautiful and functional
content: Love it as it has video and plays words on songs and great time.

author: invisik
title: Love having the screen even if it is a little ...
content:
Love having the screen even if it is a little small.  Sound quality way better then Echo Dot, not quite as good as the big Echo.  Highly recommend.

-m

author: Amazon Customer
title: Annoying and creepy
content: Damn thing comes on at the weirdest times.  Makes me feel spied upon yet half the time when I ask a question like how to spell something or is this or historical question it can't answer.  Truthfully I swear at it a lot.

author: Thomas C.
title: Very nice device!
content:
This is a very nice device. I had to rename it to "Echo" so I could speak to it without waking up my Echo Dot devices, which wake up with "Alexa". I am a little disappointed (maybe because I am still trying to learn how to use it) that I can't seem to get the videos I want to play. News videos like on ABC, CBS, NBC, and so on. I guess I need to spend more time learning how to use it.

I want to make a video call, but don't know anyone who has one besides me. I emailed my brother, but he says, "We don't need anything like that," so no chance to video call with him. Sigh. Sure would like to video call SOMEONE. hahah!

Very nice device, though.

author: Fran N.
title: So far, its working. I wish Amazon would ...
content: So far, its working.  I wish Amazon would allow you to change wake up name, at least for the Dot, allow Dot and the Spot, Spot.  Not enough options....

author: A software developer
title: It looks nice, but the audio quality for calls is horrible ...
content: It looks nice, but the audio quality for calls is horrible on mine. The echo dot was much, much better. This one is unuseable for calling. It could be that I have a bad sample, though ... I havent looked into that possibility.

author: Janet Woodville
title: I’m a Big Time Superman fan So Uploaded one of my Justice League pictures 😎🌹🎊 Is have a much better onboard speaker then the echo dot
content: I just sr got mine. I got this to be my bedside alarm clock. The I changed the background picture. I’m a Big Time Superman fan So I Uploaded one of my Justice League pictures 😎🌹🎊 It has a much better onboard speaker then the echo dot. I highly recommend this and the echo show. I love the screen. It’s easier too ask for music too. Example: Show albums of Bruno Mars. And it brings up all the albums to scroll through. I prefer it this way. I am really loving this little Spot. I've got the alarm set to wake me up with our King Of Rock and Roll! Then for my background I've got my favorite Super Hero, Superman!

author: Karen
title: It’s fantastic to keep in touch with family
content:
Loved it. Met and exceeded our expectations.
We use it to keep in touch with our Dad and siblings.  It’s not intrusive to other people living in the household.

author: Airedale Mom
title: Love the echo spot
content: Love the echo spot. I’m still learning a lot about it but so far it’s a great thing to have and enjoy. I bought one for our middle daughter who really enjoys her a lot and we bought one for our youngest daughter who will I’m sure enjoy it after Christmas.

author: Brianna
title: Randomly stopped working.
content: My spot has been sitting on my vanity for less than a year, I use it everyday when I’m doing my makeup. It has never taken a fall, I have left it plugged in since I got it. I woke up at this morning and it won’t turn on, I tried moved outlets, unplugging the cord from the back, I even tried resetting it. Still nothing. I’m sure amazon won’t be able to do anything about it as it was purchased at the store not through amazon directly. There’s no reason for something this expensive to just randomly stop working less than a year later.

author: D. S.
title: Great Item - I could give it a 5 Star, But----
content: I would give this 5 stars if it would stop the annoying messages that pop up every time  you go past it.  I originally bought one to replace an alarm clock.  It functions well as a clock with voice activation of setting alarm, waking to music, etc.  If you are a Prime member you get a limited amount of music choices, and they are enough for me.  I purchased two, one for the bedroom and one for the family room.  Gradually I'm learning more things to do with Alexa, and have since purchases smart plugs to turn on and off lights.  I also purchased a dot for my office.  Alexa's screen is sufficient and I now have her connected to my Ring camera, so i don't need to go to my smartphone app to see what's going on.  Just one caution:  Don't call Alexa "Siri" - like all women, they get a little pissed and won't respond.  Looking forward to seeing other smart home products in the future.

author: J. P. Baldwin
title: best echo yet
content: Best echo yet!  It's compact and has a small screen that still allows you to see lyrics on videos you're watching and whatnot.  If you don't have the money for the Echo Show, but would still like to have video calling and the ability to watch movies and videos, get this one!

author: Wynne J.
title: Amazing! Love it. She does so much.
content:
0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player In love with Alexa and the echo spot is a great addition next to the bed for – alarm clock, general questions, awesome safe track app which allows 91 come to come to your house just by asking her, and will p in love with Alexa and the echo spot is a great addition next to the bed for – alarm clock, general questions, awesome “safe treck” app which allows 911 come to your house just by asking her, I can listen to my audible books and anything from Spotify or iHeartRadio or Pandora and she will Play my sons Amazon videos that come with prime On the screen just for fun! Also- can add anything to any list I create (to-do, groceries etc) and I can see it on my iPhone app. Also she puts on lullabies every night onto my Sonos. Really really happy with this purchase!
Ps. The screen is dusty because I haven’t taken the plastic it came with off yet.

author: Richard T. Raynor
title: Needs to learn more to be completely helpful.
content: Pretty cool for what it CAN do.

author: Douglas McKay
title: Spots Replaced Dots - Thumbs Up!
content: Bought two Spots to replace a couple of Dots. The screen adds a whole new level of interaction with Alexa. Loved that both Spots were linked to my account before I even activated them. Setup was a breeze; being able to use the touch screen instead of the Alexa app to link to Wi-Fi was much appreciated. The Spots have replaced alarm clocks in two bedrooms, and I love the fact that the display indicates when and what time an alarm is set. That was a major worry for me...not being able to tell if an alarm was set or not, but the Spot covers that issue. Could use some additional clock faces and I wish there was a way to permanently turn off “Things to try” from even showing up at all, but overall this is a very good device for a first edition.

author: Libra.Eclectic
title: Easy to set up and fun to use
content:
I absolutely love the Echo Spot! I bought this simply to try an Echo device. I liked the idea of having a screen, but didn't want to fork out $229 for an Echo Show without trying a less expensive unit first, this was a good choice.  I have to admit, I felt a little strange talking to Alexa at first, but set up was easy, and now I like it.
One of the first things I did was pair it to my Spotify. I also subscribe the Amazon music for $3.99 a month. My 9-year-old loves how he can ask Alexa to play his favorite songs. I already have another Spot in my cart to put in his room. We're looking forward to "dropping in" on each other when he's in his room and I'm downstairs in the kitchen. I used it as an alarm this morning, and I did have a small issue with "dismissing" the alarm while fumbling in the dark, but I plan to try and talk to Alexa tomorrow morning to ask her to snooze or shut it off, and we'll see how it goes. Overall, I'm very excited about this purchase, and I look forward to trying the other Echo products.

author: Shelby
title: Awesome, powerful device in a tiny package!
content:
We bought this as a companion to an Echo, which we already thought was great.  The intent was to use it as a much smarter alarm clock to replace another.  It has more than filled the bill for that (how easy is it to say 'Alexa, set the alarm for 6:00 am' and awake to a escalating mellow tone), but also offering all the other services of an Echo (turn on/off our entertainment system, play music, answer questions, weather reports, etc.).  Further, the drop in camera is a terrific way to monitor the room when we are gone.  And all this in a device not much bigger than a tennis ball!

Thanking about getting another for our other rooms!!

author: AGDG
title: AMAZON IS WATCHING!!!  The rumors are true!
content: When we first received this product, it was great.  However, about a week ago, the device served up a video advertisement around 10:30pm at night and scared myself and my family.  If you want to make sure you are protected and don't allow video directly in your home, the spot is not a device that can keep you safe.

author: dispoman
title: Easy set up
content: Easy to set up. Easy to use. Picture quality and sound are good. Has a very small footprint.

author: Jack R.
title: Easy setup.
content: So far I couldn’t be happier - we’ll see after the first power outage.

author: Jeff
title: Can’t customize home screen
content: Can’t change the home screen to the weather. The controls for home screen customization in the settings don’t actually work. If you’d like to turn off rotation and leave it on the weather / time, find another product. Otherwise, it suffices for the other functions.

author: Amber
title: Great product with some tweaking needed.
content:
This is a really cool product. A great start!

It looses 1 star because it doesn't have a battery. It needs to be plugged in all the time to work

It looses another star because Alexa struggles to understand us or plays the wrong music. Ie. We were feeling nostalgic and wanted to hear T.A.T.U. but no amout of speaking or spelling could get her to understand. She kept playing something awful called "Lettuce". Lol.

Another tweak I would love is to have Alexa speak to me in a British accent while still registering my speech as U.S. English but no stars lost for that. I posted something to that effect and it seems other people want this to so here's hoping for an update!

If you're a Star Wars fan, try these for a laugh.
"Alexa, I am your Father"
"Alexa, who's your favorite Star Wars character?"

And for bonus laughs ask her favorite color. Whoever writes these jokes for Alexa is nailing it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Local Radio Stations
content:
I dislike not being able to get local radio  stations. Most of the radio stations available in the Amazon Alexi app do not apply to DFW market place. I cannot get AM Radio Station KRLDS 1080 in Dallas, Texas (DFW)
Seems quite unusual not to be able to get  the major local radio stations.

author: SandyW.
title: You Can Name This Device Something Other Than Alexa!
content:
I love the Echo Spot. This bedside alarm clock size device can do what the
Echo Show can do. I was concerned because I already had a large Echo in my
bedroom that answered to “Alexa” like the other devices in my home. I was
concerned about having both devices answering at the same time when I discovered
that I had other name choices (not enough for me but just enough to avoid confusion).
I named him “Echo.” Now if I could only choose a male voice. I loved that I could link it to
my security camera and my new doorbell. So many more features. Don’t forget to buy the
stand/base. So many advantages to having that. Read the reviews. Highly recommend.

author: USA1
title: Should of bought sooner
content:
Really like the additional features.
Utilizing with my security system.
Clear sound and a small quality picture.

author: Elviraida Rios
title: It’s a great tool
content: Only thing I wish it would come with suggestions of what to ask Alexa

author: C. S. Gee
title: it's a fun device to have it's nice to have control over ...
content: As I said in my review of the Echo, it's a fun device to have it's nice to have control over my few smart plugs BUT man is Alexa stupid.  If you want smart searches try Google Home but if your goal is integration and linking to Amazon then get Alexa.

author: EHC45
title: Enjoy the display
content: Enjoy the display. Works the same as the Echo 2nd generation! Wish it had the sound of the 2nd Gen. but realize because of it's size, a woofer would be out of the question, that being said, sound of this unit is excellent..

author: Andrew E Morra
title: The small LED is fun and cute
content: The small LED is fun and cute, but not worth the extra money you'll pay over a dot. On the LED screen you can view song lyrics or even an Amazon Prime movie, but it's too small of a screen to enjoy.

author: Bryan
title: Great product
content: Our new favorite Alexa device. Love every night when the cow jumps over the moon.

author: BlackShadow
title: Definitely get a stand for it if you need more angles
content: Cool product, use it to check in on my dogs

author: Michele Raible
title: Echo spot is quite handy.
content: I like the fact that this unit is smaller than my alarm clock & performs more functions than my clock.

author: MZ
title: Really enjoy the clock face and weather for kids but wish ...
content: Really enjoy the clock face and weather for kids but wish it had more parental control features. Wasn't aware that kids could watch movies on it and not able to control this is really not what I expected from Amazon.

author: David Imes
title: Compact design fits easily in a small space
content: Am using this as a replacement for the clock radio in the bedroom. Decent sound when playing music. Compact design fits easily in a small space. The screen is easy to read and once configured provides great information on what to expect for the day.

author: alonso tintos
title: I would like to say that I love it
content: I would like to say that I love it, but I would like to be able to watch YouTube videos or reproduce my videos from my phone. That will be amazing.

author: G. Fleming
title: Great hardware. Annoying software.
content:
After the first day, I have to say this is a beautiful piece of hardware. As with all Echo devices you get much more than you pay for. Footprint is comparable to an Echo Dot. The device is hefty on ought to stay put on the table, feels rock solid, and image quality is beautiful. Sound quality is surprisingly good... not up to a full-size Echo, of course, but close enough for most puposes. I would be totally in love, if only...

By default, the display rotates through various pages, including clock, weather summary, ‘things to try’, and ‘trending’. Various other pages can be enabled or disabled, but this option is not available for these basic four pages. And that is a serious problem. Not quite a show-stopper for me, but a serious problem.

I was an Echo early adopter. I got one of the first devices out the door, and have acquired several more. Alexa runs my whole house, plays my music, tells me jokes, chats with me, places occasional phone calls for me, gives me the weather, and much more. I get frequent emails from Amazon suggesting additional ‘things to try’ and new Alexa features.

I do NOT want to wake up in the middle of the night, glance at the Spot on my nightstand, and sit through ‘things to try’ and ‘trending’ to see what time it is!!!

Admittedly Amazon does give you the option to stop page rotation entirely. There is an ‘only once’ setting that rotates through all the screens once only, then stops on the clock screen. But some of the other screens look useful. I can’t imagine that it would be hard to provide software toggles for ‘things to try’ and ‘trending’, just like the toggles provided for the other supplementary screens. And, yes, I know that Alexa is always evolving and getting smarter, but this has apparently been a hot-button issue for many disappointed users for a long time, going back to the early days of Echo Show, with no response from Amazon.

The ability to freeze the display on the clock is good enough for me, for now, but the device could be so much more useful with this one minor tweak!

author: Ken
title: Great video device
content: Incredible little device. We bought it for video chatting between us and our children. It works perfectly for that and does much more.

author: Sky Pilot
title: This device needs an owner's manual
content: I was very disappointed in the echo spot from the get go because there was no guidance as to how to set this up with my wi-fi, etc.  When I wrote a very uncomplimentary review for Amazon I was contacted by Amazon Technical Support and walked through some of the issues I was having.  Rachel was patient and helpful.  She emailed an extended list of things to try with Alexsa.  It becomes obvious that there really is no user's manual and so I raise my star rating from one star to only three stars.  Please, would it be so hard to produce a manual that would be of help to those of us who do not live in the cyber-world.

author: Samiam
title: Makes life easier!
content: Love my spots. Have one in my room and one in my son’s room. He is adjusting to sleeping alone, so we connect with our spots and he can see me and it has made the transition so much easier. And I can control his lights with Alexa!

author: CutieMinnie
title: ... the Echo Dots but this one is just so perfect for the night stand
content: We have the larger Echo Plus as well as the Echo Dots but this one is just so perfect for the night stand.  It works just like all the other Echo products plus a video option.  I can even see the video from my Ring Doorbell.

author: Stele Valen
title: Alarmed for student
content: Enjoyed and a gift to my grandson which he loved it since its he starts his college and at his dorm. It helps him!

author: Sophia
title: Unreliable
content: Works when it wants to.  Camera blocks on its own.  Too late to return it.

author: Joe Bailey
title: This is my favorite echo Device
content: This is my favorite echo Device.  I use it by my bedside.  It is a great bedside clock and alarm clock.  You can tap the screen to snooze.  Don't have to ask Alexa to "snooze 5 minutes".  You can watch videos, video chat.  Also like that when i play music it displays the words to the song.  It displays the weather in rotation with other information.  Great!

author: Mr. Dwayne Hood
title: Very nice needs Improvement
content: They should go back to the micro USB port to charge the spot as well as add a battery so you can take it as you travel and you can move it from room to room with ease spot on Amazon you made something nice but you need to do some upgrades and approvement and offer a trade-in to the customers that already brought it when you make the new improvements please add a battery and go back to the micro USB port for charging

author: Veronica Husak
title: Answers a lot of her questions
content: Granddaughter loves it!

author: Eric
title: Save your money, use your smartphone for an alarm clock.
content: It's an overly glorified alarm clock.  Not user friendly at all.  It keeps on posting useless skills the spot can do when it can't do its primary function well at all. It doesn't understand any of my commands for alarms when it comes to what I want it to play.  The clock designs are subpar and so are the alarm sounds.  Seriously, I don't need to be woken up to Alec Baldwin!  And it seems like the volume goes back up over the day.  I should also be able to set my alarms manually with more details and options like I can on my iPhone.  I usually like Amazon Echo products, but this one has too many flaws for the price.

author: Adventurer
title: Great next step for the Echo line
content: The Spot is a nice addition as it does fulfill a specific role/niche in the Echo line-up as a smart alarm clock.  It is an excellent bedside "smart home" companion but it is equally at home on a desktop.  I've been steadily adding to my Echo collection since I pre-ordered the original Echo before they became available.  The Spot is the most useful overall especially because it can easily be paired/connected to a better speaker so open spaces like a kitchen are also a good fit for the Spot.  The set-up is simple and seamless.  Generally, I think people who are disappointed or otherwise disillusioned with the Spot are so because they don't take the time to fully tailor the Alexa app and Echo so it can best learn their preferences.  If you want the most out of the Spot it does take an investment of time to set-up your voice profile, and learn about and try some Skills unique to the Spot.  There's just more to it than a basic installation and expectation it can do anything imaginable.  The challenge is to take the time to experiment with it a little to prevent a "now what?" moment.  It's not perfect, but I for one really like the direction Amazon is going in with the Spot.  I knocked off a star because the Spot would be perfect if the screen could somehow stretch from bezel to bezel.  It's not that it's too small to be worthwhile, but that little bit of extra screen would go a long way.

author: Andres Pineda
title: The second best in Echo family
content: I love this Echo Spot! it perfectly fits as my personal alarm. The video calls are also amazing, I was stunned when I saw the quality of the video, no lags at all. Highly satisfied.

author: Jason Kramer
title: What is my purpose?
content: Seriously, I can't find a purpose for this other than to buy more stuff.

author: DJSpiceMix
title: Best night stand clock!
content: I really like Echo Spot. I have the Echo Dot and Echo 2nd generation and this device is at the top of my list. The speakers are a step up from the Echo Dot but not as good as the Echo 2nd gen. The screen is very clear and responsive to touch without much lag. There are a lot of customizations you can make to suit your taste.

author: Keith G.
title: Five Stars
content: Very nice. It's fun to use and works well. Love the video calling features.

author: Michelle S.
title: Worth every penny.
content: I love this. I’ve had no complications or issues. It’s always paired with other brands without a problem. It’s also convenient.

author: Henry T
title: Can't disable video watching for children.
content:
I bought this for my kids. They use it for listening to music and video calling me (their father). Unfortunately, because there is no way to restrict video watching, they were using it to watch cartoons all day.

Consequently, even though we love it, we are unable to use it.

AMAZON, please add the function to be able to restrict video watching. There is already a "parental control" to limit the ages, but nothing that stops "G" rated cartoons from playing without limit.

author: Ryan M.
title: Awsome
content: Working great. It is hard to think of not having it now.

author: nikahobbs
title: So Far So Good
content: I love this little device. Not only do I love the on screen features but there seems to be a vast improvement with sound and voice recognition with this device from the original echo, and let’s be honest it’s so much sleeker and astheticly pleasing on my night stand than the larger more obtrusive echo!!

author: Jason Daum
title: It's a great alarm clock matched with Amazon music I love being ...
content: It's a great alarm clock matched with Amazon music I love being woke up with the music of my playlist and the news but on the downside it's not much of a video player but that's not what I use it for keep up the great work Amazon

author: Nu'Mom
title: I think I have fallen in love
content:
I think I have fallen in love!  Although the Cube was an epic fail, I think Amazon got it right with the Echo Spot. As an owner of all things Amazon Echo...(echo, echo dot, echo spot, echo show and echo tap), I feel like I can comfortably say, the Spot is the real deal!
The small profile but big sound is a definite plus. I like that I can use it as a bedside clock for my room as well as my guest bedroom (I did the 2fer deal). My company loves it. All the good music it streams, the news, and if you don’t mind squinting a bit, you can watch a good movie.
I wish Amazon would buy back all of my other Echo items (minus my original Echo) and replace them with the Spot.
If you were on the fence about purchasing, throw your hesitation out the window. You won’t be disappointed.  I Gar-On-Tee!! LOL!!
Last note:  As always, the packaging was stellar and the Spot worked right out of the box. So if you are considering a purchase for elderly parents or grandparents, they won’t have a problem figuring it out. Plus, it starts up with a basic tutorial. Good job Amazon.

author: frank
title: So far so good. I use This everyday for lights
content: So far so good. I use This everyday for lights, info and alarms. I haven't used the video features yet but I like the way it shows you the forecast when you ask about the weather.

author: moodiblues
title: Very Nice
content: I have the Eco Spot and Google Home. I love the spot for its display such as showing weather and lyrics while playing music. The Google is best for information but the Echo is easier to set up with home control devices.

author: brookestar98
title: Worked for a few months...then stopped working.
content: When I first got my Echo Spot, I LOVED it. It met all my expectations. After about 3 months, it started to have major problems. It would freeze in the middle of the night and the alarm would fail. I could tell it froze because it would have the time on the screen that it stopped working. When it appeared to be working, it stopped responding to my voice all together. I had to do a factory reset, hoping that would fix the issues, and it didn't. I know have to unplug it from power several times a day to try to get it to work for just a few hours. I am very frustrated by this, as this is not an inexpensive device. I do not recommend buying a Spot. It will work for a little while and then become a complete waste of technology and money. I am very disappointed, unfortunately.

author: papab1
title: Video Phoning is the Tip of the Iceberg
content: Cool little piece of tech...we’re still learning some of its functions and possibilities, but I can see some potential.  Even my ‘technically challenged’ wife already figured out how to video call our daughter.

author: DeltaTech
title: Not very useful yet, needs more useful skills. Screen is pointless
content:
Edit: upped the stars to three.I bought this as a gift for my Mother, It was constantly dropping connection to wifi,saying check the firewall, was hanging and crashing using the dropin feature, the problem turned out to be a bad router and not the Spot. I have two Echo Shows and had no problems with mine.
 The screen is pretty pointless and not used.

author: David J Gressle
title: Very easy to buy and use
content: Meets my expectations and requirements for this product

author: Bethany
title: DO NOT USE the PAYMENT INSTALLMENTS!  It’s a hoax!
content: Do not use the 5 installments for payment!!!!! This thing cost me $300 in the end! Customer service didn’t care, it was a nightmare!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Nifty gadget
content: This is pretty neat, actually. I mainly use it as an alarm clock, but also to play sleep music (you can set a sleep timer for however long you want) and for weather reports and to check my calendar. It doesn't drop internet connection like my Echo Dot does, nor has it ever started "talking" for no apparent reason. I also like the way you can set it to night mode and have the screen turn to black and the numbers turn red. I would have liked a larger variety of digital clock faces to choose from.

author: Quiettune
title: Sometimes seems to get stuck in certain skills{apps}
content: I think It''l be aa lot of fun in the long run. Using it as a radio/clock 90 percent of the time.  Had some recent vision issues and can't fine theat perfect clock face.  for some reason it dims out the minutes when using a digital theme.

author: granna
title: I love this Device
content: I love this Device!  I now have 2 in my home, one I've had for several months and I have no complaints.  Easy to set up and the sound is very good

author: HV
title: Purchased as gifts for several people
content: We purchased these for our parents for Christmas (total of 4) and they love them. These take up a lot less space than the Echo Show but have the convenience of the screen so you now temp, time, or what is playing (vs. just the dot). Nice compact design.

author: VectorRoll
title: Great smart device.
content: Bought it just to be my alarm clock, and now use it for a bit more. It works great. It's loud enough to wake me up. Plus it can hear me across the room with no issues & understands everything I say even with other sounds in the room. Love how you can customize the clock face. Also it's extremely help when trying to know certain things. It's a good addition to setting up a smart home.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It's exactly what I expected and has a little bit more
content: Easy setup accepted my smart plugs without a problem wish I could figure out how to get it to wake me up with my music and if it hasn't Auto dim feature I can't seem to find it it should have a bedtime dimming feature automatically built in

author: Amazon Customer
title: we enjoy this device.
content: much better than echo dot.

author: Adam H.
title: Meh.....
content: Works, sound is ok, screen is always very dim and cannot be seen from afar. Cool connectivity.

author: Hairsmybiz
title: Five Stars
content: Love this and so does Grandaughter.

author: Tiffany L
title: Smart!!!!
content: Love!!!!! I was looking for a smart clock that was small and compact. This Echo Spot is beyond anything I could’ve ever imagined. I have a house full of connected Echo devices and this has to be the icing on the cake. I can tell Alexa to preheat my GE WiFi Enabled Stove all from the comfort of my bed. Also love that I’m able to control my LIFX and Nest Products as well as arm ADT. Stop sitting in the sidelines and buy this!!!

author: MrFresh
title: Echo spot is great. Small enough to put anywhere and it turns ...
content: Echo spot is great. Small enough to put anywhere and it turns my lights on and sets alarms. Alexa is constantly impoving so what she can't do now, she will be able to do in the future.

author: Seventeensix
title: Sound is surprisingly good, better than the dot
content: My Daughter loves it - in her room watches nick shows on the little screen in bed occasionally, reads along with audible for school reading and listens to relaxation music to fall asleep and has set her own home screen photo.Sound is surprisingly good, better than the dot. She loves touching the screen to do stuff as well as the voice commands. With more features to come I think its a winner for a bedside device

author: J
title: Limited in tech, needs software work.
content: It Links to iTunes but won’t play music from it. It’s set up for a child using my account and still loads my contacts instead of hers. The software needs a lot of work. Seems like the echo products were pushed before a lot of thought was out into its purpose and use.

author: Warren Keller
title: Perfect for the nightstand
content:
I’ve had so much fun with this echo spot over the past few months and the footprint of perfect for my nightstand. The clock faces are big and easy to read, plus watch news clips, ask Alexa to show you a movie trailer or even use the drop in feature to video call with your contacts.

The sound is ok, could be improved, maybe a little more bass, but the overall volume is loud enough for a bedroom or kitchen. Alexa responds quickly, no hiccups here, the screen is bright, clear and automatically adjusts to the light in the room.

Again this is just what I needed for my night stand, I can set reminders, alarms and control all of my smart home devices with just my voice. With the help of Alexa I have been able to simplify my daily routines, and you can too with the Amazon Spot.

author: Naomi Flowers
title: Education comes in all forms...try this one today.
content: I love this little thing. It’s so helpful and effortless. I like being able to change my clock faces, and make calls with it. Technology is taking over so you might as well start with helpful product.

author: Dr. Drena
title: My new office assistant!
content:
I am a small business owner with no staff. With the Alexa driven Echo Spot, I feel like I've hired my first assistant! My Echo Spot keeps me organized, updated, and assistance when I need information that will help my day run more smoothly. I love my Echo Spot so much, I bought 2 more for my kids who love their Echo Spot too! I highly recommend this product.

Suggested improvement for future versions, make the Echo Spot wireless. 😊

author: Dalia
title: Amazing product! If you don’t have one you need ...
content: Amazing product! If you don’t have one you need to start now. Don’t even bother with google. Amazon echo is the best!

author: ELENA A JACOBSEN
title: Any info is available at no time!
content: My first Alexa! having so much fun!

author: Jennywren
title: Perfect for small spaces
content: Good for small spaces. I wanted Alexa’s in adjoining rooms, the problem is the Alexa spot one room over answers before my Alexa fire I’m talking to. With the small screen you have to scroll for full view. That could be improved. I ended up giving this to my son and I’m stuck repeating myself to the Alexa fire. This item responds better than the dot or fire Alexa’ but the show screen is much nicer. I would recommend the Alexa show if you want more screen use.

author: Lauren Hardy
title: Love it!
content:
Bought one in prime day and promptly bought another. This is my first Echo device and I absolutely love it. I work from home and its made keeping my schedule so much more time efficient.
I love that I have access to all my lists via my phone. I really use it for the most basic of things, but it saves SO much time for me. And its fun, too, we are contantly playing trivia and games!

author: adelaida
title: Echo
content: Love it my daughter was the one that told me to get it so I can see my grandson in California love the music an it’s perfect

author: Judy
title: Echo Spot
content: I have enjoyed my spot. I am having a hard time getting all my echo’s to communicate with one another. I have 2 spots that I cannot get synced together and the accessories ie plug in and light bulbs.

author: Juliana
title: Fun tech toy!
content: This is a nice little tech toy! I love asking for almost anything and getting it! Now if I can somehow figure out how to convince her to wash dishes.... :)

author: mzm
title: my 2 and 6 yr old girls love it.
content: This device is a winner. my little girls play their favorite nursery rhyme and enjoy talking to alexa.

author: Kathleen Bleakney
title: Love it
content: Love it

author: Winfried D. Letendre
title: Great replacement for my old alarm clock
content: Awesome replacement for my alarm clock. I had an echo in my bedroom and a digital alarm clock. This was a great replacement!

author: Paul Stone
title: Amazon Echo Spot - Great Night Stand Accessory!
content: I love Spot!!!  The only thing that would make it better is if the numbers on the digital clock were larger and centered on the screen.

author: George Yefchak
title: Nearly perfect alarm clock
content:
I'm really enjoying the Spot. I previously had an Echo Dot, which has moved to another room. The spot makes a great alarm clock, in particular because you can enable the "ascending alarm" feature which ramps the volume up slowly (starting from zero, with alarm message only displayed on screen). This is exactly what I've always wanted. I might decide to power the device through a small UPS in case of power failure, since (unlike a normal clock) it has no battery backup.

One major annoyance -- there's a bug in the app (at least the iOS version?) which prevents proper positioning and cropping of a custom background image. Regardless of how you set it up, the image is displayed way off to the side. I've reported this to Alexa support twice so far.

author: Sonora
title: Excellent little device!!!
content: I love it as a bedroom alarm and music apparatus, the speakers are pretty good for what this is intended for. I can also tell it to show me the view of any of my Blink cameras, and love that. If I had one wish, it would be that the whole screen showed me the video, not just the inner circle. If you don't have young eyes, the small circumference view is not optimal, especially if you need wear glasses.

author: Suessa8
title: Five Stars
content: Love this!!! I can have hands free conversations with others who have echos. I can ask it anything!!!

author: Ordinary Guy
title: High quality, looks great, very functional, and fun
content: I’m really enjoying this product, which is my first Aleksa product. I’d been looking for a long time for a replacement to my 1985 digital clock but could never decide on anything. This was it. Solid, high quality, looks elegent, intelligent dimming, and a great compliment to any decor. And, of course, the Aleksa aspect has been fun to play with. There are good news briefs, accesss to music, connected it with my NEST thermostats, etc. great product.

author: Charlie
title: We like it, but sometimes it creeps us out
content: We like it, but sometimes it creeps us out.  We will be sitting in bed, and at times it will just say, "I didnt catch that," out of nowhere... She is always listening.  But works as expected.

author: Helen
title: Easy to use & does so much
content: We LOVE it! from music, to weather, to trivia it's so easy to use and fun.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It sounds like it goes to parts of different applications
content: I have reset many times and it never works correctly.  It sounds like it goes to parts of different applications.  I ask a question, and can not get any response except the color circle.  Other times it will say random phrases like page 4 of three finger swipe across face of unit. I am sure that I am responsible for the problem.  I thought this a simple enter pw and plug and play. I will return unit if I can, this was a gift.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great way to call family when there is a need.
content: I bought the Spot to go into my bedroom.  Alexa is my safety item and my alarm.  I have a Show in my livingroom too.  My son can dropin on me either place to check on me.  I can also call him for help and he can see me.

author: kim
title: Nice. Easy to use
content: Very nice. Worth the money

author: Scott C.
title: Wish it were smarter
content: Cool device. Wish it was a little smarter. I use it mainly for my room light, alarm, nest camera and bluetooth speaker when I'm in bed.  Dropping in is useless be cause the camera aims up.

author: Palew
title: Echo spot
content: Love the spot, nice bedside clock. I really like the temp and time displayed. So many things I really like about The echo spot

author: erin rosalind griffith
title: Five Stars
content: Screen isn't too small it's really just right.

author: Wayne "Rhino" Levangie
title: Great addition to the Amazon Echo family...
content: After purchasing my Echo Spot to add to our other 4 Amazon Echoes...I am very pleased with the Echo Spot...I use  it with our Arlo Security cameras and Ring video doorbell and works without any problems...

author: Neil Q.
title: An echo dot with a screen.
content: Really like that this is basically a dot with a touchscreen.

author: Montano D. Quezon Jr
title: Alexa is useful
content: I use this for my tplink lights and wall sockets,  i love it it works with my dyson, ring and bose soundtouch. Next time I’ll buy the show

author: Joseph P
title: Love it so far
content:
Love it so far.  We have this in our kitchen, connected to a set of Bose speakers.

Pros: Easy to set up and works with several "smart" plugs and products.  Alexa has lots of cool features that we're still discovering.  It's also cheaper than the Echo Show

Cons:  The awkwardly shaped screen makes it difficult to actually watch anything, but that's not why we bought it anyway.

author: Christopher Broseker
title: If you have the space the Echo shows probably a better option because of the larger screen
content: I wish it showed the weather and time 100% of the time. If I can do that I’ll change it to five star. If you have the space the Echo shows probably a better option because of the larger screen.

author: H Paul Eldridge
title: You gotta get one of these
content: Perfect right out of the box.  Super simple setup.  Makes me even lazier...

author: blenbill
title: Four Stars
content: Would have given it 5 star-but for the electric cord needed.to operate

author: Susan Thompson
title: Highly recommend Echo Spot
content: I use Echo Spot all the time. Ask it questions, play music, get news, and more.

author: WP
title: This is the only device worthy of my nightstand.
content: Come on - it's amaonmazing!  It's way more than a smart speaker.  It's my wake-up alarm, my security blanket, and infotainment center all-in-one.  It's my connection to the world during night hours when I'm mostly sleepy or zonked-out Zzzzzzz...  I can still access the world without my reading-glasses late at night.  It sounds amazing for its size.  It can hear me when I'm far from awake (mostly).  As they say, "this is a must-have device".  Yep, that is a true statement.

author: Philip Workman
title: I really like this part
content:
The Spot does what it is professed to do. The ability to play songs, visa vie, karaoke.  I really like this part.
Not happy with the fact I had to purchase a stand. But capitalism is alive!!!!!
I have 3 dots and a spot, love them all.
Gave the 4 stars because of the cord, no mobility.  Would be nice at the pool.

author: Tim D. Hendon
title: Almost perfect bedside device
content:
Works perfectly.  Easy to set up and operate.  Even adding a photo clock face was easy.  Good sound for a single speaker of this size.  Only complaint is that there is no way to turn off "Things to Try" in the card setting, or the ability to completely turn off all rotation.  Works great as a weather alert radio using Big Sky.  Better than the echo. Even better, has a DTMF keypad for calling numbers that require you to select options.
A superb complement to the echo.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best nightstand alarm clock ever.
content: I love my Eco spot. Not only can I set music to play for 20 minutes when I go to bed, but I can have it wake me up to music. I also love that I can ask what is on my calendar today and it tells me and shows me. Best alarm clock I've ever had.

author: Char
title: Love the visual
content: Replaced a 2nd generation dot. I like the visual. Using it in my kitchen. Love the clock feature, music, flash briefs. The only con, I think it needs to come with an adjustable stand.

author: Mark E.
title: Excellent addition the the Alexa lineup
content:
The echo Spot is great I have 2 echo shows, 2 dots, and the echo. I wanted something for the bedroom. The Spot is great there, perfect size  I bought the stand, very retro. Everything I have in the show is in the Spot but smaller.
I highly recommend the Spot.

author: Bullshed
title: Does what does and its beautiful as a night stand clock
content: Does what does and its beautiful as a night stand clock

author: Amazon Customer
title: Three Stars
content: Very disappointed that it’s not able to be disconnected from power outlets

author: LaRae
title: Great item
content: this is wonderful and easy for my senior citizen to use.

author: Brent
title: Quality and functional for a price!
content: Great little Alexa device with clock/ video display. When I play music it displays the lyrics, when someone is at my door, it displays the video feed from my Ring doorbell and it gives me notifications without being annoying. The standard display is a nice looking clock. I personally love this for my home office as it is a clean design and has multi functions that are actually useful. It's a nice way to add Alexa to your office or nightstand. The only down side is the price...

author: Joseph Carl Bitner
title: Awesome!
content: Love it! It’s a very cool smart alarm clock that does so much more!

author: N9FTK
title: Try it - You will like it !
content: Excellent unit ! Very pleased with my purchase. Still learning all of Alexa's capabilities. Especially appreciate that it has a low level audio out jack that may be used to feed an external amplifier.

author: K. Collins
title: Accurate info
content: She answers alot of questions and had alot of music and sleep sounds

author: Matthew J. Liptak
title: Another winner from Amazon! Awesome!
content: Amazon just keeps impressing me with another excellent release that is not only useful but compact enough to put this on a nightstand and has full functionality like an Echo Show with touchscreen and voice controls. You can lay in bed and turn off the lights, play music or even hear news. Plus it is an excellent alarm clock. Awesome!

author: James
title: Five Stars
content: The smart alarm clock I always wanted. But never knew I needed.

author: RH
title: New Communicator
content: This is a unique electric equipment. We use it a lot already. It does seem funny talking to a little round clock type machine and sometimes we stump it on questions,  but we like it. Get one and have fun

author: Eileen
title: Alexa updates me with weather, traffic and play music ...
content: Alexa updates me with weather, traffic and play music.  I still need to find out how to ask her for the music choices.

author: Johanna
title: Impressive Screen for a small Machine
content: The machine itself has crisp and beautiful graphics. I wish there was some more intergration with things like our Amazon owned  link security cameras. Right now we can just arm or unarm the system which I can easily do from my phone. Since I have this screen at my bedside it would be nice to see video from my cameras. We have this as the echo in the master bedroom and are very happy with it!

author: VicVic
title: I’m still firing it out. She doesn’t always understand ...
content: I’m still firing it out.  She doesn’t always understand me and when I ask to make an event I want to add a reminder - but can’t figure out how go to that.

author: Andrew Stevens
title: Great sound, better than a Dot
content:
Great sound, better than a Dot, but not as good (but close) to the sound of an Echo or Show. Screen resolution is good, but watching extended video is a bit on the eyes.

While the spherical shape is aesthetically pleasing, but tends to "weeble" if knocked.

author: K. Baumgardner
title: No problem with WIFI
content: Screen size is smaller than it looks in the pictures but it serves my purposes just fine. I'm using it as a bedside clock/alarm. You can make the numbers of the clock to the size they need to be easy to read from across the room and you can also change the background picture to whatever you desire. I've had no problems with WIFI even though it's in the back of the house.  I also use it to turn bedroom lights on and off.

author: Peggy Gaines
title: We love having Alexa in our home
content: Easy to set up and operate. Finding the Easter Eggs has been fun for the whole family! Integration with smart home switches and outlets has been very simple and straightforward.

author: Carole
title: L O V E !!!
content: Love, love, love!!

author: B.K.
title: great product
content: So far so good.  Have 2 spots, and the kids really enjoy having one in their room.  No issues with set up, or use.

author: Eric B
title: Doesn't function well as a clock - terrible billboard behavior
content:
It constantly shows "Things to Try" about every 7 minutes, every hour of every day - sometimes it feels like it's even more frequent than that.

It's extremely annoying and means that a ton of the time you look at it, you can't actually see the time - you see the suggestion for some random stuff like "Alexa, tell me a blooper." What the heck?! This is *even after selecting to have the card rotate only once*. This means my wife and I can't really use it as a bedside clock like we'd originally intended since we can't trust it to actually be showing the time.

I would love to return this thing, now that I've realized what this thing is - a billboard for you to use other services you don't want - I really don't like it. If they got it to stop showing "Things to Try" every 7 minutes, it would be much more useful and I'd change my review.

author: patricia campbell
title: Bought it for the clock but love all the other features too!
content: Love all the features for such a reasonable price. And Alexa has wonderfully sensitive hearing. She is able to hear my requests from the other room without me shouting. And she understands my requests more often than Siri.

author: holly
title: Love it
content: Love Alexa.  The “drop in” figure is neat.

author: Telling-it-like-it-is
title: Cute! Perfect for a bedside table alarm.
content: I like the product it’s very well made. It’s confusing to work with sometimes and it would be nice if you could ask Alexa questions about her operating system and she could actually answer you instead of referring you to the Alexa app.

author: Mitta
title: Five Stars
content: I love love love it.

author: OME
title: Great for my bedroom
content: I had an echo dot in my bedroom for a while, but the Spot makes so much more sense for the bedroom. It also has a clock and thus makes a perfect nightstand alarm clock with the bonus of all the other Alexa/Echo features. You can change the clock face, it displays more information for many of the aps i use (for example when playing music it displays song information, when used to operate Philips hue lights it allows you to also use touch screen features, when requestign the weather it provides more weather info on the screen...) I am very happy with it.

author: Araceli
title: Five Stars
content: Perfect size for my desk, perfect little assistant. Im very happy with it.

author: Pierce
title: Best Yet in a Long Line of Echo Products
content:
I am, admittedly, a huge fan of Alexa. I've had at least one of each model except Echo Look. This is my favorite. It is on my nightstand, serving as clock, alarm, evening music player, white noise generator, Audible book player, and general companion. The screen makes everything better. I also have an Echo Show, which was on my nightstand, but it functions better in my kitchen when I need cooking help. I am a clock fan, and the faces available are great. Its like having an old-timey clock, but lighted. You can adjust the brightness. Oh yeah, it's a touch screen, too. So you wake up in the middle of the night, and Spot is "Spot on" with the time. Or you're lying on your side facing away--"Alexa, what time is it?" The screen also shows what time your alarm will sound.
Have you ever awoken with a good idea, but know you won't remember in the morning? "Alex, take a note." Is your favorite song playing, but you've forgotten the words? Alexa often knows the lyrics and scrolls them while the song plays.
You can also "drop in" on folks. My Spot is set for household only. So if the grandson isn't up yet--Let's call the grandson Billy--"Alexa, drop in on Billy." A sound alerts Billy, then you see on his Spot, he's still asleep. "Billy, get up, get ready for school."
Like all the Alexas, Spot has so many uses, and the screen just makes it better. My favorite Alexa device. Highly recommended.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love this Echo Spot
content: What is not to like . Now I can listen to music whenever I want and whatever I want . If I have a question about any subject all I have to do is ask.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great concept but needs more apps and interfaces
content: Great concept but needs more apps and interfaces.  And Hue works horrible with this.  Always makes duplicates and can't do voice commands for the lights.

author: Adriano Gomes
title: Even Better than Echo Show!
content: Although it looks smaller, and maybe less useful than Echo Show, it actually is much better! It's the perfect bed side companion. It's light dim when there's nobody around, and it's much neater than Echo Show.

author: Bob P.
title: Perfect for the nightstand or small desk
content:
Bought it with the Echo trade-in discount. I didn’t think the small video screen would make a difference vs the Echo Dot, but it does!  The screen is too small to watch a movie, but works great for quick Drop-in calls, short news clips, or to check the front door camera. This is definitely replacing the alarm clock next to my bed.

Keep in mind that there is no battery back-up. (I have mind plugged in to a small UPS.)  Also, as with any video device in the home, you will want to tune your Drop-in settings for privacy.

If a larger video screen is more important than the small form factor, go with the Echo Show.

author: A Person With An Opinion
title: Good starter for the smart home.
content: Works realitively good.  Seems to have issues with hearing me over background noise.  Lacks lots of television control capability, but I am happy with the purchase.  The clock works flawless.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It's a cool thing and I like the changeable clock faces
content: It's a cool thing and I like the changeable clock faces, but otherwise, the video isn't super useful.  I paired it with a blue tooth speaker I wasn't using because the sound on it for playing music isn't great.  Overall, I'm glad I bought it.

author: Richard E.
title: Five Stars
content: It is like a miniature Echo Show - love its size and features.

author: Allen L. Myers
title: I love the screen on the Echo Spot
content: I love the screen on the Echo Spot, especially when it is being used as a clock.  The speaker is quite good for a device of this size.  I hope that that Amazon fixes the postcards with a firmware up-date.  While I can get them to display only once for each command I give, I would like the option to prevent them all together.  I don't mind the weather postcard, but the "things to try with Alexa" is a nuisance.  I also would to see more interesting digital clock faces to go with the analog faces.

author: JanelleIRL
title: Leap into the verbal terminal!
content:
Per photo, numbers on clock are enlarged to fit the limits of the display, in the dark, on a nightstand.

Commands are simple. Routines are supremely easy to program with a tap or two and declaring a variable verbally.

Everything connects easily (so long as you know your passwords 😜😹😹😹).

The Alexa app makes everything work seemlessly.

PLAY WITH US in this space! That's the only way you'll get everything you want out of this device.

author: Patrick Porter
title: Fun, functional and a great addition to the family.
content: Awesome addition to the family! The spot has great sound quality and is the perfect size for our kitchen. The Alexa assistant is very handy to have in the kitchen and family area. Also the video calling function is is amazing and fun. Great value!

author: Dr E MD
title: Love My Spot
content: Great intuitive easy to use and tons of fun!!!

author: Greg Sutton
title: "Try and ask Alexa" card is so irritating i cant even look at the screen, so now the screen faces the wall.
content: Great product and I would give 5 stars - but you can't scroll face cards without having the stupid "try and ask Alexa" suggestions pop up.  Yes you can have it scroll once, and just stay on the clock, but I like having other cards as well. God its the worst and SO irritating.  I got it super cheap, so i just face the screen toward the wall and treat it like a Dot instead of a Spot.  What a dumb move on Amazons​ part.

author: Hassan Mowatt
title: Alarm clock on steroids!
content: Bought this gift my brother for his birthday and wow are we both impressed. Never thought he would have a use for an alarm clock again until he got this. This is a well made quality unit. Speaker is decently loud, functions are easy to learn and use, and when connected to the Echo Dot in the living room he has access to linked devices almost anywhere in the home. Like it so much I'm buying my own! Oh and the alarm settings are amazing as well!

author: 315press
title: Who wouldn't love it.
content: Echo with visual interaction.  Who wouldn't love it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I like it
content: This is great. I like that you can customize settings to have a morning and night time routine. When I say good morning, it says the weather and events I have going on that day. However, I purchased this for FaceTiming and didn’t know that it is not compatible with my iPhone. It doesn’t come with instructions so I looked it up Andrew other person has to have the Alexa app in order to FaceTime.

author: Robert O
title: Great device as long as you have like devices
content:
I bought it for my mom since she is in an assisted living place to talk with the family all over the country.

The major issue was viewing her on the Spot, if she was not in the center I couldn’t see her. I ended up giving her the Echo Show and I took the spot since I also got my sisters the show too. Other than that it’s a great device. Just make sure you have like devices, unless you opt for the show.

author: Jose I Beauchamp Couto
title: Five Stars
content: I liked it, perfect size, the screen is really clear,  and elegant.

author: Andrew R.
title: Five Stars
content: love the functionality of this device meets and exceeds all expectations

author: W. Ephrim Baker II
title: It enables you to see and talk to people and look at the cloud cam
content: Very good product I love the way it enables you to play music view your Cloud Cam and view people as you talk to them

author: PIRATAWENCH
title: WE LOVE ALEXA!
content: We love Alexa - we no longer have to get up and turn off mom's tv - we just tell Alexa to do it - if we want to know something, we ask Alexa - Alexa doesn't know everything, but she knows a lot - plan on putting in a themostat to be able to control via Alexa also - and also installing security cameras

author: South40
title: It has gone beyond what we originally anticipated. We ...
content: It has gone beyond what we originally anticipated.  We are finding more for it to do each week.  Its a keeper!

author: johnboy
title: Echo spot and Wyze cams are not a good mix
content: Bought this to use with two Wyze cameras.  Neither one will work with the Alexa.  Spent over an hour with product support.

author: CasSandra
title: Spot On
content:
Got for a decent deal with a trade in. Plays news feeds well, small screen but details are crisp. The sound is amazing can hear my flash briefings for the kitchen (Spot in bedroom upstairs). Everyone recommends getting the stand but I don't see the need for it. It sits on my nightstand and is at eye level. I really don't need to see it except for the time and any notifications. I have attached my Ring doorbell and Cloud Cam so I can see the video from either, would like to be able to flip back and forth between them without having to stop one and start the other.

For me this was a smart buy, I already own 2 echo dots and a Google Home. I needed/wanted something with a screen. Will eventually get an Echo Show when the price drop but this will do for now.

Should you get it? Why not? See your new flash briefings, watch videos and see your security cameras all on one device. Wake up to your schedule and then decide if you want to roll over and go back to sleep or get up and face the day.

author: Jacob E. Walker
title: Love it!! will buy another one.
content: Love it, connect a speaker and its great for music and video

author: Apps
title: Cool device, but 4 stars because it’s pricey for what you get.
