content: Cool device. Do es what I need it to do.  I just wanted a decent looking alarm clock with Alexa features for the bedroom.  I have the camera feature turned off but will probably cover the lens with something eventually.  It would be 5 star if it weren’t so expensive.

author: Debbie
title: Great gift!
content: My son bought for me so I could talk to my granddaughters. I love it for that reason and to ask Alexa questions, play music.

author: GP
title: Works great
content:
Works great
Drop in feature is pretty slick

author: OberonChgo
title: Love it. It makes a beautiful alarm clock and ...
content: Love it. It makes a beautiful alarm clock and sounds decent for its size. I just wish there were more apps available to take advantage of the camera. I’d love if it could be used as a security camera.

author: Daniel
title: Great for baby monitor
content: We have many Echo devices throughout our home. We use this one beside our bed for the main purpose as a baby monitor. We got an Amazon Cloud Cam to go with this and it's the best baby monitoring system that we've ever had. I was concerned at first that the video feed wouldn't play all night, but it stays on all night with no problem. You can also turn the screen brightness all the way down, so it's not shining in your face while you sleep.

author: Ron Goebel
title: We love it
content: We love our new echo spot. We have it linked with our other Echo device and it works very well. It looks great in the bedroom where we use it as an alarm clock and to get early morning weather and news feeds. We have had no issues with it and will probably buy another for the basement if we catch them on sale again.

author: Nicholas
title: Love video chatting with the ceiling
content: This product is awesome. I'm a huge smart home fan so I had to buy this for our kitchen and basement. My only gripe with this product is video chatting with the ceiling when I drop in. There should be an adjustment with the camera, unless somebody is putting this on a toddler seat and it's pointing up 5 feet higher.

author: dfine1966
title: I really like the Spot
content: I really like the Spot. It has become my new alarm clock.  There are just a few problems that cause it for now to be 3 stars. First, setting the alarm and turning it off can be quite hard, especially if you try to shut it off with a touch.  You also have to use the exact word, STOP!, to make it shut off  for that day., or if you say anything else will shut it off permanently.  Also, the weekday alarm does not work at all. If you set it for weekday, after the first day it just doesn't work. When I check the iOS Alexa app, it shows that the weekday alarm is on, but the Spot doesn't recognize that it is still on, and misses it the next day. The only way to get the weekday alarm to work at all is to turn off and then back on for it to work. I have found a workaround for my problem. I have set up five separate alarms for Monday through Friday to get what one weekday setup should have done. Yes, I did contact Amazon, but they still haven't fixed the problem. This isn't a new problem if you search the web. Hopefully the software will be fixed soon so I can change my rating to higher.

author: Steven V
title: Great Alarm Clock and Weather Notifications.
content:
The Echo Spot works perfectly when it’s not really connected to any Smart Home devices.
There is a feature where you can tell Echo Spot to turn of its screen, I do this at night), however, when I have my dyson connected or some other device connected and I ask Echo Spot to turn off its screen, she just reply’s “Sorry, what device.” And this can go on forever. I found that I had to disconnect everything in order to avoid that problem.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great for bedside, but that's about it
content: Works great as a bedside clock but the microphone for Alexa doesn't work as well as the normal Echo.  Sometimes Alexa doesn't hear me when I try to interrupt her it to give new instructions.  The speaker also isn't as good as the normal Echo.  Screen is small so not really useful for viewing any type of video or for seeing who's at the front door.  But, it's great for the bedside.

author: New Jersey
title: This is a fun little item that has been very useful to me
content: This is a fun little item that has been very useful to me.  I don't get very good radio reception so this little device has allowed me to listen to music (I have Amazon Prime already) without the static or annoyance of trying to find a decent station.  I was able to program it myself without assistance from my children or grandchildren!  That says a lot for the ease of operation!  It's definitely not an item of necessity but it has been fun waking up and just asking "Alexa, what's the weather going to be like today?".

author: Tiffany
title: Don’t buy it.
content: It’s crap. You can’t stream YouTube in it. I researched it before I bought it and thought I could. I want it fixed before Christmas please. You can’t have places advertising that you can play YouTube through it when it actually isn’t possible. That is not right to do to the consumer.

author: Adam Melot
title: Just barely better than the Echo Dot
content:
This Alexa device is cool when you are listening to music streaming from Amazon - the lyrics show on the screen.
The downside to this one is you cant mount her on the wall-plug like you can with the Dot.

author: G S Svien
title: Very helpful!
content: Love it. So convenient. Currently, the reminder feature is my favorite. No more thinking of something that you need to do and remembering to write it down. Just tell the echo to put it on your reminder list. The only issue I have is that when connected to my echo show, only one unit responds verbally. So if you ask a question of he Spot, (which is upstairs) the Show answers (which is downstairs) The unit you are speaking to needs to respond. I'm hoping Amazon comes up with a firmware update to resolve this issue.

author: Tim B.
title: Best Echo Device yet!
content:
My favorite Echo device yet. This is on my nightstand as my alarm clock and is such a joy to use. I only wish there was a way to set alarms with the touchscreen so I don't have to scare my wife by talking to Alexa when she's asleep.

Surprised at how much better the sound is here than that of the Dot. Very rich and bassy given it's small size.

author: Raymond B.
title: A-Mazing!
content: Love my Echo Spot! Its been a great addition to my room, its a great multi functional clock and has added Alexa voice control to my bedroom. I can't say enough great things about the Spot. Easy set up, very intuitive and responsive. If you have your home integrated with Alexa this is a great option for adding it to the bedroom.

author: LovinLifeLivinLarge
title: Echo spot is the bomb!!
content: Love my Echo spot. Useful in many many ways. Can’t believe now it took me so long to purchase one. Alexa is the bomb.

author: Lawrence M. Hinman
title: Amazon finally hit a home run
content: Amazon finally hit a home run with this model.  The Echo Spot has very good sound, and the screen is extraordinarily useful.  I look forward to being able to customize it more as the software matures, but it's a winner.  The size is great, and of course the backend is Alexa.  This one is ready for prime time!

author: JLGGeek
title: Can't help loving my new Echo Spot
content:
I own two of the original "tower" Echo devices and love them because of their magnificent speakers. We keep one in our bedroom, which I use as a Bluetooth speaker for my Kindle Fire as well as for checking the weather, etc. The other is in the main level of our house, and we use it to play background music, and as a Bluetooth speaker for my Kindle Fire when I'm nearby. But my office has had an Echo Dot, which was great because I don't have much horizontal surface area on my desk.

Last week I succumbed to a trade-in offer from Amazon and bought an Echo Spot to replace the Dot. I wasn't sure I wanted or needed a screen to go with my Echo device, but the offer was too good to pass up. I am really surprised how much I like having the Spot and its small screen. I just tried voice ordering for the first time, and it was really reassuring to have the visuals to go with the ordering process. I'm sold! I look forward to listening to my Audible audio books and Kindle books, and having the touch screen to better control playback.

author: Jorge Valls
title: Nice thing to have
content: I like it is a nice gadget to have

author: brandon Sp.
title: Not a very smart device. Thumbs down. Needs better software.
content: Not very smart, music choices suck

author: Ben
title: Expensive Alarm Clock
content:
Pros: It has a slightly better speaker than the Dot
It has a screen.

Cons:
Can't play Youtube.
Can't play live stream TV channels through it.
Can't adjust the height of the camera
Video from Cameras (Nest cam) timeout after a while. Until this is changed so it does not time out. I wanted to use it as a baby monitor, however with this timeout it is completely pointless.
When playing Spotify Connect on all Echo's in my house, I have to have this plugged into a minijack to a Bluetooth speaker - it cannot be used through Bluetooth.
Little useful video/display content to date.

author: J. Kelly
title: My Pet, in spite of the drawbacks.
content:
I’m kind of an Alexa junkie, and even though I would never use video calling (which I understand is the main feature),  the Spot is still my favorite. It’s just so cute, and I love the display for the clock and weather, and that it shows what song you are listening to as well as the lyrics.

The drawbacks are that it doesn’t have very good sound or volume (the 3rd generation Dot is far superior), and please PLEASE give an option to take away the annoying suggestions!

author: SamI
title: My Echo Spot
content: I just love the Echo Spot. It is very informative and helpful. I’m still learning all the things she can do.

author: GoGo Joe
title: Great gift to get someone introduced to Home assistant
content:
Great little device,

when I come home from work, It's already on Joe rogans podcast via schedule routine. I can also see my child nursery any time I say, Alexa show nursery. I also own the echo show but this device for some reason has it's own appeal. Looks like an alarm clock but has soOooOOoo many abilities. If your looking for a great Christmas gift... This is it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Easy to use!
content: Excellent product.  I use it to drop in on family and they do the same.... so much fun!

author: G
title: Echo Spot is awesome.
content: Love it.

author: Arya
title: Really quiet!
content:
Okay, so, I love this product. I really do. I needed a new alarm clock and decided to take a jump into the future and get something a little fancier. This fit the bill nicely. It looks great on my bedside table, it's easy to set up, and it does everything I want it to do (plus some stuff I didn't realize I wanted like voice activated night lights with a smart plug). My one and only complaint, however: The volume. I need an external speaker for it because the alarm simply does not get loud enough to wake me up on its own. I've been using my cell phone to wake myself up for awhile now and I feel like my phone is louder. Additionally, I've got to kind of shout for it to hear me as well. This isn't an issue I have with generation 1 echo at all.

Regardless, I feel that once I get a speaker for it'll basically be perfect for my needs. Hopefully they can address this in future version. Still very happy with my purchase though.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great
content: Own two and they are great

author: coquine
title: Very useful
content: Great version of the Echo. Very useful and informative. There are privacy settings, like do not disturb, that you need to change immediately in the app.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great addition to my bedroom
content: Great addition to my bedroom...all the great features from Alexa and Alexa Show....music, video etc.  This would be great for a college student as well...but works well in the bedroom or office.

author: J. Palmer
title: Perfect Everyday Tool
content: Very effective tool. Small and compact sits perfectly on my nightstand. I use it as an alarm, weather alerts, flash briefings, order on Amazon, make phone calls.

author: Jennie
title: Perfect for my bedroom clock
content: I love all the Alexa devices, and the Echo Spot was a great addition. I use it in my bedroom as a clock and can also do a video drop in with my Echo Show in the kitchen. I can use pictures I uploaded to Amazon photos to display as a slideshow on the screen, displaying favorite family moments. No complaints!

author: Cathy Hangartner
title: Multi functions in a small space
content: I will be living full time in an RV and I love that this can be a stereo, a clock, an alarm, a FaceTime device, a calendar.  The possibilities are endless, and I can hear it throughout my home, my only complaint will be resetting it to new wifi at every new site, but the advantages far out weigh the one negative.

author: Dan R
title: Love It!
content: I never thought I would get into this smart house / Alexa thing... but I have and I love this latest addition.  Great sound quality out of such a small package.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good tool
content: Good tool for daughter to keep up with her schedule.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great Spot.
content: Love, love so far. I just received it Thursday. I unwrapped it, set it up, & immediately programmed it. No problem with the reoccurring things to try. I set it to rotate once and shows time like I want. I love the low ambient look at night.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Fiance' loves it
content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my fiance' and he loves it. It replaced the alarm clock in our room, and he has not been disappointed.

author: Joshua
title: Great but Vid calls don’t work.
content: It’s awesome but Amazon really needs to work out the kinks on the calling. The video calling just doesn’t work. Like, at all. Other than that, the speaker is awesome with 10x the base of the dots. It can also hear you better than the dots (at least it feels like).

author: JT
title: Awesome
content: Works great. Easy setup.

author: Easy Share Fan
title: My favorite purchase this year
content: I have a ridiculous amount of love for my Echo Spot. It manages to be  chubby and round and adorable and sleek, shiny  and beautiful all at once. I love that I can choose a multitude of themes for my clock face, ask it anything, play all my music and even videos but i don't use it for videos. Mainly it is the most beautiful excellent alarm clock ever. I purchased it on Prime day and took advantage of a ten-dollar smart plug add-on purchase, so I can also command it to make my coffee. I'm also enjoying the Amazon music catalog via my Spot. I've had it for a few months and am still in love with it. Seriously!

author: Veronica Wichrowski
title: Your daily life in one friendly, little gadget!
content: I love this little gadget! It is the best, latest addition I have added to my home. Echo even has a sense of humor with some of her responses and the pictures and visible information are a plus, not to mention the BT speaker feature. The background photo can be changed to one of choice from my own albums and I did easily figure out how to stop the screens from constantly scrolling.  It is in the settings, just as some folks have answered in the FAQs. There are many more neat features, but I don’t want to spoil a future owner’s fun in discovering them on his/her own. Oh, i do also love the lists and reminders. Just ask Alexa to add an item to your shopping or to-do list or an item to your reminders and she will take care of the rest.  I threw out my old-fashioned, paper, notepads. Everything is in my phone or iPad now!  Talk about convenience!  Echo is my new best friend!

author: saa
title: Five Stars
content: Nice sound for such a small item.  Works as expected.  Replaced my alarm clock

author: JD
title: Pay attention to the reviews.  One BIG drawback for me.
content:
Heed the other reviews.  I DO NOT appreciate being subjected to ad-ware and pop-ups on-line and I equally despise intrusive advertising that I cannot turn off which unfortunately is the case with the Echo Spot.  I was sufficiently concerned from reading other reviews that I reached out to Amazon customer service to confirm (on-line chat) to confirm prior to purchase.  I am very sorry to report that they lied to me.  I was told in no uncertain terms that I could turn off the Alexa suggestions "things to try".  I carefully followed their directions on how to do that but it DOES NOT WORK AS CLAIMED.  It would stop for a while and then revert.  Every time I look, the setting to "rotate once" has switched back to the default and the "things to try" will not stop.  Had I known this in advance, I would not have purchased even on sale.

Amazon, I already bought the product; quit forcing me to put up with your sales pitch on all the things I can do!  My opinion, and trust level, with Amazon has suffered a real hit due to this.

The GOOD:
Aside from the one non-adjustable "feature", this thing is potentially a great product.  I use it as an alarm clock and it can't be beat.  The customizable clock face is great, the auto brightness adjustment is spot on and the size is perfect.  I can't stand clocks that are overly bright in a dark room and I'm happy to say that this one is not a problem at all.  I really want to love this thing and all it would take to get me there is for Amazon to make it behave the way customer service claims it will.  I'm waiting (like many others) for the firmware fix to address that most annoying feature.

author: Walter J Rymarczyk
title: Not Happy
content: Not happy with it.  It keeps showing things it wants me to do with Alexa.  All I want is the clock unless I ask for something.  It’s just free advertising for Amazon.  Should have gotten another echo dot.

author: Adam OK
title: Good device
content: Works just like described

author: Nessa G
title: Impressed
content:
I'm not much into using Alexa etc. but I love this! I've been able to figure out what I've wanted or needed very easily, very easy set up with the help of the Alexa app. I was very happy to know that some apps I use on my phone I can also use on my Echo Spot.
Very impressed and plan to buy a dot to go with it!

author: Robert
title: Screen so tiny, video watching is virtually useless
content: Not too impressed. I possibly bought it for the wrong reason and needed an Echo Show to best suite my needs. The screen is so tiny it is virtually for any video viewing unless you are sat less than two feet away. I thought it might be a good addition to my nightstand, yet it is lacking. I recommend purchasing the Echo Show instead.

author: Lori Isaac
title: always listening
content: It scares us at times, we are talking and the it starts talking!

author: P.J
title: If you liked your dot your going to love the spot!
content: Does everything my dot would do and now I am able to change settings on the screen and more. This thing is great!

author: Christina Rodriguez
title: I LOVE IT!!
content: I Love it. I get to hear all my news briefings while I’m getting ready for work. I can listen to whatever song I like and I do t have to search for it. Alexa just plays it for me.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Best purchase Ive made this year!
content:
My best friend lives on the other side of the country... we gave each other the spot for our birthdays and use it to stay close with video calls and the ability to 'drop in' is great because we can see if the other has been active recently, so we don't have to pre-coordinate a time across time zones.
Love being able to play music by asking for a genre or mood.  Have learned of new artists I'd never before been exposed to.  It is also handy for hearing news, weather and commute info and the jokes are so silly it makes me laugh.  Like having a roommate you actually like, who doesn't eat the last of the cereal÷

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very good thing. Received everything that I expected
content: Very good thing. Received everything that I expected. It recognizes word “Alexa” even in very noisy room. The screen is just enough for intercom or video calls, definitely it is not the screen to watch movies. The device itself is very good, but I hope there will be more and more skills for it because now there are not many of them, especially those which work outside USA.

author: travel boy
title: Do a lot more of what you think
content: Like every time I use it, every body should have one

author: Todd
title: I like the product but they need to work on two ...
content:
I like the product but they need to work on two things:

More clock faced and the ability to create custom clock faces.

The ability to change how you turn the alarm off.  Tap is snooze and swipe turns the alarm off but I would like to be able to set that.  What tap does, what swipe does and tap or swipe does not delete the alarm.

author: needlePatty
title: Excellent
content: I got the Echo Spot as a Christmas gift.  I had thought I would just want the smaller one without the screen.  But I am really glad that I got this one instead.  The lighting at night is perfect for telling time in the format I like best.

author: S. M. Hansen
title: We love the little tidbits of information that just pop-up on ...
content: We love the little tidbits of information that just pop-up on her screen, but sometimes wish they would stay a bit longer so we could complete reading them.  The clock is really handy and her sound is perfect.

author: S Abdulla
title: Brilliant
content: My first echo with a screen. Works very well. I am impressed!

author: Mondoman
title: No more fumbling in the dark to set a wake-up alarm.
content: I don't have to find my glasses or even open my eyes now -- just ask Alexa and I know the time, weather, news or bop to Devo.

author: Betsy
title: Easy to set up and easy to use.
content: Love this little dot with a screen.  Super easy to set up and easy to use.  Instantly connected to all my other echo products.  I also bought the screen cover that has the blocking button for the camera if you want to use it.  Recommended.

author: Judyb121
title: Helpful tool
content:
I received the Echo Spot for Mother's Day and having Alexa's help makes my days more interesting.
I love listening to music at my command, along with using it as a hands-free timer when I am cooking! I've tried out playing Jeopardy and look forward to other discoveries.
The only thing I worry about is privacy.

author: Chris Channell
title: I like it, but bad timing
content: Had I known the Fire TV Cube was coming out in two weeks, I'd have probably waited on that.  From what I can tell it's the same price, all the same features, but the Cube does Fire TV as well.

author: Derron
title: Can’t remove “things to try” from homescreen rotation!!
content: I like everything about the Echo Spot except for the fact that you can not remove “things to try” from the clock screen rotation. I want it to cycle between the time and weather, and any other items I enable. Why cannot the “things to try” be disabled like all the other items (notifications, reminders, etc)

author: 1Swan
title: Cool but I still think you’re spying!
content: My 15 yo daughter received this as a birthday present. She loves it. It replaces her old school alarm clock. She can tel it what music to wake her up to. It’s a speaker. It can turn lights on and off w the smart plug. Great.

author: Brian Herr
title: Poor Quality Power Adapter
content: Unbelievable. I waited for this to arrive and was excited to use it. I plugged it in, updated the software, and got it all configured. I then moved it to another location, plugged it in and the unit was totally dead. I tried other outlets and got nothing. I went online and read that power adapter that comes with it fails with multiple customers. I contacted Amazon and will see how they respond. I ordered another adapter but it won’t be here until sometime in July. I am not happy with this purchase. I was anxious to use it and now have to wait.

author: Robert Cozzi
title: Not ready for daily use--software needs refineing and more ease of use.
content:
While the idea is good, the Spot isn't as usable as say the Echo DOT (screen-less model). The burden of having to touch the Spot to place orders on Amazon (physically interacting with it) is weird considering we've been using the DOT for a year or more hands-free was great and easy. Now you can't re-order anything without touching to select it.
Over all I'd say pass on this one. I don't know of the full-size SHOW works the same way so don't extend this review to the SHOW, but for us, we're going to replace the Spot with the old ECHO DOT we were using previously as aside from the Temperature being displayed, it adds nothing beneficial, and removes some ease-of-use features.

author: Keith W.
title: Works Great!
content: I use it in my bedroom and have my Alexa enabled lights hooked up.  Great for listening to music while doing bedtime reading, nature sounds while falling asleep, alarm for waking, news briefing while contemplating my day, and I can see my Blink cameras.

author: angie
title: great little "spot"
content: Love my new Spot-great sound, perfect size for my nightstand, able to change the clock design-Love It

author: Michael Voshell
title: Spot doesn’t connect to Bluetooth speaker in everywhere mode
content: I love it, except for an issue when I tell Alexa to play my music everywhere.  The echo spot is the only amazon device that won’t connect to a Bluetooth speaker in the everywhere group.  So, it costs more than the dot, but the dot actually connects just fine to Bluetooth in the everywhere group and the spot doesn’t.  Not cool

author: ms bowen
title: Great Unit
content: I love my spot.  I keep it by my bed and it has replaced my alarm clock.  Its a talking computer and I love it.

author: Prime Addict
title: seriously my next alexa will be a dot
content: Honestly it's no different from the Echo dots I already own,  other then occasionally seeing the lyrics to a song I'm listening too i really don't see the difference.

author: Bronagh
title: Love it...but its got a few irks.
content:
I love it- Its everything the other reviews say- sleek, stylish, neat and tidy- on your bedside table. It was easy to set  up too. I love it and how it looks. The sounds quality is great for such a small device.
However, I am having alot of issues getting things to work that I expect to work... like, playing prime video on the echo- just does not work. Or, asking when the next bus is due... It cant do it. Or, asking when my amason delivery is due to arrive.. It told me I had no 'open orders' which was just wrong. And- i must say, I am dissapointed with the 'skills'. It is a far cry from what is possible with Android Apps and Google assistant.... It pretty poor. AND I cant view what Skills Ive 'enabled'!!! It's sooooooo annoying.
You're probably wondering why I got this then instead of a Google assistant device. 1. my boyfriend had the dot and it responded to my voice reallly well, much better than Google assistant on my google phone. I have an Irish accent which devices can have trouble with, so this was a big attraction. 2. It was really easy to use- as an alarm, to get weather updates, play music, adjust the volume etc. I imagined a Google device would have more trouble recognizing my commands.

So....its still cool and functional as a above average alarm clock, and voice command usic player (this is just damn handy), and i can use it to call family and have my phone and hands free. This is what I like about it. For &$90, I can live with that.
I will be contacting Amazon to get the issues fixed and will follow up here.

author: Bandit
title: When it’s working it’s great, but it has a hard time staying connected ...
content: When it’s working it’s great, but it has a hard time staying connected to the internet. When you want to get some information, it has to reconnect or you have to wait for a long time for it to connect  to the internet

author: Tracey
title: Not very loud
content: I do love this little smart clock. The reason for three stars is I’m disappointed with the sound. It’s not very loud. The echo dot 3 is much louder. I probably need to add a echo dot to my bedroom now and play them together. I knew the size before I ordered so I wasn’t shocked to see it is about the size of a orange. It’s actually a good size for my small nightstand.

author: Valerie Hager
title: Proceed with CAUTION!!!!
content: Watch out I was looking through my spot and shows history and found multiple recordings of random conversations, even an argument. If you get one, make sure you are checking your devices history. Sometimes I didnt say anything at all and it would record.

author: Don E. Branch
title: Feature Changes/Additions to the Echo Spot requested (if you want a 5-star rating) :-)
content:
Just a couple of user comments for Amazon to consider in next software upgrade - 3 suggestions:
1.  I have to go into the Alexa app to set the home screen picture - logical as I need to select the photo from my phone and it uploads to the Spot.  But if I make any changes to the display setting on the Spot touchscreen itself, it erases my custom homescreen photo.  I have to go back to the Alexa app to re-install.  Not a killer but annoying.
2.  I appreciate the nighttime setting so the clock face dims - but the numerals for the time as way too small.  You have the screen real estate so why not offer a big type option where my clock can be in numbers 1.25 inches tall or more?  then I can see them without putting back on my glasses.
3.  Another clock request:  you have built a global product - why not offer 24-hour military time as an option?
Was not sure where to send in this feedback so hopefully you monitor these posts and this will help....thx...db

author: andrew bagley
title: Alexa elevated
content: Amazon has elevated the game, we have two already and will probably get one more. We no have three dots, one echo, and the look. The look was a bit of a dud but we enjoy all the others.  The spot take what was a good product and makes it great.

author: Superman_AZ
title: Small, reliable, great sound, extremely impressive and worth every penny!
content: This does EVERYTHING the Dot does and MORE! Worth every penny in my opinion. I did follow the advice on some YouTube reviews and disabled the "Drop In" option that allows people to call your Spot and have it autoanswer. Aside from that one little privacy concern, this has to be one of the greatest items I have ever purchased. I even bought the white swivel base to go with it, and it was just a snap to mount on the base of the Spot.

author: Gina Marino
title: Personal home assistant
content: Fab product! Love love

author: Anthony Black
title: Very confusing
content: Had it a few weeks and the wife fumbled her way through the set up for me while I was working out of town. Now I can’t figure any of this out. Can’t get it to sync with my amazon account, can’t get the app to recognize it as echo spot isn’t even an available option, though every other amazon echo product is on there. I’m pretty confused and damn frustrated. At this point it’s just an over priced  130 dollar radio....

author: Clayton S.
title: Works well with Hue and Kasa
content:
So far , 2 weeks into it, I’m very impressed. It’s amazing how well it understands what I’m saying. There are so many more things it can do than I originally thought. Albeit, most are not very necessary but are fun with the kids.

It has worked very well with my Philips Hue smart bulbs as well as my Kasa Smart plug for my coffee machine.

Still have a lot to learn but impressed so far!

author: G. Wong
title: Replacement for beside clock radio
content: Does so much more than a beside clock radio.  I like the way it adjusts the screen brightness by the ambient light.

author: Tom Hinz
title: WHAT!!!  NO STAND???
content: This is a great little unit and we are having loads of fun with it. The only reason for not giving the fifth star is the stand needed to be apart of the purchase and not be a secondary item. With out the stand the camera points upwards instead of straight out.

author: bmbutler
title: Highly recommend this Echo Spot
content: I was a bit skeptical buying this after my disappointment with the Show (would not recommend spending the extra money for the screen.).  I love this thing.  I got it with the stand.  I do wish Amazon would add the step of telling users on setup that you swipe down from the main screen to get to the settings.  You can turn off the "things to try" option, but who would know where that was without an internet search.  Other than that, love this Spt.

author: E. Sandbeck
title: I love the display!
content: This is my first "Alexa" purchase.  I haven't figured out all the things I can do with it yet, but am learning.  I am disappointed that Alexa can't retrieve answers from Google.  I did set up a daily flash briefing and like it.

author: james acierno
title: We purchased several echo spot while they were on sale ...
content: We purchased several echo spot while they were on sale. We’ve set them up. We’re getting adjusted to an automated home. It’s a learning process. They seem very convenient.

author: Chris Denton
title: Over priced. But still AWESOME!
content:
I deducted one star for the speaker level. All though the speaker is crystal clear and very smooth, it could be louder. I believe it only has a 2 watt speaker. As I am a heavy sleeper, it’s not quite loud enough to always wake me up. I bought the stand for it and that helps a little.
Alexa seems to respond well, to pretty much everyone. This includes when I’m watching YouTube on another device and someone says “Alexa” on the video. Also when watching TV.
A lot of the skills are crap, but there are some that are top notch.
Alexa doesn’t always hear you correctly either or get confused with what your asking. I had the best argument with her the other night. Lol
The spot works very well, it’s intuitive. I had a glitch with the screen not switching back to home. A simple restart was all that I needed to fix it.
This is a great little device, I plan on giving them out for holidays and birthdays this year.
On the price... $129.99 seems a little high. They were on sale for $109.99 when I purchased mine, and that’s not as painful. For the higher price, I think they should include the stand that currently sells for $19.99.
Alexa vs Siri? Hands down, Alexa! And I’m a huge Apple fan with lots of HomeKit stuff. BTW, most HomeKit stuff works with Alexa.
I could go on and on with this review but you’ll just have to get one and draw your own conclusions about it. Wait for the sales though.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good product
content: Quick and handy to use

author: Scott
title: Love this echo
content: Love this little sphere, have not learned all the tricks that it is capable of performing but it makes a nice alarm clock

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great bedside alarm clock
content: Very happy with it as an alarm clock.  I like that you can add a daily alarm but you can disable if you have the day off and enable again through the app.

author: Annette Quintana
title: SMART ITEM FOR YOUR HOME
content:
Ordered  this for my son .So happy i did .he can use this as a alarm clock ,listen  to his music,turn on lights .
built very well .will order more for the other rooms.

author: Cheryl  Maurer
title: Love watching photos!
content: Love my new spot! Works perfectly! I had it running in a jiffy!

author: P. Heald
title: Very cool, love it to bits
content: I just love this thing. Even if it were little more than an alarm clock, I'd love it - it just looks so good. But it's so much more. This was my first foray into a digital assistant that's not on my phone. The number of 'skills' you can enable for it is mind boggling. I started with having it control our bedside lights. Of course there's all the usual alarms, weather, general knowledge searches, even games (I particularly like True or False. It'll make a statement and ask if you think it's right. It also keeps score. Great way to pick up interesting facts). I've also connected it to my Arlo security camera. So I just need to say, "Alexa, show me the front door", and I can see it on the little screen. I use it to play music a lot. The Amazon music service is great, especially as it usually shows lyrics too. But I often also use Pandora. So I say something like "Alexa, play alternative 80s on Pandora", and she does! You can control volume by the buttons, or by asking Alexa to increase or decrease, or by saying something like "Alexa, volume 5". Next, I plan to get a smart Alexa-enabled thermostat for the house. I'm a fan.

author: NurseKayde
title: Five Stars
content: I absolutely love this device.. great gift. Totally fun!!

author: rick
title: I have been told you need to have an "alexa" or amazon app to make this work
content: I don't have a smart phone, so I can't make the video function.

author: DAN LUNA
title: Fun toy!
content: It is fun for my wife and I and, especially, our grand-daughters to hear different music.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Faces are limited
content: Good Alexa purchase but can’t get face for it to stay on what I want it’s limiting on that

author: C. Dellheim
title: A practical device.
content: Fun to use and helpful when I draw blank in spelling word. Also, it can be funny!

author: Reza
title: great product. I like the whisper mode
content: great product.  I like the whisper mode.  It can use a snooze button when you don't feel like talking to Alexa in the morning.

author: Julia
title: I love this!
content: Before I purchased this, I read about a million reviews, a lot of people are not buying this because of the “things to try” display. It is not annoying, there is no sound, it just scrolls. You can turn it off by setting it to rotate once, I did that and haven’t seen it again. This does so many more awesome things that outweighs this one tiny negative feature. With the Alexa app, you can “drop in” on your house, talk to people in it and even video chat with the spot. I work overnights and this is incredibly handy for me to get ahold of my teenagers. I fully recommend this product.

author: Eric H.
title: Cool little gadget.
content: Cute, nice for the kitchen or a night stand. We have it connected to our surround sound and to several other Alexa’s for a full home music system.

author: Darlene
title: THIS IS WORTH BUYING!
content:
LOVE THIS!  GOT IT FOR MOTHER'S DAY AND ME AND MY SISTER TALK BACK AND FORTH WITH IT. SHE LOVES HERS TOO!
TELLS YOU EVERYTHING AND KEEPS YOU UP TO DATE WITH ALL THE THINGS YOU NEED.

author: Boschetti
title: Great gadget
content: We have Echo Dots but this is our first Echo Spot and I must we said we love it. Yes it is a small alarm clock with a personality. I am an Apple person but my family loves Alexa. Great gadget!!!

author: Michelle Isaac
title: Super Love it
content: I love my echo spot💕

author: Carole W.
title: 😍 love it!
content: I bought this while we were remodeling our kitchen, and have only had this in use for a few weeks now.  I know I do not even begin to do all the stuff it is capable of, but I love it.  Looking forward to doing more with this than just play music, but even if that was all it could do I would be happy with that.  It is an amazing gadget.

author: Dustin
title: Great smart alarm clock!
content: I really like the Echo Spot especially coming from the Echo Dot. It serves its purpose well and I like how much more intuitive it is with its screen. For an alarm clock it works very well for me, I don't listen to music on it since it's not really meant for that in my opinion but for watching movie trailers and such I like it. Like everyone else has stated there really should be an option to turn off the things to try home card, I don't need that showing at all. Maybe/hopefully with a future update that will be addressed. Also, I think there should be an option to have the display turn off/time out after a certain amount of time or inactivity. There really is no need to have it on all the time, I'm at work for 9 hours of the day anyway.. You can turn the display off by asking it but I'd rather not have to do that everytime I leave the room. Also, they should add an option for how long your snooze sessions are. My last concern is with the alarm, I came across the situation where my power went out and I'm assuming if it hadn't turned back on I would not have been woken up by the alarm. Maybe in a future iteration they could implement a backup battery so the alarm sounds in the event of power loss? Other than those small gripes I do enjoy the Echo Spot and if you're looking for a smart alarm clock I highly recommend you pick one up. Especially when they have deals, I was able to pick mine up for $109.

author: Pops944
title: It helps to have Prime to get the most out of it.
content: Love it. It's fun interacting with Alexa and I find myself talking to her all the time.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Huge Benefits in a Small Package
content: Very happy with the Echo Spot - so happy, I have multiple Echo Spots in different parts of the house and am able to play my Amazon music using them as a collective group to have wonderful music everywhere!  I also really like the choice of watch faces - they even have some that work great for those of us with less than perfect vision so I can tell the time without my glasses!  The size is a perfect fit for small spaces but the many features make the Echo Spot a welcome addition to my Amazon Alexa family.

author: PaulTD
title: Quite a disappointment.
content:
It's rare that I would give an Amazon device less than five stars. Unfortunately the Echo Spot has not lived up to their usual stellar delivery. I decided to get one earlier this year and waited for many months for the black Friday price. It has been a surprising disappointment.

Despite having numerous clock faces to choose from, not a single one includes the temperature display. I can't even imagine what the rationale was for that.

I thought it would be nice to display background photos, but the photos are so dim as to be invisible. I haven't been able to figure out how to make them brighter.

Another big disappointment is that the volume settings have much bigger jumps in the lower range, at least over the 3.5 mm audio jack. Volume level II is barely audible and III is too loud. That was not the case with my Echo gen II.
Another volume issue is that the media plays at one volume, while Echo responses to commands are at a much higher volume. Presumably that is adjustable, but I haven't been able to figure it out yet.

One of the main reasons I thought that the Echo Spot would be really cool was so that I could stream a video while laying in bed. It can kind of do that, but I quickly learned that the video commands don't work for the most part. If I say Pause, it doesn't pause. If I say 'start from the beginning', it says I can't do that. If I say Rewind, it says that command is not available. If I say Stop, it just keeps playing. If I say Cancel, it just keeps playing. When I say 'next episode', Alexa begins playing the next song from the last Pandora station I was listening to. The streaming video function is almost completely useless.

I haven't tried making a video call because I don't know anyone else who has an Echo Spot. So that feature is virtually useless to me.

So as much as I hate to, I have to give it a one star rating compared to the Echo that I hoped to replace.

Update:  Customer service called me (stellar service as always!), I enjoyed talking with them.  They told me all of those issues are known issues with the Echo Spot, and they are alerting the developers.  (Although the video command failures seemed like a surprise to them).

So i'm returning the Spot.  I wanted to love it, but it wasn't loving me back.  I did find a nice alternative.

I bought a google home hub, which does the things the Spot doesn't do.  Then I found I could connect the home hub to an Echo Dot via bluetooth, allowing media to play from the home hub and the Dot onto my stereo system, giving me great sound from both devices, and the functionality of both.  (the home hub has mediocre sound and no 3.5 mm jack).  Kudos to Amazon for the Dot, which has both bluetooth and a 3.5 mm jack, full Alexa capability, and costs a fraction of all those other devices.

author: Maxine S
title: Alexa with a small screen
content: I bought this Echo Spot to replace my alarm clock and the Echo Dot in my bedroom and I love it! It’s simple, sleek design makes a great bedside clock. Having Alexa incorporated with a small screen is a great bonus! It’s fun watching short video news clips or seeing song lyrics stream by. The Echo Show is still my favorite, but this runs a very close second. Sound quality is good for listening to music.

author: DAYL COOMER
title: Easy to hook up to your network and easy to ...
content: Easy to hook up to your network and easy to operate....great bedroom item for alarm and differ functions to start your mornings ...informed.

author: Karolina
title: Love it! Wish I got this before the Echo!
content: The digital screen on the spot is a much better tutorial and introduction to Alexa than the Echo. However,  I would have ultimately ended up with both as the Echo has a much better speaker.  Not that the one on the spot isnt good too, just better for a bedroom, while you can use the echo to provide music for a small (15 to 20 people) party. Also,  I am very sensitive to light and this digital clock Is perfectly dim during sleeping hours, which are customizable.

author: smh213
title: This is wonderful for my 11 year old daughter who likes to ...
content: This is wonderful for my 11 year old daughter who likes to sing along to songs. Having the lyrics on the screen helps her sing all the right words. However, I wish there were parental controls. Being able to read the song lyrics means she reads ALL the words. Even the bad ones. Would love to have the option for radio versions of the songs.

author: Jason & Jodi Merkel
title: Five Stars
content: Love it!

author: Pat M
title: Love the little screen!
content: Big fan of Alexa. Love the Show and now the Spot. Put it right on my desk and it does all the same things the others do plus it has the little screen. I like the time to be visible 24/7. It lists my calendar events when asked and verbally spells and displays words I want to check. It does lots of other things as well - I'm still learning.

author: Alex Martinez
title: Love it!
content: So I started off with the Echo Dot and I fell in love with Alexa. Then I got the spot and it's even better with a screen. The only thing I kind of didn't like is the fact that the stand doesn't come with it. I think it should come already included with it but hey it's still a good product.

author: Ryan Clapp
title: The spot is a great echo device but it needs a little work especially ...
content: The spot is a great echo device but it needs a little work especially when there are 2 in the same room. We had to change the wake words to keep from activating  both of them when we said "Alexa". Also it seems like the spot looses memory of it's volume settings and it sometimes answers way too loudly for a bedroom device. It would be really great if the dismiss vs sleep interaction with the alarms was a bit easier.

author: KJ Steve
title: Functionality isn’t there yet.
content: The device will drive you insane reading all the ads that cover the screen anytime the device is on. The echo show is your best bet. The spot is better because of size for travel if you need one of the echo devices in that capacity but for a personal or business use save your money and get the show.

author: Allen Estevez
title: It would be great if it can wake you up to the news ...
content: I wish the alarm had other sounds other than regular alarm sounds. It would be great if it can wake you up to the news or any other sounds. Other than that this is amazing device. So far I love it.

author: kayleigh
title: Useful little device.
content: I love my Echo dot. It plays music, I can order stuff, I ask it the weather and the news. It honestly has impressive sound for such a little device. Alexa always hears me even from the other room. My favorite time to use it is when I'm cleaning, because it's hands free. Simply put this device makes my life easier and I would recommend this product.

author: SMO
title: Annoying tips that never permanently go away.
content:
I bought this to replace a Dot in my bedroom. Already have a Show and a couple of full-sized Echo units in my house.

The Spot is okay for what it is. Two issues, one minor and one major:

-the minor one - why include the huge bezel on the front? Why not take that space and make the display larger? A total waste of usable space.
-the major one, also involves the Show: I'm very used to these devices. I don't need to see "Things to Try" whenever I use a voice command with it (even setting it to rotate once starts this crap over again when you dare to actually use the devices). I'm not a child and I don't need to be told a hundred times how to play music on it. And having this on my nightstand and seeing these highly annoying tips is just outrageous for a unit meant to be used next to a bed. Why doesn't Amazon fix this and give us the option to turn this nonsense off? I want to see a clock face, period, not these silly nanny reminders.

author: julie Derrickson
title: Works great
content: Love it. Works great and now I can get of crappy alarm clock that sounds like a garbage truck backing up.

author: Whatnow
title: Spot does a lot!
content: I got my Echo Spot on Prime Day and love it. I think it still is a little expensive, but the chance to save $30 convinced me to buy it. I basically use it as a radio alarm clock because on my old radio the stations would sometimes not come in clearly. I also like the sleep sounds skill, and hearing the weather. I'm still exploring the other skills...just discovered some Star Trek sounds (Alexa, beam me up) which are fun!

author: Gonetothebeach
title: I loooooove it.
content:
I replaces my Google home with Alexa. I love the video feature, shopping list. Very user friendly. No regrets exchanging my Google for this - it was a gift and I felt bad getting rid of it but Alexa has a lot more features.
I can have Alexa read my books on Kindle while I’m cooking. So so fun!

author: Go Blue Girl

content: Best bed side alarm clock, AI assistant, music player speaker ever. This is the perfect gift for everyone you know!! Love it!!

title: LOVE my

It will add schedules right to your smart phone just to cool.  Get my echo show tomorrow with 7" screen will be able to watch prime TV on it right next to my bed!!!

title: Its great screen could be a little bigger or someway to ...
content: Its great screen could be a little bigger or someway to view arlo cameras in a larger window i know its not the echo show but just in general the vidoe feed window is pretty small

title: Great companion for the Echo SHow.
content: Great for the bedroom. Voice control for alarm. The light is not annoying, like some alarm clocks.

author: Brooklyn Davis
title: 5 stars
content: Great product

author: Jonzey
title: like recipes. It comes with a button that turns ...
content: Ordered this and it is a new staple to the household.  It even plays videos for us, like recipes.  It comes with a button that turns the microphone off.

author: Connie Do
title: Loving my Alexa!
content: Love this thing! I always wanted to get one of the Amazon assistants. I'm glad I got it, now when I wake up every morning the first thing I would say is "Alexa". I was able to get daily weather info and music play to get my day ready. Alexa is a definitely gonna be my everyday thing. Right now I'm not even sure if I can get used to NOT saying it every morning.

author: M. Baryo
title: Awesome little device
content: Love it! Great sound. Like the clock readout, albeit, a bit small for my aging eyes.  Most of all, I love being able to see song lyrics!

author: Minnesota Woodworker
title: I bought an Echo Spot to replace an Echo Dot ...
content: I bought an Echo Spot to replace an Echo Dot hoping that I would find the screen feature as functional as my retired Sony Dash Chumby device. I wish that there was a collection similar to the Sony Dash Apps or Chumby widgets available to use as home cards. I particularly miss having local weather radar cycle along with clock, weather information, and the news. I could do without the Alexa suggestions card displaying, or maybe I just haven't figured out how to turn it off from rotation. At any rate, a little more Chumby-like would go a long way in enhancing the usefulness of the touch screen in my opinion. For instance, maybe one could customize a number of different home screens, giving them a time range to remain activated.

author: Julio C Lara-Villalobos
title: I must admit that anything alexa related is awesome. I have one in each room of the ...
content: Definitely worth it to me. It sits perfectly on my nightstand. I must admit that anything alexa related is awesome. I have one in each room of the house and I love being able to control everything around me with the sound of my voice. The speaker is actually not bad. Fills the bedroom. It's obviously not going to be the loudest speaker in the market given its size, but on that same note, it is pretty loud and the clarity is also nice given the size.

author: Laura
title: SO CUTE!!!!!
content:
This Spot is so cute.  I am using it as an alarm clock in the morning to wake up to the news. The only thing I have to worry about is making sure it snoozes and doesn't dismiss. I also have it turn on the lights when the alarm goes off.

I like that you can use pictures as your home screen, and the clock faces are fun. The only item I am having trouble with is some of the sleep sound skills don't play all night, and I wish some of them I could mix sounds.

author: Mandi
title: so I'll mention what I love most. The screen is nice and clear
content: As soon as this went on sale I jumped on it. It replaced my 20 year old alarm clock. There is lots to the Echo Spot, so I'll mention what I love most. The screen is nice and clear. I love the options for the background. I like that I can tell it to set an alarm and the next morning I can either tap the screen to snooze or slide up to stop - I don't have to tell it to stop and wake my husband. I like that I can ask it to show me who's at the front door and it'll access my Ring doorbell/camera so I can decide if I feel like getting up to answer it. I love that it has all the same functionality as the echo dots but with added visuals - for example, if I'm playing music, it shows the album art in the background. The sound quality is pretty good, so I haven't felt the need to attach a bluetooth speaker. My one and only concern is someone hacking the camera and watching me sleep or change clothes. It's easy enough to turn around, but I never think about it, so I guess I'm not THAT worried.

author: A. Southgate
title: Five Stars
content: Like everything else we own amazon related, it's pretty cool. Kinda expensive, but perfect for our bedroom

author: Christy B.
title: Great item
content: Love this. It’s perfect for me. I got 2 during prime day.

author: Jordan Manuel
title: Great for work!
content: I purchased this for my office at work and it sits directly in front of me beneath my monitor. It's used a lot for music, timers, and seeing future events. It's linked to my google calendar and I can see the invites, meetings, and such. The visual timer is awesome because when I'm working on testing equipment I lose track because I'm working on other projects. The timer keeps me on track. Not to mention it's just a cool display to see the time, date, and weather. People are impressed!

author: Brent A.
title: Great!
content: We replaced our clock radio with the Spot.  Another amazing Echo device!

author: Natasha
title: Useful
content:
Got this for my mom for Christmas and she loves it, she uses it everyday to listen to her audiobooks and music. Ended up getting one for myself to use the video calling
So far so good!

author: Scott
title: I love this thing
content: I love this thing. The technology is still fairly new so some quirks exist. I have two spots, an echo and a dot. They work great, even with each other 98% of the time. I trust amazon will evolve ahead of the pack with voice control in the home. I've already bought lights and an outlet. It is so cool!! I totally recommend!!

author: Paul
title: Very interactive
content: Very good I love it will have to buy more

author: Sara&Brian
title: The best alarm clock + more
content:
My first step into a smart home and I haven't regretted it yet. Definitely a luxurious alarm clock, but a great way to drop in on my dogs and turning on/off my lights. I can't give to much insight yet as this is my first echo. As an echo noob most of this is probably known.

CONS:
- plugin is huge
- screen is a circle so watching videos is a bit difficult

PROS:
- light sensing - dims and brightens as needed
- I can personalize with photos
- I can check my Amazon orders
- can connect to my Spotify (premium only)/Pandora account
- an amazing alarm clock
- controls my lifx bulbs

author: Micah
title: works great just not you tube compatible
content: Not compatible with You Tube which is why I bought it, so my child could ask and see a video.

author: Drake Olivier
title: Really enjoy so far
content: We use the spot for an alarm clock. For that purpose it is great. Love having a fully voice controlled alarm and being able to pull up so much information while I'm still in bed. We used a dot previously but missed being able to just see the time and wanted a sound improvement which the spot delivered.

author: Lexi
title: Buggy
content:
I own 2 Amazon Echos in addition to the Echo Spot. Love my Echos, not in love with my Spot. Right now it's operating as a glorified alarm clock, since I can't listen to my favorite NPR station. Why? No idea. I contacted Amazon to complain that it will not connect whereas my other 2 Echos do, and they said they are "working on it." Hmm. $125 is a lot of money for something that doesn't do everything I'd like it to....

On the bright side, the display is nice. But the speaker quality is only so-so, and since it's buggy about what Tune-In shows it will play, I'm only giving it 3 stars. I'll reconsider increasing my rating if/when Amazon fixes the bugs.

author: Rick H
title: Totally bummed
content: I bought this to serve as a clock and wake alarm for bedroom , I set the clock face to what I wanted and thought all was cool, then within seconds it started to scroll thru flash advertisements for amazon and Alexa , returning to the clock face for only a split second before starting the whole advertisement cycle again, I feel sick to my stomach that this is what I paid 130 bucks for .  From what I know there is no way to undo this.  Signed : totally bummed,  :update, after downloading the newest software it appears amazon fixed this problem, it now only cycles advertisements once upon waking up instead of constantly , it’s still annoying and hope they remove it entirely, I’ve changed rating from one star to three

author: Meg Dolan
title: Love the flexibility

content: A regular alarm clock works better but if you cannot get radio reception like me this is a big upgrade. Way too difficult to setup a radio station for a alarm

author: Tomek

I do recommend getting the stand because when echo spot is sitting on own the camera faces too high up. Echo keeps my kids amused for hours as well too, they even ask Alexa to tell them jokes lol. Downfall is the phone calls and any talking from from one echo to another the voices crack in and out and hard to understand each other, also it takes a good 30 to 40 seconds for camera to focus in.

author: D. Newton

author: Moe

This like the first phone you could see each other with that didn't fly years ago...If someone else don't have one...you can't do a face to face...same here. Good way to get ya to buy your friends and family a gift so you can see each other.. Yeah...get one..they may advance and do more.maybe like play a trailer to a movie or look up your photos.

author: Cuttingchef

author: Betti726
title: Mom Loes it
content: Got this as a gift for my mom and she totally loves it!

author: Fitness Anytime LLC
title: Five Stars
content: The whole family enjoys Echo Spot!  Thank you!

author: M. Soar
title: Some useful features, just a little expensive for what I use it for. YMMV.
content:
I like it but I don't love it. Love the small footprint and the shape, combined with the screen. The screen, about the size of my cell phone, is not something I'd watch videos on. Even on our larger Show I don't watch videos. The speaker quality is so-so, quite tinny. Yes, I could hook up a  speaker, but I bought this for a tight space. Currently using it mostly as an expensive clock/weather device, a grocery list generator, appointment calendar and an intercom (the intercom feature is quite useful and works anywhere we have a device - up stairs, downstairs, basement, shop).

I like the new wake to music feature, wish it would start at lower volume and then get louder - then it would be useful in the bedroom.

Our other issue is that we are running out of useful names, lol. We already had two "Alexa" and an "Echo" and naming the device in our office "Computer" was fun but a disaster, as far as saying the wake work too often. "Her" hearing is quite good and you have to have quite a bit of separation to use the same name. More names, please.

author: Erik Rowe
title: Not worth it
content:
It really hasn’t worked right from the start. I can only adjust the volume on the unit, not the app. It doesn’t recognize any of the other six of my echo devices within my own home. This could be a one off, but this is my experience. I am really not using it any differently than I did with a dot. It’s cool to a see a clock face, but is it worth another hundred dollars?
I am a big fan of Echo devices, just not this one

author: Jennifer Long
title: I love this! We also have Ring Doorbell and I ...
content: I love this! We also have Ring Doorbell and I can ask Alexa to show me the front door and she pulls it right up. I have several routines set up which make it easy to go to bed at night and turn all the lights off at once.

author: Amazon Shopper
title: Forced to accept Audible trial membership!
content:
During setup of our white Echo Spot, repeatedly tapping "No thanks" to Audible's trial offer did nothing, screen would not dismiss. In order to move on and actually use my Spot, I was forced to tap to accept the offer. This was after the Spot had updated itself and restarted. I then had to go to Audible's web site and cancel my membership. I let Audible know about this bug.

I did not have this issue with our Black Echo Spot, and I don't know if the color of the Spot has anything to do with it.

author: Paul French

content: This is an okay alexa device but the screen seems useless deceit for seeing the time. I may as well have bought the echo dot because the spot is overpriced for what you can do with it.

author: Linda

content: I like the shape and small screen for my night stand.  I added numerous Alexa’s and compatibile devices this year.  I am loving building a Smart home.

content: Perfect for the night stand. Disable the camera though if your creeped out by having a camera in the bedroom.

author: abdullah

content: Alexa devices are always amazing! Thank you amazon!

author: Mindy schneider

content: We bought two to use as bedside alarms and clocks.  It's so nice to play sleep sounds with a sleep timer before bed.  Love "start my day" feature in the mornings as well as music and news while I get ready!

author: Amazon Customer
title: cool device and good addition to my smart home
content: cool device and good addition to my smart home.  when you decide to update please make font size adjustable.  the numbers are just too small for those of us with less than perfect sight at night.

author: Gil
title: Much easier than other echo to install because of the ...
content: Much easier than other echo to install because of the touch screen.  Skip the dot and spend more on the Spot.

author: Joseph Short
title: and while it looks like it can be donw via the app
content: Works well, but there's room for improvement.  I primarily use mine as an alarm clock.  But you can only set one alarm at a time.  Ideally I should be able to set up an alarm for weekdays to match my work schedule.  Thus can't be done by voice,  and while it looks like it can be donw via the app, whenever I have tried, it fails to go off at all.

author: xl33tgamerx
title: Only the coolest ever!
content: Out of Alexa, Cortana, Siri and Google Assistant- Alexa is the only one that could even come close to being a competent human, you can talk to her like one and she answers right back! My girlfriend is jealous :)

author: richieee_b
title: Solid Product with Great Video and Sound Quality
content:
Solid product overall. I received this about a week or two ago and it’s been great. Does everything you expect from Alexa and great for setting alarms, getting information and playing music.

I haven’t used it to shop yet, but it seems like it would be useful. Having the screen is awesome and I’ve used it once or twice for video calls. High-quality, seamless video reception when the connection is decent on both ends.

Overall, I like the usefulness of the product and feel it’s a great accessory to have when working from home or just relaxing. I intend to get the light bulbs and other accessories to make my house more Alexa-friendly.

author: mr.jcruze
title: Love it!
content: Love all Amazon devices! This one sits on my desk! Listen to music and gives my a display of the weather and upcoming events!

author: Trey
title: My new bedside companion
content: Great product. Alex is the deal!! You have to purchase the stand which is sold separate. Increases sound quality by 100% with stand.

author: ST
title: A nice technology gadget for living room
content:
With the screen added and actually a better speaker compare to Echo Dot. I notice the microphone sometimes do have some misses compare to the first gen Echo dot but it still work better than the second gen Echo dot I have. With the display It make it a nice device to be placed in living room as a clock providing simple information like local temperature, trending news which sometimes I am lazy to ask Alexa. The two things I wish it’s better....

1. the width of bezel is quite wide but I assuming this is a technology Limitation which hopefully be overcome on next generation.
2. I wish they will later add a button or way to easily get the device back to home screen when user is using touch screen instead of using voice which seem odd when I am using touch screen. Maybe I missed out a way to do it on touch screen which hopefully someone can let me know how.

author: HooiserHawk
title: Great product but shows Amazon doesn't listen to customers feedback.
content: I would give it a five stars but the inability to turn off the "Things to Try" card without turning off all card rotation is really annoying.  People have been complaining for months and Amazon just ignores them!

author: Action Jackson
title: A terrific bedroom alarm clock replacement.
content: A terrific bedroom alarm clock replacement. Nice to have new 21st century tech.  Overall it's a fantastic product, but the text size and video can come across dark sometimes making it a little hard to see.  Also the internal speaker sounds a little flat. I added a Logitech Z50 coffee mug size speaker to it and now it sounds much better. I have it paired the 2 Echo Spots with my 2nd Gen Echos and have a nice sounding whole household sound system. Optionally I can play news and music on it separately if I'm in one of the bedrooms.  I can't wait to see what Amazon comes out with for a 2nd Gen. I've been very pleased with the Echo products so far.

author: Ms. Kathy
title: Great, Easy to use
content: My Echo Spot is Great. I live alone and Alexa can keep me company 😁. I really Love it.

author: D. COOK
title: Love my Echo
content: Love the Echo. We have one at home, one in our guest house and one in our RV. I got this spot for under $100 before Christmas on a special which also included a 6 month interest free payment plan making it affordable.

author: Sherry stout
title: This is a waste of money
content: This is a waste the app won’t down load. The time is off and won’t change. Don’t waste a penny on this.

author: Patty Miles
title: Love my Echo Spot
content: I am very happy with my Echo Spot.  I have the Echo Show in my kitchen and the Echo Spot in my bedroom.  I use it as my alarm clock, music source, weather forecast, nursery rhymes for the children and the list goes on.

author: G. Ponder
title: Nice
content:
Solid device but does have room for improvement. Purchased to replace my bedside alarm clock and so far it has worked out nicely. I do wish there was a larger digital clock face and a button to dismiss the alarm. Currently, when an alarm goes off you can tap to snooze or swipe up to dismiss the alarm. Problem is that if you get out of bed before the alarm goes off, there is no way to dismiss it other than telling Alexa to dismiss the alarm. This isn't a grand option if your wife is still asleep.

I do like having the ability to check my Ring cameras from the Spot. Would like to have a built-in cover for the camera. And wouldn't mind getting severe weather alerts from the Spot (might have this ability but yet to find it).

All in all a great Echo device and not too shabby of a bedside alarm clock.

author: kkjeep3
title: It’s a great unit! Only 4 stars because I have figured ...
content: It’s a great unit!  Only 4 stars because I have figured out how to do a radio/music alarm clock yet!

author: Thomas M. Alewine
title: Try it, you’ll love it!
content:
Neat.  Good replacement for Dot - (‘Dot Senior?’)

Should not have required password for WiFi - maybe WPS option.

author: BLA
title: Very easy to use!!
content: Very handy item to help around the house. Gives all types of information. Easy to use. Still learning all of its features.

author: Jerry  W Bennington Sr
title: Ease of setting up
content: Great little instrument.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Little Product - Great for home automation activities at night
content:
Great addition to our home automation system.  I understand other reviews challenging the value of this item, but we love the convenience of setting an alarm, asking for information, playing sounds that help with sleep, turning on lights throughout the house, and viewing security cameras when needed.

I you are trying to watch movies with this, you will be disappointed, but I don't think that was the intent of the product.

author: Msmjfig
title: I think the spot Is the best Echo product yet
content: I love this thing.  I have the original echo, the fire stick 1, fire stick 2, and now the echo spot.  The echo spot allows me to change the background, I can watch movies on it, Listen to music, use it as an alarm clock, and all the other things as the regular Echo does.  I can even use it with my ring doorbell to see who’s at my door without getting out of bed,  and did I mention my grandkids love it ...lol

author: John Hammel
title: Four Stars
content: Great product. I just wish you could also watch apps like YouTube on it.

author: ibesewkool
title: Five Stars
content: Just as easy to use as all the other echo products. Love it on my nightstand.  Best alarm ever!

author: PRITI  P
title: I absolutely love it.
content: I don’t know why I didn’t get this earlier. I absolutely love it.

author: stanley
title: it's great but after a few hours it stop responding
content: This is the second unit and it still doesn't work properly.  When it works, it's great but after a few hours it stop responding.  I had to constantly reset it and it would sometimes work after.  I returned it and they send me a new one but same problem.  I'll give it another day or so and will most likely return it.

author: Karla Contreras
title: Love it
content: Love being able to connect w my Mom at home n to have her need to connect w just the drop option. Thank you.

author: K. Witt
title: A Winner!!!
content: I love this little machine!  I use it as a sound machine, alarm clock (waking to my music) and radio/weather forecaster.  It's great.  The only thing I would like different, as so many others have suggested, is for the screen to stay on the second face showing digital time and temperature.

author: Cj
title: Easy to use
content: So easy to set up and use! Using for music and an alarm on my bedside table. No holding down multiple buttons to set the alarm. Also no resetting when power goes out. Weather report each morning before I get up for work. I surely haven’t discovered all it can do, but would highly recommend for convenience and ease of use.

author: kevin haun
title: Grand tour alarm
content: Right, good morning... Jeremy clarkson waking me up and banter with the other two makes me smile every single morning. Nothing to do with the spot but God I love that

author: David Beers
title: Great
content: Love it

author: Shawn Colton
title: Bought two ... screen flickers.
content: There's something wrong with these units.  We bought two for our nightstands as alarm clocks and within 6 months both screens have this twitchy flicker that happens constantly.  Researching on the internet, I see many with the same problem, but no fix (even the replacement ones they receive will start to flicker after a few months).  Amazon should recall these units and send us the new model.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Fun and functional
content: The Echo spot is a fun & functional little gadget and Alexa is very similar to Siri .  In addition to playing a variety of games it provides the weather & news, tells jokes and even stories.  I love using it to control my 2 Sonos speakers by simply saying something like play “Willie Nelson in the living room”.  It is also helpful for creating handsfree shopping lists and for playing soothing sounds to help you sleep like the ocean or thunder.  It currently can do several tasks and more are being added daily.  Can’t wait to add smart home functionality to control lights etc.

author: Jordan Theune
title: Great multimedia device
content: We have used the device mainly as a music/podcast player and it has far exceeded our expectations. Sound quality is fantastic and volume is terrific. The video quality is fair but being that most videos need to be watched in a rectangle shape it becomes difficult to see any real detail. I would definitely recommend this product

author: Rory Teape
title: Nice product with one negative
content: Works as expected. The only negative for me is that the video does not show on the entire screen when viewing cameras but rather in a small box

author: Michael J Russo
title: Great addition to the Echo line in the house
content: Have it on the nightstand to be used as a clock, radio, and to perform smart functions throughout the house.  Don't care for the active suggestions- would prefer on option to turn that off so I can just view the clock.

author: Rizzemm
title: Love it
content: Love this device. Good sound and Video.

author: Al Skaar
title: A disappointment.
content: I'm disappointed with this product because it could be so much more than a glorified alarm clock if it only had an adjustable base. It has everything it needs to be extremely versatile but it is limited by its form factor. We bought 2, intending to use them as an upstairs/downstairs intercom and as pet cams. But you can't aim the blasted things. I've since discovered much, much cheaper and more versatile options and regret having spent so much on a device with sadly unrealized potential.

author: Angelia
title: Waste of money
content: My echo spot cannot hear very well and listen to me it does not connect and communicate better than the echo that I like the echo.better is not efficient in the way I thought it would be

author: Lee
title: Love it better then the Dot.
content: I bought 2. One for my wife and one for the grandkids that live out of state. Set them up and now all the girls need to do is ask Alex to call Nanna. They get to see and talk to one another at any time they want. ALso, anyone in your phone list that has one shows up as well.

author: Jon
title: Cool Alarm Clock, That's About It
content: A great alarm clock. Sadly I don't have much use for the bells and whistles outside of that so its potential is lost on me. A cool gadget overall though, only slightly regret the purchase.

author: Pat M.
title: The Amazon Spot is a nice bedroom companion
content: We love it actually. Works well, we get the weather info first thing, Alec Baldwin wakes my wife up and we like asking questions at night while watching TV. Just the right size for the bedside table.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Gorgeous looking
content: Love it getting use to it and Alexa is getting use to my voice . Sometimes she doesn't answer but I think it has to do when internet is low or is updating or my voice isn't strong. Over all I haven't had any of the annoying stuff that everyone is complaining about. Thank goodness I didn't listen to those reviews.  And paid attention to the Apple guy .

author: annette
title: so far I love it--i can see my RING camera view instead of ...
content: so far I love it--i can see my RING camera  view instead of grabbing phone--i havent had much time to play with it but I like the lyrics playing ---this was my newest edition. Have  the Tap, the dot and now the spot--my favorite of all three.  though the tap can't be connected to the other two I like the sound better on the tap

author: cherie dankas
title: Not compatible w/Ring equipment
content: My daughter gave me the Echo Spot thinking it was compatible (as a result of Amazon advertising) but it isn't.  Contacted Ring and they said they are negotiating w/Amazon, but details haven't been worked out yet!  Aside from not working for the reason purchased, it's a fun handy gadget!

author: STEBOU
title: Use it all the time
content: Great toy for 66 year old kid

author: Kindle Customer
title: Alexa with video
content:
Although it comes in a smaller package than its superior model, it gives you all the features that you would expect.
While some may prefer a larger screen this unit is unobtrusive when placed in a bedroom or living room.
You can also change its wake word so that it does not conflict with existing Alexa devices.

author: J. MacDonlad
title: It sets up very easily. With the exception above, it works very well.
content: I am still trying to get it configured completely. I want it to display the Ring 2 view when it gets movement or the doorbell gets pressed.  Right now I have to ask Alexa to show me the view. Most of the time there is no one still there.

author: Jinxabit
title: It’s small and light! Great for tight spaces!!
content: Works great and makes communication with the aging parents a daily visual event for the grandkid! It’s a ‘win, win’!  Price was ok.  Screen is smaller and it’s light, therefore is mobile.
