author: Dan Healy
title: Love it!
content: Great product! Cheapest price found here!

author: KADE CERVANTEZ
title: Put down your expectations and try!
content: I placed this on my desk at work and it’s been the most amazing gadget I’ve owned to date. It helps my productivity and keeps me entertained at the same time. Haters gunna hate With all things but these products have layed the ground work for amazing things to come

author: Scooter
title: GREAT PRODUCT
content: BOUGHT AS A GIFT THEY STATED BEST GIFT THEY RECEIVED FOR CHRISTMAS

author: ronvin
title: Get one.  You will love it!
content: If you are looking for a big sound get the echo.  The Spot is a perfect addition to your bedroom table.  It looks great and is perfect for waking up to your favorite music.  It will continue to improve as functions are added.

author: Paul V.
title: Perfect
content: The Spot works great if you can find a good reason to buy 1.  So far we've just used a little for fun.  It doesn't really have a place in our lifestyle.

author: Meranda mARION
title: Great device
content: This is my first Alexa device and it is so fun to discover all of the ways to use it. The biggest con with me is the "drop-in" feature, it's pretty creepy

author: William Yang
title: Five Stars
content: i really love this! looks good with my table!

author: Mary Ann Marrelli
title: Really neat gadget
content: My Husband and I love the Echo Spot.  We've added it to our collection of Echo Products.  It's better than my old alarm clock.  I can tell it what time to wake me up. I can play ocean sounds (among others) when I want to relax. It will also read me any audio book I have downloaded. I wake up and tell Alexa "Good Morning", the weather, news and the theme for the day.  I also ask her for a joke!

author: Brandon
title: Nice echo for the nighstand
content:
The Echo Spot is good for a nightstand. I replaced an original Echo with the Echo Spot.

Setup was quick as easy with the Alexa App. There is some additional configuration that can be done on the device to change the clock face and home screen background. All together it took less than 15 minutes to set up and install the latest software.

Setting up my recurring alarms was easy using the Alexa app. The Clock face shows the time that the alarm is set for, this is helpful for quickly seeing if the alarm you are expecting is enabled. When the alarm goes off, the display gives a huge advantage over a regular Echo. You can snooze the alarm by clicking on the screen or swipe up to dismiss the alarm instead of having to talk to Alexa.

I was originally concerned that the display would be distracting / too bright at night. Thankfully, the screen gets very dim and switches to a digital clock with red text when not actively being used. It's not too bright and easy on the eyes when glancing at in a dark room.

Similarly to the Echo Show during the day the display scrolls through some trending articles or suggested actions to try. I always like to see these and it's a nice feature.

Overall I have been happy with the device so far!

author: Gwenann
title: I’m enjoying my Echo Spot
content: I like how easy it is to use and learn the Alexa latest and greatest! And I don't need a beside clock or wall clock anymore.

author: Aardee
title: Loving new member of my Alexa family
content: I am a hardcore fan of Echo. Infact I am in love with all members of my Alexa family. I have Echo, Echo Dot, Echo Plus and now this new toddler Echo Spot. Every variant has its own beauty. I love feel and size of Echo Spot. It’s fabulous as far as looks are concerned. It does not have great Audio quality (which I did not expect at the time of placing order because of its compact and small size). I bought it to connect with my Bose SoundTouch.

author: Grchome
title: Very Smart
content: Alexa is very smart and at my age, I need something smart to keep me on my toes. She plays me meditation music before going to sleep and shuts off whatever time I want her to. Anthing that can serenade me to sleep is a good friend of mine.. 😊

author: TurkeyMan
title: Perfect size
content: Perfect size for the bathroom.

author: M. Donnelly
title: LOVE this little device...and the ability to view my security cams from my bedside!
content:
Ever since I got some smart home devices (plugs and bulbs), I've been an Echo convert. Now that the Echo Spot is here, I can also view my web cams from the Echo device...totally great! I've replaced my old clock radio with the Echo Spot. Now I can set alarms, view security cams, turn lights on and off and more right from my bedside. With more and more skills being added every day, the network of Echo devices have even converted my non-techie husband into a believer!

Note: I did turn off the camera mode from the Echo Spot. It is creepy to have a bedside cam. :-)

author: mikeisit86
title: Cool but creepy
content: It’s smaller than the picture screen version but can still has a screen, unlike the Dot. But it is a little creepy. Had a tech issue and suppport could access it remotely. So basically, anybody can access a camera in your bedroom.

author: Shacky
title: I like it better than the Show.
content: I like it more than the Echo Show. I have several echo devices through the house and love the multi room music feature.  It is on everyday. When the Show came out, I bought one for my bed stand.  It was fine but a little big. Plus, when you do multi room music, the show will only play on it's internal speaker and I had a nice pair of powered bookshelf speakers I wanted to use.  It switched back and forth constantly if it was streaming multi room, just this device, etc.  The new Spot has a 3.5mm speaker jack, so that is no longer an issue.  All audio comes out of my speakers.  The size of the Spot is perfect for the bed stand and even with my fuzzy vision without glasses, I can easily see what time it is at night. Note to Amazon: We still need the ability for an Echo device to be in more than one multi-room music group!  Right now, if you have an "everywhere" group and put all your devices in it, you can not then do an upstairs or a downstairs or an outside group.  Multi-room music is great!  But, this limitation just doesn't make sense.

author: hiway12
title: Really, the only Alexa device I need around the house
content: Love my Spot. Really, the only Alexa device I need around the house! Just a glance keeps me up to date. Don't need the large screen, large speaker devices. It's a tool, right?

author: Daniel Cano
title: Perfect
content:
Love this Echo Spot
Haven’t had problem with this

author: Barbara
title: Love the visual!
content: Bought the Echo Spot for my desk.  Not too big, and not too small.  Love the visual, great for spelling words, pronouncing words in English and other languages and being able to see how they're spelled.  Use clock, timer and weather all day long.

author: D. Weiss
title: Very good, but needs further development
content:
It's not perfect, but I really like this little gizmo. i bought it primarily for 2 purposes. First, so I could set wake-up alarms by individual days, and set the wake-up music individually by the day. Second, I wanted to control a bedroom light by voice, so I could shut it off as I was falling asleep, without having to get out of bed to turn a switch. The Echo Spot, together with a smart plug,has been able to accomplish that. A bonus has been getting Alexa to play music from my Amazon Prime playlists.
What's not so great is that sometimes Alexa has a really hard time understanding instructions, and repeating and altering the way you say things can get pretty frustrating. Hopefully the AI gets better in the future, along with added functions.

author: this app is amazing
title: Beware of adding any subscriptions.
content:
We purchased the echo spot in an effort to see if it would help my father.  My father is 85, nearly deaf, battling dementia and has recently dealt with the death of my mother.  He feels alone and isolated.  In setting up the echo, I was asked by Alexa if I wanted to try the one month of amazon music unlimited for free.  I said yes.

We removed the card on file so that no random charges were made either by amazon or more importantly by my father as he learns to work with the spot.

On Jan. 1st, (2 weeks after I received the device) I began receiving emails that in the attempt to renew my subscription, they had problems.  When I contacted customer service to ask why they were trying to bill me, they first said they would bill and then refund the amount for the 30 days (Harley told me this).  Heidi then told me that they just happened to notice that the card was not working (there was no card to work).  I then asked to speak to a supervisor.  Joey A then got on the phone and tried to say that the emails were a mistake that the wrong ones were sent.  I asked him to explain then why the free trial was canceled.  He told me they need to validate a card.  I asked where it says I do not have the right to remove a card at any time I choose, and where it says that Amazon has the right to bill me whenever they want.

I was told it doesn't matter, that if I refuse, then they will not fulfill their agreement.

If you have purchased this, check your card... you likely did not receive a full month free trial of the amazon music.
Likely the same is being done on other subscriptions.

author: angel
title: I love my Echo Spot
content: I love my Echo Spot.  I have it in my bedroom and do a nightly meditation before sleep. I also am able to use it to call down to another room to speak to my children if need be. I also purchased an eyeball camera that I will be installing at my front door. With my spot I will be able to ask to see outside on that camera at any time I want.

author: eddie v garcia
title: Needs Work
content:
So overall it is a cool device BUT:
1. Hey Amazon, make this so that it is NOT tied to a power cord.....Recharge at night is OK, but give us the opportunity to move it around as the camera does NOT pick up a decent wide angle
2. What's the deal with the camera function not being able to choose between YES accept video call or NOT? I mean, give us the choice to reject a video call but take an audio call
3. I am having trouble finding if the camera is ALWAYS on and therefore any incoming video call AUTO accepts

Thanks

author: Christian
title: This is the best alarm clock
content: This is the best alarm clock. I get to chose which song or artist I want to wait up to. She is very good at understanding you. I hated to fold and put away my clothes but now I am having fun by listening to music and having her tell me a joke, the weather, or what happened today in history. This thing is awesome!

author: Regina
title: love to have music played through Echo
content: Getting use to calling Alexa every time is amusing, when my husband ask me what is her name again.

author: eduardo de los santos
title: not what i was expecting it to be
content: The only thing i liked about this product was the outer design of it. everytime i ask Alexa to do something or say something it didn't respond at all, unless it was one of the predetermine word/saying. not the product for me at this moment and time.

author: Jin
title: love this alexa
content: love this alexa! music sounds great coming from this little guy. I had speakers to attach, but didn't need them. she hears you loud and clear and just makes everything easier for this busy mom. my favorite is the shopping list alexa makes for me and her telling me what's on my calendar. my middle child loves opening the magic door with alexa. my oldest loves the games she can play and my tiniest loves singing along with her! The hubs even loves calling through her so we can see him on the screen. great Spot!!!

author: Jon
title: Good but could be better.
content: This being my 4th Eco product, but I have the same comment as majority of those one star comments, very easy to use however I really would like to be able turn off the things to try. I do enjoy receiving updates of weather and other things but having other echoes, I already know the things to try. I do understand you can turn them off by going to the home clocks settings, and making it scroll only once,  but then you won't get the other things that I do enjoy getting like the weather or sports updates. Amazon please fix this, and then you would get 5 stars from me!

author: LOUIS
title: Works as advertised
content: Great product would buy again

author: J. A. Trammell
title: Love it!
content: I love this thing!

author: Louline Marchese
title: Small but powerful!
content: Really love my spot - nice to be able to watch videos, see the lyrics to songs, etc.  I am always trying out the suggestions to see what Alexa can do

author: Cleansmile63
title: Five Stars
content: We love this little ball.  Wish the speaker was a bit stronger.

author: M. Romano
title: Five Stars
content: This little guy is great. So much smarter than my first generation Alexa.

author: Mauricio Ibarra
title: Great device for video calls
content: I bought the spot so my kids can video chat with my mom whenever they want. The drop in feature is great as my mom isn't tech savvy at all. Video and sound quality are excellent. I will be buying a 2nd one for myself.

author: Advance Kimballs
title: SO Cute
content: Love Amazon. Love that this allows me to 'visit' my 91 year old mom 2.5 hours away. purchased the stand which allows you to angle the camera better. Wish the show could angle the camera.

author: a.mkua
title: Get one!
content: I like everything about this device!  The skills are amazing.

author: LEELAWS
title: item returned for repair, receivded item back from repair ...
content: item returned for repair ,receivded item back from repair 07/23/18 . parts missing no power cord included.please advise

author: Debra Anding Fiore
title: I love it and it makes being a caretaker easier....
content:
I first acquired Alexa capabilities with my Fire tablet and dabbled with it here and there. Finally decided to get a proper Echo device on Black Friday, and I'm so glad that I did. I'm using it all the time now and it's making my life easier with helping with reminders for being a caretaker for my mother with meds, scheduling, PT, and all other types of things. It's also great for when looking things up and easily pulling up my Spotify or Audible books when I have a bit of downtime.

I'm just scratching the surface of the Alexa skills, and there are so many fun and helpful things to choose from. I picked up an additional speaker only echo dot for my mom's room, and am slowly converting some of our household electronics into smart options. Just got the Phillip Hue bulbs installed - they're great and will give my mom some more independence and we've got smart plugs on the way. They also work with the Wyze cameras we recently installed. We've got one of them set up like a video baby monitor so we can check on her without having to wake her up all night or if her bed alarm goes off and we need to see if she got up on her own (she has a tendency to fall) or just rolling over.

I ordered this screen protector with it and it's a perfect fit and provides privacy/security from the camera.
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07FKNC7P6/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o02_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1

author: Sparky 212
title: Five Stars
content: I love this Echo.  Perfect for my bedside stand.

author: Maida Sedman
title: Great little gadget
content: Love this . Got it as a gift from my daughter and really love asking for recipes and getting the temperature and weather. Thinking of getting a doorbell that’s comparable so we can see who is outside.

author: Kenneth Olson
title: PROS - It was easy to setup - Desktop web app is nice - ...
content:
PROS
- It was easy to setup
- Desktop web app is nice
- One setup for all Alexa devices
- Very responsive

Tips: Get to know Skills and Routines. As well as Smart Home Devices, Groups and Scenes.

CONS
- Assistant isn't very good at answering questions
- No way to Drop In from the smartphone app
- Can't delay commands
- Built-in Custom responses only, so can't create custom responses
- Can't change use custom trigger Wake Up names or voices to anything but Alexa, Computer, Echo, Amazon
- Doesn't support Google Play Music service
- Doesn't support Skype, Hangouts, Telegram, etc.
- Scenes can be disabled from the mobile app, but not from desktop
- You can link a Google Calendar and asked what is scheduled for particular day as well as add appointments
- Since Google and Amazon are fighting, of course there's no way to play YouTube
- Asking Alexa to play a specific song on iHeartRadio never plays the correct song
- Unless you have a Spotify subscription don't expect many targeted music choices
- I asked Alexa some basic questions pertaining to an Amazon subscription, to which she couldn't answer. What benefit's are included in a basic Amazon membership? What benefit's are included in an Amazon non-prime membership? What's included with an Amazon Prime Membership? LOL
- Beware that as others have reported the integration with the Skybell HD is not a all what you would expect, as it does NOT alert the Echo Spot to motion detection or doorbell press. Even when you say "Alexa tell Skybell to record video" no video shows on the Echo Spot. Don't expect anything other than a simple Dot functionality!!!

author: Charlotte Erickson
title: Perfect For Communicating With Others!
content: I use this as my bedroom clock, just the right size. I have an Echo Show in my living room. Now before I go to bed or get up in the morning, I can receive face to face calls and also check on the weather, etc.

author: Ginaba
title: What a fun little device!!
content: I really like my new spot.  I put one in my daughter's room and it is much easier than yelling for her all over the house- to just call her through it.  I also like the different clock faces.

author: Documented Patriot
title: Simple way to transfer your home from "dumb" to "smart"
content:
I got this on Prime day and figured I'd see what all the hype is about.  Honestly I didn't really want to like it as personally bugging my house seems kinda weird, but honestly, I love it.  Like it or not this is the way the world is going, so why not.

I loved it so much I ordered 2.  I didn't get the Show because it looks like it came from the 1990's and is downright ugly.  I have no interest on watching anything on these devices anyway, so the Spot's screen does not bother me - although it is very clear.

Alexa can hear you from pretty much everywhere.  My favorite part about this is having it in our living room where it's hooked up to our bluetooth soundbar - where I can just say play any song I want and it will.  I guess I could just pick up my smartphone to do that, but you don't know how much easier it is to interact with media using your voice rather than navigating through multiple pages.

The one thing that I am not a fan of is the home screen cards do not really rotate that much - they also do not rotate when playing music.  I'd love for it to display the weather as I listen to music.

The screen is clear and I also really enjoy Alexa being able to tell me how my commute will be - there is a great skill that you can download that will tell you traffic to 5 different places (that you program and name) so you can say alexa give me traffic to my parents - and she will tell you the best route and time you will arrive in current traffic.  I have this programmed for my parents, fiances parents, work, and her work.  So it really works great.

The one thing that I actually preferred the Dot over the Spot is the dot will light up different colors when you have package notifications.. I have not seen the Spot really do much for package notifications yet.  The dot it was very easy to tell when something was delivered.  I would recommend Amazon do exactly what they did for the Dot but on the Spot - the Dot lights up colors - why can't the Spot ?  The same way you command alexa and you get that blue ring, just make that ring yellow when a package is updated for delivery.

Overall it's a great device that I am looking forward to integrating my home around.  I'm already looking at dash buttons, smart plugs, etc..- and = when I become a home owner instead of renting where I can't tinker with my thermostat I will be purchasing a Nest down the road for HVAC integration.

author: Tess E
title: Cute little thing
content: Cute! I’m still learning what it can do but loving what I use.  Like Amazon music and reminders. I have it hooked up to speakers. Sounds great.

author: B.T.A.
title: Amazing Spot!!😎
content: An amazing little piece of technology!! Well worth the price as I was more impressed with it's size and functions than I expected! 😎

author: Siva Vaidya
title: Great Amazon Echo - Hats off
content: Love the Echo Spot - intuitive design, and compact, use it daily, frequently, digital assistant so versatile and lots of use for our daily life

author: Joe
title: This makes a great alarm clock as well as an entertainment center for ...
content: This makes a great alarm clock as well as an entertainment center for your music, books, radio stations etc....  The reason for only three stars is when I play my Amazon Prime music subscription on the spot, the lyrics will only stay on the screen a very short time and I have to keep telling it to show lyrics or get the lyrics back by touching the screen.  This is one of the main reasons I purchased this is so I can have the lyrics to the music I'm listening to.  I have tried to change all the setting available but nothing fixes this problem.  I can only hope Amazon reads some of these reviews and does a software update to take care of this problem.  Not keeping my fingers crossed though.  Its a shame that the money I spent on this has this fatal flaw.  If I wanted to listen to music without lyrics I would just keep listening to music on my Echo.  So sad, too bad.

author: John Fernandes
title: Excellent item.  Will buy more without hesitation.
content: This thing is simply excellent.  It just woks beautifully and reliably.  We can say, "show me the front door" and answer the Nest video doorbell without any issues.  We also control the thermostats in the house as well as all of the Caseta and Phillips Hue lights throughout the house.  The news feed service as well as other services through amazon are truly excellent.  I use the google assistant for informational issues and complex computing tasks, etc.  I always get an answer from Google.  Alexa is about 50% effective for informational issues, but excellent for home control.  Music is okay, but mediocre.  The Apple HomePod is totally useless for anything other than music - which knocks everything out of the park.  So I have all three of these devices and I could not be happier.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Lower cost on the stand, able to view You Tube.
content: I really, really like the Echo Spot. I do wish you would settle with Google so we can watch You Tube on the Echo Spot. It is in my special needs son's room and he loves You Tube. He has to leave his room and go downstairs and get on the computer to see his favorite You Tube videos. That is a real nuisance. So only 4 stars.Also the cost of the stand was pricey, but I paid if for my son.

author: SARAH E O'CONNELL
title: Love it!
content: A gift for our 9 year old son and he loves it.  I feel like we could have one in each room.  Alexa tell us the weather and when stores open/close.  She plays music for us for dance parties and for sleeping.  The speaker works well- not amazing, but definitely good for a bedroom.  My son says "She can sing songs unlike Siri".  Haha.  Anyway, we will probably also set one up in the babies room to use as a monitor and for music.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: my alarm clock/ morning get ready for the day music

author: KarenElyse
title: Paid for new got a factory refurbished
content: It’s been used, and is slower then the other Alexa spot I bought my parents. Bought both at the same time hooked them both up and this was updating. Be the other one didn’t. I bought a new one not a factory refurbished one

author: cuppie
title: Great alarm clock but do not buy it for a Ring doorbell.
content:
Beautiful, easy set up but can not get a clear image from my Ring doorbell. Even right next to the doorbell.
iPad and iPhone look perfect but spot keeps buffering. I have a string fiber WiFi.

author: Truth Ink Tattoos
title: Worth the money and very impressive.
content: Love it. Only thing is the screen is a little small, but very crisp. Works faster than the other Alexa’s, (show,dot). As a bedside, it’s the best. Not really for larger areas as the size is hard to see from across a room. Would of done 5 stars but I wish it was a little larger.

author: Amazon Customer
title: not what I expected
content: this product was not what I expected.  I do not want Skype and the people that I wanted to facetime with did not want Skype.  It was not clearly explained until after purchase.  I returned the echo.

author: runner
title: a must have
content: received for christmas,  and i love it easy to set up works as expected can control all my lights from the bedroom

author: terribaus
title: So much fun!!!
content: I have never had as much fun as I’ve had with the echo spot! I did however go on eBay and buy a brand new one for $40 cheaper! So I will buy them from now on from eBay.

author: Rita Eason
title: Echo spot
content: Love love love it

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very easy to deal with, quick delivery
content: As described but returned and got the bigger one with screen

author: Nancy L. Pollack
title: Love the screen and the periodic fun questions that appear ...
content: Fabulous new gadget!!!  Love the screen and the periodic fun questions that appear on the screen.

author: Michael Wilson Sr
title: This thing is addictive
content: The Spot has meet all expectations and more. I'm still learning more of what it is capable of doing. My only wish is that I could see through the spot from my smart phone.

author: John H Madison WI
title: I wanted this to work more than it did!
content: I want to love this device! But I can not I tried everything with it to make it work correctly including getting help from Amazon! I will say “Alexa” and all 3 of my devices answer and create confusion they are quite a distance from each other! I spent over $1600. For Christmas to make my home smart! Phillips bulbs of all kinds many Echo devices different smart bulbs, plugs and switches! Unfortunately I only have 2 weeks to return and now I will have to return all of it! I more than anyone wanted this to work even a little bit would have been nice.

author: Robert Caldon
title: This little device works well for us. You can ...
content: This little device works well for us. You can ask it to bring up the camera at the door, when you are at the other end of the house.

author: Heather L. Inscore
title: Don’t really recxomend.
content: The “Alexa” part of it works fine, but the WHOLE REASON we bought this was because of the camera so my kids can talk to my parents. I purchased them one as well. We can hardly see each other the camera are so dark and you can only hear like 1 our of every 10 words its to glitchy. Would return if I was still in the window for it.

author: Randolph L. Todd
title: I love gadgets. And this is a great one
content:
I love gadgets. And this is a great one! We use Alexa in all the rooms of our house, and Echo Spot allows us to see our Ring Doorbell.

This product is awesome. Highly Recommended.

author: Mary
title: If you have multiple devices
content: Need to buy family plan of amazon music ,which is priced too high, if you have multiple devices, to get any good music.

author: Joy V
title: IT REALLY DOES ALERT YOU IF SOMEONE/OR THING IS BY THE DOOR
content: What a wonderful product.  Delivery people do not always ring the bell for signature for deliveries, so this alerts you that someone is is there,  If they do manage to ring the bell you get the picture of who is there.  Living in the desert, we get havalina and bobcats by the door as well, so fun to see who or what is there.

author: D. Lo
title: Great little gizmo!
content: For what it does, the Echo Spot does it very well. I use it as a bedside alarm clock, white noise machine, music player and news reader.

author: jason mauney
title: Five Stars
content: Great little night stand alarm clock.

author: Leonor M.
title: Alexa
content: I liked that it informs how many calories a certain food has. I also like the music choices. However, needs more information on other subjects.

author: Clayton J. Knight
title: I wish I had known how dumb Alexa really was
content: I truly wish Alexa were more intelligent. The hardware is nice, but severely handicapped by issues setting alarms, controlling lights, and the inability to easily add multiple accounts. It literally just sits and serves as a bedside clock at this point, with my Google Home being my go-to for everything. I'll Craigslist it for $40 when screen-based devices with Google Assistant finally launch.

author: Utilitarian
title: Probably my favorite Echo device I've bought so far
content:
Does all the usual amazing Echo stuff. Additionally, it's tiny, makes a great alarm clock (and dims to the perfect brightness at night), and is able to do all the neat tricks like visualizing lyrics as songs play. Sound quality is good enough, and just like any Echo device, it will connect with a better speaker via Bluetooth if that's not good enough for you.

I'm also fairly happy with the news content it pushes at me; it always seems to find a story I'm interested in, with video available if I ask it to show me a particular topic it's suggested. And, of course, all the little suggestions and tips on how to use Alexa features you may not have heard of. Easily ignored, but there if you care.

If I had more than one, I'd probably have something to say about the video chat, but I don't. Same for compatible cameras; I hear it's good for that sort of thing, but who knows. All I can say is that whether you use it as a standalone device or have it on a network with other Alexa-enabled devices, it does exactly what you'd expect and hope for.

author: GoDark
title: Usable as a Dumb Clock ... but not Ready for Prime Time as an "Alexa" Device
content:
We needed a clock viewable somewhere around our large-screen TV/entertainment center after cutting the cord with Verizon and returning the FIOS box.  Replacement clocks were either too large or too small ... or, were bedroom alarm clocks.  I read the reviews and knew that I was getting into with the SPOT -- NOT READY FOR PRIME TIME.  I bought it anyway because I liked the form factor.  Everything the negative reviews related are true.  Awaken it with any request and it cycles through "cards" of perfectly useless and, from a distance, unreadable screen dribble such as Trending News and long lists of things SPOT can do.  You can't read the time until the dribble is over.

Using the Internet, I learned how to selectively start turning off features in an attempt to stop the screen dribble.  I only left the ability to ask SPOT to the tell us the weather ... and then the screen dribble started again.  SOLUTION: Turn off EVERYTHING.  Now SPOT is a $99 dumb clock without screen dribble that interferes with our ability to tell the time.  For us, that's okay.  SPOT sits close to two ECHO PLUSES + Subwoofer tied into a fantastic, networked stereo system for Amason Prime music.  "Alexa" via the Echo Pluses can give us everything we need from those devices.

SPOT met our minimum requirement for a  nice looking but expensive $99 dump clock to sit atop one of our stereo speakers.  Rating as a dumb clock FIVE STARS.  Rating as an "Alexa" device ONE STAR ... and that is being very charitable.  Looking forward to SPOT updates to someday make the new clock fit/network in with our other "Alexa" devices.  That aside, it is a very, very nice looking dumb clock.  Highly recommended for its aesthetic qualities.

author: David Anderson
title: Five Stars
content: Love my echo spot nice screen as advertised love it

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great addition to your home
content:
It has been able to interpret my instructions pretty well right from the start, even from a distance. A lot of the skills are excellent. I've added a few of the late shows to my flash briefing but it's ridiculous that it can't access YouTube.
It might be important to note that adding an event to your calendar is a task; it seems to have difficulty with the time span of an event. I imagine this is a functionality people would use often.

author: Hindemith
title: What a beauty!
content:
I love the Echo Spot.

I am using it as a replacement for my bedroom alarm clock and it is just so much better than an old school alarm clock. And I don't have to change to daylight savings time twice a year anymore. Hallelujah!

This is a sturdy, elegant looking little Echo unit with a dazzling screen! There are about two dozen clock faces to choose from, digital or analog and they are all beautiful … my favorite is “High Contrast” because it looks like watercolors. Amazon is adding new clock faces all the time too.

I used to have to fiddle with the controls on my alarm clock to change the alarm time. Now I just tell Alexa to "set an alarm for 9am" and she sets a one-time alarm for me. If you want to wake up every day at 9am just say "recurring" when you set the alarm. She does everything for you.

"Show my alarms" or "show my reminders" will list your alarms and reminders on the screen.

Of course, the Spot does so much more than this... listen to music, ask questions, get the news and weather, show the front door camera (if you have a security camera that works with Alexa), video calling, text messaging, calendar, play sleep sounds to fall asleep to (my favorite is "play train sounds"). I don't know why but the clickity clack of rail cars puts me to sleep... maybe because I grew up right next to train tracks when I was a kid in Chicago. There are so many other sleep sounds to choose, from frogs and crickets, to rain, thunderstorms, and ocean waves just to name a few.

Anyway, I can't say enough good things about the Echo Spot ... I own two Echo Shows, and one Echo Spot. And I love them all! The Echo Show plays music with incredible speakers and actually shows the album cover of the song being played. I use Pandora for music on the Spot and Show but you can choose from Amazon Music, Spotify, and many others!

author: Arianna
title: Love it.
content: This may be one of the best purchases I ever made. She can tell me almost anything and the sound quality is phenomenal!

author: Honey
title: Great technology
content: I keep this 1 by my bed.  Great alarm clock and lots of useful information.  I also love that I can play my spa music to get myself to sleep!

author: AbeK
title: Great upgrade from the Echo Dot
content:
Really great - I replaced an Echo Dot with this. The small touch screen is quite useful and is always flashing interesting stuff.

The only thing to keep in mind is that it has a camera, so you may want to consider where you place it. Amazon and everyone will claim they aren't always "watching," but of course there's no way to validate that. And there's always the risk of hackers hijacking the camera without you knowing.

author: E. Okorie
title: Five Stars
content: Same as the original but with a screen!

author: Juan
title: No Ethernet port. Video chat lag.
content: Great device for Alexa features such as music and displaying recipes on the screen. However, this is horrible when it comes to video chat. I own two Nucleus devices which are hardwired Power Over Ethernet. Video connection is instant with no lag. The Spot has a delay during video chat and it takes a while to establish the connection. Why is there no Ethernet port on this device? Why can't I video chat with the Nucleus or vice versa? Amazon claims they believe in giving people options, but they have severely restricted the features on non Amazon devices. Now I have to make a choice between Amazon devices or Nucleus for an intercom system. The reliabilIty of the Nucleus is a strong winning point.

author: Megan McVay
title: I love this little guy!
content: I love this little guy.  I have an Echo Plus in my living room, an Echo Dot in my kitchen, and this Echo Spot in my bedroom.  It is the perfect alarm clock, speaker, reminder, timer and assistant.  I find it amusing how quickly I have gotten use to having Alexa always within earshot.  Paired with some smart plugs I purchased on Amazon I can control my lights, check on my pet, drop in on friends, make hands free calls and listen to music whenever I want.  I highly recommend anything from the Echo series, especially this adorable little Spot!

author: Paul H.
title: It’s perfect to replace my old alarm clock
content: It’s perfect to replace my old alarm clock. And plus all alexa skills, I don’t know what else that I need

author: Lschwindt
title: Fun for my aging parents
content: Bought this for my senior parents! The nice thing about this item is it will make calls for you. My mother recently fell and I thought it could be a safety item for her to be able to call out for help. No way would she consider a medic alert.

author: SimpleJimmy
title: Echo Show replacement
content: This is one nifty, polished device. Build quality is solid. It's a little bigger than I thought it would be but in a good way. It does nearly everything the Echo Show does (everything I use the Show for, anyway) and does it a bit more stylishly. If you were on the fence about whether you should get the Spot or the Show, I'd say go with the Spot.

author: Angela  L
title: Must have
content: Love it! The clock face is great to use as a clock for our bedroom.

author: Kerri C.
title: Normally I don't like product reviews
content: Normally I don't like product reviews, however, I felt compelled to do so. I think the Amazon developers did a wonderful job in making this spot. My family and I absolutely love it however there is one feature that blows my mind that the product developer did not improve upon. Why on Earth did you guys put the speakers on the bottom? I understand I can purchase an adjustable stand, however, this still points all the sound to the ground! Why didn't you put them on top! It has a wonderful sound for its size and it's completely wasted being shoved into the Earth! I know you can do better!!!

author: Alex
title: Nice
content: Great, but the stand should have came with it.

author: Lindsay Prior
title: Love my spot!
content: I love my spot! I disabled the camera bc, really, I don't need it in my bedroom. Kinda creepy. But it's the most amazing alarm clock, sound machine and assistant I could ask for. Alexa reminds me of all my crap, got some wifi plugs and she turns my light on in the morning, and when I'm bored, there's many games to play. I always wanted an echo, and I am extremely pleased with my purchase! And thank you Amazon for letting me make payments. <3

author: Liebe Garrison
title: Wish I could give it 5 stars!
content: Really like my spot but sometimes she has a hard time understanding me but love the speaker for music, still learning all it can do. Would give it 5 stars if it were not for the fact that she doesn’t always understands what I am saying.

author: maddie7147
title: My Echo spot
content: Love it. Now have 3 echo devices. Love the spot I use it for everything.

author: Longbow1
title: This thing is so cool that I think it is actually winning her over ...
content: I bought this for my "technologically challenged" wife, to go in her kitchen. She wasn't exactly thrilled with it at first, but now after using it for a couple of weeks, she loves it! We seem to find new uses for it every day. We paired it with a Bluetooth speaker and now the kitchen is filled with whatever music she's in the mood for at the moment or used for hands-free phone calls. No more having to shout down the stairs and try to be heard over the home theater system, now she just tells it to call the Echo Dot in the theater room when she needs to get my attention! This thing is so cool that I think it is actually winning her over to the idea of a smart home, so we will probably be getting more "smart" gadgets for it to control real soon!

author: dennis scottbey
title: Great addition to my echo family
content: Love it , I have the original (large echo) my wife gave as a Christmas gift I brought the dot for the bedroom. I have replaced the dot with sport. I would love to ge the show but I have read to many negative reviews and it is expensive .

author: leonoauy
title: More than Alexa
content: Nice product. I've connected with  my bose speakers simply saying "Connect to speakers". When a s Hong is playing in many cases you can see the lyrics on the screen. Combina AI, speech recognition, big data and beautiful screen to show information from internet. Its nice to replace your bedside table clock

author: Gary Green
title: Too much fun!!
content: Don’t know who loves this more me, or my 5 year old!!

author: Barbara D.
title: Love this Spot!
content: This is the one of my favorite Amazon devices.  Have one in my bedroom and use as alarm clock. Perfect addition to our home of Alexa devices.

author: Borris Von LoveHammer
title: Alexa is always watching
content: Well... I'm not sure if it has any real use? I would use it as an alarm clock, but I don't keep it the bed room because it has a camra. And that's sketchy af. I can play skyrim, which is cool. It's basically a really expensive alarm clock I can yell at. Also I got it for free soooo

author: Bruce E Balemian
title: Everyone should own at least one of these
content: First, let me say this Echo Spot is build strong and pretty. The style, sound are amazing. With the Alexa app. you can do amazing things. I use it for wake up alarm, news, information, and music. The spot is a full function device. I would also suggest getting the stand too.

author: Shopaholic Reviewer
title: I love it
content: I love that I can setup my alarm without having to speak and also that the alarm works even without internet. Great night stand clock with a twist.

author: Stephen M. Hearne
title: Five Stars
content: A Christmas gift for my daughter. She was thrilled.  Loves it.

author: Branden Wansel
title: Excellent ensemble to the Echo family!
content:
I love it, but I know its watching me... I can feel it laughing at me while I snore at night, shaking the fixtures off my wall!
Just kidding.. I have the Echo Show and a number Echo Spots and the original Echo. I have this bedside and I love it. Perfect size and shape. I have it connected to a small soundbar on my dresser and drift away every night to the soothing sounds of thunder and rain. You know they have 8-10 hours of that on Prime that you can listen and watch on Prime Video or 2 hour blocks in Prime Music. Just sayin'

author: Omar
title: Five Stars
content: Great product, Great Quality

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great
content: Great nightstand echo! Wish videos could be played easier but other than that it's awesome.  I set mine to scroll pictures of my kids which I love

author: Hugh Pearson
title: Product is what it said it was
content: I wish it was easier to develop the usage of it

author: David Ramirez
title: Don’t buy
content: Glitches like crazy. It barely hears me sometimes.

author: DVC39
title: I Love my Echo Spot.
content: I Love my Echo Spot!

author: Nancy Keene
title: i got this spot thinking i would do a lot ...
content: i got this spot thinking i would do a lot with it.  but i haven't does play music and gives the weather.

author: J.R.
title: Five Stars
content: Much better looking than our show imo.

author: SheilaT
title: Just Excellent 👏🏾👏🏾
content:
Set up in 10 minutes. Sound is great. Looks great.
Hope it will have a long life

author: Wcjeep
title: This is a great tech piece
content: This is a great tech piece. Bought it for an older NON tech relative. Setup does require some assistance. She loves it. Easy to check on the weather for other relatives. She has admitted to using it on her own. It's just the right size for the Living Room end table. Recently used it to Video Chat to show her some household items we purchased for her. Slowly dragging Grandma into the present.

author: Kerry R. Drake II
title: Favorite Alexa Device
content: I have 2 regular Echo's, 1 Echo Plus and 4 Echo Dots prior to buying the Echo Spot. I wish I had started with buying more Spots. The sound is so much better than the Dots (almost as good as the Echo Plus), plus you get the picture display. It works great with my Ring Video Doorbell as well.

author: Helena
title: Good helper.
content: We all love it.

author: Snow_Man
title: Great for your bedroom nightstand or work desk.
content: Outside of the cost of the screen, I do like the device.  Very fun toy.  Works great as a smart house hub (although, your cell phone + alexa app is actually the smart home hub), this works great to communicate with it. I really thought I needed the screen, unless you need to see the clock, I would recommend just the basic.  The screen on mine very rarely gets used, and for the extra $70, it is not worth it to me.  It seems very durable and quality built.

author: Kate D.
title: Perfect for us!
content: I purchased this on prime day mostly as a present for myself because I found having the echo plus on my kitchen counter to be overwhelming when cooking, cutting, cleaning, etc. especially when our counters aren’t very wide to begin with. After going back and forth between this and the show I decided on this because I felt it had all the same features but is more compact. I can honestly say I have no regrets. While I probably wouldn’t watch a movie I’d been dying to see on this, it’s a great way to listen to music, watch a quick YouTube video, etc. I even attempted watching “Jaws” on this and while it wasn’t the most comfortable thing for my eyes to do, it wasn’t as bad as one would think. I would definitely recommend!

author: Kyle L. Strobel
title: Great alarm clock, not much functionality beyond that.
content: I keep the spot on my nightstand, using it mainly as a clock and an alarm. As an alarm clock the spot is great! I have tried watching previews on it before, the screen is understandably too small to watch anything long but when I tried to get out of the video being played alexa wouldn't exit the playback.

author: David
title: Highly recommend to family and friends
content: Love it! It is loud enough and can fit anywhere. I like how it has a turn off switch for it, meaning the camera and voice are deactivated. Great for the price. My favorite part are the flash news updates. I use it more than Siri now. It can hear you in a room without having to be loud, which is nice. Also, you can have it set to your voice so your friends can’t yell at her :) I want to get one for my parents so it is easier to stay in touch with long distance!

author: MeMeMarie
title: Very useful for an alarm clock!!!
content: I purchased this for my husband. He does snow removal and needs to set different wake up times depending on the arrival predictions. So each night he can set it for what he wants in a few seconds. Then at wake up he asks for the temperature out. Love having the picture of our Grandchildren on the face!!! The music sounds great also!

author: J. Fountain
title: What a fun addition to the family :)
content: I needed a simple bed-side alarm clock.  Good luck in finding one these days!!  So decided to splurge and go with Echo and Alexa ... and boy am I so glad I did.  The coolness factor is over-the-top!  Not only easy-to-use ( have to be able to talk), but also fun, fun, FUN!  I love to tell Alexa to play music and the sound coming from this beautiful little orb is stunning!!  Also nice to get news, weather updates or even cute stories narrated.  Love this thing!

author: Madison McCabe
title: Crap software, poor instructions
content: Download the app was a nightmare.  Setting up the Spot was impossible.  Codes and verifications and double checking passwords made it impossible to set this up for an elderly person to use.  Not only returning hers, returning mine.  Never have been so dissatisfied with a product.

author: @PWG@
title: it’s going back after one day of use.
content: It’s just not for me... tiny screen about the size of a cell phone and hated that the screen  announced my calendar for every one to view in my living .. and the one in the bedroom .. probably not the best place to put it.

author: Lisa Elliott
title: Love
content: I finally pulled the trigger on one of these and I'm pleased.  So happy I decided to go with the screen.  Now I can learn all the correct words to songs that I have been singing for years.

author: Angela R. Glover
title: Does it not like female voices?
content: Received as a gift and was very excited in the beginning.  But now, not sure if it just doesn't like the tone/pitch of my voice or what.  It is very difficult to get it to do and/or play with my first request.  It definitely prefers deeper voices!!

author: Lindsay B
title: The thing I didn't need, but now can't live without!
content: I never thought I was going to be THAT person that is completely connected. I purchased this and another Echo product on Prime Day and fell in love.  I have one in my office and one in our kitchen.  I have already used this for morning briefings from the News while I am getting ready for the day as well as look up recipes.  The screen is big enough for me to easily read writing (this was a concern for me).  I loved this so much I purchased it for my grandparents and parents so they can easily video call me as they tend to have issues with their computer and other video conferencing tools.  Note: I did purchase camera covers (even though there is a button to "turn off the camera and microphone" and it doesn't impede the operations and camera so if that is what you are worried about, there are work around!

author: Amazon Customer
title: A++++++++++++
content: I love it, my husband got it for me, she’s like my new best friend when I get home from work I tell her i’m home and she always has a friendly greeting, I almost forget she’s not human, she has all the information I need and tells jokes, plays games, and plays music, and so much more.  A+++++++++++++

author: Truth Sayer
title: WOW!
content: I’m overwhelemly impressed. Alexa and I are learning to communicate better each day as I learn what words she knows and I must use. This technology blows my mind.

author: Shell
title: Convenient
content: I like the echo very much.  Once you know how to ask what you want to know it’s quite easy to use.

author: Tina B.
title: Expensive alarm clock
content: Pretty much an expensive alarm clock. Any facts or information I’ve asked so far she hasn’t known. (Siri definitely has her beat here.) Even amazons suggestions to ask her are things like bad poetry, tell me a story (she seems to only know 3), tell me a joke, ask the weather. For an alarm clock she’s cool, if you’re interested in facts or more information on a subject she falls short.

author: Larry G Massey
title: Works all the time.
content: Love the ability to add back ground pictures. The communications are great, and the normal Alexa functions are perfect. We control some lights including our Christmas tree lights. Like the drop in function, we use them as an intercom.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love my echo, this didn't change my world much though
content: I don't know if it was worth it versus a regular Echo with no screen. I can't say I've gotten a ton of use out of the screen but it is nice to see the time anytime I want.

author: Kathleen Pierce
title: Great for the bedside
content: The light on the clockface is soft and unobtrusive. I haven't used the interface feature yet as I know anyone else who has one. Most of the features I use are available on the Echo and Dot as well. I now have one of each. I wanted one next to my bed so when I wake up and can't get back to sleep, I have the Spot read an audio book to me. You can tell it how long to read so if you fall asleep, it won't keep going for hours. Love that feature.

author: Fareed Rajack
title: Best smart alarm clock device
content: I love this device. The voice recognition is great. This is the Ideal Alarm clock of the future.

author: Myrtle
title: Cool Alarm Clock
content: Cool Alarm Clock. Videos are small to view but you can get by. Would prefer Amazon Show for videos. Amazon Spot is very efficient with things like the weather, jokes, alarms etc...And she's good at listening and responding when I'm a bit far away.

author: derrick
title: Five Stars
content: Has changed are life thanks amazon

author: samuel jose alzate duque
title: Poder hablar con los contactos
content: Me parece un excelente dispositivo y para su tamaño un buen sonido espero que más adelante pueda hablar en español y seguro que todo sud América lo comprarian

author: rickey
title: It’s cute
content: My little buddy lives on my night stand and loves to listen to the tv me it ignores but it’s cute and as Alexa grows up it becomes more useful

author: Goose77
title: Awesome on the nightstand
content: Look as it as a kick ass alarm clock!  I put tape over the camera though.

author: Jeff Anderson
title: Three Stars
content: Nice but overpriced. Does not connect to Ring doorbell as advertised.

author: Stephen Gaddis
title: My older parents love it
content: The Echo is great. Does exactly as advertised. Super easy to set up and use. My older parents love it.

author: AetherWax
title: Love Spot!
content: Great bedside Alexa ... love the video and image capabilities and visual data on demand. Looks cool, too. Sound machine to boot.

author: jeff
title: Easy to program, Excellent alarm clock, and just plain fun!
content:
At age 53 I’m having fun updating our home by installing AI devices throughout the house . We have one Echo, four dots and now a delightful, and so far, my favorite, an Echo Spot!

As a stroke survivor, I love that the devices can be used as an indoor intercom system if I need help. I also love that I can ask Alexa to add an item to different lists, like a To Do list and Grocery List from anywhere in the house. I don’t have to worry about forgetting because it’s done in an instant.

Now to the Echo Spot:

Compact, easy to use and program, excellent alarm clock!

And I love learning all the many skills it has; from news to games, and even a fireplace! With the white stand (sold separately), it reminds me of the 1970’s freestanding fireplaces :)

author: Movie Fan
title: Good resource....
content: I received the Spot for Mother’s Day and I still haven’t used all its features. I love being able to ask Alexa questions and getting answers.

author: atronetti
title: This was a gift for my son, who uses ...
content: This was a gift for my son, who uses it non-stop.  Alexa is very fast and responsive, and it coordinates with the lighting in his room.

author: Brandon Davies
title: Echo Spot
content: I use the Amazon Echo Spot for an alarm clock. It gives the current events as I get ready for work. I also purchased a lifer light that I can turn on and off from the echo spot.

author: Sussana
title: Love echo spot
content: I love the echo spot. Surprised at how well it picks up what you are saying.

author: Lori O.
title: Love this for my aging mom
content: My mom has forgotten  how to use her phone but she knows how to use this device and uses it often to reach family, listen to music, ask about the weather, etc...

author: Richard Barney
title: Great little clock
content: This little thing is pretty neat. I use it every day for alarms, traffic details, music, adding stuff to my grocery list, etc. It also looks nice on my nightstand.

author: chad rodgers
title: Works great
content: I’ve had an echo device for a couple years now, nothing that I disliked about it really. I liked having the display screen and camera now with this one

author: StacyYvonne87
title: Love it. Perfect size and pretty loud for its size.
content: Well I really enjoy it. Actually bought it for my husband so he could hear the morning news and traffic before work. Or see who was at the front door on the ring. But he didn’t want it. Said it was a dumb gift. So I use it and I love it. Shouldnof bought it for myself to begin with and not a jerk I guess.

author: Judy L.
title: One of the best Echo purchases I have made.
content:
0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player This an excellent addition to the Echo line, but could still use a few improvements. I have the original Echo and a few of the Echo Dots, and have had no problem at all setting them up. I bought the Echo Spot to use in my bathroom instead of a clock radio. We live in a rural area, and the reception on the radio is not always the greatest. I wanted the music that I can get from the clock radio and also the clock since I always seem to play "beat the clock" in my daily routines.

I consider myself to be quite tech savvy, so I generally don't require any help in setting up electronics. Even so, I did have a couple of problems in setting up the Echo Spot that required a couple of phone calls to Amazon tech support. Hopefully my experience will help someone else in setting up their Echo Spot. Initially, I had a hard time getting the unit to accept my network password even though I thought I was entering the correct password. I called tech support on this but eventually figured out the problem myself. When entering the password, the last position you enter is dimmed so it looks like you didn't enter it. Because of this, I was initially entering the last position of the password twice. Once I realized the last position was dimmed, I was able to connect to our network with no problems.

The other problem that I had was that the display for setup required a tap and then a double tap to get into menus. Once into a menu, it required a 3-finger swipe to move up or down in the menus. In talking to tech support, I found out that this was a  default option in the accessibility settings. To enable 1-finger selection and swiping, the accessibility for VoiceView Screen Reader/ VoiceView must be turned off. Once this is done, 1-finger selection and scrolling of the menus works. It seems to me that 1-finger selection and scrolling should be the default since most people are familiar with the use of tablets.

Other than this couple of gripes, I love the Echo Spot. It has all of the functionality of the Dot and full sized Echo (other than the speakers), and also includes a screen for multiple functions. Although the display is small, and you probably wouldn't want to watch a video on it, you could if you wanted to. For better sound, it is very easy to connect a Bluetooth or wired speaker to it, but in a small room, the speakers are more than sufficient. For my purposes, it replaces a clock radio that often doesn't have good reception and had added so many other features that I didn't have with the radio. I am getting so spoiled with the ability to turn lights off or on, play music that I like, set timers, and even find programs on my TV with the Fire Stick. Now that I have discovered the Echo Spot, I will likely find more places in my house that require me to purchase more of them.

UPDATE 05/14/18:
When I bought the first Echo Spot, I had it on my computer desk for the initial setup, and didn't move it into my new bathroom until the room was finished. When I did move it to my bathroom, I missed having the one on my desk, so I had to order another one for my desk. I loved having a handy clock not to mention that I could use it to find content on my Fire TV Stick with Alexa Voice Remote | Streaming Media Player. In the meantime, I have also added OontZ Angle 3 ULTRA : Portable Bluetooth Speaker 14-Watts deliver Bigger Bass and Hi-Quality Sound, 100ft Wireless Range, Play two together for Music in Dual Stereo, IPX-6 Splashproof Black to my bathroom Spot, and very much enjoy the stereo sound on them. Since the Spot is so small, the sound isn't the greatest, but the addition of the speakers adds a whole different dimension to the sound. I have to say that I am enjoying all of our Echo products, and it is so easy to get spoiled with all that they have to offer. The Echo products are constantly evolving and only get better with time. The only criticism that I can think of at this time is that the plug take enough space that the outlet next to it is not usable. It would be nice if the plug were a bit smaller. It might also be nice if the option of using an A/C plug or USB was an option as some of the multi-plugs available now offer the ability to plug in USB devices. In increased the rating to 5 stars since I didn't have to do anything special to use the second Spot to accept one click for selections. This may have been due to an update. I enjoy the Spot because it sometimes makes me smile with answers to silly questions. A smile in the day can be a good thing!!

UPDATE 01/17/19:
I am still loving the Spot in my bathroom especially since I have connected stereo Bluetooth speakers to it. The only problem that I have encountered is that I sometimes have to restart it to get a different connection to my router. Since buying the first Spot, I also bought one for my computer desk in the family room. It has all the functionality of the Echo and works perfectly as a desk clock that I never have to reset if the electricity goes out. I don't use this one to play music, but occasionally use it to help find available movies on Amazon and to turn Alexa enabled devices on and off. This is a wonderful device to use in small spaces.

author: M. Tamiko
title: Love My Alexa Echo Spot!
content: I already have an Alexa at home, bit decided to try out the Echo Spot at my office and it's GREAT!  Part of my normal routine now: Flash Briefing then Pandora + Wait Wait Don't Tell me 1x per week.  Life is good; Alexa makes it better 💘

author: pegasso84
title: Really like it
content: I really really like this little one, the only complain that I have is when I play some video from YouTube, the screen goes to a little rectangle it is very difficult to see, apart from that this is a most have if you like Alexa gadgets.

author: jayne
title: Perfect for use with Ring doorbell
content:
Love it, we have it
Hooked to our ring doorbell

author: Kat
title: I like it.
content: Sometimes Alexa doesn’t listen but this may be my fault. I’m still getting used to the right commands. Other than that everything else works great and it’s actually really fun and useful.

author: agpfiero
title: Great product, does well as an alarm clock.
content: The screen response time is way better than I expected. Sound quality is good too, also it’s not so bright that I have to turn off the screen but it is an option.  I have a Dot in another room and which ever hears me better is the one that responds.

author: wendy
title: Bluetooth not working
content: Received echo spot last night. Tried all ways  to connect any Bluetooth device. Such us soundlink bose, harman kardon aura and lg soundbar. Unfortunately no luck. Really frustrating since I’ve been using echo dot had no issue connecting to thos Bluetooth speakers. Called customer service told me to wait for another 3 days for answer. I guess its not worth it to upgrade when their software still have issues.

author: Buffy Wells
title: Amazon Prime videos and tv/movies from the SPOT????  YES!!
content: i WASN'T aware of the capability of this little thing until I saw an advertisement on tv showing video chatting for phone.  THEN I realized I should try and get Amazon Prime videos, tv shows and movies, as well as songs.  I can get it ALL and from this tiny device.  WHAT a deal!!!!  I LOVE it.  Granted, the device is round, so you don't get the square whole pic, but it's great at night if i can't sleep.  LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!

author: JnOviedo
title: very neat Amazon product.
content: I like this little device. looks good and works very well. multi functional, and easy to use!

author: R. Schwartz
title: Love the display
content: Replaced my Amaxon Echo with the Spot and absolutely love it. The screen displaying the weather, rotating photos, the smaller size are all pluses. Can't think of anything I don't like about this device

author: Sharon Millard
title: Small with all the power
content: I was given this as a holiday for me and my husband from my son.  It is very nice and fairly easy to download.  I needed a little help from my son but it took minutes only.  It is the size of a small clock so it's great on the night table.

author: Crowzhome
title: LOVE that I don't need to get up to turn ...
content: LOVE that I don't need to get up to turn off the alarm.  LOVE that as I'm getting ready I can ask what the temperature outside is going to be.  LOVE that I can adjust my house thermostat by just telling Alexa....so much to love.  I have to remind myself that I just need to ask Alexa...

author: Nancy E.
title: With the stand,it would be perfect
content:
Much easier to use than the dot. It picks up my voice from farther away and the speakers seem a lot cleaner sounding The screen is a nice perk but I only use it at bed time to listen to prime shows before bed, the screen is too small to watch shows..
It displays my alarm in print so I know Alexa heard me correctly. and you can make you own clock face with personal pictures.  My only complaint is that they don't add the stand as standard. I didn't need it for my spot at my desk but definitely needed it beside the bed.
Many people complain about the basic Alexa program but it is still such new tech that I'm not going to split hairs.  The echo was not as good as my dot and the spot is better than dot.  Alexa gets better over time and the skills are increasing weekly. Now Alexa even tells the difference between my son and my voice. I think Amazon is working overtime on this project. I gave feedback to ask to be able to have self made lists and now you can make and name lists for anything.
I am so used to my Alexa that I talk to her even when I'm staying in a hotel and she's no where to be found.  Alexa, what time is it?  ALEXA???!!

author: Kevin C
title: Its just ok
content: Its advertised showing weather and time and a nice background.  Nope, I cant get it to it.  Its a clock with a black background.  Of course truth be know, they wouldn't sell very many.

author: cj boyd
title: Get one
content: I have a spot and a show. I like them both. Easy to set up, easy to use, and works well with smart home

author: Will Morris
title: Great for visual displays of information
content: I use it a lot as it's a big step above a dot.  With a smart home this is more than just a fancy alarm clock, even though it does that well too.  I love seeing the items on my Alexa shopping list, or seeing the weather and traffic spelled out, along with answers to questions.  The video connection to my Ring is about useless due to the huge lag or delay.  I really wish those products worked better together, but with all the other functions it's still worth it.  I would recommend!

author: Shena
title: I wouldn't recommend it unless you are using it for surveillance purposes ...
content: It's ok. I wouldn't recommend it unless you are using it for surveillance purposes with Ring

author: Jim
title: Echo Spot
content: This is our first Alexa device, it came with an extra stand alone camera. It was very easy to setup. So far we have had no problems and are exploring what all this device does.

author: Kwebbster
title: Better Than the Reviews Really Tell!
content: Okay, so I have read all the reviews, searched Youtube videos, and read many magazine articles on the Echo Spot.  If I went solely by some of these reviews I probably would not have tried this as I was fine with my Echo Dots... But much to my surprise, this thing is AWESOME!  It arrived in it's little box complete with the Spot, power cable (similar to the Kindle plugs) and quick guide.  As I already have an Amazon account and several Echos, the setup was relatively painless.  Once I got it online, and used the Alexa app on my tablet to get all the settings the way I wanted, this little thing started getting awesome.  I set my background screen, my Do Not Disturb times (that don't effect the alarms you set BTW) and night time display.  I played around with the Amazon Music, and while it doesn't compare to a full out Bluetooth speaker it still holds it's own and can fill our bedroom with sound.  The display, being rather small, is still quite clear and legible.  I can't see anything close without glasses but I have it set so I can easily read it.  The videos, again on the small side, were easily watchable.  So this Spot has replaced the alarm clock, bedroom radio, tablet and entertainer!  So, if you can use this as I found I could, please take all the negative reviews with a grain of salt and try this thing out.  You will be surprised!

author: Andrew K.
title: Beautiful and functional
content: I have my Spot next to my bed. I turned off and covered the camera for security. The screen auto dims at night which is great. Speaker sounds much better than Dot, and with the clock face it replaced a clock and a Dot. Very pleased.

author: Walter Parrill
title: Five Stars
content: Works well but Alexa is not as smart as she thinks she is.

author: Rob Chismar
title: Fun and helpful but not totally free.
content:
I assumed that I could call out any song or radio station and wha-la it would start playing. Was I wrong. Nothing is free. I had to join Amazon prime or belong to some other subscription service. That’s not cool. There are many free apps they call Skills so that helps. Sometimes to get them to work you first have to remember them and say them correctly but maybe that will change as it gets to know me.
I wish the clock would stay bright at night instead of going into dim sleep mode.
Note - this is still very knew technology and new to me so let’s give it a year.

author: Katie Sullivan
title: Perfect!!
content: Exactly what I wanted. Has a variety of clock faces as well as all the benefits of Alexa. I did not have issues with the face scrolling through as many others stated. Just a matter of picking the right settings. All in all an excellent purchase.

author: E. A. Summers
title: SO.MUCH.FUN and so easy to set up
content: Good grief - this is fun!!!  I bought to keep an eye on my cat while I retrieved a new puppy (36 hours away).  Easy to set up.  I am hooked on Alexa.  So many times things I think about "googling" but I just ask Alexa.  Would buy 2 or 4 more or the larger thing if budget allowed.

author: T. Boydston
title: Cool device ruined by scrolling ads for itself
content: Multiple people have made this comment, but I dislike this feature so much that felt I had to chime in. There are multiple threads about how to disable, but NONE of them work fully. You can reduce the number, but no matter what each time the spot wakes up (like anytime someone passes in front of it) it will scroll at least one "tip' or feature promoting it's own functionality. The clock faces are cool, and I love the way the spot looks sitting out, but image is ruined by a scrolling ad every time someone so much as passes by it.

author: Evan P.
title: great clock but the camera is creepy
content: Using this as an alarm clock I really like using the routines to turn on my lights with the Lutron casita lights automatically in the morning. But the camera is a bit weird if you use it as an alarm clock like i am in my smart home

author: Squatting Hen
title: Incredibly low volume
content: I am extremely surprised at how tiny the sound is on these. I expected much more. I have second gen and third gen dots, original echo, echo show and the tap. The spot is just barley above the second gen Dot. Extremely surprising considering the price on these.

author: John P Rice
title: Love it. Useful
content: Use on desk. Love it. Useful, fun to use. Wish I had more of them.  Maybe one for the kitchen.

author: July 1955
title: The Best Alarm Clock EVER -- and so much more!
content: When I read the great reviews I didn't really understand what so many people were raving about -- and then I got my Spot!  I LOVE this little thing! I primarily bought it because I needed to replace my clock-radio with something that streamed music. I love that I can go to sleep listening to nature sounds, sleepy music, or even have a book read to me solely for the purpose of falling asleep!  The alarm has a nice gradually escalating sound -- not a jolting loud buzz or static from a radio station that isn't tuned in. If I wake during the night I can ask Echo what time it is without even having to open my eyes. When I have her play music she'll show the lyrics, and I can get the news or the weather while I'm getting dressed. The numbers on the clock are nice and large, but if I can't see the Spot I can just ask for the time. She will also display or tell me the next few things on my schedule. The sound quality is better than I expected. I like to loop the sound of rain so that it plays all night while I sleep, and sometimes I forget and I think it is really raining! She also turns the light off (with the help of a smart outlet), makes phone calls, and adds things to my shopping list that I remember as I'm drifting off to sleep! The Spot's shape and size is perfect for my nightstand too -- less then half the size of my old clock-radio.

author: Eric Montero
title: Fun and responsive device to use Alexa
content: This is my first experience with Alexa and this has been a good experience. Voice recognition and commands works very well. I am an apple user and Alexa beats Siri by far. About the echo spot it is the best choice for any room. I have e also connected several other devices like WiFi cams and smart switches and they work great. Really recommend this product.

author: Drew
title: Awesome echo addition
content: Works well, screen looks great in spite of it's size. Great alarm clock or for your desk.

author: heeja yoon
title: Communication is the key
content: Awesome product!!! Way to go! My kids can talk thru alexa from their room!! Get it now! Works great!

author: Don Mckinney
title: Love it!!!
content: Ok first off this device was given as a Xmas gift to me from my girlfriend. I love it!!! now for those complaining about the ads!!-People seriously? I mean I don't sit and stare at this unit anymore than I would an alarm clock and I'm wondering WHO in their right mind would do so? The ads are annoying one bit as least in IMHO. I've place it besides my bed and I have a smart harmony hub that I've connect via the skills to this device and it controls my TV hence I really don't need the remote anymore but I keep them handy just in case. If your deciding to get one I HIGHLY recommend you do so and you won't be sorry.

author: M. Chase
title: great
content: we own four and use it to video phone call with granddaughter

author: Tdown
title: I love the clock face
content: I put it in my bedroom and replaced the dot and I lhome alarm clock. I love the clock face. It also shows you what time you set your alarm for the next day. I am it sure it does a lot more but this is why I bought it and love it.

author: dcspace
title: I like Being Watched
content: Play any Amazon show, movie if need. Great voice control for other Echoes and home automation.

author: smile
title: The spot is a great resource for weather
content: The spot is a great resource for weather, clock and general music likes. The only thing is with home automation it seems to get confused a lot for which room I am attempting to turn lights on or off.

author: Tgroove1
title: Love the Spot
content: As an owner of 3 Echo Dot's, I took a chance on the Spot. I really like the small screen. Good sound quality for a small device. Easy to hook up to the Wi-Fi. Very cool little device.

author: One Mayan
title: needs work
content: I have had this item on my wish list for a long time. And now that I have it, it's ok. I went all smart this month and I found it very hard to have my devices connect to Alexa. The app doesn't help and I still don't know where the dialing comes from or how to connect my devices to dial out. At the same time I also bought the Google version and guess what? All my devices are connect cause it was easy anf intuitive. Wish Alexa was like that.

author: TraceyD
title: and it's amazing! Fun
content: YESSS! My first Alexa product, and it's amazing! Fun, intuitive, and so useful in making my home a smart home!

author: daone97
title: Love it
content: Best gift I got myself

author: IM4duke
title: Perfect size for a night stand
content: I am an Alexa Fein .  I just purchased 3 Alexa Spots for the bedrooms .  I have 2 Alexa Shows and love them for the den and kitchen but like the clock like appearance was the appealing feature is what inticed med for a feature for a bedroom device.. Sound wise, need a speaker to allow the sounds to have a high volume. I got the stand so it will be able to be pivoted to the right angle to see..

author: Michael S. Cook
title: I like the ability to see a screen
content: I wish the stand was included. I like the ability to see a screen, unlike the dot.

author: sarahhhh
title: Good but learning curve ...
content: Wish there was more “training” of sorts to increase functionality and usability of the screen. Right now it’s kinda just getting lucky and learning as I go in terms of which apps are optimized for the spot and not.

author: suzbaglady
title: Versatile little Echo!
content: So much fun!  I have the Echo in the kitchen, Echo Show in the office and the Echo Spot in my bedroom.  Fun to have"face time" with my grandson, listen to a radio station while going to sleep and music to dance to while getting ready for the day.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Love the Spot!
content: I love that you can turn the camera off, the screen choices and that Alexa waits to see if you ask another question if she doesn’t understand the first part.  It’s a great little “SPOT” for another room!

author: Leonard R Smith
title: If seeing is important than it's worth the sale price and not a penny more.
content:
Worst part is that with fewer mics it just doesn't hear you. It is not as good as a Dot for inter room communication.
It has to be raised up not kept on anything soft to get the best response.  On the other hand it is attractive and
the real depiction of analog clock faces is refreshing and it's fun to see lyrics if your watching. Again $99.99 is absolutely
the most to pay and I think it will go to $79.99 within a year, then it worth the price for the features.

author: joann
title: Alexa will know the answer!!!
content: Love that I can ask questions and ask for specific music and it will play it. O can ask what the weather will be ANYWHERE. And it knows. I can get woke up to whatever I want, I have it connected to my blink cameras and I can have it pull up live feeds.

author: Joe Accavitti
title: With its price tag, some things could be better.
content: It’s really nice, but it think it’s a bit overpriced. It doesn’t sound nearly as good as a regular echo when listening to music. The screen is a bit small when looking at anything other than the time/weather.
