author: Benjamin D.
title: For the price this could be a lot better, micro USB power support would have been a huge help since NO INTERNAL BATTERY.
content: For the price this could be a lot better, micro USB power support would have been a huge help since Amazon does NOT include an internal battery.  Id like to bring it to the coffee table to have a chat with my sons grandmother but this makes it impossible.  Id return it if it made sense.  Other comments include anoying scrolling irrelevant information screen.  I tell it the sports teams I like it and it tells me to ask it a joke.  How about you tell me how my teams are doing instead A-HAT.  Annoyed that my mother got convinced into buying one of these FUTURE PAPERWEIGHTS just to talk to her grandson.  UGH>

author: Deedra
title: It does everything from playing songs you want to hear to answering questions and telling you the forecast. It's terrific.
content:
I bought it for my grand daughter.  I have the Echo and love it.  She absolutely loves it. She can hear whatever music she wants to listen to, she can ask Alexa to spell words and she can ask Alexa questions .  It's wonderful.
I also love the clock.  Alexa always says "have a good night  Talk to you in the morning" How cool is that?

author: Amazon Customer
title: Alexa, "How can I turn off your suggestions"
content: I mostly like this device, but I hate that it constantly suggests things to ask. And I can't seem to stop it. Do most buyers really need to have request examples shown? I have no idea why the developers force this, apparently, hated feature on buyers. Make it stop or at least stoppable.

author: craft pro
title: Better than a baby monitor
content:
Bought to keep an eye on my grandmother while she was ill at home. I could see her and check in on her and even turn on her gospel music from my house and my cell phone. The kids also enjoyed being able to drop in on her.
Now, my kids use it for everything in their room.

author: MD
title: Good but expensive for the value
content: Good product but it's expensive for the value it provides. If you can get or for$50 I would buy. Much more it's probably not worth it

author: MrX
title: We love the echo spot!
content: This makes 14 echoes in our household. From the original to this… No complaints at all

author: Amy Nicolai
title: Used in my office
content: I bought it as a clock and timer for my office. Set up very easily and I like having access to Alexa at the office as well.

author: eliz.
title: Five Stars
content: Love it and exploring what it can do.

author: Jon Forbes
title: Three major flaws
content:
We bought a couple of these on Black Friday and they turned out to be a huge disappointment.  There are three major issues we've run into.  I called Amazon support to see if there were ways around any of these and they confirmed all three were "known limitations" of the device.

1.  EXTREMELY limited Bluetooth support.  The speakers built into the Echo Spot aren't that great so we planned to connect to our Vizio soundbar via Bluetooth but I couldn't get the Spot to see the soundbar even though my phone and tablet could easily pair with it.  I then tried pairing it with a portable Bluetooth speaker and no luck there either.  Amazon support said that they only support a limited number of speakers.  I asked the agent how many speakers they support and she said it was about a dozen.  That's completely ridiculous!  The whole point of a standard like Bluetooth or USB is to support interoperability.  I'm not going to throw out a $300 soundbar because Amazon doesn't support that particular brand/model.

2.  You'll see this in a number of reviews and forum posts - there's no way to turn off the Alexa advertisements on the device.  You will constantly see "Try asking Alexa to suggest a Prime movie" and other similar content.  Amazon has built in settings that allow you to turn on or off everything EXCEPT these messages.  There's no way to shut them off.  The direct quote from my Amazon support assistant was "At this time there is no way to turn off Alexa advertisements".

3.  The camera quality is horrible.  We tried using our two devices as intercoms and the audio is just fine but the video is terrible.  All we could see was a silhouette of the other person.  If we cranked the brightness up to 100% then we could start to see the other person a bit but the quality was absolutely terrible.  I would have suspected a defective camera but we had the same quality issues in both devices.

Overall we're extremely disappointed.  They definitely are not as advertised.

author: lee norwood
title: Alexa is useless if it doesn’t work
content: Bought in July 2018, quit working in September 2018. Alexa not responding to anything. Sent in to be repaired since it work... out over a week, get back and still didn’t work. After calling again of the same exact issue, they sent me out a refurbished one... it lasted less than 2 hours and again Alexa doesn’t respond... its only useful thing is being a clock... very disappointed with this product

author: Kindle Customer
title: Really cool. I own and use all of the Echo ...
content: Really cool.  I own and use all of the Echo products and this is my favorite.  It's the right size and shape for my desk with the complete functionality of the Echo Show.

author: Chimene Olynyk
title: Alexa and I will get along just fine!
content:
I have both Echo Spot and Google Home... I like that the Spot has a display unlike Google. However I do believe that Google has a better music selection when not having a paid subscription to a music source.

So what every your preference I would make my decision on that.

author: Lin
title: Great Product
content: I love my Echo Spot.  The speakers in the Spot sound a little better than with my Dot.  The screen is small but I knew that, it still is great to see everything that comes on it.  I do wish there were more clock faces to choose from but I am sure there will be in time as updates occur.  This little Spot is great for what I got it for - mostly the clock, weather and music, love everything it can do.  So glad I got one.  It is fun for some of the things you can ask and a laugh when you ask her to sing you a song.

author: Brian
title: A Must Buy!!
content: This Echo spot is awesome! It does so much. This device understands you very easily unlike some of the others. I’m learning new things about it everyday. I highly recommend this to anyone.

author: alondo r brown
title: I love it! It’s just what I was looking for

I can stream music to it and it will play through my Bose speaker (another plus). Apple Music doesn’t work that way, but nothing works with Apple but Apple. I haven’t used it for anything else, but I’m sure maybe at some point I will.

author: wrc
title: nice footprint. I've got it in my kitchen and ...
content: Decent sound, nice footprint.  I've got it in my kitchen and use it to view my Ring doorbell, timers, recipe display, music, home automation I'm using the heck out of it.  But my favorite trick is pausing my FireTV if I am still in kitchen when the commercials are over!  Timers, volume conversions, ingredient substitutes, music, this is a great little kitchen device.

author: Bob Albert
title: Don't be fooled like I was!
content: Support for this device is appalling. It is difficult to configure and the support staff cannot make it much easier. I purchased two of these Spots, one for my 97-year-old mother, and one for us and her great-grandchildren. She is 1400 miles away from us and there is no way I can remotely manage the device or instruct her how to do it. The ad makes it seem so easy. Just say, "Alexa, call mom!" Don't be fooled!

author: Buyer2345
title: Very happy with the product I really don't like it having a camera on it though
content: Very happy with the product I really don't like it having a camera on it though

author: Michael
title: Ok
content: It’s a nice piece of electronics - has turned on randomly at night a few times

author: Sylvia
title: I like it.
content: It's great although I think the Echo Dot has more powerful speakers. I find the Echo Dot hears my voice easier than the Echo Spot. I believe this is due to not having the stand for the Echo Spot which would then elevate the bottom of the Echo Spot to allow for the speakers which are at the bottom of the Echo Spot to hear your commands better whereas with the Echo Dot the speakers and sensors are on the perimeter of the Echo Dot not the bottom. Otherwise, I really like the Echo Spot. I'll be ordering my Echo Spot stand today!

author: Amazon Customer

author: Leigh
title: Best Echo yet!
content: As an owner of two Echo Shows, several Echo Dots, and the original Echo Tower, I bought this on a whim for a bedroom with a small nightstand.  It never made it to that room and is now in the Master Bedroom.  I love this little Echo.  In my opinion, this is the best Echo!  I wish I had not purchased the two clunkier Shows.

author: BillA
title: Very Cool Device With One HUGE Problem
content:
This is a really cool device. I love having a clock and the weather displayed in my bedroom, but there is a huge problem with this device. In the stack of cards that you can display (clock, weather, notifications, reminders, etc.), there is a "Things to Try" tips card. You cannot turn this off.

With this, you're essentially left with two choices: 1. set your cards to rotate once (and see Things to Try once) and then not be able to rotate to the weather or anything else, or 2. put up with seeing a "Things to Try" tip about a third of the time you look at your clock and never see the weather.

For a $130 device, this NEEDS to be fixed. I do NOT want to see these tips. You can turn on and off any other card but this, and that totally ruins it. I'm considering sending it back and just using a dot instead.

author: Robin P. Sellers
title: Kids love it
content: This is so much better than echo. It is awesome. My kids love it

author: Sandra Baker

author: Alan M. Schneider

We are using this in our bedroom as an alarm clock, but we use it for so much more! Mainly, news and weather reports, and music. It's great to be putting away laundry and just ask the Spot to play some music. It also shows the lyrics on the screen which I love! It was easy to set up, looks great, sounds great, and works flawlessly. Awesome!

author: Brenda Nichols
title: Five Stars
content: Love it! Except Alexa doesnt know a whole lot . You have to teach her almost everything!!

author: M. L. Smith

content: Nice echo device. Can't say I've actually done much with the screen side of things other than play with it a bit. Makes for a nice clock in the kitchen when not doing the Alexa thing.

author: John Boone
title: Grandkids Video Chat with Grandma
content: There is a commercial of grandma opening a box with echo then saying "call home." There are a few more steps involved but ita pretty accurate. We use this thing to video chat with grandparents. We do not have iphones and echo ia basically face time but on a circle screen. My kids 9 & 11 do not have cell phones but love this. Alexa beat boxes, tells jokes and is our daily reading timer.  We got it on prime day and I was skeptical but now do not know how we lived without it.

author: bonalex
title: Smart Design
content: Use for bedroom nightstand clock  Love everything about the design and display

author: Lucy's mom

content:
Saves me time. I type a lot and use medical terminology in a form that does not allow spell check. Saves tons of time looking up words. Also allows me to listen to music at work when I have to stay late until 11:30 at night and don't have time to dink around finding something to listen to.
Reminds me of appointments so I don't work through them. Can actually see recipes. Just little tasking things. Traffic reports before I leave, major in Seattle.

author: M. LeFlore

author: Yvette
title: The Echo Spot is spot on!
content: My 5th Amazon Echo device and I love it! Replaces the Echo Dot on my nightstand. The Echo Spot has great sound and I love being able to view my calendar and news flash briefings. It’s perfect for the bedroom because I don’t have to verbally request everything. I can just tap the screen. (The dot is now in my den.)

author: Amazon user
title: Another Awsome Amazon device
content: Have been using for several months, very pleased with it.  Easy to read at night, and very clear voice. Alarm options very easy to set, just tell it.

author: DCW
title: It’s awesome they can wake to whatever music they like
content: I have purchased two of these for my kids.  They have replaced their alarm clocks.  It’s awesome they can wake to whatever music they like.  They set reminders for anything they have happening on that day at school or after, like take vitamins or medicine.  It works with an app on the phone so they get the reminder wherever they are. My son is able to see and talk to his favorite cousin that lives 4 hours away.  My son also likes to watch shows on it through amazon prime before bed.

author: DB
title: Great picture and sound on this smart home product
content: I like to have the option for a smaller Alexa product with a screen aside from my Echo Show with all of the same functionality. I really enjoy having my Prime photos set as my background to function as a digital picture frame in a sense. Also, it’s nice to have the time and temperature displayed. You can even tell it to play anything that is on Prime video , although the screen is a bit small when it cuts the top and bottom to make 4:3 or 16:9 mode, it is still a crystal clear screen and is sometimes nice to have something playing on my desk when I am doing work in the office. He speaker volume is great for its size. I can control my hue lights with my voice and multiple other WiFi outlets. The other great feature is the drop in feature where you can view the room your spot is in from your smartphone and talk to someone similar to FaceTime. Overall great product and happy with it.

author: Russell Johnson
title: Excellent Technology
content: It's great!!  I put it on my nightstand. It's like a smart phone, Alexa Dot, and alarm clock on steroids.

author: Samantha
title: It’s alright
content: Eh, kinda overrated. She’s just a big speaker. Good for listening to music though. And alarms. And telling me what time it is. I hate that it has to be plugged it too.

author: Terri Bailey
title: works great!
content: Have it in my bedroom and it turns on and off my lamp ( I have a smart plug) puts me to sleep with the sounds you can ask it to play. Love it. Lets me know if anyone is messing around in my backyard or front door using Ring with it.

author: Ronm01
title: Five Stars
content:
Well-made product.
Echo Spot - White

author: Naturelady
title: My most favorite Echo yet.
content:
I purchased 2.  One for my mother who is bedridden, and the other for me to replace my alarm clock.  We used Amazon Music at her bedside to play Patsy Cline for her to keep her agitation down (she has dementia). I discovered by accident that I can play any of my prime video on the spot as well (very small picture though).  We haven't tried to do video chats yet.

We have an original Echo, a dot, a spot, fireTV stick, and at my mother's a dot, spot, and a fireTV stick and a FireTV.  Between the two houses we also have 4 of the Echo buttons to play games.  This one is my favorite form of Echo.  It is louder than my dot, and we use it to play music as well as an alarm clock.

author: J. Iuzzolino
title: Not just a clock
content: Fast shipping and easy set up. We used this to replace an old alarm clock. More than just a clock and we could not be happier.

author: MRAguru
title: Great option for a  clock on my night table
content:
I really like having the display on the Echo a spot. The clock has a choice of faces plus a day and night mode, which is great.  She will scroll through the days events, weather, birthday’s, things to try, trending topics. I even watched a cooking video on it during the holidays.
The only thing I’d like improved is the speaker sound for music, which is less rich than a full size Echo.

author: Isabel
title: Echo Spot
content: I keep this on my nightstand and it answers my questions any time day or night.  I love it - can always see the weather and time.

author: DR
title: One Star
content: Pointless Amazon product. Invest on the other options

author: Retired
title: Not a fan of spot
content: The echo dot functions better, and I really DISLIKE not being able to turn off trending on spot

author: Kndllyn
title: Love it!
content: Love my Spot! I purchased one to try which was great until the rest of my family saw it. We now have 3 and will probably add more. They're perfect as a small alarm next to your bed. The apps for meditation, jokes, random stories for the kids, music, and news are all great. I'd love to see more viewable apps since it has a screen, but since it's new I'll be patient.

author: TacoGone
title: Meh..
content: Cramped screen, crummy sound, even worse video. The main selling point with this is the AI, Alexa, which you can easily program and add countless libraries to from a web page. The rub here, is that you have to give all your passwords to Amazon, be they Spotify, Arlo, Samsung, etc. Another kinda cool feature is a 'drop in' button, which displays your mug from your cell phone, after downloading the App, so you can video conference a la Skype. Voice detection works about 80% of the time. The other 20%, Alexa can't hear you over what it's playing, to turn it down or off. Despite having a fun design that has more personality than most Alexa devices, it's showing its age, even with discount pricing. So, if you really need a touch and sound sensitive clock radio, go for it. Otherwise, I would go with a newer model, or *gasp* a Google home.

author: L. J. Morrison-Aguirre
title: Love it
content: I have this in my bedrooms.  I love how the screen is night time friendly in that it is not so bright that it lights up the dark room.  My previous clock radio was way too bright and was really annoying.  The brightness on this screen changes based on the lighting in the room.  I usually say Good Morning to Alexa, and she gives me some interesting fact from history from today's date, then I ask her the question of the day while I put my shoes on for work!

author: Maddie baker
title: It’s cool, it looks nice
content:
Bought it to use as a alarm clock.
It works well as any other “Alexa” device, but 2 out of 5 days the alarm failed ... either I turned it off accidentally, or it canceled.  Either way it didn’t wake me up.  It’s cool, it looks nice, but save some money if you want it primarily for alarm clock

author: Kjtownshend
title: Love the spot, should have gotten it sooner.
content: This spot is so cute and we are having a blast with it. Now that I have it connected to my echo dot, I can play music no matter what room I'm in and the ability to use like an intercom is amazing, no more yelling for me.

author: jojo c
title: Nice but kids are sneaking screen time on it
content: I really like the form factor. As a parent of small children, I wish there was a way to restrict any video content from playing - perhaps only allowing it for certain voices or to put a lock on it that can be disabled through settings. My kids have figured out how to play cartoons from amazon prime so this has become another screen that I have to police their access to.

author: Stefanie Bragg
title: Love it
content: Kids love calling their grandpa and talking/seeing him. They love the fun facts and music

author: Pecossky
title: I like it. I use it as a bed side ...
content: I like it. I use it as a bed side clock and to set alarms and everyday top stories. I wish I could customize it more on the App. The App is in need of a major redesign.

author: Syrak
title: Great edition to the Echo family
content:
Looks so cute sitting on my dresser. Replaced the original echo with this baby. Love that it can bluetooth to my home audio receiver unlike the original echo.

Cons: Covering camera for privacy makes it think its always night time. Can't change a setting so it doesn't change my clock's color at night. Telling alexa to turn off the screen is canceled everything you say alexa.

author: Piran Mohazzabi
title: It is great
content: I like echo spot over echo dot. It is very easy to setup without app. Great product

author: Daniel G.
title: Great product with reasonable price
content: I enjoy with my spot so much. I start with echo dot, compare with Eufy, I quickly switched to Echo, then I in love with Echo spot. It helps a lot to my daily life, turn light on and off, check security camera without go to my phone, good night music, blue tooth connection, check my Leaf charging status, etc.  I enjoy all these functions.  Great product!  Thank you amazon!

author: DanSchaller
title: Everyone should have one! Echo Spot
content: This device, in my opinion, is probably the best so far.  My biggest issue though, is that even though I thought I had the annoying "things to try" solicitations turned off, they seem to keep showing up with the rotation for weather and agendas  I really like the "Drop in" function,  as this is useful as an intercom. We used this on our original Echo, but is more useful with video.

author: Nebu10us
title: Screen is beautiful, but I wish the speaker was better
content: This thing is seriously cool. The touch screen is responsive and very versatile. It looks very stylish in my living room. The speaker isn’t near as good as the dot though, I can barely hear spot’s music 20 feet away in the kitchen.

author: R. Beauregard
title: So much fun!
content: I bought this as  a gift for my daughter for her birthday.  She loves it.  It was easy to set up and I love that I can call her and see her and my grandson while talking to them.

author: Braden Welch
title: Needs updated
content: The physical product is great. Love it! BUT THE FIRMWARE NEEDS TO BE UPDATED!! "Things to try" needs to be GONE. The clock faces need to be more customizable. Like putting the weather on the clock face, more digital options, and dates. Different fonts. Ect...and a white noise option like the Google home has would be very nice. Rain, thunder, wind, and heavy rain.

author: Illsa
title: so many great things to say about it
content: I will start replacing all dots with this.....so many great things to say about it....cons are close to none

author: tstrasser
title: Great for the bedroom!
content:
We use it to control our home's wi-fi stuff.  What we really love is we can play sleepy sounds like the ocean or rain...
The alarms are awesome.  Has all the same features our Echo has.

author: Sarina.S
title: Love it!
content: The echo spot works as expected and is convenient for setting up an alarm and having a good clock background. I love this device!

author: Brian Davis
title: Echo spot
content: I love the compact size of the alarm clock.  It fits perfectly on my night stand. I do like the fact that it displays the weather. I still have a lot to learn how to effectively use it.

author: jyea
title: The smart features, alarm and weather make this a great ...
content: Very sleek device to replace my old alarm clock. The smart features, alarm and weather make this a great buy. I love the display it’s warm and bright daytime and discreet in the evening. I paired this device with my cellphone and can take calls on other echo devices, it’s great!

author: Dave_KW
title: Works well, clock is what I really needed.
content: So nice to have a visible clock in the bedroom.

author: Tlknox
title: Enjoy having this on my nightstand
content: Enjoy having this on my nightstand. I utilize this to run my lights and set up an alarm. Is also useful to add items to my shopping list as they pop in my head.

author: Snapshooter
title: It works
content: It’s just plain cool. I can turn on lights, set an alarm or make a shopping list all just by saying Alexa.

author: Stu
title: I think this is very cool, lotsa features
content: I think this is very cool, lotsa features .. on the bottom side, kinda expensive and screen is small but overall a good product!!...

author: Katie Leifker
title: Cute!
content: I like that it's compact, but still has a screen.

author: pnumbno
title: Spot-on
content: Alexa spot....killer device..visually interactive with everything from my wifi lighting, nest, sound...plus you can do video calls with another Alexa Spot. And, it's good looking. I have two and Apple has blown it big time since the passing of Jobs with the growth and development of Alexa. And that is my final word.

author: Mike shell
title: Keeps resetting
content: Keeps resetting

author: CMoses
title: Great product, BUT...
content: It’s a great product BUT I find it less useful then it could be because of its inability to stay persistently connected to 3rd party cameras. We wanted to use it as a baby monitor during the night, but it automatically disconnects the camera after a certain amount of time. Requested a setting or something be added to allow persistent camera feeds. They claim they are going to do it, but we will see.

author: Amazon Customer
title: buyer beware - faulty product! never trust amazon tech support
content: Bought this device during Black Friday weekend. Timer/alarm didn't work despite multiple attempts.  Called tech support - After spending an hour on the phone with them, they failed to figure out the issue, were extremely rude, and honestly sounded kinda stupid like they didn't know what they were talking about.  Wish I hadn't wasted my money - Returning a faulty product since they refused to replace it after an hour on the phone! Absolutely ridiculous - Will not be purchasing any more echo products.

author: AmazonPrinzess
title: Nice but the sound is NOT good
content:
I feel the sound is very muffled on this device.  I have to turn up the volume to listen to Audible Books and such.
I like the original Amazon Alexa best.

author: Nathan
title: Improvement of Echo Dot
content: Pretty much an Echo Dot with a screen. Built in camera for calls. Great display for the size. Only criticism is visually there is no way to tell if disconnected from internet connection. Basically if signal is lost, the display has no indicator until Alexa is activated. Otherwise great device.

author: Brennan Household
title: Pretty cool. Same as Echo Dot
content: Pretty cool. Same as Echo Dot, but it’s got a screen, which is cool, cause it will display song lyrics, and photos, etc. Def worth the money.

author: Ltnsr4me
title: Not as good as expected but still good
content: For the most part this item is very good. I don't know if it's the connection or the item itself but it does appear to have a few glitches. Sometimes I have to tell Alexa several times something to do.

author: F. Stealth Banana
title: Love it
content: I use this as an expensive alarm clock. My little boy will climb in bed with us sometimes and he figured out somehow to tell Alexa to pay rain sounds. It made for a great sleep.

author: Michael
title: It's so cute and wow, it can make calls ...
content:
It's so cute and wow, it can make calls, send messages, set reminders, show pictures, intercom, etc.  But I do wish it has these features:
- more video skills (eg. showing news headlines on screen)
- be able to use the built-in camera as an IP security camera
- play movies from Prime Video and Netflix
- play Youtube videos

author: Patilu
title: Great to use with Ring doorbell; can see, hear and talk to visitors
content:
We have purchased 3 types of echoes this Christmas and are having lots of fun with them. I purchased the spot version of the echo primarily to go with our new Ring doorbell as I wanted something handy to see who is at the door without finding and fumbling with my smartphone  to open the ring app (and my husband still uses a flip phone, which doesn't do the ring app). Spot displays the door much quicker that the process on my phone. We CAN both hear and speak to visitors at the door with the ring app on the spot. (I've seen info on line stating that you can only hear visitors but they can't hear you with the spot. )
I also purchased the matching stand to go with the spot. The stand makes it sit up higher and it's easier to adjust the position of the spot. The price seems high for what it is, though. Nevertheless, I'm glad I got it.
Setup was easy, but this was my second echo. Note that you can scroll down on the Spot's  screen. I was stuck on a step of the first set up page I encountered that required scrolling down to see the arrow to click to go on to the next step.
I had to call customer support to complete wireless connection with my first echo but not this one. With a little Google help I paired the echo with the Ring doorbell.
The spot does function by default as a clock and also displays local outside temperature,  but these displays are constantly interspersed with other messages: trending topics and suggestions for using Alexa. I tapped screen to open trending topic and a short article opened. I tried tapping screen to go back to default display but nothing happened.  The display did return to default momentarily as if there is a preset time for the article to display the article before it returns to the usual routine. The default display does NOT include the date. I realize I can ask Alexa the date but would still like for this to be on the screen as I am a visual person who  needs to ascertain the date several times a day. Seeing the date visually helps it stick with me more than hearing it verbally.
There are an array of clockface styles for you to choose from.
Our experience with having Alexa available in several rooms  for asking a question or making a request has been delightful. Before Alexa, I was  always  thinking about looking up something or setting a reminder on my smartphone later, when I  had time. Now I can multitask by immediately asking Alexa to respond/perform a task. I can continue changing over the laundry while asking Alexa to set a reminder for one hour or asking what the weather is going to be like this afternoon or make that phone call that keeps slipping my mind. We can immediately get an answer to all of the things we usually just  "wonder" about in discussion (I wonder how old  Clint Eastwood is? I wonder when the superbowl is?). We can just include Alexa in the conversation to get the answer rather than breaking off conversation to Google it (keyboard or verbally) on a handheld device.
I'm excited to involve Alexa in even more management and fun, informative skills over time.

author: Nick T
title: A great purchase
content: When we were buying another product there was an option to bundle this one for an extra $30...so we thought why not? Well, I'm so glad we did! We are really enjoying our Echo Spot. It reads stories to our girls, plays music, gives us the news, and so much more!  It's so responsive and has so many skills that we enjoy.

author: Mister-Rodgers
title: Not there yet
content: Last year I decided to try a smart speaker.  I did the usual reading-up and decided to go with Google Home.  This year I thought I'd give Alexa a try because I thought some of the things people didn't like last year might be worked out by now (not as many apps associated, things "she" could do, knowledge base, etc.).  Using them side-by-side, I gotta say  that Alexa still has a way to go to catch up to Google.  The sound quality on Google Home is better - my cheap one sounds like a Bose compared to the old transistor radio sound of Alexa.  And Google finds answers to most questions that leave Alexa scratching her head.  I'll keep it and use it - the video option is kind of fun.  But I'd still go with Google for the time being if I were choosing between the two formats.

author: Samuel 333
title: A Blessing for Geezers
content: I'm 72, hard of hearing and have arthritis. The Spot  has been a blessing for me! Over the course of the last few years I've purchased several clocks with amplified alarms that were a complete bust. Once I removed my hearing aids I may as well have unplugged them. The Spot's ascending alarm is the first alarm that wakes me the second it sounds. In addition, reaching over to turn off an alarm when you have arthritis of the spine is no fun. Being able to shut it off with a verbal command is literally pain free. It was worth every cent.

author: Rebecca J. Woodby
title: Great assistant for the elderly!!!!!
content: I bought this for my 90 year old grandmother and she and I love it!!! She can call all her family members with just her voice, play games, even watch a video and I love that I can “drop in” on her any time to see how she is doing. She lives all by herself. And I feel comfortable if there was an emergency she could call out to Alexa for help!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Wonderful device
content: This little round ball beat my expectations! For such a small device the sound quality is crisp, clear, loud! Is it as good as a much bigger speaker, no. But the sound is fantastic! The microphone is sensitive to your voice even when the music is loud and you are not close. The Alexa app on this specific device is extraordinary compared to other Echo devices. It would be great if this unit was portable with a small battery, I suppose you could hook it up to a USB charger. This is truly like having a personal assistant, always waiting on you! You can make phone calls on it as well!

author: Jim McEachern
title: Five Stars
content: Pretty cool device - easy to use for alarm, love saying snooze

author: RB
title: 00 more out of you)the stand allows you to better angle and aim the unit to suit you
content: I functions as promised. I purched the magnetic stand which enhances its versatility. (It should be part of the Spot-not a sneaky way to get $20.00 more out of you)the stand allows you to better angle and aim the unit to suit you. my only disapointment is the Camera's Field OF View, It's quite narrow.

author: Cheryl Sparta
title: Good Product But Has A glitch.
content: The Echo Spot was pretty much as I expected it to be.  I works perfectly as part of my Echo products line.  The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because I liked the clock feature of the spot however, my big disappointment is that the screen scrolls through several screens periodically.  I would prefer it to stay on the clock mode continuously but I have not been able to solve that issue.

author: Robin Anne
title: Compact multitasker!
content: I love the echo spot. Made more room on my nightstand because it is so compact. I like this better than the original Alexa for sure! Easy to use and great sound when I use the Bluetooth for my music. Can’t go wrong purchasing this item, for sure. Not one bad thing to say about it.

author: J. Leahy
title: Big improvement
content:
Love the flexibility and options on this version. The screen flashes random interesting info interspersed with time and temp.

Big improvement in volume.

author: Desiree Villegas
title: Good buy
content: Oo how I love my Alexa!! I like to go into my room and say Alexa start my day and its filled with weather and news. I fall asleep to whatever music I like. Screen is a perfect size, lyrics, news all good quality. The only thing that I dont like is it has to be plugged in to stay on...hhmm u would think for the price it would have a internal battery instead of having to drag the wires around everywhere to have it on.

author: Margie E. Sherwin
title: Five Stars
content: I recommend this product to everyone

author: Gustavo Barbosa
title: My second Echo... and I do recommend.
content:
This is my second Echo. I initially bought a Echo Show and I love the functions and the lyrics on the screen when playing a music besides the very good quality of product.  The Echo Spot is no different. The screen is smaller but the round shape and different clock skins make it perfect for your bedroom.  I love it.  Now I can use it as internal communicator from the bedroom to the kitchen between the two ECHO.  The sound is very good for such a small system with a good resolution screen.
I will buy one of those camera covers as we never know if someone can hack the system and access the camera without you knowing... :)

author: beverly
title: we love our new echo spot
content: We have the Alexa dot, we love our new echo spot.  Love listening to audiobook and listening to music is awesome with the lyrics shown. Great as t way to learn new songs.

author: Jessica Gainey
title: Echo Spot is easy to use and a huge help
content: We love the Echo Spot! Our 8 year old son is going through his "who, what, where, when, why" phase, and this has already helped so much with all of hus curiosity.

author: wishfulexpat
title: Multipurpose
content: I love this thing.  Alarm clock and Echo all in one.  It's replaced my regular alarm clock and I always listen to flash briefings in the morning.

author: Paul Gerard
title: Great replacement Alarm Clock
content: Perfect alarm clock. When my old trusted alarm clock failed, I replaced it with the Echo Spot. What a great move !!  Besides having a true ,accurate clock, I can easily set my wake up time with a simple voice command. I also have an Echo show it the area where my dogs sleep and can quickly check up on them from my bedroom.  This was a great purchase

author: duffydill
title: Keeps me company
content: As I am all alone , it is nice to talk to Alexa, she gives me all kinds of information and it is nice to have someone to talk to. I love this device!!

author: DaQueenBee
title: Great buy at a great price!
content: Bought as a Father's Day gift for hubby. He loves it n uses it all the time. I will probably buy myself one eventually ;)

author: A. Relyea
title: The most useful alarm clock made!
content: I’ve replaced my alarm clock with a device that can do SO much more. While it’s a little pricey for an alarm clock, I love everything this can do.

author: Jason
title: Gorgeous
content:
This is one of the most gorgeous devices I have ever had. Alexa was a brilliant companion and worked into my routine seamlessly. I did return it. Why? The video element is gorgeous and the clarity of the screen for the size is spectacular, and though I have a “smart home”, I do not rely heavily on video. If I had children or another specific need to access video readily, this would be an ideal option. Alexa with eyes.

That being said, the shape, feel and presence of Alexa in this form is  aesthetically pleasing. It’s even terrific for the person who prefers form over function.

author: jasdev55
title: Good night and daytime clock... Okay as an alarm clock if you like to talk to it!
content:
I bought the Echo Spot to use primarily as a night clock.  I love the fact that you can select the clock face, and that it automatically dims when the lights go down. I don't use it for an alarm because I don't want to talk to it in the morning to turn off the alarm... I wish it had a button that did this.

I have two Echo Dots that my wife and I occasionally use to get the weather for our city or for a city that we are travelling to.  I setup a "Good Morning" Routine on the Echo Spot to tell me the weather, traffic on my commute to work, and then play a local radio station.

author: Cyndi Salbego
title: I like being able to see the weather temp with just ...
content: The spot seems much more sensitive to hearing her name then the Dot we have in the kitchen.. I like being able to see the weather temp with just a swipe of the screen.  The lyrics when you listen to music is nice.  She gives you images when you say Good Morning, or Good Night.. etc..

author: Jeff
title: Easy to Setup, Super Helpful, Amazingly Hidden as an Alarm Clock
content: Amazing product! Keep developing awesome product! Best evolution of Alexa (echo) yet.

author: Daniel
title: Better then Siri
content: What a day to be alive. I’ve called you Siri hundreds of time but you never get upset. For every beck and call you served your purpose. You play me music, wake me up in the morning and even give me a daily news brief. I have no reason to upgrade you. You such wonderful digital servant.

author: Judith from Las Vegas
title: I love the spot
content: I love the spot. I have purchased echos and dots and given them as gifts.  I love all of my alexa family.  I wish I had one in my car. I use it many times during the day. I like the screen.  Now I can see photos and recipes.

author: Amazon Customer
title: No way to keep the alarm clock on when the power goes out
content: The features on this are great, and it does get loud. However, we bought it mostly to use as an alarm clock, so I am disappointed that there is no way to charge it or add a battery. If the power goes out, I won't wake up. So I am deciding whether to keep using multiple alarm clocks just in case, or to return this item to get a less techy alarm clock that just does the bare minimum. Disappointed in this oversight

author: Cvh
title: Cool for facetiming
content: Cool for facetiming,  but everything I've asked her she doesn't know.  Asked her what the lunar phases would be in June and she didn't know.  I live in Kerrville,  Tx and she has the weather set for Sugarland, Tx.  In settings I changed it to San Antonio,  but it won't change.

author: Jairo Sanchez
title: Five Stars
content: WOW

author: DZ
title: It’s a solid little echo. My one issue is ...
content: It’s a solid little echo. My one issue is that the timer screen won’t stay on. It goes back to the home screen and you have to ask to see your timers or tap the screen. I wish there was a way to have it stay on the timer screen when timers are going.

author: roxie
title: Great value
content: Goes with the stand I bought too 3 echos what shall I do love them all

author: wifi-er
title: What? No package delivery notification alerts?!  Ignores turning Alexa suggestions off!!!
content:
I like that I can see the time and view video and do everything I can with the dot (I compare it to the dot because the sound quality is like a dot rather than the echo) with the added screen display. I was surprised that unlike the dot or echo, there's no notification ring. Yes if you ask, the message appears but who wants to have to do that; I had waited a bit after my dot and echo lit up to see what would happen. I then decided to shut off the Alexa suggestions because it was constantly showing them like some sort of running billboard and yet failed to notify me of something urgent.  Despite that, I am still getting them! -- so annoying!! Shut off the camera due to privacy concerns. I bought this to replace an old alarm clock and it serves this purpose.

According to my home content settings, I should see my messages, weather, reminders, photos, upcoming events. Alerts from Alexa services are disabled yet they keep appearing -- frustrating.

author: T. R.
title: Better than I thought it would be
content: Am just learning its abilities and skills.  Good for alarms, timers, reminders, short lists, radio in real time, podcasts, intercom, checking time/weather/sports, converting measurements,  etc etc.  Good quality speaker and microphones.

author: Corrin
title: While features of Echo Spot does the intended job, getting Skype to work was frustrating!
content:
My family has pretty much invested with the Alexa technology. We have a couple of dots, echo generations, and now the spot. I liked how playing music, lyrics would show up on screen. The setup is fairly simple as long as you follow the instructions and tie it to the correct Amazon account. What was fun about the spot was having it work with Skype. Setting up to work was annoying. There weren't any good articles online on how to set it up, and I felt I was going in circles.

Fortunately, we figured it out. First you'll need the Amazon Alexa app on your smart phone, and then making sure to allow contacts through "Communicate" and link to Skype. We also ran into a situation where we had to reboot the device in order for it to work too. Headaches involved at least for us, but so far no problems.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Awesome bed side piece!
content: I love that I can set it right next to my bed and it beats setting an alarm on my phone; makes it super reliable. Also, I love the features of adding a daily routine with of course the existing awesomeness of the Echo.  As an added bonus, the changeable graphic screens makes the Echo spot equally attractive as it is useful.

author: Lexxi
title: WORKS GREAT 90% OF THE TIME
content: I use this for a lot, mostly entertainment like the gaming apps or to play Spotify. But also reminders and alarms. There are times where I have to ask her something a few times or she’ll mishear me. I’ve had a couple times, in the beginning and not now, where she randomly started talking or playing music without anyone saying anything.

author: Andrew
title: Great aesthetics, mixed functionality
content: We bought 4 of these and we have an Echo Dot. They make great bedside alarm clocks. We enjoy them but it’s a little pricey for what you get. We are particularly disappointed with the call feature. She understands us about 60% of the time and the call quality is very weak. That was what we wanted the most and it is disappointing. The alarm clock is pretty good. They make it hard to select certain music. It’s definitely aesthetically awesome.

author: NandE'sDad
title: Nice little video Echo!
content: Really like the video screen to watch local news briefings , and seeing the lyrics (when they are available) scroll when I play music. The sound is ok (and I bought the little matching stand), IMO the sound is much better on the taller Echo, and the 3rd gen Dot (both of which I have). But, I have since paired the Spot with a high quality Bluetooth wireless speaker, and the sound is excellent. Otherwise I’d give the Spot 5 stars. No regrets, glad I bought it, and I use it every day.

author: Travis B.
title: Love it!
content: Makes the perfect bedside clock with all the fun and helpful features of Alexa.  Really love it.

author: K. Easton
title: Love it. It is so cute
content: Love it.  It is so cute.  Having trouble with it dropping calls, but it could be the internet?

author: PaulB
title: Alarm Issues, Do not trust as bedside alarm. But there is a work around.
content:
As I am sure many have or plan to, I bought this to use as a pretty cool alarm clock. Well there's a huge issue with that and Amazon, seems not to be too concerned about fixing it. So these devices have separate volume slides for timers, alarms, notifications from the main volume. I have mine set as high as it can go. But then I want to go to sleep listening to some music.  Obviously I set the main volume music to play at a low volume, so I can fall asleep. I then set the alarm to wake me up at 7:00 am. So what happens. I fall asleep with the music playing at volume 2, and then I wake up around 7:45 am. I notice the alarm on this device is going off.. But it's at an even lower volume than I had set the music for the night before. I'm like WTF! I was glad I wasn't relying on this alarm to wake me up to catch a morning flight, which is sometimes the case. I can several tests that morning. What I discovered is, if you have music playing, any timer or alarm which is set to go off will go off at a lower volume than the playing music and will totally disregard the volume setting of the slider bar specifically for alarms, timers and notifications. I sent a feedback notifying Amazon of this issue and except for a short "We will look into this" they have done nothing for the past couple of weeks. Well this device is totally useless as a bedside alarm and I'll go back to using an alarm I can trust. I gave Amazon time to fix this, but I'm not holding on to it past the return period. So this thing is going back to Amazon until they can figure out how to make it a functional alarm clock.

Update: 1/17/18: So after numerous tests I did find a work around to my main issue. To get the alarm to function properly, you have to use one of the Sleep Timer commands for your music the night before. It works, but I still think the 2 volume settings should function independently. I'm still not very impressed with the device for the cost though. Some more new clock faces and more useful features could change that. The clock face selection is very limited.

author: junkers
title: This has Improved my life!
content: I use this as my alarm clock and love it. The auto darkening feature is just right. Time is always right and no more fumbling for buttons. I have it set to turn on a smart bulb to 2% and tell me the forecast upon wake up. I really like the routines function. Once set up you really don't haft to mess with it yet its still easy to set a extra alarm or timer. Sound is Great. Overall this is one of the best pieces of tech I have ever bought!

author: E. Shields
title: Invasion of Privacy
content: Invasion of privacy

author: mtr_01
title: Second Echo purchase to compliment the first for a second ...
content: Second Echo purchase to compliment the first for a second room. Works as expected.  Considering a third in the near future (when there is a discount).

author: radiantsteve
title: Easy to use
content: This pretty cool, but I have to admit I have not used it for a lot beyond being a super easy alarm clock.  That is why the 4 stars which is a knock on me not the Echo Spot.  I have not gotten the knack of talking and interacting yet, but I am sure I will.  Really easy to set up and use.

author: D. Skerritt
title: Don't have to Mess with Buttons!
content:
I've had this for about 8 months now.  Got it on sale from another local store.  Yes I mainly use it for an alarm clock but the reason I love it is because I was constantly having problems with a $15 AM/FM radio alarm clock making changes and hitting the wrong buttons or not pressing the buttons in the right sequence.  Hold this button down while pushing this other button to change whatever.  I would constantly have to find the manual online to fix any accidental changes I made to either the alarm time or radio station presets.

I wanted something where I didn't have to push buttons to make changes and this fits the bill perfectly.

author: robert c.
title: i thaught i saw a price of $100.00 less than i paid on tv?
content: it seams to keep the old lady happy

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: LOVE my Echo Spot!

author: Robert Dailey
title: Small and portable
content:
Really like the size of the SPOT. We have 3 “SHOWS” in the house and will use these for around the patio and pool.
I really wish that they CAME with the stand. Like it’s big brother the SHOW, the standard inflexible position leaves it pointed at the ceiling unless you’re standing right over it. Not even a good position sittting in front of it.

author: S. Murray
title: Things to Try
content: SUPER annoying you can't stop it from displaying "Things to Try". This REALLY keeps me from enjoying this product even though the rest of it seems superb. Please update the UX to remove this card.

author: Evelyn Kawula
title: Love this. You can get anything you want
content: Love this.  You can get anything you want.  It know all information.  Love how it greets you in morning when you say hello.

author: Jo Boutwell
title: Like Amazon Echo Spot
content: My house is full of Amazon Alexa devices. I just got the Spot today. It is perfect for my kitchen. I like the display, and the sound is resonant, full, and crisp. Spot was the perfect finish to my Alexa home.

author: Amazon Customer
title: One star....maybe, no product support from Amazon!
content: Did love it at first, now it cannot keep the Wi-Fi connection even though all of my other Alexa devices do, very frustrating to not have a working unit, especially in the bedroom. Had to come back and downgrade after having so many issues, keep moving to a different product.

author: Nanquist
title: What will they think of next?!
content: I think this handy to have. We ask Alexa questions all the time. We get a news brief and weather every day. I even “drop in on my husband to aks/say something and I am too lazy to go in the other room. My grandson gets a kick out of her when he visits. I want to get my daughter one for her house so I can “see”my grandson more often. Alexa reads my audible books to me, and plays my music.

author: Cary
title: Love
content: I love it in my meditation room can play soft music and images that I have chosen to be in the background .

author: Jessica Martorana
title: Perfection!
content: I bought this as a gift for my mom and she adores it! She loved the ease of set up, and how many features the device has. I would certainly recommend this product!

author: Raymond DeMartini
title: Doesn't Meet Expectations ...
content: It's OK but didn't even come close to meeting expectations. Alexa doesn't hear me half the time and I have to repeat myself twice or even three times. 1/3 of the time Alexa doesn't know what I'm asking. So overall it's OK and I use it daily but it does get frustrating.

author: John the Retired Man
title: I love this device
content: I love this device!  It adds another element to the already useful Echo line of products. The main reason I bought this device was so I could view the images from my various outside cameras from our bedroom without picking up my phone. It also allows me to read various notifications and other info.

author: Jennifer
title: Very good for technically challenged
content: Husband loves his spot, not complicated at all,  and the book helped a lot!

author: James E. Black
title: Best Smart Home Alarm Clock (connect it to five tv in the bedroom)
content: Love it. Use it as an alarm clock/radio/music play/news station/ambient noise machine!  Love having it connected to other Spot and echo and playing music in whole house. Talking from room to room is cool feature. Just having Alexa close by is awesome. Controls all my smart lights in conjunction with my Echo. It’s just great. What I really love is it’s connected to the fire tv in the bedroom and connects via blue tooth so I don’t have to use the TV volume from way across the room. I have it right next to me on the night stand. Which is both very convenient quieter in the room.

author: Indigo Montana
title: Three Stars
content: Software issues with the AI When using more than one echo.

author: John Charles
title: But I still love it and love it a little more each day
content: The echo spot has exceeded my expectations. I find myself using it more and more. My only issue, and I knew this going in, is that you can't use it to control lights and such, you need the larger version for that. But I still love it and love it a little more each day. A++

author: D. Driggers
title: Fun but comparatively expensive
content: I like it, but it's much more expensive than the Dot for the addition of a small screen.  I use it as a bed-side clock, to control my bedroom lights and thermostat,  and to play  music and sleep sounds through a bluetooth speaker.  It occasionally loses connection with my wifi for some reason, even though the signal is strong. Not a five because of cost and occasional wifi issues.

author: Rick
title: Works just like the show - added it without issues
content: Works just like the show - added it without issues.  Minus two stars for it's BLUETOOTH support.  It will turn off bluetooth speakers when using the video drop-in feature as well as the "calling" feature.  You are stuck using the little speaker it comes with or you will have to plug it into an amplifier using the mini-jack patch cord (Speaker out) connection.  Boo on Amazon.

author: Steve
title: Damn Cute Echo Dot With Screen
content:
I love this little guy.  I use him to monitor cameras, listen to music, playback where noise, and occasionally view Amazon prime videos.

It’s compact, feels solid, never crashes, easily connects to Bluetooth and has a UI to check on it (echo dot can be difficult to manipulate Bluetooth devices).

Essentially it is a (very cute) echo dot, with a screen.  Makes it more useful.

author: Manfred M.
title: Great hardware - disappointing software - terribel unreliable alarm
content:
So as always with Amazon made hardware - great solid quality (we own 7 different kindles, 10 Echo Dots, a Show, and....), good sound and nice screen resolution.
But what a disappointing software you can't turn of the extremely annoying "Try, Alexa...."  - Many customer complain about it, but we just Amazon is not listening.
But here is the worse: Terribel unreliable alarm
When I set the alarm to "Every weekday, at 6AM, play Pandora" - it works for a few days and then the music duration starts to get shorter and shorter (the time the music alarm stays on before you say "Alexa Stop") and eventually (in around a week) there is no more alarm.
It looks like that there is no "Backup alarm" if you select a music station for the wakeup and you would loose WIFI over night.
I hope these things will get fixed soon.

author: NewOCPaddler7
title: Love this little thing
content: Powerful little thing. Packed with lots of features. Yes, it’s a small screen but fine to view quick news videos.

author: Ma Lu
title: Fancy but doesn't listen well 😂
content: The echo is very fancy looking and I really like it. The only thing I dislike it that sometimes it doesn't understand what I'm asking it to do

author: Ted Koch
title: Really like the Echo Spot as a replacement for my alarm ...
content:
Really like the Echo Spot as a replacement for my alarm clock. I wouldn’t pick it to anchor my smart home, but as a second echo that doubles as an alarm clock it’s awesome! I have disabled the camera so I won’t speak to any camera related functions.

Pros:
Alexa is awesome!
Sounds good relative to it’s size.
The screen/clock are easy on the eyes at night.
The alarm options are very pleasant and configurable.
I like the weather and news functions that it provides.
It’s a breeze to set up.

Cons:
Price.
Camera feels invasive.

author: John K. Childers
title: Really like all the echo products
content: Really like all the echo products. Have Alexa turning on and off all my hue lights.  It is great!!!  When I tell Alexa good morning she turns on lights in house and tells me the weather for day.  The only recommendation would be to have a chamberlain garage door skill so I could have her open the garage doors when I approach the house.

author: Christian C.
title: Get one!
content: Super device.  If you don't have one, get one!

author: Greg
title: Very covveinment!!!!!
content: The best thing I like about my spot is the size. Perfect for my night stand. I can check the front entrance way without leaving my bed also set my alarm, Listen to the sound machine, and set the alarm. How convenient is that?  Nothing negitive. To say about my spot.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Another technology to keep you intouch with family, life, and learning.
content: Love everything.  It's sooo cute and small in size but Mighty.  I really am pleased with it. My family gave it to me on my 72 birthday. We converse,  see each other and laugh slot.  Good product. I can talk to my husband in another part of our Home. Alexa is knowledgeable.

author: Julie
title: Great bedside clock. Dims in dark!
content: Spot is a great addition to our Echo Plus and we love our new alarm clock and Alexa device. Very helpful!

author: Thornerfhammer
title: Five Stars
content: So its cool, its groovy and it wakes me up.. plays music or back ground noise .. love it

author: Natalie Saunders
title: Very nice tech addition
content: Fabulous addition to my coffee bar. Alexa let’s me know the news and weather for the day as I get ready and really helps me multi task. She also has good speakers for me to listen to my podcasts at night. I wish the echo was compatible with YouTube though that would be the only reason why I knocked it a star

author: S. Quinn
title: Good voice assistant overall but lacks polish
content:
Overall: Good voice-assistant device with the expected basic functionality (smart home, calendar, lists, music, etc.) but still rough around the edges.

Pros: Great voice recognition, can hear and usually understand you from across the room even with music playing. Has all the main features you'd expect from a voice assistant. Connects and manages most smart home devices quite well. Ordering is easier compared to other Echo products with on-screen feedback in addition to the audio.

Cons: Internal speaker is hollow and tinny sounding, fine for voice but not good for music or radio and you can connect to SONOS but you can only play music through SONOS, and not override the default speaker. Cannot get rid of "Things to Try" flashing on the home screen, which feels like it's advertising itself constantly. Not integrated with iMessage and Amazon's message system is a little clunky.

author: R P
title: This is Awesome
content:
This product is really awesome, Alexa echo is better than the other devices as it has screen and all other features.
super smart.

author: DONALD M.
title: Echo Spot - White Amazon
content: Hi I love the Echo spot close unit. I got the white one nice. Sounds really great for the size of the speaker.

author: Peter Forde
title: Love it
content: I like the Echo Spot much more than I thought i would. I have it connected to my Bose wave radio in my bedroom. I like the clock face feature and how it dims or brightens to any light conditions.

author: Ducky
title: Price guarantee?
content: I love my Echo Spot and Show but right after purchasing Amazon marked the price down.

author: NJpopeye
title: Very convenient
content: Operates a lot of devices.  Works well and also can start a newer vehicle.

author: Krista G
title: Pretty hand little gadget
content: I was looking to replace my old clock radio and decided to give this a try.  I actually love using it.  I listen to music while I put away laundry or ask for the weather.  I can set my alarm to wake me to a pandora station of my choice.  My one complaint is the volume, but it is adequate.  I ended up hooking a blue tooth speaker to it so I can hear it over the fan.  I do wish you could customize the timer sound but I'm sure someone will come up with something in the future.

author: Martina Kirby
title: Not enough name options?
content: Very responsive just like the Echo Show just smaller. The only thing I don’t like they get confused if I talk to Alexa in the Living room, Alexa in the bedroom has to respond. Tried changing the name, but I don’t like the name option I have (

author: Amazon Customer
title: I love this because you can view your cloud cameras included ...
content: I love this because you can view your cloud cameras included nest ones on it.  We have an Amazon cloud cam in our babies room and are able to use the Echo spot as a baby monitor and it is amazing.

author: Private
title: Useless info on screen! Poor sound quality!
content: Sound quality much inferior to the Echo Tap. Useless info keeps popping up on the screen. Would like to freeze screen to clock while listening to music. Camera has very poor resolution. I did receive a nice call from tech support and was able to connect my echo spot to my stereo. Also made changes in the settings that should stop the unwanted info from popping up on the screen.

author: D. Neunaber
title: Not worth the extra money for my purposes. Stick with the dot.
content: I wanted an Echo with a small screen to see what was happening. I also bought it for an alarm clock.  It works ok, but it does give suggestions when I font want them. I also want to preview my Amazon video purchases. I have a hard time getting it to do that.  My suggestion: stick with the Echo dot—much cheaper and equally functional

author: Chelpiper
title: Great product
content: This was a great addition to our Alexa smart network.  The only disappointment is the sound quality. Compared to the Show or even the 3rd generation Dot, it doesn’t compare.otherwise it’s a great product.

author: smj
title: A great smaller versiom of the Show!
content: It's smaller than the Show, but just the right size for a bedside table. You can choose the wallpaper, clock display etc to personalize to your decor. I even bought the stand that makes it look that much more unique!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love Alexa.
content: Love to share this with family.Everyone enjoys this device.

author: Pap
title: Who needs this
content: I received this as a gift.  I don't see the need for it.  Screen is too small to be usefull.

author: Amazon Customer
title: You wont be disappointed!
content: My husband absolutely loves this! Bought for him for Christmas. Use as an alarm clock, a communication device, play a games, white noise maker, music player, set reminders etc etc. The only thing I have to say I dont like about it is you cant video chat people who dont have the alexa app, but maybe we arent doing something right. Other than that its wonderful and I'd buy 3 more for every room in the house if i could!

author: CAPTAIN
title: Cool tool
content:
I reieced my Echo Spot for Xmas and didn’t think much of it. But I went through the menus and setting and read the forum on it. Well don’t believe the negative comments in the forum.
The Echo Spot is amazing. It has lots of really cool features and I love the way I can voice communicate with it. I can’t list all the features since I am till learning, but it is a clock, a weather reporter, a music selector, self dimmer at night, etc. Great value for the price.

author: Catintexas
title: Absolutely love it
content: I am admittedly a gadget geek but I love the Amazon Alexa products. I got the original when it came out. I now have 3 dots and the Show, with the Spot as the new addition. I love it. I love being able to see the image of my front door from the Ring doorbell, as well as operating my lights and other home items by simply asking Alexa. Not to mention music and weather forecast. Just LOVE 💗 it.

author: Goldwing
title: perfect size for bed side clock
content: Superb product! The sound is beyond belief for size, perfect size for bed side clock. I listen to Amazon music with my photos flashing on screen! :)

author: H W Berry
title: this unit works well
content: spot works fine . There should be software dedicated to setup ofthe spot  functions and appearance.

author: Fred
title: Five Stars
content: very nice gadget. love it's look.

author: Lori M
title: Fun alarm clock upgrade
content: My daughter loves this upgrade to her little girl alarm clock that Danta brought her, she’s 10. I’m still trying to figure out the setting so she doesn’t have access to all my calendars & other personal setting. I’m considering buying one for myself

author: Seth Lukash
title: Five Stars
content: great product...for music , news, weather and waking-up.....etc...It's a good companion for my Alexa

author: amymirandamakeup
title: i am so happy I bought this device!!! want a second one!
content: I love this and I should have bought a second one when the price was a bit reduced.. they cost too much and it would be great if the price would come down again temporarily so I can get another one. This little device stays in my room on the table and I say alexa start my day and i get the temperature and the news or a song.. not bad at all, you must get this.

author: John Mebine
title: Worth every cent
content: Best alarm clock, speaker, video combo ever. This product was so amazing I purchased 5 more as gifts. Love to play with my dog using the app u can download to see and talk through anytime I desire.

author: Mick
title: I/we like the ease of getting “SOME” info
content: I/we like the ease of getting “SOME” info.  Some info is Very difficult to get & sometimes we don’t get the requested info. at all.  It was VERY Difficult to set up.

author: B. Hoov
title: Great clock...except for the background choices.
content:
How about a basic grey or black background and or the ability to adjust font size when uploading a personal photo. I prefer the digital clock but the backgrounds are limited with no plain colors. I created a plain background photo and uploaded it to the device. However when you do that the clock moves to the bottom of the screen and reduces in size to the point that it is harder to see. I guess they think that if you want to upload a personal picture the font should be smaller and at the bottom in order to see the picture, but surely it isn’t that hard to provide a plain color background.

Functionally the device works great, but sometimes it is the simplest of things that cause a product to be less than perfect.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Awesome
content: Luv it

author: Michael J Hanson
title: Remote access is great but having it in bedroom you'll need to shut camera off.
content: I love the way it works. I tell it to show me weather and it does. Whatever I ask for it does. I use it for an alarm clock and radio. Should have bought it long ago.

author: Mark A Kempen
title: Terrible as a clock or clock-radio
content:
It's a great idea--My thought was I could replace my old clock radio and it would take up less space and do all the alexa stuff too.  Strangely enough, though, it's a miserable, terrible clock.  My cheap old clock radio has bright 7/8" (digital) numbers.  I can see it day or night from anywhere in the room.  The echo spot has half-size digits, 7/16" but only when it feels like showing them.  It goes to sleep at night, so if you're half asleep you're out of luck.  You can wake yourself up, and move close  enough to see the tiny dimmed numbers, or you could call out and ask it, and wake everyone else, or you can just go back to sleep and quit worrying about the time.  And as often as not, it changes those tiny 7/16" digits to much smaller ones to show you the temperature.  I know I could go into settings and make that stop but my old clock radio never sacrificed the time to make me look at the temperature.  To add insult to injury, they advertise the echo spot as having all these different clock faces.  What a lousy scam!  You have these tiny digital numbers, and you can change them to 5 other tiny digital numbers that are exactly the same.  The screen is large enough that they could make it a fine clock, I don't understand why they don't?

On the plus side it does do all the alexa stuff and plays music, and it's even easier to set up because it has a screen so you can choose a wifi network and type in a password without using another device.

author: lak
title: Great alarm clock, speaker and all functions that come with it.
content: Writing after using couple months. This is the best product. Couldn’t believe Amazon made an excellent electronic item. Response to voice is great. Drop in works fantastic. Great sound quality for the price.

author: jesse burgess
title: Five Stars
content: Very useful, replace another echo and an LED clock on the dresser, it serves so many purposes.

author: Pen Name
title: Perfect size for my room
content: I absolutely love my Echo Spot.

author: Chris
title: Big sound and functionality in a small package
content: I bought 2 of these and gave one to my parents. So far I primarily use it as an alarm clock for my room, and controlling my hue system. It is a small package, but the sound for listening to music is just as good as the original echo. I've tried watching a video from prime off of it, and while it does work, the screen is a bit too small for this activity. The video calling however does work well. The screen is large enough to see the person you are calling and a smaller view of what you are broadcasting. A very cool device and a welcome addition to my smart home.

author: R.wise
title: There's a learning curve
content: So far I like it the only dislike is the manual is to small...

author: Natashia Sinckler
title: Love Alexa!!
content: I love having Alexa in my home, I think I will get one for my office as well. I’m very happy with it

author: JUDITH RALYEA
title: Alexa Try This
content: This drives me nuts, no way to stop this device from displaying TRY THIS. I think I will return this item.

author: Celeste
title: Get the Alexa show instead
content: For a few more bucks, spring for the Alexa show instead. In my opinion the bigger screen and better sound system on the show makes for a much better experience with the device.

author: BBurns
title: Bought this for my 13 year old daughter for her ...
content: Bought this for my 13 year old daughter for her birthday and she loves it! Sets various alarms and reminders and loves to wake up each day to a new song and the weather report.

author: Marilyn Kelly
title: In love with it
content: In love with it, it does what I ask which hasn't been much since I don't have other accessories  for lights and such.  It starts my day with my favorite song and give me the weather report, answers questions I may have when I don't have the time to look it up. My little time saver.

author: Theodore L. Wirth
title: Spot takes Alexa and Echo to a whole new level--you need at least one!
content: I received mine yesterday and the unboxing was about as exciting as it gets. Beautiful packaging and the gorgeous Spot unit felt substantial in my eager hands. Its design and workmanship are truly first rate--especially at this price. It does all the usual Echo stuff but the beautiful touch screen takes it to another level altogether. You can also swipe through several screens where there are other views and options available such as a screen showing what is music playing complete with touch volume and track controls. The result is that you can do a lot less yelling at Alexa to do things for you or fooling around with the cranky Alexa app. It replaced a misbehaving Dot Gen 1 and an old clock radio, and it looks beautiful in the bedroom. Setup is done from the touch screen so you can say CYA to the Alexa app. I use it primarily for music and have it hooked up to two rescued/reborn mini Jambox speakers paired in stereo mode. Thanks to Amazon Music with its advanced fidelity technology (it replaces your uploads with high fidelity tracks) it sounds fantastic at the low volumes required for adult bedroom use. I tried the built-in speaker for a few minutes and it sounds much better than the Dot and closer to the Echo 2, albeit with lower volume potential. In fact, it sounds good enough all on its own and just may be sufficient for quiet spots like a bedroom, but external speakers really seal the deal. Finally, the Spot with touch screen and camera does a whole lot of new stuff that I probably will not use and note that I turned off the camera because it is creepy in a bedroom setting (it is easily turned back on using the settings touch screen should you want to use it for video calls, etc.) In summary, I could not be happier with this supremely-designed and constructed unit.

author: Mr. FedEx
title: Alexa...with video.
content: Basically the echo dot with video. Best to connect via Bluetooth to a better speaker for music listening.

author: Esley M. Pendleton
title: Echo on spot
content: Got this to compliment our other echo. Using in bedroom as a clock ,wake up ,and radio source. Love the many looks you can give the clock feature!. Also got the stand which is ok but a little pricey.

author: Christian
title: I use it as a smart alarm clock
content: I have had an overall enjoyable experience with the spot. I use it as a smart alarm clock, it’s perfect for that use. My only complaint is that Alexa can be a little inconsistent when making requests. I will ask Alexa to show me one of my security cameras and it would work one day and not the next.

author: Ron
title: Takes a while to get to know the commands to do different actions
content: I like the face and colors. Dislike having to know the correct commands before you get the right answer.  For example; you cannot say fitbit steps you need to say ask fitbit for steps.

author: DLK Web Design
title: Great little display
content:
Purchased as a Christmas gift for my wife. She loves it. Has some nice clock faces and don't have to ask
Alexa for the time or current weather like with Echo Dot.

author: K. Odella
title: Great gift
content: We received the Echo Spot as a Christmas gift from my daughter.  My husband liked it so much he promptly went out and bought an Echo Show, so we keep the Spot in our bedroom.

author: Frank and Grace Billings
title: Great and versatile product!!!
content: Echo blacks exceeded my expectations! I gave it to my son to use as an alarm clock and he loves all the different features. He loves using it as a speaker, loves to ask it questions and loves to use it as a timer and an alarm clock. I love that I can “call” his room from the Alexa in our living room. Great and versatile product. The price is great too because it eliminates the need for multiple electronics. I love it!

author: J. Grigsby
title: Works very well
content: I love this little thing, I ask it all kinds of questions, it beats Siri all day long. We use it for weather while getting dressed, alarm setting, it shows pictures, wish the price was a bit lower but I bought for Valentine’s Day.

author: Lamone smith
title: ... can’t wven get it to connect to my phone like my other one
content: I can’t wven get it to connect to my phone like my other one. It’s just sitting there.

author: Shelly
title: REALLY Smart Alarm Clock
content: All I can say is WOW!!!  The Echo Spot has just replaced the Amazon Show on my night stand. I like that the screen is just right for night. It does everything that the Show can do, only smaller. Some people may worry about the camera. I just covered it with a small sticker. I chose not to use the clock faces that were provided. I downloaded a personal photo and used that as a clock face. Another thing that I JUST found out was that I can set my Spot to wake me up to a particular song. I didn't know that!!!! The speaker on this smart clock is perfect. I didn't have to hook it up to a Bluetooth speaker. I am running out of room for all of my Amazon devices in my house!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Amazing in a work
content: Simply amazing what a awsome device. It never ceases to amaze me, wake up to big bang music, go to sleep softly falling rain. Drop in on the kids and keep in touch. I have just scratched the surface as to what this devise can do.

author: Man Tucket
title: Speech recognition and query interpretation are not as good as Google
content:
Speech recognition and query interpretation are not as good as Google... have to repeat myself often.
Doesn't do well with accents either.

author: Mr. Arthur Matthews
title: Love my Echo Spot for superb design, build and functionality
content: I just love this Echo Spot, I also have the Echo Show but this has such a great form factor and works flawlessly. If I was starting my Echo devices all over again I would have more Echo Spots as they not only have a super screen and Echo functionality but are so solidly made with an excellent inbuilt speaker.

author: William Tota
title: Fun new technology
content: Still learning how to operate all the functions

author: Brent1
title: I love my new Alexa
content: Has all the standard benefits of an Echo Dot, but with the added benefit of a screen. I can tap into my security cameras and see what's going on, granted it's on a small screen, but you can still see it pretty well. Has a ton of different screen options. Most of the complaints you read about advertising  and settings are from people who haven't looked thru all the settings. Not sure if the speaker is better then the Dot, but to me it does sound better.

author: ITGuy265
title: Great Echo Device...
content:
