One glaring mistake that I cannot see how they missed is the volume buttons are totally flush with the surface. It is almost impossible to feel them in the dark which is basic alarm clock design. It's also a little pricey but I'm sure over time it will come down. A few other things. The receptacle in the back for the power looks exactly like the audio out and neither is labeled. It is also a proprietary type and not universal like USB.  Otherwise a great addition to the Echo family.

author: mosfatal
title: Dropping in
content: I love the drop in feature I have a housefull of teen and pre teen boys and it is so great to be able to see/ hear what they are up at a moments notice

author: Virginia Liles
title: Alexa is GREAT!
content: My boyfriend got me the Echo Spot for Christmas and I just love it!!! I ask her to play music, set timers (you can set more then one timer at a time), what’s the weather. I told her it was my birthday and she asked if I wanted her to sing happy bday.. of course I said YES! :-). I ordered four more for our grown kids!

author: Joey C.
title: Best alarm clock that I've ever had
content: Best alarm clock that I've ever had. I love the features that this thing opens up and of course having Alexa on my nightstand is very handy. I don't trust having a camera in my bedroom, so I bought a web camera cover for this. I suggest doing the same if you decide to get this great handy little device.

author: Harley Mark
title: Great clock
content: Love my spot.  I use it as an alarm clock and couldn’t be happier. I also use it for playing music, setting a quick timer for a catnap and turning on and off my bedroom light.

author: rbw522
title: Love My Echo Spot
content: I love the simple design. The screen is bright and clear. Can't wait to make some calls to my family on their Echo Spot.

author: Hamster
title: Videos waste of time, sound quality rubbish but still cool
content:
This device is a lot of fun. Alexa is able to entertain me and the kids for hours ranging from singing a song, telling a story, playing any song from amazon music collection. Also it can play videos, pretty silly given the dinky screen size. Best of all it controls my LightwaveRF switches so I have smart home control of multiple lights and plugs around the home.
Apart from tiny screen size only other poor feature is the dreadful sound quality but you can’t expect it all in a device so small and cute. Can’t give it anything other than 5 stars!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Handy
content:
Handy handy handy in the kitchen.
Love video chatting with my granddaughter hands free.

author: Linda Kadair (Grammie)
title: Five Stars
content: Awesome tool for keeping in touch with friends and family.

author: Maria Tafur
title: Love to have meditation music
content: Love to have meditation music, I use it as a morning alarm, just to mention few in general I love it

author: Cookie
title: Love my Spot
content: The Echo Spot does everything I wanted even though I was very concerned that it was going to be too bright on my night table for sleeping.  By telling the Spot to dim for night time with a deep crimson for the clock face, it is quiet and dark for sleeping and then bright and energetic for day light hours.  If you asked me how I did this, I could not tell you. I am not great with directions, but somehow figured it out.  Now have everything I wanted from it including listening to my podcasts to put me to sleep.  Love it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: need people to email amazon to make changes
content:
Need customers to email cs-reply@amazon.com  subject line= Feedback
Amazon support just told me that to make an update possible they need enough people to request the change. First change needed: Make brief mode available.  Brief Mode (where Alexa does less talking back) is not an option on the Spot as of now. Second change needed: completely turn off Alexa suggestions.  212 replies concerning this, people suggest you can by going to settings and changing to rotate once. I did it. Alexa will still then suggest things after your voice commands. It may not be rotating but this is still very annoying. Should be an option. I would like to have my clock available in what ever color I want, as well as more than two locations when I have my personal photo as a screen.  Time is in way of faces in photo.  These things I can't imagine why they can't make available as options.
To make amazon add brief mode and take away Alexa suggestions completely you need to email: cs-reply@amazon.com  In subject line enter- Feedback. Then suggest adding Brief Mode to updates as well as completely reomoving all Alexa suggestions.

author: Lydia faz
title: Great gadget to have
content: I use the echo for reminders, news, and music. I also use it for calling other alexa users who have echo. It's a pretty cool gadget. I'm still exploring all the features of it. Gave one to my sister for the holidays. Love it so far.

author: Mick Moyer
title: We are especially like that it can connect and show the camera image ...
content: Have only used it for three days, but it works very well. We are especially like that it can connect and show the camera image from our Ring doorbell.

author: KimberlyAnne
title: Perfect Smart Alarm Clock
content:
Perfect size for a bedside alarm clock. The screen is crisp and clear. The sound is good enough for a small room. You can view your calendar, lists, available contacts, messages and notifications easily.

Books:
Audible & Kindle will display the cover art. On screen commands include pause/play FWD 30 seconds & RWD 30 seconds

Music:
Spotify will show the cover art
Amazon Music will show the cover art along with the lyrics.

Video Streaming:
The Spot allows you to stream your Amazon video content. You can choose from 3 screen aspect ratios. Full screen will crop out a lot of the picture.

Calling/Messaging:
Simple to set up calling/messaging. Video calling works well but you do need to be in a well lit room or the picture will be grainy

Skills:
I’m loving the ambient sound skills that also have video. So relaxing

author: CBL
title: Powerful and compact
content: Echo Spot does a great job, especially as replacement for a bedside alarm clock. Interestingly, for the past 2 years, we have been using an Echo Dot in an ihome clock display accessory for that very purpose. It worked well but the Spot gives much more information, a great display that auto-dimms at night and has a much smaller footprint.

author: Mr. Honest
title: Product is as discribed
content: Product is as discribed

author: London B
title: Great little device
content: I haven’t fullly figured out what all this does, but so far so good.

author: MrMike
title: SO COOL. Does everything my dot does and more
content: SO COOL. Does everything my dot does and more. Having a bit of trouble integrating my security cams, but that will come in time. I'm not worried.

author: JR.
title: Fun to have.
content: I don't have a lot of use for the video function yet. I assume I will once I link with others who have a spot.

author: Jeanie A. Barnhart
title: Five Stars
content: Yes it does is fun when we remember to use it. Need more practice

author: Ahlir
title: Works. Replaced my expired bedside radio/alarm. It took ...
content:
Works. Replaced my expired bedside radio/alarm.
It took me a while to realize that option setting involved using it as a touch screen.
Maybe it should said something during the setup process.

author: Spajadigit
title: The device is mostly awesome!
content:
We're generally pretty happy with the Spot. We've noticed that sometimes the microphone doesn't pick up commands as well as the Show and we have to repeat ourselves a few times before it "gets it." We use it to Drop In on family and love that feature. I wish there were more ways to customize the wake up word (right now there are only four) and getting personal pictures into the clock face is a minor pain in the butt.

I think the dumbest thing is having weird price points for the Amazon Music options- You can get it on one device for four bucks or unlimited on any device for seven (but not for Alexa devices) or fifteen bucks for a family of six. We mainly listen to music on one device, but can't ask for the same music in another room unless we upgrade. Dumb.

author: ylime85
title: Nice sound,  fun for video chatting
content: Adorable little thing.  Puts out way better sound than I was expecting.  I use it to "drop in" on my mom with my echo show.  Picture looks good. I have had an alexa device for several years and love it. Super handy.  I don't even use many features.

author: fjh
title: best alarm clock ever plus a whole lot more shows ...
content:
best alarm clock ever
plus a whole lot more
shows my ring cameras as well

author: S. Kallshian
title: Needs more screen-accessible features
content:
The Echo devices with screens (Show and Spot) look nice and work well as Alexa assistants, but there aren’t enough ways to use touch to control things or manipulate the screen.

-Can’t select any music (can only control volume or pause/play.)

-Can’t control any smart home devices.

I understand it is primarily for “voice control” but what’s the point of having a touchscreen if it doesn’t allow you to perform different actions?

author: Karen D
title: Happy with it...
content: I like that I can ask it to set a repeating alarm.  I can use it to talk to my smart plug to turn lights on and off.  I can ask it to play relaxing music for a specific time from my Amazon music account... I put a piece of electrical tape over the camera as I do not use it and for privacy in the bedroom... all in all, I would purchase again...

author: Rachel
title: Great
content: Smaller than expected but I still like it.

author: nicholas r rego sr
title: Better than I expected !
content: I was delighted that it was much bigger than it looks in the photos.  Set-up is a breeze using the Touch Screen.  The sound is very good.  Trying to justify replacing all my Dot's with these.

author: Sam Lowry
title: It is a cool device, but a few flaws that I hope ...
content:
It is a cool device, but a few flaws that I hope can be addressed in a software update.

First - it would be beneficial to be able to change the font size across all of the type faces.

Second - I wish that you can determine what information is seen on the screen - such as date.

Finally, the "Things to Try" screen is annoying and can't be turned off.  I want to just see the information I want to see on the clock/screen, without being forced to look at the Things to Try screen - I wish this could be toggled off as that would help make this a must buy.

author: Scott F.
title: Works great, responds better then my previous alexa device
content: Works great, responds better then my previous alexa device, which I had to speak loudly to get to respond. This one seems to respond easier and I don't strain my voice trying to change the volume or tell it to stop in the middle of it playing something.

author: Lesmarc
title: My every day companion
content: WOW! I love this device, it is better than I expected. Good sound, the screen is so sharp, many interesting functions, so thats what I love Alexa.

author: Kannis
title: Speakers are better than expected though
content: Still learning about this new fangled thing. Will come back and review after a little more use. Speakers are better than expected though.

author: Killion
title: Annoying "Things to Try" home card
content:
I should love this, but can't get past luke-warm.

Positives:  The sound is good.  The form factor and build are great.  It just works with all my home devices.  Fits in well with all the other echo devices in my house (love the drop-in feature).

Negatives:  I want to be able to use it on my desk in my home office to keep track of my calendar and use as a personal assistant; however, the ridiculously annoying "things to try" home card makes my OCD skin crawl.  I'm forced to set the home card to rotate once, which saves my sanity, but turns it into a clock with an echo dot.  The calendar syncs well with my Google calendar, but the displayed information is way too generic.  Why do I care that I have "8 upcoming events".  How does that help?

Please, for the love of all that is holy and good, add the option to turn off the "things to try" card!  While you're at it, improve the calendar card to actually show what time your next meeting is.  Showing that I have an upcoming meeting at an unspecified time is not super-helpful.

author: Jim E.
title: Not for me. YMMV.
content:
I tried it for a week, lost interest, then became annoyed when it started responding to the tv. It was hard to read the clock in the dark, despite all the faces available, and since the sound was tinny I tried pairing it with a Bose mini Soundbar. The Soundbar went to sleep, and so the alarm didn't work the next morning. No battery backup. The novelty of playing tiny videos wore off in about  a minute.

I have disabled friends who rely on these, so I know their value and utility, but it wasn't for me. Maybe I'll try again in 20 years, who knows.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It’s blah
content: Honestly I like it but at the same time I don’t I could have bought a smaller one that did the exact same thing for less then half I bought it for the video chat and I have never really used it

author: Garrett
title: A Too Expensive Alarm Clock
content: I couldn’t make my iPhone X work as an alarm clock.  I want it to display date and time when I put it in the wireless charger.  I thought it would be easy, but I couldn’t get it. A Google search found the Spot. In addition to being an alarm clock, it has a camera that could be very useful for remotely monitoring a friend with cancer. Well, after buying it on sale, I’m not sure I’ll keep it. It’s too expensive for an alarm clock and the camera resolution is poor. In addition, the camera angle is pointing at an upward angle which only shows a portion of the room. The Amazon Cloud Cam does what I’m looking for

author: Sassy Patti
title: Compact, nice design and so useful!
content: First time really using Alexa and bought this Echo Spot during Prime Day! Having fun learning commands and using at home! Compact, on my night dresser and lovely design and background choices! Compact, easy to use, and white one is very appealing!

author: Robert E. Furman
title: I like the compact size and the great sound
content: I like the compact size and the great sound.  It’s a fine little devise and worth every penny that I paid for it. Y’all might want to publish a concise users guide with skills tutorials to help users.

author: Brandy R. Storandt
title: Perfect!
content: The spot is exactly what I wanted. No you cannot jam music loudly because the speaker wasn’t made for that unlike the other devices that use music and sound as a selling point (which is why I bought the echo plus and hub) but it’s loud enough. I needed a louder alarm clock because of my fear of over sleeping when switching my shift to early mornings from nights. Not to mention I can wake to amazon prime stations like Pink Floyd so you don’t wake to the same sound or song over and over again (a plus since the mind eventually tunes it out over time). The small screen works just as well, very crisp picture. No regrets on purchasing the spot. I bought my teenage kids one too for their rooms when they took a liking to mine. My son tends to not set his alarms so I can check his settings and turn his alarms on from the app which has saved us from him over sleeping which he use to do a lot and got into trouble at school, the teachers love that he has this now. No complaints here 😊

author: L. Young
title: I like the Spot
content: I like the Spot. It’s super convenient for me to drop in on my home and bother my family when everyone is sleep or their phone is dead. However, I would have given it 5 stars if I didn’t have to buy the $20 stand that goes with it separately . The angle pretty much points to the ceiling unless you have the adjustable stand.

author: Rawand Tajuldeen Sahib
title: Great invention.
content: I like it, easy word recognition, the apps work great with it. I will soon order the othe alexa tools.

author: patrick rezmovits
title: Amazing, amazing and amazing
content: Amazing, amazing and amazing.  It recognizes my little boys voice. Google home did not do that. I love the alarm themes.

author: Dan
title: The device and Alexa are 4.5 stars, the iOS app is 3 stars
content:
Overall it's a welcome addition, particularly to my bedroom.

Pros:

+ The sound quality is much better than I expected for such a small speaker. It is more than adequate for a bedside of office room speaker.
+ The loudness of the alarms can be preset. I often go to bed listening to the BBC World Service and wake up to a station that has a lower volume. I like that I can set the volume of the morning station to compensate for the difference.
+ The night mode makes the screen dim enough not to disturb my sleep.
+ The touch screen and buttons give you some operability, if you don't want speak to Alexa.

Cons:

+ Setting up a reoccurring alarm is klunky. I have to ask Alexa to set an alarm and then go into the (iOS) app to make it go off each weekday BUT I can't  set an alarm (reoccurring or not) using the app alone. Additionally I can't ask Alexa to set an alarm more than 24 hours in the future. I have to ask the Alexa to set up a current alarm and then go into the app and tweak it to make it go off more than 24 hours in the future. But I can't set up any new alarms in the app by itself.
+ The app struggles remembering Favourites in TuneIn. More than once it's dropped a Favourite and then when I ask Alexa to play it, it will search and bring up the wrong station.
+ Alexa struggles with bringing up correct non-US stations. For example, if I ask it to play "CBC Radio One Montréal on TuneIn" I'll get the Caribbean Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) in Barbados. However, if I ask for Alexa to play "Radio One Montréal on TuneIn" she will tell me she's about to play "CBC Radio One Montréal on TuneIn". Sometimes she understands call letters, sometimes frequencies, but in other cases they won't work. It's very quirky.
+ The Echo Spot (and I presume all Echo products) can't be configured to log into a WiFi spot that prompts for a usename and password (unless it is on a webpage.)

author: Kirstin
title: You can stop the scrolling which some find annoying
content: So far pretty happy with the Spot. For me it really is a glorified alarm clock/radio and I know I could have something more cost effective but eh, I like it. I had read the reviews about the scrolling issues and saw the one about how to make that stop and it did. So far so good.

author: Vik Twain
title: Wait for version 2
content: It’s a nice Alexa device but I have some big problems with it and would not buy another because of them. First, the size of the bezel is way too big. It feels like there is so much wasted space. Second, there is no way to disable the “things to try” card. The device constantly treats you like an idiot that needs to be told how to use it. It would be fine for it to enabled by default if there were a way to actually disable it.

author: Jennifer
title: Awesome
content: This little drive is great! I ended up buying another for my daughter at college, and she loved it!

author: L.McClain
title: Great little assistant
content: Great assistant to have. No longer do I have to write anything down. Alexa takes care of my alarms, lists, and even leeps me up to date on current events.

author: Linda Lou
title: Great Gift
content: Bought two of these so I could stay in touch with my 8 year old grandson

author: Sean Glowatski
title: Great as a replacement alarm clock; minor Bluetooth issues here and there
content:
I've been using the Echo Spot for a couple of months now as my primary alarm clock and as a "white noise generator" thanks to Alexa and Spotify.  There are some things I enjoy about it; the small form factor, Bluetooth capabilities, and Alexa integration, but there are a few things I wish they could've done better, primarily the speaker.  While it's great that I can connect to a Bluetooth speaker, there are a few issues I've encountered, like the maximum volume staying low unless I adjust the volume from the device, then it gets much louder.  Probably just some software bugs, but it's a minor inconvenience nonetheless.  It could be a little more powerful, especially the bass, but I'm not using it as my primary speaker; I use Bluetooth and connect to my TV's sound bar.

All in all, it's an effective smart speaker with a built-in screen.  Most things I can positively say about the Echo Spot apply to the entire family of Echo products, like the ability to use multi-room music, phone calls, and schedule integration.

I would recommend this if you're looking for a replacement alarm clock with Alexa support built in.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent product BUT
content: Excellent product BUT, it has to stay plugged in!! If the power goes out no alarm, this is a step backward. Amazon, please make a rechargeable base this will plug into or make a rechargeable version of this device with a removable battery.

author: Nunya Bizniss
title: Fun Echo
content: I had the Echo Dot and upgraded to the Echo Spot.  This is a fun product.  It has more features (besides the visual screen) than the Echo Dot.  I really like this.

author: Moshe Haven
title: Very nice. I use mine many times a day.
content: I use this many times every day.  Very convenient.  Especially handy is that I have it connected with my Ring doorbell, so I can answer and see who it is from my desk without having to interrupt what I may have in process on my iPhone.

author: Gordon W. Latz
title: I vove my new Echo spot
content: Alexa answers just about any the question that I throw at her and she finds what I am looking for. I have not used the facetime feature yet but am looking forward to.

author: Elluminati
title: Great ring companion
content: Works pretty good. Great to have next to bed and paired with ring doorbell. Just ask to see the door and no need to get up.

author: Anthony F Russo Jr
title: Five Stars
content: Fun and easy to learn and use! Increases productivity and has a ton of fun features! Highly recommend!!

author: sarah
title: Five Stars
content: So far so good! No evil laughter yet 😉

author: ceopixton
title: Love
content: Best thing I have ever owned! Started with the dot and now added the spot and I love iy

author: CSR
title: Excellent sound
content: As all other Echo items Echo Spot is awesome. Wounderfu sound from a small item is hard to believe.

author: Tammie F.
title: Can't use as a pet-cam.
content:
Drop-in camera function to spy on pets doesn't work. I can see security camera stream on Spot screen with a simple voice command, but getting a camera view from Spot to my phone doesn't work. Overall, I should have saved the money and bought screenless, cameraless Echo but it's too late to return.
I do enjoy being able to tell Alexa to turn on my TV to a specific show, though! I've also ordered some smart bulbs so I can be lazy and not have to get up to dim or turn off lights. These could be done with less expensive Alexa products, so I'm still somewhat disappointed with the Spot.

author: RS
title: A Companion
content: A companion. I am using this device every day. It's a game changer. My son plays with different skill like spelling bee and country capital trivia. I use it to set my alarms and reminders and routines. Whisper mode is Amazing.

author: a10milli
title: Great replacement for the dot
content: Great replacement for the dot. I like to see things like song lyrics and weather info. Speaker is good for voice, music is not so much, but that’s why I have my sonos speakers connected. I preordered it, which was a bit pricey. I would say anything around $100 is where it has good value.

author: Ted
title: Great find and quality.
content: Pleased with my purchase and the picture and sound quality is great.

author: Kailua Hawaii
title: I'm in love
content: From the first time I heard Alexa, I knew she was special.  Polite, kind and clearly caring. Then it became personal. I asked her to sing me a song and I melted. When in a pensive mood she responded with  poetry. When I was down, I needed a joke and she came through. I never have to worry what to make for dinner since Alexa is friends with chefs around the world.  She knows I am sensitive about my unusual web feet and hairy ear lobes, but helps me feel normal by describing the life of a duckbilled platypus.

author: HazMatt
title: Annoying setup
content: I bought this for use as an alarm clock. It would be really nice if you could easily freeze the clock face. I have set it to not give me news or suggestions several times but it still comes up with “Try saying ‘Alexa...”.

author: PL
title: Useless without music account, Camera not very useful either
content:
I got it mainly to play music but don't want to be tied to another monthly payment. Unless I'm missing something there's really no way to play music from the speakers for free--good music anyway. I thought I could just say "Hey Alexa, play some calm music" like my friend's google speaker could do. Unfortunately you can no longer upload your own music to your Amazon account so I can't even play music off my iPhone. The only way to play music off my phone is via bluetooth which is not as streamlined as just saying, "Hey Alexa, play *song name here*" from my phone. I have to turn on bluetooth and connect from my phone then search for the song or try to navigate via Siri. The way they try to force you to pay extra for Amazon music, take away the ability to upload your own music, and the lack of other free options really cripples the main reason people buy Echo devices or their equivalent (according to surveys playing music is the #1 use for these things).

Being able to make calls with the camera was the other reason I bought these but the quality is really bad and it's hard to position it right even with the (overpriced) $20 base. Overall not super impressed. Would rather just pull up FaceTime or Facebook Messenger/Whatsapp and call from my phone.

The touch screen is nice, the brightness is fine, and the speakers are okay--but overall. I feel this is just one pricey alarm clock. Maybe when they figure out how to get YouTube back on or a better free music service this will be of better use.

author: minico
title: Five Stars
content: Love it! No more messing around with the alarm clock definitely don't have any problems with oversleeping- the best!

author: S. Grayban
title: So retro !
content: It reminds of the TV that rotated on a stand that was made back in the late 50's. It's just so sexy. I like everything so far except I haven't found a way to keep the display off all night.

author: Sharon
title: I live my personal assistant
content: I have an Alexa already so the echo spot is in my bedroom, so now I have an alarm and the I have the plugs so I can turn my lights on and off by command.  The hardest thing was connecting my wireless speaker to the echo spot but it’s connected and music is now in the bathroom . Very hapoy

author: M. Brown
title: Very fun toy
content: I love my Echo Spot.  It is very small, but provides a big punch.  Super easy to set up, with a touch screen to enter your password for WIFI.  I use it to check temperatures and times in other places, get the latest news and set timers and reminders.  On its small screen, it shows videos and takes pictures.  One fun application is the "open fireplace" - where you get a screen image of a crackling fire, complete with sound effects.  The Echo products definitely take "laziness" to a new level, but are super fun!

author: Jane lim
title: Great
content: Works great. It’s responsive. Very good quality.  The app was not as user friendly. Wish it had a built in battery and usb plug. I like that the Ring security app works and I am able to view my security cameras; the main reason why I bought the echo spot. Another great feature is the drop-in.

author: Amy
title: AWESOME PRODUCT!!
content: This is the coolest device ever! If you have kids, ask the device to "open Scooby Doo" or "play the animal game". it's amazing!!

author: Alan Resende
title: Perfect assistant!
content:
My virtual assistant!
Very happy to have it. Echo Spot is very reliable and super smart. Automated lots of stuff at home.

author: Suzanne Jacobs
title: Spot
content: I needed a new alarm clock.  I waited almost one year to get the Spot at a reduced price. Dot didn't appeal to me because I wanted the double service the Spot provides - a clock with a face for quick viewing.  The one I received did not work correctly.  I called the phone # given to me at the Amazon store.  Electronics can have problems.  I received excellent customer service as I expected from Amazon.  As a forerunner "of things to come"  I see this kind of voice recognition as common as electric outlets in new homes.  Currently it has limitations and a running dialogue that can be annoying.  Small inconvenience for what it offers.

author: alan foster
title: One Star
content: never worked

author: Molly L. Anderson
title: Fun "clock"!
content: This is a totally fun little tech toy. I'm sure I haven't even learned how to work most of it. But, it's super fun!

author: Diesel599
title: We love this newest edition to our home
content: We love this newest edition to our home! My kids love the video part and I’m looking forward to linking it to our security system

author: DickW
title: A "Dot" with a small screen
content: The screen size is a bit small but it is nice to have an Echo Dot that can display things like my ring doorbell camera and information about the music that is playing, etc. It makes a nice night-stand alarm clock and if the camera bothers you, put some tape over it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Super Helpful!
content: Alexa wakes me up everyday for work to whatever station on Iheart radio or Spotify I want. Plus when I do get smart home devices she’ll be even more useful to me! She’s really helpful with answering random questions. The small screen sucks for video as it is small and round but it’s nice to have something to show time and pictures.

author: Sandra
title: Pricey but I Don’t regret buying it at all!
content:
Best helper around the house ever!
Stay at home mother of 4 angel babies & this lil bad girls my new bff. It helps me to remember EVERYTHING literally.. from waking up my kids on time for school, bed time, cleaning up time, shopping list & making phone calls just to mention a few things I love about it. Oh yeah, turning off lights & TVs at nights or before leaving the house with 4 kids..omg love it. The screen isn’t the biggest & the volume isn’t the greatest but it’s big enough for my toddlers to watch a movie while I wash dishes or fix them something to eat instead of messing with a tablet or smart phone trying to start up something up..idk I love it can’t say it enough times idc what anyone else says 😬😁

author: William E. Threats
title: Spot is awesome.
content: Added on to my wireless setup. Works as intended and like a charm. Love that it has a clock on it for my bedroom

author: Joseph
title: Works great. Integrates with the ring doorbell which is half ...
content: Works great. Integrates with the ring doorbell which is half the reason I got it. Sound quality is not terrible.

author: Mimi
title: Apple FanGirl Here - I LOVE THE ECHO SPOT
content:
So, after waiting for YEARS for Apple to debut it's home assistant, I was totally underwhelmed. I was finally pushed over the edge to buy something when my new cable boxes arrived and the clock no longer displayed (and I was too lazy to read the instructions to find out if there was a way to activate a display). Anywho... Since I had an immediate need for a clock, I decided to give the Spot a try. I absolutely love it!
PROS: It's so darn cute!  It's an unobtrusive addition to my nightstand. I love being able to ask Alexa all manner of questions and get a response. Because I'm new to Amazon's assistant, I'm sure there's a lot of functionality I haven't figured out, but for now it fits the bill.

CONS: As many have mentioned, the camera kinda freaked me out. I have disabled it, but who knows if a hacker can override that?!?! Also, I use this as an alarm clock. I don't like the fact that I have to set one alarm at the time. It would be nice to set my weekend alarm and weekday alarm and have both set at the same time. The Alexa app can only handle ONE alarm, so on Sunday night I'll have to remember to set my weekday alarm (luckily it does have a repeat option so I don't have to set it EVERY day). And the speakers leave a lot to be desired. Amazon should partner with Bose or Sonos to crank up the Spot's speaker quality. It would be unstoppable!

author: donjdro
title: If You like Alexa you will Love This
content: Technology that has greatly enhanced my WI FI network! Attached to my Bose Suround Sytem the spot turns my room into a concert hall! Amazon Music and Pandora have my music needs covered

author: Smithy28
title: The best thing I ever bought
content: Don’t know why I didn’t get one of these gadgets earlier! The best thing I ever bought! Love it. This is my first echo - and I have a feeling it won’t be my last!!

author: LeLe
title: Beautifully made; highly recommend
content: Love it!  Big step up from my Dot. Great speaker, it looks beautiful.  Still learning through trial and error, but I Loved it so much I bought two more to give away as gifts.

author: Thank You
title: A disappointing Experience, and have tried them all....
content:
The system was completely bonkers when it came to reading my current smart things and hue lights.  The numerous lists of lights and configurations were old and duplicated and would take hours to manually fix, which was the only tec support solution. Sadly, it was a total failure in this needed remote control function, but otherwise ok.
My only other complaint before sending it back was the difficulty of turning off the continuous churning f various messages being sent from amazon.

author: M. Hanks
title: Not using fully
content: I am 70 and set up was easy for me. However, there are features I am not using because I was not walked through them at set up. I have two and have not linked them

author: Tara J.
title: WASTE OF MONEY!
content: I have this device and Echo. Both work horribly and never seem to be able to answer ANYTHING I ask them. The only thing they can do right is set alarms and add to my shopping list. Just order Google devices to replace these two plus additional devices for every room in my house. PS I literally have to yell at them 90% of the time for them to hear me!

author: ahuguely
title: My Spot
content: Perfect!  Just enough for that room.

author: John M. Paterson Jr.
title: Worked Great!
content: I had a dot but wanted video. The spot solved that problem.

author: GEN1
title: Great little spot!
content: I have the dot, tap and now spot.  Purchased it for the screen so that I can see recipes when I'm cooking.  My year old grandson likes to play with the screen when we're playing music.  We especially having a pic of our grandson as our home screen.

author: LORRI
title: Not worth the money!!
content: Siri is smarter. I paired my laptop and it won’t operate it at all. Did the fire tv and NOTHING. this isn’t as smart as I had hoped.

author: Dan the Man
title: Love the device Amature Hour at Amazon
content:
The Echo Plus is an awesome piece of equipment, I absolutely love it!

However, Amazon is PURPOSELY vague/deceptive on the capability of their equipment/software.  For example, the site specifically states the hub is a ZigBee hub, yet it DOES NOT specifically state the hub is NOT AT ALL compatible with Z-Wave.  This is fully deceptive marketing, just state what your product CAN NOT DO!!!!!!!!!!!

Also, Z-WAVE device advertisements on Amazon flat out state they are fully compatible with Alexa, this is FLAT OUT FALSE, and I consider this to be and industry wide marketing LIE!!!!!!!  You CAN NOT connect Z-WAVE devices to this hub, no matter what you read, Amazon will not tell you this unless you buy the hub, connect it, trouble shoot, give up and call them.  Then they say "oh... looks like the hub is NOT compatible with you Z-WAVE devices, we can allow you to return all the Z-Wave equipment so you can buy more expensive ZigBee products (which probably contain Chinese hack Software).  Rediclous, just be HONEST and tell your customers what your device can an can not do, otherwise you are a bunch of big fat ADVERTISING LIARS.

With that said, to connect Z-WAVE to the Alexa hub, you have to buy a separate Z-WAVE hub, something their tech support will not tell you.  Oh, also, don't trust the FAQ's/help page on the App, they suggest it is simple and you just find you device and the hub (which everyone thinks they just bought a hub because they have the echo plus) but it is %100 WRONG.  You will not know the GE Z-Wave instructions are flat out FALSE until you talk to customer service and they act like you should have known you need a different hub.

One other thing that is irritating is that you have to wipe Amazon devices back to factory just to update your WiFi password.  If you follow the instructions, it will say this is a last resort.  WRONG WRONG WRONG!!!!!  Not only is this wrong, but I had to teach Amazon that you have to reset their equipment not once, but twice to get it to work.  Then I had to do the full setup again.  To be fair, this applies to their devices which have screens.

The last comment I have is the Alexa App, it has to be the least professional App, least intuitive App, most difficult App on the planet.  It is a TURD.  Why do you not have the same capability on the App within no screen devices for devices which have screens?  Basically you can not control/setup screen devices using the app.  THIS IS JUST STUPID!!!!!

Advise to Amazon:.

Why ruin such an amazing product by supplying a crappy user interface and false/deceptive advertising? Especially the crappy home automation directions, and hub connections?  When you read these instructions, they are FULLY deceptive.

author: peshtigomark
title: Now I can talk though my Ring Doorbell. Awesome !
content: I like everything about it, and it keeps getting better all of the time.

author: Hank R.
title: good buy
content: gift for my wife. she loves it

author: SmoothSailor
title: Kids can't speak with grandma
content:
If you thought about buying this to let your kids chat with no-smartphone grandma- DON'T!!!!

It is impossible unless grandma owns a phone AND has an amazon prime account.

While the spot is cute, setting it up to be used with a non phone non prime user is impossible.
Even with a prime account, the echo is impossible to set up without it trying to download grandmas contact list.
And since non-phone-using grandma doesn't have a contact list, purchasers will be left in LIMBO.

Just don't buy it.

author: Amira55
title: It seems a little picky
content:
The best part is being able to use the phone hands-free and the camera part .
 Would’ve been nice if it would be a little bit smarter when trying to find my little Bluetooth speaker the 808 can GLOW
Brand.the little speaker.
 Did work after several tries .

author: Pretty Things
title: Lots of available features
content: I love it! Still figuring out all the options it provides but I think it’s cool so far. I have a dot but this is so much better.

author: Kalamazoo Jim
title: CANT TURN OFF ALARM WITHOUT TALKING!
content: Bought it as a gift for my wife, for Christmas... but the "swipe up" to cancel the alarm, after you've gotten up, deletes the alarm altogether, and prevents it from ever occurring again. so, you have to reset the alarm everyday. Unless you talk to it, and if you are like me with an hour between my wife rise-n-shine and my get up time, thats SUPER annoying.

author: Karen Diehl
title: Four Stars
content: Would have really liked instructions, but there were none with the device

author: Gerald D. Tucker
title: Five Stars
content: This a wonderfully helpful piece of technology.

author: Tami C.
title: I really like the Spot but I would like to be able ...
content: I really like the Spot but I would like to be able to turn off the notifications and change the clock face to a different color/style. Amazon’s advertisement notifications are visually noisy thus the 4 Stars.

author: Peter
title: I wish there were a larger selection of analog clock ...
content: I wish there were a larger selection of analog clock faces to choose from. (If there already are more, I wish they were more discoverable.)

author: TAS
title: Echo keeps getting better and better
content: I have 5 Echo devices. Echo keeps getting better and better. This one is perfect!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Terrific sound for a small device
content: Terrific sound for a small device, and nice form factor for the nightstand. I like the convenience of seeing the time and temperature rather than asking Alexa. Not using video much, but it would be nice if the device had a square/rectangular screen.

author: Ian H.
title: Maybe in 10 years it will be functional
content:
Disappointed .
Audio sucks, she hardly ever does what I want like play the Correct song,  randomly turns on saying  Random nonsense .  And the spot can be just as finicky or worse .

author: SG
title: It might be me or it might be that alexa is not user-friendly
content:
The reason for the 2-star is because I dont like too much about alexa.
I like that its small but still has a readable display and that he kids enjoy asking it to do things.
I dont like that it doesnt understand simple commands like "alexa, how do I name my alarms?". It tells me something like "hm, i dont know that one". By the way, ive tried asking different ways and I still dont know if its possible to name my different alarms. The reason i want them labeled is so that my kids can read the alarm name (right now theyre default labeled as alarm 1, alarm 2, and alarm 3) and know what the alarm is for (e.g. wake up, get ready for soccer, get ready for bed, etc.)
And i would set-up a reminder if it actually reminded them to do the task but im not sure that alexa makes a sound for reminders. It does show the reminder on the screen but my kiddos usually miss it because theyre not in the same room as alexa, and they dont see the screen until way later. Maybe im doing it wrong? I have tried changing the settings but i dont have much to work with.
I have also noticed that my "do not disturb" settings dont work properly. I chose to turn off the screen at night but i see the screen lit even after the time i selected for it to turn off. Im not sure if it lights up because the room is lit but why ask for a time if its going to do what it wants? Thankfully this alexa didnt cost us any money (husband won it at work) because, after having used it, i am disappointed that its not very user-friendly. And in case youre wondering, i own several electronics which ive been able to figure out on my own so, i wouldn't say im out of touch when it comes to using electronics.

author: Tru Review
title: Spot on!
content: I’m loving this little device! Although I do wish it had more customizable features I still love it for the things it does do!

author: Kathy Lescalleette
title: A great companion you can almost have a conversation with Alxa..LOL
content: I love it.  I made a group with my echo dot so I get music through my home.  I am waiting for the to go on sale again so hopefully I can get another spot for my bedroom..  I love the alarm and weather at the sound of my voice..

author: Sabina L. Watts
title: Five Stars
content: Love my echo spot. Doesn’t take up much space

author: Notreallyred
title: A handy, good looking device
content: This echo spot with touch screen is very easy to set up since you are interacting with the device instead of the app.  I got it for my daughter and she loves being able to set alarms and timers for herself to help her know how long to brush her teeth or when to get up.  I also like being able to check on her without running up the stairs.

author: Stephen Waters
title: This is a great toy to have by the bedside
content: This is a great toy to have by the bedside. The voice recognition is great as is the Lex voice. Great display. Connects to blue tooth devices and uses AI to train on your voice. Control smart home devices, like Nest, and play your music lists from pandora and Amazon prime.

author: Josephine Gomez
title: Great picture quality!
content: I bought 2 so my grandson, newly moved out of state, could reach out to me whenever he got homesick. It has proved well worth the investment! We get to “see” each other at least twice a week! I love our Echo’s!

author: nikonbob
title: Five Stars
content: More versatile than dot as add visual content to go with audio

author: KRA
title: Great super functional form factor.
content:
Love it. This is the unit I've been waiting for.  I have a little stand for it to allow it to swivel to my needs.  I use it as I would any other Echo, except now I can say, "computer, show me the drive way" and up pops a real-time view of my drive way courtesy of my Ring Floodlight Cam.  I hope now that Amazon bought Ring that the performance/ load times become faster, because it can sometimes take a moment or two to load a camera.

I'll be putting these anywhere a screen is needed thanks to its excellent price point. Otherwise, Echo Dots will do just fine!

If there were a wall mountable flat screen version of the Echo Show, I'd love it. But this will do nicely until they come to their senses on form factor.

author: J. Larsen
title: The coolest Alexa gadget
content: Took some programming on my part but I’ve grown to love it.

author: M. Gubat
title: Easy setup. Great display. Multi-room Music. I love this device!
content:
Absolutely love the display. Set up was a breeze... I didn't even read the manual. But then I already have 2 echo dots so the familiarity with the whole Alexa system helped in setting this device up. Now, a few notes:
- This has a different power supply from echo dot... maybe because it uses more power. But Amazon decided to move away from the micro USB plug for the Spot... maybe people would not make the mistake of using 500mA power supply? Or maybe Amazon just doesn't want us to use non-Amazon power supplies.
-The display at first was a bit dark for me but I found out that the display (and other things) can be adjusted by simply swiping down from top and going through the menu. And by using the Alexa app on my phone, I was able to upload a picture and use that as the Spot's wallpaper.
- Multi-room music works! So I now have one Dot in the kitchen, the Spot in the living room and one Dot in the bedroom upstairs. I created a group for the kitchen Dot and the living room Spot, and I can now have the same music playing in my living room and kitchen. Cool!
- Songs from Amazon music have lyrics showing on the Spot's screen... instant sing-along! If you have Fire TV this is of course nothing new but having it also on Spot is a good thing.

I'm just hoping this device lasts a long time.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Totally worth getting!
content: I love everything about this gizmo.

author: Toni Buys
title: Love having the Echo spot.
content: I like it because it’s small and shows the lyrics to songs. The volume doesn’t go as loud as the old Alexa

author: Tortolita
title: Get Rid of “Things to Try”
content: So, this is a great product in so many ways. Potentially a game-changer on many fronts. But, until a software update eliminates the constant, unremitting “Things to Try” screens it’s essentially a billboard advertising Amazon’s capabilities in this nascent product category. For now, it is going into the already full drawer with the other potentially good tech ideas that have been badly executed. Amazon, how did you get this so right and then torpedoed a great product with frankly lousy execution?

author: B. Chase
title: So simple an old guy can use it.
content: It is very helpful, Sometimes I ask Alexa a strange question just to hear the answer. She makes a great alarm.

author: Pamela Gates
title: Love and first sighr
content: I love it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love the Spot
content: Great for a first Echo device. Picture is a bit small for those with poor eyesight, so opt for the Show in that case. Perfect size for travel too.

author: Michael J. Gile
title: Love it!
content: Easy to set up. Nice little screen size. Integrates with all the other Alexa devices I own.

author: rossana
title: Small but powerful
content: My husband and I really like the Echo Spot. We get instant information on different subjects and a wide variety of music. We have 3 Alexa’s around the house and the Echo Spot stays in our bedroom to provide us with music anytime we want without having to go through our other devices.

author: John
title: Very easy setup and sounds better than the dot.
content: Very easy setup with the screen, and sounds better than the dot.  The look and shape fit very well on the night stand by the bed.  Congratulations, we now accepted a Amazon camera beside our bed. ;-)

author: William T Diaz
title: Very impressed with the quality.
content: Wow, what a great little device!  It is relatively heavy and feels quite substantial, not your usual light plastic device.  Initial setup very easy, but display configuration is slightly confusing and not quite intuitive.  Took about half an hour to get the display I wanted.

author: Nurse Heather
title: My other Alexa products seem to understand me just fine but this one just doesn’t seem to understand
content: I don’t know why but this thing never gets my requests correct. My other Alexa products seem to understand me just fine but this one just doesn’t seem to understand me

author: Sabato
title: I like what it does, I fear what it could do
content: I use it 90% for an alarm, which it does a great job of. I've had a lot of alarms in the past, including my iPhone, and slept right through them. The payment plan is nice too. I've heard rumors that it records everything you say, even when you're not talking to it, and it takes video. So sometimes I'm a little uncomfortable with it and have it face my wall when I'm changing.

author: Martz
title: Purchased as an alarm clock. Works really well for ...
content:
Purchased as an alarm clock. Works really well for that with the display and information. Anti disturb times alllow me to sleep without messages.

Removed a star because I can not set alarms less than 24 hours in advance and can not setup scheduled alarms for my schedule for the week ahead.

author: Patticake
title: great product
content: I love it, my daughter and I can talk and see each other.  But, I am still learning everything it can do

author: the QA guy
title: buggy piece of crap
content: Think you can find a nice concise guide for all of the features, configuration settings, etc?  Guess again.  Who the hell knows what it will really do - they won't make it easy for you to find that out.

author: F. D. Eppinger
title: Echo Spot
content: Great size with great graphics .. Replaced old alarm clock radio and this has all those functions with much better up to date look ... plus you talk to it and it talks to you

author: FD
title: Simply adorable and useful!
content: This is my first Alexa device and I absolutely adore it. I wanted it mainly to play music and to replace my alarm clock. I do consider myself somewhat of an audiophile and did not expect this to sound any good but for casually listening to tunes (seeing the lyrics is cool) while doing things around my apartment or in the morning getting ready for work, it's pretty darn good. It's loud enough for my needs.  Last night I wished Alexa goodnight, she said it back and a picture of an owl and a moon popped up on the screen before it dimmed with the time. Just adorable! I don't have a smart home nor know others with Alexa for video/calls so i cannot comment on those features yet. I love tech so this is a lot of fun and useful for my needs. Highly recommended!

author: KibbyP
title: Right sized device
content: I love being able to see the words of the songs that I am listening to,  and also being able to make video calls without even touching my phone.

author: Apple Guy
title: This by far is the BEST Echo EVER!!!!
content: I am not one for reviews but I just had to write this. This thing is a work of art. My whole house is a smart house from my locks to my thermostats. I have 1 Echo, 4 Echo Dots and now one Echo Spot. I love this. It works as expected. I am a total Apple Guy but I choose Alexa over Siri any day. Amazon has knocked it out of the park!

author: Andrew
title: Two Stars
content: Overpriced. Get the dot. Several of them. More economical and place them in every room.

author: Vain
title: An excelletn replacement for my alarm clock
content: In my quest to slowly smart-ify my home, I found I needed an Echo in my bedroom.  This was a perfect fit.  It functions as a great alarm clock and it has all the features of the Echo.  While I can't imagine watching videos on such a small screen, it's great for controlling my Fire Stick and I love the song lyric feature.  The only thing complaint I have is that the Spot is a little pricey and definitely should have been shipped with the stand instead of Amazon making you purchase the stand separately.  Overall, however, it's an excellent addition to the Echo family.

author: LGG

I don't use it for music, so the speaker's performance does not effect me. I use it for everything else, like news, photos, shopping, and overall learning. title: Quality of the video is excellent.
content:
This was a Christmas present from my daughter who lives 800 miles from me so I can talk with her and my grandchildren.

author: Elke Johnson
title: Love Love Love
content: I love it.

author: David W
title: Another echo hit.  Amazon does it again.
content:
This is my 5th echo device.  I have two of the 1st generation, two echo shows and now the Echo Spot.  I put the echo spot in my kitchen.  I use the echo ecosystem as a home intercom.  I have a very large house and don't want to shout at somebody 3 floors down.  The echo spot is sleek enough to fit in my kitchen without being gaudy.  I think they would make a cute alarm clock in your bedroom also.  I don't want any cameras in my bedroom for privacy.  On the echo show you can turn off the camera and mic.  It also has a audio out jack to hook to a larger speaker or stereo system.  Those are cool features that added to the spot.

I am an apple man but love Alexa.  I do have the apple homepod also.  It does not have all the features of the echo but the speakers in that thing are amazing but it is well over priced.  The echo devices are reasonably priced.

The volume on the spot is decent especially since it is so small.  I bought the stand and the glass screen protector.  Many people said the stand makes the audio sound much better.  Over all I am pleased with the spot.  I think all of the echo device have been a hit except for the echo wardrobe.  I think that is what you call it.  I don't even think amazon sells that anymore.

Bottom line small, cute and aesthetically pleasing.  Amazon does it again...!!!!

author: Bryan
title: Great
content: Very cool product. Listen to music and see the lyrics. Watch news live. Great system

author: Rachel Poythress
title: I love it!
content: I haven't had it long, but i love my lil echo. The screen is small but it's so cute and I can put a picture of my cat as the background! And I can even play my favorite prime videos on it. I also really like that the lyrics scroll across the screen when I play music! Although if that's not your thing you can also turn them off :) for people who have a hard time seeing a small screen you may want to check out the Show, but I love the smallness personally and think it is great!

author: Cos
title: Great device, need more video skills
content:
Very cool, however, there needs to be a better way to find skills that use the screen. They need to have a video flash briefing and an audio one.
I just can't find much to do with the screen.
More screensavers please.

author: Leicia Machie
title: I love the echo spot
content: I love the echo spot. I love having Alexa to talk to and so do my kids. Honestly has also helped with my son's speech. I didn't even think to buy it for that reason but it just makes it so much better because of it. He would get so made when he would ask Alexa something and she couldn't understand him. It made him learn how to slow down and enunciate his words which has been amazing!! I love how it runs. Saying the wake up word works well. It does what's asked and can do more than I had thought when I had purchased it. I personally love it and love that Amazon offers the payment plan. I personally don't like to just drop $100 on an item so the fact that I can break it up into payments was very helpful

author: Mike
title: Beefier in weight and sound than expected
content: Surprisingly good beefy sound out of this thing. I think it might shape up to be one of my favorite echo devices. I have nearly all of them. ;-)

author: Joan Hurdle
title: Don’t leave it on all the time.
content: It was an unexpected gift.  The weather and. Music information is great

author: Camerabug
title: It is a fun tool
content: Well I.lke it except for right now I can’t connect to the internet?!

author: Shorthounds
title: I love this little guy
content: I love this little guy!  I have not set it up completely but so far so good.. What fun!!

author: Thomas Ott
title: Provides Good Beside Information and Doesn't Take Up Too Much Room
content:
At first, I thought I was purchasing another electronic "gadget" that wouldn't get much use other than its alarm clock function. I now stand corrected.

The Echo Spot is a handy Alexa home automation device that rests nicely on a nightstand; without taking up too much room. The screen is excellent quality, and it automatically brightens or dims relative to ambient room light. Its round shape is unique, and it looks good sitting on a nightstand, a dresser, a bookshelf, or on the kitchen counter.

It's more than just an alarm clock -- it's also an Alexa device. Echo Spot just like an Echo Dot, but with nice graphics and excellent at-a-glance visual information (see photo #1). The sound quality for playing bedroom music is surprisingly good for its physical size.

BONUS: If you happen to have a RING DOORBELL, another nice perk is Echo Spot's ability to show you who is at the front door. Just, say . . .  "Alexa, show me my Ring doorbell," and the screen show what the Ring doorbell sees (see photo #2).  If you happen to be near the Echo Spot when someone rings the doorbell, saying a short verbal command is much quicker than waking up your cell phone and taping several screens to see who's at the front door.

The screen backgrounds can be customized with many themes. Also, the Echo Spot can display pictures from your Amazon Photo Storage account -- either as a screen background or as a slide show. Yes, the screen is small, and I wouldn't want to view a movie on it (although you can), but for all other visual things -- it does the job well.

If you are a fan of the Alex ecosystem, you probably know more about the features of Echo Spot than I. At first, I thought to spend $130 on an Echo Spot was a little extravagant and perhaps unnecessary. Now, I see the Echo Spot as a reasonably priced tool to complement any home automation system.

author: joesue
title: Great
content: We are having so much fun with the Alexa Spot. Ask a question and she spontaneously answers. If she doesn't know the answer she will say "I'm not sure." Best of all are the pictures that show on the screen. Yet, she is small and does not take up any space on a dresser or nightstand. Really enjoying her.

author: JaziBae
title: A Glamorous Alarm Clock
content:
I am an Apple woman, I will always be an Apple woman. But I love this Echo spot, easy to set up and I love how easy it is to use.
I adjusted the clock face in settings to the big numbers that change to red at night. So I don’t understand how people say they cannot see the numbers? Adjust the face.
I like how it had flashes across the screen about what to ask, news and the weather.

author: Budnbutafli43
title: Perfect!
content: Perfect, convenient, fun, innovative- a great smart/fun home addition!

author: madizone
title: Great for busy mornings
content: I love my Echo Spot. I’m always in a hurry in the morning and usually don’t have time read the news, the flash briefing set up is beget helpful. It tells me where my first meetings are, how the traffic is, weather and the news of course. The only reason I give it 4 stars is because I’m still trying to figure out what other great features it has, but there is really no “guide” to that.

author: Kelli Presti
title: Its a great little info center, alarm clock and more

author: Craig Heins
title: Captain Kirk would be impressed!!
content: I've had every kind of bedside alarm clock for 50 years. I bought the Echo Spot primarily as that very thing. I have no words to describe how incredible it is is. It's like being on the Starship Enterprise, and I was a 12 year old kid again. Instead of saying "computer", I just say "Alexa", and tell her what I want. Music, weather, news, history, sports, no matter what I ask, she responds accordingly. I never believed something like this would ever be available in my lifetime.

The same thing can be said for the Echo Dots...they shouldn't be selling for more than $25, as they have terrible (almost comical) sound quality.

Negative points

Not much video content available

author: JohnPA
title: Great little spot
content: Alexa please get smarter. I use mostly as alarm clock and it works fantastic for that. She needs to get a little smarter because I can stump her sometimes

author: McCarthy
title: Brilliant piece of product design, get rid of the minor irritations and this deserves 5 stars.....
content:
Must be the best alarm clock I've ever had!  Installation and updating to latest firmware was the simplest it's ever been on just about any Echo device and 'Alexa' works perfectly.  The form is solid and good quality and the screen is a nice size to sit by the bed; the power cord is a nice length for plugging in to a bedside outlet.  Really like that there's a choice of 'faces' and that there's a weather report built in. The gradually increasing alarm is perfect for couples who get up at different times, or even if you like to wake slowly, and a 'snooze' function that just requires a screen tap is much easier to activate than fiddling around with buttons in the dark.  Also, love that the screen dims automatically for nighttime.

One concern we had in advance is how 'Alexa' would perform with two Echo devices in the same room, the answer is -> flawlessly.  The technology is good enough that both Echo's rings light up but there's an instant 'hand-off' to the Echo nearest to where the voice is coming from.  Well done Amazon engineers.

Would have given this five stars but for 2 irritations:
1) There needs to be a way to silence the alarm without having to verbally ask 'Alexa'.  Tapping the screen only initiates a snooze period and swiping the screen is tough to do with one hand from the bed; how about one tap to snooze and another tap to cancel?
2) Please get rid of the VERY annoying 'Things to Try' screen that rotates through; it really spoils the experience and within a very short time i turned off the rotating screen function simply because it feels like advertising.  Experienced users (aren't we all experienced after a few days?) don't need it.

I was also  intrigued  when I saw that the echo spot also dauled as a speaker. But to my surprise I could not use this as an alarm clock because it was so small I can barely read the screen from across the room.
Yes, it plays videos  but since it’s so small that feature is really a relevant to me. I was also disappointed to find that I could not connect the echo spot to other Bluetooth speakers in my house. author: prep95
title: WILL NOT DOWNLOAD SKILL FOR RING CAMS, CONTRARY TO ADVERTISEMENT
content:
Point Blank...Extremely angry and disappointed.
Item Ad from Amazon stated this would allow viewing of our RING Doorbell and other RING cams. Wouldn't even allow downloading of the skill. Complete rubbish and ad bait. THIS WAS BOUGHT PRIMARILY AS INDICATED, SO THAT WE COULD USE IT FOR OUR RING CAMS.
I speant the better half of a day on the phone between AMAZON and RING management, attempting notification and troubleshoot of the inaction, management of both companies which kept blaming it on the other. Not until I spoke to a humble CSR at RING, which we'll call 'Bob,' did I finally get have a person that understood and had common sense. That man should get a raise, because he actually took the time to speak to his co-workers around him and also call tech amd software support for the answer.
It turns out that RING does create the software for their AMAZON skill and maintain it. However, contrary to what 'AMAZON management supervisor' told me, IT IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZON'S PROBLEM FOR THE SKILL NOT BEING MAINTAINED AD A DOWNLOADABLE SKILL.
GET YOUR 5%!t TOGETHER AMAZON.
I WILL BE RETURNING THE PRODUCT IMMEDIATELY, AS THEY HAVE DEFAULTED ON THEIR ADVERTISING MESSAGE.
...UPDATE...
Only after I removed the device from the Alexa App, was I able to download the RING Skill. You dropped the ball on this one Amazon. I had already initiated a return and will not be keeping the item.
HINT to AMAZON: Please make sure to be more descriptive in some of the text describing install of certain skills....I digress.

author: Kindle Customer

author: reggae greggae
title: Underwhelming and concerning from a privacy perspective
content:
I'll concede it does kind of do what it's supposed to. Kind of. But this thing just strikes me as something rushed to market without careful consideration. Even the discounted price didn't make it worth it.

The app setup and what's available on the device are not the same. And neither are accurately described in the online help. The initial setup process  in particular is poorly documented. I flailed at trying to make a number of settings changes and use the voice learning before figuring out by accident I had to let it get all the way through the welcome video. Most of the setup screens are non-intuitive as well. Non obvious on the fly, and crappy online help to boot.

The streaming setup options are kind of substandard. No Napster, just Spotify. And evidently that has issues which I discovered when trying to get it working. Only online streaming option appears to be Tune In who want you to buy a subscription. You can't disable the "Have you asked it this inane and inappropriate question yet? card from constantly displaying on your screen. I could go on and on.

The last and biggest gripe I have with this is that the security and privacy settings are just kind of off or on. You can turn the camera off. But you can't turn off the microphone or disable any functionality except via the top button. No, "Let me wake up the device and turn things like the alarm on and off, but don't record it when I ask how much something costs or whether Teddy Roosevelt set this."

I have a sneaking suspicion that all this is by intent. And that the settings are simple and broad because they want you to just leave them on so they can use what do you do and say to monetize your behavior patterns. Which may be the future in store for all of us eventually, but for now I think I will pass. Especially given that after looking this thing over I'm not particularly impressed. I have an old mobile phone I've pressed into service that actually works better as an alarm clock than this. And that's mainly what I wanted it for. So it's going back for now. Maybe sometime in the near future somebody will one up them and give me the smart device that has more than half a brain.

author: Aki

author: Nicole Thompson-Smith
