author: Lance P.
title: My newly purchased Echo Spot will not pair with the ...
content: My newly purchased Echo Spot will not pair with the Bose Soundlink Mini II.  I have tried all known steps gleaned from the Internet and both the Bose and Amazon Information Sites.  I know the problem is not with the Bose since it connects perfectly with my "big" echo, my iPhone, and iPad.  I have a friend that ordered a Spot and I plan on trying to pair it with the Bose.  If it pairs, my Spot will be going back for replacement.

author: Jason S Callahan
title: Amazon Echo
content: The echo is helpful and the screen has good resolution.

author: Mike K.
title: Great product
content: Another winner for Alexa

author: LB Moreno
title: Gotta love her! She has most of the answers as ...
content: Alexa... is Alexa! Gotta love her! She has most of the answers as we add more skills!

author: Soozie
title: Quaint, cute, versatile
content: We have our Echo Spot in the living room.  It is our tool for many things, weather, clock, entertainment.  We have it connected to a smart plug to turn our lights on and off which is really handy.  Alexa is not hard of hearing...so we can call down to her from upstairs to turn off lights at bedtime.  Kids have fun with the story telling and games.  A great little device.

author: Rob
title: Advertising on Echo
content:
Echo Spot works great so far. Had a few issues with giving it commands but Amazon customer service has been great with helping me fix it.

One of the biggest issues I’ve seen with the reviews is people complaining about the device displaying “Things to try.”
Just want to make it clear that this isn’t “advertising” like everyone is making it seem. It isn’t telling you to try certain apps, restaurants, etc. It’s telling you to try different skills with Alexa. That’s it.

You can choose to have it rotate once so it’ll wait to suggest something else until after you give Alexa another command; until then it’ll just display the time.

It’s great. Just buy it. Use the payment plan if you have to or if you’re that skeptical about getting it. It’ll be worth it.

author: Zoey M
title: This particular one is a unpredictable fail.
content: I have used friends etc but this one doesnt work unless you are standing directly beside it and even then not that well.  Different models i have used work great.  Unfortunately this one doesnt

author: Handi-man
title: Wish I would have waited for gen2
content: There's alot to like about this device but for those contemplating a purchase I'll get to the point about what I don't like since that is the deciding factor for most people considering a purchase. My biggest letdown is the screen size compared to the plastic case. It's way too small in my opinion especially considering falling screen costs on similar products available in the market. The screen has great resolution but is so tiny that you can't see basic clock numbers from across the room. A larger screen size of 3/4 of an inch would make this device usable in my opinion. Increasing font size on such a small piece of screen real estate makes the clock face look disproportionate. Honestly speaking it's not that usable for me without using binoculars. I would gladly pay an extra 25 dollars more for the size bump. The second major dislike is the forced fed random tips & advertising that I'm not interested in after interacting with Alexa. If I wanted to see a particular tip I would ask Alexa otherwise I want my display to stay clutter free with what I want displayed such as a clock face. These seemingly never ending commercials are annoying enough that I may unplug the device and return it. I'm going to give it a few days before making that decision however am leaning in that direction at the moment. Why Amazon would clutter an otherwise stylish device like this with annoying pop-ups is puzzling. The other functions are great but these two major distractions are worth considering before purchase. I have several other Echo devices that I like but am having buyers remorse with the Spot purchase wishing I would have waited for gen2.

author: P. Thompson
title: This thing is great. It looks so nice and it gives me ...
content: This thing is great. It looks so nice and it gives me more space on my nightstand. I love the way I can see my front Ring Doorbell from it.

author: Larry C.
title: Be sure to keep a REAL alarm clock around
content:
I had really hoped to replace my bedside alarm clock with this. I'm glad I kept my old reliable clock as a backup through the trial phase.
First, let me be clear that I have TWO Spots in different rooms. They have the same reliability issues. I have very solid Wi-Fi, so much so that my visiting daughter said "I love the Wi-Fi at Dad's. You can't knock it offline." I bought the second Spot only after I found very bad reliability issues with the first. Within days, the second had already duplicated the problems of the first one.
The first issue is that it will often (two to three times a week) fail to respond to the wake word, and usually it's in the morning. The blue ring doesn't light up, nothing. On my bedside table, the Spot is only a couple of feet from my face, so acoustics is not the issue. My Dot in the bathroom hears and responds fine. So if an alarm set on the Spot is going off but it's not listening, it won't shut off the alarm. I have to unplug power to kill it. When power is restored it's back to normal.
Final update: I determined through research that the troubleshooting I did was exactly what Amazon support would have walked me through, so I did not bother calling. I still have the same problems with disconnecting or failure to listen at least once weekly. My solution (overly complex for most): I plugged the Spot into a smart outlet that is controlled by SmartThings. When I leave the house now, my "Goodbye" routine arms the house, and shuts down power to the Spot. When I get home, the "I'm Back" routine disarms the house and turns on the outlet. Since I leave the house at least once daily, this keeps the Spot "fresh" when I'm home. However, nobody should have to resort to this kind of workaround. And Amazon Product Development, PLEASE LISTEN to all your customers who want to TURN OFF "Things to try"!!! That little feature is purely self-service on the part of Amazon, not customer service at all. Just look at all the reviews that would have given the Spot an additional star if it could be turned off. It's overwhelming on anyone's scale.
The second issue is remaining connected to Bluetooth. I have used a number of different Bluetooth speakers, from Samsung to Bose, and the Spot drops connection at least once a week. My old Surface 3, connected by Bluetooth to an identical Samsung speaker, works flawlessly on a daily basis. If the alarm is going off but the Bluetooth is offline, all I'm getting is a silent alarm.
Aside from the very real lack of reliability, I'm also very put off by the "Try this" stuff that scrolls across the screen. To me this is useless fluff. I already use Alexa throughout my house for really useful stuff. If I want to "discover" new ways to use it, those emails that keep telling me "What's new with Alexa" are more than enough. Or I could just ask her. It's like having someone standing in the corner repeatedly saying "I can do this cool thing." Very annoying when you just want to see the time and weather.
If the Spots could be made as reliable as the Dots I have around the house, and I could have better control over what's on the screen, this would rate 5 stars. For me, we're a long way from there.
NEW: Within minutes after posting this review I was contacted multiple times by Amazon support (although two of them were for a Kindle that I recently bought for my wife but didn't review). Although I did not yet contact them in return, I did decide to do the regular things like resetting to factory default, reconnect to Wi-Fi, and update the firmware. One Spot was on an older version but the other was up-to-date. Although Bluetooth connectivity seems better, responsiveness after four days was still an issue. Although the Spot wasn't totally unresponsive, it did take nearly a minute (48 seconds on two attempts) to actually respond to a query. Again, the Dot in my bathroom (only three feet farther away than the Spot) responded immediately. The Dot has not been reset for weeks, and that was only because I moved it there from another room. I do intend to contact support to see if anything else can be done, but the common things to try have been done with only limited success.
UPDATE: I still have not contacted Amazon support. However, since the firmware updates, I can confirm that the Spots are only slightly more reliable. My bedside Spot went about a week without becoming unresponsive, but two days after reconnecting it by Bluetooth to a Samsung speaker, it again became unresponsive. I'm theorizing at this point that since the speaker has speakerphone capability, this is somehow confusing the Spot. I think next I'll try a "raw" speaker and try again.

author: Marc Horn
title: Sight, along with sound
content: It’s great to have visuals along with Alexa’s voice recognition.

author: Maya
title: Needs a update for seeing lyrics
content: I don't like that I can't see the lyrics on this if I'm using spotify but if I use Amazon instead I can see them. Also i would like to see the date on it. These two issues could be fixed easily with an update. I'll change my rating when I see those problems addressed. After writing this review I received a call from the tech team who was very helpful with my concerns so I gave it another star. Hopefully soon they will add the lyrics to spotify. Thanks

author: Sprsteel
title: Disappointment. Unable to connect Echo Spot via Bluetooth to ...
content: Disappointment.  Unable to connect Echo Spot via Bluetooth to my Bose deck using the Bluetooth adapter I have. The adapter works perfectly with my iPhone and iPad.  Yes, I can use the aux plug to connect but not what I hoped for.  Nor do I want to limit all audio to the Bose Deck.  99% of all questions I ask I get an " I do not know answer".  Watch faces a major disappointment.  I am keeping the Echo Spot because it was a gift. The 2nd generation Echo a much better value.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Easily handsfree accessible  information
content: I haven't found anything I really dislike thus far. It has come on a few times if I'm watching a movie and similar name to Alexa is said. But it then turns back off.  Screen is 2 small really so I don't access it for prime videos. Overall the short time I've had it I'm pleased . You can pair it with your phone /other bluetooth

author: Db37777
title: Great product
content: It’s a great device but would like to have a way to balance the light. If your room is a bit dark the picture is VERY dark and opposite for brightness. Further, you’ll want to purchase the base for it as when it sits flush it is not in a place for natural view when sitting. The base allows you to tilt to a more natural position while sitting or standing.

author: Megan H.
title: LOVE. IT!
content: I was given an Echo Spot along with a Dot as a birthday present. I couldn’t be more excited. It’s like having a little friend on the counter. And I can Drop In and talk to my mom on her Echo Show! It has most of the benefits of the show in a compact size. I can even use it to make regular phone calls. Now i

author: Darrell
title: Nice
content: Love the echo spot

author: Joyce St Aubin
title: More than you may want
content: Wish I had read the reviews on this before purchasing.  I have set this spot NOT to revolve, turned off all the options and have it set to alarm clock, and it STILL revolves to the "try this with Alexa" every half hour or so.  I would like to get the weather, but if it revolves to weather, you also revolve to the skills to try.  VERY DISAPPOINTING!!

author: Jairo
title: Great Buy
content: I really liked it. I went from having an echo dot to the spot. I like if I dont hear it. It's on the screen in writing. I lets pretty loud too.

author: Kevin Kao
title: Aesthetic and practical, great for video calls
content:
I bought this device primarily to use for video calling, and I have to say that it's exceeded my expectations! The streaming video and audio quality of the Spot surpasses the quality I have when using Skype/Hangouts on my laptop on an average Internet connection. I don't get much if any lag at all on this device.

A few improvements could be made to make it even better:
- The angle of the Spot is fixed so it takes some time to figure out where to best place it for video calling. The stand that Amazon sells for the Spot does address this.
- Right now, if I want to move the Spot to a different part of the room to video call, I have to unplug the entire charging unit and move that. This means the Spot will turn off as well. If the Spot could be made more portable (through a supported portable battery base), it would definitely solidify its spot as one of the best devices to use for casual video chats.

Overall, an aesthetic device that is great for casual video calls.

author: J. Normand
title: Lack of an OLED display is a single star killer.
content:
Solid device.  My only real issue is that its a forgone conclusion that many of these devices are going to find there way into the bedroom.  The display that is on the Spot is a normal LCD display.  The result being at night with the lights off you need to manually dim the display making the time almost impossible to see.  If Amazon had used an OLED display the blacks during night mode would be where the screen is truly off not just dimmed.  Bad design IMHO.  It makes the device cheaper which is good, but every night I'm manually going in and turning down the display to almost off.  The only way to check the time after that is ask the device as I can't see the time with it that dim.

Update:  Voice commands have gotten worse in the last few months.  Lost another star.  Alexa Downstairs lights off.....it turns off every light in the house.  Crap like this is starting to get so old, considering going to Google.

author: Black jude
title: Amazing!!!!
content: Crazy about it the only thing I should be able to set schedule alarm like Monday to Friday Friday to Saturday

author: Phil Dunlop
title: I never thought I'd be talking to Alexa
content: "Spot" showed up as a gift, I doubt I would have gone out looking for one.  It currently resides on a bedside table, and it's duties are primarily to be a wake up alarm.  The basics, this thing is BUILT, I think I could drop it and it would be fine, but I'm not going to test that.  Great speaker, solid, easy to set up.  Already a "Prime" member, so it's a snap.  First thing I did was turn off the camera.  Seems a bit dodgy, that.  If I ever want to make a video call, I'm now ready.  Alexa can be frustrating.  It is fun to tell her to arm phasers and set them to kill.  So, currently, a wake alarm, plays music from my one and only playlist I set up.  Easy to set that up BTW.  The biggest and dumbest thing that I actually can't believe, is Alexa does NOT support wake up playlist shuffling, so here I am, playlist with 27 nice songs and music, and Alexa can ONLY PLAY THE SAME SONG EVERY MORNING.  Now that makes one wonder why have a wake up playlist?  I don't know who is asleep at Amazon in the Alexa department, but this is the single most irritating factor about Alexa and the whole "echo / spot" thing you can imagine.  And that's why I only give it 3 stars.  It IS a 5 star device, and it is chopped back to 3 not because of build quality, sound quality, clock quality.  It gets knocked back to 3 stars due a mindless apparently unimaginative "Alexa" crew at Amazon.  Come ON GUYS, can't shuffle a play list in the morning, TOTALLY STUPID.  Oh yeah, and why can't I change it's name to "Spot"?

author: MRD
title: "See Spot Run"
content: Wow, she's a friend LOL.  I listen to audible books (better than earphones).  My husband plays his music on the Echo Show, which our son gave him for his birthday after I decided I didn't want to share my Spot!  Everything is a favorite feature but I love, love the timer!  Anyone who cooks will appreciate that feature - just say Alexa set the timer for 4 minutes, instead of fumbling with the stove time,  and that's it!  Except for the "dismiss" command when it's done.  No stopping to shut off the stove timer.  The speakers are great!  I can't say enough about how great it is.  I thought I didn't want one!  Saying "self" you don't need that! you have a computer.  Thank goodness my son saw the error of my thinking and bought me one for my birthday!  The Show being larger is better for video calls and other videos!

author: Tech guy
title: Does not have notification ring
content: Disappointed this doesn't have the yellow notification ring on it, yes it shows a tiny envelope on the display but when you are across the room  the yellow ring is much better just like on my dot. hoping they do an update to add the notification ring on the Spot. would be nice to get rid of things displayed like "things to try" and customize it to display exactly what you want. Also the stand should be included not a $20 option !

author: Carlton R Hunt
title: Absoultely Great Echo!!!!!!
content: I have the echo dot echo next generation & the echo spot is the best of the best I absolutely love this device!!!!

author: Joey J.
title: Must have for any bedroom!
content: Love the video option along with all the wonderful things Alexa provides!  This is a must have!

author: Chris
title: I love how you've integrated a customer's music library and Kindle ...
content: I'm still learning how more about my new Echo Spot, so I'm unable to provide any detailed feedback. I love how you've integrated a customer's music library and Kindle into the interface. I think the alarm clock and and reminder functions are really handy. One improvement for Alexa could be a longer explanation when you ask Alexa for information from Wikipedia or other information sources. As I mentioned before; I'm new to voice activated devices like Alexa. As far as I can see, Echo products are really sound devices.

author: ashok nair
title: Love the device.. highly recommended
content: I already had the Echo device and an avid Amazon user.  This device still had so much surprise in store for me with a crystal clear display and the quick response. I can whisper 'Alexa' and it can hear me. I am so happy with it and the millions of skills that it has and a growing list at that. I totally recommend this device for anybody who like smart devices

author: Amazon Customer
title: A great product!!
content: I really like the echo spot.  The clock faces are very nice and they dim perfectly for nighttime.  I have it hooked up through the home app to a lamp and it makes it so much easier to put on and off.  Very nice to have weather at fingertips, traffic information, and news.  Highly recommended.

author: barbara
title: Not sure how to download pics to spot
content: It is working ok... find it difficult to do some things such as get pics from my iPhone to the spot. I also think the stand is very good to have..

author: MiamiC70
title: Lot of potential hampered by Amazon’s inconsistent and haphazard approach to Echo / Alexa.
content:
Has a lot of potential however, it is hampered by Amazon’s inconsistent and haphazard approach to Echo. Example; most of these will be use in bedroom yet there is NO way to pair two as a stereo pair. WTF? Can’t pair them with the be subwoofer. WTF?
Clock faces are crap and lack any creativity or sense of styling. Also, not onevclock face includes a digital number display of time. WTF?
Stand should have been included with decide especially for $129! Charging $19 is akin to highway robbery.

author: Jim
title: Great purchase.
content: We love our echo spots. We now have three through the house and like that you can drop in on the other spots. We do wish the clock faces had more customization options and that there were more faces in general.

author: Micheal Jacobs
title: What’s in a name?
content: My only complaint so far with this is, I wish we could personalize what we call out device. “Computer, Alexa, etc” just doesn’t do much to make it feel like it’s mine. Other than that, I enjoy this device. See how I did that? It’s a device until I can name it as my own.

author: Brian
title: Great item to have
content: I've loved my echo spot as an alarm clock.  Easy to talk to set alarms, get information from the web and weather.  Very easy to use!

author: Alvaro G
title: Good Start
content:
I’ve had the Echo Spot for about 4 days and I am impressed with the quality although of course as a first generation it needs some improvements that can be fixed with software updates. Please consider.....

The personal photograph is a great tool however you should have the option to show the clock in all the options available in other modes for example having the clock show in the middle of the screen or top with the current weather conditions, It will be beneficial to have those options available.

Also there should be a black background option to reduce brightness at night (you can add your own adding a personal photo), another improvement would be when using the wake word the ring or brightness should go up that way you know it is listening.
The camera on the front is a concern if not using video calls but there should be some assurance it cannot be hacked, if not the good old tape trick can ease your concerns. However if you really need an extra surveillance camera at home this can work wonders using the drop in feature.

Another suggestion for improvement would be the ability to use video related skills fully (Ring) to allow 2 way calling when answering the door or seeing someone just like the app, the hardware is there just need the updated software.
I’ll be updating this review after a few weeks of use.

author: ariel
title: Not worth the price not alot of usability get a echo dot instead
content: Its basically a clock with voice assistant not really worth the money its a echo dot with a screen screen does not have any significant use other than clock and a few videos forget about music unless you use it as a bluetooth speaker because if your not connected you need to get prime music service

author: K. Auclair
title: Easy to use and set up
content: Easy to use and set up. Good if not relying on it for your main source of music, regular echo is better speaker (like if you want to listen to music in the kitchen while cooking, get regular echo). The ability to connect with other devices video feeds is pretty cool, especially if you have a smart door lock or baby monitor. I got 2 for my house one in bedroom as my bedside clock and one in living room.

author: AverageJoe
title: Does Not Integrate Well with Home Automation
content:
DO NOT PURCHASE.

Bought this to automate home stereo and tv systems. Incredibly hard to setup. Never fully worked. Spent time on four separate tech support calls, and nobody ever solved issues with this device that were directly advertised as capabilities on the Amazon website.

If you want to do questions and answers about the weather or whatever... go ahead and buy the echo as a glorified toy or voice condilled single speaker radio.

If you want this device to integrate with home automation, do not recommend this as a purchase. Definitely not ready for prime time.

Tech support does not fully understand the system well enough to address involved tech support questions having to do with home automation.

author: RRH92
title: Great addition to our family
content: We love our echo spot and not sure how we managed so long without Alexa.  I like having the digital display - simply as a quick clock or to look at the weather forecast.  we use this device constantly in our kitchen for playing music (doesn't get very loud, but good enough for one room), looking up recipes, ordering items on Amazon.  Love it!

author: Soph@Dtown
title: Having great fun with this newest toy
content: Having great fun with this newest toy! Alexa knows most general things. Love getting the weather. The screen is fun it lists the words of the currents songs playing. "She has become our new best friend!"

author: Tophat420
title: Wife loves it!!
content: Got this for my wife's birthday and she couldn't have been more happy!!

author: Ted J.
title: A handy little electronic piece
content: I have it hooked up to a Sony speaker by wire.  I may try the Bluetooth again some day.  I agree with another party that a battery backup would be good when power goes out during hurricanes or snow storms.  It is unfortunate that after you buy it seems a good thing to buy the stand to aim it and a mechanical device to cover its camera eye as it is in your bedroom.  I got the screen protector too, so three items were purchased as accessories.

author: D. Peterson
title: Easy setup
content: I think this is a good first step for building a smart home. I didn’t have any smart devices so I got this and now added light bulbs. Will Slowly build a network of smart home devices.

author: JC
title: View outside security cameras with voice commands.
content: Display is good addition to Echo product family. I can select and view outside security cameras with simple voice commands.

author: A. L. White
title: Play local radio stations with ease
content: It's fun. First alexa device in my house. I like that there is minimal learning curve on using it. Plays my local radio stations! Displays photos on clock face. Overall, very good device. Makes me want to get echo devices for other rooms. Amz can do better with podcasts sill on alexa.

author: Gigi J.
title: It is really fun, BUT
content: It is really fun, BUT, I wish it would play at the same time the Anker does. Now you only play one or the other. If I want one permanently in another room, I have to buy another Dot t Spot. BOO!

author: Katherine Roby
title: fun and functional
content: We are using the Echo Spot for many things.  We have used it for alarms and short term timers and reminders.  We also have used it as a resource.  We also use it for playing music and the speaker is good quality.  Most mornings we ask Alexa for the local weather to know how to dress for the day.  Also, we have used it to communicate with someone in another room using the app on the phone and the Echo Spot together.

author: taffy ledesma
title: Stay connected with your elderly / sick loved ones
content: My mother is battling health issues and she's recently been diagnosed with Parkinson's Disease making it hard for her to speak and it makes her fine motor skills pretty bad. That means she can't handle a smartphone well (answering / prodding buttons) let alone hold it up when on FaceTime / video call.  With the Echo Spot I can Drop In on her without her needing to answer the phone.  For this alone, it is a winner.  Also her caregivers can easily play music for her via Alexa as I have this connected to Spotify.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great concept, its just not quite there yet
content: I am impressed with the packaging and build quality. Reminded me of an apple product. The set up was really straight forward. My issues and the reasons for 3 stars started to crop up after I downloaded the app. First, maybe i'm crazy, but when I searched the app store for the app using the alexa keyword, I got several amazon apps. the first was Amazon Prime Music. The Amazon Alexa (music), then Amazon Music. It wasn't hard to figure out which was the one I needed, but the Alexa app is categorized under music which I thought was weird. After downloading, I assumed the app would be a slick, user friendly, and intuitive. I found anything but these characteristics. its clunky, very intuitive and just strange. Amazon, you can do better than this. The whole concept is great, but I really hate the app. Another negative was when I was setting up an alarm (since I plan to replace my bedside alarm clock with this. It took several voice commands to get the alarm set. Through some web searches, i was eventually able to get a weekday alarm set. Not intuitive and Alexa didn't seem to understand to set an alarm for every day. So then comes the alarm choice. What a weird selection of tones. Come on Amazon, you can do better. So not I decided I would rather wake to an i heart radio station. I tried dozens of commands to get alexa to do this (no the app wont let you just type in what you want, in fact the app doesn't even indicate that this is possible). Finally, I went back to the web to do searched to find out how to do this. I eventually found the exact wording to make this happen. I assumed alexa could do this stuff, but I am finding it very limited. Oh yea, dont even try and understand how to hit snooze or cut of the alarm. I dont want to talk to alexa in the morning and wake my wife, just want to touch a screen or button to make this happen. Eventually figured it out,but again, totally not intuitive at all. So Amazon, great concept, its just not there yet.

author: FALOME
title: SMALL SCREEN
content: It is an excellent device but forget about watching any video on it.

author: james d san filippo
title: Great for viewing cameras

author: wings2flyon

author: Sean Deschene
title: OK Replacement For An Alarm Clock, But Not Great.
content:
The screen is too small and round to really watch anything on it.  Content that is 16:9 is either clipped so badly that you cannot see what's going on, it is shrunk so small you cannot see what is going on.  If you watch older content that is 4:3, you can see that better, but the corners are rounded off.  Also, it is so small, it is really hard to focus on what is being shown.  Do not plan to watch Amazon Prime Video on this.

The screen auto-adjusts to the ambient light level in the room, but it really does not get dark enough at night.  I had to pick a black clock face to even get close to a dark enough screen to sleep.  It is an upgrade over the bright blue LED digital alarm clock I had before it.

There is no YouTube for the Echo Spot, nor the Echo Show.  Amazon and Google are mad at each other, so we as the customer have to pay the price.  I watch a ton of YouTube on my Roku TV, and wanted to do the same with my Echo Show and Echo Spot, but neither can play "internet video" as it tells you when you try.

There is no repeat alarm.  So, I want the Echo Spot to set a wake-up alarm each weekday at 05:30, but you have to tell it to set an alarm every night.  Additionally, it does not understand 24 hour time, so it keeps asking "Is that in the morning or the afternoon?" because it does not know which 5:30 I am talking about (AM or PM).  The snooze activates too easily.  You need to swipe up to turn the alarm off, but if you do not get a full swipe, it snoozes nine minutes and then goes off again.  This is annoying to my wife, since she sleeps in later than I do.  I can tell Alexa to stop the alarm, but then I am just making more noise to wake her up.

This is a good way to bring Alexa into the Bedroom, but an Echo Dot will do most of the same stuff you want in an alarm clock replacement and a fraction of the price.

author: Beth Getz
title: Five Stars
content: Bought for a gift

author: Cliff jackson
title: Babb Alexa.
content: Does all it is advertised to do and more. I am very pleased with it and I love how it works with my Alexa Show in another room.

author: Paul Davis
title: Does just what I expected of it and a little more.
content: I like it, it does just what I expected of it and a little more.  Kind of wish it had a better speaker and I would replace my echo in the living room with another one of these.

author: R Miller
title: Very smart and surprisingly useful
content:
About 10 years ago I had a 'Chumby'; a "smart" touchscreen alarm clock. It always felt half-baked but ahead of it's time and I loved it fiercely. The Chumby servers went offline a few years back taking all the devices with them and I've been looking for a replacement ever since. This is everything the Chumby was and wanted to be. While I'm offput by the camera I still elected to place it on my nightstand and use it as an alarm clock. I am extremely light sensitive (hotel room smoke detector LEDs are the bane of my existence) when sleeping and so was worried about having an always-on screen next to my bed but was surprised to find that the auto-brightness on the screen goes very very low automatically and the clock face switches to a black face with yellow hands which further reduces the brightness. It's enough that I can easily sleep with the Spot on my nightstand, facing(watching) me at eye-level, something I cannot do with any other alarm clock.
I'm also rather impressed with how smart Alexa is. She can recognize some very obscure requests and even handle follow-up questions:
ex: "Alexa, will it rain today?"
"No rain is forecast today"
"Alexa, what about tomorrow?"
"No rain is forecast tomorrow"
She was even able to recognize my request for Ludovico Einaudi on the first try which is especially amazing being that I'm sure I butchered his name.
The second complaint I have (after the dumb camera) is that Amazon has the separate "Prime Music" and "Amazon Music Unlimited" services. Prime Music doesn't include a lot of the songs I request and Amazon Music Unlimited costs more $$ each month. What's super annoying is that Alexa feels the need to try to sell Amazon Music Unlimited everytime I request a song Prime Music doesn't offer. You can change the default library to Spotify but not Apple Music.

author: william j sanders
title: Time for everyone to pick one up!
content: It met my expectations. I enjoy it as a bedside clock and the versatility of its ability to change faces and present videos etc. It does all that its big brother Echo does. I bought the stand to go along with the Spot which gives it more positional movement and its sounds are better.

content: Impressive little device. Definitely exceeded my expectations. The Spot is smaller than I first thought it would be, but it's big enough to read the screen clearly. I love the wake to music feature and I am looking forward to learning all the great Alexa capabilities.

author: TJ
title: You get a suprising amount of info on this small screen.
content: It works well on video calls and the screen is small enough that you can't see up their nose. I like how any answers it gives are followed up with text visuals. It sounds quite nice as well.

author: Steve M.
title: The screen increases the utility 2-3x over the Dot
content:
So the Echo Spot is a glorified alarm clock. To me, though, it represents something more as I get ready to return to work after being laid off 6 months ago. To get back into the routine of waking up early on weekdays, I *need* an alarm clock now, and the Spot is my early "new job" present. I was delighted when it was delivered a whole day before the official release date. Echo Spot is a metaphor for Alexa sneaking into the earliest, most vulnerable part of your daily routine, and in my case it's a very exciting journey as I return to a regular 9-to-5 (with *pay*). Enough about my plight--how will this thing work for YOU?

OVERALL CONCLUSION
======================
Four stars out of five because Echo Spot's screen is a useful addition to Alexa, the overall aesthetic design is great, the sound is very good for a tiny speaker, BUT the price is high and the video ecosystem is immature (and not ideal on a round screen). You should buy it if you really need a fancy device in the kitchen or bedroom and you have this amount budgeted for an "extravagant" gadget for yourself or loved one. Otherwise, wait a little while until the price eventually decreases.

WHO SHOULD BUY AN ECHO SPOT?
==================================
The Echo Spot is one of the more expensive ways to enter the Alex ecosystem. It has a screen, which none of the other small speaker versions have. Only the angular (ugly?) tablet-on-stand Echo Show has a screen, but that's where the differences end.
✓ If you care about style and want to put a device in the bedroom, on a desk at work, or in the kitchen, the Spot would look great.
✓ If you want to see the live video feed from a Nest/Dropcam/Ring, etc. camera, watch a video (albeit a limited selection right now), see reminders, lists, song lyrics and recipes, that screen is really helpful.
✓ If you want an upgrade to the Dot (whose speaker isn't really meant for music) and have about the same amount of money to spend as the Echo (Gen 2), the Spot should be on your shortlist. The Echo G2 wins for sound quality by a small margin, but the Spot wins big for versatility with its screen and hardwired line-out for an external speaker (which the larger Echo Show inexplicably lacks, supporting only Bluetooth and not corded external speakers).

HOW DOES THE SCREEN LOOK?
=============================
Good, not great. The resolution is excellent, somewhat close to retina, but the brightness is just OK, the glare is waaaay worse than I wanted (similar to the new/cheap Fire tablet screens, which lack the gapless lamination you'd find on the older/expensive Fire tablets and of course on all modern iPads). These previous factors coupled with the visible (but not terrible) color-shifting at extreme viewing angles make me realize how spoiled I am with flagship phone and tablet screens in the last 2-3 years. This is not a top-tier smartphone display, but I have to give a lot of credit for the cool-factor of a perfectly round screen.

ARE VIDEOS WATCHABLE?
=========================
I looked up a recipe for the ever-sumptuous pannacotta. To my delight, the Spot immediately took me to allrecipes.com with a video on how to make an easy version of this Italian dessert. The video was zoomed in to fill the circular screen, and it looked surprisingly "normal". It's not likely that Amazon somehow curated videos for ones that look good on a circle screen, so my assumption is that most video producers just center tightly on their subjects and we actually don't use the sides of our rectangular screens very much.
That being said, I couldn't stand to watch long-form content on this tiny screen. Moreover, where is YouTube? Please end this fight, Amazon and Google. Maybe it will be available in 2018. Until then, recipes from non-Google sites are the killer app for the Spot, and they are a tremendously useful feature.

HOW IS THE SOUND?
====================
I own the Echo Dot (gen 2) and the Echo (gen 1), and the sound of the Echo Spot is somewhere between them. If the Echo Dot is 30 in quality and the Echo is 100, the Spot is probably a 70 or perhaps even 80. It's going to forego a lot of bass richness, but I listened to many hours of music this week and I was pleasantly surprised at how good the sound actually was. It's certainly better than any other speaker I've had in a bedroom or at work, which is where the majority of these will end up. If you want even better sound, then buy a nice Bluetooth speaker as a satellite, but the Echo Spot already sounds as good as the $50 little Bluetooth cubes a co-worker had at my former job. It's got a standard stereo out port and Bluetooth streaming, so if you need better speakers now or down the road, you can expand.

WHAT ARE SOME THINGS YOU LIKE?
=================================
✓ Design, weight, premium feel
✓ Very responsive touch screen
✓ Lyrics for songs (the killer app for old Christmas carols, wow!)
✓ Recipes
✓ Video calling (worked well with my Alexa app on my Android phone)
✓ Voice drop-in / intercom
✓ Custom photo upload for background
✓ Simple, uncomplicated UI, and most things, even Wi-Fi setup, don't need the Alexa app--this is a good gift for people who aren't bonded to a smartphone
✓ Easily watch Amazon video content (but on a tiny screen)
✓ Multi-room features are INCREDIBLE. During setup, I had my Echo Dot in the same room, and Alexa just *knew* (ESP is a great name) which device I was talking to; playing music in all rooms is nifty as well...
✓ Mics and voice recognition seem just as good as all the other Echo devices, even though Spot seems to have only 4, not 7 like my original Echo and new Echo Dot both have

THINGS LESS LIKABLE?
======================
❌  Power cord is not USB--why can't this just be a USB-C device?!?
❌  Not a lot of clock faces, just 6 analog and digital right now; I do LOVE the "bokeh" clock face, though, which is a geeky photographer's term that refers to those out of focus rings made by lens aperture blades
❌  Can't watch many video sources, yet
❌  Expensive--this thing is as overpriced as the original Echo, so expect it to drop to about half the current level in 1-2 years
❌  Screen is silly small for watching longer videos or videos that can't be cropped to circular proportions
❌  No way to really "stop" video--it started again on its own today, which was beyond annoying because I had left the room at least 5 minutes beforehand and heard it resume from across the hall
❌  UPDATE: You can "tap" anywhere on the touchscreen while the alarm is going off to snooze for 9 minutes. Very cool! Thanks to commenter Smokey DeBear for correcting me. (Original statement, now no longer valid: Utility as an alarm clock relies on using your voice--no dedicated buttons or intuitive way to snooze, etc.)
❌  Camera could be a risk for those concerned about privacy and can't be *truly* disabled aside from blackout tape (which apparently stops the motion sensor and auto-brightness as well)

ABOUT THE PHOTOS
===================
I wanted to include some common fruit for size comparison, so the logical sequence is to show you a grapefruit and tangerine so that you can visually see the Spot is about the size of a large orange. My wife then decided that Spot was "lonely" and needed "friends", so the two citrus fruits got faces, courtesy of a black Sharpie. Hopefully she'll keep the marker away from the Spot itself!
To show an example of a custom clock face, I then took a photo of the grapefruit with the smiley face and made it the "face" of the Echo Spot. It was already round, so the cropping worked really well. You can upload any photo from your phone and zoom/crop to fit.

UPDATE AFTER 5 DAYS
====================
Everyone who has come over for holiday gatherings has been amazed by the sound quality. It's a tiny form factor for such rich sound.

I realized that the motion sensor will enable lyrics display as you walk up to it, waking it from the clock mode if music is playing. Neat!

My phone is suddenly becoming less useful to call people because the speakerphone quality of the Echo Spot is just incredible. Everyone I've called says the audio on their side is amazing. Alexa wakes up and processes voice commands so much quicker than "OK Google" on my Nexus 6P, so it's more convenient to call when I'm near an Echo device.

The kids love playing 20 questions and The Magic Door with Alexa. The Spot's screen doesn't help much with those, but I can definitely see other games/skills being built to entertain kids (and big kids) for hours. This could be a great homework helper in the future as the ecosystem evolves . . . "Alexa, how do you spell syzygy?" and the word appears on the screen as Alexa reinforces with spoken letters, S-Y-Z-Y-G-Y.

UPDATE AFTER 4 WEEKS
=====================
Things that cracked me up the most: "Alexa, sing a barbershop quartet" and "Alexa, sing auld lang syne." The first is pretty bad, but Auld Lang Syne is FABULOUS and obviously has some human backup singers.

Things I'm totally addicted to: I use the Echo Spot as a remote portal to check-in with the kids while I'm working remotely. I "drop in" on their Echo Dot and have been reading aloud to them ("Lord of the Rings," if you're curious) for an hour or so, a few times a week. The speakerphone quality is phenomenal and the connection is very stable. I wouldn't be able to do this on my cellphone.

Lists galore: I now have half a dozen lists going because it's so easy to make lists and add stuff via voice. I worry that my short-term memory will be totally gone in a few years as I now depend on virtual assistants for everything . . .

ALSO, responding to another reviewer, the clock's time size is big on the INCLUDED clock faces! See the last photo I just uploaded. Amazon must think that if you have a personal photo uploaded, you want the time to be small (which makes sense--you can see your photo better), so if you want the numbers large, just don't upload a personal watchface photo. Maybe they'll give an option to change that in the future, but it's not a big deal, in my opinion. Finally, if you walk up to the Spot and the camera senses your motion, the display will change to the weather or reminders, etc. Therefore: it's only big when it senses no motion (you're far away) and you've got a stock clock face. Pretty smart!

author: Lowell Turner

author: Brian
title: Nice Echo
content: I purchased this for my den's desktop.  Nice addition to my work area.

author: Dianne Skolnik
title: It's a great addition. We have the echo alexa
content: It's a great addition. We have the echo alexa. My only problem is not be able to see the screen. I need to put it right next to my bed. I have not really tried to figure out all it does.

author: Barb22black

content: The Echo Spot is a great addition to my night stand! It turns my bedroom light off and sets my alarm to wake up to my favorite artist. The possibility’s are endless.

author: SteubenOhio
title: Got what I wanted
content: Returned, bought by mistake.

author: TechGuy
title: Love it.
content: Really like it. The screen is a major plus.

author: RDRE
title: Great to use for late night and early morning calls to friends.
