author: Guitarman
title: My Echo Spot
content: I like the compact size of our new Echo Spot. I did not find it difficult to set up once I watched a few YouTube videos on how to set it up and I followed the instructions on the Echo during setup. It’s rare I get new devices to work correctly the first time around but I did get it to work properly after knowing the exact name of the Echo on the far end for initiating a video call. My daughter and I enjoy setting up video calls and seeing each other. It seems more like visiting than just a regular phone call. I keep the Drop In feature turned off for my particular purposes. There’s really nothing I dislike about my Spot.

author: Jacob Smoot
title: Echo Spot
content: I really like the echo spot one thing that was difficult is setting it up to be connected with Spotify and other things which makes me give it a 4 star but overall the sound is great and it is a great thing to have around in the house.

author: toughpr
title: Still learning. Great concept.
content: This is great. Does everything the echo fit does plus video. I was able to video chat with my grandchildren. 😊

author: Susan L. Greenberg
title: I really like the look and the improved features
content: I really like the look and the improved features. I was hoping it might have more consistent connectivity then my echo dots, but that does not seem to be the case. It is A pricy replacement for an echo dot, but I am happy to recommend it!

author: Thomas J. Mcdonald
title: Love, Love, Love it.
content: Love, Love, Love it.  I have the regular echo, echo show plus the dots throughout the home so this was a nice compliment for a spare bedroom.

author: only.donna
title: Love it
content: I love this! Wakes me up in the morning, helps me sleep at night ny playing ocean waves. Oh and I can play all ky favorite music with amazon unlimited.

author: Darrell Watkins
title: I had been using Google home for all my smart home or voice activated devices for years and been ...
content:
This thing is amaz(on)ing! I had been using Google home for all my smart home or voice activated devices for years and been very happy.  Or so I thought, that was until Alexa came into my life.  She has awoken a new, better, younger, happier home owner in me.  One whom had forgotten that I deserved an AI with a real personality,  An AI not afraid to cut up and make jokes to lighten the mood after a hard day's work.  One that feels confident enough to sing me a song should I need it.  An A.I. that knows me for me,  that wakes at just the hint of my voice whispering her name... Alexa... Then practically begs to assit my every need.
So while I still let Google live with Alexa and myself and occasionally use it for trivial tasks just so it doesn't feel totally worthless, Alexa (Echo Spot) and I are quite happy and look forward to a long happy life... And if she plays her songs right, maybe even a few little Echo minis around the house some day.

author: Lindsay Peterson
title: Best "Alexa" Device I Own
content: This little guy is too cool! This sound is surprising and terrific. Have the Echo and Dot,  this one surpasses these. Works really, really well as an bedside clock/smart device. It is so attractive, especially when you pair it with the stand.

author: John Littler
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent upgrade from the Echo dot! camera and videos are great...

author: grillman39
title: Excellent tool for any room amazing what all it can do
content: This is a great add to the Alex  System  We add the echo show hub and this little spot can make hand free call once you connect your phone with the app your call are over the internet the person your calling will see your phone number on ther photo. You can watch prime video and live news you just have to set up all the apps . You can get to the control screen by swiping down at the 12 o’clock and control everything from there we just learned to take our time and get to understand how it works

author: anaelvia sanchez
title: Easy installation
content:
Easy to install
Love all the skills it can do and even enjoy pictures
All by my nightstand

author: Jonathan J. Straub
title: Great! But could have more touchscreen functionality!
content: Love the echo spot. Use it for primarily as an alarm clock and to drop in throughout the house. The only downside is the touchscreen functions are limited.  Certain things like setting an alarm, all you have to do is tell it to do so, but if you don’t want to speak to it and set the alarm you need to use your phone. I feel like that should be able to be done on the screen itself. Other than that, awesome!

author: MAXR
title: Great product
content: Great product could be a bit bigger screen for us older people to see better....

author: Jeanie
title: A Must Have
content:
I love every about my new echo spot. It can answer almost any question you ask it. It can show you things like how to do's, pictures of things that you dont know what they look like. When you connect to Alexa,
you can play music, control your smart home, get the news, weather, and so more all with just your voice. You can set an alarm, turn on your stove or turn down your lights if you have the smart devices. Alexa gets to know your voice and can tell you who is speaking. You can play all your favorite music, and you can play games with it. You can have Alexa read your favorite book to you, or you can play movies. Skills are like apps that help you do more with Alexa, you can customize Alexa responses and create personalized skills in minutes, no coding required. You can link calendars from Google, G Suite, iCloud, Outlook.com, or Office365, and Alexa will remind you, that way you won't miss a thing.

author: Lee Wissel
title: Easy to use and setup
content: I bought one for now but so far it's great. Plan to add in the security cameras that work with Alexa.  We love how it will answer questions and set reminders and alarms. Very easy to get up and running. My wife heard me talking to someone and it was Alexa answering me, he he. Alexa has a sexy voice, I'm cheating with a smart round ball that knows everything. It's like the old magic eight ball that you shook and read the little triangle float thing in bottom of it. I would shake Alexa but would probably have SWAT at my door in seconds to arrest me. We are having fun with it.

author: Daisha Nieto
title: OMG I’m in love with the spot
content: OMG I’m in love with the spot! I got black and it’s perfect for my studio in downtown Seattle! I got it to have music; turn/off when needed to be hands free. Keeps me company, when im bored or there is dead silence. I keep mine in the kitchen/living room to get me out of bed each morning to turn the alarm clock off! It’s great! The sound and speaker is perfect she hears me pretty well!

author: DVRYS
title: Very useful
content: Alexa smart home temperature, light, and appliance voice control, classy alarm clock, automated wake up assistant, security camera monitor, weather and news in a small attractive package. Auto dim for night function

author: George A.
title: Great device to add to your smart home.
content: What more can you ask for? A great add to the Amazon Alexa family. Easy to setup and works like a mini version of the Amazon Show. The camera features are nice if you like to use drop-in.  You can also disable the feature in the menu if you don’t use the video portion. The device has an auto dim feature that can sense light so it won’t be bright in a bedroom if you want to use it for the alarm clock feature. Sound quality is also great for a small device. You will be suprised with the audio quality.  Smart integration works well too. I have my Arlo cams and Ring doorbell skills synced and works flawlessly. If you want a smaller version of the show or a smart alarm clock that has Alexa features, you won’t be disappointed.

author: Geoff P
title: This works as advertised, it would have gotten five ...
content: This works as advertised, it would have gotten five stars except for the fact that the base is not adjustable - you need to purchase an accessory that attaches to the base for it to be adjustable.

author: Robert Mitsch
title: Quality Device
content: I was impressed with the quality feel of the Echo Spot.  The sound was much better than expected from such a small device.

author: JC Fazzone
title: Cute and space saving
content: Perfect if you are trying to save space and is much better compared to the Echo Show.  Even though it is compact, it performs wonderfully.  Price is a bit too high and sound quality isn’t that good if you play music.  I would buy another one for my office if came down in price.

author: Nicholas Feduska
title: Probably the best nightstand alarm clock I've ever owned
content: Still learning all the stuff this can do... the list grows daily. Probably the best nightstand alarm clock I've ever owned. Clock dims beautifully when it's time for bed. Can stream relaxing sounds to go to sleep. Hooked to smart home, Nest thermostat, and Ring cameras it can control just about everything. Love the ability to make speakerphone calls from the device, too. Way to go, Amazon!

author: J.K.
title: ... when my husband got me the spot I thought cool, but why do I need it
content: I have an echo dot so when my husband got me the spot I thought cool ,but why do I need it??  Well I’ll tell you!  The small video screen really adds a lot more function.  You can watch videos, FaceTime, see your grocery list, but by far my favorite is that it shows song lyrics so it’s basically a karaoke machine as well.  I can sing my favorite songs or watch amazon video while cooking dinner. I highly recommend the spot.  it’s such a cool addition to our house.

author: Timothy Crowley
title: What time is it 🙀
content: Looks, works and is excellent😺

author: VisionsOnVinyl
title: Happy Customer
content: Very happy with this purchase.

author: Rob MacGregor
title: This is the Alexa experience you are looking for!
content:
Incredible!  I hated the idea of a "connected" home.  Then my mother in law bought us echo dots for Christmas.  We purchased the Echo Spot to allow for us to video call our family members and even my 4 year old can operate Alexa.

There are some things to learn, but Alexa in conjunction with the Alexa app allow us to video call anyone on iPhones or Androids.  All that is required is that they install the Alexa app.  It is as simple as saying "Alexa, call X" and voila, it connects.  It defaults to video connection first but if there is only an audio call available, it seemlessly switches.  The sound quality is VERY good for a package this small and I am nearly deaf.  The screen is bright and clear and you can adjust the brightness to suit your needs.

author: M. Callis
title: I hear an Echo!!!
content: Love it

author: Shauna
title: Love it
content: Easy to use. Alexa is all over my son’s apartment. Made a great addition and gift.

author: Kenneth T. Amerson
title: Oner
content: I love my Spot.  I have it on my desk in the Livingroom. The clock is great, when you set a timer the remaining time is displayed on the screen.  Thinking about getting one for my bedroom now.

author: Timmay
title: The best echo to date
content: The best echo to date!  I went all in on home automation about 6 months ago.  My house currently has 7 echo devices, 1 show, 2 spots, 1 echo plus, 1 echo, and two dots.  This is my favorite out of all of them.  It looks like it was made for my desk, and I love the display.  I hooked mine up to the microphone port on the back of my PC so that Alexa talks through my computer speakers/headset.

author: Page Lane
title: I don’t like the sound quality
content: All of the echo home devices are easy to set up, convenient to use and function very well with my smart home devices. I have the 3rd gen echo dot and the sound in that is 10 times better than the echo spot. I guess the trade off is the convenience of having a screen. I’m going to keep the spot but if you want great sound and don’t need a screen I would recommend the echo spot for an economic option or the echo, both are still cheaper than the spot. I will be purchasing another echo dot to connect my devices and have music play throughout the house. I love this feature and want to have nice sound quality for the surround sound effect.

author: Tammy
title: Very good for trips 👍🏾
content: I am absolutely loving this! I’m a huge tech nerd and this helps reduce clutter on the table, everything in one! Very good for trips 👍🏾

author: Ann-Sophie Juste
title: Cool enough
content: I really like it but sometimes she does not understand me. I would still recommend it

author: tripcatz
title: Four Stars
content: THESE ARE GREAT BUT THE VOICE QUALITY ON CALLS AND DROP INS IS UNRELIABLE.

author: jamie bosch
title: We love the spot
content: We love the spot. We can video chat and we love how all the things we cab do with our spot. My husband calls me to make sure I'm awake for work in case my alarm fails. This is an amazing product and we will be purchasing many more Alexa enabled smart home items

author: Devan Keith Taylor
title: Makes your house a smart house!
content: Very handy. Works with direct Tv and changes channels when you tell it to, works with nest and adjusts thermostat when you tell it to, works with my debot vacuum and will tell it to start cleaning or return to base. Works with Amazon music and plays any station or song you tell it to. Knows the weather. Sets a timer (handy if cooking in the kitchen) Even calls contacts on your phone through the speaker! The list goes on and on. Those are some of my favorite features.

author: Ann
title: Adorable and functional
content: I'm loving this cute little thing. It's in my kitchen and I use it convert measurements, set timers, reorder my coffee pods, play music and of course... it's a great little clock. The screen is really great. Much more useful than other echoes without a screen.

author: Jennifer Pinckley
title: Doesn't work with Nest....
content: Its not bad for what it is, but we bought it to use with Nest Camera and it was a complete failure in that regard. It turns off after an hour or so, which renders the camera useless.

author: Daniel Kutka
title: Four Stars
content: i love it. i hope to see amazon open up the video abilities like they have for the show

author: Kindle Customer
title: My new favorite Echo device
content: My new favorite Echo device! My smart alarm wakes me up to my favorite music playlist. The camera quality is ok and the video while small is still useful.

author: WallyD
title: Not Worth It
content:
I received an Echo Spot and an Echo Dot for Christmas.  I set the Spot up by my computer for convenience.  What I get is a continuous list of things to try and what's trending on the Internet.  Really annoying.  After a lot of Googling I finally figured out how to get rid of most of the messages coming across the screen and learned that this is a widespread frustration.  Amazon makes it difficult for you to find out how to do this in the settings menu.  They call all these messages "rotations".  Amazon technical support confirmed that you can't get rid of the suggestions of things to ask Alexis to do - Amazon isn't listening to their customers on this issue.

I've now been playing around with the Echo Spot for a couple of weeks and read the book "Amazon Echo Spot".  Hence an update to my initial review. Do you want to watch movies on a 3" screen; use the clock for selfies or to view your photos; view your to-do list on a clock; or would you rather use the big screens of your computer or TV as well as your cell phone/tablet for these activities.  At 5 times the cost of an Echo Spot, you are getting an expensive clock without useful features you don't already have on the Echo Spot or your other electronics.  It looks cool, but doesn't provide value.

author: luiscorona2000
title: Not every feature is available in my country however it works fine. Great product
content:
Very accurate on speach recognition even with a different accent. I had to twitch my phone setting a little bit because I live in Mexico but now everything is working. I had some issues with pairing Phillips Hue with Echo but after a change in the WiFi it worked.
Not every feature is available in my country however it works fine. Great product!

author: Herbert Garcia
title: Not worth the cost without You Tube Support !
content:
Not worth the money without You Tube Support !!!

The Echo spot does everything the Echo dot does and it does it perfectly. There are a few nice extras that the screen provides such as:
1) Lyrics to words to songs you hear on Amazon music and interesting song facts using music Genius
2) It can display the weather graphically and show you 3 day forecast
3) You can upload your person picture to use a screen-background
4) It can show you a small squeezed size picture of your RING camera video (too small and cannot be enlarged)

However, notifications, from skills like Dominoe's Pizza, Amazon Shopping, Life360, etc only display a sound instead of turning the ring a color Yellow.  So if you are not there to hear the sound, you will never know you had a notification.

Lastly, without for the Price, its simply not worth getting !!  The Amazon Dot can do practically everything you'll need and until Amazon gets you Tube Support - I would not recommend buying the Spot at over $100 - too much money for too little bang !!

Lastly, without

author: Jennifer
title: Echo Spot
content: I don't like how there's not a cover for the camera... I Do like the shopping list and to-do list that syncs with my phone. No issues at all with it connecting to any devices!

author: Kitty
title: Amazing!!
content: I absolutely love this echo spot. I’m still trying to figure out all the perks, but so far it works great with the commands of my iRobot vacuum, and with daily tasks such as weather forecast, time etc. I know it’s capable of so much more.

author: satisfied
title: Love it
content: Love it, works much better than echo dots, dont think I have ever had it loose wifi connection, dots do all the time. I use mainly as alarm clock, and to turn on lights fans etc works great.

author: Zach P.
title: but it's nice to see some alerts and notifications right on the ...
content: Cute little echo for the bedside table. A glorified dot with a clock face. The screen is too small for much else, but it's nice to see some alerts and notifications right on the screen.

author: Kelley
title: Love this product
content: Have a few different Alexa devices, this one is my alarm clock. Love that the light coming from it isn’t obtrusive! Beautiful sound !

author: Nannettee Ramos
title: ECHO IS NOT EASY TO PAIR WITH OTHER DEVICES
content: IM RATING THIS PRODUCT SO LOW BECAUSE ITS NOT EASY TO PAIR WITH OTHER DEVICES TO MAKE YOUR HOME A SMART HOME. YOU NEED TO DOWNLOAD EXTRA APPS AND GET OTHER DEVICES TO MAKE IT HAPPEN. THEN THE NEXT THING IS YOU HAVE TO LEARN ALEXA COMMANDS TO BE ABLE FOR IT TO DO WHAT YOUR ASKING TO FIND OUT WHAT WAS PLAYING AT THE DRIVE IN MOVIES WAS THE MOST RIDICULOUS THING EVER.

author: Digital_Furry
title: Beautiful fun piece of technology
content:
So I picked up my first Amazon smart tech when I needed a bedside clock to replace the IHome I had. (Switched to a Samsung phone) I have to say my favorite feature is the ability to tell Alexa to set an alarm for any time and tell her what music to play straight off my Spotify account for it. It looks very clean and crisp and only takes up a small spot on my nightstand. Just like all the other echo devices it works great for asking various questions. Getting the weather first thing in the morning is nice. There are also a number of different backgrounds and clock faces to choose from to make it interesting. Sound quality is great and music sounds clean and crisp. At first I was worried about having a screen next to me at night for a clock because even on dim most displays are still too bright. The spot when in night mode and senses little to no light gets super dim. Enough that I can still see the time but doesn’t create any excess light so that is a super plus. Setup was really easy and the phone app makes it easy to adjust finer settings.

As for the CONs I don’t like how it cycles through the “things to try” without the ability to turn it off. I would like just having it cycle through the clock face and the weather. A little annoying but nothing too serious. Hopefully an update fix down the road. Another thing I noticed was the lack of ability to display 24hr time. I’m so used to it that switching back to the a.m./p.m. is sometimes a pain. Finally is the lack of a backup battery in the event of a power outage. The old clock radios I used to use would at least have a battery backup so if the power went out my alarm would still sound. Because the spot requires an outlet, good luck waking up on time if power is out during your alarm time.

Overall very fun piece of tech I enjoying using and having around. Hopefully I can use the full function of the smart home someday as this little sucker can do quite a bit.

author: David
title: we have Google Home as well this looks beautiful and makes video calls to different devices very convenient ...
content:
but does not feed from google, we have Google Home as well
this looks beautiful and makes video calls to different devices
very convenient and beautiful

author: Tom McClay
title: Had it two days and love it, just hoping the government is listening to ...
content: Had it two days and love it,  just hoping the government is listening to everything I do (like fart). Also, will this be affected by Trump Tariff Tax #TTT ? I'm thinking of getting a couple more before the price doubles.

author: Larry
title: Not quite perfect
content: I love the echo spot, but don't like that I can't disable the "things to try" screen from showing up as part of the standard screen "rotation".  Also, since this is most likely to be used as a bedside companion, the ability to physically mask the camera should be standard feature.  Everything can be hacked, so turning off the camera through the software is not adequate.

author: Chazzart
title: Delightful almost stealth like.
content: Absolutely delicious. Inconspicuous. So small you forget it’s there.

author: Metalhead
title: Impressive product with numerous skills and features
content: Although some critics believe this product is over priced at the $130 we paid for it, I would challenge them to find a comparable product at this price point that does what it does. I've yet to see any critic indicate a cheaper, yet equal product in functionality. Set up is very simple and there's numerous skills that can be used and the wife loves the images and video it displays. When asking what are my notifications, it not only announces them, but shows an image of product(s) out for delivery or on order. The sound it delivers is immensely better than that of the Echo dots we have.

author: Geraldine
title: I subscribed to the Music feature and love it -- wonderful selections
content: I received the Echo Spot as a Christmas gift. I wanted it because of the Ring Doorbell.  Wow, am I surprised.  I didn't realize the sound was going to be so impressive for one speaker.  It can hear me from another room.  I can't wait to get my Echo Spot book so I can learn more about this little gem.  I'm getting more this year!!  I quilt a lot, so I am looking forward to adding audio books.  I subscribed to the Music feature and love it -- wonderful selections.  Thank you for making this little gem!!

author: Ms Stacy
title: Super satisfied
content: I love my echo dot, it makes life so much easier and I can call my love ones hands free.

author: Pamela M. Sanford
title: Smart Display
content: I enjoy the display that comes on the screen.. It adjusts to what I need.. I had the regular echo and like it so much I wanted an echo spot..

author: Nyronni
title: The best!
content: I love it!  Alexa is my list keeper,  my music player, my meteorologist, and my reminder in chief.  I constantly discover new ways to use her.

author: CTX1300
title: Spot Rocks!
content: I was a little skeptical at first buying this but with Amazon’s Black Friday deals, I thought... what the heck as I wanted, not needed a fun new alarm clock. Well, I love this new toy. The fact that I can adjust the background light, the clock face, give it a verbal command and get a response quickly is wonderful. Finding out the weather before getting out of bed is a plus for me. Also not having to search for the alarm button is another plus.

author: Azphxguy
title: Perfect Bedside Companion
content:
The Echo Spot is like the best smart alarm clock you can have! I already have my smart home setup with another assistant. Adding the spot to my home was painless. Just add the skills to Alexa, ask her to discover new devices and within seconds I was ready to go.

Upload pictures and movies to your Amazon photos account, then sort them into albums and your can watch all your personal home videos on it, and watch your favorite pictures work as backgrounds for your clock. It dims very low when all my lights are out and doesn't bother me at all when trying to sleep. You can also tell Alexa to turn off the screen and it'll go completely dark.

I wasn't sure about the echo show, that looks great for a room, computer desk, or other area, but the spot is PERFECT for the bedroom, right beside the bed. My friends are really impressed with it as well.

Trivia, games, reading my books, movies, even reading my Twitter feed, it has it all.

author: Debbie
title: Love it
content: I really love this. Great to customize to your liking. Now my husband wants one!

author: Mark K.
title: Pretty dang cool.
content: Wife loves it.  I am fine with it.  Does exactly as advertised.  She uses it as an alarm clock, weather reporter, music player, and google enabler.

author: Frompus
title: while usable could be substantially better and from industry experience
content:
This is really in a class by itself. It’s small, powerful and just a pleasure to use. The sheer number of possibilities it creates for use is staggering and continues to increase exponentially. It replaces an alarm clock, mini speaker, small screen enhanced Echo.

The ONLY two minor complaints that I have are somewhat trivial. The first is that the speaker, while usable could be substantially better and from industry experience, would add nearly nothing to the price.

The second is that because of the round shape of the screen not everything displays in a fashion that is conducive for use. All that it would need is a tweak in software to correct this and it would be infinitely more usuable.

I have found the optional stand gives it a massive increase in placement scenarios. I would recommend it to anyone. Although it works well without if you want to save the $15. Don’t beat yourself up.

The bottom line is you will be happy you bought it and never think twice about spending the money.

author: oc
title: Echo Spot is AWESOME
content:
I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE my Echo Spot. FaceTime calls on it work flawlessly and the sound is super clear.

It looks great and it works great.

Everyone should have one!!!

author: Gerald Senear
title: Headaches.
content:
Received my spot today. I was an early adopter of echo. Then my apartment switched over to free internet. included with the rent. We
had to go to an internet site to sign on to the internet. It was s nightmare because Amazon had made no provision for hot spots or open wifi sites. I gave my echo to my son and bought an Alexa equipped tablet. The setup today took me right to the sign-up internet site. This little guy is great. I now have an always on Alexa again.

author: Raven
title: Easy to set up! No app required.
content:
Such a fun, quirky little clock to sit on my desk. I had the Amazon Alexa Echo sitting on my desk before but, I wanted something a bit more useful. So I purchased this, along with the stand. Set up was quick and simple. Because of the touch screen, I didn't have to use the Alexa app like I did with the Echo. Everything was set up right on the screen. In the Welcome email you get from Amazon, it does tell you to get the app, but I didn't use it once for the setup process. The screen seems to be good quality and I have no complaints about the sound. I think the Echo gave a bit more bass, but this one is just fine. Being that it sits right here at me, I don't need it to be loud. It has a jack in the back and is also bluetooth so if you really need better music from it, you could always get a little speaker for it. I find that I personally don't need that. So here's some things I like/don't like about this little thing:

Touch screen which makes it easier to set up than the echo and dot.
Multiple clock faces to choose from, including the ability to make your own.
Different events, such as weather and news will scroll across the screen.
Lyrics of songs that you request it to play scroll down the screen and it keeps up pretty well. I did notice some lag when the songs had pretty fast lyrics but it did a pretty great job otherwise.
My son loves coming in and randomly asking Alexa to show him different pictures of animals and it does. One of the animals he asked to see was a Llama. Because of the way the screen is, rounded, it cut off the Llama's head completely. I think the resolution may need to be tweaked on Amazon's side or smaller bezel, not sure. It was funny to us when we noticed it.
It's small, about the size of a softball, maybe a touch bigger. Fits perfect on my desk.

When it comes down to it, it's a nice little upgrade from the Echo. I got mine while it was on sale. I wish I would have gotten two! One for desk and one for bedroom! I can't comment on how it works as an alarm clock, as I just use my phone for that. As a replacement for the echo, it's definitely an upgrade.

author: Charlie
title: The dot works fine for me in the bedroom as an alarm clock ...
content: The dot works fine for me in the bedroom as an alarm clock but this is very nice to have in the family room where everyone can see it.

author: Doug DiFranco
title: Echo Spot for the win!
content: I love this device! All the functionality of an Amazon Echo with the added benefit of a video screen. It looks great on my nightstand as a clock (lots of faces to choose from) and displays weather, reminders, etc. I think it can do video calls too but I use FaceTime for that anyway. It’s a great shape and doesn’t take up a lot of room. I’m planning to get another one for my guest room. Awesome for a great price!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Really like the clock and calender display
content: Have 4 echo dots around the house.  3 used as bedroom nightstand alarms, music, info, etc.  Thought I would give the Spot a try.  Really like the clock and calender display.  Grandkids like video chat so can use spot vs phone. They also like to "drop in" and tell me what new thing they discovered or when they get bored and want to talk with someone (being a grandparent is fun).  For the price the Spot is still the most economical, but the Spot is a bit of an upgrade.  Will probably be more features as it's been out more.  Would like to be able to send a picture to the Spot to share.  And having a revolving picture album alternate with clock would be great.

author: Chemeng53
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent device. The clock and its shape set it apart from others .

author: michael w. flint
title: Five Stars
content: Great! Will buy again. Great value! I use it by my bed. works awesome!

author: Christina P
title: It's a great addition to my echo family
content: It's a great addition to my echo family. Perfect size for my desk in the basement, and if the kids call me I don't have to run upstairs I can chat with them from my desk.

author: mpaq13
title: What a cool little device with Alexa baked in
content: What a cool little device with Alexa baked in!  Adding a screen was a great idea, and it's perfect as a smart alarm clock that does every thing I could want it to do.

author: Luis B.
title: Just need more skills integrations but so far the best in market
content: Ecelent product. Long time waiti g for an affordable visual echo interface. Just need more skills integrations but so far the best in market. Widely recommend.

author: Jeffrey Scatena
title: Essential for families
content: What a great way to keep my kids near me

author: Mel
title: Echo Spot is awesome
content: I love the hands free. The alarm with music. Weather and sports. Plus I love talking to Alexa she makes me laugh

author: Iceburg
title: This is awesome, now I want more to go in all ...
content: This is awesome, now I want more to go in all the rooms, but I'll have to do with just one.  How long until Amazon is hacked and a bunch of sex videos are posted?  I guess I should move it out of the bedroom just in case.

author: N. Littlejohn
title: I Love!!!
content: I love the screen on the echo spot! Now when Alexa is talking a lot of the information is also displayed on the screen. Very nice product. I was mostly looking forward to it as a nice nightstand clock and I didn't expect it to be that much of an upgrade from the dot but it is. Looking forward to using it with other items! :)

author: Lozo
title: Love it.
content: Worth the price.  I have two dots.  But love the Spot!

author: MichaelD
title: Best of both worlds!
content: The perfect blend of the functions of an Echo Show in the footprint of a Dot.

author: Lorraine
title: Great bedside clock
content: I have several Dots and a Show. The Spot is great for use as a bedside clock because of the way it dims down at night. The sound is better than the Dot too. I use it to listen to podcasts when I am doing household chores.

author: tylor
title: I love this. My daughter has learned so many things
content: I love this. My daughter has learned so many things, and she is always asking it to play music while she dances and plays around the house. I'm very pleased with the display as well. Ask to see a butterfly, and boom, a butterfly. Love love love!!!

author: David Emanuel
title: My favorite Alexa device so far
content: My favorite Alexa device so far. Its a great clock, with dynamic screen that displays the time, weather, music lyrics, calendar and even pictures of my incoming "stuff" from Amazon. I'm totally amazed at what it can do, and I'm probably utilizing only 10% of its functionality. One day I might even read the documentation, but for now 100% satisfied.

author: Kelly Meacham
title: It's a little hard of hearing.
content:
Likes: The design and functionality. I like to be able to view our security cameras from the bedside.
Dislikes: Seems to be a little harder for Alexa to "hear" our commands on the Echo Spot.

author: Valigirl
title: Great little bedside alarm clock with “benefits”
content: Had been wanting an Echo, but did not want to spend the $$$.  There happened to be a 24 hour sale, so I finally took the plunge!  Wanted mainly as a bedside alarm clock, as it will give so many face options, including a 24 hr clock, which I prefer.  Regarding use of Alexa, don’t use this feature that often.  When I do, it’s mainly for weather info, alarm clock and as a source of music when in the bedroom.  Nice design and works great!

author: Ravinder Soni
title: Beautiful by design
content: Beautiful by design, needs functional improvements. I am concerned over camera as they should give some physical lid to close camera lenses rather than software to disable it.

author: Wes Miller
title: Video enhances the echo expierence
content: Got this with a discount for taking advantage of a Audible membership offer and find the addtion of a screen really does enhance the Amazon Echo compared to the other 3 just Audio Echo's that I have

author: Lucky Daughter
title: Nearly Perfect with a few tweaks...
content:
I've been using the Echo Spot for a little over two weeks now and so far I think this product is AMAZING. It's voice recognition is fairly spot on and I have never felt like I was misunderstood when asking Alexa something. It's been immensely convenient. There's a couple of small things that irk me though, such as the fact that although it will recognize my contacts when I say "call ___", if i ask it to show me all my contacts, neither my parents nor half of my friends appear.

 It also doesn't show you what skills you already own. If you say "show me my skills" or "what skills do I own?", Alexa will ask if you'd like to download the three most popular skills on the market. This makes it really easy to lose track of the skills you downloaded prior.

I was wish there was more flexibility into what you see on the home screen. I love knowing the weather and time, but I really don't care for the "things to try" page. It'd be more nice to have that page for things such as "Don't forget to meditate today with your HeadSpace skill" or "Tell Alexa about your day with your MyJournal skill". Ya know? Something that applies to me.

Lastly, the routine program could use some major tweaking. Some of the vocal replies sound really awkward and I would have hoped that the language engineering team put more effort into making at least the default expressions listed sound natural. Also you can't open skills as part of your routine so you can only check the weather, receive an awkward automated reply back, play a song, or hear the about the news... you might as well just go to your home page.

I understand this is just me being knit-picky, especially with regards to the access of skills, but I also hope that someone who is working on the next software update reads this review and takes it into consideration for improvements. Fix these couple of things and the Echo Spot will be darn near perfect.

author: Richard
title: Have two of these and its great for the Kitchen and Bedroom
content: Have two of these and its great for the Kitchen and Bedroom . It changes to a clock also which is very nice also when needed and you have the screen to view anything .

author: Frank Brown
title: Great smart device/clock radio and then some!
content: Device met all expectations. Good speaker. Sharp screen. Great interaction with Alexa service. The only thing I’d change is I’d like a little more versatility with the touch screen (specifically, it’d be nice to use the screen vs. speech to start ambient noise playback when others are already asleep). Aside from that small nitpick, this is an excellent device and all that it’s advertised to be.

author: D. Martinek
title: Everyone should own one!
content:
It's yet another Amazon Alexa device for my collection, and I then bought one for a friend.

I'm not sure how Amazon does it, but it's the best personal assistant out there.

author: maggie perez
title: NO OPTION FOR SPANISH
content: BOUGHT THIS TO COMMUNICATE WITH MY MOTHER, WHO DOESN'T SPEAK ENGLISH.  TURNS OUT IT DOESN'T UNDERSTAND, OR SPEAK SPANISH.  NO OPTION AVAILABLE FOR SPANISH LANGUAGE SET UP, DESPITE THE FACT MANY REVIEWS SAY IT DOES... WELL, THE ALEXA APP HAS NO OPTION FOR THAT LANGUAGE.  IT'S SAD THAT MANY HISPANICS LIVE IN THE USA, AND MANY AROUND THE WORLD WHO PURCHASE FROM AMAZON  HELPING ITS PROFIT.  I THINK IT'S TIME TO UPLOAD THIS LANGUAGE AMAZON, OR GOOGLE, NETFLIX,  AND SMARTPHONES WILL BE A BETTER CHOICE OFFERING MOST LANGUAGE TRANSLATIONS TODAY...

author: DAR
title: Love my Spot, and looking for this clock face
content: I love my Echo Spot & Dots! It's more then an alarm clock for me. When your recovering from surgery it is a wonderful companion. She hears all my gripes with no talking back! Lol. But I'm trying to find a watch face. It's from the most recent commercial for the spot. I asked the question & it's posted there if you know the answer-thank you in advance. In the commercial with Rebel Wilson from PP3 the face is a bright Sapphire Blue. It's perfect!

author: Kathryn R. DeCaria
title: Not what I expected
content: I am huge Amazon fan! First to have a kindle and the echo. I waited a bit on this but have wanted it for awhile. I do love it!! My kids love it! They love watching videos and the lyrics to the songs. Now the video calling feature is nothing like how the advertisement made it out. I thought as long as someone would FaceTime me I could do it through that and I can’t. It’s Spot to Spot. Can’t even Skype (which I do often with my aunt). The is my major disappointment with it.

author: Lawrence Weiss
title: I love it
content: I love everything it just what I expected

author: Joseph
title: Five Stars
content: Great little echo!!! Love the display and fits perfect on my nightstand we use it every day!

author: Scorpio
title: I knew I would love it...and I do.
content: The design attracted me. The reality sealed the deal. I'm sorry, but this is just a cool product. We have a "regular" Echo and use it quite a bit. When I saw the Spot, I just had to have one. Mine sits on the table beside my bed and serves as my alarm clock, radio and information center. I can make calls and so forth, but I don't. I have a few VERY minor quibbles with how things are done, but that's down to me learning how to tell my dear friend what I want to do. I think we might get more of these and put them all over the house. Need to save up for that, though. By the way, I got a stand for it, which makes it look even more cool and allows it to swivel. It's clearly not a necessity, but it's cheap enough to have one if you want one. And, trust me, you want one.

author: mindyury
title: My favorite Echo so far!
content: Love my Echo Spot! Works perfectly with my other Echos, reads my audio books with no issue, and shows my nest cameras to me. This little guy is a great price too!

author: Jason
title: Absolutely!!!!
content: Seriously awesome! My daughter has one in her room and it replaced her night light, radio, and alarm clock. Huge space saver!

author: Anna
title: Device has to be at near max volume to be reasonably heard, at least with Amazon Music Unlimited.
content: I bought this to put in the kitchen so I can listen to music while doing stuff. With the water running and this device on max volume tuned to Amazon Music Unlimited, you can barely hear it.  And I have a small, galley kitchen. With no water running, listening to Amazon playlists at anything less than 8 and you will hardly hear the music. I don't have this problem with the two Shows I have or the Echo that's in the living room. Just the Spot.

author: Joan Aldinger
title: Nice for my night stand
content: I use this on my night stand. It’s ok but after getting the show first, would rather have another show. The show is bigger and better.

author: Esrom mengstab
title: Great addition to my bedroom
content: Aside from the camera which kinda freaks me out a bit, I absolutely adore this product!!!! Great addition to my bedroom.

author: Zer0 Divide
title: All the Echo Functionality and Doubles as a Bedside Clock
content: All the usual Echo functionality including a small screen that doubles as a bedside clock.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Font too small for use as a bedside clock
content: I wanted to use it as a clock in our bedroom.  But the font is too small to see from any distance.  And apparently you can't change it.

author: wxg124
title: First Echo Dot I have and it really amazes me.
content: I have been thinking of getting one of Echo Dot as I have heard of lot good things about it. After I got this one, it really changed my thinking of Amazon of just selling things. I like all the features it comes with and it is so cute!

author: Janice B.
title: Fun and easy to use
content: I’ve only had it setup for 24 hours but I already love it. I’m having a little trouble hooking it up to my Bluetooth speakers but I’m thinking the speaker may not be compatible. The echo is pretty loud on its own. Other than that, it’s been a breeze to use. Created shopping list, hooked up music and setup some skills. Now I need to start buying the home automation items so I can setup the house scenes and really have fun.

author: kandiland
title: Got to replace old digital alarm clock
content: Why wouldn't someone take advantage of the great sales and get this feature in their home. I love Alexa an all she does She has survived two power outages and bounced back into action without skipping a beat. Alexa and Echo are my new best friends!

author: MidDelaware
title: Love the clock feature
content: The only thing I disliked about my original Alexa was no time display. This solves it  I may need to read up on it more because it scrolls past the time and I have to still ask it the time which it says out loud and goes back to time screen. Only complaint is it does not pick up speech as well so I have to repeat myself or talk straight at it

author: B. Smith
title: Tiny but viewable screen
content: I had the first edition of the Echo and was so unimpressed that I ended up selling it.  This new one is a treat: tiny but viewable screen, all the old features, plus I have started to use the home automation features.  Only those [like control of sockets] that can connect fairly directly for now, but in the future...

author: jj
title: Still needs some help
content: Speaker is less than adequate and microphone is horrible. I have to yell at this most of the time. No issues with my DOT or Echo but this one needs help

author: dfwsig
title: I like it
content: What a fun little item. Reminders, weather, calls to my daughter. Not the greatest sound quality but certainly okay for what I am using it for. If you want music, get the sonos and it will pair with the Alexa and your Amazon Music with much better sound quality.

author: Callan Anderson
title: Great sound, but the clock sometimes shows a different ...
content: Great sound, but the clock sometimes shows a different time and alarm to the actual time that Alexa will say (not always synced)

author: Michael
title: Waste of money
content: It sucked. Has to stay plugged in. Speaker is not loud. Won't play your music from phone. It's just a gimmick for Amazon to always be in your house and try to sell you crap! I returned it next day.

author: Katiedid26
title: It's worth it!

author: GrindMyGears

content: I've become a fan of Amazon devices since the Dot and was interested in the Show.  The Show is a bit pricey, so I decided to try out the Spot.  I'm still getting used to it, but I like it!  I use it primarily as an alarm clock with bonus features.  I enjoy all the features Alexa brings to it.  I've setup my Arlo cameras so I can actually see them through the Spot.  Pretty cool.  And I also like the ability to use this and my Dot as intercoms.  My only complaint is that I wish there were more clock faces, but that's pretty minor.  I will try out the video conferencing soon.  Overall, great addition to Amazon family.

title: Changing clock face feature worked briefly, then no longer an option!
content: Thirty minutes after setting up my new Echo Spot, the option to change the clock face stopped working. After an (seemingly) endless amount of time speaking with customer service, and trying the various fixes they suggested, I was told that this feature is now no longer available on ANY Echo Spot device. It was an option for 30 minutes on my device, then not ever available? REALLY, AMAZON???!!!! I purchased two of these devices, and back they both go to Amazon. Very disappointed.

author: Paul Semel
title: Works as advertised. Using it as a lazy man's ...
content: Works as advertised.  Using it as a lazy man's toy.  I also bought a WiFi thermostat.  Now, I can change the thermostat setting without getting off the couch.

author: Guadalupe A. Munguia
title: Alexa has so many features/skills, this is only a small input from using it for 2 weeks. I love it!
content: I have this in my room and I love it. I customized it to tell me what I want to hear when I say good morning, for example the weather, news, traffic to work, and a personalized message to remind me to say a prayer before getting out of bed. It has so many awesome features though and I have yet to learn more because I've only had her for 2 weeks. It plays some movies, shows lyrics to most songs, reads books from kindle. If I whisper to Alexa she whispers back, I can turn on/off my light from the app if I'm not home. Sounds to help you sleep, guided meditation when you synch the app to it, (I found it in the Alexa app on my phone) tells you jokes, she sings, the more you use it personalizes to you. You can even call someone from your phone contacts with Alexa and if someone else has an Alexa it calls them there.

author: Bobby Lane
title: All I Wanted Was A Simple Black & White Clock. (I Figuered It Out)
content:
I have 3 Echo Dots in the house & mom & I really like them. When I heard about this a couple of months ago I jumped right on the pre-order train. It caught my attention because the Echo Show was interesting to me but it was just way to big. I wanted something that I could use as a clock by the bed, currently I was using my Moto 360 watch (it turns into a simple clock dial when docked). So this would replace two things on the stand (my watch as a clock & the Echo Dot). I absolutely LOVE it. / What I really wasn't fond of were the clock dials, all I wanted was a simple clock (all black background & white numbers), sadly that option isn't available as a choice... but there is a work around!

As you can see in the pics it's VERY dim at night when the lights are off & it's bright & clearly visible when the lights are on but still stays as a simple black & white clock.

For those that want to know how to achieve this:

1.) The main thing is to turn on the "Night Mode" "Nighttime Clock" (pic3) and set it to run 24hrs a day.

2.) Turn on the "Adaptive Brightness" & crank up the brightness, you can see how high I set mine in the pic (pic4), but you can fine tune  this setting to your liking (this is the setting that actually controls how bright it is in the day & how dim it is at night).

3.) Choose the "Street Lights" or "Bokeh" digital clock.

4.) That's it, once you make those setting just wait about a minute for it to go back into standby mode and your "simple clock" will fade in.

Oh, for those that have an issue with the screen cycling through all the the displays non-stop (Clock-Weather-Things To Try, etc.) & just want it to stay on the clock face of your choosing, the way to achieve that is to go into Settings>Home & Clock>Home Card Preferences, click on "Rotate Once".

Hope this helps someone. ;-)

author: Anthony Lewis
title: Good but has its issues
content: I was happy to switch out the standard Echo for the Echo Spot in my bedroom so I could use it for a clock as well. Its sound is not as great though so I quickly had to add a Bluetooth speaker to make listening to music more enjoyable. Only issue is that a couple times a week, it stutters. With or without the bluetooth speaker, you can hear little pauses while it speaks and it's much more annoying when trying to play music. They recommend rebooting the device when this happens. Yes. that works... but having to unplug and re-plug my echo every time I want to listen to music gets old. I should've had it replaced months ago but I waited too long.

author: Mar Mu
title: Echo Spot is not that useful. This is acceptable as I'm in the process ...
content:
She tells me what she can/can't do and I'm still learning her ways. While I believe the basics is acceptable, I think unless you have some home automation accessories, Echo Spot is not that useful.  This is acceptable as I'm in the process of adding some home automation items.  The most annoying  thing is when Alexa speaks, the "speak" volume is great except when she does a sound effect or plays music those volume comes in at a lower volume.  Ok.  Another annoying thing is when I ask Alexa to do something, she responds correctly but when I give the same command again (another day), she does not understand.  My wife does the same thing so maybe this isn't a flaw but, it is annoying.

I purchased two Alexa products when one would have been fine. I still have the box for one and Christmas is on its way.

author: Pouyan
title: Nice companion
content: Alex improved a lot. She can understand my English with accent pretty well! Nice job

author: S. Jacobs
title: Usability of alarm dismiss needs some work
content:
This is a more functional replacement for the combination of the Echo Dot and my regular alarm clock - nice to have one device replace 2 that were there before - and obviously takes up a lot less space that the Dot + Clock combination that I had before.

The sound as others have stated is pretty good for such a small device. But honestly I don't use it much for that - certainly not for music as I have various Sonos connected speakers throughout my home. However - as with other Alexa enabled products now - it is easy to use it to play music in my bedroom or bathroom - so that is nice - and that was basically most of what I was using the Dot for before I replaced it with the Spot.

The big negative to me is that I am not a snoozer - I could care less about being able to easily snooze my alarm. I would much rather the single tap simply turn the alarm off for the day - but of course keep it active for the next day if it is a recurring alarm. I typically have one alarm set up just for the weekdays and have none on the weekend. So it is important that the easiest gesture be to simply turn it off without completely deactivating it - and not snoozing it. I get up before my wife typically - so I don't want to wake her to tell Alexa to stop the alarm - it has to be a touch gesture. And yes - I know I can swipe up to dismiss the alarm - but that gesture is problematic. Often I end up just snoozing it because as I go to swipe up - that first touch registers the snooze and the swipe up doesn't have the desired effect. And if I don't go into the app to see whether or not the alarm has been deactivated I run the risk that it will go off again when I am in the shower and wake my wife up. Not good.

So - the single touch gesture needs at least to be configurable to either cause a snooze or to simply turn the alarm off for that day - but to keep it active if it happens to be say a recurring weekday alarm like I have set up.

As it stands now - it is borderline unusable for my use case.

title: Great, just a few glitches
content: So far, great; however, we have multiple spots and dots. The drop in isn’t exactly working between spots. When I drop in on my brother, it goes to my mom, and when my mom drops in on me, it really drops in on my brother. I’m really confused as to how that happened, because we each have a profile. Also, my old contacts from a phone that was destroyed are still in the Echo app, and it hasn’t synced my new contacts. Also, when my boyfriend called my spot, it went to my mom, so that was pretty embarrassing. I’m really confused on what to do on my own and will be contacting amazon to try and get this straight. It is a great device and I would definitely recommend again. If you don’t like the camera, you can get a camera cover for spots.

author: Michael H.
title: Power saver.
content: Okay there are a lot of reviews about this echo spot. I think it is great. One of the things I like best about is this. I have this one in the den and another in my bedroom. Both are on surge protectors.  This is what is great. When I get up and am ready to leave my room I cut off the surge protector. Go into the den turn that surge protector on. Leave the house cut that surge protector of. When I cut either of them back on the clock is correct. This is an electronic clock and more that can be turned on or off at any time. This saves both electricity and data allowance. How awesome is that?  The old electric clocks you couldn't do that unless you don't mind doing a reset every time.

author: Amazon Customer

content: Great bedside alarm clock. Nice clear display and quick functionality. I have Google Home minis too which I like for music but Alexa has a better range of smart home features and I think this one in particular is very aesthetically pleasing. Get the stand, puts it at a better position.

author: Gracie's Mom
title: This isn't in the Things to Try menu
content: My 95 year old father recently spent two weeks in a rehabilitation hospital.  He has dementia and adapts poorly to new situations.  I installed an Echo Show in his room with Moms picture on it.  He can call her and she can see him.  It has helped him settle in although Mom does get calls all night long.  I have put reminders on it to drink some water. Like many aged people, he doesn't get thirsty. This has saved him from an IF drip.  Than-you Alexa!

author: Michelle A Cain
title: It Can't Do Anything They Say it Does
content: I wanted to love this. We have Google home assistants all over the house, but the idea of a little screen and the drop in feature were too much to pass up. So I bought it. It has never worked correctly. I've had it for 29 days and have spent at least 5 hours on chat and phone conversations with Amazon. Keep being told they'll email me the answer...nope, never happened. It can't even operate fire tv...c'mon. It can't link to anything and answers about 10% of questions while just shutting off for the other 90%. I'll stick with Google and suggest you do the same!

Excellent, I received the desired product.

Amazon, are the best, a very committed supplier, I recommend that purchases be 100% reliable. The items are new and in good condition. I recommend it to all those interested and the friends fulfill their expectations.

author: This Tech Guy
title: Alexa's little Spot....
content:
At first I was undecided about getting a Spot. After having one for a couple of weeks, I am loving it! I love the fact that you can actually see what Alexa is doing. I love the lyrics that scroll when music is played and the fact that it is self contained is nice too. Almost all of the settings can be modified by simply swiping down from the top of the screen. Speaking of the screen, it is bright, clear, and easy to read even in direct sunlight and the viewing angle is great. I disabled the adaptive brightness because it would go completely dark (black) screen at night. The bluetooth connectivity works without flaw.

Only thing I would like to see more of is the clock skins. I found one that I like but it would be nice to be able to create one with widgets maybe. Sure, it scrolls things like the weather and top news but it would be cool to style my own. Maybe I just haven't found the settings to do so.

If you are considering purchasing this little gem, just do it! You will like what you get.

title: Love it!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Read before you buy.
content: If you're thinking of buying a Spot you're likely already familiar with Alexa.  I do like the Spot but can't rate it above 3-stars due to the inability of turning off the advertisements that scroll across the screen prompting you to ask Alexa questions or try new things.  I accept online advertising as something that comes with the territory of our tech laden world, but I don't want it sitting on my nightstand on a device that I'm using primarily for its function as a clock and as an Echo.  Thumbs down, Amazon for not building in the ability to turn the ads off completely.

author: plcd22
title: The screen is nice speakers ok!

author: J. R. Lambert
title: Great addition to Echo but needs more.
content: Have had this for a few days. Setup was a breeze, 5 minutes. Plug in, connect, and go. I really love the compact size and it even lets me see who's at my door with my Ring doorbell. I tried making telephone calls with it, and it works beautifully, not just to echo users but to any phone. I would like to see more choices for the clock faces with the next update. There seems to be no way to download additional ones using the Alexa app. The ones included are OK, limited, and, for people with older eyes, a little small. My husband couldn't see the clock the first night, so I turned off the night dimming function, cranked the brightness up to maximum, and found a digital face without a lot of background clutter (there are 6 digitals to choose from). I would love to see a digital face with no picture in the background, just a screen with a dark color like black or blue or purple. I'm giving it 4.5 stars actually, due to the limited number of clock faces.

author: Thankful

content:
My family and I laugh a lot with this and we listen to a lot of music. I made a shopping list for what I want and one for my husband. When he goes to the store he listen to the lists writes it down now he don't forget. We Enjoy Echo Spot!
Thank You, Ava and Amazon <3

author: Fun and addictive!
