content: This product just looks adorable in any room and I love it. I recently just bought my mom one as a gift on Prime Day and she can't wait to use it.

author: Sharon Westfall
title: This one is my favorite. It's small enough to place just about anywhere
content:
I've got one of each kind of Echo except for the Echo Look. This one is my favorite. It's small enough to place just about anywhere, and I LOVE having a screen. I put this in my media room and use it to control my lights. I don't have a clock in that room, so the screen is a great way to check on the time and more. The Echo Show was just too big on my end table, but this little guy is just right.

Set up was a snap. I think it found my other Echos so it didn't need anything beyond customizing the settings. I'm not sure if the Echo still needs a smart phone to connect with your Amazon account, but they really, Really, REALLY need to fix that if they haven't already.

I find the background to be a little too dark, as I do with the Echo Show. I would like to have independent settings for background brightness and overall brightness. I'd also like to have different volume settings for media versus alarms and Alexa's voice--but that's more of an issue with the Echo Show. I would also like a LOT more customizability in being able to program Alexa's responses to my dialog. That would be a lot of fun!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Mom loves it!
content: Love it, have to my mom of 84. She loves it!

author: vera Alila Shabazz
title: I'm shocked that it is working so well since my experience with the BLINK was horrible
content: The Echo Spot is, thus far, phenomenal, I am still learning how to use it but so far I am amazed. I am using caution because I once thought the AMAZON BLINK was a fantastic product but it has turned out that I have had to go to my local channel 5 news support team for help to get satisfaction. If Echo continues as it has been then this will be a plus for AMAZON. But I would never buy another SECURITY product from AMAZON.

author: Marvin
title: Does everything the big guy dose.
content: I like it because it is small and easy to use. Good partner with the echo show, wife in one room and I in another can talk with out yelling back and forth.

author: robert drawbaugh
title: it gets the job done
content:
the radio is weak, it does not pick up on voices as well, and there is a lag when playing music or skipping songs.
it gets the job done.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Alexa Echo Spot wish it to be more smart
content: I like technology just got Echo Spot, a little disappointed with limited functionality. No Skype, have a hard time see videos. Authentication not always working out with tv providers. Clock have limited backgrounds wish it have more, choices color not like 4K clear, the size of screen is too small could be bigger cover shape.  Still figuring out what else it can do except Weather and Clock.

author: Andrew Truesdale
title: Five Stars
content: Great new amazon device in the Alexa family. Perfect for the bed side table or the office.

author: saymylastname
title: Overall very good, but a few technical issues.
content: Works great, but struggles to hear me if the window is open and I'm in bed about 7 feet away from where I put it.  If the TV is on and it's about 5 feet away from me it hears me about 90% of the time.  Sometimes the routines do not do what it's supposed to it.  Like I programmed, 'start me day' to turn on a light and start flash briefing', only the light turns on.  Somethings with Alexa in general aren't very intuitive, but I imagine in time that will improve.

author: Mark S
title: Great voice Assistant
content: This is the best Alexa device for it's price. I have the original Alexa Echo, Echo Tap and now Echo Spot. I originally wanted the Echo Show but deceided against because of its lacking You Tube. Which is my go to for Videos.

author: Jaclynn baynes
title: It’s fine
content: Part of it is my fault, I thought it could be wireless.  Though for the price, I still feel like it should be. Also the sound quality and volume could be better. I prefer the tap. Unless you really want to have the call options but today most of us have phones, computers or iPads. Just not worth it.

author: DW
title: Its a nice but expensive clock.  Doesn't bring much to the Alexa device table.
content:
Been using it for about a week.  Replaced a gen 2 echo dot that we had for a while.  Also have a full size echo in my house.

Pros:  Looks really good on a night stand.  Functional as a clock and alexa device.  Decent amount of settings and tweaks you can make (minus how you access those).  Speaker is superior to the Dot I replaced.

Cons: Screen is too small to really have any use other than a clock face.  Most skills/app are not optimized for the tiny, circular screen.  Most force a "square" picture that makes it even smaller/harder to read.  Even the weather is too hard to read to really be useful.  Also not sure if its just the zillion people who just bought one using it or what, but Alexa seems 'slower' on this device than my other echo devices.  Takes a few extra seconds to respond compared to the dot.  Not a terrible lot longer, but long enough I notice the pause.  Finally, the settings have to be access ON the device using the tiny touch screen.  This makes configuring it slightly painful, although not impossible.  Also if you want a black background with white clock face (you know, the standard for alarm clocks since forever) you have to do some major shenanigans.  I had to make an all black, square picture on MS Paint on my computer.  Upload it to my "Prime Photos" account.  Then target the Spot to my prime photos in a setting buried about 5 menu's deep on the device's tiny screen.  The picture must be in its own album on prime photos or it will try to slideshow every picture you have uploaded also.  Thats a lot of extra steps to make it look like a normal clock guys.  If you like weird backgrounds/color on your clock face they have you covered though.

author: Natalia Dziambor
title: VERY limited on day-to-day apps & activities
content: I like the concept of the Echo Spot, but some of the apps aren't really well developed with it. Like with the Ring Camera Doorbell. If someone is at my door, my Echo Spot should be able to alert me. Also, I am NOT happy about the fact that I can't sync my Apple Music or my Bose speaker with it. When it comes to buying a virtual assistant, it should be universal with apps and phones that are at the top of the market (i.e. iPhone, Apple Music, Apple Watch, Samsung, etc.) It doesn't do any good for me if I can't sync any one of the items that I use constantly to keep myself organized. I am toying with the idea of returning it.

author: Victoria Stodnick
title: Great device
content: I got this for xmas and use this next to my bed as a clock / alarm clock - it's fabulous!  LOVE it and we actually bought one for my 12 year old who loves it.

author: Tim Adams
title: Great Look!  Great device all around!
content: I am truly delighted with both of my Echo Spots.  They provide great entertainment for music and radio, serve as alarm clocks and are a source of reliable information.  I am impressed with the sound quality and they fit into my decor, seamlessly.  Thank you, Amazon for providing ongoing updates on the ever growing array of services available with Echo.

author: Grey
title: Great, but Not as a Clock
content:
I bought this one to put on the entertainment center, next to the TV. Big mistake. Although I have it set to rotate screens only once, the constant lighting changes in the room cause the Spot to frequently show the "Things to Try" screen which can't be disabled. It's distracting when watching TV and annoying when you look at the Spot for the clock and don't see it.

I "fixed" it by covering the camera with a sticker. But for something that costs as much as the Spot does, I really shouldn't have to do this. An option to always show the clock is much needed here.

author: usakvr
title: Echo Spot is pretty cool. It can do everything the Echo Dot ...
content: Echo Spot is pretty cool. It can do everything the Echo Dot can and more. It is also an alarm clock (you can change the background and face of the clock) and you can even watch videos on it (even though it is very small and you won't be watching any long clips or movies). Great for yourself and as a gift. If you gift one you can make video calls to the recipient of your 2nd Spot :-)

author: Amazon Customer
title: Echo Spot, plug
content: only problem I had is the plug in the wall took up most of the wall outlet so had to purchase a power strip just for that

author: becky
title: Mixed thoughts
content: It's hard to think of things to ask sometimes. It doesn't understand what your asking, phrasing is important seemigly. Sometimes it plays music, tells you the weather etc when you don't ask it anything. It's also irritating when your kids figure out how to use it haha!! Still a work in progress knowing how to get the most out of it.

author: jeremey muckelvaney
title: Five Stars
content: We like it alot

author: JJFlash
title: Love It
content: I love this thing. Setup was very easy, as was learning to use it. Build quality is very good. Sound quality is surprisingly good considering the size of the device and speaker. Oh yeah, as someone else commented, please give us the option to adjust the font size on the digital clock screen when using a personal photo. The default font is too small.

author: Maria M. de la Garza
title: Five Stars
content:
This is one of the greatest invention of the last 10 years.
Love everything about it.

author: Jeffrey M. Mason
title: Home automation with visual Alexa.
content: I have a 90% automated home; Insteon, Sonos, ISY, Honeywell 950 thermostats, alarm, Nexia, IFTTT and I can control all of the via Alexa.  Up to this point voice control was through Echo and Sonos.  Now with Spot it not only can control them via echos, but also spot and the visual aspects of spot are a welcome convience and will be used for my incoming Wyzecams.  Great product!

author: Justin Hosmer
title: I love this device
content: I love this device. I use it mostly as a clock/alarm clock. It still has all of the features that the echo dot has but it also shows suggestions on the screen of what to ask. The clock auto dims when it gets dark. I feel there is still some room for improvement though. When the alarm goes off, there isn’t a button to shut it off. You have to say Alexa, stop to get it to shut off. That is a bit inconvenient when your significant other gets up later than you.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Who designed a screen you can’t turn black
content: I would love this if I could turn the screen off during certain hours

author: J. Glover
title: Once there are great offers I could see purchasing additional for nightstand or ...
content: Loving this way more than google home devices. I've been using for a couple months and if you're an amazon prime subscriber the value here is greater than google. I'm using to listen to free music with prime (better than alternatives), audible and you can even watch movies. The display is a little small for lots of watching, the sound should be louder, and YOUTUBE NEEDS TO BE AVAILABLE. These issues put this at a 3.5 to 4 stars. Fix one of them (youtube) and its a 5 star item. To alleviate sound I've paired with a blue tooth speaker. Right now this sits in my living area. Where I think it will shine is my office desk. Once there are great offers I could see purchasing additional for nightstand or other Amazon Alexa items for my household. I felt happy after adding this to my house where as I felt stupid using google home.

author: Patricia White
title: Great tool!
content: We have purchased 4 Alexa products total and love them all. I love that the spot has a screen and it makes the perfect bedside clock. We go to sleep listening to soothing sounds on our spot every night.  My granddaughter loves telling Alexa what music to play for her.

author: C. Barnett
title: Be aware of a malfunction with wi-fi will render Alexa inoperable.
content: It is just what I wanted to replace an old alarm clock.  I really like the way the alarm system  wakes you gently. Then it's the news, word of the day, history and finally weather!

author: Mike Morton
title: Welcome to the future!
content: Another Echo doing wonders for me. I would have never thought a few years ago that I would simply speak “watch a movie” and all of my lighting would come on and automatically dim to 10% and my receiver, Firestick, and TV would come on and go to the correct inputs. Welcome to the future! I’m extremely delighted with the Spot. I have no use for the copies...Google and Apple. Alexa started it all!

author: Dorothy Tressler
title: I love this spot
content: I love this spot. The Sleep sounds is great to put a crying baby to sleep. I like to use the clock in the middle of the nigh. So glad I got this.

author: C J Campbell
title: Just exactly what I needed
content: My favorite Echo. A more than adequate replacement for a clock radio.

author: KiWiSouP
title: It does the job, but...
content:
This was my first Echo device. I got it for my bedroom and it works great as an alarm clock and Alexa device.

One of the most notably features is the screen which adds extra functionality over the standard audio-only Echo devices. It displays time, supports video calls, touch input, Amazon Prime Video, etc. Because the screen is circular video is cropped, zoomed in, or both.

I bought an Echo Dot (3rd Gen) as my second device and I realized a few things which are surprising considering the Dot is the cheapest device by far. One is that the range the Dot can hear me exceeds my Spot... I've been right next to the Spot and had the Dot answer me from the other room instead. Second is the speaker on the Dot is much better than the Spot. I know the newest Dot has improved audio but I've always been under the impression that the Spot was better and that's not the case at all. Last, the Dot responds to commands that the Spot doesn't know. For instance I can say turn off all devices and the Dot does this and the Spot instead says "there is no device called 'all devices'". Really perplexing...

author: Brettano
title: I like it
content: I liked the idea of a smart alarm clock and I was not disappointed. A tad of a learning curve to understand all it's features.

author: Jay J Couzins
title: Purchased 5 Spots to upgrade Dots
content:
Move over dot, I have spot.
Best nightstand alarm clock
Great at my desk for video calls
Great at my office to check in at home

author: barbara
title: Telling Alexa home screen and how not to always rotate the top 3 or 4 things
content:
I Love it added to my 3 echo dots so now my little home  can play my music on all 4 echo devices. The  spot shows like a little TV  you can see recipes, news, song lyrics it’s a fun and great assy
I put mine in kitchen.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best clock u will ever own
content: First amazon product I ever bought and I love it! my morning and night routines are better with my spot; I’m able to do so much with this tiny thing it added a big convince to my life.

author: Jorge González M.
title: great article, thanks
content: incredible Alexa with touch screen, great article, thanks Amazon

author: Richard Wiley
title: Great!!!!
content: Bought the echo spot and wyze camera as a package deal. Wife loves the spot. We set the camera up in the living room so we say “Alexa show me the living room”, and she pulls it right up. My wife was very excited over this whole setup. The spot is great and so are the wyze cam v2 cameras. I highly recommend both. Cameras are easy as hell to setup, have great picture quality and easy to hide.

author: AdrienneR
title: and works better. Also wish I could have clock display in ...
content: This Alexa has an attitude. She says I’m having difficulties, try later. I have another Alexa’s (the display), and works better. Also wish I could have clock display in digital.

author: porky
title: Five Stars
content: Cute little device for the adult.... sold my Dot and bought a Spot !!!!

author: Amazon Luv'r
title: Five Stars
content: Perfect for small spaces, easy to read yet not overbearing.

author: R. Jenkins
title: An insomniac's dream!
content:
I am so happy to have made the decision to get this. I attended a health and wellness seminar and they talked about the importance of sleep and not having devices near you. Now it's going to seem ironic to talk about a device that's on my nightstand, but is very different than reaching for your phone. I have programmed my Alexa app to set an alarm every morning and when I wake up I tell it to start my day. Alexa gives me the weather and my flash news briefing that I have set up to customize for my area. I synced up my Spotify premium account and my audible books. My Prime shopping orders I can just speak into the phone and I can call up Prime videos or music as well.

However, as I've had trouble sleeping these days in the middle of the night while I'm laying there in bed I just turned to my Alexa and ask her to play me a guided meditation. Some nights I asked her to play me an ocean sound playlist and set a timer on that for 15 minutes as I fall asleep. This is been really really helpful. The video on it is clear and I love the clock face. I am not using it so much as a speaker for my music, however I find it to be very good to just play music while I get ready. The true magic comes and how you can program Alexa to do the things that you want, but with spot you get to see video of your favorite things that you'd like to see as well. And lastly, it's super cute sitting on my nightstand.

author: Christopher Chaos
title: Feel it will get a lot better over time
content: Its pretty cool. I dont use it all the time. Just for some tasks but i feel like this will get better as people create more smart things and it will be able to do a lot more over time. Currently im just using it regularly in my home office to turn on or off my Hue lights, play music and listen to the top headlines. It would be a cool alarm clock in my bedroom but its just to pricey for something id rarely use in my bedroom. I feel its best for an office or living room or maybe some who is in the kitchen a lot cooking.

author: SuperJenn
title: This is my Magic Ball!!!
content: I am in love! This is the greatest product I've purchased this year. Laying in bed I just tell Alexa to add odds and ends to my lists. I play music from my Amazon music account playlists. If I want to see something quick or even check lyrics of a song, they are displayed. I love the different clock faces and alarms. This is a magic ball!

author: Wendy B
title: Awesome!!
content:
I love this echo spot! To be able to see things on a screen is great!  The clock is dim at night...u can set that.  I see words of songs when streaming music, I can put my own background image on it, Looks cool, great size for my end table.
Yes, it shows trending things but it goes back to the clock often.  Not a deal breaker...you get so much more out of it.  Speaker is decent but I would use Fabriq for better sound.
I play sounds for meditation and so much more! Love it!

author: WeeZ
title: Love this Gal!
content: She makes my everyday! I am up to date on the weather, news and my favorite tunes - just to mention a few of her many talents! She is right on time for the "Year of the Woman" and I get a information fact each morning when we connect! Good morning Alexa!

author: Mike Ebert
title: Very easy setup!!
content: Replaced our alarm clock. Love it

author: Chrissy T.
title: Love it!
content:
I took advantage of the trade-in promotion and turned in my 1st gen Echo for a new Echo Spot and I love it! Being able to have a visual instead of just a speaker was nicer than I thought. Obviously being a lot smaller than my old echo, I was also worried that the sound for this Spot wouldn't be as good, but so far I haven't noticed any significant sound differences. That being said, I'm not the type of person to play music super loud or with a heavy base, so it may or may not handle more extreme sounds just fine. THE ONLY CON I'VE ENCOUNTERED SO FAR is that I find it slightly annoying that for certain actions or commands, once I'm done I have to tell it to go back to the home screen, it won't change back automatically. But to say "Alexa, home screen" takes two seconds and is not enough for me to knock down my rating to four stars.
BOTTOM LINE:  I'm happy with my Echo Spot!

author: schutrop
title: both of my kids LOVE it and so do I
content: both of my kids LOVE it and so do I.  I travel so i can drop in on them ... they don't have phones, too young

author: Kindle Customer
title: We have been very happy with our echo spot so far
content: We have been very happy with our echo spot so far.  It has many great features we love and we seem to use it frequently. I love being able to connect and view my Ring Video Doorbell on the screen. We also purchased the buttons to be able to play games.. we are a little disappointed in the games that are available to use with it, especially for the kids.  I hope they have more available soon. Overall we are pleased and I think it has been worth the price we paid.

author: JuanGrande386
title: Now I can be even lazier!
content: With the combination of this, smart plugins, and the Alex app I can turn stuff on and off with my phone or telling Alexa to do it. I can order stuff, get answers, watch videos, get weather, set alarms, video call, and so much more with this device!

author: Wattsan
title: Five Stars
content: Love it!!!

author: Porsche Whitfield
title: Good investment.
content: I love my echo spot. I changed the name due to watching youtube getting some tips and tricks. For the future I'm going to pick up some smart plugs to get my ac, tv, and lights to come on with my voice. Plus if I want to order something from Amazon I can do it with the echo spot and not have to whip out my phone to place an order.

author: Derrick Holbrooks
title: Really neat device.
content:
Sound quality is better than echo dot. Makes a good beside alarm clock. Really needs 24 hour time format, though.

Update: now supports 24 hour format

author: Tony Johnson
title: Looks great, I think I need more time to make it do what I think it can or should
content: still have not figured this device out.  really like some of the features.  When connecting to all of my other amazon devices to play music throughout the house, it will disconnect the dots from blue tooth speakers and play on its little speaker.  Works great with my original echo for this.  For some reason after adding this device, Other echo dots loose network.  I think I have too many too close to each other and it seems to overwhelm the system.  I thought I would be able to launch apps on this device and watch Netflix or Sling TV like the fire TV, if you can I have not figured it out.  To view my cameras, I was able to connect one of the camera apps to Alexa app but can not "show me" this camera.  I probably need to sit down and try to figure this out, just thought it would have been more user friendly and less putsy to have everything work together.  Looks great, sounds good and the lyrics for music is really fun!  Can't wait till a few more family members connect to try video calls, but I could never seem to get Alexa to work for this feature very well on the old devices.

author: Sophie
title: Love the Spot!
content:
I love this little guy. Bought the white one.... looks great on my nightstand.

The little screen is actually pretty useful and the speaker is very clear.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great product
content: I love all the echo products.  Highly recommend them!

author: Chari L. Liming
title: Fun to play with, great alarm clock
content: Mainly used for an alarm clock. The only thing I don’t like about it is if the WiFi is down, it won’t respond to me

author: Pilly
title: Estupendo
content: Estupendo equipo

author: Bryan L.
title: I hope they add some larger digital displays or a better analog. The other thing that's a plus is ...
content: Only used a little. Primarily use as an alarm clock. On the plus side it dims well with light conditions. On the negative side the options for clock faces are limited and is hard to read at a distance. I hope they add some larger digital displays or a better analog. The other thing that's a plus is during song play it provides the words, which corrects many misunderstandings. Other than that the usual Alexa stuff I become so dependent upon.

author: Huntsman
title: Very good quality works very well
content: Works well but I still have a lot to learn on the skills. Very satisfied very good qualityVery good quality works very well. It picks up my voice amazingly well

author: SKW
title: Great addition to the bedroom!
content: Love this little addition to the Echo lineup! My husband wanted a clock that he could read in the middle of the night and I didn't want to give up the convenience of having Alexa bedside to lull us to sleep, so I bought the Spot! Easy to set up, love the ability to add a family picture to the clock face, and it is very compact. I moved my other Echo into the kitchen where I can conveniently tell Alexa what to add to my shopping list.

author: andrei
title: connectivity problems
content: awful device with wifi and blue tooth connectivity issues. Who needs $129 clock?

author: Sy Wafflewitz
title: Has far exceeded my expectations
content: Has far exceeded my expectations. To me this is the perfect little device. Awesome alarm clock and a thousand other things.  Very surprised how easy it is to watch full screen video on it.  Also, a blast to play Jeopardy with text of questions visible.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Pointless?
content: Not entirely sure what to do with it but its kinda cool, I guess

author: M J
title: Not as adverstised
content: Purchased the Ring Video Doorbell 2 bundle with the Echo Spot. My issue is with the Ring Video Doorbell, it states clearly on the packaging and I quote "Connects to Your Existing Chime" this is false and misleading. The only way it connects is if you have a hard wired Door Bell, I have currently have a Wireless Door Bell and thus am unable to have my Ring Video Door Bell ring inside my home, unless I purchase The Ring Chime, which is an additional $ 29.99. This is a SCAM and clearly in not intentionally mis-leading. What good is a Door Bell if you have to sleep with your iPhone in order to see who is at the door, great when you're not at home, but that's not the issue here. I give this a negative 5 Star review, also Ring Customer support doesn't do a good job, as soon as you get on the phone after waiting 20 minutes you're not allowed to ask a question, they ask a whole bunch of questions to verify I own the Ring device. I mean why else would I be calling. Do not purchase this if you want it to ring inside your home as well as appear on your smart phone. Unfortunately this site in order to submit a review dictates you have to give at least 1 Star, this product as sold and as it currently performs is not worthy of 1 Star.

author: Ruth
title: Really nice as a bedside clock/alarm
content: Got the echo spot to replace an aging, failing clock radio.  Love it, so easy to set and love that it can be set so it goes dark when the lights are turned off.

author: Reviews4U
title: Alexa has a face!
content: Alexa is my girl!  I had the dot and this is much better with the display.  I would order again for sure if I needed to.

author: Danielle Humphrey
title: Good tech move for Amazon
content: Bought this for myself to keep in touch with family. It’s easy and enjoyable for my dad to use who hates cellphones. Oh, and you can turn off the drop in feature!

author: Victoria
title: Best investment!
content: I’ve had this for a little over 3 weeks now and I absolutely love it! It’s so easy to use. I’m basically using it as a smart alarm but it can do way more. The screen quality is great and it looks super cute sitting on my night stand. I don’t know how I lived without it so long. If you can’t decide whether to buy it or not, GO FOR IT! You won’t regret it!!

author: DoctorDoctorK
title: The perfect bedside companion
content: This is the best replacement for an alarm clock -- the display makes it useful day or night, and it has all the usual Alexa functionality for turning on and off lights, music, etc. before going to bed -- and playing some "go to sleep" music, too...before waking one up in the morning!

author: R. Grabowsky
title: An Excellent Device For Our Kitchen
content: This Echo is an addition to our growing stable of Echos. It started with the original, then came the Tap, followed by the Show. Each of them fits into a different portion of our home. The original is in our bedroom and provides the news as we dress as well as music at other times. The Tap resides in our family room during these winter months, but is our patio and screened porch unit in warmer days. The Show is in the den where we watch TV, read or just hang out. It has become somewhat of our casual entertainment device - music while we read or search the web and answering questions about current, past events or just trivia. We enjoy viewing the occasional movie trailer and family/vacation photos. Then came the Spot. It is a perfect addition to the kitchen and resides on a shelf above the sink. My wife enjoys music while she works and the timer feature which is a convenient addition to the ones in the microwave and the stove. It is particularly useful for some recipes. We have occasionally used the Show and the Spot for calls to our daughter's Echo and cell phone. She lives about five miles from our home. To sum it up. the Spot is perfect for our kitchen. It is the right size, has a reasonable speaker and fits our lifestyle. Next is the workshop?

author: L. J. Young
title: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️ Echo Spot!!
content: I so love this little powerhouse!  So much better than an Echo Dot!  The screen makes the difference.  The perfect size to sit on my nightstand.  And Alexa looks great there.  I love the way she wakes me up gently. And the sound is better than a dot, but not quite as good as a regular Echo. I paired her with a TP plug so she turns my light off every night.  Those with kids will appreciate the fact that Alexa obeys immediately,and never talks back or says she’s too busy.  I need to buy another to replace the Dot in my kitchen.  Did I mention that I love this thing/lady?  The geek in me is very happy!

author: Robert A. Guertin
title: This item is awesome leap into time keeping and overall functionality
content: This item is awesome leap into time keeping and overall functionality. You could say it's an Echo Dot with more brains. Well worth the price.

author: Tina B.
title: Dissappointed
content: I dont like that when u put in appra she dont talk back and remind u of them it just shows them my husband has severe sleep apnea and that's the reason I bought t him is

author: Loralie7492
title: Small But Mighty
content:
I love this little Spot more than I thought I would. The sound is great for such a little thing...my music plays nice and loud and clear. The video is terrific...I was watching some Prime shows just for the heck of it, and I was really impressed. Immediately convinced my mom to buy my sister one for her birthday!

Only thing that kept me from giving it 5 stars...I really wish it was cordless. I love having it in my kitchen but trying to find a place to plug it in is a pain. And it won’t connect to my Bluetooth speaker while playing Amazon Prime Music for some reason, which is a drag when I want to hear it in the dining room during dinner. Of course, if it was CORDLESS I could just bring it with me...otherwise, I absolutely love it and will probably buy another one!

author: SideKicks Cafe
title: Nice way to get information
content: I love the size and the price was right where I wanted to be. The screen is small but overall for something I use in my kitchen to do hands free things, this is a great device. Overall sound could be better but overall a great purchase for what it is..

author: D.C.A.
title: A good clock, not a great speaker.
content: It's okay. The sound is pretty much on par with what I was expecting. Not very bass-y, a little tin-y. The display is nice and bright during the day, and dim at night during Do Not Disturb. My biggest issue with it though is that if I have it on Night Mode, if I ask Alexa a question, the screen goes from Night Mode to regular eye searing brightness and doesn't go back to Night Mode. Seems like a pretty glaring omission to me.

author: Emma
title: Highly recommend
content: Love this device! Easy to connect and just super cool

author: Lisa
title: Lacking background options
content: The time on the weather/time background is too small. Also, lame background options.

author: Tara Raven
title: Fo with the dot not the spot!
content: I also loving my echo dots but not loving this echo spot. The echo spots microphone works like crap compared to the dots. You have to be right in front of it for anyone to really hear you. I will not buy or recommend this echo spot but highly recommend the dots!

author: Monica
title: ABSOLUTELY FUN
content: This is the second one I bought. I kept the first and gave the 2nd one as a gift. Great for having to make an urgent call and you can't reach your phone. It does so much you'll have to do your research before you get started. I love the unlimited Amazon music for a small monthly price.

author: LaShumbra
title: Enjoying my Spot!
content: It's so cool!

author: New PL user
title: voice recognition is good. Speaker is ok
content: Setup took about 10 minutes including unpacking. voice recognition is good. Speaker is ok, but we don't use it mainly for music. Being able to see some information on the screen is very helpful for certain queries. We like being able to customize the screen. We currently use it for our bedroom alarm clock and to give commands for lights, heating, locking doors etc.

author: Abigail Carnahan
title: Ask a question
content: Love it ! Good product. Lots of information on how to use it. Easy installation! Works great.

author: MJ
title: If you are looking for a monitor, don’t waste your money!
content: We bought this to use with our Alexa-enabled camera so we could have something at the bedside to keep an eye and ear on our daughter. However the Spot times out and goes back to the home screen. I will be returning it because this was the sole reason I purchased it.

author: Walter
title: Five Stars
content: From all the Alexa devises I owe, this is my favored.

author: SDGLAMGRL
title: Lovin' it!
content: Love it!  I have an Echo Dot......and added this to it!  Am enjoying learning how to use it and about the features.  Got it on sale, so honus!  😎

author: Ehsan Shabahang
title: Must have item for any home
content:
I love the new AMAZON SPOT, truly this item is fantastic, and cam makes life so much easier. I have been using Alexa for a while now and using her is kind of second nature to me. Every morning she will read my news that I have selected inform me about the weather and give me all the details that I need to now. And NOW I can drop in and make phone call see my dog or talk to my family if I have to. THIS IS AWESOME

I understand that many media communities have stated that the "Drop-in" feature of the Echos is a bit "creepy" and I can see their points. However; Here is a different perspective. My Grandmom is now about 95 years old, and she has a short-term memory, she is in high spirits though I really can't teach her anything technical, such as using a phone or pressing a memory dial. So what can she do in an emergency situation or if I need to make sure she takes her medication.

Therefore I say with an extreme gratitude to Amazon that, Thank You Amazon for this for all the time that you have put in to create such a fantastic item and making my Grandmom happy.

I Personally am enjoying all of the other amazing features of an Alexa with an addition of the screen, using her with all my daily need and making my home automated. Amazon Spot is absolutely a quite a fantastic platform. In my house, I have added a Pioneer bookshelf stereo system so that I can be listening to Spotify and Pandora. From now all I have to say is "Alexa, connect to Bluetooth," the stereo Bluetooth will get enabled with that command, the Spot will wake up the Pioneer, and start playing the sound.

THIS IS MAGICAL

author: James
title: Mini Show, Max Fun
content: Love it so far, still figuring out skills and routines which will make it rock.

author: Ryan
title: Great for Arlo cameras
content: We got this integrated with our Arlo security cameras. Love how we can ask to view a camera at any time. We own both google home and Alexa devices and we prefer Alexa. Just easier to use and more intuitive.

author: Rattler77
title: Spot On
content: I did a lot pf reading about how to set up the Echo Spot and have had nothing but great results, it stays a clock unless I change it. I can use it to play music from my show in another room. Touch control or voice control alarm. Glad I got it. Also worked with all of my other home automation once connected.

author: David
title: SPOT
content: Got it and, as expected, ITS GREAT! Almost a swell as my SHOW.

author: Bonnie
title: I love it! It’s a good alarm clock.

The downside however is the audio quality, it’s fairly decent but can be a meh at most times. I suggest getting a decent speaker and connect it just to get a good bass, cause this has none, but the display makes up for it. This isn’t really a good platform to watch videos with.

I also have Echo Show in the Kitchen, Echo Dot in the den, and Original Echo in the family room. author: Jose B Ayala
title: Echo spot

author: FUEL DOG
title: Its cool but my problem is I am using it as ...
content: Its cool but my problem is I am using it as an alarm clock but at night you can not see the time. Which sucks because if I wake uo during the night I would like to see the time.

author: Gene Mona
title: One Of My Favorite Amazon Devices!!
content: I use this as my clock on my night stand! I love the display and the ease of setting an alarm. Also I can get any info I need. Traffic, Weather, Sports Scores! I love it!!

author: Jennie Borum
title: It's a great size for a nightstand
content: It's a great size for a nightstand.  I love that I can just ask Alexa a question and she responds.  I do wish there were more clock choices.

author: Noodle
title: Numbers small - No Black background option - Snooze time doesn't work for me.
content:
I had high hopes for using my new Spot, but after one night of using this little Spot is going back. First of all, it was very annoying to not clearly see the time - I had the largest red numbers available. Then, on an illuminated gray background it made it even harder to see the time. I literally had to pick it up and look at it.

Then the issue of snooze. If you say "Alexa snooze" it snoozes for 9 minutes - they need another snooze time.

All in all the unit was a bit smaller in physical size than I had anticipated. I feel bummed out that it didn't meet my expectations.
1) Needs to have LARGER numbers.
2) Needs to have the ability to have a solid BLACK clock (night) background (as a choice)
3) Needs snooze options - 9 minutes doesn't cut it for me.

I'm going back to using my old Sony box clock. It may be ugly, but at least I can clearly see the time from wherever I am, day or night.

EDIT: If Echo developers solve these issues I'll be ordering again in a heartbeat.

author: CAROL LILICK
title: Great buy
content: One of the best devices I ever bought highly recommended

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: Works well -still learning about it. Should prove to helpful.

author: Delia A. Jones

I already have the Echo 2nd generation with smart speaker and I love that one. I decided to try the Echo Spot by my bed and move the other one to our family room.
The Spot does everything the regular one does but it also has a glass screen and I have my favorite picture as home screen. The sound is fantastic, I love the sleek design and super easy to adjust settings with the touch screen.
My sis loves using Alexa in family room to order pizza, groceries, Amazon Prime shopping and reminders :-)

author: sandra merritt
title: echo spoy
content: love it and learning more fun things about it everyday

author: golfaholic
title: Fun? Yes
content: Have to admit, the breath of knowledge is slim, especial with older topics that are a matter of record. " How many children did Bob Marley have?" Not able to answer. Also, linked to my Pandora account, not my Pandora Premium. Fun? Yes. As good as my smart phone? Not even close.

author: Andy
title: Nothing to say
content: Love it, plan on buying smart plugs soon, and thoese fancy smart lights!

author: Crubin
title: great alarm clock
content: Works great by the bedside - easy to set alarms and auto-dimming in the dark, along with all other regular features. I can ask it my schedule and the weather before even opening my eyes in the morning.

author: Blaze91991
title: MUST BUY device for automation

author: Robert Damiani Jr
title: Everyone should have one!
content: I love this smart gadget! So much, I bought one for my parents, my son I. The military and my GF. We are all connected now too via Drop In which is pretty cool - it’s like face time.  I personally live the “sleep sounds” Alexa offers and I sleep much better with a continuous loop of the night forest sounds one of favorites amounts many and I wake up to the alarm I easy set just by asking.  News briefings and weather is also a feature I use regularly.  Everyone should have one!

author: Gabriel Johnson
title: I like it, but...
content:
So it's an Alexa enabled alarm clock.  All of the previous reviews have pretty much captured the ups and downs.  I'm here to tell you (and Amazon) what this thing needs to become closer to perfect.

1. A repeating alarm - The Spot needs to allow you to set an alarm for multiple events.  Example: "Computer, set an alarm for 4AM Monday- Friday."  Also the ability to turn that saved alarm on or off in case of a day off from work or whatever.

2. 24-Hour Clock display - Some people (like me) just prefer it.  Also would make it more user friendly in some other countries perhaps?

3. Ability to choose your Home screen - I would like my Spot to display the Clock/Weather combo screen all of the time except in night mode.  I stopped the scrolling "Things to Try" abomination, but in order to see the info I want I still have to swipe the screen over.

4. More clock face options/font size selections - Make it a little easier to see the time at night or from across the room; without having the menus be oversized for the screen.

5. Battery backup - Alarm clocks are no good with the power out...

6. USB power - Why is this thing not powered by a USB like nearly every other thing on the planet now?  At the very least give me a USB out so I can charge something else from it while this thing sucks up an outlet.

Bonus: A wake up light - Something like the Philips sunrise alarm clock.  A wake up light that gradually increases in brightness as part of your alarm would put this little device over the top for me.  While I'm not naïve enough to believe that the little LCD screen could reproduce that sunrise effect, I think I would still be a beneficial add on for those that like it or may have used it previously.

Overall for me, I like it.  But I'm still in the honeymoon phase as well... We'll see if I stick with it, or go back to my old way and relegate this to be a very expensive Echo Dot somewhere else in the house.

***UPDATE*** I have figured out that once you set an alarm on the Spot, you can go into the app and adjust the alarm settings to recur for weekdays, weekends, etc.  You just can't set the recurrence with voice... yet?

author: Ciprian Popa
title: Classy gadget that guys will love! I do!
content: I was kind of worried about buying it. I was wondering if I had just purchased a high-end alarm clock. The sound (for its size) is unbelievable! I ADORE the Echo Spot. The features, the quality, and its general look are all worth it. I have mine placed on my TV. Echo Spot will even open the show you want on HULU. If you're a guy who loves gadgets then this is a must-have! I love this little thing so much. Plus it connects to my Echo Dots and plays music in all rooms simultaneously. Screams class!! You can even find a screen saver to match your furniture like I did in my photo!

author: Tlk
title: Works great
content: Arrived as expected. Worked great . Easy bvb set up

author: Frank L. Bobo

content: This is a great Echo. The flexibility, the technology, the usefulness, the ease of use, the ease of set-up. You cannot go wrong with this.I think I will buy 2 more.

author: Desrine salmon
title: Not for me.
content: Ok to start she never alarm although I set it for daily 2 days and that was it expected more from it sorry cant five her 5 stars,

author: Rita Edwards
title: Amazon Echo Spot
content: Love this Amazon Spot! I replaced my old radio DVD player.

author: f105av8r

content: The Echo Spot is compact and well made. It was easy to setup and to link to Spotify. The view screen is small and difficult to see from more than a few feet away. The sound is not as good as the full size Echo but is still adequate.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great add on
content: Like the design. Works fine. Sometimes a lag in resoonse. Have hooked up to lights—love that feature.

author: B
title: My most used Alexa device
content: Echo Spot replaced my twenty year old alarm clock. I was initially concerend about its display light being turned on 24/7, but it hasn’t really bothered me once the device was set to dim mode. Aside from its clock function, I use Spot to control Spotify, Sengled light, Nest thermometer, Ring doorbell, and Samsung robot vacuum. Spot’s speaker may not be as loud as Echo’s, but I personally find it the most versatile Alexa device in my arsenal yet.

author: Mike M
title: Great for smart home
content: This Echo Spot ties my Ring products, hue lights and thermostat into one smart hub. This is a great product and I couldn't be happier. I only wish I could keep the weather on all the time instead of breaking news or trending topics being shown.

author: Andrew
title: Meh
content: Not a great alarm clock.  It should be so easy to set an alarm and turn it off when it goes off.  Good luck doing that with this.  I thought I could just chain this to the rest of my smart home system.  Nope.  Sound quality is ok.  But geez it relies way to heavily on voice commands and not enough interface for touch commands.  I literally threw this thing across the room twice trying to get the alarm shut off in the morning.  Just kept going to snooze.  Also, no need for a camera since this thing clearly belongs in a bedroom.  Amazon just needs to work on obvious stuff with these Echo devices.  Not there yet.

author: Buttercup
title: Unhappy
content:
Edit to add: I’m upping my review from one to three stars, because although my spot did stop working within five months, and at least one of the three customer service reps I online chatted with straight out lied to me, in the end, a different customer service rep contacted me by phone and email and came through with the good amazon customer service I have experienced over the years.

Original post:
Got my spot in December and it was immediate love. Five months later, it’s quit working. Not happy. Not happy with customer service. I was lied to by customer service, first they said it needed thirty minute software update. An hour and forty five minutes later, it still didn’t work. Contacted customer service again. Now they said, oh, yes software updated. I checked. Still has the same number. I made timed screen shots before and after, the same number. They forwarded me to technical person.  I confirmed I had restarted and reset to factory and still it didn’t work. So they are going to send me new device. But not until I mail old one back. Seriously? I will mail tomorrow they will get it at best on Wednesday. They will have to check that it is really broken. That will take a day or two. Then they will mail replacement. That will take another few days to get here, so all told at least a week to replace. Probably longer. And this is the thanks I get after I have purchased at least five echos for my house, given others as gifts, and have encouraged friends and family to join the amazon ecosystem. Well I’m having another think about that now. Google Home, I will be looking at you.

author: Brian Pressman
title: It is ok... but stupid "things to try" can not be shut off
content: We like the Echo Spot except for one very ANNOYING feature-- the home screen has a "things to try" screen that keeps rotating through.  It seems you can not turn it off.  Sorry Amazon but I don't really want to see your stupid suggestions.  Why won't you allow a user to customize the screen to remove this?

author: Loretta Alvarez
title: Awesome

author: J. Wobser

The camera  normally costs $25 without the purchase of the Echo Spot, but even at that price, it is well worth it.

Asking Alexa for the time in the dark is easier than rolling over, and squinting at the clock.

For anyone investing in the Amazon ecosystem, I recommend this.  That said, if you are a Youtube watcher, you may want to avoid the FireTV and Echo Show since Youtube is no longer supported.  The Spot is too small to watch Youtube on so lack of it did not volor my review.

author: Beach Girl

author: Calv

content:

Edit: Amazon reached out to me with what seemed like an automated response of “Sorry you gave us a one star review, perhaps you’re not using the device correctly?”
I still like the for the clock and the weather, but I don’t need to constantly be told new things that Alexa can do on my home screen.

One feature I really like is how it slowly dims after I turn off my bedroom light, so I have a night light for a bit. I love Echo devices and have just about run out of places to put them!

Alexa understands worse than the echo.

author: Danielle Llanes
title: Best way to communicate with loved ones
content: I love my Echo Spot. When I moved 1500 miles away from home, I wanted to stay in contact with my family. This was the best thing to purchase. Does everything my Echo Dot does and then some. Love the new features - love the suggestions for things to ask Alexa. Enjoying the Amazon Radio feature as well. I’m sure the possibilities are endless with what Alexa can do...also picked up a TP Link and liked how I can adjust lamps with it and my Echo Spot.

author: Danno
title: Take the Plunge and Purchase and start learning the way of the Future!
content: Yes, Its a learning curve, but one in which after purchasing it, can learn more about what it can do and the possibilities of much more. I elieve it will take a while to learn and it will be a continued learning experience, but this is the way the world will go, automation, AC/Heath, Lights, Smart Home and More. Please with it so far.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Works well and is fun.
content:
It's awesome!  Do I use for more than asking the time and the weather and maybe the daily news?  Not really.  But it's cool.  Someday I may try to connect with a friend or family member and use the built in video calling.  I would, however, like it if you could just use it to do a photo slideshow.  I don't think you can do that without the clockface being in front of it, but I could be wrong.

One gripe would be it's not like Google; you can't ask it anything and get an answer.  But it's still cool.

author: Harlin
title: Great for Elderly parents
content: Put this unit in my moms room so I can drop in on her and if she fell she could just yell to Alexa to call me.  Not to mention she can control her lights which gives her a sense of independence as that is one less thing she has to ask for help with.  This device is used daily in our house, we love it.

author: Roxanne
title: No good intructions to  see any one.
content: Bought this so when I talked to my mom I could see her and we cant and my brother in law is good with computers and says the instuctions are not good and he is still trying to figure out

author: Miguel
title: Throw your table clock away
content: Echo spot,great item.will by more for the rest of my family.Like everything about it.

author: Cookie
title: Sleek and great looking!
content: I keep this next to my bed.  It acts as Alexa, clock and will show short videos. I need to learn how to access more of the features..

author: Nivia E. Garriga
title: Very accurate. Nice design. Love it
content: I love it.  The light combination in the clock face is very nice. When the lights are turned off it dims doesnt disturb your sleep. I haven't got it to work with my ring video yet but it's supposed to be compatible.  I also got the stand for the echo spot and is very nice. Now I have to get one for my granddaughter this Christmas.  She fell in love with mine.

author: S. Cooper
title: Dot works as well if not better.
content: The drop in feature just doesnt seem to work well even though its with in about 8' of my router. Otherwise i like it and the whole family enjoys using it. I like our dot better and its much cheaper.

author: Individual-1
title: works great so far
content: works great so far, i think the price is a bit high considering it's just a dot with a touch screen, but can't complain otherwise. i bought it for my mom to swap out with her old alarm clock, she loves it

author: BCH
title: Nice screen. Not crying over the youtube loss
content:
Very responsive.  Nice screen.  Not crying over the youtube loss, cause that just hasn't affected my life that much.  Works awesome as an alarm clock, music player for the bedroom, making video calls, displaying photo slide shows, games.  Don't care about a camera being in my bedroom, maybe I should, but don't.  Guess I could throw a towel over it if it is particularly cold in my room.

Overall a really great device, and most importantly, a FUN device.  Yes there' are things it doesn't do, and no device is perfect, but this is a very fun device to have and it is very useful as well.

author: Craig L.
title: it works
content:
It's ok, just haven't use its features that much, yet
Video and camera worked well when I was communicating with my son from California

author: Rava
title: It's a clock radio and so so much more!
content: Its a clock radio with everything else you need to know.  It entertains you, makes calls, is a secretary, answers questions, asks questions, plays games, music and lots more.  I think everyone needs one.

author: TaoZeta
title: Simple to use, fun to use, and it adds even more practical functionality to my life...
content:
I purchased an Echo Plus last year and, like most people, have really enjoyed the extra level of functionality and geekiness it's added to my life. At first, I thought this might just be a novelty item of sorts but I quickly found many uses and applications for the Echo. I keep the Echo in my main living area which is quite a distance from my bedroom, and didn't think the Echo Plus would fit on my night stand. So, when I saw the Spot advertised, I immediately saw that this would solve the problem. And it has.

It has all of the functionality that the Echo has and fits easily on the nightstand. It has taken over many of the previous functions of several different products such as alarm clock, sleep aid music player, etc. While I agree that the speaker is not as good as the Echo, it is more than adequate for my purposes. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a very functional, high tech, well thought-out, easy-to-use, bedside or office desk, smart gadget.

author: GiaJuly
title: Multifunctional Alexa EchoSpot reads bedtime stories for adults!!
content: Really love Echo Spot: it plays my Audible books, with sleep timer! Wakes me up to SiriusXM stations. Tells me time in middle of night. Interface between various podcast players could use some work, however so far this is one of the best products I've purchased this year. (4 stars due to podcast snags only)

author: Sue Perry
title: Fun to use... works well...
content: Love this... I like dropping in on my distant family.

author: A.C. Alongi
title: Alexa helps you with mathematics, no extra skill needed.
content: Alexa help me in so many things! Reminders, lists, maths. I have an Alexa device in every room!

author: Mooret1979
title: Awesome device
content: Awesome product.  Great replacement for my echo Dot.

author: Daniel Galvez Lopez
title: Cool
content: Great product!

author: Brian
title: Five Stars
content: I was surprised how much i use the little screen but it works great

author: Richard Taft
title: Good Alexa, bad screen
content:
As an Alexa device, it works just as well as any of the other products.  Unfortunately it doesn't go up from there.  The ability to play videos is very limited.  You CAN NOT play YouTube and when you can play a video the cropping of the screen makes it look very strange. There is quite a selection of clock faces, and you can control what is displays with one glaring and VERY ANNOYING exception.  You can't turn off the "Things to try" screen You can turn off the screen scroll, but that defeats the purpose of having the screen.  I don't need to be reminded every 5 seconds what things I can do with Alexa.  I don't need the advertising, especially at the cost of this device. Just a couple of more things to add.  The stand (That little .50 bit of plastic they sell for $20) dosn't come with the unit. Why??? Let the purchaser decide if they want to use it or not.  Lastly there absolutely should be a Physical way to override the camera on ANY product that comes with one. They promote this as an in home/bedroom appliance, you should be able, with absolute conference, be able to know the camera can not see anything.  Yes you can disable the camera in the software, but that can be remotely overridden.  Overall, its an expensive Alexa device with a screen that's not very useful and annoying.  I would not recommend this until the Amazon people get their act together and come up with a screen that's actually useful.

**UPDATE** 7/31/18 I was contacted by a member of the review department at Amazon.  He was very polite, present to talk to, and concerned about my low rating of the product.  He was very willing to hear my thoughts, that actually brought up a couple of more issues I had thought of and added above.  He also offered to have their development people speak with me and see if there was something that could be done.  I welcomed that very much.  So we will see if anything actually happens.  I due encourage you all that have purchased this product to submit a well thought out review and express exactly what you like and what you done't. Maybe we can make this a better product

author: Logan
title: Great addition to a Alexa home!
content: Sound is fantastic for listening to music while cooking or a podcast in your home office. Screen is good size for a desk or side table. I bought the bundle with the amazon cloud cam and they work seamlessly together, other amazon cams may need a "skill" download but those are easy to take care of. Timer alerts can be hard to hear if you have background noise going on, but i've heard you can set a timer with music so that might solve that. My only complaint and its not that big of a deal but between the radio and the TV i had to change the name to echo instead of Alexa because of all the Alexa commercials. Amazon, it was funny in the beginning but can we get this figured out lol

author: Mama Britt
title: Five Stars
content: Best kitchen accessory! Love this gadget, use it for everything.

author: lharding
title: Best secretary ever!
content: My 3rd echo unit.  Love them all!  This one is on my desk at work but my boss has one, too, and we have to whisper so we don't pick up each others' devices.  Also, we get feedback when we talk to each other.  May have to relocate them.

author: Carol
title: Needs to be plugged in to work
content: Nice for making video and voice phone calls. Unfortunately it has to be plugged in to work which means it’s not really convenient to move to various locations in the house. Have to really pick a “spot” to use it. I believe this is true with the Echo Show as well. Decent sound and video. I didn’t have any problems with “things to try” as others have mentioned. It stays on the clock display for me.

author: Roy J. Stroup
title: This thing is fun to use and it makes life easier
content: This is one awesome device !!  I can’t say enough good things about the Echo Spot. It plays my favorite songs, it updates my shopping list, it gives me weather radar and news and it can even display streaming video. I could go on but you’re missing out on a lot of fun if you don’t have one of these. 🙂

author: Sarah
title: I love this thing!
content: I was a little late to get on board with the Alexa thing, but I kinda love it! I specifically wanted the Spot for my bedroom to use as a sort of alarm clock. I love that I can set a personalized routine for waking up in the morning. I get a nice greeting & a weather report to wake me up a little, and then 15 minutes later it plays music to get me out of bed! We have a few dots around the house, and will be looking into a show for the kitchen area eventually.

author: Josiah
title: Great device, could be more usefull.
content:
Coming from an Echo Dot this is miles ahead. Having a smart clock and being able to Drop In from my phone to see my room is awesome. The screen size is perfect, and the features it has work well.

My only issue is that for over $100, it’s not the mist useful thing in the world. I want more interesting click faces, or a way to use it as a real security camera.

Overall it’s a great device, but only pick it up if you have the extra cash.

author: OOSH
title: Drop in call
content: There so much one can do with this but the repeat feature is awesome

author: Harold Smoliar
title: Another winner
content: I like this a lot. It is my new bedside clock/alarm clock. My eyesight isn't great without my glasses so I'm still picking the best clock faces. I'm a big Alexa fan and this joins a Dot and an Ecobee thermostat that can all work together. I like living in the 21st century.

author: EricinHuntersville
title: Very cool desktop addition
content: The Echo Spot is a very cool thing to add to your workplace desktop.  The speaker is just loud enough to provide a little background noise, and the screen is just big enough to let you clearly see YouTube videos.  I also like the round shape.  It reminds me of my Magic 8 Ball from the 80s.  Except that this magic device can actually give you real answers.  Enjoy!

author: Jeff Cavanagh
title: Clock face options are lacking
content: Got as a smart alarm clock.  Clocks are terrible.  Variety is non existent.  There should be hundreds of designs instead of a handful (plus some distracting backgrounds).  Expected it to show time and temperature like it does in every Echo Spot ad.

author: John Smedick
title: Lots of fun and very helpful.
content: Having lots of fun.  Still finding out what Spot can and cannot do.  Do not expect google depth of information.  Ask me later.

author: Marquis (Q)
title: I have found this little device to be very handy ...
content: I have found this little device to be very handy with new possibilities being discovered every day.  It works as promised, and continues to have new applications.

author: Anna L. Lamassonne
title: Great upgrade to Echo Dot
content: I purchased this to upgrade the Echo Dot in our kitchen. My husband was skeptical of the need to upgrade, but he quickly came around to appreciate this new device. The sound quality is significantly better and the cute little screen is great to have a quick look at time and weather all the time. The ability to play video recipes is amazing. With TuneIn radio it shows you what's playing. My only beef at this early stage is the interface to change the scrolling display seems a little clunky. Perhaps I just need more practice.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love this little Echo!
content: This little Echo can do a lot! I love it!

author: Lois J. Deroest
title: Great timesaver
content: I especially like getting information on the fly without looking it up. The alarm setting by just speaking to it is awesome. The only thing I do that is weird is that I am always thanking her

author: Rob Eli
title: Cannot disable the despised Things To Try screen. Don’t buy until this is changed.
content: Product forces user to review Alexa Things to Try. There is no way to disable it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Enjoying
content: Just got the Echo Spot today and I can’t stop talking to it!

author: Amy
title: Love my Echo!
content: I love my Echo!  My sons got it for me for Christmas and I’m having so much fun learning what all it can do.  I actually got to pick it out and I’m glad I chose one with a screen. I can’t see anyone being disappointed with this purchase.

author: PaulCVW
title: Five Stars
content: Does everything I expected it to do,

author: DBU
title: Excellent  smart Clock
content: The voice recognition is amazing, perfect companion for the bedroom.

author: Larry Bolton
title: Great to have the video
content: Great product. Could be more but it’s overall a great product. Sometimes it can’t hear me in my apartment or it doesn’t do what I ask but maybe it’s learning.

author: R. McBee
title: Great way to video chat with friends and family
content: Easy to set up and use

author: Kibbee
title: Great buy!
content: I love the fact that it has a screen and I can use other smart devices with it. I’m still learning it but so far it’s pretty nice. I have a Google Home also and the sound on my google home is much louder. So that’s the downside. Other than that quite nice!

author: Michael
title: Perfect
content: Love it!

author: Teresa Cassidy
title: If I could do a negative star I would
content: I love my Echo Show and My Echo Dot.  the Spot is defective.  Took forever to get it connected to my internet and I was 2feet away.  Then it would not register after multiple attempts.  Waste of money and will be sending back.

author: laurieb
title: Love it!
content: I mostly use my Alexa devices for music.  The echo spot is perfect for my bedroom side table, alarm works very well, you have your choice.  Also, it automatically dims the display when the room is dark, so it is not really intrusive at night.  (my regular alarm clock I had to cover with a shirt at night, I'm very sensitive to light) I don't think it has a snooze function/skill though, maybe I can teach her?  Music sounds good on this device, I can drop in on the one I have in the kitchen.

author: James
title: F$&# These piece of $&$#
content: Don't waste your F&$#ing money on these pieces of $hi$.  They never respond and the software is a comical sideshow.  Amazon claims they are the future and they are not.  They can't pickup your voice an inch away or a mile away.  Stop being lazy and take back control of your home.  Because when you need them to work they won't.  They get progressively worse and are a complete waste of money.  Don't do it!  I literally just threw mine in the trash. All three of them.

author: Christine
title: feel like a technosaurus
content: difficulty adding facetime linkage to settings....working to get music I want to hear when I want to hear it...feel like a technosaurus...

author: Sylvia Benick
title: Small but impressive
content: I just love this echo spot!  It’s so convenient being the size and I especially love that the face can be a clock. It takes up so little room on nightstand but with everything you can do with it is amazing.

author: Susan Nicholas
title: So happy with my Echo Spot!
content: I use the Echo Spot as an alarm clock. It has worked out perfectly for that. I love that I can set the alarm to repeat  every Tuesday at 8am.  I love being able to see the weather in the morning & get a forecast for the day. It shows the first thing I have on my calendar for the day & the number of other events for the day. I wish it could show my whole day, even if it means swiping the card. It shows the day of the the month "15". But I wish it showed the whole date, included the day. EX: Fri 2/15/2019.

author: Zoo TV crew
title: Amazon never ceases to amaze me
content: Great clock, sounds great and looks great! The only problem is I have too many echoes in my house now. I wish the stand was a little cheaper. Either way I highly recommend getting this while it is on sale while. A no brainer

author: John
title: We really enjoy this device
content: We really enjoy this device.  We have switched from Apple products to Amazon products.  I wish the wake word could be changed to spot.  We have an Echo Plus, Dot and now this.  This replaced our alarm clock and have also paired it with a bluetooth speaker. Might get another one for the guest bedroom.

author: Jennifer A. Corse
title: Love my spot
content: I bought this as a treat for myself.  We have two dots downstairs and I wanted a visual alarm clock for my side table with Alexa integration.  The spot is awesome and is great quality.  My kids love coming into my room and asking it questions.  I love waking up to a picture of my kids in the morning and that I can also get my daily info without leaving bed.  I highly suggest purchasing a spot!

author: Deborah Pruitt
title: I love the Echo Spot I already have the Echo Show ...
content: I love the Echo Spot I already have the Echo Show and I love it I purchased the Echo Spot for my bedroom if you won’t a great speaker look into this one

author: Amazon Customer
title: Works great  have it set up to turn off the lights my kids leave on
content: Working good  nice little home addition

author: SurfCaster
title: very happy with
content: really nice

author: Karen Slocum
title: Worth having
content: Like access to lots of music and the ability to answer a number of questions

author: Paul Shuckhart
title: I love the Echo Spot
content: I love the Echo Spot! It shows the time and temperature and updates, one gets use to seeing that. So I moved this one into the bedroom (perfect size for there) and I brought the Echo Show (7" screen), which is GREAT for the living room.

author: Stephen Cucchiara
title: The Spot is SPOT ON!
content: What a great product. It is beyond what I expected. I think that I'll have yo upgrade my Echo since I purchased it when they first came out and it doesn't appear to be completely compatible with the newer Dots and the Spot. All in all a great addition.

author: B. Jones
title: This was a gift to me, while I like it, would have never bought one for myself.
content:
Would not have bought this for myself, but as a gift, I found it easy enough to setup. So far I use it to turn lights on and off.

I guess I'm just not the target consumer, looking for home automation. While I find the things it can do interesting, most of those things I was already doing with my computers, remotes and smartphones.

author: Barry
title: Update on Inability to show Ring front door camera
content:
Update 10/31/2018— Echo Spot now shows the Ring camera with no buffering and reasonably fast. For some reason, after long monitoring, Ring decides to disconnect so watching the kids approach the door wasn’t quite what it could be, but no complaints. The only latent “quirk” is that when evening comes along, the camera shows in color until a bright light hits it. Then it goes to black and white and stays that way. Not an Echo problem but a Ring software flaw.
Update--4/5/2018 Echo Spot.  I originally gave this a one star since it did not do what it was advertised to do, namely show me my Ring Pro front door camera.  This was the only reason I purchased it.  All it shows is "Waiting for Ring.com" with a blurred view of the last thing it had in memory for the front door.  On a hunch, I stayed up late and tried it again. Much to my surprise it worked almost immediately, but showed "Buffering..." every other second.  My past experience is that this is a server problem and not a device problem.  I think that the Ring server in Dallas has difficulty communicating with me in Houston, TX.  Since Amazon now owns it all, I presume this will be remedied since Houston is the fourth largest city in the USA and many others will have the same problem.  So far, I like everything about it.  It is very intuitive to use to the point that I have not even watched a YouTube explaining it.  Telephone calls are crisp and sound great on both ends and do not require the other party to have an echo. Amazon---please fix the Ring camera problem!!!  This is a buy recommendation.

author: Cheryl pitts
title: Echo spot great purchase!
content: We love the echo spot I use it on my nightstand for alarm clock and play iHeartRadio radio while getting dressed!!

author: Tleath123
title: Great Addition to our sons room!
content: We purchased the Echo Spot for my son’s birthday. He loves it! He uses it as his alarm clock in the mornings and listens to Audible books at bedtime. He plays music on it while he’s doing homework or playing video games. We also use it to drop-in on him when we need him to come downstairs or ask him questions instead of yelling upstairs for him. It’s been great to have additional Echo’s around the house and we’re planning to get another one for our younger kids’ room as well.

author: shane lafountain
title: I definitely think its worth the money!
content: I bought this as a alarm clock for myself. I have a couple Echo dots and an echo and wanted to be able to use this in my bedroom for broadcasting messages dropping in basically using as an intercom system. So far I've been pretty happy with the spot. I like the fact that it's got a decent speaker in it and that I use it for white noise when I'm sleeping. I found a Babbling Brook sound that really does help me sleep. It's pretty nice the screen the way it darkens automatically when the lights go out. As far as watching anything on it I really haven't done that yet. I haven't used the screen feature much except for it being an alarm clock and adjusting my settings. I do like that you can use pictures that you have stored on your phone as background for the clock face. I get to wake up every morning to a picture of my dog...which kind of irritates the wife but she'll get over it. I would say overall I'm happy with my purchase for the price. A little better selection of the clock face would be nice but I'm sure if I searched the skills I would find something.

author: JGeiermann
title: The most amazing tech to help elderly - truly life changing
content: My husband has Lewy Body Dementia which causes both cognitive and vision problems. This causes a lot of issue with technology use.  He often cannot find his phone, keys or wallet. I got the Tile app but that got difficult on the phone but the voice control works great for this. He uses it about 5 times a day, instead of asking me to find them. I can use the drop in feature to connect, see and hear what is going on in the house which is extremely helpful especially when he cannot find the phone or his cell phone. I just added the connect so he can voice dial too. I also use the reminders to make sure we don't miss any medications. We have Sonos and he cannot use the use the iPhone app with his issues but he can control it with the voice control.  The calendar and shopping list are great too. I did print a list of commands to help him remember how to use it. I used a very large font to make it  easy to ready.

author: Tim J
title: "Things to try" ruins this potentially great item.
content:
I received this as a gift to replace a broken bedside alarm clock. Excitement turned to frustration. When I set it up and selected a wallpaper, it had a nice size time centered in the screen. I was so excited. Looked great! Then.............The "Things to try" took over. Not only annoying, they dominate the screen and minimize the time to a small area at the top. You can't even see it unless you are close. THERE IS NO WAY TO TURN IT OFF!!!!!! Unbelievable! I have multiple other Echo devices and I am thoroughly disappointed in this item. The Echo Show has "Things to try" also but seeing as it sits on a desk in my kitchen, it's not that annoying. Please, Amazon, allow us to disable this function! I've had Echo products for years and do not need redundant suggestions that I already know about! "Try asking Alexa for Horse jokes." Puh-lease!

******Gotta give credit to Amazon Customer Service, they called within hours of posting this review. She was very helpful and understanding but didn't quite "solve" my problem but gave me direction to minimize it.
1: Change display to modern setting.
2: Turn off notifs including continuous rotation.
Not ideal, but we'll see how it goes. I'm using as an alarm clock, others might want notifs on. She did state they are pushing developers to rectify this issue. Will update later. Thanks Customer Service!

author: John L. Howell
title: I just hope that everyone that buys an Echo Spot will enjoy it as much as I have enjoyed mine
content:
I recently bought an Echo Spot and it was white with a black stand for it to sit on, I think that it looks really sharp.  It raises the spot, and it looks as though it is freely floating on my desk.
I just hope that everyone that buys an Echo Spot will enjoy it as much as I have enjoyed mine.
  Sincrerly,
  John Howell

author: Julie Gardner
title: Spot is awesome!!
content: I absolutely love it!!  I also got my son one for his room. We now have two spots and a dot lolol. Highly recommend especially if you use them to control lights etc.

author: Irakli Vekua
title: Five Stars
content: good

author: Donald R. Austin Jr.
title: Alexa seems more alive.
content: Its everything I thought it would be.  Makes speaking to Alexa even more real with being able to see as well as hear her answers.  If there is one draw back its the size.  Its great using it on your desk where you are sitting right on top of it but doesn't help having it if you are a little farther away from it.  If you want something larger, get the Echo Show.

author: AC
title: Didn’t meet my needs
content:
I bought this for a master bathroom, which is also used by our two teenage kids.  I wanted two primary things out of this device.  First, the ability for it to switch between everyone’s accounts, so everyone could play their own Spotify playlists, and have other account specific services available.  And secondly, I wanted to display the analog clock constantly.  Neither of these needs could be met.  I realized during setup that it can only switch between two adult accounts.  My wife and I thought this was an odd policy, since many families have adult children living at home while attending college, or elderly parents sharing the home.  But in general, these devices really should support an entire family.  Kids/teens want to listen to their own playlists, and have access to their own services.

As for the display, it starts with the analog clock, but then changes to other screens, and I was unable to find any settings to prevent this.  You can set a background, but that’s all.
