The round display was mildly annoying during setup, because if your input is too wide (as was our WiFi password), the first and last letters only show half of the characters.  This doesn’t cause any real problems - it’s just a small annoyance that’s worth mentioning.  Additionally, the Alexa app seems to be a little behind in the new device setup area.  It doesn’t even list the Spot as a device to set up.

On the positive side, it sounded fairly loud, and I would agree with other reviewers that it falls somewhere in between the full Echo and the Echo Dot.  We own a Dot already, and this Spot was definitely more rich and full sounding than the Dot.

author: DRJAZ
title: Very Pleased With Echo Spot!
content: Love the spot! Doubles as clock and provides a great sound for such a small device. Alexa understands commands easily. My only wish would be for temporary battery power so I could take it out of my office at end of the day.

author: Austinjn
title: Choose your name wisely
content: Great device.  Easy setup.  Just choose your name wisely.  When company hears you say Drop in  on Baby they give you an odd look...hahahha

author: Teena
title: Easy set up and many wonderful options
content:
I gave this to my son as early Christmas present bc he needed an alarm clock. Set up was super easy as well as setting up Alexa.

My son seemed to be hesitant to use it but loves it! My daughter is asking for one now for her bday! Highly recommend and hope to be trying out more features such as phone calls.

author: Mark T.
title: Must have with the ring security
content: Its awsome,,,, If you have the ring security,  this is a must ....

author: Jeremy R. Ward
title: Love it.
content: Love, love, love it. Great speaker, easy set up. Only thing that takes getting used to is using voice for volume control.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Get it...
content: If you are looking for a glorified alarm clock with a lot of gnarly features, than go ahead and make the plunge.  I am really happy with my purchase.  No regrets thus far.

author: dferron
title: Love the Grandkids
content: These were gifts to our kids so that we could talk with the grandkids and see their creations, and smiling faces. Quality viewing on our Amazon Show. Kids said that it was an easy set up. So far, no issues.

author: Eddy Sanchez
title: Works well
content: Works well

author: I. M. Ford
title: Great product, limited by Amazon.
content: Great product with great possibilities. But it's limited by Amazon ecosystem... Example no YouTube or other Google based support and Alexa still has a ways to catch up to  Google Assistant.

author: Marion F.
title: Love this Echo Spot
content: Love this Echo Spot.  I use it right beside my bed.  Just wish I could see it from other areas of the room.  Since it is round and flat on one side, sometimes I want to see the time or weather and I can't because of that.

author: islandbob
title: Five Stars
content: wife is happy

author: Kathleen Butler
title: We can call anyone in our contact list using the Echo Spot.
content: I ordered 3 Echo Spot. One for the parent’s room, and one for each of my children’s rooms. I love the drop in feature room to room and from my phone using the Alexa app when I’m away. My kids play their favorite music on their Spots. And my teenagers now have a totally reliable alarm clock. I make all three of my kids charge their phones in my room at night so their sleep isn’t interrupted. They have never liked this rule. The Spots make it easier.

author: ~ Julie ~
title: Advertising can be a little misleading but excellent unit
content: I love this little unit. I actually only do not give it 5 stars as it was bought so that I could see my baby sleeping in another room as the video says it can do but what the video left out is that that feature only works if you have 2 of them and you carry one with you room to room. I assumed since all the dots echos and Spots are run from an app on my cell phone I would be able to access it like this but apparently you have to have the second spot. Which took an excellent price viewer to the same price as a baby monitor that does the same thing. This was the sole purpose of me buying this unit and this is why it doesn't get 5 stars. For every thing else it is perfect.

author: Jay the Cronie
title: Alexa ruins this thing
content: I mostly bought this thing to be an alarm clock and to play white noise while I sleep. It worked good for that at first, but Alexa...Alexa started out great and was pretty helpful at letting me know the time, setting alarms/timers, checking weather, playing music, etc. I don’t ask for much more from it, not interested in the smart home capabilities. As time has gone on though, I find Alexa saying “sorry, I don’t know that one” and “hmm, I’m not sure” more than anything. Nowadays more often than not, I am completely ignored. I don’t ask for more advanced tasks, just “Alexa, wake me up at...” “Alexa, play wave sounds” and a couple of other things. Day after day, Alexa has become more and more incapable. The ai is ruining this device. There is no manual way to set an alarm, you can’t bypass Alexa. I don’t blame the Echo Spot itself for its recent shortcomings. It’s obviously the fault of the people who work specifically on Alexa. Maybe that’s not fair to say, as Alexa is still better than Siri. In the end, if your looking for simple tasks like I was, this might be okay, but I’m wondering if there’s a better device (like a regular alarm clock). But if you’re looking for a good ai, I’d try google.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I absolutely love this! its amazing
content:
I absolutely love this!  its amazing, wakes me up in the morning, tells me the weather and keeps track of my schedule and sets reminders for me.  I have this linked with my TV so I literally find shows to watch without having to scroll through the guide endlessly.  I love that I can ask it to play music and it has my favorite music playing within seconds.
I purchased the TP-link smart switches for my home and now alexa turns my lights on and off!  I bought the echo dot for my kids and to have in the living room and they love theirs as well.  I even set a reminder for alexa to tell the kids I love them and have a great day, it went off at 7:30 am, while my kids were eating breakfast,  - they called laughing and said mom we loved it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It is just a great product!
content: Great device and is everything I expected. It is very easy to set up and for playing music it has great sound. I love the clock face and background choices. I am very pleased with the spot.

author: Dot
title: Love this!
content: My grandson set this up and every time he’s here I can’t keep him off it. He plays the trivia games. I love it when I’m in bed and need the light off or to know something. I also like the ability to use it as an alarm.

author: Ryan Bell
title: Great little piece of tech
content: Wasn’t sure exactly what to expect when I ordered my spot, I picked it up for a steal on prime day and honestly I love the thing. I use it as my new alarm clock on my nightstand and it’s great, it looks sleek, I love that I can change the background to a picture, the sound quality when listening to music (while maybe not as good as my echo or my show) is still very good. The screen is a little small for watching videos on but I don’t think that’s a very big deal. Ultimately I love the thing, and if you are a fan of Alexa and Amazons echo system like I am, you’ll love the Echo Spot.

author: Bob w
title: Best alarm clock out.
content: I use these for alarm clocks for wife and I . No issues setting either alarm with them facing each other in the same room. You could say there spot on. I’m up to 5 echo devices. All work flawless for lights and anything else. Works great for wife as she works random days and can very easily set the alarm clock now. Mine is set for Monday -Friday . Perfect

author: M. Sheftell
title: It’s even better than I had hoped for
content: Actually... It’s even better than I had hoped for!  If you’re unsure about it, just pick it up.  You can always return it if it doesn’t meet your needs.  I highly recommend this product 😉.

author: RFearns
title: Perfect nightstand accessory
content: Love this on my night table! Every good thing with Alexa is here in this device. This has sooooo many possibilities.

author: olopez
title: Small screen but great speaker and performance
content: I must say even tho it's a smaller screen than I thought, I love it. Was looking for a nightstand clock to replace my old analog one and this one is a great replacement and no need to have my giant echo anymore in the same room. Very happy and alot louter than I thought which is a great

author: EG123
title: A super-duper glorified alarm clock..and then some!
content: I use my Echo Spot as an alarm clock but also use it for soothing music when going to sleep (plus various other Alexa skills, of course). I set it to a simple digital clock face and to dim so that it's a nice, quiet red in the dark that doesn't keep me awake with ambient light. I don't know nearly all of what Alexa can do but there are tons of tips on the interwebs. It is excellent in its functionality for which I bought it and it offers so much more!

author: Tim Williams
title: Love it!
content: Love this - and find it very useful when getting ready for work in the morning or wanting soft music while fixing dinner, etc.  Very accurate and great sound.

author: Linda Gonzalez
title: AWESOME!
content: I love it! I use it as my alarm clock on my bedside table. Best buy ever!

author: Mario Nicotra
title: Absolutely LOVE this new Echo
content:
What an amazing new generation of Alexa Echo devices. The Spot blew me away. Easy to set up and get connected. The Touch screen menu means you don't need to always use the mobile app to make changes. Integrated microphone with great sound pickup, Speakers that deliver clear sound, LCD screen to display all manner of things and an inbuilt camera to enable video chats.

The auto dimmer works extremely well and is ideal for bedside use. Multiple clock faces to chose from and you can also add a picture as background to the clock face. When appropriate it display information on the screen as well as audio responses to your questions. For example, ask about weather, or your schedule and it also shows the information on the screen. It can also be configured to 'do not disturb' (other than alarm clock) during your sleeping period.

Home control is a breeze and it also enables you to select light controls via the touch screen.

Can't wait to see what the next Echo transformation will be.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A must have for your night stand
content: Absolutely love the echo spot. The stuff you can do with it is endless. Love to play sleep sounds to help me get ready for bed. It can also help you find your phone. As well as setting alarm and checking the news. Defin a must have for your nightstand.

author: Justin L A
title: Awesome technology
content: I like the premise of the spot. The news flash feature is cool. But the cost to make one's home "smart" in order to get the most out of the product is too high.

author: L. Easterly
title: These will pair and stream Stereo to your favorite bluetooth soundbar, OR through line-out jacks if you have the cable!
content: For those that care, these will pair and stream to your favorite Bluetooth soundbar, OR through line-out jacks if you have the cable. Alexa can be odd when you make a complex music request like "minimalist classical" but this can be easily solved by building a custom named playlist first. The "Flash Briefings" are nice with images, and the size is perfect for the nightstand.

author: Bxstrb
title: One annoying flaw
content: Bought this to replace a Sony Dash (remember those?) after Sony decided to pull support from it entirely. It works great for what I use it for: an alarm clock, a weather station, background music player and voice control of lights throughout my house. My biggest gripe about the device and why I knocked a star off is that you can't turn off the suggestions on "Things to Try". It 's an annoying and a stupid design decision since you have control to turn off other things you don't want to see as it cycles through content screens. A software update or two would help this improve especially full control of what we want and don't want to see in the content rotation.

author: RMH
title: Alexa my friend
content: I really like this addition to my family, and it is a great hands free helper. I sometimes have to get close to get Alexa's attention. I did buy 4 of them just the same, for friends and family.

author: Bill Speaks the Truth
title: Helpful and annoying
content: This thing would get 5 stars if it didn’t freak out in the middle of the night on several occasions. The first time, it very loudly wanted to play trivia at 1 am which no one prompted it to do anything. The speaker is very sensitive and the tv or watching videos on your phone can trigger it. Don’t whisper anything bad about it or you might be sorry. Maybe that’s what the maniacal cackling everyone was complaining about was the result of people and how they treated their devices.

author: Scott
title: Very nice product, easy to use
content: Does what I expected it to do.  Prefer it to my alarm clock but this needs a usb port so I can plug in my phone and charge it over night like what I'm able to do with my alarm clock.

author: eDude
title: I love Amazon Echo.  This Echo Spot takes it to another level!
content: I love Amazon Echo.  This Echo Spot takes it to another level!  The only drawback is that it will not "DROP IN" on Amazon Echo Look.

author: NJL
title: Fantastic device!
content: I live in a rural area that doesn't get much in the way of radio signals.  I still prefer a clock radio over my cell phone as an alarm.  I had been using the Echo dot for about a year as an alarm which was fine but in order to snooze you had to actually say "Alexa snooze".  That's a bummer when you're trying to actually stay mostly asleep a few more minutes.  I love love love that with this device you just have to tap the screen to snooze for 9 minutes.  It has sophisticated choices for clock faces to choose from and it looks very high-end.  It has a lot of bells and whistles like video calling and of course controls your Alexa smart devices at home.  It replaced both a worthless clock radio that just told time and the Dot on my bedside table which saves room.  I could not be happier.

author: Michael
title: Great product (turn off "purchase by voice")
content:
Seems to be a good addition to my collection of gadgets, this one next to my bed stand. The microphone(s) appear to work at a distance of one foot (not quite as good as the sensitivity of the Echo Dot at perhaps twice that distance).

As a developer, I find that the APIs for the Echo Show don't gracefully "just work" as expected on the Echo Spot. Amazon's changed the layout in such a way that the Spot won't show an incoming image, for example. Presumably there is a different layout required in the programming but since the product is so new, there are no examples yet so it's a little problematic in the coding space for this.

It does seem to work in a number of capacities. It feels like Amazon's grand design would be to empower ("enable") us to be constant consumers so it appears that much attention was placed on making this Amazon.com-friendly. I encourage owners to immediately turn off the ability to purchase by voice; the Alexa interface can easily hear "what is the starting time for the new Iron Man movie?" and it respond with "okay, I've made a purchase for seven books on Amazon.com and they should arrive soon". (I jest, but not by much.)

author: Valerie Kellar
title: Buy the subsciption to music
content: We love them. I bought 2 one for my son & one for myself. I can “drop in” on him if I know he hasnt woke up yet to tell him to wake up or time to go to sleep.

author: K.M. Brunner
title: What a Way to Wake-up in the Morning!
content: I love my Echo Spot!  I enjoy listening to my wake up alarm music (Good Morning featuring Toby Mac)  and my morning news brief (video) , plus I can control my bedroom light with the addition of my "smart" light bulb!  Awesome way to wake up each day!

author: R. Graziano
title: Best ever replacement for a bedside alarm clock
content: What can I say?  It has a dedicated night-display mode, gently wakes you up in the morning, always keeps the right time, and adjusts itself to daylight savings time.  It'll also play whatever music you want.  I should have purchased this sooner.

author: Shivanand Maraj
title: Converted Apple Siri smart home fanboy
content: I'm an Apple fan boy fully integrated into the Apple ecosystem and I was blown away at how much better the Echo Spot device is versus Siri and Apple HomeKit. 1) Faster response time when performing tasks such as turning off lights, switches, and adjusting my ecobee thermostat. 2) Understands what I say 90% of the time versus 50% with Siri. 3) Does much more. i.e. play's Pandora, iHeart radio, NPR, given me video news briefs and can answer questions without telling me to check a website. 4) The device can even help me sleep by playing ocean sounds, rain, wales etc. Amazon is ahead of Apple on AI technology.

author: Robert W Wilson
title: Love it
content: Love it. Sometimes a bit slow but it could be my connection.  My Hey Google is a bit faster but no face. I love how you can put your photos in the background. All in all, I wish I could buy like 7 and put them all over.

author: Florida Gal
title: great device
content: I just love this little device.  It is perfect to keep on my night stand. I have to really set it up with phone numbers  and stuff to really take advantage of everything it does, but for now it's nice that I don't even have to turn my head to check the time, I can just ask what time it is.  I'm getting way too lazy Alexa!

author: DYL
title: Glad I picked this up during Prime Day.
content: Absolutely love it. After much persuasion from a friend, I finally gave in and bought one. Let's just say that the moment Alexa enters my life, I turn around and tell Siri to get the hell out.

author: Dean Coats
title: Is Spot worth the price!!!!
content:
I bought two of these last week and I have been an Alexa user for sometime and my home has many of the smart devices, i say that the product is great for those things. The screen is good for things like my camera system for outside or my “ring door bell” to see who’s at my door and be able to talk to them.

I don’t use as an alarm clock and amazon has come out with a shell you can put on spot to cover the camera that pretty cool. Like others on here and I have read many reviews and the countless requests for the THINGS TO TRY BANNER to go away and amazon has done nothing about that and that disappoints me, plus if you are going to put a screen on your device give it more uses.

I still argue the point that Alexa needs a platform to work off like google home, but i do love the skills you just have to find the right one and remember the ones you put on the device.

Over all it’s just an over priced dot, with a few tricks since it has a screen, will probably return then until amazon comes out with a better use form them, until then LOVE my dots and will continue to use them.

One more thing for people that are only apple users, I have to say I do like Siri better then Alexa. Siri is more personable and remembers thing better the Alexa, she still kind of cold!!! lol

author: Chilly Winters
title: Five Stars
content: I presented the Echo Spot to my daughter for her birthday.  She loves the Echo Spot.

author: Ghango
title: This thing feels so premium
content: I have every version of every non screen echo device.  This product seems so sold.  The screen is beautiful.  It feels very premium.  Also, over time the App that coordinates all this is getting better and better.  I also have google devices but really dont use them any more as part of the appeal is once these are everywhere they expand in value.  I really like the visual interface, it is simple, pleasing, and relaxing.  Having a visual along with the spoken makes things stick longer in my mind.  The one thing  is the add in the scroll that cannot be turned off unless you turn off the scroll.  However I get adds on my kndles and I dont care after a while.  Especially since I know that it brings down the cost.  The cost of this unit is not the unit but the sever farms and bandwith that you dont see processing your requests.  There is no subscription with any of this yet it gets better and better.  My house  has an intercom, synchronized music, timers telling my kids get ready for bed that trigger at different time in different rooms, a sub woofer in my living room,  5  named tirmers running at once when I'm cooking, on and on, and I paid maybe $500 for all this?  Everyone who is complaining about suggested apps is missing the bigger picture, and has become spoiled to some degree.  I paid $99 for this device, seems more than reasonable.  I love this thing!

author: J Mac
title: Greatat device with lots of skills (apps).  Works well with Smart Home & many other products.
content: Echo Spot is great size for a nightstand and travel.  The video screen/feature is awesome.

author: Irma Baez
title: Excellent
content: I got for me in black, and have one to my best friend for Christmas in white. She loves it. I think anyone would like this. No way to explain it, you have to try it.

author: Robert S. F.
title: Already having a couple of Echo Dots, I find the Spot to be an improvement, if only for the display.
content: Setup of the Spot was simple.  I use it as a bedroom alarm clock, and I like the features.  You can select from several different clock face displays.  This display automatically dims at night, but that feature can be modified in the settings function, along with many other parameters.  The display also randomly lists different suggestions for the device's use, which is helpful.  The flash briefings do contain some video.  I'm a fan of talk radio, so mostly I use it at different times, along with the Dots, to listen to various stations.  The sound quality for that use is surprisingly good.  Frankly, while I think that these devices are fun, I don't find them particularly useful for me, but that may be partly my own lack of interest in trying to learn all of which they may be capable.  I'm in my sixties....  I did buy a smart switch and use the Dot/Spot to turn a lamp on and off.  It works fine, but I'd rather just use the switch.  I guess I could go crazy and get wifi smart door locks, thermostats and whatever else is available, but as the saying goes, you can't teach an old horse new tricks.  Still, these devices can be fun to explore.

author: Fast learner
title: SLOW much, much, much slower than the other Amazon devices
content:
Great idea poor performance, it’s so much slower than the other Alexa devices. I some times wait nearly a minute for her to wake up, it’s unbelievable. I should have sent it back but life got in the way. For now it’s a very expensive clock... I hate to say this but I should have waited for the google device.

Update - Amazon had me send it back, 10 days later I have the same device with the same problem.  It took 25 seconds to get Alexa to STOP the alarm I set.

author: D. Lawrence
title: My "Spot"
content: Extremely satisfied with my "Spot"! This unit is the most easy and helpful electronic I own! It's like having my own secretary!

author: Carol B.
title: Great size for my kitchen window sill
content: I like the size best. And the fact that the time is always visible. I own 4 Alexa devices. The Spot is perfect for my window sill. Just a word of warning though — I really liked the idea of having the time/temp/weather always visible, like in the display. That was one of the main reasons why I purchased the Spot. But that is not an option. You can set the display for time only. Or you can set the display to scan between several screens, the one in the picture being one of the screens. If you want to know the weather, you either have to ask Alexa or wait for the screen to scroll to the screen you want.

author: mfarch99
title: Convenient and easy to use
content: Great for video access to all my security devices. Have one setup in most of my main rooms. Perfect also for using as a video chat with family and friends.

author: Heidi Winegar
title: Worth the purchase!
content: I love the Echo Spot! I have one in my basement ( I can call my kids downstairs) and one for my alarm clock. Love all the features.

author: Teresa
title: Caregiver for Dad With Dementia, on Oxygen, and Insulin Dependent
content:
Dad has dementia and I need to know what he's doing and I need to know if he has his oxygen in his nose.  I received 4 "spots" less than 24 hours ago and 3 are set up; one in my room, one in the living room, and one in the kitchen.  The 4th will be in dad's room once I have learned what it can and can't do and how to do it.  The lack of available information so I can learn is why I'm only giving it 3 stars.  Alexa can't answer questions about what she can or cannot do.  She can't answer questions about her own features.  For example, I asked her what the "remote" function was for on her own set up menu.  Her response resembled this:  "huh, duh, what".  Annoying.  I asked Alexa if she could search the web for me and I got the same response.  Alexa's "self-awareness" is pretty much non-existent.

I incorrectly assumed I would be able to "drop in" to make sure my dad is safe.  However, you can't use the camera to see a room, or as a nanny cam.  It is meant for web content and closeups of faces.  I just ordered 3 Wyze Cam Pan 1080p's (I don't need one for my bedroom).  The Wyze Cam is advertised to work with the spot.  If I can't immediately access video of my dad using Alexa Spot I honestly don't think I will keep it.  I got the spots because my hands are busy with things like cooking, laundry, etc. etc.  I thought I would be able to tell Alexa "drop in on the living room" and I could look over at the spot and check on dad as opposed to dropping what I'm doing and physically going into the other room -- mind you dad rarely sleeps in his bed.  His sleep habits are not habits, they are unpredictable.

I will update after I get the cams and let other caregivers know if it's working and, if pertinent, where to find the information to get it to work.

author: M. Salazar
title: The screen is an excellent addition and just the right size
content: I was skeptical about the spot at first because of the screen size. Now after having used it for a while I think it is actually a great feature. It works quite well with my ring video doorbell, I like getting news and sports updates on it and it is awesome to drop in and video chat with the kids.

author: Michelle C
title: It Does a Ton of Things!
content: So happy with my Alexa Spot! I use it beside my bed for a traditional alarm clock. I also use it every night for sounds to fall asleep by. I listen to the rain or ocean sounds or soothing classical music. Love it! I recently downloaded audio books as well so if I want to listen to those, I can. In the morning I can watch a few videos from bed before getting up. I video call my husband to talk to him a few minutes on his way to work.  It can turn up loud enough to hear it in the master bath so I’ll tell her to play upbeat music while I’m in the shower! I’ll be ordering a smart plug so I can tell Alexa to turn my light off if I’m too comfortable to do it myself because sometimes if I just move a little while falling asleep, I’ll pop up, wide awake and can’t get comfortable again. Idk. Anyway, it does so much!  Get it! You’ll love it!

author: brelli
title: Love!
content: First smart device in my apt and I love it! Recieved as a gift. Had it set up in no time. Connected the Phillip hue bulbs, cloud cam, and tp outlet with ease! Pulled them all into the Alexa app and was able to set up my routines in minutes! I have the spot in my bedroom and it can hear me down the hall in the living room to turn the lights on and off. Even picks me up at a very low voice when in my room. The sounds quality is good in my opinion and i just love that it has the touch screen with the clock face! The few things i wasn sure of how to set up i realized, i can just ask alexa!! The directions come up typed on the screen and alexa will read them to you as well. Ive only had it for a day now but im loving it so far and  know theres so much more to learn!

author: Chauncey T Grey
title: Works great. Just needs a little larger display so I ...
content: Works great.  Just needs a little larger display so I can read it at night without my glasses.

author: frequent shopper
title: not the best member of the family
content: I have 5 different echo devices. This was the one I was most excited about, and now least impressed with.  Screen is almost too small for anything except a clock. Cant adjust angle of camera. As with all echo devices I love the functions, but I would recommend a show if you want the full effect of video

author: Dcn. Tom
title: AMAZING!
content: In just one word, AWESOME! Alexa is super cool. Music, Information, Jokes and more! Great Family and party entertainment. The more you use it the better it gets. Extremely happy with product.

author: Barbara C.
title: Bad setup
content: Once a spot has been setup and then moved, it will not setup agsin

author: A. Barela
title: Camera angle sucks
content: Like the product it's an upgrade from the Echo Dot I have in my other rooms but the camera angle kind of sucks. I wish there was some way to adjust it without having to buy a stand.

author: Jamyn
title: Just as advertised
content: Just as advertised

author: TaDarius
title: Best gadget in my house.
content: I love it. The voice recognition could be a little better but I still give it 5 stars.

author: Tom Dahl
title: Spot
content: we use it as an alarm clock as well as controlling them light and heater, this works great.  My only complaint is the ads that appear on it fairly regularly

author: Juan Garcia
title: Intuitive and user friendly
content: Handy device that was well received in my household.  I bought this for my art studio.  It took a few days to get used to, but it has quickly become a very welcomed studio mate and multitasking part my workspace

author: tarrah
title: Love Love my Echo
content: I love my Echo products. I am very addicted to all of them.

author: Jeffrey Wattman
title: I love Alexa!
content: I already had the dot so this was an addition to the family. I keep it next to my bed and use it as my alarm clock. I love all the skills you can download as well and use them daily.

author: Tammy Vaisey
title: Small, but efficient size. Perfect for the Night Stand.
content: I bought this to replace my alarm clock. Thought it was the right size and I could use it for many things besides being a clock. I now get the weather, get alerts when my packages have arrived, especially helpful when I am at work. I play music, watch some news videos, know what's trending, etc. I just love it. It is a perfect gift I think for even a teenager.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Easy setup
content: So far, so good. I'm now using the spot as my bedside clock and alarm clock.  I'm having a little problem setting up my ring doorbell to show up, but I think that is a ring problem and I really haven't spent much time on it yet.

author: R. Clifford
title: love it. Second
content:
First off, love it.
Second, turn the camera off if it is in your bedroom. Because that's weird.

It's a great alarm clock. A good speaker addition to.your other echos and the white is just great looking.

Enjoy.

author: Jester58
title: How much God loves us
content: This is such a wonderful joy to have such fun and knowledge in one home

author: Art Tart
title: Alexa developers - listen to the nearsighted of America!!!!
content:
So far, so much love, with a tiny suggestion - hopefully the Amazon developers read these reviews.

Easy peesy set up - I was able to get it up and running and customized in less than 20 minutes - score!!!
Paired my bluetooth Thonet and Vander speakers (that also live with my bedroom TV) flawlessly. Figured out how to set recurring and different alarms for weekdays and weekends (after you set the 'single alarm' go to the alexa app under alarms and reminders - you have far more control through the app to easily change that single alarm into a recurring alarm with lots of options). Got a photo uploaded to make a custom clock face (used my photo cloud storage at Prime). Played some Prime music. Watched a little CNN. What isn't to love???

THE FONT SIZE!!!!!

It can't be that hard to give us options on font size on the 'personalized' clock. Hey, Amazon developers, not all of us have perfect eyesight, especially at night when the eyeglasses end up on the night stand next to the Spot. Listen to the nearsighted of America, heck, the World, give us a bigger font!!!!!

As soon as Amazon addresses this 'you gotta be kidding' fix, I will be changing that 4 star review to a 5!!!

Edit:
They listened!!!
There is now a much bigger font, very similar to what I photoshopped in my ‘wish’ photo, and it can turn red at night. A++ and I changed my rating to five stars. I really like this little spot, we have been buying more Alexa compatible items and our ‘smart home’ is really coming together.

And for all of my ‘commentors’ who suggested just asking Alexa what time it is, I would rather not wake up my guy in the middle of the night.

author: Steven dubose
title: Great features!
content: I was so amazed what all this can do, I would definitely recommend it to a lot of people! Who knew you could do video calls with grandparents.

author: Stephanie Woodard
title: Call ME
content: I love this product and for the price.  I am so glad that I caught it on sale.  just trying to figure it out how to connect it with my Bluetooth.  but such addition to my night stand.  Would purchase this item again.

author: Raul
title: Another Great Product From Amazon
content: An echo dot with a screen. What is there not to love!! Speakers seem to be higher quality than the dot, screen is phenomenal,  although the bezels are really big. Love it as my clock on my nightstand!!

author: mark e in kc
title: Love the Spot.... have it in kitchen,,the Show in bedroom
content: I already had a - Amazon Show- so was familiar with -Alexa-.  I have Show in bedroom, and the spot in the kitchen.  Family (wife and our 18 year old daughter) love it as well.  The commands are all the same.  Settings easy too.  We bought the stand along with the spot, and i also liked the -stand- too.

author: Slekker
title: I bought it to connect with a Show in another room
content:
Im a caregiver for my parents right now, who are elderly and one has mild dementia. The Spot serves the function I bought it for - it let’s me “drop in” on my dad, for whom I bought an Echo Show. When I got the Spot and the Show at Best Buy, both were $129. The Echo Show is in almost constant use by my dad, who LOVES his music. I opted for the Spot instead of the show for myself due to bedside size constraints. I ended up buying everyone else in my family Echo Shows after I saw how much easier it was for my dad to use than his phone nowadays. But for me, the Spot is all I need.

I keep the camera covered and I try not to have conversations around it. But I’m happy to use it as an alarm clock, timer, music machine and quiz mate. I’m not expecting it to take the place of my phone, but given how reliant my family members are on their Echo Shows, I’m glad that I can use my Spot to interact.

I get how people who wanted it more as a home assistant are less than impressed - it is small, and there aren’t as many features as the Show. Also, there are quirks that were bad enough to make me deduct a star - specifically, the “Alexa Billboard” that pops up and the fact that having Alexa devices in the same Prime household - regardless of separate Amazon accounts and forms of payment - Alexa “merges” our calendar entries, so everything from my calendar shows up in my father’s Show as well as my Spot. That bugs me.

That said, it’s a valued tool for me. I’m not dependent on it, but it has improved my life in many different ways. If you don’t like the small size, just get a Show. But if you don’t really care what the screen is doing, this is a perfect addition for random tasks and functions. Worth it.

author: Brad Wudi
title: I use it for multiple reasons many times a day and I love the screen
content: I love this little spot!  I have it mostly by my bed and it does everything I need it to do.  Clear screen and I love that you can set the wallpaper to what you want.  My 10 year old takes it into her room to listen to music when her friends are over and it tells bedtime stories to my 4 year old when I'm still doing homework with the older one. I would say I wish it could be louder and chargeable so I could just take it in back yard.

author: dd
title: Adorable But Expensive (Too expensive?) Addition To The Family (Dec. 28, 2017 update)
content:
SHORT & SWEET: If your bedside table has a clock radio and an old-fashioned phone, this is the perfect replacement or, at $130, would have been about 5 years ago. For 2018, it's an adorable but overpriced replacement that should have some kind of battery backup.  OTOH we've had it for only a few hours so ...

(I've updated the Setup section - 12/28/2017)

BACKGROUND:

It started with a Generation I Echo in the bedroom, to be used mainly as a clock radio with voice input. As a radio, it was pretty good. As an alarm clock, rather annoying.  (Really, when you wake up do you honestly want to *tell* your Echo to shut up?) But we got a second Echo (also Generation I but at a reduced price) for the living room. Meanwhile, upstairs, we got tired of moving the main bedroom Echo into the guest bedroom while cleaning. (I mean, we had to unplug it, carry it half a dozen steps, plug it in, let it wake up.) So we recently got a Generation II Echo for that room. Not just for convenience, of course. We figured visiting family and friends deserved a better "radio".

We needed another Echo like the proverbial hole in the head. So, why did we buy the Spot? Well, we convinced ourselves that it would be quite a nice addition to the kitchen, even though said kitchen is but 3 steps from the "living room" Echo (albeit around a small corner). That Echo's location was selected precisely because it was between the kitchen and the living room, but it also meant putting the Echo very near the TV and, sad to say, Alexa appears to like the voices of those on the tele better than ours. So we convinced ourselves that if we had a "kitchen" Echo we could move the "living room" Echo to a more central spot, where Alexa might be more amenable to responding to us.

Also, let's face it , the Echo Spot is cute.

REVIEW

NOTE: We are not exactly Amazon's target Echo family. We own no smart devices, other than the TVs. We don't use the Echos for lists or for shopping. They remain, basically, enhanced - but overpriced - combo clock radios/timers/calculators*.

Delivery Oddities

When we ordered the White Spot, we were given a delivery date of Dec. 19, 2017 - which is when buyers of the Black Spot (based on the early reviews) seem to have received theirs. Then we got an email informing us of a Jan. 10, 2018 delivery date. A few days later, the delivery date was changed to Dec. 27, 2017.  Then we woke up on Dec. 24, 2017 to find it sitting by the front door.  Not complaining mind you, but others have speculated about the Spot being shipped before it was fully "cooked" and I wonder if these changing delivery dates are signs they may be right.

SET-UP

Each generation of Echo seems to come with fewer written instructions, as if Amazon assumes everybody is already familiar with Alexa on some device (other Echo or tablet) or as if the Echos had become self-explanatory.

Is set-up easy for a newbie? For the most part, yes, but I'm not sure it would have been quite so easy if I had not read some of the reviews first. The instructions in the box are minimal, the most useful being that you need to know the password for your Wi-Fi. After plugging it in, we were greeted in German(!) but the screen display let us change the default language to English. Then you must enter the password for the Wi-Fi network you want to use. Alexa then informs you it will take about 10 minutes (which seemed fairly accurate) to download and install itself. The screen shows progress via a light bar circling around and status (updating, optimizing, checking for latest software).  Once it has finished, you'll see a brief intro video telling you all the wonderful things you can do.

It's at this point that I think several reviewers ran into trouble. What to do next? I'm not sure I would have known to swipe down from the top for settings without having known about it beforehand (even though I own 5 Fires and should know that by now). I suspect that the proverbial grandmother who is unfamiliar with touch devices might not have known when to touch, swipe, or press the check mark. These are, I think, relatively minor issues that could have been solved with either a few more written instructions (the booklet is so small many probably missed the 3rd "page" with the "instructions" about pulling down from the top) or a much better introductory video.

One example: changing the clock face. It had seemed to me that I could only choose analog or digital, not that I could change the clock theme (and there was no visible feedback when I selected digital). So I asked Alexa and she told me how to do it. The Spot still doesn't have a lot of theme choices but I'm guessing that will change in the future. (Oh, you can get rid of Trending Issues and cycling. Our Spot has a simple clock that dims when the lights are out and brightens up when the lights are on.)

12/28/2017 Update: There aren't a lot of options with the Echo Spot but after several problems setting up the theme background (choosing "Personal Photo" works only about 1% of the time) I want, and after reading a number of complaints, I reviewed the tiny booklet that comes with Spot and then went to Amazon's help section and looked at "all" the videos for the Spot. Note: Amazon, for the most part, doesn't even distinguish between the Show and the Spot. The videos are inadequate. To say the least. Some of the issues with setting up the Spot could be resolved by adding check boxes to the options rather than relying on touch or Alexa. But Amazon could probably solve most of its help desk issues by creating a simple text document that shows each Spot screen with the options and sub-options available so new users don't have to keep cycling through stuff trying to find what they want.

FUNCTIONALITY

The Spot is sort of a smaller Show or a bigger (and cuter) Dot with a screen. The speaker is surprisingly good for such a small device, although I doubt you would want to listen to opera on it (unless you attach a Bluetooth speaker). The screen is less than ideal for video (not so much because it is small as because it is round). But we've found the screen display of our music makes it easier to choose something than with the other Echos which rely on voice.

Our main reason for choosing the kitchen as the Spot's home was the idea that its screen would help with recipes. So, naturally, we thought "YouTube".  Unfortunately, whether because of device limitations or Amazon's current (Dec. 2017) feud with Google, YouTube is not available. Nevertheless, we were able to get several recipes simply by asking and YouTube doesn't have a monopoly on videos.

WAKE WORD

Well, having established Spot in the kitchen, we moved the "living room" Echo away from the TV and kitchen. And, guess what? Yep, both Spot and the "living room" Echo responded when we addressed Spot. So we changed Spot's wake word to "Echo".  Now we have 3 Echos that respond to "Alexa" and one that responds to "Echo" plus our tablets which respond to "Amazon".

I understand the logic behind having a single command word for all of one's devices, but there are circumstances where one wants to interact with only one specific device, whether it is near to one or somewhat distant. So, Amazon, if you're reading these reviews, a suggestion. First, we want to call Spot "Spot".  It fits. Second, how about a command hierarchy which would, for example, let us give a unique call word to each Echo with "Alexa" or "Alexa All" being the "all devices respond" command word. I haven't completely thought through how this would work, but device proximity isn't sufficiently discriminatory.

SUMMARY

1. Full Echo functionality in a tiny, good-looking package.

2. As currently designed, its most useful spot is probably the bedside table. It's not that it won't work on your desk or in the kitchen, only that the primary functions (alarm, weather, radio, phone) seem best suited for that location.

3. It's over-priced for what it does, but I am assuming the price will drop so I consider this simply an early-adopter issue.

4. Each of our Echos gets its electricity via an extension cord of some kind. Between the power cord's length and the AC adapter brick, well, either our apartment is remarkably deficient in electrical outlets or Amazon engineers have them spaced at table height at 3-foot intervals. This hadn't been more than a trivial annoyance (common to lots of electronic devices) until we decided to put Spot in the kitchen: the most useful locations were already in use by the microwave, toaster oven and mixer.  The one spot available doesn't affect its usefulness as a radio or clock or timer but does as a recipe aid.

5. Spot needs a battery. Desperately. By your bedside, you want your alarm clock/radio to work even when the electricity goes out at 4AM. (Which also means, of course, that some basic functionality shouldn't depend on Wi-Fi). In the kitchen, it would be great to be able to pick the Spot up and move it to wherever you are working. in addition, the most comfortable way to use Spot's touch functions is to pick him up and hold him in your hand. Doing this is not all that easy when the power cord is stretched to its limit ...  which is yet another reason why a well-designed battery base would be welcome.

If there are engineering reasons why Spot can't have a small internal battery, battery power could be built into a small base or stand. (I think some vendors have offered them for at least the Generation I Echos.) This would be useful especially IF Spot's alarm clock & radio functions weren't dependent on WiFi. (Maybe Amazon has heard of FM receivers?)

I was torn between 3 and 4 stars but decided that giving it 4 stars because it's adorable to look at was, well, somehow not professional, and, of course, there's the price. Spot's a nice addition to the Echo line with potential, either in its current implementation or in its next incarnation.

------------
*Oh, we still have real radios, timers and calculators in every room. None are dependent on the wi-fi working and most either run on batteries or have battery backup so they're useful even when the lights go out. So, yes, the Echos do rank as perhaps our most frivolous fourth-world purchases ever. But we wouldn't give them up.

author: Shawn Sutfin
title: I love the small size
content: I love the small size. It fits perfectly on my nightstand without taking up a lot of room. It's easy to use and set up. We have it hooked up to our lights which makes it so nice, and easy to turn lights on and off hands free. I can do everything on the spot I can do on the Show or Echo.

author: Oscar P. Pipkins
title: The Efficinator.
content: Made my life a lot more efficient while at my desk.

author: B KEITH SIBBETT
title: Nice but limited flexibility.
content: I wanted the spot to be a smart alarm clock. However the limited flexibility within the skills leaves me somewhat disappointed. Having to do practically everything by voice is annoying especially at night if your partner is asleep. I wouldn’t buy it again but will continue to use it. The fan sounds skill has been useful but I have to restart it every night and tell it to loop. Otherwise it turns off after an hour.

author: Bill Schreiber
title: Buy i
content: Does everything as advertised.

author: Katharine Meyers
title: LOVE
content: I got the spot for my bedroom and I love it. So easy to set the alarm, listen and change music while getting ready, and it's small and fairly inconspicuous.

author: Michael R
title: Best nightstand companion
content:
Replaced my Sony Clock/Radio circa 1993 with this. The voice commands including controlling smart lights is great.
The alarms are easy to set and there are many features to help you sleep. A great nightstand companion.

author: thatgirlrightthere
title: I am really having a hard time with Alexa not ...
content: I am really having a hard time with Alexa not responding at all. I have a wifi extender in my house to help the situation, but its not working so I will return her asap!

author: Swes
title: More than just an alarm clock!
content: Recently added the echo spot to my other echo devices at home and I love it. Replaced my digital alarm clock. I like the features of using it as an intercom with drop in and being able to to play music on all devices at once.

author: Caleb T.
title: A more compact, modern, artistic version of the Show!
content:
I installed this in my bedroom and have used it every single day since it’s arrival. It is basically the most high-tech alarm clock you could possibly have, that looks awesome as well.  It’s nice to glance over and see the time, the weather, and any other news updates that are trending that day.

I couldn’t be more pleased with it, I undoubtedly will be getting another one!

author: B. Wood
title: Love It
content: Besides my Echo Plus, this is my favorite. Whatever complaints about “things to try “, or whatever, must have been addressed. I don’t ever see this. I wouldn’t mind the ability to have the clock, day, and outside temp, on one screen. I can get the day to show, but it’s tiny. This is my primary alarm clock. I like how it goes into the red night mode. My old clock would light the room, even in night mode, and it had that awful classic alarm noise. The Spot has a progressive loudness and it has a series of pleasant sounds to pick from

author: MindSeedTV
title: Alexa is looking SEXY!
content:
4:050:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born?SubmitAdobe Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash Player Alexa is looking better than ever! I love having this little screen besides my bed!
Asking her to show me movie trailers, set alarms, and make calles has never been better!
I made a video review on this little guys! Check it out and I hope this helps one of you interested in buying
Cheers

author: Amazon Customer
title: This is the one electronic device you need in your home.
content: We purchased the Echo Spot two weeks ago. Have been extremely pleased and satisfied with our purchase. It was easy to set up and get running. User interface is unbelievably intuitive. Has a wide, wide range of capabilities and functions.

author: Annette
title: Picture is not great has a lag
content: I purchased this to talk to and see grandkids. The lag on this is terrible so half the time we miss what each other are saying and the picture is just ok. Wish I would have purchased a different video chat item.

author: Zamir
title: it's awesome but...
content: does everything I expected and more. the only disappointment is that it doesn't support the country I'm in so I needed to do some hacking to install the app for my smartphone and activate all of it's features..

author: Sean & Tiffany
title: Just get an Echo Show...
content: Too small... even for a nightstand. Normal 16:9 (widescreen) video is either shrunk or cut off to fit the screen making it far inferior to the Echo Show... we returned ours an replaced it with a Show. Screen, speakers, and mic are all better, and for only $50 more (as of this writing)… well worth it for us.

author: Erik Leo
title: no 24 hour time
content: Pretty disappointed that this is the newest and most expensive clock in my apartment and the only one that can't do 24 hour time.

author: K. Benoit
title: Google has more knowledge than Alexa
content: Its ok but i mainly use it for a timer or for the weather.

author: Deebo
title: Not much for the price
content: First of all, I am a big fan of Alexa and we have many Echo devices around the house. I bought this Echo spot thinking the size with the screen would fit nicely in the living room where we can display pictures, view information...etc. while still have a good alexa device for home automation purposes. It turns out the screen is way too small for anyone to read from 1+ foot away and I have 20/20 vision. For the price I paid for it, I would've been able to get 4 Echo dot devices, so def not worth the money. Either buy the normal Echo devices or go for the Echo Show (I don't like it's size).

author: The Zigster
title: Wanted to replace my ancient clock radio, BUT ---
content: I have my clock radio programmed to wake me up to a local news radio station (WCBS 880 AM) so I can get weather, traffic & local news info. I was hoping to be able to do the same with the Echo Spot. Unfortunately, Alexa devices can only set alarms based on radio stations that exist on TuneIn, and all of my local news stations have moved to Radio.com. Frustratingly, I can tell Alexa to play WCBS 880 AM, but I can't set an alarm based on it! So while I think the Spot is adorable and *should* make a great clock radio, it's not fulfilling this most obvious function for me. AMAZON - PLEASE FIX!!!

author: Mines1975
title: I think the product is great. The only thing I really think is annoying ...
content: I think the product is great.  The only thing I really think is annoying is not being able to turn off  the "things to try".

author: manor645
title: Very convenient!
content: Have the Echo show and video chat to my daughter all the time, she has one also. She wanted an Echo spot and asked me if I wanted one and I said no. Then she surprised me and ordered her and myself one. I really didn't see the need for one beings I have all the echo products except that one but I love it!! Have it on the nightstand next to my bed. Can video chat on it, watch videos while laying in bed, use it for alarm clock and wake up to the morning local news. Ordered a stand from Amazon that adjusts the spot in different directions. I wish I would have got the spot a long time ago, I just love it!!

author: maryz
title: The Echo...An Easy Way to Get Information Quickly
content: We like that we are able to get weather and other information quickly.  You can even hear music played. The speaker is clear.  We are enjoying it.  What we did not like because it was creepy was that the day before my husband played a particular song on our stereo for me.  The next day, I asked the Echo to play music from the same artist not specifying any particular song.  The Echo played the exact song by that same artist that my husband played on our stereo the day before.  It was a little disconcerting.

author: angieparsley
title: Great sound and cute too.
content: Love my echo spot.

author: G. Dern
title: Love my Echo
content: love this i can do almost everything:) havent had any problems an ive had it 5 months now an still works good.

author: CactusMomma
title: Greaet video calls!
content: This is a welcome addition to my Echo family. I'm a fan! I enjoy using this to make video calls to my family, and it has great sound when I play music throughout the house. Better sound than the Echo dots, so it's on my desk where I use those features most. Love that I can use one of my own photos for the clock background screen, silly me. Am considering getting another one for the den!

author: HRGApollo
title: Couldn't be happier...
content: Bought as a gift for my wife. She loves it... It's the only alarm clock she's ever really liked. She says it's "small, cute, friendly & smart" just like her.

author: KMY
title: I love it. It is so easy to
content: I love it.  It is so easy to use

author: Joyce Waltz
title: other purchases required
content: you will have to purchase smart light bulbs and they are not cheep.  Then you will have to download another app and any way if you are not as smart as your grandchildren, well it is not as easy as it sounds.

author: KAREN, TX
title: Love It!
content: Another great product from Amazon! My house is full of these things!

author: Sean S.
title: Big Disappointment
content: This was a Christmas gift from my daughter.  I am an owner of numerous Echo devices and all have worked flawlessly out of the box.  This device was the exception.  After numerous times over multiple WiFi networks the device would not complete its set up routine and would terminate trying to download updates saying network connection was lost.  All of the networks I attempted to use for the setup had other devices (including 2 Echo's and an Echo Dot) connected to them but this device would not connect.  I wasted over an hour on the phone with an Amazon Help Desk person who was no help at all and was clearly following a script.  Also, without You Tube capability this device is essentially an expensive alarm clock.  My other Echo's work and sound just fine so this device is being returned to Amazon by my daughter.

author: DCW
title: Expensive marketing crap
content:
Just another conduit into your home for Amazon’s lazy Marketing team:/

You want to have control over a product you purchased and turn off “Things to try”?  Well, according to Amazon, too bad.  You’ll get that on rotation (without any pre-purchase disclaimer) whether you want it (who would?!?) or not (I do not!!)

The bad:
Already mentioned above, you get what Amazin wants you to have the way they want you to get it, period.
Alexa software = crap.  Worst UI since Phillips! Not user friendly in the least.
Would you like to learn more about “Things to try”, good because you will be seeing a lot of it on this device, don’t like it? Sucks to be you (yeah, I’m hammering home this point)
Speaker, better than the dot but could have been a lot better for the price range

The good:
Alexa voice controls responsive
Plays music
Good alarm features
Easy to see in dark or fully lit room

Bottom line: avoid this product at all costs.

If you get one as a gift this year, I’d strongly recommend sending it back.
Don’t purchase this until Amazon learns that we’re buying devices for OUR use, not to make their sales jobs easier.

author: Jmcm
title: Screen is small but easy to view
content: This little Echo Spot looks nice on my white counter. I can see the weather at a glance,play my favorite tunes,although sound quality could be a bit better. Love the clock faces. When I look at the Spot it will show suggestions of what you can ask or get. It is an Alexa in a clock. I am more apt to use it as it sits out on my counter top. I did get the matching stand,but feel they could have tossed that in with the deal. I also purchased a screen protector. Glad I purchased this souped up clock,I really do enjoy it.

author: Jeannie Scott
title: EXCELLENT SIZE FOR SMALL SPACES
content: EXCELLENT SIZE FOR NIGHT STAND I USE IT FOR AN ALARM CLOCK AND TIMER AND REMINDER IT'S GREAT I'M A ALEXA FAN ADDICTED LOL

author: Midieval
title: Can't disable things to try
content: Till they disable things to "try this thing " is horrible. I know all the things it tells me already . Until they disable this echo spot gets 1 star . Also needs a digital face with bigger numbers. Considering returning.

author: Blacksmithking
title: The Spot is the best alarm clock I've ever owned
content: The Spot is the best alarm clock I've ever owned. It sets its clock by itself. I can use voice commands to cancel or schedule alarms. I wish the screen were bigger, though, and I'd like a physical switch for the camera.

author: Stewart
title: I read and watch alot of reviews before I purchased ...
content: I read and watch alot of reviews before I purchased the Echo Spot. I lived up up to they all said. I use it as clock for my bedroom. And to check weather, traffic and news briefing in the morning. At night to control lights throughout my house.

author: Vicki M.
title: Information at a moment's notice....lightning speed with answers to your requests.
content: I love having the Echo Spot beside my bed. I use it for my alarm, news, weather, music and I can also check in with other friends and family. It is so convenient and very useful. I ask it for many types of questions and events. I cannot say enough good things about it. 💖

author: AJ
title: Great (if pricey) addition to the Echo family!
content:
I'm so happy with my Echo Spot!  I needed a replacement for my dying clock radio, and it frees up space on my bedside table, so I count that as a win. It also replaces a 1st generation Echo (which I've moved elsewhere), which I used for music, weather, and alarms/timers.

The setup was quick and easy, though it took me a while to figure out how to turn off the annoying time/weather/try-this scrolling. There isn't a great selection of clock-face choices, but I'm happy with the one I picked....and really.....I just need to know what time it is (I use the digital display). As other reviewers have noted, the sound quality isn't as good as the old Echo, but based on its size, I wasn't expecting that it would be. I suppose I could always connect it to a better speaker via Bluetooth, but I haven't tried that yet. After having it for a few days, I did decide to buy the stand (sold separately.....Grrrrr), since it makes for a better viewing angle, and slightly better sound quality (since it's not sitting directly on the table surface). I've opted to turn off a few features, e.g., the camera, which I probably will never use.

There are a couple of items I'd change: 1) it would be nice to be able to have the time display in a larger font, so I could see it without needing my glasses, 2) after starting to play your music selection, it stays in 'music,' and you have to either tell it to go back to 'home,' or touch the display and select the 'home' icon. Perhaps these capabilities will arrive in a future software update...or perhaps I haven't dug deeply enough into the settings menu yet....

However, despite its cost, I'm extremely happy with my Spot, and would recommend it to others.

author: Michelle Andersen
title: A great alarm clock!
content: I am really excited about this new addition to my room. It plays the music I want, lets me watch a video if I want and is a great alarm clock. Compact too.

author: igor
title: Mehh
content: First impressions are important. This one failed the first time for me, after all the updates and downloads. It just wouldn't respond. I love the Amazon show though, so i'm just returning this one.

author: Tommy Rojas
title: Five Stars
content: I love this “spot “ it works well with the original one and my wife loves it.

author: Brian Young
title: Echo Spot - Just about right
content: Really like the Echo Spot.  Took some time to get it to see other Echo device; but, works very well once I did.  Think I had wrong email address loaded.  Its a perfect size and easily goes with room décor. Would be nice if I could integrate it into the house phone line.  Suspect there is a way; but, not a high priority right now.  Needs more clock faces.  Anyway, very good addition to the Echo family.

author: Brad Willey
title: A+++++
content: Another addition to our echo family. Works seamlessly with other alexa based products. A true homerun from Amazon.

author: Mike
title: Very happy with my Spot
content:
Very happy with my Spot.
There have been so many people unhappy with the rotation of information all that is needed is: This is so easy to correct. Just set to rotate cards once and that’s it. Only clock will show or you can say ‘’Turn screen off’’ and it will appear to be off until you touch it or give it a command.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very handy
content: Great for bedside use - very convenient. I don't use the camera but having the display is handy for quick-glance stuff like weather. Mics don't seem to be as sensitive as a regular Dot, but good enough for bedside use.

author: Jeesee
title: Not great with Blink cameras
content: I purchased the Echo Spot to use as a way to look at the Blink cameras I was ordering.  This is not a good use for the Echo Spot.  The picture is just OK and the Echo Spot leaves a lot to be desired for normal Echo audio quality.  It is also not a good alternative to an alarm clock - the clock face is hard to see at night and it cycles through other info making the time even harder to read and find.

author: jantchr132
title: Excellent to keep tabs on your kiddos
content: Absolutely love this device-perfect for my kids’ rooms!

author: Vicky
title: I loves gadgets and would like to get them in every room in my house
content: Wish I could take it everywhere! I’ve got one in my office, in my bedroom and the large screen echo in my kitchen so it can show me recipes. I loves gadgets and would like to get them in every room in my house!

author: Larry P. Brown
title: DO NOT BUY THIS PIECE OF JUNK!!!
content: If you want to buy from Amazon from this device great this is for you but if you want to have this device help you forget it. Just a piece of junk.

author: Timothy Chen Allen
title: Great device! Love tinkering with it.
content: I love it: clock faces, lyrics, reminders and events are all very cool. Multi-room music with my other devices is AWESOME! Things I want: Voice control of night mode, and better auto-dim sensitivity. Overall, fun to try new things and tinker with it.

author: Antoinette H.
title: Useful device
content: Useful device...  Love the “launch briefing” capability

author: robert
title: Can't Go Wrong Buying This Product
content: This product exceeded my expectations.  So much so I bought another for another bedroom, and plan on buying another for "away from home" office.  Excellent product.

author: Steven Jay Yagerman
title: Has all the Echo functionalities, plus video.  Same size as an alarm clock and can be used as such and much more!
content: The Echo Spot is another great addition to the Echo/Alexa line-up.  So far I am still learning how to best use it’s visual features, so,I can’t say too much about that, except so far so good!  For fun I have tried watching a movie on it and the screw and its desktop location make extended viewing a little less than captivating or immersive. I agree that the sound quality is above the dot and below the full sized Echo.  The next thing I am looking forward to is getting a remote camera to monitor the front door.  Of course some things can be done just as well with a smartphone, like video conferencing, so the question is, how will it’s smart features augment your home or Office.  Personally, I like it and look forward to developing my uses for it.

author: StevenM
title: Alexa is way over rated.
content:
Don't like any of the Alexa products I've purchased.  Every time you ask her to do or change anything, she tells you to go to the App on your phone to do it.  So I have an voice recognition assistant that tells me to "Go do it yourself!".  Tell her to Don't ever play any Ed Sheeran, and she says "I don't know any Ed Sheeran."  I pay for I Heart Radio, and Alexa won't play my Playlists or Albums, only stations, and gives me limited skips, as if I have a free account.  I set IHR as my default, but unless I tell her to play something on IHR, she defaults to Amazon Music.  I have 3 Alexa items in the house, but to be able to listen to different music on each I had to pay more for an upgraded music account.  IHR I can play different music on all three devices, but have to be specific, and its limited.
My 4k Samsung Smart TV, PS4 and Satellite receiver all work well together, they can turn each other on and off, they play games together, but Alexa doesn't play well with them, and all the add-ons to try to get the TV to work are sketchy looking.
Tried to set up Voice recognition for my kids, but couldn't figure out how to get it to work, mostly it kept sending me to add another adult account.  I called customer support and spoke to a man who didn't speak enough English to understand what I was asking help with.  Spent most of the time on hold, every time I asked a question he would say just one moment, then ten minutes later would comeback with a vague answer, that wasn't really about what I was asking.  After 40 or so minutes, the best I got was 'I don't think it can do that."
Most of the Apps are just Gimmicky junk, I haven't found anything all that useful, unless you want some pre-programmed goofy responses, or play some dumb games.  Might be good for Smart Home, but I don't have any Smart Home stuff, but she can't even control my TV, so...

author: Meghan McC.
title: Clutch
content: A must have for your home... keeps you updated on your surroundings and news around the world.  Volume is great, but hooked it up to my bluetooth speaker anyway.  Love love love

author: PD
title: Rough Start to my echo spot
content:
Wanted mainly as a talking alarm clock. The first time I set it, never went off. The second time I tried to set it, Echo kept saying 'The Alarm is set for..."(no time) when I asked what time the alarm was set for right after I set it. It didn't go off.
Then I started playing around, setting both timers and alarms , which never went off. The timer would accurately keep the countdown if you asked, but not make a peep when the alarm expired. Every time I set the alarm, asked what time I set it for I would get the 'The Alarm is set for..."(no time). It was more like "The alarm is seh for..." It sounded truncated and weird. I reset the unit to factory. The alarm still did not work properly. Reset again before I called Amazon. (theres nothing on this issue that I could find on the internet btw) After the SECOND factory reset, the alarm works. As it always has on my Echo Dot.
The internet connection was fine throughout. Kept checking that to see if that was the issue. Always connected.
anyway. hope this helps someone. IF I was wasn't a nerd, the unit would have gone back right away.

author: Nita Simms
title: If you don't video chat often, just get an echo dot
content:
Pros: you can video chat, it has great voice range, it's a cool clock, and overall cool looking. Really minimalist like.

Cons: Alexa can't operate without wi-fi, even if you're just trying to set an alarm. I can't connect to some wi-fi depending on the set up. It's not portable, so it always has to be plugged into an outlet.

Overall, it's a great gift for a teen or an adult. Not necessarily for younger kids because they'll get bored with it.

author: Bill Abrams
title: Echo Spot is Awesome
content: The Spot is my 7th Echo device installed in my home. Stationed in master bedroom to control lights there and to drop in on our Echo Show in living room. Lots of fun

author: lisa kravitz
title: Very disapointing
content: I bought the echo spot to view my living room. The camera is on top of the echo which was bad on their part because the video is too high if you want to look in a couch or chair. It will aim up towards ceiling which is useless. I paid an extra $22 for the adjustable stand which didn’t bring the camera down much lower. Total disappointment.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Wonderful addition to the product line
content:
Great device. Already had three "Dots," so I pretty much knew how to operate the device out of the box. Setup was very easy. Many options, including "brightness," "themes," "volume."  For those (many) complaining about the screen scrolling, here is the "fix:"
  Drag a finger down from the top of the device. This opens a display with three icons at top and an adjustment bar for the brightness level. Select the "gear" icon on the right, then select "home and clock," then "home cards," and finally " "rotate once."  The display will rotate through the screens one time and then stay on the home screen. Many other options to explore.

author: Chance Selvidge
title: Love it!
content:
I love this device! It's so great. What a great alarm clock and what a surprisingly good speaker! Only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because it needs to have a few more features like playing YouTube videos, and Google play music. The camera is not very good in low light if you decide to drop in and it's dark in the room.
Other than those minor things, I love it. Great buy and would buy again

author: DV

content: Love it!  Small, but mighty!  Love having a clock with temperature always available, but also Alexa to answer any questions or help with other smart devices.

author: Jeff
title: Great device, but issues with alarm required factory reset.
content:
Bought two for primary use as alarm clocks.  Alarm doesn’t work for either one.  Alexa acknowledges that alarm is set.;  phone app shows its set, but nothing happens.

Revised:  To Amazon’s credit , they attempted to reach me within hours of me posting a 1 star review.  I was at work and unable to take the phone calls. I appreciate the excellent customer service.  I followed instructions posted in online forums and performed a factory reset which fixed the problem.  The device is excellent, but the hassle of having to fix something out of the box kept me from rating it higher.

The Echo Spot is awesome.
It replaced my alarm clock and the bedside phone. It plays the newsfeeds I want to hear. It gives me the local temperature and weather as I dress to go out. It plays the music I’m in the mood to hear. It controls the bedside lamp with a few words. It can adjust the house thermostat if my schedule requires it. It has a small footprint, too, and a modern look I like.

The speaker is on the bottom and the spot does sound better when the speaker is not directly on the countertop. It will sound even better with the Spot stand. The only down side, the Spot stand should be included. It should not be an additional $19. Well, after using my Amazon Spot for five months my device does not always respond to me. So, still was not wanting to spend $20 on the Spot stand. I decided to do a DIY stand. It works better. author: BobbyG
title: Great mid range smart speaker with useful screen
content: Works really well, understands commands from way across rooms, speakers are good for music, been playing lots of Christmas music. Not so good - still no u tube, weather Rader has no zoom or local area. Good phone call drop in, two timers is useful. Bought kids one too.

author: B. Shamford
title: Great first Echo with a few limitations
content:
I have spent about 3 weeks with this now and I really enjoy it so far. The Spot is not perfect, the screen is round but most content is square, there is less home screen customization than I would hope for and there are still limitations on what it can do. I suggest checking out IFTTT to add functionality to your Alexa by connecting with other apps you may already use. For example, I linked my Alexa todos with my Apple ical calendar which isn't available directly from the Amazon software.

I keep the Spot in my kitchen to entertain me while I cook with music and news. It does the basics really well, though you can't ask questions with any complexity. I like that if I ask for something that is covered by a skill I don't have I have the option to download it on the spot. For example, I asked for a TED talk and it downloaded the TED skill so I could ask for various talks in the future. The sound quality is good enough to fill a large kitchen or kitchen and living room even, but not good enough for a party or really rocking out.

All in all, I am happy with this device and it is WAY better than Siri on my phone. I think there are several features I am not yet aware of that will also add to my enjoyment in the future.

author: Peacemaker 12
title: Great family connector!
content: I love my Echo Spot! A family member gifted us with it. A fabulous tool for keeping all the family in touch with instant video calling! In addition, the tiny size makes the Spot a perfect unobtrusive clock, speaker for NPR, music, shopping list maker, etc. I have a large Echo and Dogs in other rooms, but the Spot is my favorite.
