author: Anon.
title: What’s not to love? I’ve had an Echo Dot for a year
content:
What’s not to love? I’ve had an Echo Dot for a year, but the Spot surpasses it in every way! I wanted a second Alexa device and couldn’t decide between this or another Dot. At first I didn’t think a screen would be such a huge difference to justify the extra cost, but I was very wrong. I bought two of them and one is in my bedroom and one is in my kitchen. The Spot will do everything your non-screen Alexa devices will do plus the following, which for me justify the extra cost of the screen for me:
LISTS: You can create your own lists and add items on both by saying “add passport to my packing list”, but on the Spot it will show you the whole list on the screen after adding it. You can also ask the Spot “show me my packing list” to see entire list on screen, where you can delete directly from screen, as in after you packed passport.
REMINDERS: When you add a reminder (like remind me to take out trash at 7am), the Dot will chime & state the reminder only once at 7am, but if you’re not around to hear it you’ll miss it. After adding a reminder to your Spot, it will chime the same as the Dot at the right time but if you are not there to hear it, a visual reminder stays on the screen until you dismiss it by either saying the word “dismiss” or you swipe up on the screen.
TIMERS: Much better than the Dot, especially for kitchen because you can add multiple timers and see all timers in motion all at once. Same as alarms and reminders, you can say “dismiss” or swipe screen up.
ALARMS: It’s easy to see if alarms are set or not just by looking at the screen as it shows up on home clock. You can also set multiple alarms, weekday or weekend, etc. I would never rely on the Dot for an alarm without feeling like I had to check the App on my phone many times to confirm alarm was set. Not anymore as it’s visible on the main screen.
TRACKING AMAZON PACKAGES: When you ask “where’s my stuff?”, both the Dot & Spot will say where your Amazon package is but the Spot will show you pictures of the items you ordered on the screen.
FLASH BRIEFING: I haven’t found many Video flash briefings to love yet except for Jimmy Fallon’s monologue and even though the screen’s small, it’s still watchable.
HOME SCREEN: Many reviews complain that the Spot won’t stay on the clock face, that it continually cycles through a few screens. There is an option to make it only cycle through your home cards (clock, weather, reminders, etc) once and then it stays on the clock until you wake it up. I chose the analog clock and can read it from any distance while in the room.
MUSIC: I have Amazon Prime so can access all music with Prime. The cool feature on the Spot is that it will show the artist or album cover and then show the lyrics as you hear them, your very own Karaoke machine. Another difference on the Spot is regarding choosing music to play. You can say “show me albums by Coldplay” and it will bring up 16 albums that you can swipe to see all albums and pick the one you want. You can also do the same with playlists if you’ve made them.
VIDEOS: Not sure I would ever watch a movie/tv show I’ve never seen before on such a little screen, but it’s great to have on in background while doing other things. While cleaning kitchen I can re-watch The Newsroom or Suits and the Spot is much louder than my iPad or laptop and I can even hear it while washing dishes. It’s the same process as finding music to play. When you say, “show me all episodes of The Newsroom Season 1”, the Spot will then show you each episode on a separate screen so you just scroll to choose which one to watch.
JEOPARDY: Same game as played on the Dot, but the Spot will show you the answer as well (Eye of the Tiger)
OVERALL: Love it! If you are already familiar with Alexa devices, I can’t imagine you won’t love this Echo Spot!

author: Andrew Schutt
title: Don’t trust it as an alarm clock!
content: Really wanted to love this and have enjoyed it up until we set an alarm for the morning and it never went off. Thinking I did something wrong, I went into the history on the Alexa app on my phone and confirmed the night before where it recorded me saying “set and alarm for 4:30 in the morning” and could see where it confirmed and set an alarm for 4:30 in the morning. The problem? 4:30 rolled around and nothing. 5:55 rolled around and you see the next thing in my Alexa history is a recording of me saying “Alexa, what time is it?” To which she responds and a frantic me misses a flight. I replaced my old reliable alarm clock with this and now I have to set a backup alarm every night because I can never trust this alone. Will be replacing. Can’t work with trust issues. Amazon couldn’t troubleshoot beyond saying “it’s working now right?” Well, yes, it is...for now...hence trust issues. If you want this as an alarm clock, don’t, I repeat do not! I missed a flight. What will you miss? And no, there were no power failures overnight.

I use the Spot primarily as a smart alarm clock and it’s absolutely perfect for that.  I’d recommend (and have several times) this to anyone wanting a quality smart alarm clock or just prefers a visual display instead of the standard Echo Dot hockey puck design.

author: LiquidSteam
title: Amcrest camera integration
content:
READ THIS REVIEW IF YOU WANT TO USE ECHO VIDEO WITH AMCREST CAMERAS

I just set this up today. This is my 5th Echo device but my first device with a video screen. I bought the "spot" (vs the show) for a couple reasons.

1. I feel like Amazon is going to be coming out with a 2nd gen "show" very soon and I don't want to spend $230 only to have my show be outdated in 6 months.
2. The "spot" is new and its generation life should last at least 18-24 months

I wanted a video screen Echo to use in our home office as a baby monitor. We currently use an Amcrest camera and our iPhones and Ipads to video monitor the babies room. While it works great it has the downside of using your phone battery up and the feed shuts down during phone calls. When I read that Alexa devices support Amcrest cameras I thought I wanted to give it a try.

Setup was easy except for 1 small kink. The camera firmware needed to be updated. Now this is not a review on Amcrest cameras so I won't go into details but it did extend my setup time by about 30 minutes. The basic setup through the Amcrest cloud app and the Alexa App was quite easy.
Very self explanatory for those that have delved into Amcrest cameras and Alexa previsouly

The screen is very nice. You can find the specs yourself but I'll say that to the eye it looks crisp clear and bright (unlike our last Amazon screen device the Fire HD 8 6th gen)

This sits on our home office desk and a quick "Alexa show me babies camera" and 5 seconds later we are up and running. The camera we are using is currently only 720p but with such a small screen it looks great. I'm curious to see how our 2k and 4k cameras would look on the Echo Show.
The integration with the Amcrest cloud is smooth but limited. What I mean is they give you access to ONE camera only for free. If you want more it will cost you a monthly service fee. I won't get into what you get for the money but I'll link their website incase you would like to see it yourself.

Yes I know there are options available for less money that can handle the baby monitor setup I just made with the Echo spot. However we wanted an Alexa in the office anyway and we already had the Amcrest camera in the baby room so it just made sense in our situation.

Setting this Echo up with the camera connection has me thinking about using it on all the security cameras. It would be great when there's a bump in the night (which we have had a couple times) to be able to say "Alexa show me security cameras" and have all of our camera feeds display on the bedroom TV or on an Echo show type device at the bedside. Currelty we need to grab the phone, enter passcode, open the Amcrest app, then open the cameras you want to see. It doesn't seem like much... BUT, When you wake up out of a deep sleep by a loud crash and glass breaking down stairs (yes this happen to us twice) every little thing you do seems to take FOREVER! Not only that but you are multitasking, you want to get the phone ready to call the police if needed, you've gotta open the safe and grab your weapon, open the security cameras, all while half asleep in the dark with blurry vision (or almost blind if you are my wife who has 20/400 vision).

That scenario could be in the future but for right now we are happy with our single Amcrest camera connection to Alexa and the spot itself works great in this case.

The reason for only four stars is the terrible speaker. Presumably you will buy the "Spot" to watch video of some kind. Video chat, news updates, streaming a local camera feed.... with all these things you'll need sound or at least want sound. I don't ding the DOT for poor sound because I use it for the microphone only basically. Home control ect. I do use 1 DOT for music but I have it connected to a JBL Pulse 3 external speaker. But the "Spot" is used differently as stated. Now I wanted to get the "Show" at first because of the larger screen and I read that the speakers are bigger and better. But as I stated already I went with the "Spot" for now. The speaker is basically garbage. I'm guessing its the same speaker as the "Dot" although I didn't bother to confirm that. If you have the "Dot" already you'll know what to expect for sound with the "Spot"

author: R. DesRochers
title: Can’t think of a single complaint! Love it!
content: From checking my front door cam from being able to read the lyrics of my new hit song, the spot takes Alexa to the next level!

author: JP
title: I love this as a bedside clock, but...
content:
Wow, I've been searching for a clock to go next to the bed and the echo spot filled that need perfectly. The screen is easy to read especially in night mode which keeps the room dark but still displays time.  I'm able to control my zwave switches and lights, as well as check the weather as I wake up. I love this thing. Everything's been going great for a month of use until this morning at 2AM.

So, apparently every single process this device makes is in the cloud. At about 2AM I woke to see the clock wasn't in its normal night mode, but in regular bright mode and the time says 6:50. After a short but intense panic attack I realize that the clock is simply wrong. The clock remained at the 6 o'clock hour, cycling through the minutes but never advancing an hour.  It went back to 6:00 after rolling over 6:59. This happened on 11/27/2018.

Is there any chance we can suggest that the clock function be processed at home in the device? Failing to display the correct time due to a disconnect seems....well...it seems like a glaring issues that can be easily fixed. I'm assuming my router has finally given out as it does every 2 years which has been the cause of the problems. This gives me great pause in relying on this clock for anything other than a time display. I'm not sure I'll ever trust it for an alarm.

The way I remedied the problem was by changing the access point to which the Spot connects. Definitely a connection problem causing issues a connection problem has no business causing.

author: Karl
title: Not happy
content: Will not disconnect from Bluetooth so I can use my phone instead.  When WiFi goes down it will not release Bluetooth connections when you ask it.  You have to unplug it from wall.  They send all data to cloud servers so if it can’t connedt to WAN then Alexa locks everything out.  Hay geniuses??  How do I turn my lights on when echo has no WAN connection!??  Seriously, this is rediculous.  Try some LAN abilities for us people who know stuff

author: Steve Harper
title: Excellent Product
content:
The Echo Spot was our first experience with Alexza.  We use it as an alarm clock and play music through it.

We purchased An Echo Show two months later. They are excellent products.

author: Bill
title: Good but too restrictive on what the screen shows.
content: The spot works just fine but I really don’t like the fact that I can’t get rid of the Alexa suggestions. I would like the ability to just have it show the time, or the timer, or the weather. That is really a bad feature. Hope Amazon fixes that.

author: Amazon Customer

content: Still quite a bit to explore. It is very responsive and works well between my wife and I. It is fun to simply greet Alexa with a good evening, morning, or night. The scrolling display is by far the best feature to keep time and weather simply and easily available without other interaction. This replaced a defunct Sony Dash and does it very well.

author: Baji L Mihaly
title: Not enough help received
content: The little booklet "Ask Alexa" is not enough to start effectively to use this device. Like the main reason i have bought it to connect with my wife "calling and messaging" but so far i could not figure out how to do... Please give out more information!

author: J. Bloom
title: Love this!
content: As with all echo devices, this is really easy to use.  The device is well thought-out.  It’s a great nightstand companion.  Videos are small, but they work great.  Need YouTube back.

author: Juan C.
title: Awesome gadget! Alexa users is a Must!!!
content: Thanks amazon for An amazing product. I’ve had plenty of smart clocks and devices and it looks awesome in my night stand. It has all features of Alexa with a lot more of design and functionality. Please keep doing amazing products!

author: Laurelp52
title: Makes CALLS! Wow, so many capabilities!
content: I use the Alexa app on my phone (which does not have cell service anymore) and I can call my contacts. At first I thought I could only call my home echo "Alexa, call home". But I can call ANY of my contacts also. I can also use my Google phone number for people to call me. My google phone# is set up to ring my home phone, which is connected to my echo Show. Wow, I may decide not get a new cell service provider! I listen to Ocean waves going to sleep, and play Bird sounds in the morning, sometimes rain forest sounds also. I've tried "BluePrints", which is really fun. I taught it say "She pooped on the rug again", when I say "Alexa, bad Tessa", ha,ha.

author: Tomas Curbelo
title: Compatibility
content: Amazon is going in the right direction on home automatization. We would like that video calls can communication with other available video calling applications

author: Douglas Graber
title: Good for drop in on kids. Has to be set up just right to see though.
content: Works pretty good. I like the ability to drop in to see what my kids are doing. Would be ice if the camera had a little more range. I have to have it set low and tilted so that it sees the room. No complaints others.

author: Francisco
title: Five Stars
content: Great looking gadget I use it all the time! I love that I can see my security cams

author: Jasolds
title: Nice replacement for a bedroom alarm clock...
content: This is a pretty cool product, but could use some tweaking. I use it in the bedroom and that’s really the only place I’d put one. If you want something for any other room I’d just with the echo dot or echo itself.

author: David P.
title: Great Alexa device
content: Great Alexa device. Works just like the other echo devices. Voice control for music, lights, and air. The video chat is great. The visual time and timer are helpful.

author: Shannon Hodgkins
title: Convenient device
content: Such a fun, easy, and convenient device to have around the house. No need to pick up my phone to look something up, just a few words and the world is at your fingertips. The speaker puts off great sound and the screen is crisp. The price is right for a device like this.

author: Beverly
title: Awesome
content: Just amazed at all I can do, from jepordy, alarms , timer, weather

author: PMoore
title: Great gadget!
content: Easy to install and fun source of info!

author: Michael
title: Does not work
content: Does not work with Echo. No support Needs constant rebooting

author: A. T.
title: Convenient
content: I like the daily updates and tips displayed on the Spot. I like that it has time and temperature on the  display. I use it in my kitchen to listen to  music or audiobooks while I am working in the kitchen. I have also used it to call other Alexa devices in my home so I don’t have to yell to get someone’s attention.

author: printeruser
title: Perfect Alarm Clock Plus So Much More!!
content: So far it is really, really cool! I had been searching for the right alarm clock, but had not been able to find one. The Echo Dot is perfect! It is small and is quite an amazing variation of my original Echo. So glad I purchased this. Thank you Amazon! You read my mind...again.

author: Kary
title: I love my Spot
content: The only problem I’m having with it right now is being able to use a playlist that I created for an alarm. I’ve tried so many times and it just uses a different playlist from Amazon music. I love my Spot lol

author: knoxmom
title: Great Little Electronic
content: Love this item! The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is because the sound fell below my expectations. I have the original Echo and would advise to stick with it if you are seeking a quality Bluetooth speaker. The Echo Spot has some nice features and serves well as a bedroom clock/speaker/assistant!

author: E. Dodd
title: when it gets to the good parts, I actually watch it
content: I can use it for everything my echo dot does and I can use it to "watch" my video collection on Amazon! The word "watch" is in quoations because I don't focus my attention on the movie (the screen is a bit small for that) but rather I have it playing in the background, when it gets to the good parts, I actually watch it! In the meantime, I listen to the music. In addition, unlike the echo dot, I get graphics with things like the weather report! So I feel I have definitely taken it the next level!

author: A. Kressly
title: Easy to set up
content: I bought 4 spots so my family can all stay connected. They were a huge hit.

author: Bryant
title: Mid-tier echo device with cool features. Amazing potential here
content:
This is a cool new addition to the echo family and about the size of a softball. I have had other echo products including multiple Dots and a first-generation Echo and I'd consider this a mid-tier device that’s better than a Dot but below a regular Echo (I know this has a lot more features with the screen but I’ll get to that later in the review). I am relating this to other echo devices for comparison purposes, but the screen could make this it's own category of device. I’m constantly finding new features and will update this review periodically (especially as new screen features become available). Overall, I’m impressed with my initial experience of the Spot and more excited for the potential... but IF developers don’t come through this could be a big letdown.

Audio - I am impressed with the audio quality of this and would put it closer to the Echo than the Dot. When playing music, you can quickly tell that the Spot was designed as a standalone audio device (which we know was not the case initially with the Dot). The Spot will never sound as good as an Echo but you can tell thought was put into the sound quality to enhance the experience while trying to keep the footprint as small as possible. The speaker is bigger than the Dot and music doesn’t sound drowned out like it does on the Dot. Obviously, they are not fitting a subwoofer in this tiny package so it won’t have the range of an Echo, but I don’t think that was ever the expectation. If you are only looking for audio quality this wouldn't be your go-to product to begin with.

Alexa – This device uses the enhanced version of far field voice technology and seems to pick up the wake word much easier than my first-gen Echo or any of the Dots. There are 4 microphones on the top of the Spot to pick up your wake word.I feel that I don’t have to yell like is needed sometimes with the older echo products.

Display - I haven’t seen any glitches or had any trouble with the display yet. The screen is a good size and I feel that if it were any bigger it’d feel too bulky. The whole device is about the size of a softball. My only minor complaint about the screen is the shape. I’m a bit torn on this complaint because I do like the uniqueness of it when I have the clock face displayed, but when looking at a news clip or camera the picture shrinks to fit the widescreen display into a circular screen. Not that it’s bad, but it’s just different from other display screen we use day to day.

New Features – The biggest selling point of the Spot to me is the screen and all the possibilities of features that come along with it. I have never used a EchoShow so I can’t compare this to that, but from feedback I've seen I don’t think the Show caught on as much as Amazon had hoped, so I think this will be a cost-effective introduction to most people to an Echo with a screen. There are infinite possibilities of things to do now that Alexa has a display and I am finding new features each time I play with the device.  There are honestly too many features to go through, but I personally use this on my nightstand as my new alarm clock and can see the time, make video calls, ect… The POSSIBLE uses are endless and I’m excited to see what new features will be available going forward. My only complaint about the features is that there are not enough yet. I know the idea of a screen on an Alexa device is new but I had hoped for more things to do out of the box. Skills need to be added through the Alexa app on a phone or computer, which just feels unnecessary. Hopefully updates will allow skills to be added directly from the device.

Overall – I am impressed with the Spot. I feel that there is a lot of potential for this, but just think developers haven't had the time to come up with the world changing ideas yet. The footprint is small and the sound quality good. The screen is a good size, clear, and bright. I would recommend this to anyone with the disclaimer that it should get better with updates and new skills.

author: Maryann Bateman
title: Cute but does not work with a Ring Doorbell
content: This is advertised to work great with a Ring Doorbell Video. Not only does it not connect after several customer service inquiries.  The Ring doorbell works but the Echo Spot does not let you connect.  So, do not buy this as a part of the Ring Doorbell purchase. It DOES NOT WORK!

author: Carol J. Polakoff
title: Love my Echo Clock Spot
content: I love my new echo spot-it wakes me up and tells me jokes and is such a constant source of information.  So glad to have it!

author: R. C Lauther
title: you may receive this product and be disappointed. I have multiple Alexa devices
content:
The reviews of this product are subject to expectations of the buyer/user. If you are not experienced user of an Alexa product, you may receive this product and be disappointed. I have multiple Alexa devices, Echo(s), Dot, Connect. When I ordered the Echo Spot I knew what it was capable of. I have not been disappointed. The hardware is well done, the sound quality is better than a Dot and the AI is what was expected. The Echo Spot is heavy and stays in place on my night stand. I have a Connect as part of my home phone system. When someone calls in early morning, the Echo Spot announces the call and I can answer the call. The screen is crisp, colorful and displays information from multiple souces.

I have read in other reviews that sleepers were troubled by the Spot's bright light. The spot does adjust for night conditions. In addition to that adjustment, you can go into settings and manually reduce the brightness which will further reduce the light at night.

I was not disappointed with this device's performance and quality.

author: cec1218
title: A potentially great product that is an absolute fail
content: Seriously disappointed in the echo spot. I had big hopes for this little assistant with a screen,  but it turns out to be nothing more than a vehicle for advertising Amazon stuff and trying to get you to use other features. the inane “Things to Try” cards That endlessly displays the time on the screen are just dumb. They try to get you to do things like add items to your calendar, or send a message, or create a shopping list. If I want to do those things, I will have already done them and don’t need that popping up every five seconds on the screen.  Such a disappointing, disappointing product. Mine hits the return mail for a refund first thing in the morning.

author: Robert Blake
title: "Things to try" rotating continuously is very annoying. When I look at a clock I'd like ...
content: "Things to try" rotating continuously is very annoying.  When I look at a clock I'd like to know what time it is, not the life span of a giraffe.

author: Rodger Jones
title: unit works well
content: Areal pain to adjust so I could use it very touchy.

author: larryzplace
title: Very convenient all in one device for the bedside table
content: I bought this to replace an old Sony alarm clock that was dying... It does all that i want it to do. It displays the time, wakes me up. Helps me sleep... easy to communicate with multiple other alexa products in the house

author: IAN DOUGLAS
title: Works as expected
content: the sound is not great, but one of its better features is the auto dimmer. I probably have too many of the echo "listening devices " in my house but i just love the gadetry. If buying it is highly recommended that you purchase a stand for it  at the same time. you will need one

author: Kathy
title: Love the face time calls!
content: We received this as a gift and could not be happier.  It replaced our dot, which we relocated.  Love the fact that I can see who I have it call!

author: Steve
title: Nice!
content: Very nice got it for use with Ring cam, now using with smart lighting, works great!

author: Abu1234
title: Great product - Way better than my Dot
content: The Echo Spot exceeded my expectations! I had an Echo Dot first and then the Spot. The screen on the spot is a great addition to the echo family. The sound this produces is great! much better than the dot. And Alexa keeps getting better. I have a "smart" house and this will control everything I want in the house. The spot is great for the bedside. It has and adaptive light sensing screen. So it is darker when there is less light and brighter when there is more light. I use it as an alarm and pair it with IFTTT it will turn my lights on when the alarm goes off. Its great!

author: Corey Hensiak
title: Selective listening
content: I own every echo device that amazon has put out and the spot is truely disappointing. Out of all my devices my spot only can hear me half the time. I have to be staring directly at it for it to hear me. For my smart home this is useless since I have to constantly repeat myself to turn on a light or any other function. All my other devices even the dot have no trouble hearing me from across the room. This one has trouble from my night stand 3 feet away from me. If I could do it all again I would just get an echo show for my bedroom.

author: Bill C
title: Pretty disappointed
content: Thought I would enjoy this addition to the Alexa ecosystem in my home. Biggest disappointment is the screen. The "bezel" is obnoxious and unnecessary. The rolling/scrolling "try this" ads are beyond annoying. I tried to like it, but ended up selling it on Craigslist. Don't waste your money.

author: Susan Pecaut Stark
title: Echo Spot worth the money!
content:
I love being able to check on my home when I am away!  I adore all the Amazon Alexa capabilities!!
I have numerous Echo products and take some of them on trips!

author: smokey kowaleski
title: Man this little thing is great at the office
content: Man this little thing is great at the office. I really enjoy all of the functionality i get in an attractive small package.

author: Chris
title: Five Stars
content: I Love the Echo Spot it's just the perfect size 4 my nightstand & easy 2 work.

author: Jim larson
title: Everything I Expected..and. More
content: Everything like a Dot, but with video! Nice

author: hawaii v
title: Great, just one little thing...
content: I love this device, it hears me well across the room, the sound quality is nice, and I love the customizable options. The only issue I have is the home screen keeps flipping screens, there is an option to not flip, but it still flips! Frustrating when I go to look at the time and it showing me other info. Also it doesn't allow you to flip through all the screens you select.

author: Stephen Hicks
title: I like the spot as a hardware device -- it's crisp ...
content: I like the spot as a hardware device -- it's crisp and clean.  The software is generally excellent and the sound is excellent.  I had envisioned buying more of these if this one worked out, but the issue is that it continually shows the "Things to try" on Alexa list.  I have this on my desk at the office currently and would like to have it slowly rotate through weather and my schedule or something, but the things to try is totally distracting mentally if not visually.  I don't want to continually be processing (in my brain) what Amazon is pushing to me.  There are suggestions of how to fix it, but none of them do what I want -- I just want this eliminated from the list of things it rotates through.  I don't want to turn off other features to get rid of this.

author: Walter Sharrow
title: It's good, but I wish I had more control over ...
content: It's good, but I wish I had more control over the idle display. I want large weather-small time to always be showing. Maybe they'll fix that in a future "skill"?

author: Jimmyv
title: Nice little unit
content: Compact and attractive. Works nicely on my desk.

author: RayB
title: Simply Amazing!!
content: Truly a great product to have.  It's like having your own personal assistant!

author: Marianne
title: I didn't know how much I needed this!
content: I love the Echo Spot!  The sound quality is awesome.  The fact that I can voice activate any of my favorite radio stations, set an alarm; ask a stupid question, etc. without doing anything but speak it awesome.  I ordered one for my parents so that they can contact me without dialing the phone!  Brilliant!

author: Jen Shops Amazon
title: Love it! Great, small .size and lots of fun to use
content: Got one for me and for my son on Prime Day. We love them! I want one in every room, but that would be excessive.

author: iamaustin
title: Can function as a cat toy!
content: Aside from all the positives, including fuller sound than a dot, a crisp display and a perfect bedside form factor - it can also play videos of birds which my cat absolutely loves. I’ll probably be picking up a glass screen protector

author: Steve Lehrer
title: Great device!
content: works  great, Alexa can pick up my voice across the room. The features are great. The Speaker is awesome music sounds wonderful. I am hooked

author: AustinSun
title: Love the shape and size
content: Love the shape and size.  The small screen is good for displaying song lyrics, news flashes, weather updates,  and to view who is as the front door.  I wish I could pair it with my Firestick like my Echo Dot.  Why isn't there Bluetooth?

author: Margaret A. Johansen
title: Fantastic!
content: Our first interface with Alexa.  Full of information, easy to use timer, funny riddles for my grandson -- just an amazing array of service from one little device. Thank you!

author: J. N. Price
title: I can’t believe this device doesn’t have wireless power.
content: I can’t believe a device intended to bring together a smart home and make life easier requires a power cord to function. Why is this not wireless? I was going to buy 2 until I realized it had to be connected to a wall to work.

author: Miri Golden
title: I love my little spot!
content: I was able to buy the Echo Do, but I couldn't resist having an actual screen. So, I went for it, got the Echo spot (who I named Pugsley) and fell in love  right out of the box. It's still pretty new, so I haven't gone around to using all its features. I mainly love using it to play my audiobook. Very convenient.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It’s like having your very own spy in the house
content: It’s like having your very own spy in the house. In a good way. She knows all and turns on and off lights, TV , heat ,air and more.

author: d0gg
title: Worked so good for myself
content:
Worked so good for myself, I bought one for my wife.

Gets most use as an alarm clock. But also used to control home automation devices

author: Amber K
title: Difficult for Technology Impaired
content: If you are thinking of getting this for someone elderly so you can have that cute commercial moment, think again. This does require someone who is very comfortable with a smart phone in order to get much use out of it. If you're smart phone savvy and into home automation though, you'll love this.

author: amaya montalvo
title: I love this product.
content: I got this product for Christmas from my parents, and it's super helpful. I can't say anything bad. It's perfect that it also acts as a speaker.

author: JamesD
title: A halfhearted attempt at proving a useful device.
content:
This looks like a really great thing.  It seems as though you can video conference with friends and family, maintain shopping lists, get random trivia information, listen to streaming music, even watch videos (via amazon prime).  BUT, you cannot set up any of these features except by using a smartphone.  Correct, once you have registered your device with your account, and now have access to an alexa config page on your amazon account, you cannot do anything useful with it unless you use a smartphone with the alexa app.  Mind you, as dumb as this is, it gets worse.  You can only use the alexa app on smartphones produces within the last year or two.  Android 8.2 or newer, for instance.  So if you want to buy these in order to video-chat with your parents, or your grandparents, they better be technofiles or you just bought them a really expensive alarm clock.
This is the perfect example of where the "Minimum Viable Product" design paradigm fails completely.  IF, and only IF, amazon updates their alexa config page so that you can actually configure the device - to make phone calls, for instance - this is one product to avoid.

That being said, the device has a lot of potential, and once that potential is realized, this should be an awesome device.

UPDATE: Amazon contacted me after posting this to let me know that users can now use the alexa app on android 5 or better, which is great for people with older phones.  You still can't add contacts to your device manually (I don't want alexa to have my work contact information, for example), but they are making progress.  The alexa page on my amazon account has been improved as well.  +1

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: I love the echo spot, and it’s a lot bigger then expected which is great.

author: Sara N Burks
title: Yes! But it !
content: Love this Alexa! Use it daily. Love that I can drop in on it when away from home so I can see my dogs. Smart plugs are a must for conscience. Love it so much!

author: crazybrain
title: The Spot is Awesome
content: Love this thing.  I should have gotten two when they were on sale because I keep this one next to my bed and I want one in the living room too.  And live in a studio apartment so that's like 8 ft away!  The other night I was having trouble sleeping and I said "Alexa play the lego batman movie" and so I watched the first 20 minutes of that until I got tired, didn't think the screen was too small or anything.  When it plays music the lyrics are on the screen which is super cool and you can turn the volume up/down from wherever you are by asking alexa to.  It's great as an alarm clock too, screen darkens when the lights go out and brightens when the lights turn on so I haven't had any problems sleeping next to it.  Favorite Amazon device.

author: Joe Buch
title: Amazing!! Love it!!
content: Absolutely love it!! A great addition to our Echo family.  Love every feature and looks great too!!!

author: JudyK
title: The amazon Alexa is so nice to have she wakes me up in the morning ...
content: The amazon Alexa is so nice to have she wakes me up in the morning with alarms and is great if you have prime because she can do a lot more plays any songs you want her to play and she can even make playlists of your favorite songs i love the Alexa because she has games you can play ad you can watch videos or movie trailers on the screen!

author: Dennis
title: Great alarm clock but if you want to video chat just buy the larger show
content: Works better than a standard dot for the kitchen.  It is nice to see timers so you know they are set, but the video is either cropped so you miss most of it or it is so small to see.

author: Charlotte Hill
title: Just learning.
content: Works well, but Alexa does not look things up (on the internet) as much as I expected.  I do like that I get different answers or comments when I say thank you or goodnight.

author: Laura
title: LOVE THIS!!
content: This is my favorite of all the products. The size is perfect, sound is great, and it's a new aged clock that is more useful!! We are finding new ways to use this everyday. This one sits on my bathroom counter and keeps me on time, provides me with the weather when I'm deciding what to wear, and the news while I would normally just be wasting time standing in front of the mirror fixing my hair and makeup. I want one of these for the side of my bed, too! We have the SHOW in our kitchen and love it as well, but this one is more affordable for the every room setup.

author: Apryl
title: Device great- Alarm with snooze option sucks
content: The spot is a very aesthetically pleasing.  It’s a very nice addition to my bedroom.  The sound is good, not as good as the Echo, but better than the dot.  For the size and money- a plus.  The main feature I use it for is the alarm. The issue I have is the snooze option.  You can tap the top of the screen, but BE CAREFUL!  The very top of the device is a mute button.  If you put your hand on the top of the spot to tap the top of the screen, you’ll mute all future alarms.  (Happened to me more than once). Also, about 30% if the time when I say “Echo snooze” she hears “Echo news” and begins telling me the news.  At that point there’s no way to get her to go back to the alarm to snooze it and I’m awake yelling several different commands.  I have it 2 stars because the main purpose of this devise has several flaws for those of us who want a few extra minutes of shut eye.

author: Christer Lundin
title: Woke me up in the middle of the night
content: This thing woke me up in the middle of the night saying “ready for setup”. It was already setup. Should be a simple thing to check  time before asking. Wife not happy...

author: Marci Bratton
title: Convenient and Fun
content: Links the household to one spot.  Adds things to Google, Calendar, Outlook and I-Cal.  Easy video calling with app.  Oddly enough, the games are addictive and fun!

author: Jennifer Guffey
title: Love it
content: Both I and my 13 year old daughter got one of these for Christmas.  I love the drop in feature.  My daughter's room in in the basement and it is nice to check in with her when she is down there.  I enjoy the screen but do wish you could move the camera to see more in the room.  My daughter loves it for music and for an alarm clock.

author: Sand
title: So easy to setup
content: A breeze to use and pretty good sound quality.

author: Vincent Balunas
title: It's a nice looking clock
content: It's a nice looking clock. but my iPhone does everything it does and more. And I still can't figure out how to turn off the alarm clock without yelling at it.

author: Kelsey C.
title: Perfect for my dorm room!
content: Love the size and the display of the Spot! Alexa is very smart and easy to speak to but she has a few bugs. For example if I say a command during Do Not Disturb it overrides that mode and then I have to reset it. If I enable the explicit music filter, it resets to disable the filter after a few minutes. I also wish all the clock faces have a digital option. I can also play music without having to subscribe to Prime Music Unlimited since I already have Prime Music. I love the fact that I won’t have to use my phone as an alarm clock anymore either.

author: linda
title: Best Picture
content: So easy to ask alexa anything.  Also you can see words to a song or a picture.

author: Todd Levine
title: This is a great way to set up your alexa with your video ...
content: This is a great way to set up your alexa with your video surveilance system for half the price of the echo show...both will work to activate alexa with your home or business security system even if the say the show is the only way thats not true,its pretter cool when u link all your other devise to it alike a newer fire tablet and all you have to say is alexa show me the front door and presto...the con is that you can not control the 2 way intercom or motion sensitivity due to lack of permissions so all you get is a screen that shows the front door when you pair the ring always home security system...overall glad to have the spot looks nice and functions perfectly! Thanks amazon!

author: Robert Cochrane
title: The perfect addition to your nightstand.
content:
If you love Alexa, you need to get this.

It makes news briefings more interesting, is a great clock, functional and elegantly designed. Surprisingly great sound quality, this thing is loud if you want it to be. Has all the features you want like scheduled night mode, brightness settings, different themed clock faces and cycling home screen with your calendar, news updates, weather and more.

author: FLEMMING JENSEN
title: Four Stars
content: Interesting and helpfull

author: liz
title: Promising
content: Only a three cause it not syncing with my Bose speaker

author: Steve Hughes
title: Great value
content: This seems to be the perfect size for nightstand, works very well.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Echo spot's microphone not as good as I good as the dot
content: I got my echo spot to accompany my echo dot and put it on the opposite side of the room then I realize it would be more functional if I put the echo spot where I had the echo dot was and put the echo dot on the other side of the room and immediately I started noticing that the echo spots microphone it's just not as good as the dots microphone. Maybe I got a defective one but I do not know I could be listening to music on the echo dot and give it a command and I will work just fine however if I try to do the same thing on the spot it'll give me a completely different message or not understand what I'm saying at all for example " Alexa turn on kitchen light " and the echo spot will tell me " kids light is not responding" I don't have any light under that name for it to even suggest it or in a device under that name for that matter it does this all the time when there's music on or off the screen looks great the sound quality is great when you drop in calls it's great but the microphone on mine is just horrible and I've tried to move settings around and try to fix it but it doesn't work the one thing that I've noticed is if you are on the right or left of it or behind it and you yell a command 50% of the time it's not going to understand you you have to be in front of it for it to understand you and even that only works 75% of the time

author: Sunshine
title: I bought this with the Camera so my wife could ...
content: I bought this with the Camera so my wife could see who was at door while sitting on coutch and not having to use her phone

author: Broffermoon
title: Use keeps getting better
content: Ideal alarm clock with a gobs of features that just continues to grow. Smart home a must.

author: Lord McFatty
title: The Best Alarm Clock
content: The other morning I was sleeping soundly in bed when all of a sudden I heard someone talking in a freaky voice in my room. It scared the heck out of me and woke me up instantly. It turns out that when I lazily said "Alexa, set alarm for 6:45am to Today's Hits" she heard, "Alexa, set alarm for 6:45am to Kid's Hits" so she woke me up with a song by Elmo where he started talking before he started singing. That freaky experience aside, I am really happy with the Echo Spot as my new alarm clock. 98% of the time Alexa understands what I'm asking for when I set an alarm, timer, etc. Other benefits include listening to Audibles or sleep sounds with a sleep timer set after I have Alexa turn off the lights, having Alexa give me my daily report on weather, traffic, news, and sports every morning that I wake up (and even turning on the lights to mirror the outside sun as it gets closer to my alarm), waking up to personally selected music, playing Head's Up and Yes Sire, etc. It's basically the smartest alarm clock I have ever had and I am taking full advantage of it thanks to Prime Day!

author: Amazon Customer
title: amazing product
content:
well-designed AI product. Alexa is an excellent listener.  The product is Great  and it was good condition when I received it .
It will be better if amazon prime music can be available for customers located in China. On the whole, it is a marvelous product!

author: ShilohLauren
title: Overkill but fun
content: Perfect.  I dont think I'd buy another one but if uve got the money to spend it's fun to have. I prefer my echo and dots better

author: Lwos
title: Notice some "Drop in" sound quality problems....
content: 4 out of 5 stars. I have the Original Tall Echo, 4 dots, 2 spots and 1 Show.  The only thing I'm finding a problem with is the speakers in the Spot. when using Drop In.  Sometimes I'm not being heard on the other spot and vice versa.  The voices tends break up or the sound coming through is intermittent. The optical is fine........ it's just the sound. Sometimes I'll have to repeat the wake word 2-3 times and I'm only 8 feet away plus it's on one of those $20 stands.  I find the ECHO DOT, Original echo and the Show has much better sound quality.  That's one reason I bought the Echo Show.

author: Staycia Dillard
title: Love it
content: She wakes me up every morning. Gives me the weather conditions and news. I’m a commuter so this is perfect for me.

author: Sergio G.
title: Great device and awesome deal, recommended.!!!!!
content: I can believe I lived without one this long. But really, is like the first piece of equipment that you will interact with, and will guide your thru your morning way way easier. Of course, these tasks can been achieved with you phone, but as the saying said, “two smart devices are better than one”

author: J. T.
title: Good product - which I waited for the price to drop
content: Good product - makes my mornings easier having traffic and weather announced as the day starts.

author: mestucson
title: Works well with my other Alexa’s! 🤣
content: My Echo Spot is used on my night stand. I love telling her to set an alarm, or give me the weather etc. And Clock face is great for middle of the night and I can read perfectly. It dims automatically so notto disturb sleep.

author: Amazon Consumer
title: Skills are a work in progress...
content: I bought the Echo Spot because of the promise of working with other devices through Skills.  I have found that the Echo Spot will work with Arlo cameras and Ring doorbell but...you have to ask twice.  The first time, Alexa says the device is not responding.  The second time works.  Echo Spot shines where you just want some quick, basic information.  It will not show Youtube videos but will show Bing videos.  Better than nothing, I guess.  My next task will be for video calls to my parents.  So far this has worked between my Alexa app on my iphone and the Echo Spot.

author: Fargo Dude
title: but these units are not that useful the app ecosystem is not good
content: I am going to keep it only because my 3 year old ripped up the box, but these units are not that useful the app ecosystem is not good.

author: Nalukaikamahine
title: My favorite so far!
content: Oh god, I love this thing. I want a few more! Replaces my alarm clock and my weather app.

author: JSpeirs
title: Better than the Dot.
content: Not too much to it. But the sound is better than the dots. And it is a cute alarm clock. I really bought it for the ring doorbell and is shows who is outside. It does work.

author: SparkleMePretty
title: Great Alexa Product for tweens!
content: We bought two of these for our older two kids. They are perfect tween size. Does not take up much space on a desk, dresser, etc. The drop in feature is nice to check in on each other.  They can wake up to an alarm of their favorite music.  Alexa can turn a boring day into a fun dance party. They love her jokes. Alexa makes it easy to check the weather to help in picking out clothes.  Soooo many great Alexa features and uses! Love this Alexa product!

author: Alex Bustamante
title: ... is not designed to watch videos but to provide nice glimpses to daily information
content: This is not designed to watch videos but to provide nice glimpses to daily information. If you want to complain about videos, buy a tablet. Also makes for an awesome alarm clock!

author: Thomas b.
title: Microphone is great at distance, poor less than 3ft
content: The microphone in this is extremely frustrating. It can pick up a whisper from 30feet away, but can’t register your voice commands reliably from your pillow to night stand.  It was fine until a recent update and now I just use my phones voice commands when I’m in bed as the spot just isn’t reliable at all.

author: Amazon Customer
title: We threw away our old, ugly alarm clock and put Alexa on the night stand. She looks great there !
content: Compact, totally helpful and ever ready

author: Angie
title: Love how after you download the app you can set ...
content: I purchased this for an alarm clock to replace my old ivee alarm clock when it started to go.  I don't know how I lived without it. I know there are lots of ways to use this but for now I just use the clock functions. Love how after you download the app you can set different alarms and repeat alarms. I also set my Pandora acct up to it.  So far I love everything about it

author: Kindle Customer
title: Love
content: Bought one for us and my sister in law.  We all love it, especially the music weather baseball scores and trivia

author: marlaw
title: More Than A Pretty Face
content: I saw the Show but felt my tablet had the same functionality. Then I saw the debut of the Spot and it was love at first sight. This one device gave me a clock, radio, voice control of my smart devices ( Nest, lights, alarm, locks), video and voice calling, and access to a host of skill sets that I didn’t know I needed till I started using them ( Headspace to name one). Plus, I love the whole house feature that lets me play the same music in each room that houses an Echo. Members of my family have fallen in love with this cute little orb and have gotten their own. Grateful to other reviews that have offered ideas to personalize the Spot to my needs and improve functionality.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Two thumbs up
content: This is everything I was looking for in the Echo show. Its small so it doesnt take up much counter space and displays the info I need. Echo show has alot of wasted screen space when not showing video.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Fun to use
content: To use as a alarm clock and speak to other rooms.

author: rusty capling
title: This thing is amazing. It’s sleek
content: This thing is amazing. It’s sleek, sexy, and intelligent. I wish I could move it into different rooms instead of being connected to the wall. I have a couple other Bluetooth speakers in different rooms and I wish they could all sync together. If you’re hesitating, don’t !! It’s life and routine changing to have one of these.

author: Rob
title: My wife loves it
content: Works great my wife loves it

author: Purrucajb
title: Five Stars
content: I liked this little echo spot

author: TD6527
title: Amazon needs to disable "things to try"
content: Nice concept.  AGGRAVATING as I have been unsuccessful at disabling "things to try".  I've done ALL that Amazon says to do - darn thing Still pops up.

author: Wilyue
title: this is by the far the best Echo Spot better than the Echo Show ( too ...
content:
this is the third Echo Pot for my home, this is by far the best Echo Spot, I ever have better than the Echo Show ( too Big), if you want to use this Echo Spot fully, you need to buy the "Echo Connect" (Perfect companion to Echo Spot & Show) to pick up your Home Phone etc...

Love it

author: ML
title: I like the screen!
content: I wanted the Spot because of the screen. Lots of customization options and the screen gives helpful visuals. Speakers are ok, Alexa comes in loud and clear but for music it's not great. I recommend getting a regular Echo or Echo Plus for music.

author: Dario
title: I LOVE MY ECHO SPOT!!!!!!!
content: I love my Echo Spot, it surpassed my expectations. It has so many functions that the other Echo products doesn't have. It does so much that I couldn't describe it all in this post, absolutely no regrets.....

author: Alexandra Najera
title: I love it!
content: I love my Echo Spot! I use it daily to hear music, as an alarm, and every morning i ask Alexa how's the weather. I occasionally use the video chat feature with my friends and it works okay. But it's still a nice feature. The drop in feature is awesome! I get to see who is in my room when i am not home. I also bought a wyze camera for my front door/porch and connected it to Alexa. So now i can see my front door through my Echo Spot which is pretty cool. Over all, it's a huge upgrade to my old Echo dot (2nd generation).

author: mary
title: Should have bought 2
content: Love it, Love it, Love it!!! Bought it on Prime Day, then had buyers remorse, but once I got it, it was Love at first sight.

author: Mason W.
title: Excellent device. But pay premium price for lack of patience
content:
After using an iHome 1st gen ipod alarm clock for the past 10 years, I've been keeping an eye out for an upgrade and this was a no-brainer when I saw it. The missing star is a lost star for value- at only $20 less than the echo show, the debut price point is disappointing. I was tempted to just order another show in place of this, strictly due to the value factor... larger screen, more sound, more utilities, but this spot does fit its current application much better on a nightstand. Amazon you dirty dog, you knew we couldn't resist.

Google "smart video alarm clock", there are much cheaper alternatives out there... but if you're an echo fan, perhaps hold out until summer or next fall when I suspect it to sale at more than half the current price.

author: Tam2
title: Love the screen
content: I have an Echo Dot and decided to give the Spot a try. So far, I love it! The screen is an added bonus and the Spot has replaced my digital alarm clock on my nightstand.

author: Joanne McDaniels
title: Echo Spot - Smart Display with Alexa and camera is perfect for my daughters needs!
content: I got this for my daughter for Christmas with the camera that goes with it. Since I personally did not try it or see how it works I can only say what she has told me. She said its been great to use. She can ask all kind of questions and schedule tasks for her. With the cameras she can watch around the house while she is doing something else in other rooms with clear pictures. She said she is extremely happy with it!

author: Drew
title: Great buy.
content: Screen a lot smaller than anticipated. Still, it HAS a screen and is perfect for that alarm clock feeling without sacrificing technology such as your morning brief, video calls, and pretty loud speakers. Overall a great item.

author: Gladiston Belem
title: Five Stars
content: Got this Echo Spot as a gift from my wife and so far I’m loving it.

author: freshprince130
title: A whole new world of alexa
content: Amazing!! One in kids room one in the Master. The ability to watch whole movies is amazing.  Not only that but the engagement and jokes is precisely what the future of tech should be.

author: William Stevens
title: It works, but it also leaves a lot to be desired
content:
20181108: I recently purchased on Echo Show (great device) and was looking forward to using the Echo Spot to augment the Alexa experience. Alexa is pretty much the same on both units. The big disappointments with the Spot are: 1) setup is not nearly as easy on the Spot as on the Show; 2) the Spot's screen is so dim, it is difficult to see in all but the darkest of spaces; and 3) the Spot looks up, which is great if you set it down low (like on the floor) but not so great if it is higher, such as on a counter or bookshelf.

Setting up the Echo Show was very easy. It already knew it was registered to me, and most of what I needed to do was either done on the touch screen, or on the app on my phone. Setting up the Spot should have been the same, but it wasn't. First, the Spot asks me to put in my amazon credentials -- on a tiny dark screen -- and then tells me that a user with my name is already associated with the spot. After some fumbling around (because it is hard to see) I somehow got back to a screen with my name and an invitation to continue. OK, dodged that problem. BUT, on the second Spot (I bought 3 of them) I had the same problem. At least forewarned, I typed in the info, got the message, and backed out to see my name and the Next button.

The screen is DIM, and I don't mean a little, it is dim. In a dark room, it is great, but otherwise, almost unusable except that it is voice controlled. If you don't really need a screen, get the Dot and save the money. There is no command to change the brightness, and no manual button.

update: did some more research. It isn't documented anywhere (no manual) and you can't just tell Alexa to brighten the screen, but there are screen controls. To access the controls, swipe down on the screen from the top. Jeez, Amazon, come on. Why hide that away and NOT let it be accessed by voice?

Here is an article that gives a lot of info on the settings: https://mashtips.com/customize-alexa-echo-spot/
It would have been nice if Alexa could have told me all this. :-( Any way, I am upgrading the rating to 3 stars.

Finally, the angle of view is looking up. Gets a good view of the ceiling, unless you put it down low. In my boy's room, I put it on the window sill, works great there, but in my room, on the night stand, mostly all I see is the ceiling. If you want to use the Spot to see what is going on in your house, you won't see as much as you'd like. Also, the spot is basically a sphere with two flat sides, so it won't mount on the wall either.

In general, the screen is not a great advantage, and the camera is less than useful because of the angle up orientation.

All in all, it is a nice idea, but I wish I hadn't bought 3. If you think you want it, just get one and try it out. Probably, an Echo Dot will work just as well.

One other item to discuss: all Alexa devices require a login. You can login with the same account on all of them, which solves some problems, but causes others. I have a wife and two kids. Alexa assumes everyone is me, because I logged in with my Amazon account on all the devices. So? It means the reminders are mine, the alarms are mine, the calendars are mine... all my stuff on every device.

Amazon, if you really want to make Alexa useful, you need to make Alexa family-aware. If my son updates the calendar on the Spot in his room, it should stay with him, and he doesn't need to know about my appointments. The Echo Show in the kitchen is a community device for the entire house, but the Spot or Dot on the nightstand should be much more personal, especially for alarms and calendars. And Drop In should work for all the devices, no matter who the device is personalized for.

author: J. L. MacDonald
title: This little orb is great! Gives me the weather
content:
This little orb is great! Gives me the weather, wakes me up, gives me the news and even has a fish tank with calming music playing!!
Love it!!!

author: bmalcolm
title: Awesome robot
content: Very nice product even when Alexa talks to you in the middle of the night for no reason she often can’t answer the questions that the ghosts are asking I think it may be a frequency thing

author: Ralph Bernstein
title: if this goes down to 50$ ill get 4 or ...
content: if this goes down to 50$ ill get 4 or 5 of them.  if you can afford 115$ (currently) for a very fancy control center alarm clock, id do it.

author: rgrant16
title: Great product, what they don't tell you is that ...
content: Great product, what they don't tell you is that once you allow a "Drop In"  they can drop in anytime!!!  While they are sleeping, while we are yelling at them, while anything.

author: Scott Harrison
title: A great replacement for the bedside alarm clock
content: A great replacement for the bedside alarm clock, which had a funny habit of going off at 12am every time the cleaning ladies came through. We mostly use it to turn the ceiling fan lights on and off, while leaving the fan running. Only gripe would be the mic sensitivity, which doesn't appear be as good as the View or Gen2. It can get a little frustrating having to repeat yourself.

author: P. Figueroa
title: Best Echo device
content: I love my spot. I have the original echo & the dot but the spot is the best. Does everything I need it to do and has a screen. Fantastic little device.

author: Fred D.
title: Use On My Bedside Table
content: What can I say. I love Alexa. In fact, I have them all over my house, so no matter where you are, if you say "Alexa" you'll get an answer. Sometimes even typing the name will prompt a response. Okay, that last sentence isn't really true. I never thought much about getting the Spot, primarily because the screen seemed so small. But then I saw that my sister had one by her bed. She uses it primarily as a clock (it has about 1 million clock faces, and by 1 million I mean at least 50). For that reason alone it is nice to have. When I go to bed I ask her to set a music alarm and the next morning she wakes me up to whatever kind of music I want. You can even adjust it so the music starts quietly and gradually gets louder until you wake up. That's a great feature. As an added bonus, I have it scroll thru family pictures during the day, which is rather nice. Other than that, she does everything any other Alex device does. The sound is not great, but I have it hooked up to a stereo system so that is not an issue. I love this as a bedside device and highly recommend it. You just can't go wrong with Alexa.

author: Ronda Stone
title: Alexa - Write a Review
content: It has been fun -- I got the Echo Spot for my family.  I told my husband I got it for him and his gift to me was setting it up.  It was a bit beyond my pay grade in techie stuff.  But if you have a handy husband like mine or someone else in your family, you will soon be asking Alexa questions and tell her to turn your TV on.  It isn't easy, but worth the effort and fun. Even my husband had a bit of a trial but he prevailed and Alexa is up and running.  We have to refer to her as Alex when we are talking about programming Alexa to do something because she is right there listening to our every word and ready to respond at the mention of her name.  She is still not up and doing fully what she is capable of -- but we like her so well we want to get another Echo Spot for another room.  My one disappointment is the Echo  has to remain plugged in at all times and cannot be moved about without unplugging and plugging in to another room.  It would nice if they were more portable and could be moved about from room to room more easily and could still work while unplugged for a short time.

author: Jeanette Gonzalez
title: Love love love
content:
Love this little device
I added the blink camera system and it’s so awesome to be able to check in and see what’s going on with Alexa
Great purchase

author: Amazon Customer
title: It’s very nice. Like others mentioned
content:
I replaced my dead echo version one with the spot.  It’s very nice.

Like others mentioned, the spot used as an alarm clock would probably keep you awake from the light of messages all night.  Easy fix was swapping with an echo dot in the bedroom.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Pleasantly surprised
content: I was totally against having smart tech in my home but it’s honestly so much easier to just ask her the weather while searching through my closet than having to stop everything to look it up. I like that amazon music often provides on screen lyrics to many songs (though has a limited song collection). I also love being able to make video calls bc it has much better reliability and clearer voices than phone video calls. My roommate has several Google homes in the house, both standard and minis, and though the audio quality for music is better on google, everything else is better with Alexa.

author: Tara
title: Great product for the price
content: good size screen and gets good range for voice commands. sometimes it picks up weird commands when I'm watching tv though. Great product for the price if you don't need the big show screen.

author: loverstreet
title: A great addition to any home!!!
content: I don’r know what we did before Alexa!!! She’s so much fun! We love the ambient sounds she phat did us during the night and my husband is hooked on Jeopardy!!! The music is outstanding!!!

author: RMalseed
title: Love It!!!
content: I'm loving having Alexa sitting on my night table. I can ask her to do things right when I think of them rather waiting and forgetting. The display is crystal clear and beautiful. This product is a must have!!

author: CindyLou Whoiswayover 2
title: Very Easy
content:
This is my 3rd version (5th if you count firesticks and kindle fires) of Alexa products.  This one pleases me very much.
1) read the tiny set up book and you see how to resolve the aspects that annoyed many reviewers
2) based on early reviews, the display has improved and the clock face is visible to those of us with bad eyes
3) it is a good size and shape for my bedside table
I purchased it on sale and I am pleased with my purchase.

author: CLTGreg
title: Good speaker poor functiins
content:
Pro: Sounds better than Dot.
Con: warm to the touch. Stupid Things to Try where literally hundreds of customers have begged for it to be optional. Just what I need when I wake up in the middle of the night, a tip instead of time. You can turn off rotation but it will forget settings if disconnected for 5 seconds.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Camera is cheap and not wide angled.
content: Don't by it for camera. Hard to place it for any use at all. Text is tiny for viewing it from far. Only good for night stands.

author: YB Hoel
title: Speaker leaves A LOT to be desired.
content: I like everything about this device except for the speaker.  Sounds cheap and tinny.  Trying to figure a solutuon for this...haven’t been able to link to Bose Resolve.

author: franklin
title: product not good
content: came with time preset from factory at Pacific time--unable to change setting to Eastern time.  When called for tech support  the person tried to up sell a package for softwear.  totally unsatisfactory and absolutely no tech support given---VERY unsatisfied.

author: Jeff Carter
title: Echo Spot a must have alarm clock
content:
I have all the echo smart speakers except for the Look and I must say the Spot is one of my favorites. I got it mainly for the clocks. I use it mainly as an alarm clock along with my first generation echo which is right beside it. Both are next to my bed on a night stand. This product has 12 clocks 6 analog and 6 digital. It also lets you use your own pictures from your phone on the clocks. I like the analog ones best. Clocks keep great time and have a second hand that moves. There are a lot of alarms ot to choose from or you can tell Alexa to wake you up to music from amazon,your amazon music library,siriusxm,spotify,I heart radio,tune in etc. Note you need to have some of these like siriusxm and spotify already. When Alarm goes off you see good morning and the time,weather condition and temperature which I think is nice. Alarm last for 1hr but you can also snooze or dismiss it.

The Spot also does everything all the other Echo Speakers do with Alexa plus you can watch videos,see some video news from cnn and some other news outlets,see you're local weather and forcast,view amazon when you're shopping and watch shows from Amazon Video and not to mention all the skills that like ordering a pizza,movie times etc.

Update
I have the white echo spot and meant to write a review on it but the black is the same device with just a different color.

Update
Amazon added 5 new clocks. 4 Analog Clocks and 1 Digital. Hope we see even more. I love the tangerine. This update went unnoticed by most people but it happened. I'll post some pics. Note these colors look a lot better then they do from my camera phone.

Things I like
Being able to see your weather forcast and conditions especially the temperature and 7 day forcast.

Most videos are adjustable as to how it looks on the screen however music albums and art isn't.

The clocks

Music sounds much better and louder on the Spot then it does on the Dot.

Has an option to hook up an additional wired or blue tooth speaker.

Has nightmode so most of the clocks projects a pretty green glow at night. Some just have a dim background.

When an alarm is set you can see you have it set under the clock.

Things I don't like

Not enough analog clocks and the ones it comes with has only 2 colors and sometimes 1 eg the record theme clock has only one color version. Amazon says more clocks are coming in the future though thru updates. More colors are needed like red,blue,orange,green,purple and yellow. Also I've suggested a weather themed clock which shows your local temperature.

The Spot can't get Youtube but that can change if Amazon gets it back. The Show can no longer get Youtube either.

Music Album Covers are too big for the Spot. You don't seem to have an option to decrease the size so you can see more like you do with videos. Same with recipes. Album Art still looks ok though. For recipes you're better off using the Echo Show.

I recommend this device for you're bedroom night stand.

author: SSG Derpy
title: Alexa is like HAL9000, just less overtly sinister more.......a sign of things to come
content: I like Alexa. She’s fun to talk too, responds to pop culture quips and plays music videos and games well enough my family all got one. The spot itself is nice I use it as an alarm clock because of the clock face and the camera lets me check in on my dogs while I’m at work. It’s funny I can get them to do tricks over the video phone! I also like that I don’t have to touch light switches anymore, like a 20th century troglodytes, Alexa knows all my lights and tv channels!

author: Dave
title: Easy
content: Works like a charm. Easy to use.

author: Lazo
title: Spot on!
content: I needed an alarm clock and this fit the bill perfectly.  I am a believer in amazon echo, Alexa and fire.  Great customization options and Alexa is always helpful.  Sound quality is also surprisingly good.

author: Lee
title: Great little helper
content:
Wanted a new clock on the bedside, this fits perfectly. Can control the lights in the bedroom, play music (wake up) on the Sonos. One downside; the Amazon "try this" keeps popping up. I just want a clock, no suggestions.

Happy with it, added the stand to it, now it is perfect for me.

author: Gina
title: Love my echos and I love the suggestions that come ...
content:
Love my echos and I love the suggestions that come across the screen asking me to ask it questions.Voice commands are easy and responses are clear and easy to hear, the speaker is great.
I love that I could set up my own home screen photo. I do call this one Echo because when I set it up to Alexa, the one in the next room would answer my questions as well, so it is a nice feature to be able to call it something else.

author: Heather
title: Absolutely love these
content:
I bought 3 and they're perfect. One did not work because no matter what I did the alarm clock feature didn't work (the most important function). But after spending 30 minutes on the phone with a non-english speaking technical support and doing a factory reset(the reason for 4 stars and not 5) it works just fine. Alexa would repeat the alarm time back to me but not go off. When asking Alexa to show the alarms the screen would flicker then go back to the home screen. After the reset it works just fine. The only gripe I have is that the option for setting the repeat option for the alarms does not allow you to pick which days of the week you want it to repeat. I only need an alarm Monday through Thursday but you can't pick more than one individual day. It's either weekends, weekdays, or only mondays, only Tuesdays, etc.

Using the app on my phone allows me to "drop in" and see what the camera sees right on my phone. Very convenient way to communicate when away from home. The kids find it hilarious to video chat from room to room. When one of my kids is listening to music too loud I can asked Alexa to turn the volume down on that specific device or use the app to turn it down.

The sound quality is better than expected. Not tinny at all and has some bass to it. Comes with an equalizer option for those more advanced. Fills the room with loud music without distorting it at all.

Added plugs all over the house and it is an awesome experience walking in the house and asking Alexa to turn the lights on rather than trip over something or stub my toe on furniture in the dark trying to turn the lights on. You can even use the app to turn them on away from home.

The many skills that can be added is amazing. One of the best is having Alexa start my vehicles.

author: Tom K
title: Not great as the second alarm clock
content:
My wife and I have separate alarm clocks, mine is set for an earlier wake up and I don’t have the option to talk back to my Spot in the morning.  I need to qualify that because maybe there are more possibilities if I was able to speak to Alexa in the morning.

So my review based on this scenario is: A lot of potential, but still not quite there.  I love the flexibility and the ability to micromanage alarms, but snoozing it is nearly impossible.  The reason for Snoozing an alarm is because you’re just not ready to get up. If I need to wake up just to get it to snooze, it pretty much defeats the purpose of snoozing.  Also, and maybe it’s because I haven’t google searched it yet, but I still haven’t been able to figure out how to make the display brighter.

Again, my review might be better if I was able to say “Alexa, snooze” instead of having to fumble for a “snooze” icon on poorly lit screen.

author: Graveyyy
title: Great alarm clock replacement.
content:
The Echo Spot works great as an alarm clock replacement. We also chose this device to use in conjunction with a nursery CloudCam. The only drawback to using as a nursery cam is the screen size. It can be challenging to see your young one in this screen. Also, you cannot zoom to specific areas as you can with the CloudCam app. There is a zoom function, but it only zooms to the center of the camera's vision.

If using only as an alarm clock or as a video communication tool, I would rate a full 5 stars. Since the CloudCam functionality is limited, I give this 4 stars.

A tip for those looking to replace a nursery camera, go with the Echo Show.

author: Susan H
title: Love my dot
content: the only thing I downgrade it for is the screen size - not very useful to me.

author: Kathryn L. Infante
title: Someone in the house needs a smartphone.
content: I got this for my 85 year old parents so they can video chat and have fun talking with Alexa over the winter. To do the video chat though they need a smartphone and they have a flip phone with $100/year service, or free if you dont call much.

author: Racquelle simons
title: A bit overpriced
content: I do like it. It does everything it's promised to do and does it well. I wished it was a bit smarter when you asked it questions. I don't think it was really worth the price and I got it for 80 on prime day. But it is nice for an alarm clock and music!

author: Neal A Cooper
title: It's a clock, headline news source, calendar minder, video phone, and so much more!
content: It's difficult to review the device based on such limited exposure. That said, the setup is easy and the voice interface is convenient and intuitive, just like other echo devices. The screen is nice and allows a much richer smart device experience compared to Amazon echo and dot. The screen will be useful for certain video calls.

author: Northghost
title: Better than expected.
content: This is a likable little clock that takes up little space on on night stand.  I especially like to turn on smart lights while still in bed before I get up.  Sound quality is much better than I expected.  Makes a nice white noise machine when I play nature sounds or rain showers on low volume.  It is very easy to replace the clock background with beautiful personal photos with the app.  It is small but has some weight, which is good because it prevents my cats from knocking it off the table.  This clock should probably win some sort of gadget design award.  It is a little expensive but I don't regret buying it.

author: quis
title: Does not support Freetime Unlimited for kids
