author: conway2009
title: Five Stars
content: Works great!! paired with my dot automatically Love It!!!

author: Maria C
title: Love it!
content: I love this clock, I just have to tell it to set my alarm.  No more fussing with buttons!

author: R
title: The echo spot, one hell of a alarm clock.
content:
Echo spot is a great clock at does so many other things, I would recommend this to family or friends.
You just have to remember since it is so small the sound is not gonna be that great but it is very good for a bedroom nightstand.

author: Windwish
title: Replaced my clock radio
content: So far I am loving the Echo Spot.  It has replaced my alarm clock (that I really loved) ..i am learning new things to do all the time.  Both my Husband and I got one for each nightstand.  It’s awesome that it has blue tooth..so he can listen to a talk show while I listen to ocean waves to relax me while I read.  I think the screen is very clear, and given patience and time it is really pretty easy to figure things out.  I wasn’t ready to be this impressed, but we are..both of us...I love that I can change my photos or shuffle them, and use my own photos too.  I use it a lot and the alarm tones are very nice.  I like soft and easy tones so I’m not woken up afraid maybe that is why they call it “ALARM”because some of those sounds DO  alarm you..sure you right out of sleep.haha.  Anyway I love I can just talk to it and not roll over and have to hit buttons to silence the alarm.  All in all it far exceeds my expectations, it is small and doesn’t take up a lot of room on my small nightstand.  I still have plenty room for my Kindle Oasis and pad now.  It’s also really cute, we bought skins to help protect it and brighten it up..I opted for hot pink, Hubby got a pretty blue...We have the original and updated Alexa and a few dots as well as the tap and this blows them al, away. Now I’m not picky about my sic sound, but I am happy with the way the music sounds and the only change I wish for..are new names...we are running out of device names...it would be nice to name it myself or with all the ones we have maybe a few new selections of names..Tha is Amazon we are both very happy!😀

author: Donald Thompson
title: Great device for Alexa enthusiasts
content: I really like this spot and yes in addition to Alexa features such controlling lighting and my HVAC I use it as a glorified alarm clock. But I ask it to wake me to news or music depending on how I feel the night before. A lot of reviews complain about how it flashes things to try etc but since I don’t sit and stare at the screen it a non issue for me.

author: Michael Shane Harris
title: Rated 5 stars
content: We love our echo spot it shows you recipes it googles questions that you can’t answer not to mention displays a beautiful picture video chatting and volume is just to write our family enjoys every Thing about it  very easily connected to other devices with your Amazon Alexa app .

author: Evangeline Massey
title: Lack of video quality.
content: Too much laging even when I was in wifi. From my phone to the unitm.  It will be better if it had a version where you plug and RG45 cable. To get the best signal.  Besides the chopping there was no sound sometimes. For almost 30 seconds.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great
content: Great

author: Andrea Marsh
title: Perfect bedside table companion
content: This is my first Echo Spot, but not my first echo product. My boyfriend expressed interest in this one, so I bought it as a Christmas gift. The little screen is nice, and I love that the brightness of the face adjusts, so it’s never blinding in the middle of the night or early morning. Quick and easy way to catch up on the news each morning while getting ready for work!

author: C. Hand
title: Great little device
content: A perfect thing to have by the bed as a clock, alarm clock.

author: Robert Sanborn
title: Echo Spot Does Little
content:
Wouldn’t sync with my tv even though both are on WiFi. No directions cannot use!
After speaking with Amazon I was given much more information and I’m using my Echo Spot.  Most companies don’t follow up on reviews; this was very helpful and I’m using it Way more. Thanks Amazon😀

author: cutegerl
title: Best singer ever ... lol
content: We put it in bedroom and it sings nursery ryhyms to my little one during bath time.

author: Prime user Lloyd
title: Love my Echo Spot
content:
I enjoy my spot.  I am not going to even try to do a technical review.  That's up to Amazon.  Easy to use?  Yes -- plug it in and connect it to the internet.  Talk to Alexa.

It is small and convenient.  Use it in place of my alarm clock.  I have a regular Echo in the kitchen.

I enjoy Alexa.  Have enjoyed trying out the different experiences and the convenience offered in timers, reminders, lists, etc.  Between this and my Kindles I'm a happy Amazon shopper.

author: Peter
title: I really wanted to like it, but it just fails as an alarm clock.  The first Amazon device I am returning.
content:
I really wanted to like it, but it just fails as an alarm clock.  The first Amazon device I am returning.

I wanted an echo in my bedroom, so I figured I would kill two birds with one stone.  Get rid of my alarm clock and replace it with the Spot.  In theory this should have worked.  Here is why it fails as an alarm clock.

1) You cannot manage the alarms from the touch screen, except to dismiss them.  If it's 11:30 at night and you want to set the alarm, you have to talk to it.  My wife didn't appreciate this.  I don't understand why I cant tap the screen and turn the alarm on.
2) The alexa app lets you set the recurring alarm M-F.  The problem is most of the time I dismiss the alarm from the Spot it will cancel the entire week.  I cant just dismiss the Monday for example.
3) Worst of all, the alarm did not work the last three mornings.  This is unacceptable.  I have a $30 alarm that never failed to wake me up.  I would go to bed and the alarm would show on the display.  I woke up at 5am and the alarm was not shown.  So i told Alexa to set the alarm (again my wife did not appreciate this).  Alexa said it was already set.  Of course, it did not wake me up and I had to hustle so i wasn't late for work.

I find this unacceptable.  These are really very basic functions.  You can even initiate the alarm from the app.  You have fist tell the Spot to set an alarm then you can go the app and set it to recur, change the tones, etc..  It is just really a disjointed experience.

If you don't care about the alarm then this is a really nice device.  Screen is clear and build quality is great.  Sounds much better than the dot.  I just can't play Russian roulette with alarm hoping it will wake me up.

author: MCE
title: Amazing little piece of technology
content: Amazing little piece of technology. This is my first Alexa device, and I use it primarily as a bedside clock, weather guide, and music player. It's feature rich, customizable, and voice recognition is to the level of advancement I'd expect from a software/AI technology leader like Amazon. Fantastic, overall.

author: Iamkeithyb
title: In the bedroom it adds a nice touch, the speaker is small but the sound ...
content: In the bedroom it adds a nice touch, the speaker is small but the sound is good enough. It's a mini show.

author: Mark
title: Hits the Spot! (I couldn't resist)
content:
Just about anything I could write about the spot would sound like marketing literature.  We purchased two Spots and a Show (and a dot and two of the original Echo towers) -- clearly, we're believers.  The Show is in our kitchen and we have it flanked by two (for stereo) Oontz Ultra speakers -- and we liked it so much we went ahead and got the Spots one for an upstairs bedroom and one for the downstairs master bedroom. We also linked the master bedroom spot with a Sony Bluetooth speaker (one of the XB models with "extra bass") in order to use Alexa's sleep sounds capabilities while keeping the "clock" face closer to the bed.

The video is good to very good Spot to Spot and Spot to Show, etc.

If you were (or are) an iPhone fan, you may recall the choice you could have either a 6 or a 6-plus etc. Believe it or not, I think there could be a market for a Spot-Plus.  There is nothing wrong with the "original" spot -- the screen is 2.5" however.  Perhaps a 3.5" or even 4" screen could find consumers willing to part with another $20 or $30 for a screen (the Spot hardware itself) that would allow placement a bit further away than your bedside table.  A Show, if you asked me, would be too big for this purpose, but perhaps a Spot-Plus especially if you want the thing to be both an "intercom" (with video) and a full-featured Smart-Clock.

 Even if Amazon never comes out with such an in-between device, the Spot is a winner!

author: pete
title: Cool gadget but very limited functionality
content: The spot is a cool device to add to your Alexa home but wish it offered more. There is a very limited menu accessible on the spot but everything else has to be changed via the app. Videos are not very enjoyable on the spot so basically it’s an expensive echo with a screen that isn’t very helpful.

author: Robert N.
title: Five Stars
content: Sleek design, stand should come standard with device.

author: harley1joker

content: I love how easy this is to use and how much fun I have with it.

author: Leah Otto

author: Melissa
title: It's just ok
content: I have the dot and Echo Plus, this one can't seem to "hear" me as well and doesn't do as much as I expected.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I have every echo device out there so naturally I ...
content: I have every echo device out there so naturally I wanted the spot to add to my collection. Set up is a breeze if you follow the onscreen directions as well as changing any and all settings so I’m not sure what everyone else is talking about when they say they couldn’t figure out how to adjust things. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is because the sound is a bit muffled since the speakers are on the bottom of the device. The sound moves downward towards whatever you have the device sitting on. The speaker should probably be on the back of the device. And when you try to center your own photos as the display they never seem to center correctly. Other than those issues it’s a cute little device.

author: Chance Roberts
title: Wow!
content: Fantastic product. Simple set-up. Endless Functionality. At first I was hesitant about purchasing echo devices simply because I didn’t think I would use them. However, after purchasing more smart home devices (plugs, lights, etc.) I’ve realized how necessary it is to have a “one-stop-shop” method of access. Very great product overall, and decent speakers!

title: Beautiful in form and function!
content: What a quality product. Amazon is officially ahead of the game vs. Google and Apple. The Spot is not only beautiful in design with great resolution, but brings a new level of functionality to all of the Echo devices. My only question now is what to do with all of my old Dots!

author: Jessica Flores

content: I LOVE my new Echo Spot. I have mine on my night stand and use it all the time - for the weather, for the news, to listen to music, etc. etc. I have a large bedroom and I have no issues with the audio. It picks up my voice for anywhere in the room and the speakers are great. I highly recommend this smart home device.

author: F. Masters
title: I like it, but I had to return it because ...
content: I like it, but I had to return it because it missed a programmed alarm that Alexa verified as set. I don't know why because it was listed in the Alexa application. I need an alarm / clock an an Echo Spot that is reliable. I did reorder it though.

author: JZ
title: I love how this integrates with my Ring Doorbell
content: I have two Echo Dot and now the Spot.  I love how this integrates with my Ring Doorbell, Sonos speakers and Wemo switches.  I love the weather and news updates on the screen.  I use it most often as a timer while cooking and for other quick info.

author: NYCAVA

author: Hank B

content: Recently made the move to the touch screen echos and could not be happier. They are sleek, take up little space and the camera is pretty decent on it. Have two already and plan on replacing all units in the house with them.

author: Jerome Maier Jr.

I am still figuring out all the features,but having everything connected in my rooms makes my life easier. That’s awesome. I need all the help I can get when it comes to moving around! It can be quite painful for me,as I’m partially disabled. So this product helps reduce my pain,and make my life easier. Thank you amazon. You guys rock!

Or i should probably learn what the ALexa system knows because it  always tells me "Hmm.. I don't know that one." Makes noises and then doesn't tell me what they meant. I love the simple display. The Camera freaks me out and I covered mine with tape. It's a terrible camera. why would I ever use this camera. WHO IS using that camera???

author: Christi F
title: Exactly What I Needed and More!
content:
I have been incredibly sick this year and have had a hard time getting around.  My husband purchased me the Echo Spot so that just in case there is an emergency and I can't move that I can just call out to Alexa and I can get the help I need.  Luckily I haven't had any emergencies but I'm still glad he purchased it for me because the Echo Spot comes in handy!  I've used it to add things to my grocery list, check the weather and news, and set timers and alarms.

I have a picture of my boys as my background which I also love and since it's black it blends in nicely on my end table.  The only thing I wish was that it was wireless since I hate how wires look so cluttered.  Other than that I love it!

author: C. Jackson
title: Love my spot
content: I love the spot.  It's so easy to set an alarm when you're really sleepy!  It turns off my lights and tells me goodnight!  Ha!  My wish is that it could also have a nightlight mode so when I get up in the night I could ask her to turn on a nightlight and a soft light would come on.  It's a great little device.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great for the price!
content: Love it!  This is my third Alexa, use them all the time.  Easy to use, like the customization....  I use it to send texts, synched to my work calendar so I can keep track of meetings....

author: Gornisiewicz
title: and the sound quality is far better than the Dot
content: I have a regular Echo but wanted on for my bathroom. The Spot is ideal, and the sound quality is far better than the Dot, so if you're looking for a smaller Echo, I'd go with the Spot. Plus, the clock is adorable. I know...

author: Mi'i Tamatoa
title: Great clock and Echo at once!
content: Nice size - prefer this to the original Echo which is a towering figure compared to this. I find that it seems to get disconnected from our Wi-Fi more than the original one, but that could be because I have this located in a slightly different place.

author: Kat
title: Love this thing
content: Love this thing, I think it is the best of these products so far.(I have had the spot and the cube) It hears better than the puck or the cube and sounds halfway decent.

author: Rocky Mount Eddie
title: Five stars with a bit of reservation.
content:
Not bad. But I would say that it is a bit pricey at $130 for a glorified clock.

Setup was easy. Just logged into my wifi, and off and running. I made some simple adjustments on the screen with a few swipes, and some that needed to be done from the Alexa App. All set.

It has several clock faces that are art or digital face. You can even use your own photos, too (I chose our Pit, Nutmeg). You can make video calls to anyone with a Spot, or the pricier Show, or even to an Alexa app on their phones, if enabled. The video call was clear and voice was amazingly perfect.

Music sounded as expected--some bass, but the overall sound was pleasantly surprising for such a small device. It sounded louder than its little sibling, the Dot, and that's a feather in Amazon's hat.  Amazon issued an update a week ago so now there's an equalizer setting for bass, mid, and highs. It does help some. If you have a good Bluetooth speaker, or one that uses 3.5mm cable to connect, I suggest you do so if you plan on entertaining.

I like the  little guy. As far as YouTube videos are concerned, though, don't hold your breath.  There probably won't be a meeting of the minds, as Amazon and Google won't make nice with one another.  Shame.

Those who cook can use the gadget for seeing recipes. You can watch short news clips, or other boring crap--and that's that, save for Amazon Videos. So if you plan on looking into purchasing the Echo Show, with its much larger screen and fantastic sound, think wisely before plunking down over $230.  Is it really worth that much to be able to watch movies from Amazon's video service?  If you positively must have the Show, purchase a refurbished one, and save up to $60.00--why pay more? It would worth it IF YouTube were a part of the Show. Sadly, it's a no-Show for now and evermore.

IF you're entrenched in the Amazon-centric world of online buying, watching movies with your Amazon membership on a tiny 2.5" screen doesn't seem a likely thing that will catch on. Really. How long can one watch full-length movies on a screen the size of a baseball?  At least with the Echo Show there's more real estate: seven inches of low-resolution. Hell, your tablet is probably bigger than that with a higher pixel density!

If you have a hankering for a small video-call gadget that also plays music, news briefs, weather, even videos, then I say go for it.  But see if you can get a better price by looking for a refurbished unit.  You may find one for less that $90.00 if you try.

If you already have an Echo or Dot, you're not missing much except for the screen, and having a screen on a device this small does nothing to really enhance the experience your larger screen phone can provide.

author: KHALID S.
title: Very nice I am super happy.
content: If I knew how good this is I would have bought one months ago. I am really happy with it

author: shellzy33
title: The advertising for video calling for this product and the Echo Show are misleading
content: I bought this device, along with an Echo Show for my elderly mother, so that we could video chat. Nowhere in the many things I read form Amazing did it mention that both parties need to have access to a smartphone or tablet in order to download the Alexa App. My mother has neither so I am not able to use this for the one specific reason I bought it.

author: David
title: Not bad for first generation product
content: Not bad for first generation product. Still a little quirky. Bought two to visually drop in from one room to the other and discovered that cam does not generate an image in anything but a strongly lit room, and it takes a few moments to wake up and focus. So those worried about bedroom invasion need only turn the lights down.

author: pbin
title: Looks good and screen is very nice
content: Looks good and screen is very nice.  It hears with difficulty and seems to have a volume glitch.  Will only lower volume in one huge step to a whisper, then you have to raise it to a reasonable level.  Takes 2 commands in short.  Then, on the next song, it reverts to the original "too loud" volume.  Would have thoughts this was an easy software bug to fix but 3 months in...

author: Sarah S
title: It does everything!
content: I love love love the echo spot. This thing is incredible!!!

author: Debbie Rhoads
title: Great Echo Spot!!
content: Was previously using the original Echo - but since it was technically our daughter's echo and she was moving out we had to get something to replace it.  We love the Echo in any form we also have two Echo Dots.  Back to the Spot - the sound quality is great - we can call our family without having to lift a finger.  Great addition to our house and the echo family.

author: Mag
title: Its a great product, I have matched it with Philips Hue ...
content: Its a great product, I have matched it with Philips Hue and some light strips. When half way across the room alexa wont pick up my voice but other than that its great!

author: Kimberly A. Jarrell
title: Five Stars
content: Love the echo spot.  Have it in my bedroom and use it for everything.

author: JBird
title: On the fence on this one
content:
Long time fan of the 'Alexa' products.  I use them in garage, kitchen, bedrooms, etc.  They are great for music management (I use Sonos), and controlling my various lights (Hue) and locks (Schlage).  I will say I'm on the fence with the Spot.

My biggest beef is Amazon's comfort to advertising on it's products.  After paying $125 for a product, I don't expect to have multiple click throughs to turn down products of Amazon's.  Call it a pet-peeve, but I feel it's stepping over the line.  Different if they were giving these away.  To top it off, the decline is preset as 'no thank you'.  I personally would be more apt to click a button called 'NO and stop advertising on my device'.

The device is somewhat an expensive bedside clock as it's too small to really be of great data value.  The weather and such can be displayed, but I haven't come across a really solid reason to pay this much more over one the simply speaks the weather.  It does add some value in 'seeing' things like your 'alarm clock' set time verses just listening to it.  This gives a sense that it heard exactly what I told it.  Still playing and looking for a solid win on this one as it's not far off from equally effective as a Dot.

Hope this helps others understand what they are getting into.

author: Heather
title: Convenient for the whole family.
content: So far pretty good device.  Kids love it. Got it hooked up to allplugs switches and outlets and shuts off and on just with a word. My wife and I love playing the game's and havnt touched some of the other video features

author: ris
title: great buy!
content: here it is next to my TV remote for size comparison. so far I have had this thing for a few days and i dont have any dislikes! i have it linked to my TV, and she listens great. Even my 5 year old can tell her to do things and she responds perfectly the first time. She is very kid friendly, she has no trouble understanding anybody who has spoke to her (even my husband who mumbles) she can even hear when you whisper to her. The sound of the speakers are very loud, I have her in my bedroom and i can hear the music over my master bathroom shower. the display is bright the touch screen works great.. I have not yet linked her to a camera source but I ordered the YI cameras and she did not pair well with them so I sent them back to order new cameras. I have smart plugs coming tuesday.. I hope to get those working soon after receiving them. I love this purchase tho, money well spent!

author: Shane Broska
title: This thing is neat!!
content: we Had already bought a Show so we went with this for our parents to each have one.  Drop ins r great!! Our kids can call the grandparents with ease.  I would buy another!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great value
content: I LOVE this item. Bought it to check on my dogs while I'm at work.

author: S. Jones
title: Love Alexa
content: I’ve only just started learning uses for Alexa but I love her already. She gives me reminders, tracks my orders, answers questions saving me time looking things up on internet, adds things to grocery list , and this is just a few things. Love Alexa, simplifies things

author: Michael F.
title: This is a very cool device
content: This is a fun toy for me.  While I am a bit wary of the whole listening in on me thing, I am willing to suppress my concerns to enjoy the conveniences it offers.  It works flawlessly and I have hooked it up to work with my sound system (Sonos) and doorbell cameras (Ring).  It all works pretty seamlessly.  I would like it to have a better speaker, so I could just use it in a separate room without tapping into Sonos and get better sound.

author: Tammy L. Martin
title: So many features to enjoy!
content: Echo is really nice to have. I like that I can listen to music, even songs that I didn't think were available, Like " Brand new key." I also enjoy the reminders, and especially like that I can see news, videos etc on the screen. I am still learning how to use it, but I'm enjoying it very much. Can't wait to use the drop in feature to see, and talk to family. I feel like the cartoon "The Jetsons" is more a reality now.

author: Bubu
title: Makes my life easier!
content: Fun to use, helpful in many ways, set alarms, play anything over it, it's fun!

author: B. Lunt
title: Enjoy having it our office to talk with our son ...
content: Enjoy having it our office to talk with our son who also got one at the same time while he is in his office.

author: MIchelle Pia-lawson
title: Better than I expected
content: I like that it can hear you better than the dot. It has a bigger screen than I expected. The screen looks very modern and not like a computer screen. It dims as it gets dark . I like it has a drop in feature so you don’t have to spend a lot of money on the show. My husband doesn’t have a cell phone and can send messages to me. I can also do a video call to him with the app from my phone to the spot.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Debating between echo models? This is the one
content: I absolutely love this thing, I also have a earlier generation echo dot but this thing is better in every way. Very cool as a clock and excellent at voice recognition and functionality. I couldn’t be happier with this purchase. It has made sure I wasn’t late over the last year where my other normal alarm clock routinely failed. If your debating between echo models I believe this is the one to go with.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Buy a full size Echo, skip the screen
content: The screen is a novelty, if it doesn't support YouTube, Google,  or Apple products. Asking someone to download another app for screen time is ridiculous.  I love my full size Echo, but for the price, why bother with the poor sound quality of an clock radio.

author: Jim
title: Nice replacement for the Dot. Small screen and 100 times the usefulness.
content: It's a Dot with a lot more usefulness, visual cues, maybe it's just me but I use it a lot more than the other devices, just the right size for my overly cluttered desk. Bought two with one to go to grandparents in Tijuana for visual talks. This item allows me to see visual cues for new uses for the Amazon products. The camera is tilted back for closeup use and announced this this was available for selfies with visual notes. It seems to hold 3 but it's not straight out like you might think. Will be trying to set it up in Tijuana this afternoon.

author: ILK
title: Love this!
content: I got this cute little spot to use as a nightstand clock. I love all the different clock face choices, the different alarm or music options and having the weather right where I can see it before I even get out of bed. It even shows me the words to the songs that It plays for me. Love it!

author: CallaLily757
title: Wonderful little spot
content:
Alexa...why didn't I buy an Echo Spot sooner???
Wonderful little spot...plays music & displays weather & clock -- love it.  She tells jokes, reads stories...could have used this when the kid was little.  Love the music.  Had to learn to say Alexa then pause then say whatever it is.  And, oddly enough, Alexa comes on randomly sometimes.  Guess the TV does it...not sure.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great feeling.
content: Still getting acquainted, but has changed my lifestyle from almost always late, to almost always on time.  Great feeling.

author: kohiko burrell
title: The Good and Why!
content: Love my Alexa Dots products but am somewhat disappointed with my newest addition, the Echo Spot. Now that Blink cameras have been acquired by Amazon, would really like to see the ability to watch Blink's video clips on Spot. At present am only able to get times last motion clip recorded. Oddly, to view security video clips on Spot I must now purchase a new camera system compatible with Alexa when Blink is already a part of the Amazon/Alexa family!

author: Tricia
title: Helpful for elderly
content: Very easy to set up, I bought it for my elderly mom for alarm clock, weather report and for emergency calls

author: Dobe
title: Stylish and small
content: I haven’t had the chance to set it up yet but I am really looking forward to using the Echo to replace my outdated alarm clock and having ability to automate the lights in the bedroom.

author: bobble
title: I like the design though
content: It can never hear me. I have to yell at it and when when it can hear me, it can't understand what I say. I imagine this is an Aussie accent issue in combination with reduced mic capability. I like the design though. They should release a voice training skill so you can teach it to understand certain words.

author: T. Chase
title: Five Stars
content: The Echo Spot is awesome! Works very well. I highly recommended it.

author: Rverb
title: Great Alarm
content: I use the product as an alarm clock. I love being able to set my schedule for the week and not worry about it. When images are shown, they are cut off. Little because its trying to fit it into a circle.

author: Scott Jones
title: Make life simple.
content: Added this along with my Echo Show and it is worth every penny.

author: Kayle Growcock
title: Favorite amazing purchase to date!
content:
We have our echo spot in our kitchen and use it every day!
Every day, we ask Alexa questions that we have in the moment, I prove my husband wrong when he doubts my knowledge, we play Question of the Day, we watch the daily briefing every morning, and we dance to all kinds of music with our kiddos!
The screen display is amazing and the speaker quality is exceptional! Perfect for dance sessions!
I really love: the lyrics that you can see when listening to music, how you can read her responses as well as hear them, see the time/temp, see random news stories flash through the screen all day, and how you can watch your prime videos on the spot!!
Perfect size and lovely appearance. It looks sleek anywhere I place it. My favorite amazon purchase to date!

We also recently bought the echo, and the spot and echo paired with each other easily!

author: Maria
title: Five Stars
content: Awesome item that I had to buy two!

author: Nadine Panek
title: Love this mini Alexa
content: Love this mini Alexa!  She’s a perfect size for my kitchen counter! I cook a lot so she is a timer and radio more than anything. But she is synced to my ARLO  cameras so I can see around my house with HER help!

author: L. Wood
title: Just what I expect from Amazon
content: Love al. The info in one spot.  Still adding skills to make easier

author: Era53
title: Everything should run on Echo
content: Echo is starting to replace clocks and audio devices in my home, welcome to the 21st century.

author: Colleen H.
title: Love our Echo Spot!
content: The Echo Spot exceeded our expectations!  We love the wide range of music, which is available with Prime, the ease of operation and the size!

author: Anthony Boffice
title: Okay, fine! I really like it!
content: Pre-ordered in case I needed an extra Christmas gift.  I have echo's new and old all over the house including an echo show.  Didn't end up needing it as a gift and fully intended on returning it.  I figured it's small, sound wouldn't be great, and doubted the usefulness of such a tiny screen. And as others have mentioned you could get a show for not much more dough.  But it kept staring at me so I decided to open it and check it out.  So here's the thing...it's flipping adorable!  And it's perfect for what it's designed for.  Perfect for the bedroom and a perfect alarm clock. Realized the speaker is adequate for the bedroom (I had to actually think about how very little I listen to music there).  I also realized all I use my bedroom echo for is alarms, weather, and some smart home stuff. Sounds better than the dot obviously, but no bass due to its size so no where near as good as a regular echo.  Nice touch to add audio out via cable and Bluetooth in case I ever need it.  Also it's really nice to see my calendar reminders, the weather, and see my Amazon cameras. So yeah, the lil guy really won me over within 15 minutes.  Reminds me of the little chumby I had years ago! Some random things I saw in other reviews that weren't right btw... Yes you can turn off the tips, yes you can connect speakers, phones and headphones via Bluetooth, yes you can disable the camera (or tape over it if you're really paranoid), yes it gets really dim at night if you want it to.  Also I know some reviewers complained about them (were almost offended by them), but I really like the tips!  Even though I turned them off on the spot, I use them all the time on my echo show.  I am an expert user but the "try" this tips can be fun and informative.  Alexa does ALOT so it's nice to learn a couple new things or even be reminded here and there. The only knock is the price. But like I said, spend a little time with it and you are like fine!...I really like you!  I'll keep you, even though you're a little too expensive!

author: Roberto J. Tercero
title: Five Stars
content: Better than my original echo. Have in the bedroom and now I can see the time without asking.

author: D. Norwood
title: Neat device
content: Very nice because you can control your thermostat and security system with the Echo Spot AND you can see your live video/camera footage with the Spot (as well as video calls like FaceTime).  Not sure if you can control your thermostat and security systems with the Dot, but obviously the Dot does not have the small monitor to view live coverage of what your security system can see.  Other than that, not much of a difference, but about 3 times as expensive as the Dot.  Both devices are neat, but the main difference that I can see is having the small monitor to see who you are talking with, viewing security system, etc.

author: sadiayah
title: Woohoo
content: I’m only sorry I didn’t buy more on prime day

author: Lemonslices
title: Love it!
content: We use several spots around our house as a sort of intercom system. They are alarm clocks, music players, story readers, and more all in one. My wife was worried about “big brother” always listening in, but honestly if the want to drop in on our personal conversations I’m sure they could do that through our phones anyway (besides, I’m boring and don’t have anything to hide).

author: Laura Gregg
title: Sound
content: The sound is so weak. I know it is small but there is technology that would give better sound. Please work on this. Paid a lot for an alarm clock since I cannot listen to music.

author: Peace Queen
title: True apppreciation if you take the time to get to know and learn what she can do!
content: Love love love, it does so much more than what you think, amazing , looking forward to future capabilities! I needed an alarm clock I could see at night but not too bright and wanted it voice activated. Got it and so much more!

author: Agustin Lopez
title: Bummer it doesn't use my iPhone's music library for alarm!
content: Even though I really really like it, thought it could use my iPhone's music library to alarm wake up settings. Otherwise, excellent product!

author: shaunoxster
title: Like with all Amazon products (e
content: Like with all Amazon products (e.g., Alexa, dot, etc.) the speaker is weak.  Once the alarm is triggered, you have to yell at Echo or ask it to shut off at least two-three times.  Very frustrating first thing in the morning.

author: Jim Payne
title: Good quality!
content: This is my third Echo device and they all are excellent!

author: Breeze
title: Echo Is More Than Sound in Your Life
content: Love Echo Spot is great looking, works great, and just fun to use. Life is easier with Echo Spot helping you out in so many ways. Just a great buy for the home and family use.

author: Chris White
title: FUN!
content: enjoying the ability to video chat with my child

author: Lee
title: This is amazing
content: The Echo Spot works great except that she doesn’t always understand what I say.

author: Juan Carlos Palacio
title: very happy I have the 3 echo plus
content:
very happy
 I have the 3 echo plus, dot and spot
the only thing missing is youtube and I place 5 stars

author: Susie Kinsey
title: Echo Rocks!
content: I LOVE my Echo Spot.  It’s replaced my clock in my bedroom.  It’s just perfect!

author: Head Doctor
title: Five Stars
content: use this for alarm clock among other things-really glad purchased this spot-works great

author: Gadget freak in SF
title: Great little device!! I love it!
content:
I read a lot of reviews and saw a lot of YouTube videos before I bought this. I already have a house full of Echo products, a second gen. Echo, two Echo Dots, and two Sonos One Alexa enabled speakers. So I thought, why do I need another one?

My main intention with purchasing this was to replace the Echo Dot in my bedroom. I have it connected to a Bose Wave Radio that I've had for years which greatly improves the sound, but it's very boring looking. I wanted something more aesthetically pleasing to the eye. Well, this Echo Spot does just that! This thing is beautiful and so cute. The addition of the LCD color screen makes all the difference and I love the ball shape, definitely give it character. The ability to change and customize all the clock faces is really fun. The interaction of the display when you play music (sometimes with lyrics), video news, weather displays, etc., makes it worth the price in my opinion.

The sound from the little speaker is still pretty sub par, but definitely better than the Echo Dot. I would strongly suggest connecting it to a Bluetooth speaker if you're going to be playing any music on it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A little smaller as small but awesome.
content: Love the idea and how small it is but the round shape  makes for some strange croppings of things you might want to or need to read or see. Allows me to easily see who's atbthe front door with my Alexa capable camera and still does everything that Alexa was already great for.

author: Ana Taveras
title: I loved it but had to return it because I do ...
content: I loved it but had to return it because I do a lot of monitoring my mother around the house due to her illness and screen is to small for that. otherwise I love this amazing clock and monitor. Good for monitoring the baby. I got the Echo Show instead. I will recommend this smart device. Just love it

author: cpu99
title: Graphics controls still leave a lot to be desired
content: I wanted it to show the weather all the time, but I can't. It will only rotate about once thru all its displays, the weather being the second one, and then go in "sleep" mode where even the background you selected for the clock isn't showed in its full glory. Needs lots of work. Should come with a free stand instead of requiring an extra $20 for a tiny piece of plastic. Definitively an overpriced device for what you get.

author: NYCJF
title: I had no idea I’d use this A.I. device so much!
content: My Echo Spot is an alarm clock, Bluetooth music player, drop-in phone caller, fish tank, Hue light controller, on-demand news brief, recipe book, music streamer, timer and so much more!  My two Echo Dots do all this, but the Spot has video.

author: TMH
title: It is all of the great stuff from the standard Echo
content: The Spot is a worthy addition to the Amazon Echo family. It is all of the great stuff from the standard Echo, plus a decent video screen. Sure, the screen is small. But it isn’t made for watching from a distance. We are using it as a clock in our bedroom and it is doing just great. We haven’t scratched the surface of what we could do with this thing yet. Right now it is the hub for some smart plugs controlling lamps and then some of the simple weather/time/questions functions.

author: Andie
title: Best Echo ever!
content: My new favorite Echo. Perfect size for any room. I'm using it as my bedroom clock, alarm to my fave song and speaker. They hit the nail on the head with this one!

author: MHR
title: We love using it for bedtime reading on Audible
content: We love using it for bedtime reading on Audible. It's very kid-friendly, and I can see liking it in the kitchen while I'm cooking since it's small and unobtrusive. We like it better than our Echo Dot.

author: Mark Mollick
title: Great product
content: Great product

author: Jacque S. Roberts
title: The Greatest Little Gadget and Companion to Echo Plus!!.
content: Love It!  So much, that I ordered and received the glass cover for the screen.  Just right for your night-stand. Even though the screen is small, I have already watched to Prime Video movies while reading and enjoying the experience in the "dark".  I love the feature that allows you to upload a favorite photo as the clock-face which gives you the time and temperature!!.  And, it lets you know all of the current events, news, and trending items right on the unit.  I recently engaged the Drop-in feature so that I can hear my grand kids doings in the living room when they visit without having to leave my Master - This is a great little gadget and companion to my Echo Plus!!.

author: Steven Simmons
title: 4 microphones. Unresponsive?
content: The new echo spot is great, honestly. The device is cute. The screen is perfect. Aside from watching videos, which I don’t think this should be used for. However the ‘Spot’ is incredibly louder than the ‘Dot’ which in fact makes it unresponsive to the Alexa wake word when the volume is all the way up. Finding myself yelling at the device over the music. Probably should have went with 6 microphones instead of 4...

author: M.B.
title: plus a great fully functional clock face
content: Everything that I've come to expect from an Echo device, plus a great fully functional clock face.  I'm not interested in the voice ordering of products, so haven't used the feature with that showing on the device yet (probably never will).  Also haven't done a video chat call, not my thing.  But we have used it for "drop in" with daughter stationed across the country.  Reason for only 4 stars instead of 5:  the customizability of the home screens doesn't let me REMOVE annoying advertising from that rotation.

author: Byron
title: the best product and way ahead of all the others!
content: Love it! much better than google or apple!

author: TsoKa
title: Meh at best. Everything You read is accurate. But I guess I'm spoiled by Echo Plus
content:
Echo Spot is a wonderful addition to your alexa smart home family.
However I guess I was expecting more out of Echo spot.
Don't get me wrong! This is accurate advertisement and everything you read is absolutely true.
HOWEVER!! comparatively speaking, the sound quality is disappointing :(!! and I say this compare to the Echo DOT!!
I am surprised by the sound quality produced by the Echo Dot 3rd generation. I guess I expect more out of Echo Spot especially it's 3 times the price of an Echo dot.
Yes I get it, Echo dot does not have screen or these wonderful display. however Comparatively speaking of all Alexa Family Echo Spot speakers are disappointing :( (I own echo plus, echo dot and 2 echo spots, I got them all during Black Friday)

I say just spend a little more money and get the Echo Show.
I will be returning my 2 Echo Spots (one is unopened ) and use that money to get either echo plus/show or dot. Because frankly all of them sound much much much much much better than echo spot.

author: Bill Esposito
title: love it. Also like setting a sleep timer and ...
content: Use it as my alarm clock, love it.  Also like setting a sleep timer and listening to music.  I purchased a $19 UPS so that it works with/without power.

author: Amazon Customer
title: What a surprise
content: This is a great toy/gadget and functional too.  You can a actually watch things on this device, even though I'm not a big fan of a tiny screen, it's nice to have for somethings when you're in a hurry.  Love it

author: Samuel M Ferguson
title: Great for daily information
content: Great for daily information, entertainment and humor. Most advanced bedside Alarm Clock on the market today, and that's just the beginning. It learns and better adapts to your routine.

author: abandelman
title: I love that it will show some of my photos - ...
content: So far, I'm loving the Spot.  I have only figured out a few things that it can do - and those are mainly by accident.  I love that it will show some of my photos - I'm still trying to figure out how to get all my photos in there that I want to be shown. And I'm still trying to figure out how to get it to play my Amazon Music playlists. Oh - and I wish it were wireless.  I take it outside when I get home everyday but have to unplug and replug in.  But that's a minor issue.

author: VASteve
title: Nice upgrade to the Echo dot.
content: Looks right at home next to my chair.  So far it's been working non stop without a hitch.

author: gte888v
title: Convenient, Practical, Smart Device that looks slick
content: Word recognition works equal to or better than dot. Great way to pop in on my baby and see how she is doing in her crib! New features are being added all of the time to the device so I am having to keep up. Aesthetically pleasing and well designed. I currently use it in my living room but I could see value in bedroom or kitchen as well. Surprisingly, I'm using the function to take random pictures a lot when I play with my baby.

author: Lance_big_daddy
title: I really want to love this...but I can't
content: It is beautifully designed and built.  But the severe lack of customization options makes it not very useful.  It works fine as an Echo, but the information displayed in the screen is limited.  What really ruins it though is that one cannot turn off the annoying "Try this" suggestions.  That is so annoying I am likely going to return the device.  I don't need to be told to "ask about dog toys", or "ask what time it is Tokyo", etc. every freaking time I walk by the device.  Also, it needs a physical camera cover so one can be assured of privacy in the bedroom.

author: William L. Sanders
title: Great gadget. The screen adds a lot.
content: Love this device. The screen makes the interface easier and more useful although for a significant jump in price over the Echo Dot.

author: asuss
title: The screen makes the Echo so much more useful
content: We've owned a number of Echo devices, but have viewed them as more of a toy than a tool.  Other than playing music through a sound system, we haven't found much use for them.  We just don't find the voice user interface to be all that efficient.  The Echo Spot solves the efficiency problem by displaying the information that you're routinely interested in.  Furthermore, you can do some basic navigation using the touch screen as well as tailor the settings.  We now use these as bedside clocks.

author: David Heck
title: My Favorite of the Alexa A.I. Products!
content:
My Favorite of the Alexa Products. I also have two minis and one Alexa. Great sound and also has a bluetooth speaker connection., perfect side table clock and the screen can display your music, shopping lists, recipes, articles etc. I have not use the camera for a call. I'm very happy with my Alexa products.

All they need to do is enhance the 'wake word' option. This is the Alexa's true failing. Alexa mishears her name at least once a day in my house. It need to be a phrase like the google AI.

PLEASE add a "hey Alexa" to the wake work list.

author: CMoore
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent product. Fun way to find out information.

author: Jambandman
title: Spot on!
content: Certainly met my expectations.  Just what I was looking for.  Wish it were a bit more functional bedside.  There needs to be a way to control without speaking - more button functions.  This way you do not have to disturb the person next to you.

author: Hunters Mom
title: Perfect
content: Love it

author: Peter C.
title: Excellent, with a few downsides
content:
I use my Echo Spot as my new alarm clock.  It works great!  I only have a couple of complaints:

1. The interface makes it a bit difficult to set alarms.  It can be done, but not as easily as others (I'd previously used a Sonos One speaker).  With the Spot, I need to create five separate alarms since I have a different wake-up time one day per week.  Alexa defaults to either a single day every week or "weekdays" and "weekends."  It is also more complicated than it should be to wake-up to music (ie., a TuneIn radio station) instead of using a stock alarm sound.

2. The speaker is worse than the original Echo Dot.

author: M. Bennett
title: Great nightstand tool and assistant
content: I love having the visual screen to go along with all the functionality of my Dot.

author: Craftcpc
title: Giant Features packed into a compact wizard!
content: Greatest purchase ever from Amazon!  I just am nuts about my Spot and will for sure be getting another one as I love the ability to video chat from one to another.

author: WDP
title: Five Stars
content: using it at work LOVE it and I can check in on home also

author: Hemmi06
title: Neato....
content: Neat device to go along with othe Alexa items. Wish there was the ability to sync them all if you do desired.

author: ArrowInTheKnee2!
title: Good buy
content: Very nice and we love it. Esp if you have amazon cams

author: Susan Busse
title: Love my Echo Spot
content: Love my Echo Spot. We have 4 Echo's and this one is in our master bedroom. Love listening to Nature Sounds as we sleep. Really like the display screen and love the drop in feature.

author: Maverick
title: The Echo Dot gets a display; bluetooth settings are missing.
content:
I ordered the white Echo Spot to occupy a night table, taking the spot previously occupied with the Echo Dot.

Unlike the Echo Show, which takes up more room but still disappoints with the sound, the Spot has a footprint similar to that of the Dot, and provides a screen that is large enough to display the time and other information.

The touchscreen is responsive; interacting with it takes little effort. The brightness responds to changes in lighting conditions, so you don't have this bright glowing thing in the darkness of the night.

The Spot sound better than the Dot, and could pass as an alarm clock speaker.

What seems to be missing in the settings, however, is the ability to pair the Spot with a bluetooth speaker. This is how we use most of the Dots in our home, and that is how I would like to be able to use the Spot. I am sure this is an oversight in the settings, and should get resolved soon.

I do think that the price point needs to be lower. The Spot is $50 more than the Echo that sounds better, and only $20 less than the Show that has a larger (albeit uselessly larger) screen. I think the right price point for the Spot is $100 or $110.

So far, I'm happy, and hopeful that the bluetooth settings will appear soon on alexa.amazon.com.

author: Kevin M
title: Echo Rocks
content: Platform keeps getting better. Enjoy all of the various models and combinations available

author: Buyer
title: This item was returned with the security lights. In the same box it came in.
content: Item never opened it was returned with security lights in the same box it came in.

author: Patrice A. Hunt
title: Just added echo spot
content: We have had an Echo downstairs for a few years thought I needed one in our bedroom. I use to add stuff to my shopping list, as an Alarm and to listen to music . Check weather for that day and days coming up which comes in handy when packing for the weekend away.

author: R. M. S. Deese
title: Compact and Powerful!
content: Very happy with this item...and I know I haven't even scratched the surface for what it can do! It sits on my desk and has been really helpful with maintaining productivity.

author: Michael Holeda
title: This product exceeded my expectations. The only recommendation I ...
content: This product exceeded my expectations.  The only recommendation I could possibly make is a battery backup for power, since I do have it on my bedside stand.

author: Amazon Customer
title: BUGGY FIX THE BUGS
content: If you dont tell it exactly what the skill name is ...it will not understand pulls up wrong things or different stuff each time frustrating. Have Hue lights and often Spot says cant connect to lights wont turn on or turns on and when it does the lights will be very dim and I have to again tell it to turn lights to 100% setting just like music is always low. Spending a lot of time making it understand me. When I told Alexa to set a alarm to music or not  it sets the volume so low on alarm  I was late to work what kinda of alarm clock is automatically quiet! I dont trust its alarm function so buggy that I use my phone instead the only thing it can do consistency is tell you the weather forcast.

author: Pablo
title: So far I like the product
content: So far I like the product, specially the ability of voice commands. I haven't use to it's full potential but working on integrating other accessories to control other appliences. Another feature I like the integration oh my calendar. I wish that "Alexa" could be bilingual.

author: Eric Westrope
title: Fantastic Echo Bedside device
content:
Excellent device. I have the Echo, first generation and have used it a lot.
I had thought about purchasing an Echo Dot for my bedside, but this showed up in the store for pre-order, so I ordered it.
Very happy with it. Not only can I go to sleep now listening to my music, I now have a great bedside clock again, which beats using my phone. And it has decent alarm which actually wakes me up on time.
I have also used it for listening to my Audible Audiobooks and newsflashs briefings.
I understand it can be used for videos. But that really does not interest me, so I haven't tried it, nor the video calling feature, since I do not have any family or friends that currently own an Echo device.
But the features I do use, make this a worth while device, at least for me.

author: A Mom
title: Super convenient. Wish the sound quality was better
content: Super convenient.  Wish the sound quality was better.  Maybe in a future version.

author: Tdbpayne
title: Great product
content: Absolutely love this little thing but my 3rd gen echo Dot has better sound.

author: Jim Malik
title: Problem after only 4 month
content: I have only had Alexa for 4 months and now all she says is "sorry, something went wrong".  This is not what I expected after only a short time. Need to send it back.

author: releppes
title: An expensive alarm clock, but stylish
content:
This is one of Amazons more pricy gizmos, but i hand it to them for simple and stylish. It was not as easy to set up as i expected. Out of the box it had a horrible time connecting to my WiFi router. After a few reboots, it came up and starting working. That makes me a little uneasy for long term usage. The display is crisp and the sound is okay. I upgraded my Dot to the Spot thinking the sound would be much better. It wasn't much of an improvement. Just slightly better in my opinion.

Overall another great product from Amazon. Expensive, but attractive and simple.

author: Jason Ramsey
title: Great
content: Great

author: Jerry Regalado
title: Five Stars
content: The ease of operation and the way it looks.

author: Bryan B
title: For my use, Echo Dot is a better experience
content: For me, the echo dot is a better experience. The Echo spot doesn’t say answers out loud when asked questions, they show up on the screen instead. I also have issues with the scrolling banners to ask Alexa that can’t be turned off.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Don't waste your money
content: Pretty stupid piece of hardware, and it is incapable of doing the one simple thing I purchased it for. I was hoping to buy this, and have it display the temperature at all times, but the best it can do is stay on the home clock, or rotate between screens. You cannot remove the, "try things," feature at all. So Alexa will always recommend you try asking things like, "how the spell, 'rhythm,'" because I guess Alexa assumes the American education system failed me like everyone else. Needless to say, out of the box, it was very frustrating trying to troubleshoot this to do the most simple things. Amazon support, and the help articles available for this device are so convoluted, and so innumerable, it's an hour long process just trying to find the information you need. Just buy a dot for $30, and don't waste your time with this overpriced piece of garbage.

author: Shane
title: Seems like a hit
content: Christmas present for my 15 year old, the screen works well and is surprisingly big enough to enjoy.  Connected well to his smart devices

author: Ronald Harris
title: A Nice Addition to My Other Echos
content: The Echo I received performs as advertised with no issues.  I already own a Echo and Echo Dot so I'm enjoying the visual display of the Echo Spot.  It is nice to work all three devices together.  I particularly like connecting with my Cameras.  Worked great with no issues at all.  Love display.  This is an excellent product and I would purchase again, in fact I'm going to invest in the Echo Show.

author: MP from NY
title: Amazon should listen to its customers.
content:
I own 3 of these...  amazon is ignoring its customers and using these devices as a marketing tool.  You can customize the screen contents, but you cannot turn off there advertising, Things to Try...  People will suggest that you can, but you can only do so if you turn off all content changes which is not an acceptable option.

Moreover, they should increase the size slightly, and improve the audio speaker.  That would give you a 5 star device.

Right now i’m debating whether to return all 3 devices.  My wife says we should.

author: Brad Robinson
title: Awesome. Exactly what I expected out of it!
content:
I love this thing. I talk to it through walls and in other rooms. I have been an amazon lover for a while so I have amazon music unlimited, kindle unlimited, prime video, etc., so I was ready for this when it came out. The screen is just so nice to have.
The only thing resembling a down side is that it doesn't always perfectly understand which song I want to hear, but I do have a deep southern accent, lower Alabama, so I don't speak English anyways.

author: Time to walk the dog, Dave
title: Good looking, but too many odd behaviors and too many limitations
content:
I like the look and feel the device itself. It feels very well made.  However, I find it only a slight improvement over an Echo Dot due to limitations and odd behavior.  For example, one minor odd behavior is the one shown in the picture.  If you ask Alexa to turn up the volume, the device pauses the video and overlays the screen with some controls that don’t even include volume control. Why? I don’t know anyone who wants to watch TV that way. Oh well...

Pros:

* Good looking hardware
* It’s a good alarm clock.
* Includes the same function as an Echo Dot

Cons:

* You cannot play the same videos you can play in the Prime Video app or through a Firestick. For example, no Netflix.
* No YouTube.
* The Spot’s display does not integrate as a target/action in IFTTT or Stringify*
* The Spot doesn’t pick up voice as well as a Dot**
* Alexa is much louder than video.
* You cannot schedule the display to be turned off automatically at night.
* You cannot change the font, font size, and font color for time (especially noticeable when you a photo backdrop)
* It has an LCD display instead of OLED
* It insists on pausing video to turn up volume.
* Annoying default rotation for things to try.

Footnotes:

* It’s true that neither Alexa nor any Echo integrates as an IFTTT or Stringify target (just a trigger), but the situation is more noticeable with a Spot for all the simple things you cannot do with its screen. For example, update the clock’s background image automatically from a variety of sources.

** The Spot has 4 microphones, the Dot 7 (according to specs). This was very noticeable when I was sitting in bed, the Spot was next to me on a nightstand and the Dot would reply from across the room. I had to move the Dot so that Spot could reply

author: Abby dawson
title: Love the screen.
content: Love this thing. We have a dot and a full Alexa tower thing. This is by far our favorite. Love the little screen. We can check our cameras, including our nursery camera, from the Spot.

author: Bob in Atlanta
title: My Favorite Echo Yet
content: I've only had my Echo Spot a few days, but it's already been a blast, becoming my favorite Echo product yet.  First of all, it takes the place of a clunky, 20-year-old clock radio on the nightstand, looking modern and high-tech.  And asking Alexa to set an alarm is MUCH easier than doing it manually.  Then there's the sound quality.  You really CAN use it as a speaker and be quite satisfied with the quality of music.  I also like using Echo Spot with my Arlo cameras to see who's at the front door or getting my Flash Briefing with accompanying video.  Playing Jeopardy is more fun, too, because now I can read the questions, not just listen to them.  I'm guessing there'll will be another Echo Spot in my future.

author: Jessica
title: This is astonishing with the quality of video.
content: We love our new Echo Spot. It stays in our bedroom so while getting ready for work in the morning we can hear and watch our news briefings and weather. This is also great for making calls.

author: coco
title: Five Stars
content: I just love my little friend.  You can do a lot with it.

author: Gerzy
title: use unknown!
content: still not quite sure what this is good for, screen too small for video! Also it seems to be quite hot while plugged in which is very worrisome!

author: N. Poventud
title: Best smart alarm clock!  Camera can be disabled.
content:
I absolutely love this thing. I had an Echo Show in my bedroom but it took up a lot of space on my nightstand. It is now in the kitchen and this replaced it perfectly. This looks like a modern alarm clock that will blend in seamlessly with your bedroom decor. This is the perfect compromise of size and function.

The Camera
Personally, I say so what. Many people are worried about privacy concerns. If you have a cell phone, it most likely has a camera and a microphone that can record too. Just like a cell phone, you can disable the camera in settings and also mute the mics. If you absolutely do not trust it, you can put electric tape over the camera like many do to a laptop. Not a big deal for me. The features and capabilities GREATLY outweigh this perceived "negative".

The Screen
This is the best alarm clock on the market hands down. If you own an Echo Show, then you know how nice it is to have a screen to go with Alexa. You can customize the clock face on your alarm clock however you like. You can see your calendar and upcoming appointments. You can watch movies from Prime video. You can watch the news video broadcast in the mornings with your flash briefing. There are so many things you can do with this. I use it to check cameras in my house to look after my sleeping baby and to see who is at the front door or in the backyard. Tons of promise here.

The Sound
Simply put, this is just okay sound. It sounds better than the Echo Dot, but not as good as the Echo Show. You can plug in a set of speakers using the auxiliary port or you can go Bluetooth. As we all know, the Echo product line does not compare to Sonos or Bose. They won't be bringing any awards home for sound of the year. If you are an audiophile you probably will not be using this for playing music in your bedroom anyway.

Alexa
If you are looking at the echo product line you probably already know what you can do with Alexa. What I'll do is basically share how I use it. I have put in smart plugs and switches so I can turn on and off lights without getting out of bed. I use it to turn on and off ceiling fans and to view my Arlo cameras and Ring doorbell. I can ask Kevo if the front door is locked and not have to go downstairs to find out. Alexa is a growing ecosystem and is compatible with the most smart devices of AI available.

The Verdict
Must buy! If you are looking at this, you should get this. Something about it caught your eye which means you are interested in a smart alarm clock. I tried hard to find something wrong with this device. The only thing I could wish was better is the sound quality. This is a must buy for all bedrooms!

author: Brenda J.
title: Spot Sound Quality A Bit Muffled
content: Sound quality on the Spot is a lower pitched sound vs. the Dot. It may be slightly better for Spot music but not so good for the Alexa speaking voice. Amazon needs to update the sound quality of the Spot to a bit higher pitch, such that the Alexa's voice is clearer and less muffled.

author: David Edwards
title: Four Stars
content: Great alarm clock replacement.

author: nicolelleirb
title: A great bedside alarm!
content:
I received this as a gift, and immediately replaced my old alarm clock.  I never trusted my phone 100% and always preferred an alarm clock.  The best part about this is not having to navigate for any buttons, it just does exactly what I tell her to do.  It picks up on my voice super easily.  I enjoy the snooze a bit too much, and it's really convenient when I can just say "Alexa, snooze" and it gives me 10 more minutes.  To stop the alarm, I just say " Alexa, stop".  It's also a great deal to get the amazon music for about $5 a month, which allows you to play any song at any time.  I love to set reminders about things I need to take to work that day, or ask about the weather as I'm picking out an outfit.  I don't use the call feature or many of the other features, but what I do use it for, is worth it to me.  I'm getting my daughter one for Christmas this year and we are getting one for the living room.  I thought it would be nice to the have the music feature in other rooms, plus contact each other through Alexa.
After I got mine, so did my dad and my sister.  I haven't heard anything but positive remarks.

author: Amy R,
title: My new BFF
content: *sigh* I love my Echo.  Like, big puffy heart it.  It's like I have a new BFF.  My son had so much fun asking Alexa to play music, tell jokes, play 20 questions and what the weather was all over the world... I ended up getting him his own!  I love the alarm feature to wake up to my music (or "Best Day Ever" by SpongeBob!), I love the announce feature to get my son out of bed... I love the flash briefing to get all the info I need for the day.  All in all, it's great!  I don't have any issues with the Echo at all.  The skills can be hit or miss, but that's most likely user error, not Echo's fault.

author: Kindle Customer
title: works fine
content: It was fun to have for the first week, but it's really just a toy.  We use it to turn lights on and off and the occasional weather report, but we usually use our phones for most everything Alexa can do.  I suppose if you had your whole house connected, you could REALLY be lazy and use Alexa so you never had to stand up and exert any energy at all...  I wonder if Alexa could do my sit ups for me- let me ask...  no, she can't do that- yet.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bought the spot and loved it. Within months it started acting funny and ...
content: Bought the spot and loved it. Within months it started acting funny and would stop working—called and they determined that it was overheating. I was told to unplug and technical support would call within 24-48 hours. Waited 48 hours without response and replied to email and was asked to wait a week. A week goes by with absolutely no response so I do the inline chat per instructions. Told to wait longer. REALLY????  Unacceptable—expected more from Amazon. Find it funny how they always thank me for being a Prime member but when an issue arises I cannot even get assistance.

author: Joel Wetzel
title: "Things to Try" ruins an otherwise great Alexa clock
content: Amazon, give us an option to turn that off, and I'll change the review to 5 stars.  Otherwise brilliant little device.  But it's screen real estate is precious.  I shouldn't be losing 100% of it for something I don't want.

author: Paul P
title: Great addition to the family!
content: Awesome addition to our echo family.  This is in addition to the original echo and the dot.  This one works great, with a clear screen.  Bought primarily as an alarm clock but use it with a sleep timer each night too.  Works as good as all the other echos and sounds great too

author: Tim Clarke
title: Great Device, Amazon Listening to Customers.
content:
This is a mini Echo Show.I have every Echo product, and the Spot seems to be able to pick my voice up very well. I have no issues. All Echo devices I unplug and plug back in every once in a while to reboot, I have done a reboot with the Echo Spot once in the month I have owned. Yes, this has a camera and small speaker, which features I use a lot. I am not worried about privacy since I have webcams, tablets, cell phones, and TVs with microphones and cameras laying around the house already.
  The hardware is everything I wanted after owning the Echo Show. Echo Show is just too big for a desk, better on the counter or a bigger piece of furniture like a secretary. Same screen, just smaller and round. Nicer sound than an Echo Dot. Great display. This fits nice on a desk or nightstand. I tried on the nightstand one night, it was neat watching the news and a quiet movie to fall asleep to. In the end, it sits on the desk. Because there are so many useful features, I chose to stare at it all day usually tuning into different exterior/interior cameras to check out what the family is doing while I am working.

Things I like:
1. I have the Spot sitting on my home office desk. I also have an  Echo Show in the Living Room by the front door. I like that I can "drop in" on any Echo for voice intercom, and "Drop in" on the Living Room for video intercom via Echo Show.
2. I like that cheap cameras like the EZVIZ series connect really well to the Spot. I don't need to spend major money on higher end Arlos, etc.
3. I like the screen a lot. I like the scrolling information, especially the extra Alexa tips. It makes me use Alexa more in general and helps me grow my "alexa capabilities".
  3.1 - I like the touch screen. Scrolling through lists, pausing music, etc. is SOMETIMES easier vs. talking to Alexa.

Favorite Alexa commands on this device:
"Alexa show me the patio camera".
"Alexa show me my lists"
"Alexa play Joe Rogan podcast on Sonos"

TLDR:
Would highly recommend this device to anyone, especially those new to the world of Alexa. Full featured and more versatile than Echo Show, this rounds out Amazons Echo offerings very well. Obviously Amazon is listening to customers and getting some great hardware out the door. I am trying to think of a negative with this device but strangely cannot.

author: sara keenan
title: Omg!  Must have!
content:
I am not easily impressed with electronic goodies. But...OMG this is by far the coolest thing I have ever had.  It does everything short of clean your house... which, when I asked Alexa to clean my house.... was told she didn’t have hands, but instead played a fantastic playlist for cleaning!  From reading books to my five year old, to video chat, to silly selfies, music that automatically goes to my Bose Bluetooth speaker, setting timers, alarms, changing my thermostat on voice command, tells me the weather, sends hubby a grocery pick up list, and I am sure. Million more things!

BUY IT.....you u will not regret it.

author: Charles Couchenour
title: Screen and camera makes a valuable communication device
content: I really like the screen, I use it for my alarm and to control the lights and my airconditioning at night. It also serves as an  intercom to my “show” or my other Alexa devices

author: Lou
title: My second best friend
content:
I can’t live without Alexa /Echo lol
Love this procduct !!!!

author: Smiscedra
title: Love my little Spot
content: Love my little Spot. Good speakers. Fits on my nightstand perfectly. It does everything the big ones do while it takes up less space.

author: cj
title: Love this!
content: My kids love this! Got it as a joint birthday gift from my parents who are moving to Arizona. Now they can "drop in" on them and video chat when ever they like. They also figured out they can get me on my cell phone when I'm not home.

author: ninjini2013
title: Five Stars
content: love this little Echo ,  I was surprised it can even play my video library

author: JephryB
title: display is great, Alexa response as
content: Works as expected, display is great, Alexa response as expected

author: Robert J.
title: Nice
content: Smart looking.  Nice addition to the bedroom.  Voice is clearer and visual display are easy on my tired ears/eyes 😀

author: Mazen Chehab
title: Could be better for the price
content: At its price point I was expecting more from the Echo spot and the fact the you can't watch YouTube videos is a huge let down. Amazon needs to work out their issues

author: Mark
title: Nice little thing to have in the room
content:
Nice little thing to have in the room. We use it mostly as clock, alarms, weather and news. Let me tell you a couple of things that many people ask and nobody gives a straight answer:
* How to setup it: From the device itself, but it's easier from the cellphone Alexa app (you add the "Alexa" devices to your account and can manage them from there).
* Alarm clock: Yes, you can use it as alarm clock. You can setup alarm for the entire week, weekdays, weekend, etc. You can setup multiple alarms with multiple tones (including the classic alarm). To snooze it you touch the screen, to stop it you have to say "Alex stop".
* It has a nice feature where you can setup certain actions at certain time, i.e.: you can tell the device to tell you the temperature and forecast every day at 7am.
Hope it helps

author: MTC
title: Love all my echo devices but this one is great in my den
content: Needed a small clock for my Den desk area and I thought this would be great way to add that while getting the benefits "Alexa". It works perfect for my needs. Speaker is not the best as you would suspect but I already had a nice Bose bluetooth speaker in that room and it connects with it easily and it gives me access to my prime music account so I am all set with music when I need it. But you can also ask Alexa for help on allot of things while you are working, like weather, the date, stock market updates, spelling of a word, and tons of other things. You can also access your audio books or podcast. Its great at placing calls if you enable it to do so. Works really well and looks great. Highly recommend adding this to your home. If you find this review helpful please let me know as I am trying to write the best reviews I can and appreciate the feedback.

author: V. Biggs
title: Easy and useful
content: Easy setup and use. It is great for checking outside cameras when the dogs start barking.

author: Beast_Mode 01
title: Absolutely great
content: I absolutely love my echo. Works perfectly and it is easy to use. If one doesn’t know, then it is easy to get a walk through. I use Alexa all the time and I wouldn’t go back to any type of alarm. It is techy  and I love it

author: NessaSap
title: Works great!
content: It's exactly what we needed for our bedside. The clock dims and Alexa displays helpful info for the day. The camera seems to work well too. It's a bit pricey for what we use it for, but I really like the display.

author: Liz
title: Glad I got it.
content: I love it but it does need some work. It does not always get what I ask. I also wish it would have more clock faces like pictures of the seasons maybe holidays. I think that would be nice. However so far it’s been great. I know it learns more and more so I can’t complain.

author: Chris
title: Love This Little Spot
content: I have an original Echo Alexa, and have found her very helpful. Decided to go further and ordered a JIBO.  And promptly returned him. The Echo devices are far superior, and a fraction of the price. The Echo Spot is the perfect size to set on my desk and it's like having all my lists, apps, and an encyclopedia right at hand (or voice). I hope Amazon and YouTube can make peace at some point because that would make the Echo perfect--but for now I am very happy with this device.

author: Jabon Mojado
title: Best Echo device for the money.  Hear and See.
content:
The Spot is the perfect addition.
We own 1 Echo 1st gen, 3 dots 2nd gen, 1 Show 2nd gen, 1 dash wand, 3 fire tables
4 Fire TV sticks, 1 Fire TV 2nd gen.

The spot is on our bedroom a perlrfect addition. It’s an alarm clock, smart home controller.
I love seeing the weather when I ask what’s the weather

author: AbCritter
title: Five Stars
content: Can't hardly live without it now.

author: Sam Quinones
title: Best echo so far
content: My best investment so far. I use alexa for anything and everything, and the echo spot just adds more convenience to using more features like drop ins, shows song lyrics, movie trailers and much more. I have it on my night stand and kitchen. It’s just perfect

author: Kindle Customer
title: overpriced with a bad camera *excellent customer service*
content:
I bought myself and my honey one for xmas because i wanted a hands free option to hang out without phones/facetime when we are apart. i was really excited about them, had read all the reviews, and when we got them set up I was underwhelmed. we've been using it about a month now, and i'm disappointed in it.
CONS:
The Quality of the camera on the spot is horrible in Low light(lamp on) it is unusable.
it's tiny.
theres a half inch frame around the display that is black so the entire surface is NOT screen.
the display colors of the camera are off badly, very blue tinted, and it's very grainy.
For the price point you can buy a second hand device of another brand that has a 7 inch screen and is crystal clear.
can't turn off the "ask Alexa...." function.
can't turn off the  'news highlights"
you have to repeatedly issue commands because she cant "hear" you
music is kinda muffled. possibly due to the size.

Pros
when you ask for your daily review it is presented well.
videos played are decent resolution
you have the ability to tweak the equalizer for music, that's helpful
The clock is fun, but as a feature it doesn't warrant the price you pay for it

overall i'm glad i got mine at a discounted price, i paid full price for his, but they have both been returned and i'm buying a different device that allows me to actually SEE him...

meh...don't recommend

****UPDATE****
Amazon Consumer Services called me the day after leaving this negative review to discuss my opinions and ask for suggestions on how to improve the product. The conversation was pleasant, and not intrusive. Although it did shock me they called.

It was nice to know they actually monitor these reviews, and want to improve their products. Unlike some other reviewers angry with the calls, I was pleased with the personal service. Knowing we are going to be treated as human consumers, and not just a statistic, is a positive move for a conglomerate of this size and stature.

author: N. R. gallant
