title: I received the Spot for Christmas from my son. ...
content: I received the Spot for Christmas from my son.  I haven’t had a chance to see what all it can do yet.  So far I ask it what the weather for the day will be and have used the sleep sounds for going to sleep.  And of course the time.  Look forward to seeing what Spot can all do.

author: SMcD
title: Good but not like the original
content: I am a sucker for my Amazon echos. So I got the spot to go in my bedroom. With the speakers being on the bottom it could not always tell what I was saying. So I purchased the little magnetic stands to go with it and it understands me better now. However, I've noticed that the Wi-Fi is a little spotty on it. I play Pandora a lot and I have no problems with my other tall echoes. But this one, it almost seems like sometimes it forget that it's supposed to be playing music? And then I'll tell it to play that station again and it'll tell me that it's already playing and will start playing music again. I have not used it for video calling yet

author: Lisa
title: Great but not perfect.
content: I really like it. I like the amount of light as a bedside clock and the ability to play white noise at night.  I love being able to view the security cameras I have. I do think it’s not being adequately utilized. There are no apps to do things I want. Why can’t I see a weather radar? That seems like such a basic thing.

author: Paul  G
title: Very cool! Just a little training on both parts... mine and hers
content: Yes I love this model... just still having issues with Alexa taking orders.... she’s a stubborn techno! But even my wife who refused the dot likes this one.

author: HaoHao
title: Taste good
content: Taste good

author: phazeone
title: Five Stars
content: Top notch job from the guys in the lab ... keep improving and I’ll keep buying

author: Aimee Close
title: Exactly what I needed!
content: Best product ever! It's an alarm clock, a reminder service, a music player, and so much more!

author: Marla Hines
title: I Like Alexa!
content: I never saw myself buying an Echo Spot but I did and I must say I am hooked!  I am still learning all the things "she" can do but this one handy gadget!  I especially love having Alexa turn on my Sonos speakers!

author: Brian Reid
title: Loving ALL Things Alexa
content: This is my third Alexa device including the Dot and Echo. I have them placed throughout my house and enjoy all of the conveniences of automation. This device, the Spot, sits alongside my bed and I use it for an alarm, news of the day, music and of course automation. It's very simple to setup just like the other Echo devices. Aesthetically, it looks great! It's small enough to not take up much room yet big enough for me to see in the middle of the night when I wake up. The touch screen is just right for my big hands and not overly sensitive. The voice command responses and music are loud enough for me to here even without my hearing aids. Overall, I love this device, just like all my other Echo products.

author: Karen Johnson
title: So easy to set up even I could do it!
content: This Echo Spot was a gift from my son and I love it.  Clock is easy to read and Spot is very responsive to voice commands. Best feature is the ability to sinc music with other Echos.  I now have music all through the house with just one command.  Love it!

author: Gordon Ewasiuk
title: A piece of adorable technology that you can put ANYWHERE!  Alexa is amazing!
content:
Amazon hit a home run with the Echo Spot design.  This thing looks great ANYWHERE.  I hate calling a piece of technology "cute" but this one fits the bill.  It's ADORABLE and having Alexa manage my alarms, show me weather reports, and other useful features is AWESOME.

Do note that the Echo Spot has a camera installed so if you're putting on the bedroom, keep that in mind.

author: Thomas Alexander
title: Perfect for bedside.
content: Bought this for my bedroom and the Show for my living room. Love them both. The Spot is perfect for bedside and has an impressive design. Shows lyrics, photos , etc. I paired it with a Smart Plug for the bedroom lamps "Alexa, turn off lights", love it.

author: Lynn B
title: Turns lights on and off
content:
When paired with smart plugs. Used to have outlets controlled by remote but one died and cannot get replacement.
This was a Christmas gift from daughter specifically given so that we can make video calls, our phones are not compatible. She has not set up her Echo Spot yet so cannot comment on the video calls. I get a kick out of having Alexa turn my lights on and off.

author: Elizabeth Z
title: I love being able to play Prime videos and music from ...
content: The Echo Spot is everything I thought it would be, and more. I love being able to play Prime videos and music from what essentially is taking the place of my alarm clock. It’s also great to be able to check in on my various security cameras and control my philips hue lights. The screen is small (as expected) but still has great playback quality. I really like the analog clock faces and it would be great if even more were released for some variety. I can’t think of any drawbacks to this product. It was worth the wait.

author: MacGuyver
title: I found the set up process to be very easy and intuitive
content:
Just unboxed my Echo Spot an hour ago, having asked my Wife for it as an Xmas/Birthday gift. It took less than 20 minutes to set up all my alarms and preferences - and 10 minutes of that was waiting for the firmware update to install!
Since we already own an Echo (1st gen), I found the set up process to be very easy and intuitive, even if It had to be deregistered first (my Wife forgot to ✔ that little box). The sound is quite impressive for its size, as is the screen clarity, even though some reviewers have complained about this; and yes, I took the time to read all the reviews and answered questions before setting it up - the other reviewers tips saved me a lot of angst.
Some complained that the camera couldn't be shut off, but there was a simple button in the Settings Menu to do just that; since this will be on my nightstand, we didn't want to accidentally "flash" the Internet! Additionally,  I had no complaints about the selection of clock faces, and I'm sure more choices will be added in the future- after all, the Spot is only 6 days old... Give it some time, people!
All in all, this is a wonderful, well thought-out product that is excellent as-is, and will only improve with time.

author: Matthew Frost
title: Small screen.
content: It's a good product, but I probably would have preferred the show.  You can't touch the screen (manual scroll to while Alexa is taking,  or she will stop talking immediately.

author: Derek C.
title: and this addition to my nightstand has been great! Perfect side table clock
content: Big fan of the echo line, and this addition to my nightstand has been great!  Perfect side table clock, alarm, planner etc...

author: GWF
title: Perfect for our application
content: Met all expectations. Display is perfect for our specific intention. Simply to interface with our Ring door bell. We can quickly ask Alexa  to show front door or leave it on all the time.

author: nanny
title: Love the Echo Spot!!
content: We love our Echo Spot!! It is fun and easy to use. Love having it in the morning to check the weather.

author: Kindle Customer
title: As advertised - fun & useful!
content:
Lots of fun & good info just for the asking!
Easy to set up!  Would be really good for elderly that might have medical emergency or need help

author: Fran
title: Room for improvement with alarms, otherwise fantastic little device
content:
I gave this to myself as a christmas present and I love my new little Alexa device. It sits on my bedroom nightstand and gets used every day:

- as alarm (can be configured to your favorite music or your radio station via TuneIn)
- listening to my audible book before I fall asleep
- listening to music while taking a bath
- adding things to my shopping list while I am getting ready in the mornings
- taking photos of my kids
- future use: video calls with my mom

I really like the touch screen and also the buttons, so I can easily change the volume without actually having to stop the narrator.

I am giving it 4 out of 5 stars, though, because

- No youtube support (come on, Amazon and Google, get your act together!)
- I find it too easy to cancel/dismiss an alarm. A single tap on the screen is snooze, but multiple times now the device confused snooze with cancel and let me without alarm. So now I am still using my cellphone alarm as backup
- I can't figure out how to link my Alexa alarm to "Routines". I have a good morning routine that switches on my lamp and tells me the weather etc, would be great if that could be triggered by an alarm.

I've now ordered a smart bulb for my nightstand lamp, I wonder if I can link this to my alarm, so the light comes on when the alarm goes off...

author: B. Loomis
title: Really awesome product.  Soooo many applications.
content:
Loving this thing, we are still finding all kinds of ways to use it.  Thinking of buying a couple for the parents.  This is basically the type of video phone you saw in science fiction movies in the 70s and 80s, where you can just say "call grandma" and it works as it should.

We use this to play music, ask weather forecast, tell jokes, and ask Alexa silly questions.  Using the Alexa app on my phone I can "drop in" on my family when im at work and see them, talk to them etc.  Also ordered a couple of wifi plugs so that we can turn lamps on and off with our voice.

author: MTW
title: I was able to connect ALL of my smart home device (unlike google) without any issues
content:
Having received this as a gift, I am writing my initial thoughts: (compared to my google home mini)

PROS:  Way easier to setup than the google home mini.  I was able to connect ALL of my smart home device (unlike google) without any issues.  Making phone calls on this was clearer for the receiver to understand me.

CONS:  Need to enable 'skills' to get more functionality.  Google home has built in functionality to search the web for answer to questions easier than  the amazon echo.  Could not connect this to youtube.

author: natmommy
title: If you want as a clock I suggest you look elsewhere
content:
Pros: it is a fun novelty
Cons: the sound is worse than their other models
You can’t just leave the clock face only up - I bought mainly for an alarm clock but the screen rotates and most the time when I wake up in the middle of the night I can’t see the time - this is awful and why a low star review
Lastly and it is just annoying for me - when I say Alexa snooze she says “ok snoozy” not sure why snoozy bothers me but just an okay would be sufficient

author: Joe Ganem III
title: Great device- look for a sale!
content: This is a nice echo device to own.  Attractive and useful in multiple ways.  I like the video feature and use a clock face on it routinely.  It works with our doorbell camera and shows front door activity.  If they were less expensive, I would have bought more to replace my 7 echo dots.  I paid $80 for this one on sale. That’s much better than $129.

author: D F
title: Perfect for nightstand
content: Great for the nightstand.  I don't like the look of the echo show, and I don't do video calls, so this is great to show me the weather and news.  We have 4 echo dots and an original echo so we can control everything throughout the house, but we have replaced the one in the bedroom with this.

author: J. Card
title: Its small. Hard to see across a room.
content: I like it as an Alexa device but its small.

author: Jason C. Vaughn
title: Great Echo Spot
content: I enjoy using the echo spot as an alarm in my bedroom. It's nice to listen to music, get weather updates, and the news in my room through voice activation as opposed to using my phone.

author: Matt Storms
title: Really enjoy it! Do I need Alexa
content: Really enjoy it! Do I need Alexa? No. Do I like the fact that I can lay in bed and not have to go through the trouble and inconvenience of lifting up my phone to set my alarm, listen to music, or video chat my friend? Yes. Totally worth spending $129 for an alarm clock.

author: Vera
title: Faulty device stuck at Amazon Echo screen!
content:
Started optimizing, back to normal and now stuck at Amazon ...Echo black screen! Useless and total waste of money! Tried plugging off and replug, no-use. Switch off the whole day and when switched on- it’s back to Amazon .. Echo black screen!
Googled and no solutions found. Unfortunately I’m based overseas so can’t even call helpline.

author: Robin Boswell
title: One Star
content:
Froze on me after less than month.  Amazon is replacing, but...hopefully the replacement lasts longer!
Update on second Spot-Replacement kept dropping internet.  Returned as well.

author: Stephen D.
title: Great device for the small things in life
content: It’s useful when you need to know something quick like traffic or the weather. Great for when you want to turn on something music without having to go on your phone a Bluetooth something. My only problem is that it does not hear my voice that well when I say “Alexa.” I have a google home mini and it’s surprisingly more responsive, but I still chose the echo spot because of the clock display and it having better features overall.

author: Teresa J. Vincent
title: Truly feels like a home assistant!!
content: Shopping list the whole family can add to by just asking, music, ambient sounds (babbling brook, thunderstorm are the ones I’ve tried, love it!) drop in on the kids and dogs with my iPhone, so many features I have not even begun to research, the first thing we did was play “Should I Stay or Should I Go” by The Clash and my teenage boys and I just instantly started dancing and singing, I love it!

author: raquel adams
title: Good screen. Sound is good enough to fill a ...
content: Obsessed with my spot. Compact. Good screen. Sound is good enough to fill a small room. I loved it so much that I ordered a second echo device within the first week of purchase. Pretty much every person who has visited since my purchase is considering buying one. One of my friends came over and within minutes had ordered one while still on my couch. Fun for everyone!

author: Scott Foy
title: A++, it's like having a great assistant at home.
content:
This is one of my favorite Amazon products.

I use it to set alarms, hear weather & traffic, get information, play music, watch videos, plus it help me sleep better with the sleep and relaxation sounds.

It's just pretty amazing.

author: Jaye S.
title: Screen is fairly useless.
content: Most text content is hard to read or designed for a larger screen.  You can’t ask Alexa to read the text to you.  My Alexa has said “one message” since I first plugged it in but my Alexa app says I have no message.  I bought two and plan to give the second away.

author: Ironcorazon
title: First Alexa, impressive!
content: I have had this for about three weeks and I am very pleased. I can control the AC and will work on getting compatible lights for Alexa. Next year I will get Alexa Show !

author: BassGuy
title: Best Alarm Clock
content: Love the spot! Makes a great alarm clock! Very responsive! Many features!

author: Rachel W
title: Nice Alarm
content: Love the Spot. I hope they update the program a little. Not enough lyrics for foreign music. Not enough modification options too. Wonderful for the schedules and setting up different wake up times based on my different days.

author: Kelly
title: Fancy alarm clock
content: Not only can you set alarms and listen to music, you can play games with Alexa and ask her random questions too and more. But you must have WiFi or she won’t do anything but be an overpriced clock. Nice design. I find it useful.

author: Pam Cassidy
title: It's worth its money. The only issue, there ...
content: It's worth its money. The only issue, there are times you have to reset it.  When at work, I'm able to check on someone at home thats,sick. I have it facing his chair. I drop in to say hello, and able to see all is,well.

author: TristaW
title: Very useful
content: As expected

author: magnolia127
title: I just wish..
content: I like the echo spot. It's perfect for my office desk. I don't like the scrolling Alexa spam, but fine for the space. I would like one by my bed, but I can't deal me with the spam. Yes, I've done the card rotation thing. They (developers, Bezo, or the man) need to just eliminate the spam. I also have the echo show and same problems with the spam but that's in the kitchen and I don't have to look at it.

author: LizinVegas
title: Oh, What Fun!
content: We like how easy it is for our grandchildren can contact us. It allows them to call when they want to rather than waiting for a parent's help. Our Spot is funny, clever and oh, so, smart! A delightful addition to our home.

author: Martha
title: I love Alexa spot!!
content: I love Alexa spot!!  I can see my shopping list on the Alexa app and make changes. It is great!  The main reason I got this is so I can see who is at my front door. I highly recommend!

author: Dale M Palladino
title: Being a big fan of Echo Alexa products - having ...
content:
Being a big fan of Echo Alexa products - having an Echo two Dots a Tap and Echo Connect which works flawlessly, I was anxious to
receive my Spot.  One important reason for the Spot was her ability to bring video stream from my Nest Outdoor Cam to the screen for
viewing in the bedroom.  Setup of the Spot went well until time for her to capture the image from my Nestcam.  Her continued response
is that "the camera is not responding" and a "Hmmm" .  I know it is not the camera as I can view on my iPod, iPads and iPhone with no
problem.  Have read of several people experiencing this same problem within the last few days.  What gives, Amazon?

author: DN
title: One Star
content: Disconnects often

author: virginia
title: Not worth the money
content: I wasn't aware that this doesn't work unless you have a updated phone, you can't listen to certain music unless you subscribe to Amazon music at 3.99 a month or other and if you already have a amazon account for another echo in house it doesn't work you have to buy 9.99 a month subscription !!! So the bottom line this does nothing more then face time,and turning on your radio on or listening to music on your computer. Oh and looking at the time on another device. It truly is very misleading on amazon part!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

author: Gregg Psky
title: Absolutely Wonderful!
content:
We have been using Echo devices since the very beginning and week by week, month by month new skills and functions are being added.  When configured Alexa turns on and off the TV, lamps and the Christmas tree.  When asked, Alexa sets timers and alarms, reports the weather, adds items to a shopping list, answers trivial and important questions, streams internet stations and plays music. The Amazon Echo really is voice activating the home.

So why do I especially like the Echo Spot?  I think the clock face is awesome and it now has a place next to the bed replacing the clock radio alarm which has a world of information including weather and streaming internet and 11 minutes more of snooze time, just for the asking.  The Echo Spot also sits next to the living room sofa for the same reasons while looking like a clock.

author: Courtney T.
title: Great
content: Great alarm clock, very useful for morning motivation. Only problem is the screen doesn't have many background options

author: PJB
title: It's ok but not really that useful
content: If you don't have smart lights,  plug etc it basically doesn't do much of anything really useful. The random display of things it can do doesn't bother me.  I actually think it's helpful to know things it can do if your home isn't a smart home to utilize features.  It's not a big deal and I don't get why that bothers so many people. I bought it so that I could visit with my kids and grandkids face to face.

author: A1r6lan3
title: Loses connections, heavily dependent on internet
content: I really like Amazon Echo devices, I own 2. However they have some major limitations that caused me to give the Spot 3 stars. For starters the routines don’t work when you lose internet. Logic would dictate you would at least get a warning that the routine can’t run at that time. I use routines as an alarm and I learned about this limitation the hard way. I also have an amazon basics Bluetooth speaker and the echo devices randomly stop being able to connect to it. At first I thought I did something wrong with my other Echo device so I paired it to the Spot and the same thing happened, it just stopped pairing and keeps telling me the speaker is not in pair mode. But I will still pair to my phone. I also have trouble controlling my fire tv sometimes. I don’t see why there is any reason the Echos have issues with connecting to Amazon brand items.

author: AC
title: Good but needs some improvements,
content:
Does not hear as well as Echo and Dots.
Reminders are also a bit broken - a reminder gets shown on the screen for about 30 minutes (can be dismissed with a swipe) - during that time no other reminder will be triggered.

Good for the kitchen since you can view recipes and shopping lists.

author: ITechNate
title: Great little assistant
content: It’s a great alarm clock, sits on my night stand and I use it for playing soundscapes for bed and love seeing my calendar and weather by glancing over at my echo spot! I want to get more for drop in calls with video

author: Carlton
title: Thank-you Amazon
content: I have only but Two Word's for Alexa Spot, "Most Beautiful"

author: Liz j
title: Favorite gadget
content: I already have an amazon echo, and love the show. I use it for my alarm clock, and powering my amazon fire and Phillips hue.

author: Neville
title: Echo Spot
content:
Pros: Like the new look and display.
Cons:  Volume not loud enough.

author: gernonoe
title: Great features, meh sound quality.
content:
I purchased this when it came with the free echo dot 3rd gen promotion.  While all of the features and functionality are fantastic, I was disappointed the the dot had better sound quality.

My only other thought is that I put this on in my bedroom and use it as an alarm clock. It’s an expensive alarm clock and might be better used in a more high traffic room.

author: Dennis L. Kitch
title: Echo Spot
content: Echo Spot not able to set up with scimpy instructions provided.  Hope Amazon provides better instructions for installation and set up for usage.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Learning to use,  but nice so far
content:
I didn't even know there was a model with a screen.  That was my biggest surprise.  My kids probably use it more than I do honestly. They think it's great. I usually use it to play music (which was my entire reason for wanting it in the first place) and I use the alarm clock feature.

I don't like that the screen is lit at night. I have to put it face down because the light bugs me.  I wish it could be turned off.

author: MELISSA SPLAWNIK
title: Love it!
content: My 5th one.  Works for so many things.

author: BEN
title: I like it very much and hope more features will be ...
content: Got it during the promo ($40 off for 2) and was a breeze to set up in addition to my existing Echo Dots. Everything works as it should and I noticed there's a firmware update so I've updated it. My only gripe is the screen is always active which is quite distracting at night. I've discovered you can change the settings to let the cards scroll only once instead of continuously and you can also set the do not disturb timings to customise to your individual needs. Overall, I like it very much and hope more features will be available in future to make it even more useful.

author: Gary
title: Love it
content: Enjoy the many features clock, alarm, seeing what I have requested etc

author: Joshua C. Scott
title: Great alarm clock, not so good speaker
content:
I love my Echo Spot. I used it to replace a sound machine and add an alarm clock back to my nightstand. I will admit the screen quality. It’s sharp but to be honest it’s not entirely user friendly figuring out how to use it. There are not enough clock faces either. I’d also prefer the speaker be louder than it is. Most of these are minor issues that can be addressed with a software update. The speaker maybe not so much. I’d also love it if I didn’t have to see the “Alexa suggestions”
Screen but there’s no way to turn that off. Overall, for $130 it’s a solid product.

author: Margaret B
title: Great Device
content: I love it!  I especially love that it is so small and does so much.  Got rid of my old CD/Alarm clock radio.  Much more room on nightstand.

author: BlackLotus
title: Great as other Echos, didn't sign onto my main account though.
content:
I like the Echo devices - I want to start this positive and I love most of the Echo Spot.  I'm going to address the huge glaring issue I had though first.

I set my Echo Spot up and it was ready to go like past Amazon devices.  Great!  Wifi set up without issue, I saw it in the Alexa app and it even had the ability to set up the multi room uses/music listening.  All things were great!  I then asked it to turn off a group of my Hue lights.  Alexa said she didn't see them.  I thought maybe because I'd recently updated my Hue lights software, that was an issue.  Hue was finicky in the past, but not anymore so I was curious.  I asked Alexa about news, she got that.  Showed me a CNN video brief too, that was great.  I then wanted to test the music sound as it's supposed to be better than my Echo Dot - Alexa couldn't find the artist I asked.  Hmmm, ok let's just do a genre.  Alexa couldn't find any Pop music.  She didn't find any jazz or any classical.

At this point it couldn't do much of anything but time, weather, and news.  Which is most of what Alexa could do on day one, but it's grown since then and I expect the best from it.  I let it sit a couple days thinking all the updates had to happen.  I even reset it after trying to get it to play music or see lights in the home or the thermostat.  Since this had a screen, I asked it to play one of the shows my son watches KNOWING it's a Prime Exclusive show made by Amazon.  This is when Alexa finally told me I had to switch to the primary user to do that.  I asked it to switch to my name and BOOM, Alexa was happy.

I have no earthly idea if it was set up without the account or I was a 'guest'.  I bought this on my account which pays for Prime and is the main account.  I manually logged into my account after the reset which again is the account Prime is tied to.  It works great now.

I love how it sounds better - huge improvement over the Dot.  I know the Dot isn't big and physics limits the speaker, but come on.  Put a decent one in to power Alexa's voice if anything.  The Spot has a passable speaker.  Sounds very nice and fills my office - granted it's the smallest room in the home but eh.  Voices, as I mentioned a second ago, also sound way better.  Alexa's voice, the CNN lady on the news brief, etc.

The screen is great too.  I didn't buy this as an alarm clock replacement, I wanted the camera (I'll address soon) and other video/display options this enables.  I like seeing a quick picture to go with the news.  It's much better to chat with my son when he's home and I'm at work - plus it bugs my wife when I do it.  Recipes have pictures too.  Lastly, seeing the item I'm ordering is good - sometimes the deals through Alexa aren't clear and I don't want to buy the 50 razor pack because of poor labeling by a seller.

Alexa and her skills are great.  Now that I'm on my actual account, Hue lights come on and off.  The Nest Thermostat works flawlessly.  I look forward to the new skills coming with Echos that have screens now.

I'll end with the camera.  It works fine, like most front facing cameras on cell phones these days.  The test calls so far haven't had issue.  I don't get or like the incredibly long 'soft fade' in type thing on the calls.  My connections were strong, so video should have been clear.  My other thing about the camera - obviously it has one.  Why are there reviews going on about it?  Simply don't purchase an always connected camera if you are worried - end of story.

author: Pen Name
title: I wish I could return this as I was too dumb to realize how much of my info is stored/shared ...
content: It's really creepy when she starts talking randomly on her own. I wish I could return this as I was too dumb to realize how much of my info is stored/shared through it.

author: RBJ
title: Great gadget
content: Compact and does everything that the echo show can do. We are certainly an Alexa household.

author: Mimi Pierre Johnson
title: My favorite part about the Echo Spot is the music feature
content: My favorite part about the Echo Spot is the music feature, it searches, pause resumes and I ask it to play the last song. Just the fact I can be lazy and not have to search for something is so cool.

author: Charles O Lanham
title: Fantastic Amazon AlexaEcho Spit Device
content: Fantastic Product...already transforming auto functioning within our home.....

author: william work
title: Great bedside Alexa equipment
content: I have several dots and taps. My security camera and doorbell work with this. I’m able to check all my video feeds. Still functions like all the other Alexa items.

author: Michael G. Shuchter
title: Product died. Customer service awful.
content:
After less than 60-days the Spot stopped working. Would cycle between logos in startup mode, but wouldn't boot-up.

Called customer service. Spent 46 minutes on the phone, while the first two people I spoke to had me on hold most of the time, while they were "waiting to talk to a supervisor." Third person, "an Echo specialist," quickly came to the inevitable conclusion that there was nothing that can be done with device that can't be rebooted. Frickin' obvious!!
Such a colossal waste of time.

The Indian call center experience took a minor frustration, and turned it into a 1-star product review.  Well done!!

author: Grace Pierce
title: So very useful!
content: This is everything you love about echo and more.  It's a clock, it's a radio, it's a weather station, etc.  Simple to set up and a joy to have around.

author: Melanie H
title: Love it
content: Love it

author: Jack R. Rivers
title: Almost great product with big dealbreakers
content: I like a lot of things about the spot. Two big problems though. As previously mentioned by other reviewers you can not get rid of the screen that says “Say Alexa try...” Also, you might think oh I can customize my clock, well I want to customize it so I will have my chosen background picture up. Sure you can! But it will only stay up for a minute and then you get a blank black background. You have to say “Alexa home” in order to have your personalized picture come up. Luckily these should be easy fixes with a software update so I hope Amazon does fix.

author: MaggieMay
title: Love Mine. Glad I Upgraded!
content: I have the Echo Dot and decided to upgrade to the Echo Spot. I love it! The screen is nice, I can watch videos and I enjoy seeing the lyrics for my songs. It was worth the money to upgrade.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Easy set up.
content: Got a great deal when we purchased 2.  We kept one and gave one to our son and daughter-in-law so our granddaughter could call us.  We are having so much fun.  The Echo does so much more.  Everyday we are learning something new with the Echo.

author: Matt F.
title: Amazing device!
content: I have an echo dot in my office and love it. I picked up one of these on sale to add in my living room. It's slightly bigger than I thought it was going to be. Very high quality, responsive and quick.  The speaker is great and provides great quality sound. The level of customization is amazing. Excellent addition to the echo family.

author: D. Vasquez
title: I just don’t know about techie things
content: Eh, I’m not really sure how to feel about these things. For one, I can’t connect to my internet since changing modems. It says to do through app, but I can’t find it.

author: Rod
title: Great upgrade from the Echo dot but still some issues overall
content: This is a great upgrade from the Echo Dot but still is very hard of hearing. Sometimes I feel like I have to raise my voice to it which is stressful for no reason with an inanimate object. It also fails to connect to my 5g network, when my router is literally 10 feet from it. No idea what that's about. Next time I think I'd just go all out and get the Echo Show which was the same price.

author: Emoroian
title: 100% recomendable
content: 4/5 stars because it does not have a battery backup in case the power goes off, so your alarm will not sound and you will stay sleeping. Even though its an awesome product ! Really surprises you.

author: ZiadTurk
title: cute shaped Alexa
content: I like the design so much, the audio quality is also amazing although the small size, I ended up placing one of those in both our cars, they work perfectly (with in car hot spot), excellent to video call home while driving (using one eye), play quizzes with the kids and Alexa, or having her open the garage door...….

author: G. Roddick
title: Great device.
content: Love this echo spot.  We are very happy with the purchase and plan on getting more in the house.  She is bright and cheery in the morning, answers most of our questions accurately.  We love the shopping list and the question of the day.

author: Joe
title: Buy one!!!!
content: Got rid of my alarm clock. This is way better. Does everything. This is my second Alexa.

author: Bill D
title: Mom is just a tap of the alexa app away
content: Great phone apps.echo spot at moms house.apps on our phones so we can drop in to check on her.all she has to do is tell alexa to call us..its great

author: Michael G
title: Four Stars
content: Its pretty nice, you can add a custom image to the screen. Wish the speakers were a little better.

author: charles
title: This makes a great bedroom alarm clock
content: This makes a great bedroom alarm clock. Wakes you with any song you want to hear, and you can just ask Alexa what time it is instead of raising your head to look. I highly recommend this Echo spot!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: This is the best! I got it for my birthday to replace ...
content: This is the best! I got it for my birthday to replace my old alarm clock. It's the most fun and I love the announcement feature to merge our other Echos. Waking up the boys is fun (thanks Missy Elliot). We plan on getting them for our parents so we can video call.

author: Ericologist
title: Exceeds expectations
content: Great addition to the echo environment. Surprisingly, the sound quality exceeds the echo plus. Did NOT expect that. One thing I was wary of, was using the spot as a nightstand clock. I really didn't expect the brightness to go low enough for my personal taste. I prefer a blacked out sleeping environment, and the echo spot met my needs better than imagined. Definitely recommend.

author: Colin Stark
title: A great product!
content: Really enjoying this product. It’s a lot of fun just finding out all the things it can do. So many skills can be added it is mind boggling!! It pretty much runs my smart home!

author: Dan B
title: The size and functions are great
content: Great size for my nightstand. Like the Amazon Music compatibility. Still learning all that Alexa can do. Use the alarm every day.

author: Nannette
title: Love my Echo...
content: I absolutely love my Echo...she’s only gotten mad at me once and gave me the silent treatment because I called her Siri. I wish it were wireless to take her into my sewing room. I love listening to music in there while quilting. The speaker on that thing is surprisingly very good. Don’t listen to the reviews that say you can’t turn off the things to try...you certainly can. Play with it you will find all kinds of thing you can turn on or off depending on your needs!!! I now have two!!

author: chap
title: Five Stars
content: Great, my wife and daughter enjoy this very much.

author: Amazon Customer
title: GREAT DEVICE
content: I love this little guy!! It has been a great addition to our home. I use it for recipes, music, Messages and as a home intercom with our other two Dots. I really have enjoyed all that it can do and I know I am just scratching the surface, thanks Amazon! Its awesome!

author: Don C.
title: Awful Ring Doorbell integration, otherwise a decent gadget.
content:
i bought this primarily to be able to interact with my new Ring Pro doorbell in my bedroom.  I normally don't keep my cell phone in the bedroom at night, but if I don't I won't hear any alerts if someone is lurking around my front yard.  The Echo Spot seemed like a great solution to this, and it could replace my alarm clock.

The actual hardware is better than I expected.  I expected some lightweight plastic device with a screen and speaker, but it's fairly heavy and seems like a well built device.  The screen is very nice and crisp and the audio is much better than I expected for a device this size.  It supports Bluetooth but inexplicably, it can't connect to my phone to answer calls, only as a speaker.  I don't really care much about that, but it's a strange limitation nonetheless.

It does a pretty good job as an alarm clock replacement, and it's convenient to ask questions about the weather, traffic or whatnot while I'm getting dressed. However, it is a near total FAIL when it comes to the reason I purchased it, which is for it's integration with my Ring doorbell.  All it can do is view the doorbell camera.  It does NOT notify me when the motion detection goes off, or if someone pushes the doorbell.  How stupid is that?  So I still have to keep my cell phone in the bedroom at night to receive any notifications from Ring.

I don't know if this is Amazon's fault or Ring's fault, but since Ring is now owned by Amazon it doesn't matter.  Ring is part of the Amazon family and the Alexa Ring "skill" should be a shining example of what you can do with the Echo devices.  Instead, it's an example of a nearly useless skill, and should be an embarrassment to everyone involved with Ring/Alexa development.  Something is very wrong when a skill for an Amazon-owned product gets almost 1-star reviews from everyone.

I'll probably keep the Spot as it makes for a cool alarm clock, although I no longer actually need to get out of bed to hit the snooze button, which could be a problem.  Hopefully the brain-dead Ring integration will be fixed sooner or later.

author: J. Giles
title: Love it
content: Love it!  Great as a clock and playing music.

author: Virgilio J.
title: Good device, still prefer echo dot
content: I use my echo spot mainly as a clock on my night stand, the night mode on the spot is pretty responsive, it has a better speaker than the echo dot and being able to watch the screen while buying something on Amazon is quite cool. What I don’t like is that you can only set the screen to either be on or off all the time, there is no smart sleep mode on the screen or something like that. Also the screen is too little for media consumption other than vimeo so if you need a screen better buy the echo show or if you don’t need a screen, just get the dot.

author: courtney Hoek
title: Like
content: Love the look. Doesn’t get as loud and my other Alexa

author: Chris Carde
title: Not a "must have".
content: Too small and the sound quality is very poor. I stay with my Echo first gen. Amazon should make the screen more manageable.

author: estelle macon
title: Great device
content: It’s amazing! No phone required to face time!

author: Raj
title: Awesome Device
content: A great upgrade to Echo Dot!!!

author: DaddyBear
title: Great echo. Perfect for a bedside clock and sounds ...
content: Great echo.  Perfect for a bedside clock and sounds much better than the echo dot.  Good enough sound to be a standalone radio clock replacement.  I have all of the devices besides the tap and this is almost my favorite one.

author: Alex Nery
title: Alarm clock on steroids!
content:
Exceeded all expectations so far.  No more static radio in the AM.  It'll find almost any radio station on either TuneIn or iHeart, so it won't skip a beat.  You can obviously also use Spotify or any other music streaming too, but if you're setting the bar low, as I am, it overachieves.  It's also nice to be able to ask it for time and weather, without opening your eyes. You need to use the slow Alexa app to set things like graduated alarm, so it doesn't come on blaring, but as soon you figure that out, you're good.  I guess you could do all these things, with any of the other Alexa devices, but if you're like me, and still like the concept of an alarm clock on the night stand you can look at.  In that case, this is a major upgrade!

Taking a star off for design shortcoming.  They could have put a small battery in the thing, in case you use power.  I'm also reading that, without internet, it's basically a paperweight, so not sure it'll wake you up if that happens either.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great if you need quick access to news, commute time and reminders
content:
Love that I have command access to news such as Bloomberg TV, NPR, etc.
Highly recommend that you gain access to Alexa app before setting up Device and get familiar with key features/services...such as setting up your daily commute.
If family and friends have Spot...then it’s a great substitute for Skype and Face Time...you can always “drop in” when missing loved ones or just to catch up.

author: Amazon Customer
title: My husband and I are in love with Alexa
content:
My husband and I are in love with Alexa! Love Alexa's home; "Echo Spot"!

I bought two at the time, one for us and one as a gift to my nephew... He started to use the Echo Spot before we did and told me how his family especially his four year old girl enjoy and love it and learn from Alexa!
When we set it up for our home I experienced all good things my nephew and others said about the Echo Spot and....fell in love with Alexa!

author: SKalata
title: Not stable or reliable
content: Once the novelty of this device wears off, it's kind of annoying. I use it for waking up to news radio here in NY for traffic and weather reports, but it's not reliable or dependable. The constant software updates are always changing what "skills" will work. For example, recently Tunein was dumped and replaced with Radio.com - which DOES NOT WORK, at least for me This was a huge annoyance and there's no one to complain to. I am going back to my Bose Wave radio as soon as I get home tonight...

author: David Wallas
title: Works great and nice to get info
content: Didn’t think we needed another Alexa device but wanted something for my nightstand. Works great and nice to get info, play music and great alarm clock in the morning.

author: JR
title: Must have technology for the price of a clock
content: Love it. I only needed a clock. Got a lot more. So cool. Love the screen. Got two more DOTS for other rooms of the house.

author: Kindle Customer
title: LOVE this more than the echo dot
content: LOVE love love this!  I have an echo, and several echo dots, but love the video with this and the clock.  I no longer have to wake up and say "Alexa, what time is it?" or "Alexa, weather"  I can even watch videos on it if i forget my kindle before bed.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Frustrated and Disappointed
content:
I bought an Echo Spot for my older granddaughter as a Christmas present. I had already, earlier in the year, gifted one to her younger sister, who does not have a phone (smart parents!) so we can drop in her, let her listen to her music, etc. I too have an Echo Spot also so adding another device sounded like a nice idea.

Well, it was not:
To begin with it activated itself in the middle of the night asking to be "set up". Talk about a spooky experience for a 12 year old.
I have connected my calendar for reminders and both granddaughters are being alerted to my next dentist appointment on Wed at 11am.
I could not drop in on her as Alexa insisted her device was not allowing that, even though it knew about her echo spot and was set up for drop ins.
When she said "call mom" (phone connection) her sister's and my echo spots both rang. Whoever answered first was connected.

And the list goes on and on and on.

My son spent 3 hrs with various technical customer support personnel to no avail. We are all very frustrated by the experience, including my disappointed granddaughter, whose Christmas present is being returned.

Amazon needs to work on the set up program specifically in a family account environment.

author: Beverly Yuruki
title: Very helpful device!!
content: I love the display on this echo spot. I hooked up my living room lamp and dining room lamp with the smart plugs so I just need to Tell Alexa to turn it off and on. So convenient!

author: Peggy Snyder
title: Spot is worth buying
content: I got the Spot and set it up but did not use for a week except for some music.  I have been using it lately and really like the calling and video on it.  Only issue seems to be doing so am trying different options to fix. As always love the music and use lists a lot. Am looking forward to learning more things to do with the Spot.

author: PLW
title: LOVE IT! LEARN SOMETHING COOl & NEW EVERYDAY!!!
content: still learning how to ise it but is DOES NOT disappoint. I’m giving to everyone for Christmas so I can “check in” on them unnannounced like they do me...just show up with no advanced warning!!!

author: Jim Hoy
title: Cool product.
content: Cool product using in bedroom for alarm clock. And having an Alexa speaker in the bedroom is a plus so far no issues with it.

author: Christopher M.
title: good product idea
content: good product idea. Wish the screen was dimmer in night mode. even in night mode. it is very bright for a alarm clock. if you have it paired with a fire ty, it will play videos on the little provided screen before your fire tv. you specficially have to say...play on my fire ty.

author: C. L. Kehoe
title: Looks nice and easy to use.
content: Love my echo spot.  I have two dots but this is really a nice addition.  It’s in my living room so shows the temperature and time plus some things you can ask Alexa.  You can set it to use a personal photo for the face if you want.

author: La Gee
title: Great for my nightstand
content: I love this little thing!  It is perfect for seeing the weather without asking Alexa first and the screen adjusts it's lighting based on the lighting surrounding it.  Easy to hook up and sync with the other Echos around the house for a surround sound musical experience.  Sometimes the screen picture gets cut off with the app isn't 100% made for the Echo Spot simply because the screen is round but it's such a miniscule downside.  Volume buttons on the top make it easy to turn down your alarm too.

author: Michael J. Dauria
title: Hard to use in the morning when your groggy
content: I like echo spot. I bought it to use as an alarm clock. One negative that i didnt really think about, when you wake up in the morning and are somewhat groggy, its hard to tell alexa to turn off the alarm, or hard to remember commands to snooze for a few minutes. In this case a clock with buttons seems to work better

author: James E. Mcmillan
title: Echo Spot - Love it!
content: Love the Echo Spot. Have it controlling various lamps through-out my house. It also used to keep tabs on my appointments, to do list,,ect. It great!

author: Thoughtful Customer
title: So, You Get a Clock Face on an Echo Dot.  Big Deal.
content: I was hoping the video screen would offer a little more than you get with the Spot.  I'm not interested in movie trailers or other advertising on the mini screen.  I had the impression it could stream CNN or news headlines or anything else I wouldn't mind running in the background.  After all, the ads for this have a picture of Anderson Cooper...so how could I get that impression, right.  Instead, you can only hear the news with a clock face on the screen.  So what.  Not an improvement over the Echo Dot, which is what I had before.  Until I see any better applications for the Spot, I would say Buyer Beware!

author: Steffyn R.
title: It’s small, but it works well for most things you’d need it for!
content:
I received an Echo Spot as a Christmas gift (along with some mocking) but so far, I love it. The form factor is perfect for what I use it for. Alarm clock, date planer, weather, falling asleep to music...

Yes, all things my phone can do. But with my phone I find myself getting distracted and with the Spot, not so much. Eager to start adding in more smarthome additions like security cameras, locks, and thermostat.

author: nanclus
title: Too easy to turn off alarm when you mean to snooze!
content:
Please help us Amazon! Update the software to make turning off alarms “harder”. In the half woken up dizzy of an alarm going off, it’s too easy to turn off an alarm vs just snooze. Can you please update the firmware so you have to push a button on the top to snooze like most alarm clocks? Both snooze and disable should both not be a swipe  Too often we turn off our alarms and we meant to snooze.

UPDATE: I got a call from Amazon asking to tell me more about the feedback above. They typed everything out and said they would pass it along to the team. Upgrading from 2 stars to 3 stars because I really felt like they cared enough to know more. Thanks so much! I would still be careful using it as an alarm clock with the snooze and dismiss gester the way it is but it means a lot to be heard!

author: Bobatthebeach
title: Go to settings and set it your way.
content: Perfect for a bedside alarm clock plus more. I had read complaints about the scrolling screens, either unfounded or an update fixed the issue. The feature to adjust the lighted screen gets a 👍, adjusts to any intensity you desire.  Ask Alexa to go to settings, from there set it your way.

author: Edward
title: It's a neat idea.
content: Pretty cool when it works properly. If my wifi gets reset it takes about an hour for it to work again. While the echo dots take about 10 minutes tops. Kind of disappointing since once is so much cheaper. It also likes to disconnect from a Bluetooth device and never reconnect to it.

author: Jim B
title: Perfect for bedside table
content: Love, love, love this.  Had a 1st Gen Dot in the bedroom but replaced with this for clock / alarm.  Works great! So many neat features.

author: Kevin Tong
title: Love it, but there is one issue!
content: I love my new echo spot as my alarm clock.  It is pleasant to look at and setting an alarm is REALLY easy!  Here is the problem(s) I have.  1)  My wifi is spotty as my router is at the other side of the house from my echo spot.  There are mornings where my alarm goes off, and while I can usually just say..."Alexa, stop" or "Alexa, off", I will get a response that she "isn't connected to the internet" and the alarm keeps going.  There isn't, that I have found, a button that will stop her from chiming.  2)  I finally figured out how to modify or change the settings on the thing.  No instructions that I could find on how to customize my spot's look and sound.

author: w. tyler sall
title: Useful purchase
content: Bought this for my parents, kinda nice to be able to video call them. It's also great for checking in on your dog or cat or if you think someone might be in your home. It's great for music too, pretty good speakers. Also useful for setting alarms and reminders for yourself.

author: Debo
title: Amazon has a winner here
content: My new favorite device. Device does everything from reading to playing music weather forecast to traffic updates. So much you can do with this Spot. I’m ordering one for every room.

author: Chloe Dougherty
title: This is PERFECT
content: We use this for everything in our family room- music, news, and it can even take pictures! I also love that you can video call each of them. We also have one in the bedroom- I would honestly say they are necessary for each room you spend a lot of time in.

author: S.Cutter
title: Good but unless you want video phone, Dot is a better deal.
content:
Overall i'm quite pleased with the unit but its not perfect.

Display is ok for a bed side clock, but don't expect to use this to watch Prime movies - Its just too small and dull to use as for video.

Volume control is quirky... At volume level 1 there is absolutely no audio produced by the unit (same as mute), at volume level 2 the noise is hardly perceivable.  Volume level 3 is quite a jump up and is a bit too loud for bed side use. Volume 4 and up then step up in an expected linear fashion.

Alexa tech still has a long way to go to properly deal with human instructions.  If you tell the unit what to do precisely following the commands in the examples provided, it works like a charm.  However, remembering the proper construct of commands is a pain in the ... especially for 'learn' technologies.
EG:  "Alexa, tell ASUS to turn on the guest wifi for 30 minutes" works, but "Alexa, turn on the guest internet for 30 minutes" does not.

author: Melinda6701
title: LOVE my Echo Dot
content: I can set any picture I want to be the clock background and play music all night long.

author: Shane37
title: Spot
content: Love my echo spot. It's a great Alexa device.

author: Jean
title: Excellent Alexa Product!!!
content: Excellent!!! I use it in the bathroom as a clock radio. Nice to check the weather, listen to the news or set a timer while getting dressed in the morning. I like the automated dim setting.

author: Marla R.
title: This is so cool, i find more ways to utilize it everyday
content: This is so cool, i find more ways to utilize it everyday.  Very easy to set up, waiting for smart plugs and receptacles to arrive today!!

author: Yehudah Y Kenon
title: Too many subscriptions needed for this device
content: This device worked fine. It just wasn't a device that works for me. I have Amazon prime and thought I would have access to all features this device has to offer but that was incorrect. You have to have 10 subscriptions to unlock this devices potential. It really seemed to be a cool device. I had the echo show as well but returned it along with this one. I'll stick to Google home.

author: Robert Dolan
title: Versitile Uses
content: I really love this item. I use it for appointments, alarm clock, meditation guides and music, ambient sounds and sleep timer for a great sleep.

author: ROBIN DIETRICH
title: We love it it’s greatThere’s so much you can do it on the echo spot
content: We love it it’s great

author: Thehutt
title: Great super dim clock on my nightstand.
content: Thank God, and alarm clock with an lcd that gets dim enough for me to sleep. I'm a very light sensitive sleeper and wind up taping black tape over all my other stuff in my bed room. Not this guy. The Alexa features are nice and listening to music at night is great. We enjoy falling asleep to meditation podcasts though we have to use the skill anypod to get the podcasts we like. Video is kinda tiny and useless at this size but that's to be expected. Audio quality is much better than echo dot.

author: Tom
title: My wonderful Echo Spot
content:
This is the best yet. It is like owning a crystal ball except you really can see the answer in it. I love the Echo Spot. I own several Echo's and Echo Dots. I am 75 years old and they are very handy and entertaining. This one tops them all. With this and the new Echo Connect they can also be a life saver if I need help. The sounds is wonderful and the picture though small is very sharp and clear. I recommend it to everyone!

Echo Spot will tell you and show you 24 hour military time if you ask her, " What time is it in Military time? "

author: SarahCat
title: A nice addition to the Echo family, but could use a pop up keypad for incall responses
content: I’ve been using the Spot for about 10 days, now. It’s a very nice device, but since I also just installed my Echo Connect to my home VOIP phone system, I’ve found a shortcoming that should be able to be remedied by a software update: Making phone calls is very simple, however, many calls to businesses require a key entry (e.g., “Press 2 to connect to a technician.”) and that would be simple if the Echo Spot had the ability to display a phone keypad during a call. That feature is very similar to how the in-call screen works on an iPhone. The Echo Spot would find even more applications in my home, if I could use it in lieu of most of my cordless phone VOIP handsets. When I’m at home, even though I can place a call on any of my iOS devices, they still aren’t necessarily convenient and I like having voice capable fixed-location devices. With the number of Echo devices I have deployed, I can make typical calls from anywhere in the house, without having a device in hand. The Echo Spot is the only one (other than the Show, which is too bulky to be as many locations) that has the potential for ‘button presses’, unless there is an Alexa skill for inputting touch tones during a call.

author: Jo Beth Lewis
title: Five Stars
content: Love it, still learning all it can do!

author: Audriana
title: My new morning routine
content: I really like it! Got one as an alarm clock because I liked to dot but don't have it anymore. In the morning I can get the weather, traffic to work, and even can play either my Spotify or the radio station I like!

author: Ricardo r.
title: I love the clock function and the fact I can drop ...
content: I added this as second unit for the bedroom. I love the clock function and the fact I can drop in to the downstairs unit and communicate with who ever

author: ScottD
title: So much smarter than my old alarm clock
content: The list is long. I love this thing.

author: Carol Justice
title: Older Non tech person happy as could be
content:
I loved this Echo Spot so much I purchased  2 Dots to go into the other rooms.
Much easier to talk things on than physically walking and gettin gup etc.

author: Trina McKim
title: Fun and useful
content: Love it, so do the grandkids. Easy to set up, love the app and we like checking on the dog and cat while we are a work wth the “drop in” feature from our phones.

author: sweet virgo
title: works great
content: just have to work slowly on buying devise to work with it

author: Craig Smith
title: A feature packed update to an old school solution
content: I got the Spot to mainly replace my old alarm clock so turning off the drop-in feature was a simple settings adjustment. It’s got a modern style and the additional home automation functionality is s bonus. The sound quality is better than the Dot so that too is a plus. I like being able to choose from different clock faces (but a few more created by Amazon would be appreciated).

author: Boomin
title: Almost better than the Echo Show
content: I bought this before my echo show. Responds better to voice commands than the echo show. Love it..!!!

author: Itz TK
title: Works pretty nice for me as long as they keep improving there software
content: As advertised but wish there was more intuitiveness

author: Kelly  Peterson
title: Not bad
content: I’m using this as my alarm clock.  Have 2 other type echos in the house.  We like them and find them convenient.  Has a few small bugs to work out, but I’m sure they’ll fix those in time.  Very small screen size.

author: Pradeep
title: very portable
content: very good item for daily use

author: Steve Giblin
title: Perfect alarm clock replacement!
content: Well made and a really nice design. Perfect replacement for an alarm clock and it doesn’t light up the room at night!

author: richela
title: Can't discover Smart Socket
content: I recently acquired and set up the Echo Spot.  I'm just getting up to speed as to what it can do.  However, at this point I have found out that the Echo Spot cannot discover my Tuya Smart sockets.  Tried numerous times to sync them with the Echo Spot with no success.  The Tuya app works with my Iphone but I have no voice control using the Echo Spot.  This was a big reason why I wanted the Echo device.  Will try with other smart sockets.  If the don't sync as well, may have to give the Echo a 3 rating.

author: Phillip Mailloux
title: Good product
content: Works very good thanks

author: Kindle Customer
title: Echo Spot
content: I like the Spot for playing music, getting information and the weather.  It is easy to use and set up. The display is not as good as I expected or as shown on the ads.  Overall I do enjoy it.

author: Allison Helm
title: Mehhhhhh!
content: It's not as good as Siri, BUT it still has some positives, it's great at playing music, and setting alarms. I personally felt that I paid too much for this product, as it was nearly half off on prime day (literally the day after I purchased it). So I'm pretty disappointed. I might still return it and get my money back. .

author: Byron Valentine
title: Replaced an old alarm clock and looks/functions great. I just wish Alexa would learn to say ...
content: It's a charming nightstand accessory. Replaced an old alarm clock and looks/functions great. I just wish Alexa would learn to say "I love you too" back to me. Sad face.

author: Jatz1
title: Great, even though Alexa will never stop suggesting "Things to try"
content: I almost didn't buy this spot because of all the bad reviews that talked about how terrible the "Things To Try"  feature was. After considering, I decided to get one anyway and really that feature was not as bad as it was  made out to be.  Anyway, the good things far outweigh  the bad......you can get the weather,news, make calls, recieve calls, send texts, order food, get updates on  packages you are expecting, set timers, play music, play jeopardy, turn off your bedroom lights, turn your heat up, call other alexa devices, and thats just scratching the surface. Dont get this one, however, if video is high on your list of important features because as of now youtube is not an option. You can watch videos on Amazon.

author: Hennared
title: Awesome purchase!
content: I love this thing, and I also have the Show.  But I do not think the speakers are of the same quality as The Show.  It is on my nightstand, and for my purposes on my nightstand it is fabulous.  Speakers are good enough to listen to music while I get ready for work.  I love the clock face and the fact if I have insomnia I can play games or listen to whatever I want.  The alarm is great too because it will wake you up, but not give you a heart attack.  I also got the stand...it makes the Spot so cute, but I really do not think you need it.

author: Nash Crawford
title: Worth every penny!
content: I wanted to see my security video cameras without having to use my phone. Works great and extremely easy to set up.

author: M. Istvan
title: It's a great product - I've been using it in the kids' ...
content: It's a great product - I've been using it in the kids' playroom and having the screen makes it much more personal I feel against the usual speaker-type. I appreciate Amazon sending us from time to time some tips of commands we can use with it, so it's a perfect addition to the room to play music, set timers, ask trivia actions related to play.

author: Clyde Parks
title: Great device.
content: Very easy to set up and use and has excellent voice recognition.

author: Amy
title: Great device with a few issues.
content: Perfect form factor to put on your bedside. Replaced my google home. However, like everyone else says, please allow the option to disable the things to try card. Also, the ambient light sensor could be better as it turns into night mode even when light on automatic mode. I would recommend this item though.

author: Drosenkranz422
title: Recommend!
content: Easy to set up, easy to use. So much fun! I’m still discovering all this little smartie has to offer. We all love it!

author: Rhodie Mom
title: Love everything except sound quality
content: I like our Spot, it performs as well as expected.  My only criticism is the quality of the speaker, my regular Echo has a great speaker

author: Anna B.
title: I love it.
content: I bought the Alexa Spot so I could drop in on my mother who is sick and see how she is doing. It makes it easy for her to contact me if she needs anything and gives me a price of mind. If you’re not looking for the device to do astronomical things for its price range then it does the things you need it to do and more.

author: The Brandon’s
title: I absolutely love these.
content: I have 5 of these and love them.

author: tonyhemp
title: Best alarm clock ever!
content: I bought this for an alarm clock on my nightstand, it works great. All the benefits of the echo plus it has a nice alarm clock setting. I know other alarm clocks cost less than $10 but when you want the best you go with the echo spot

author: Charlotte T
title: Wonderful gift and household tool.
content: Wonderful gift to family member so we can stay in visual touch from far distances.  Family member loves theirs and I love mine. Keep it up Amazon.

author: Donna
title: Love my Alexa
content: I’m still trying to decide what else I would like to do but I’m enjoying my music, weather and news and some of the suggestions.

author: Kurt Fisher
title: It's a great alarm clock .
content: I use Spot to play music, tell me when an Amazon order is delivered, and remind me to take medications.  I know it can do more but this is all I need for now.  I can't think of anything negative; it's an amazing device.

author: Jon
title: This product is beautifully designed and I no longer have to hide an ...
content: This product is beautifully designed and I no longer have to hide an Echo device away like I did with Dot. It would be nice if Amazon would lose that camera though, which I have not used and might cause squirms for the privacy conscious.

author: JDK
title: Great sound and love the screen!
content: I love this thing! I was worried about it being loud enough, but it's plenty loud for my 1-bedroom apartment! It picks up my voice really easily too. I've tried a few of my friends' regular Echos (the tower ones) and I think this one is so much better because of the screen. You can touch the screen to pause or skip a song, and you can actually skip forward to the middle of a song too, which I love. And I love that it shows scrolling lyrics to every song - it's like having your own personal karaoke machine! Haha.I just feel like it makes the user experience much more simple and clear to have a screen where you can see what's happening.

author: J. McCormick
title: Seems to be a hit in my house.
content: My kids are obsessed with playing Music and asking Alexa a variety of questions and/or asking for jokes and riddles.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Awesome
content: Love it!

author: araceli
title: So far so good
content: Had trouble setting it up but now that it's up and running I'm liking it more

author: pjb
title: Great gadget and alarm clock replacement
content: Getting used to talking to the Spot and it is very intuitive. Sometimes wakes up though and says a few random things. It is so much more than a simple alarm clock. Wish the screen would allow one to adjust pictures so they fit the entire picture.

author: Deno
title: When doing a "drop in" if you don't have a bright room the image is very bad. I know it's a small camera but so ...
content: This is my second echo and I don't regret buying it.  For people wondering if they can dim the screen when sleeping, it has an auto brightness sensor which made it to dark for me.  So I set it too full brightness and when the sun goes down the screen will auto switch too a darks color scheme.  I have to point out the only thing I wish the could improve on the the camera.  When doing a "drop in" if you don't have a bright room the image is very bad.  I know it's a small camera but so is my phone camera and it's like night and day.

author: Jul
title: Great fun!
content: On a whim, for Father’s Day, I ordered the Echo Spot in White for my husband.  He loves the quick, spontaneous Alexa response.  Andi we’ve enjoyed learning to utilize the various games.  Specifically, True or False, Jeopardy, and Song Quiz.  So easy to set up with existing internet, too.

author: Robert 4our
title: Five Stars
content: Best bedside clock and assistant I have ever had.

author: Gary Clavelot
title: I like the echo spot
content:
I like the echo spot, but for a little more money I could have purchased another echo show.
I think the unit could have a better selection of clocks and at least one with a digital display with larger font that could be read from a distance.
Sound was good and I have not tried the video with my video doorbell, but I will one day.

author: brentmarla
title: The future is here
content: Awesome! I've bought Echo and Echo dot as well. Spot is very cool for video calling. Spot is a bargain, looks great, nice to have display at times like song lyrics, time, weather, etc......  I'm buying more!

author: Mike Schuring
title: I love my Echo Spot
content: I love my Echo Spot! I can glance at it and see current news, sports, weather, and so much more. I can also view videos, and even movies from my Prime movie list. I have one of the 1st generation Echo's, 2 Dot's and now the Spot and love them all!

author: Michael Magnusson
title: Looks like a nice clock on ad
content: Looks like a nice clock on ad. But it is actually an AD.  This thing rotates ad messages to  you constantly. "Go check this out" - "Trending is this" - and there is no way to turn that off.  I just wanted an intelligent clock - I got a Main Street billboard in my face.

author: Amazon Customer
title: So simple and useful...but dock should be included
content:
This is my new bedroom table clock.  It's a blessing to know the time listed is accurate (it pings the wi-fi connection) and I don't have to do anything.  It goes into a dim mode at night so it saves on the battery and screen.  The alarm is loud, so waking up is not an issue.  But even better, instead of having to physically move to hit a snooze button, all I do is yell "Alexa, snooze for 10 minutes".  Boom, done.  Those 10 miinutes are blissfull since I never had to move.
I've also used it to send me reminders to my phone, play games with the kids, tell me the weather/news and even to find my cell phone in the house.  Yes, it's extremely expensive, but it's a keeper.
What I hate is the fact that for its price, the stand was an extra expense.  To me, there's no reason for it not to have been included.

author: fluff
title: Two Stars
content: I switched to google. The amazon helper is more for shopping, and google is the tasks assistant.

author: Gemma S
title: Buy it! you will love it!
content:
This device is much much better than the dots.  It's great for use as a travel alarm clock as well as at home.  FYI, if you pair it to your phone with another phone prior you can used your phone as a hotspot of this device
Update:  Bought a second Spot for Hubby's side of the bed. We love the easy alarm settings.

author: Damian
title: Great assistant/alarm, OK LCD screen
content: This has become my new alarm clock and personal assistant for everything! I love being able to snooze without hitting an alarm anymore or just requesting a random song I want to hear while relaxing. The only thing I wasn't too happy about is the screen. Since its an LCD screen, it doesn't dim to black like an OLED panel would and you can still see the glow of the "black screen." Hopefully, one day Amazon could upgrade to an OLED screen in order to have a tried and true nocturnal alarm clock. Otherwise, this is an awesome product and I've really enjoyed it!

author: Magelys concepcion
title: This is amazing
content: Best ornament in my room ever. Also you can personalize your own picture screen my husband is in mine. Highly recommended for everyone out there.

author: M. Patrick
title: love it. don't have to mess reseting the alarm ...
content: love it. don't have to mess reseting the alarm every time. listen to music while your getting ready and I have the plug so she can turn light off after u get into bed. wonderful

author: DARLENE LOSPOC
title: Best thing I ever bought
content: I love love love my echo spot. The screen automatically adjusts when I turn off the light.  I can see the time & it was easy to connect to my stereo. I like when it displays the answers to my questions & I constantly get the weather updates. Alexa displays suggestions and ideas and the screen saver is soothing

author: CyberBuyer
title: Pricey fancy Alarm clock.  Some shortfalls as a clock and Privacy issues...
content: This is a nice addition to the old alarm clock.  I'm not a big Alexa fan, I just don't find that handy, but I do think this is a cool gadget clock.  Some shortfalls is there is not many "skills" other than weather and time, but does work nicely to have a weekday alarm only to Prim Music of your choice.  Another shortfall is the camera in the bedroom.  The software on the clock says that the camera is off, but is it really?  It's also always listening to your conversations.  Waiting for wake word Alexa.  So, not sure I like that either.  If you hit the mute all button, then the clock turns obnoxious Red color, so you really want to turn the listening back on to get rid of that.  Another thing is that you can't turn off the alarm early on the clock's touch screen.  Maybe I don't want to wake the wife, but I would have to say, "Alexa, turn off alarm".  That wakes people up!  My Bose alarm clock I can push a button on the remote to turn off before alarm time.  There are other little things like this that come up.  Would like more functionality on the LCD settings so you are not forced to speak to the device.  It also shows current temp.  Not that handy in 6AM.  I want to know what the high for the day will be, and I don't want to ask it (again to be quiet with still sleeping spouse).  I just want to see it on the rotating screens.  So, let's hope that this improves over time with software upgrades.  So, the last work is that it's a mixed bag.

author: Richie Rich
title: Amazon Echo Spot and Insteon LampLinc - Perfect Companions
content:
I gave this Echo Spot to a friend and she loves it. I included an "Insteon LampLinc Smart Plug" so she uses her Echo Spot to voice-control the lamp in her bedroom without having to stretch or get out of bed at night. It was all easy to install and she's loving this birthday present. She is enjoying the Echo Spot since it is small and also functions as a clock on her nightstand besides having the very powerful capability of an Amazon Echo. She enjoys the Flash Briefing each day. I included the link to the Insteon LampLinc Smart Plug below. It is a perfect companion purchase to any Echo device if you'd like to control a lamp.

https://smile.amazon.com/Insteon-LampLinc-Dimming-Dual-Band-Amazon/dp/B003IHTZDU/ref=sr_1_4?s=hi&ie=UTF8&qid=1520373089&sr=1-4&keywords=Insteon+dimmer+plug

author: Lassiter
title: Best investment for my home!
content:
L💜💜💜💜VEmy Echo Spot!
Great volume, bass and alarm comes on as set!  Love that i can also reorder items purchased from previous orders too! 💜🙌🏽💜

author: Andrea Doyon
title: Handy, useful gadget for any home.
content: This is the third Echo product in our home. We were early adopters of the first (tall) Echo, and we since purchased the Echo Dot as well. The Echo Spot is the perfect blend of the two. Its small size makes it easy to find a spot in nearly any room in the house. Currently we have ours in the kitchen so we can add items to the shopping list, and discover the weather before heading out the door in the morning. The speakers in the Spot are clear, with nice sound that resonates throughout the large room. (I had complaints about the poor quality of music with the Dot, but not here). We purchased this model for the video chat feature, as we have family out of town. We purchased them a Spot, too, and now we're all able to chat Spot-to-Spot, but also Spot-to-Mobile, which is convenient. This is my favorite Echo so far.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Alexa vs iPhone for control of smart items
content: In concept, I really like the echo spot.  However, controlling smart devices leaves a lot to be desired and no real way of getting help.  I have a smart plug called “my lights”.  When I tell Alexa to turn off/on “my lights”, I get the response that “a lot of items share that name, which one do you want”.  Saying it again gets me nowhere.  I only have one smart plug.  Turns out my iPhone will also control smart fixtures, without an issue.  I walked into the room and said Alexa, turn on my lights by mistake to My iPhone and the lights immediately turned on...... as Alexa was saying “l’m sorry, a lot of items share that name, which one do you want”.  Makes you laugh.  I have not been able to find anyone to help solve the problem

author: Amazon Customer
title: Cannot access Radio.com stations for radio alarm function.
content: For me, this was a 5 star product while it lasted.  Long story… for as long as I can remember I would set my previous radio alarm clock to 1010 WINS to wake me in the morning.  The echo spot seemed like a great replacement… smaller footprint… many more features than a simple alarm clock so I purchased it.  Everything was fine until last week when the Alexa voice informed me that 1010 WINS was moving from TuneIn to Radio.com.  That’s fine.  I thought I would be able to just reset the echo spot to use Radio.com.  No can do.  After August 1st the echo spot just beeps when the alarm goes off (annoying).  TuneIn doesn’t have my alternate station either.  So I am rating echo spot 1 star because the radio alarm function is now broken and I’m looking for a new clock radio.  it appears Amazon doesn’t realize that when you make a software product change you should probably test it.

author: Barbara Thomas
title: Echo Spot Rescued me when phone was Dead
content: I have enjoyed the dot and am now delighted with the echo spot,  especially when it made a phone call for me when my cell phone was out of charge.

author: Tee
title: Five Stars
content: Love this Echo Spot. Very pleased.

author: David Carr
title: Love my Alexa
content: Love Alexa will buy again over other similar products

author: Mariann Swain
title: Works great
content: Wonderful little tool

author: David
title: Works as advertised but...
content: ... the Spot doesn't hear as well as my Dot. I always have to repeat my commands to Alexa.  Other than that I like the device.

author: Betsy S. Holmes
title: OK but I like the dot better
content: I have several dots and they seem to be easier to use and are better at accurately hearing commands. I’m not sure I see any real benefit to having the screen.

author: Steve
title: Great Alarm clock replacement
content:
I like being able to monitor our ring right from spot at night instead of fumbling for phone then getting blinded by the light.

The sound quality is much better than the echo.

author: Amber
title: My new best friend. My whole family loves it and they ...
content: My new best friend. My whole family loves it and they all want 1. The speaker is AMAZING! You would not expect this HUGE sound and clear sound quality from this handlheld adorable device.
