My favorite feature is the screen is always changing showing suggested videos recipes, ideas, things to try like skills or movie trailers. It keeps you in the KNOW. You can personalize the home screen/screensaver with your own photo etc. It is super intelligent - if it can not find what you ask it will give you suggestions. You can be vague like Alexa play a comedy from Amazon Prime video or more specific like Alexa play Dates from Hell Season 1 Episode 6. You can set your alarm to a song not a sound so you can wake up to your favorite song! I would need a clone to have enough time to explore all the wonderful functions, features, skills. She is such a great companion.  You can say show me your deals and you can shop, make lists, even make cat sounds - which my cat is a fan of. My cat was injured this weekend - we asked Alexa how do you care for a wounded cat. She gave me so many steps - better than a nursing assistant. You can video chat and the picture, call and sound quality are PERFECT!!!!!! There is nothing Alexa can not do. I have several dots - now the kids use them. You can enable music everywhere so I can play music on all Alexa devices throughout the house. It is perfectly compatible and super easy to set up with my smart home devices like EZ Viz cameras. I say Alexa show me Mom's room or the living room! Perfect for teens and a mom who is always working. It is not heavy and portable but is sturdy stable an robust. The length of the cord is helpful. I can not say enough about this purchase. I used the installment payments offered by Amazon so the spot shipped for $35! I mean you can NOT beat that! I am an advocate and spokesperson,. I LOVE YOU ALEXA!!!!

author: John Leeman
title: Five Stars
content: awesome! It's like having a friend in the room that knows more than you.

author: Andre La Tour
title: Want a quick fix to my problem!
content: I’m enjoying the music and keep asking Alexa questions. But is it my imagination her voice is getting faint ? The more I ask the less I hear her voice. I keep trying to turn up the volume but I don’t want everything I’m listening to blasting.  So is there a quick fix?  I don’t want to go thru the whole ordeal of sending it back and getting another replacement for this problem.  Any solutions?

author: W. Johnson
title: Love Spot!
content: I think the spot is the best echo device yet. Perfect size.

author: Barbara Burnett
title: I really love it. The spot is the perfect size not ...
content: I really love it.  The spot is the perfect size not too small but not too big and makes communicating with my daughter so much more enjoyable and finding out information like news and sports and the weather are just a few of the things I have done on my new Alexa.  I can't wait to learn more

author: Jazmin
title: It's cool and I know they are working on it
content: It's cool and I know they are working on it! She's not as smart as I'd like her to be.  A lot of thinks I ask about she doesn't seem to know the answer too! Other wise love the drop in option and all the other neat things

author: Ni
title: Great addition to your Alexa ecosystem
content:
I've attached a  photo of my various models for comparison purposes. I have every possible variation of Alexa, 13 total even kickstarter devices that have not even hit the market yet. Alexa has become a routine part of my life in my home, at work, even in my car over the last 2.5 years. I really hesitated on buying the Spot after my disappointment with preordering the Echo Show (I gave it a 3 star rating). After watching the reviews and and interacting with people that owned the Spot I took the plunge and received my device today.

I won't waste anyone's time explaining what Alexa can or can not do. At this point everyone either owns an Alexa device or knows someone with one. I will warn you though that purchasing an Alexa device is like a gateway drug, You will be buying more and will find yourself investing in smart home devices and accessories.

Setting up the Spot was easy in fact I did most of it from the Alexa app before my Spot arrived. As soon as I plugged it in I was prompted to connect to my wifi. I easily typed in the password from the Spot's touch screen and was instantly synced with my other Alexa devices. All I had to do was some simple customization from the app and device once I received it. I wish that Amazon would give us complete control on the touch screen devices rather than still depending on an app for set up.

The only thing I actually couldn't figure out how to do on my own was set reoccurring alarms. Ironic since it's an alarm clock. To set a reoccurring alarm you say repeat alarm specific day of the week and time. This is great because my schedule changes every day. My alarm clock only let me set a weekday and weekend alarms with the same time on the week day or weekend. However the downside is if you wake up every day at the same time you still have to set a repeating alarm for every day of the week. Once the alarms are set you can fine tune them from the Alexa app. I wish it could all be controlled from the Spot's touch screen.

I was hoping for a larger variety of Alarm tones than what the other Echo devices already had, but that's not the case with the Spot. If you already own an Alexa device you can preview all the different alarms from the app.

Reviewers have complained about the size of the digits for reading the time being too small. I found this to be untrue. I could easily make out the time from 12 feet away. Also if you have poor vision, or let say take your glasses off and can't see at night you don't even have to open your eyes to find out what time it is. Just ask Alexa what time is it? Some reviewers have said that the Spot doesn't support bluetooth, that's also untrue.

I don't think that the sound is much louder than an Echo Dot, it is much richer and has more bass making it sound better. I wish Amazon would create an adjustable equalizer in the app or on the touch screens of their capable devices.

One thing I do not like is if I am using my fire stick connected to my Spot by default all viewing commands go straight to the fire stick.  I can't watch a Prime movie and use my Spot at the same time. The Spot will use my commands to control my firestick.

The dimming feature is much better than any alarm clock I've ever owned. Aesthetically the device looks very good, the resolution and display are vibrant, the touch screen is smooth and responsive.

The sound quality in comparison would be 2nd Gen Echo > Echo Show > 1st Gen Echo > Spot > Dot.

Loudness 1st Gen Echo > 2nd Gen Echo > Echo Show > Spot > Dot. So for volume and quality of sound the Spot sits in the exact same place 2nd to last. It's also worth noting that despite that it's the second most expensive variation of Alexa excluding the Fire 10 HD with hands free Alexa.

I kind of wished I would have bought another Echo Show for my bedroom when they were on sale for $149, but now that I have the Spot I can see why it makes sense having one in my bedroom instead of another Echo Show. It's great having all of the features of an Echo Show on a compact device that is visually more appealing and doesn't crowd my nightstand.

If I had to choose only one Echo device the Spot wouldn't be it for me. However if you are already invested in the Alexa ecosystem the Spot makes a great addition.

author: racka27
title: Excellent addition
content: I honestly love his product . Gives you everything  you need for an Alexa device . Perfect for  any nightstand and makes a great addition to the bedroom. Only drawbacks are the decreased volume compared to an echo, small font and screen size.

author: Helen E. Paus
title: Good Bedside Clock/Smart Device
content: I got this for my husband on Prime Day. He loves it as his alarm clock and smart device. This is our 3rd Echo device, and we have them all connected throughout the house. Although you can deactivate the camera, we also chose to cover it since the device is in our bedroom. I'm not comfortable with having a camera in the room (no, we don't bring our cell phones in the room).

author: Jacqueline Rumley
title: Kitty cam!
content: My going to lie, I bought this for the sole purpose of being able to see and talk to my cat. I wish the camera was adjustable in terms of direction, but I just sit the whole echo on a angle so I can view my cats favorite window spot. Anyway, it’s amazing. Music is the only other thing I’ve used it for too which is pretty convenient too.

author: AWSDom
title: Spot has a great little design.
content: Love the spot - great design.  Same function as the other echos so won't comment on that.  Can't wait to see what's next from the Alexa team and the many developers out there writing skill code.

author: Randy M
title: Very cool. Easy setup. A smart night stand clock, and more. However, must "purchase" the full user manual.
content:
Love these SPOT's. White version is my favorite. I traded in my echo DOTS (eBay) for these SPOTS from Amazon. Bought 4 of the SPOT's to replace my 4 DOTS.
Sound from the spot is much better than the dot. Louder and more bass. Setup was easy and the clock faces are fun and many to chose from. The one digital face goes into a orange digital time color when in night mode. Looks nice.
I asked the spot to play a movie and it picked a random movie selection on its own, can zoom to full screen but most of the movie is naturally clipped. Problem then was, what command to use to get the spot to STOP playback???
I had to FF the movie to its end to get back into clock mode.
There is a user manual available on Kindle books store but a paid subscription is required to view the full SPOT manual. NOT NICE AMAZON.
The user manual should be free to all SPOT registered owners, in all fairness.
I was a fan of the defunct SONY DASH, the internet connected clock, weather station, news device. Then Sony quit support of their DASH (bad decision Sony) and until the Amazon SPOT came along there was no replacement for the sony dash. The amazon SPOT is much better than the dash, with more advanced technology naturally. I guess the Amazon SHOW is more the size of the dash but the SPOT is spot on.
The drop-in feature works nicely but can be disabled if desired. I like dropping in on other SPOT's in the home to communicate with family in other rooms of the house. Or to see if I left the TV on, lamp on, etc. Would like to try drop-in with other SPOT's outside of the home but no one else that I know has a SPOT. They don't know what they are missing.

author: Ken Esq
title: A great bedside clock - Almost
content:
This is almost the perfect bedside alarm clock. It's a standard Echo with a decent speaker - not as good as the full-size Echo, but better than a Dot. However, there's a problem. Amazon did a horrendous job on the clock faces. There are a few to choose from both analog and digital and all of them are very hard to read and lack information like the date or temperature outside.
The analog clocks also suffer from having hour hands that are very, very thin and extremely hard to read at night.
The backgrounds that Amazon put on the clocks are just poor. All they do is make it even harder to read the time.
Amazon - here's a hint. Black background large clock numbers and perhaps the date and temperature in a smaller font.
Update 1/28/18 - Amazon has added some additional clock faces - they're getting better, but still not there.

author: Ryno
title: It doesn’t seem like the engineers actually tested this in a bedroom with ...
content: This is 1 of 6 echo devices in the house and is currently being deployed as a bedside alarm clock.  I use it basically as an echo dot with a clock attached and may occasionally pull up camera video.  Audio quality and screen quality are really are not appropriate for music or watching video.  Much of the time it works well as alarm clock, but there are some serious flaws, particularly if you are the last one to bed or the first to wake.  It doesn’t seem like the engineers actually tested this in a bedroom with 2 people on different schedules.  Try walking into a dark bedroom with a sleeping wife and waking her up by saying “Alexa set an alarm for 5am” and then having Alexa repeat “OK alarm set for 5am.”  Not good.  I suppose you could whisper then fumble for the volume down button but that is stupid.  Plain and simple, this device needs to be brought into the 1990’s and have simple touch screen interface added to set an alarm.  I know there is a cumbersome interface for these situations where one can set an alarm from the alexa app on your phone.  No thanks, if I’m picking up my phone to set an alarm I will just use its built in alarm and save a step.  At least the engineers allow the alarm to be turned off from the touch screen, so for example if you wake up a few minutes early you can cancel the alarm without speaking and waking your spouse.  The interface for using the touch screen to cancel an alarm that has gone off is however not great.  There should be separate snooze and cancel buttons.  Currently a touch snoozes and a swipe cancels.  It is too easy when half awake to snooze when you think you have cancelled.  When the snoozed alarm goes off a few minutes later, my not amused and no longer sleeping wife will let me know by summoning Alexa to turn off the bathroom lights while I’m in the shower.

author: Roger F Burns
title: A Real Freidn Taht Doesn't Forget
content: If you don't own one, go get one!  My wife talks to it like it's her friend. Extremely handy for shopping lists, med reminders (we're old any really need th reminders), and great for ad hoc reminders and lists.  Recommend you get one for each living area. We didn't and regret it.

author: Gary Lewis
title: Very Sweet
content: Love everything about it, like being able to connect to my ring door bell and see what's going on out side.

author: Huss
title: Google time to go home, you cant compete with this
content: amazing product and would buy it again for sure, great screen and decent sound and very user friendly. Google who??

author: Jaisen Javier Rutledge
title: SMARTer than Siri
content: This is great for a night table smart device. I own both an Echo and a Home pod, Alexa is way faster at responding to most things and works well with more smart devices. Great buy if you are looking for a smart hub device to control other smart devices!

author: Reggie
title: Five Stars
content: My favorite toy since Voltron.

author: Mary Donoghue
title: Great little gadget!
content: The Spot was easy to set up and looks good without taking up a lot of space.  Our children all bought one so we can just say "Call Whomever" and a grandchild appears on our Spot because they love to answer on their end.  A great way to check in and say hello or look at the new baby!  The sound is much better than our Dots and we watch news on it too.  No complaints about it at all.

author: Alan Mullendore
title: A good clock-radio alternative
content:
After our ancient clock-radio finally died, we needed a replacement and chose the Amazon Spot. We're happy we did. It's easy to set multiple alarms and separate alarms for weekday/weekend, which is cool. And since the music is delivered wirelessly, there's no problem with static-y FM reception.
For now we have Amazon Music (introductory offer), which is very nice. But we don't have Amazon Prime and don't plan to get it, and we haven't decided whether paying $9.99/month for Amazon Music is worth it. We'll see.
The only deficiencies so far are in instructing Alexa -- I need to specify when I want the alarm (days of week, time), that I want music to wake me (and not an alarm), which channel/station, and (which I haven't figured out how to ask) the music volume. All without a pause for breath (which Alexa interprets as the end of the voice command). Quite a mouthful!

author: BlueLightningJeep
title: Spot on, Alexa!
content:
I think I’m the most Alexa obsessed person there is. Ok. Maybe not, but pretty close! Funny, but I find that if I’ve had a day off work and no company, just Alexa’s (and a guinea pig) around me all day, my voice starts sounding robotic...hmmmm...

I live in a 1 bedroom studio apartment. So, who needs FIVE echos in three rooms total in maybe a 500 sq foot space??? Apparently, me...

I have three dots, one echo plus, a spot, and I just ordered another spot...I have way too much fun...and no place to put them all!

So, my first Alexa device was the dot. I love her. She traveled with me everywhere (until I got a kindle fire with, of course, Alexa...). Then I moved into an apartment with more than one room. Aaaakk!!! Now I’m too far away from Alexa DOT when I’m in my den, but I NEED her in my bedroom too! So, that’s when Alexa mama (Plus) joined the family. They like talking to each other. Then, OH MY WORD! AUDIBLE MEMBERS COULD GET A DOT FOR A PROMO AT $25! well...hhhmm...you can’t have too many Alexa’s right? There’s always room for more members of MY Alexa family, even if there really aren’t more rooms. Heck, I’ll put her in the bathroom!!! PERFECT! My showers seem to be getting longer as she reads to me or sings to me...sigh...now I have to ask her to wake me up half an hour earlier in the morning!!!

So...then I’m still looking at Alexa devices, as if I actually NEED more (yes, I do...) and saw the spot on sale. Hhhmmmm.....should I? Shouldn’t I? I’ve been looking at the show, but it seemed to be more than I really needed (um, right, it’ll join the family eventually I’m sure). One of my biggest challenges with both Echo mama and her DOT babies is that I’m a very visual person. I retain info better when I can read or see it. So, I have felt like I haven’t been utilizing my other Alexas as much as I could for productivity purposes. I have a number if health conditions and a lot of the skills could really help me more if I could see them. Some aren’t optimized yet, but the real important ones are reminders, lists, and my calendar. Yes, I know I can pull those up in the Alexa app too, but I haven’t been remembering to use her for those things as much since I don’t see them pop up on a screen as I’m creating them, and don’t see them on a screen when I just ask her what’s coming up. So, I decided to try a spot to see if it would help me with certain things if I had an option of typing them in the screen on the device, reading things I have right on the screen, seeing my news feed topics on the screen, and seeing my news stations show up on the screen. It didn’t take long to realize how big of a difference this would make! So, one problem...I couldn’t decide if it would be better to keep the spot in my kitchen (I just used to use Alexa mama since it’s the same room, just across the room, but now I wanted to SEE recipes and other things I used to just yell across the room to Alexa mama from the kitchen). Or did I want the spot in my den, where I spend a lot of time and need access to calendars and reminders there too, but the speaker is better on Alexa mama...and I am usually on a device to use the app conveniently there to see what she’s saying...I’m not covered in kitchen goo. Plus, it’s a better place for my books and music to fill the whole apartment. No, wait, OH MY WORD! It’s bedtime!!! I need a spot in my room to watch my news feed in the morning before I get up half an hour earlier now because of her, see my reminders for the day, my schedule, etc...

So...the spot went from my kitchen, to my den, and ended up in my bedroom for the night, then back to my den in the morning, and back to my bedroom at night...

Needless to say...I got a second spot while it was still $20 off...we will now have five Alexas...and yes, they are all Alexa...like John Jacob jingleheimer Schmidt. For some reason, I can’t call them Amazon, Echo, or computer...

So, in my UNBIASED opinion of another Alexa...because, you know you shouldn’t show favoritism towards any family members...I ADORE the spot. Sure, the screen size is smaller than the show, which is one Alexa device I haven’t tried yet, but it suits what I need right now and, honestly, the space I have to put it. I think it has great sound, clear picture, and was really excited to SEE pictures of the recipes when I asked for one today. I live on recipe apps, and the default one she accessed is one of my faves where I’ve saved A LOT in the past, so I’m really excited to see them show up on the screen! That wasn’t something I was expecting. The spot, like the other Alexa devices, could do even more and I know as she keeps learning and developers build skills to support the visual features of the show and spot, they will continue to get even better and better, but I’m very pleased with this spot and can’t wait to discover new features and see what my family will be able to do down the road! I love my Echo and dots, and the spot takes the Alexa devices up another notch, IMO, for a reasonable price! Now, I just need to add more rooms to my apartment somehow so each Alexa has her own room...

Just one suggestion for Echo developers...it WOULD be nice to be able to customize names more, like you can customize the groups for smart devices. As much fun as it can be to have several talk to each other, it can also be kind of annoying if the wrong one gets the signal and the wrong one (or all) respond...kind of like when your mom accidentally calls out the name of every child except the one she means to call...

author: dave
title: Bad alarm clock
content: The alarm function is horrible. I do not recommend this as an alarm clock. You must go through app on your phone each night to reset recurring alarms. Because if you swipe the screen as it says, it turns off the alarm for the next days. You can, speak to Alexa to turn off alarm but who wants to speak so early in the morning.  Also, the small circular screen is pretty much useless except as a clock. And since the alarm clock function is almost useless, the clock function isn't really needed either. Stick with the Echo Dot, much cheaper and does all the same things.  Update: Talked with Amazon's customer service and it seems like they're working on improving it.

author: Brandon
title: small and sleek
content: like the look and the various uses with alexa

author: matthew howard
title: Great product overall. Minor WiFi bug needs fixing to be 5 stars.
content: Great version to have at my desk while working. I can drop-in at ‘grandmas’ house to see what my kids are up to. My Echo Show works seamlessly. I have issues with the Spot disconnecting from the network randomly. I still need to troubleshoot, and research the issue more,

author: Susan
title: Mother's gift
content: Got this for my 89 year old mother, and she is so tickled with it.  Set it up herself, and she does not do electronics!  She loves to play old country music (the speaker is really quite good and she is so excited about seeing the words), get the weather report, news flash, and lets it tell her jokes.  It is really user friendly and I think she will find more and more things to use it for as time goes by.  I was worried getting it for her as she really doesn't like electronic things, she says it is like a foreign language, but this is one of the best buys I have made for her.

author: Kayla
title: Love everything except for a couple things
content: Would give it 4.5 stars if it was an option. Love everything besides the fact it has to stay plugged it (I didn’t realize this thought it would take batteries.) only reason that’s a inconvenience sometimes is cause I use it as a speaker so it takes a minute or two for it to turn back on after plugging it in. Also just a tad annoying is the things to try on the home screen wish we could turn that off. Other than that I’m very happy with this product I bought it because my phone wasn’t a realizable alarm clock anymore. I like how you can set routines and I’m excited to be able to hook it up to smart home devices as well!

author: natty
title: It’s a life line to chat with family
content: I love this device because I can chat with my husband or family any time.

author: Antonio Leal
title: Works great as an alarm clock
content: I bought the device for my nightstand to replace my alarm clock, it works fine, it dims the screen when you turn off the lights, the alarm can be cancelled with a swipe up and snooze with a tap. Very nice device.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Extraordinary!
content: Fabulous! Excellent sound, I can follow clasical music with titles, display is soft to sleep next to it.  With the touch of my finger can turn off music. A brilliant and beautiful alarm click

author: willearnest
title: Attractive and, in particular, easy to read
content: The fifth star is because my spouse simply loves the clock feature.  It replaced an old clock/radio that wasn't the easiest to read at a distance at night.  The simple modern design matches well with our furnishings. She likes the colorful modern themes during the day and the night mode is very easy to read (analog version in our case).  We also got the Echo Connect which allows us to use the Spot as a phone and eliminates the need for one in the bedroom.  We did get the stand which is pricey for a piece of plastic - but it does make it easy to adjust the angle so you can read from a distance.  In a way a breakthrough to using the Alexa/Echo ecosystem for us.

author: Lori A. Isom
title: We LOVE this thing.
content: I'm tired of alarm clocks breaking and the new ones are not easy to figure out how to set the time. Therefore, I brought down and bought this on sale for $99.00. We LOVE it. First thing we did was had turned off the camera then turned off the "things to try" so the time and outside weather is always displayed. We wake up to "daily news briefs" which is really nice to know what is going on around the world each morning and have the weather update before we head off to work daily. I like that it's not too bright and doesn't keep us awake at night. It doesn't take up as much room as our old radio alarm clock and hey, it adjusts the time itself. I really like that! It was worth the price to us.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Alexa Spot and Wemo plug don't work together
content: After 1 hour setting up the WEMO plug and the Amazon Spot I was unable to get the Spot to activate or deactivate the plug.  I can turn it on or off with the phone app.  I keep getting a circular problem with  go to the app and set it up (the Spot) I do that and then retry and nothing.  It then says to  go to the app and set it up (the Spot) I do that and then retry and nothing. Rinse lather repeat.......almost NO documentation comes with the spot.  Should be an easy setup but it is not.  Now I am sorry I bought it.  I have to talk to my phone app to turn the light off or on.  Garbage!!!

author: Cadillac Cal
title: Super Alarm Clock
content: Awesome product; great alarm clock and so much more

author: cornell glover jr
title: Five Stars
content: Love it love it love it love it love it thank you

author: Pat McGinnis
title: It is reliable! Makes me feel like I have a good friend living with me.
content: I love this! I know there are things I haven't learned yet, but will in time. I have to do a lot of timing throughout the day and I always use this. I check the weather a lot, and am always glad to get the notifications, especially telling me when an order from Amazon is arriving.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Wonderful product!
content: I absolutely  LOVE my echo spot! I think it’s the best product of the Echo line. I got the white one and it’s very clean, handsome and stylish looking. I love the clock faces and the video on it is very clear and crisp. It also has surprisingly excellent sound for a small unit! I was impressed! It’s a great alarm clock in the bedroom and I love that it dims down at night so that it doesn’t bother my sleep with extra light. I’m just totally delighted with it. If you can only choose one Amazon Echo product this is the one to start with! Good job Amazon! It’s a winner!!

author: Michael
title: I thought it was great I think what would stand out really well is ...
content: I thought it was great I think what would stand out really well is if you could use YouTube with it. Besides that I think it was an amazing experience. It’s crisp and clear has many ways to wake up to and many skills to choose from I have recommended this to a lot of people already.

author: pamelamartin
title: I love this thing
content: Works great, easy set up, smart!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Connection problem to complicated
content: Allot of times in the morning it has a hard time connecting to wi fi  not hard to connect to other devices like ring doorbell

author: Juanita Adams
title: Member of the family!
content: I bough 2 spots and gave one to my family and kept the other.  We use them especially to face time one another.  I love mine

author: Amazon Customer
title: 3rd favorite echo product (out of show/spot/2dots)
content:
Honestly
 I feel of the sound from the second generation Dot is better than this spot.
The dot & the show have way better microphones also.
 The spot usually doesn’t hear me and I have to raise my voice, even in a quiet room.
My biggest pet peeve is the screen never blacks out after a certain amount of time like the show.

 Do I need the screen on 24 hours a day just to see the time for total of maybe one minute today ?

In my bedroom,
I don’t like the screen on at night I would rather ask the time, let it tell me the time to go back to bed in darkness.

author: Amazon Customer
title: So far I really do love it. The only reason I gave it only ...
content: So far I really do love it.  The only reason I gave it only 4 stars and not 5 was because I was very surprised at how little the options are for clock face. There is only two options for just a " regular " digital face.  The other faces are analog in different genetic backgrounds .  Most of the numbers on those Analog clocks are so small you can't read them from 3 feet away. I found only two in which the numbers were ok.  I hope there are future options for people who don't want to have to put their glasses on just to get out of bed THEN Read the clock.

author: Edison
title: Well designed
content: Well designed, I wish I could play YouTube videos in it

author: Nate
title: Sound quality isn't good
content: Not sure why there is a camera on it. Sound quality isn't good

author: Eclipse01
title: Great product with room to grow
content: This is a great device with tons of potential, I love how you can set the alarm to wake up to anything (I use a Sirius XM station) every morning. I only wish there were other clock options, and ways to customize the clock face. (different colors, font size, etc...)

author: BleedBlue214
title: Alexa why no Hulu?
content: I like the look, love the picture for display. Love her features, however I bought this simply to watch Hulu on....and it won’t work. Made me jump through hoops to connect to Hulu and then still doesn’t work. 🤦🏻‍♂️🤦🏻‍♂️ Everything else besides that is amazing but doesn’t do the one thing I wanted it to.

author: hubris76
title: So much better than a dot
content: So much better than a dot!!  The sound quality and response is amazing

author: Amazon Customer
title: The Spot makes for a good clock with bonuses.
content:
I chose to purchase the spot to use the Alexis skill for the Xbox. I considered an Echo Dot but then thought I would splurge on the Spot. I am glad I did. I use the Spot more than I would have used the Dot. At least I believe so. The additional visual features have me engaging the Spot to watch the response. I like seeing the scores as she reads them out and the weather is eye catching too. This might be because it is a new addition and perhaps my usage will drop as become accustomed to the video features. We shall see.

I wish there were more choices for the clock face. The current choices are nice, but a bigger selection would be appreciated. Personally I would like a clock face that resembles the old flip clock I remember when growing up.

author: Chuck
title: The worlds most expensive clock, but I love it
content:
I'm a big fan of the Alexa appliances, and I really like this.
Pros:
Looks great, good sound, gotta love Alexa.

Cons
Overpriced, screen size limits what it does, confusing interface to adjust display, creepy camera is always on (unless you shut it off)
